Amazing Happy Hour!  They have really good food during their happy hour. (aka: Tuscan Taster Bar Menu)..and the portions are enough to fill you up.  It gets a little busy on Thursday with their Martini special, but is always a fun time.  Happy hour is only available in the bar area, so get there early to claim your seat!  I highly recommend the cheeseburger and fries (and it's only $2.95!).

A fairly recent family visit to Brio was relaxing for brunch. We were seated quickly as we had a reservation. The prices for brunch were reasonable,  the servings were huge, and the drinks delicious. Our waitress, Brooke, made our visit enjoyable with her knowledge, smile and comfortable ease of conversation, and her recommendations were perfect. The french toast was sweet, as she had said it would be, so we were happy that we had chosen that item to share with an Eggs Benedict dish with an absolutely smooth hollandaise sauce. The others inhaled some of their meal and took the rest home, but I can not remember what they ordered--only that they were good! We did not feel rushed by the staff, and left Brio feeling very content!

One our favorite places to eat. Easter Sunday we had shrimp and grits, omelette...I think Italian....Service is always top notch.  Food was not that good and portions were small, very small.  Getting a cookie on the way out the door changes this from a 2 to 3 Star Rating...

This place was recommended by a local business owner. I love good food and definitely a decent happy hour. So, I tried the place while out shopping at San Tan one night; not sure that was such a good idea.

Atmosphere (3): This place was reminiscent of Olive Garden but, not as dim. The bar area was quite spacious and open (I didn't feel crowded like at other restaurant bars...too many stools scrunched together to make a buck).
 
Service (5): Hands down the service was five star. The servers were very informative with helping me to find something to satisfy my picky palate. The happy hour options were decent; $5 glasses of wine (hello somebody! A few glasses of Pinot Noir never hurt).

Food (1): This is where I has HUGE issues. I ordered a greek salad and a Margherita flatbread. Perfect combo right? No!

My salad came out and I was rather disappointed that my "Greek" salad didn't have and kalamata olives. Who puts regular sliced olives in a greek salad? I've NEVER! The dressing was decent but, I was totally thrown off with the olives. It didn't taste right. 

Note: Regular sliced black olives are not acceptable in a Greek salad. EVER! But, to each his own. Some may find it feasible; not I. 

My flatbread....I think they are pre-made in a sense that they add toppings to a pre-cooked flatbread and place them back in the oven. When it came out it was rather cold. It was obvious that the base (flatbread, sauce and cheese) was pre-made. I was expecting it to be hot with at LEAST warm melted cheese. Yeah, no. I sent it back and the second one came back the same way with the exception that the top layer of cheese was SLIGHTLY warmer. Bottomline, the bottom layer of cheese was unfit for anyone. Flatbread...Pizza...its all the same (IMHO). It has a crust, sauce and cheese. Everything should be hot and the cheese melted. No bueno. 

I think the ONLY thing that was pleasing to me was the two glasses of Pinot I had. Some may find it great. It just wasn't for me.
This place is great! I had the pasta alla vodka it's was delicious!!

I love the food here and most everything is great. I was not a fan of the chopped salad though and won't have it again. It looked like it had started to oxidize and was a little wilted. My friend had the wedge and I tasted the Ceasar dressing which I understand is home made, that Rocked! I also loved the service. Nice guys and attentive without rushing you. I'll be back.

Food is great, but the service needs attention. The waitress (am I allowed to use that term since it's gender-specific?) was very friendly. Unfortunately after she took the order, she returned much later to ask if we would like dessert. I guess what happens between the initial order and the time they are ready to clear the table for the next party does not matter much. The guy who actually delivers the lunch was ill-prepared to serve us because the table was covered with dirty dishes from the appetizer round. Hello? Clear the table and then bring the meal. Got busboys? Use them. It also never pays to respond to the typical question, "Is there anything else you need?" because you never get what you need. A simple request for red pepper flakes, which should be within reach of every table in an Italian restaurant, was completely ignored. I guess he had other things to do such as deliver water to each new customer regardless whether the water is requested or not. (I thought there was a water shortage in this town. Never mind....) Considering the location (Tivoli Village, the "Rodeo Drive" of Summerlin) the service was at best cordial, but hectic. Maybe adding more staff during the Christmas season, as many offices are having their office parties these days, would be helpful. I am sure we will be back, as I say for the great food, but dear friends, bring your own red pepper flakes if you like your food spicy.

Consistently a satisfactory experience and, an awesome happy hour! Brio has become a "go to" destination. Although it's a chain franchise, I always feel like I get personal service.
 
 Our group of four (two couples) just had an awesome happy hour experience, after meeting up after many months, The drinks were perfect (even with "house liquor"), the food was hot and well prepared, the service was spot on, and even above and beyond.

 If you have been recently let down by other places, give Brio a try, for a refreshing change.
Was very and really busy. Good food for a good price. Service was a bit slow, but had a good time. Would recommend.
Eggplant pomodoro was soooooo KILLIN'! Service was nice and attentive, no wait for a table, and there wasn't an unhappy diner at our table.

Stopped here for lunch while in town.  Great atmosphere which made for a relaxing lunch after doing some shopping.  

I had the steak salad and it was great.  My friend ordered the salmon salad and was equally pleased.  

Our server was friendly and attentive.  It's a bit pricey, but they quality lived up to the price.

R u serious, this place is buffet quality Italian Food.   Yes, I've been there several times for events/parties and it feels like a running joke.  Baddddddddd food at a great location.

It isn't a waste of your food time, but its definitely 50 minutes of your life that you will never get back.

Hosted my 50th Birthday party in the chefs banquet room. There was quite a bit of miscommunication between me and Maria. The tables were not set up to my liking and the service was slow and not very thorough. Actually,  we were lacking food servers. They did a great job rearranging the tables,  however, the manpower used for my party was inadequate  It took about 45 minutes to get the beverages to all the guests and the courses had to much delay between them. Keep in mind I only had 15 adults. When we finally did get the food it was excellent. Based on this experience I would dine there with a small group of people,  but hosting a party is not there strong suit. Additionally,  I never met the Banquet Manager or the Assistant Banquet Manager. Did not get a sense that they cared if my party was a success or not, I got the feeling they were only interested in my money. I do NOT recommend this place for a banquet or party. They are way to disorganized to host a great party.

I guess two stars says "Meh. I've experienced better." and that's exactly how I feel about this place. 
Pros: familiar chain restaurant that can be back-up plan in a new town, large food portions, descent happy hour, consistent service, good place for gift cards?
Cons: food is bland, definitely  inconsistent the 3 times I have been there!

I remember the first time we went there was the first month they had opened and for some reason, I recalled the food being amazing! I was excited for a new great italian restaurant, however, the next time I visited the quality of food had gone down dramatically! I went there again, for a birthday, hoping that the food would be as good as the first time and I was definitely disappointed!

I also tried the Brio in Tucson, Cleveland, Colorado, and I think it's a better  place than cheesecake factory, but not as good a maggiano's.... butt if you are in a new town for a meeting, you can trust that you will get mediocre food from a reputable place.

Sonia our server was very pleasant and attentive. The Bread-boy asked if we wanted more bread to which we responded affirmatively. However, he never returned. I would suggest not promoting him to server until he gets the bread right. The place is noisy so don't expect a nice quiet dinner for two. Mom said the crabcakes were lukewarm at best. With so many waiters and cooks bumping into each other, why would food come out of the kitchen cold? Go figure. We'll return, but we won't be in a big hurry. Las Vegas has many choices, and at Town Square, many are within walking distance.

I just have to write this review because usually I have the worst experience at Brio due to the servers. But today Aaron really impressed me, he was on top of the refills and had the best attitude. I'm so glad he was our server today and to top it off the food was delicious no doubt!
Great place for happy hour! Appetizers are ok!

We used to dine here often but the last couple of times have been awful! We went there for lunch on a Sunday -they were pretty busy but the wait wasn't too bad. Everything was going alright until our meals came. I ordered the pasta ala vodka which was completely cold but that was nothing compared to what my husband received. He ordered the lemon chicken and when he cut into it, it was COMPLETELY raw! We flagged down the waitress immediately and she didn't even seem concerned with it, she just said "ok I'll get you another one." She treated it as though we were complaining about the portion size of our food, not the fact that it was raw! It took over half an hour for my husband's plate to come out. I had already finished my meal so we didn't even get to eat together. Now, we are never the type of customers who complain and try to get things for free but I told my husband that they better not charge him for his entree being that if he would have taken a single bite out of that, he would have become terribly sick! She brings out the check and nothing. She had the nerve to charge us for the raw chicken. We asked to speak to a manager and she said "well can I just offer you a dessert instead?" Absolutely not! You can't make up for a $16 dish with a $5 dessert but we simply said no thank you. She walked away then came back a second later and said "she would just take care of it and to have a nice day." We were baffled by this because in no way were we trying to get our whole bill take care of but we had been there long enough so we just left her a $20 and walked out. My husband thinks that there is a chance that the waitress pegged us as "dine and ditchers" but regardless, we will never be returning to Brio.

Love this place. We eat here here 3-5 times a month. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. They even took the time to talk to us about our special dietary needs and really fixed us up! Top notch from the food to the service to the atmosphere.

Our party of 4 enjoyed an excellent lunch at Brio today. I asked for asparagus instead of mashed potatoes with the Chicken Limon and didn't get any grief from the pleasant waitress or the kitchen. The only aggravation was the hostess absolutely was not friendly. We were the first customers of the morning (10:50 am) and she acted like we asked for the moon because we wanted to sit outside in the sun.

We wanted to like this place but sadly could not.  Although customer service was good, the food was not.  I had the Pesto Pasta, which was more soup like.  I was later told that the pesto sauce is made with chicken broth.  My husband had the carbonara, which was bland, like bacon bits boiled in a cream sauce. Needless to say, we will not be back.  The place was the "Applebees" of italian cuisine.

My wife and I went in on a Tuesday night after shopping (choice of convenience) and I was completely underwhelmed. The service was slow and somewhat lackadaisical not understandable for a Tuesday night at 530. The food was ok but way overpriced for the quality. We tried to like it; we shared wine a starter and our two mains. It just didn't stack up. Not worth the 70 bucks we spent.

Brios is a delectable Italian restaurant that recently opened at Santan Village. Located inside a structure made to resemble a Tuscan country villa from both the inside and outside, Brio's offers a variety of fine Italian cusine. 

  I came to Brio's for the Happy Hour and was very impressed with the appetizers. Each was only $2.99, making this one of the better if not the best happy hours I have been to. I tried the mini burgers, the steak bruchetta and the margerita flatbread . All three items were delicious and I can't wait to come back here for more.

My husband and I always pass Brio and talk about going there one day for dinner. Tonight we finally had dinner here and we were happy with everything!! Customer service and the food was awesome, the atmosphere was a plus!! We'll will most definitely be back.

It was super clean, server was nice and the tomato bisque was amazinggg
I usually HATE anything tomato so it was like an OMG HALLELUJAH moment when I had that first spoonful
It actually tasted like lasagna which made me want to cry with joy :')
The hostess was a little rude, but I'm just going to assume she had a bad day and leave it at that.

WOW, they sat us on time and  the food was very fresh, cooked perfectly  and tasted great and the decor made us feel like we were in Tuscany. 
My wife and I called them Saturday around noon and made a reservation for 7:45 as we were taking some friends out for their birthday. we showed up at 7:15 to try their wine before hand. When we got there they were telling people that there was over an hour wait. However, they sat us right on time.  The wine selection was limited however, everything we tasted was excellent. The two slight negatives for us personally are that they serve Pepsi instead of Coke and I don't like Pepsi and because it was so busy, it was rather noisy which made it hard to carrying a conversation. I RECOMMEND THIS PLACE and cant wait to go back.

We ordered the bruchetta sampler and I had the rack of lamb. Both were beyond amazing. The flavors are intense and DEFINITELY worth the price. A bit pricey, but the price was justified by the wonderful food. Best food i've had in a long time.

Alfredo sauce was awesome, they use parmigiano reggiano!
I had them make me a custom pasta, rigatoni with alfredo and crumbled sausage.
My girlfriend and I shared a single entree which was huge for both of us and cost.......$12!
Cheaper than any entree there!
Service was good, she took a while to get our initial drink order. But after that she was great. Hooked us up on some free alfredo bread dipping sauce and a cheap entree, so she got a good tip!

i will go back and hopefully it will be just as awesome.

Brio is great for lunch, dinner or happy hour. Prices are comparable to other similar restaurants and they have a decent variety of entrees to choose from. Their flat bread is my favorite,  along with the wedge salad.

I've been to Brio several times (all lunch) and it's a decent spot.  Through architectural trickery, somehow all the restaurants at the Scottsdale Quarter are made to appear very small from the outside yet lo and behold are cavernous upon entry!

I had the Mediterranean Chicken Salad (my diet attempt for upcoming Hawaii trip) and it was ok.  Unexciting.  I've also had the flatbreads here and I believe pasta once....but it's just not memorable.

Service has always been good, and the lunch specials very reasonable.  The best bread item (seasoned crisps) were stale this time--no bueno.

I can't get excited about Brio, it's food, and faux Tuscan architecture but I can't really knock it.  Oh, and the bathroom really smelled like a bathroom--not cleansers but um...urine.  Seal that travertine folks!

My boyfriend and I came to Brio, already lovers of the chain restaurant (townsquare our favorite pick), thinking it would be the same great experience. In the beginning we were told 30-40 minute wait and since it's Homecoming weekend in Vegas, we understood and the lady manager took my name and handed me a pager. We sat RIGHT OUTSIDE and waited not long after were pleasantly surprised that another woman manager with a bun came up to us with a flatbread to take a piece while we waited. We were so grateful that she not only offered us a snack, but thanked us for waiting. Patronage is a huge thing in local restaurants and being thanked for waiting is a rare commodity.

Well an hour passes and we finally get up And walk inside. We ask how much longer to be told they were paging us for 15 mins?? Apparently they gave us a broken pager that was fully lot and functional. Thanks to the First Lady manager. We're surprised at this considering there were 4 hostesses and 2 managers, not one of them would've walked outside to call our name? 

At that point they handed my boyfriend a new charger and expected us to wait more. At that point I walked over to the bar and say down. THANK THE SERVING GODS for Kelly at the bar because she made up for my irritated and highly agitated night. 2 stars is for her and her ONLY. No more Tivoli Village Brio for us.

Always an enjoyable dining experience at the Brio.  Not surprised by the 30 minute wait on a saturday night.  Pork chop was juicy and nicely seasoned.  Even picked up the bone to finish it off.  Small tiramisu cup to finish off dinner...perfect size.

My first review - I'm rating this 5 stars due to the exceptional service provided. We originally were seated with 5 people, and they were able to add 3 (total of 8) when friends happened to join us. Additionally, our server and the restaurant manager still ensured that the timeliness of our food was still a top priority. They did everything to make sure we were satisfied and made us feel very welcomed!

Very disappointed, waited forty-five min for entrées then cold, they remade everything but much too slowly.
Big parties are priority from what we observed. 
Ruined my family's dinning experience!
Thanks.

It was a very good time. The food was delicious (had the grilled mahi mahi and my buddy had the grilled salmon), service was excellent, and helpful servers.  I would stay away from the fried calamari.  It was really greasy and more batter than meat. The design to the restaurant was pretty neat.

Had gone past this place many times while visiting Town Square.  Finally decided to do lunch one day.  The food and staff is excellent.  From the time you enter and see the hostess to the top manager who is Will.  He visits every table while you're eating and chats to ensure everything is OK.  Not many managers do this.  The servers are the best.  They're very attentive to all your needs.  They also have a lot of items on the menu to choose from.  Since this is an Italian restaurant I wasn't disappointed when I ordered the Tiramisu.  Rich and creamy.

Made plans to meet a friend/colleague for a long-overdue lunch. She suggested we meet at Town Square and Brio is one of her favorite haunts. I was panic-stricken as the last time I dined there, healthy fare options seemed scarce.  Was pleasantly surprised to find a phenomenal lunch special -- fish of the day. This day it was mahi mahi with spinach and other veggies. No need to do my "no rice/no potato" special order drama.  I asked for sauce on the side, no oil  and some lemon wedges.  Delicious! I even resisted the bread basket. My friend's steak salad looked fabulous and hearty as well.

Great and Gorgeous my girl and I are having a delicious lunch in Tuscany paradise good is so good!!! And service is excellent the chipotle panini is amazing and my girl loved the low cal salmon plate perfect for couples brunch/dinner

We threw our wedding rehearsal dinner here in April of 2009.!  Wow.  The most courteous wait staff and management we have ever witnessed in Vegas.  We had about 35 people at our dinner and we had some last minute additions as well and the staff scrambled to get everything set for the extra people.  The private dining menu prices are very reasonable and for great food.   The steak was amazing.  Thank you Brio for great service and great food.  We live in the Chicago suburbs and have hosted a friend's baby shower at the Brio in Lombard and have had great experiences there as well.

My first time Brio. Based on review from fellow yelpers I decided to take my wife and try out the happy hour menu.

We loved everything we ordered and the service was great. I will definitely be back to Brio next time I'm in Town Square.
Why doesn't yelp allow half stars.  This is really a 3.5 restaurant.  Typical higher end Italian chain.  Food was ok but not exciting.  Was I expecting any thing different? Service was good.

As a first timer I was impressed with this place! The location is perfect in Town Square. It's a great place for family/friends dinner or even date nights. It had a very soothing and settling environment.

The dishes were slightly large but enough to be finished. They also do half servings, which comes in handy for children or anyone with a small appetite like myself. I got the Lobster and Crab Ravioli and it made my taste buds jump! Their pastas taste how they look - YUMS.

In addition to my satisfying experience, the customer service there is also a two thumbs up. They're on top of customer's requests.

Food was a solid 7.99/10, but service was pretty mediocre, dude with a beard served us.  One refill.  Food arrived separately, food that arrived late, we had to remind him twice to bring us the fresh grated Parmesan.  Eh, maybe worth it on another night.

Four of us was here for dinner on a Saturday, around 8:30pm, the restaurant was quite busy but didn't wait long to be seated, and the food was pretty decent. 

However, we had some very bad service from our waitress. First, she forgot one of our lemonade orders, she never even bothered to come to check on us after the food was placed, not even once, which gave us no chance to ask for the missing lemonade; after we had done eating for about 15mins, she still didn't show up, maybe for a dessert menu? No, not at all. We had to ask a passing by waiter to get our check, and of course when the check was delivered, she showed up... We've heard good things about this place, that's why we tried it.. But the bad service just did not prove anything. Although the food was decent, there are just so many more better Italian restaurants in the valley that we could be treated so much better, and better food.

This place was a big disappointment! I'll keep it short & simple. Server was slow as molasses and not into her job. I ordered a chicken Caesar salad ..easy enough , right? Nope...yellow lettuce, chicken tasted gross and barely any dressing . Manager asked if I wanted a new one...uhhh no! If you can screw up a salad then you got probs! Service slow..food not up to par. Waste of time & money .  I've been to another Brio in Cali ...guess I'll stick with that one because that one is fabulous!

Valentine's Day Special. After receiving numerous e-mails advertising the Valentines Day Special dinner we decided to try it. BIG MISTAKE. Reservations at 5:15 pm. We stood for an hour at the reception desk (little seating and no bar seats available) along with many others waiting for a table. At 6 pm they were just seating the 5 pm reservations. We bailed out and went to another restaurant. Either they overbook or can't get the orders out quick enough to allow early diners to complete their meal. Very disappointing. We wont be back.

Three of us dined. I had a whole roasted chicken with mashed potatoes and grilled veggies was excellent. Of course, I could not eat a whole thing. My son really enjoyed ravioli w/ tasty sauce. My wife had crab cakes which was good. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. Do I go back again? Yes, definitely.

Long story short- I ordered my lamb chop medium rare but it  turned out to be a bit too 'sashimi-like'  for me and they devotedly have it redone for me to medium regardless the buried night. Maybe cos I wasn't expecting much, that was A+ service!
The meat was very tender and the dessert trio was impressive. I think it would have even been better if they could be easy on the salt and sugar.  
Overall I was satisfied with the dining experience.
Great service and food.  Busy Friday night so was a bit noisy for intimate dinner with the one I love..

Hard to find real Italian food in Arizona.  Let's face it everyone can claim it, but hard to match NY style Italian.  Brio, being a chain itself, rises above the other chains and offers some higher quality Italian cooking.

My wife always gets the whole roasted chicken which *is* really good.  It's some of the best restaurant chicken I've had.

I'm partial to trying something different each time I come here, sticking with some pasta dish (heck I can get a steak somehwere else).  The ala Vodka dishes are great and anything with prosciutto is tasty.

This is a great place for small-ish date night group of friends.  Service is always good for us, selection is consistent with specials when you want them and the quality of the food has been excellent for me each time.

Tip: check out the happy hour times to save some cash :-)

Mmm. Brio.

I am so addicted to their Crab and Shrimp Crab Cakes, it's ridiculous. Personally, I like to get the appetizer size (two GIGANTIC crab cakes) and then add my own side of asparagus - which they do just right there. 

If I really want to go crazy, I'll get the Spinach Artichoke Dip that comes served with their Cheese Crisp Flatbread as an appetizer. 

And if I really, really want to go crazy - I will add a Bellini to all that action. 

Brio has never let me down. It's got a great location, right smack in the middle of Town Square. If the weather is nice, have a seat out on the patio for some great people watching. 

I have taken my parents here - I've been on a date here - I've been on a Girl's Night Out here - it's just a CROWD PLEASER. Every dish is delicious and the service is always on point.

I hear they are opening over at Tivoli Village come Spring 2011. A Summerlin location would be fab for those of us who have to make the trek out to Town Square to get there otherwise.

All around great experience. Everyone enjoyed their meal, the service was great and the atmosphere was gorgeous.  

*****Tip sign up for their email club and they send you an offer for a free bruchetta quatro appetizer*****

I've been to Brio for both dinner and happy hour, and enjoyed both experiences.  The happy hour tasting menu has a bunch of items for just $2.95!  We had the burger, margharita flatbread, shrimp and eggplant and the steak bruschetta....all were really good and decent sized portions.  But make sure to get there early to snag a table, it is first come, first serve seating in the bar area and only goes until 6 pm!

The only thing that I have had a Brio so far that I would not suggest is the lobster bisque.  I absolutely adore lobster bisque, but this version was so thick...you almost had to chew it!  Other than the bisque, the food has been perfect, seafood risotto, Gorgonzola lamb chops....all excellent.  And if you still have room for dessert...you must try the caramel creme brulee....it is amazing!

Brio is a Italian Grille in a shopping center catering to tourists on the strip. The food is average, but takeout from any chain fast food is just about as good. 

We started with Roasted Garlic, Spinach and Artichoke dip. It was warm but not hot when served. By the time we all had some it cooled to a strange consistency. Chopped salad was good. Veggies were fresh and the portion was good size. The Campanelle Carbonara was presented in a soupy white sauce that was very thin and tasteless. The thin Alfredo sauce was the consistency of a white wine sauce. When asked the server explained that was normal. The pasta was cooked properly but was not fresh. Clearly prepackaged dried pasta. The special for the night was a Chicken and Vegetable Spaghettini this too was served lukewarm. Surprising to have that happen considering the place was half full. No big tables or crowds. 

Basically just an average place with very average food.
Brio has an excellent menu and wonderful atmosphere.  Ideal for date night or any celebratory dinner.  They also have a fabulous happy hour.

Pricey, but you would expect that going into a fine dining restaurant.  Came here on a double date with some of our friends from out of town.  I forgot what cut of meat my husband ordered but we both agreed that it was one of the most tender steaks we have had.  May come back once in a while but probably wouldn't be a regular here because of the prices. Nice clean and welcoming environment.  Probably good for bigger groups looking for a nice place for a special dinner.

I rate this place three stars, the service was average, nothing exceptional to remember. Me and my friends were sat down in a booth and the waiter took ages to arrive, but we could understand since there was a rather large crowd. We put in our order and our food came quickly, extremely fast to be honest and we sat there amazed that they did it in a short time span. Other than that we just sat amongst ourselves and ate our meals, I had ordered the chicken Marsala and it was alright, a little bit overpriced in my opinion. Other than that it was an average experience

Brio is a step above your typical chain Italian restaurants. The atmosphere at the location in Town Village is great. The food is fresh and hot and the wine list extensive. Top off your day of shopping in Town Village by going to Brio.

My husband and I finally made it to Brio across from Kierland last Saturday night. We usually do not stray too far from the Central corridor and RARELY to Scottsdale but this place was worth it. The place is beautiful inside and busy so I recommend a reservation. We ordered a bottle of Malbec (tasty and only $27.00). My husband ordered the lobster bisque...1 word for that ....mmmmm...and I don't think that's even a word. I ordered a chop salad which was more than enough to share....we followed up by splitting the lasagna. This was where it really got good because they split for us which to me is always a plus and kudo's to the person that can eat a whole piece. The pasta was light and fresh and it was covered with 1/2 alfredo and 1/2 red sauce. Maybe not traditional but was REALLY good. I wish I could have had desert but there was just NO room. All of the other food looked really good as well....and...before I forget the service was great. We were served by Saira who knew her stuff....she was friendly, out going with a great personality and helped answer all of our questions plus threw out her favorites. Next time I am going for HH to try that menu because $2.95 appetizers ALWAYS works for me but if there is no seat at the bar than I would be just as happy in the dining room and I would definetly ask for Saira. P.S....this place won't break your wallet.
The food was actually very good!  However, it took us forever to get our food, and it was definitely on the pricey side.
This location is 10x times better than Town Square. Plus we had an amazing waitress. Good job and keep it up!

Visited Brio for the first time last night to celebrate a couple of birthdays with my girlfriends. I had, had data for dinner the previous night so I thought I would do something different and decided to order the Filetto Di Manzo Toscano and I have to say I was the steak I have ever had! I'm not a big steak eater maybe crab it once a year but for this on I might ale an exception an go back multiple times a year. Just delicious!

We had a wedding rehearsal dinner in a private room at BRIO. The staff was amazing there. Novo (events manager) was so nice over the phone, assisted in making this an easy booking, and making sure we had a great dinner. Our server was great. He was on top of drink orders, making sure the food was correct and placed in front of the right person. He was never intrusive when coming in to check on us, somehow made us feel taken care of but never bothered. Truly a great experience and would recommend to others.

Brio is great.  As crowded as Town Square restaurants can be, the wait is always quick at Brio.  Their menu has some seriously delicious selections, and the pricing is great for the quality of the restaurant.  One of my favorite things on the menu is the shrimp and eggplant appetizer... spicy, crispy... its as good as it gets.  I've had everything from pizza to pasta and fish and chicken here and its all been great.  The daily special menu usually has a fish dish on it which have always been great.  And if you stick around for after dinner, the creme brulee here is awesome, as is their coffee.  The brunch menu is also amazing... try the sausage florentine crepes... i'm getting hungry writing this.  Go there... you'll see.

I rate this place a 3 all because of the sever she was extremely nice and well spoken.
The food was meh nothing special. I had the grilled chicken breast with mushrooms and mashed potatoes.  I had the peach sangria which was superb.

Amazing wait staff and great food.
Atmosphere of this bistro can't be easily beat.
I chose the Brunch Burger which was perfect medium rare!
Gluten free pasta available was also a plus.
Great place for brunch and plenty of room, no crowded tables.

I've been to Brio Several times now for a sit down dinner and many more times for togo orders.
- I get the salmon Caesar salad - not on the menu but they always complie to my request on a Caesar salad with Salmon (they could add a  lemon wedge to that salad without having to ask each time).  Dressing on the salad isn't enough sometimes have to ask for extra , but delicious - only once was my salmon not cooked thoroughly (hey it happens, no biggie I'm not going to think that the restaurant is out to get me and did it purposely- and based off of that one incident give them a negative review as I see so often on yelp for many restaurants out there) but every other time which is more than 7 times now since I've had the salad has been consistent, not chewy has slight charred/grilled taste (love)  and not over done either. 

- Kids always share a kids menu item Pizza -can feed both your kids, nice size to share with two small kiddos, kids enjoy the frozen lemonade and a smoothie.

-hubby gets a few different dishes each time, mostly pasta with some form of chicken. He says he likes it, and its enough for leftovers as well.

-The two times we've had desserts were great, nothing extraordinary. My kids love the ice cream lava cake?- I'm not a huge sweet tooth person so my dessert review maybe skewed.... maybe will need to try each dessert to get a better impression.

- No experience with wine so can't comment there

I've given 4 stars because I'm a fan of the food and the atmosphere and will continue to be a patron of Brio,  Service has always been pleasant, but there has been a couple of times where the waiter forget to refill the water or only stopped by only once during our meals and that was to deliver the check, but still room for improvement and nothing negative to say. 

Beautiful décor and ambience, people complain about the price, but what do you expect? I'm sure food cost isn't cheap on salmon, chicken or other seafood, Gotta cover the overhead of the building, décor, tons of staff, pay the their bills somehow.  Depending on the time, we've waited anywhere from 5 minutes - 30 minutes.

Came here this past Friday night with my mother, it was super busy and we were starving! The staff was extremely accommodating - especially to my mother who is very particular - thank you staff for being so patient! The manager, I believe, was seriously was of the most professional managers I have ever had the pleasure of speaking too, I was seriously beyond impressed. Food was delicious and our waitress worked very hard. This has always been one of my favorite places and I left absolutely happy and satisfied! My mother was too :)

I walked into this place for happy hour one evening expecting a few reasonably prices cocktails and a couple decent appetizers. I had experienced below average service here in the past, but nothing egregious. Knowing this, I had mentally prepared myself for the culinary adventure I was about to undertake... I sat down with a friend at one of the round tables in the bar area. I noticed the same waitress who had been my waitress the other times I had entered the establishment, the very same one who had given shotty service in the past. She was very busy talking to a woman seated at the bar, they appeared to be friends (I made eye contact with her about five times as I waited). I noticed the bar tender as I sat, Making eye contact with this gentleman multiple times. I sat for about 5 minutes, my excitement disappearing by the minute. Again, I made eye contact with the bartender. He went over to the waitress who was still talking to her friend and asked "are you going to take care of them?" being busy, she retorted "that's your job, my tables are all taken care of". They are arguing loudly, so the patrons in the bar could hear every word, for about 3 minutes. My friend was so embarrassed. Finally, the waitress came over and handed us menus, asked if we wanted waters, and would be back to take our order. We left the establishment. We went across the street to Made LV, and vented to the bartender there about this treatment. He laughed and said he heard it all the time. I wrote an email to the Brio corporate office relating this experience. A couple of days later, brio called, but I missed the call. I called back and spoke to the hostess, who took a message for the manager that I had called back. I received a call from the manager the next day, who apologized and was very sweet,  but also informed me that HER manager wanted to talk to me and apologize. It's been 2 and a half weeks and am still waiting for a call. By the way, first yelp review. 

-Russ

Unimpressed. My husband actually thought the lasagna bland. the risotto and chicken dish I ordered had too much salt. Service was decent though we were seated at a booth with an extremely bright light emanating from a lamp we shared with another booth, while lights were dimmer elsewhere. The folks occupying the booth sharing our light expressed annoyance as well. I proceeded to inquire from a waitress if there was anyway to adjust the lighting but she indicated there wasn't anything that could be done other than pushing down on the lampshade to block the brightness which only  spotlighted our neighbors. So my husband, noticing my discomfort, took it upon himself to fix the problem, stood up and loosened the bulb turning off the lamp. Whew, what a relief and we were thanked by fellow customers in the neighboring booth yet there was more than sufficient lighting enabling us to  read the menu and hopefully enjoy what turned out to be a boring meal. Quite disappointed and we will not be returning anytime soon.

In a word: disappointing.  In two words: very disappointing.  

Food: average.  Typical BRIO (one step up from Olive Garden).
Service: bad.  Really bad.  UNFORGETTABLY bad.

When in college I worked as a waiter.  I well know how hard the job can be.  And I give food servers every "break" I can.  But ours was just plain BAD!  Yet, I sense, it was not entirely his fault.  He was not well trained.

I dislike Yelp reviews that drone on about every detail of one's unpleasant experience.  So I won't.  But, in summary: waiter had no knowledge of the wine list, did ask if we wanted our salads before or with entrée (we chose before) but forgot all about bringing them and, finally (without asking) cleared the table of bread, butter, and my dining companion's plate long before I was finished eating.  (He asked if I wanted my "leftovers" to go while I was still chewing my last mouthful!)  

I chose to dine at BRIO specifically because I love their chopped salad.  Oh, how I wish I had had the opportunity to enjoy one.
Service during happy hour in the bar area is just so-so. The service in the actual restaurant is excellent. Shrimp and eggplant is my favorite appetizer.

I love Brio! Great food ,great service, great prices in the beautiful Town Square center! During the week they have fabulous, large portioned appetizers for $2.95 or $3.95. I booked a large group and they placed us in our own private room without charging banquet prices!I highly recommend!

Just went there tonight, it was great, chic restaurant, great service.
The Veal was really good but the dessert part was the best, had the Tiramisu, just wished the portion was a bit bigger but it was probably the best Tiramisu I've ever had.

Also, if you're planning to get the whole roasted chicken, beware, it is a WHOLE chicken but very good though.
Below average Italian food and miserable service on the night we were there. I was back on a second occasion with a group and had only a slightly better experience. 2 stars for a nice patio.

I took my boyfriend to this place for his birthday. We loved it. I would recommend that if you are in Vegas to go to this place. The food was excellent and customer service was on point. Omg there dessert is to die for. Can't wait to go back. It was an amazing  experience.

My son and now wife held their informal wedding in the private dining room on 10/20. Everything was great.  The event coordinator got everything arranged according to their wishes.  All of the guests enjoyed their meals which were prepared and presented very nicely.  The servers did a great job, especially considering all of the mingling guests they had to take care of.  The private room was perfect for the occasion.  Thank you to all involved! Char

Invited my mom there last night, found on Yelp that if you check in you have a free app.  Our server tell us that we can choose between app and bruchettas. We pick the Spicy Shrimp and eggplant and it's was delicious!!! We finished the spicy sauce with the warm bread!  We also found on Yelp some pasta with angel hair,  shrimp, caramelised onion,.. but they didn't do it anymore but the server recommend something similar and put shrimp instead of chicken  (without any up charge :) ). So we both had the Pesto pasta . It wasn't very flavoured,  we had to put some salt and pepper.. we will come back for a glass of wine and the amazing spicy shrimps and eggplant! ....and the patio is beautiful !

Absolutely love this place. It's a Italian steak house of sorts, with great eats and a classy ambiance. It's not necessarily Capitol Grill or a Chop House, not that it is trying to be, but its half the price those ever were, local and with a great menu.

Just had the Sunday brunch at Brio.  The crab and shrimp cakes were delicious.  Service was awesome today!  Location is beautiful.  I have eaten at the Brio at both town square and Tivoli and been very happy with both locations in as Vegas.
My fiancee and I had dinner at this Brio Saturday night and enjoyed great service, great food,  and delicious drinks.  The bartender was outstanding!
Was looking for a place to beat the heat and the bartender Brendan was pretty neat! The Black Pepper Shrimp is made for a Pimp. And the Brio Burger! Should I go any further?

Went here for lunch. Was good food. Took long time. Our waitress was very out of it and smelled
Like alcohol. Kind of amusing but had we been needing to be somewhere I would have been really mad. Hopefully the managers look at these.

Delicious Italian restaurant with a great atmosphere located close to the airport.  This will become one of my favorite restaurants to come. to.  Relaxing, good service and after dinner, you can walk around looking at some great retail establishments.

We came here for happy hour and the place is superb. Our server Nikki is top notch and was very attentive. This place is lucky to have her as she is a valuable asset to their team. The food was exceptional and the price was great. The atmosphere was good and we had a great time. We will be back.

The originality of the dishes are platitudinous however there was some fresh and delicious qualities. The bruschetta flight was decent (every place feels the need to put bruschetta on something that has the texture of a stale pretzel but its so much better on a piece of lightly toasted bread like sourdough) and the risotto had good flavor but the shrimp inside the dish were puny. Solid wine list, good happy hour, plus good service would bring me back for a snack and a drink... I would probably skip dinner though and just patron the happy hour.

I am gluten free and had the most amazing pasta lunch here for my birthday. I honestly never thought I'd taste anything that delicious again after I got diagnosed as having celiac disease. I literally day dream about my last meal at Brio and can't wait to go back.
Brio is back with the great service. We had plenty of bread and drink refills before our dinner came out....5 stars!

My favorite Italian/Tuscan food in town.  I think it's far better than Allesia's in Mesa.  The lobster bisque is the best soup I've ever had in my life.  Not expensive, but reasonable priced based on the food quality.  Good wine menu and something for everybody.  Take the fam or make it a special night out with the wife.  This place will accommodate any occasion.

Haven't been out to a restaurant in forever with the fam so I thought we'd give this one a try. My bistecca salad side was the highlight of the meal for everyone. My wife ordered a lobster bisque appetizer which was flat and salty. Her Mediterranean penne pasta was bland and over cooked. My fettucine "Alfredo" rustica was missing the creaminess desired in an Alfredo dish. I don't think they added any cheese. My 5 year old also said that the lemonade is better at McDonalds. Overall- $50 plus for bland, over cooked pasta. Sucky. Will never return.
Solid food. Neither spectacular nor bad. Good service. Sit outside.

Authenticity is not their forte.  However, location and happy hour is.  Loved the beef carpaccio and pasta vodka with Peroni draft.  My wife loves the free sour dough and spiced flat bread - lol.  Fyi, mall employees get a nice 20% off ;)  I say 3.5, but rounding up to 4 because service has always been great.

I've been to Brio several times--it's been a great go-to place for us while walking the San Tan Mall. It's always been reliably good, reasonably priced, and good service. I would always have given it 4 solid stars.

BUT, last night was outstanding and they earned the 5th star. I went with 3 friends from work for happy hour, 1 of whom was grumbling about driving all the way out to the middle of nowhere (we work in Chandler, he lives in Central Phx). When we got there, the only room to stand was on the bar patio, which was wasted space. There were a couple of tables, but we could have done cartwheels in the empty areas. So, we asked if we could bring chairs out, and we borrowed a side table from another couple who had 2, and the servers bent over backwards to accommodate us. Suddenly, we had a nice, cozy corner of the patio to ourselves and we stayed for 4 hours! Don't worry, we ordered enough drinks and food to justify sitting there that long! Our server, Amy, was absolutely adorable, and she could have sat down and had drinks with us and fit right in. The little garden table was small, so Amy left us a serving tray and a stand to put our food on. Again, above and beyond.

The food was outstanding. $3 for huge appetizers?? Hello! We ordered 8! It made the fact that we were spending $10 on martinis a little more palatable. No drinks specials, but really, the food was so good we really didn't mind. The burger was HUGE, and well cooked, the flatbreads were delicious, and the bruschetta--especially the steak one--were perfect.. High quality ingredients, very well prepared. This was NOT happy hour bar food. Not a chicken wing or mozzarella stick in sight.

Amy told us that on Thursday nights, they take $2 off martinis in addition to the food specials, so we'll be going back then. And by the end of the night, the grumbler was totally won over--he couldn't say enough about how great it was, and he's a tough customer. He doesn't hand out praise easily.

We'll be back again, that's for sure!

Wow! Planned a wedding reception for 25 after my son's wedding last weekend. All done by phone, planning with Tiffany at Brio. She couldn't have been more effiecient and professional. Our group was put in a lovely private room with 2 servers to assist us. The food was really, really delicious! My favorite being the grilled pork chops, yum. We had the room for 2 1/2 hours and I was able to have a cake delivered and also put out favors at each table. The servers always asked us  prior to adding any charges to our bill. Very well priced. Beautiful setting at Towne Square, inside as well. Not high end but well presented and a great value and looked and tasted MUCH more than the price reflected. What a memorable evening!

My family loves Brio! We eat there once a month and have never had an issue with anything. Our food is always great, servers are friendly, atmosphere great and we love the desserts! Anyone who complains about pricing needs to get out more. Food prices everywhere have gone up and for what you get at Brio it is reasonable.

Beautiful decor, super friendly staff, but it's a chain...

Typical italian fare and a brunch menu, so we tried both.  We had the french toast which is better at IHOP or any other breakfast joint.  We also tried the lunch sandwich and salad combo. My turkey club panini was a waste...tons of bread with one slice of turkey, too much cheese, and an unchewable tomato.  The chopped salad was ordinary.

We won't be going back. Once is enough.

Went there for Xmas breakfast with my family. Ouch bad choice. The breakfast fare was less than exciting. Scrambled eggs,bacon,sausage,home fries, French toast sticks and muffin. Eggs were good. Bacon was greasy and undercooked. Home fries were hard and cold. French toast were dry and hard. The orange juice served in sealed cups were frozen. Waste of time and money.

This is a fantastic place to stop after a day of shopping.  The decor is a little bit over the top, but the food definitely makes up for it.  The service has always been great for me and the pasta is excellent.

This place is a winner.  Having just relocated from one of the best food meccas in California (SF Bay Area), I have been on a quest for good, non-chain restaurants. Every thing about this place works.  Atmosphere, location, parking, meal any time of the daytime,  excellent menu choices, great service mixed with mediocre, healthy food choices,  small dessert portions, excellent wine choices--I could go on.  In 6 weeks since moving we have been here 5 or 6 times.  I will bring friends here for sure, and I just ate dinner alone in the bar area 2 days ago, & it was perfect for me!!  All you negatives , go elsewhere. This is a fine choice!!
Love the atmosphere and the service! Nice clean friendly place that my husband and I enjoy regularly.

Made reservations for 8 on Mother's Day for a late lunch and was seated promptly with my entire family. The service was phenomenal, our waiter was extremely attentive and kind! Ordered the Pasta Ala Vodka which was absolutely DELICIOUS. The waiter never left us without bread as he knew my two picky toddlers were only going to be eating the bread and he even gave us fresh bread to go! Ordered the dessert sampler and tiramisu which were just amazing. I am never disappointed, but this visit was really special. My 3 year old daughter even hugged the waiter before we left!!! Will absolutely be coming back!
Came here for lunch with coworkers, had grilled salmon angel hair pasta. The salmon is pretty good, but a very small portion. One of my coworker keeps saying he is hungry right after lunch :)

Don't bother to come here if your looking for good tasting Italian food. The service was good, but quality of the food was poor. Appetizer we ordered was calamari. It seemed frozen and not fresh. Sauces were not good. I had the pesce piccata, it was very dry and not pleasant tasting at all. The pasta fra diavlo was terrible. It looked like mac and cheese with shrimp.  The third person had the risotto, that was just okay, definitely not good. 

Highlight was sangria and bread. 

It's sad that we wasted some decent money on some bad food.

alright Brio!!! You have redeemed yourself! 
Came here on a Thursday and the service was back to the expectation we had. Our server was lovely and she was well informed on all the happy hour menu! 
Thursdays are absolutely insane, so get there early to find a good spot, the server in the bar found us a spot even though there were none. Anyways my wife and I will be coming back again and am happy that we had better experience.
 Hopefully the previous cocktail server has had some  better days and shows more kindness to her guest! For us the restaurant experience is a combo of service and food.

To start, -1 star for repeat violations, all three violations were repeated from last visit. -2 Server chewing gum while folding dinner napkin (essentially spiting on everyone's napkin THANKS, -3 runner bringing out food when we are only half way done with our salads (I had to ask him to take the hot food back, which when it did come out it was just warm oh well, he was just going to leave it on our table where it would have turned cold by the time we got to it, c'mon man I know it's not fine dinning, but it's not Olive Garden either), -4 pantry cooks using single use food handlers gloves improperly (really scary, if you don't know how to use them correctly, they are actually worse than bare hands). I like your food, but please these are all training and management issues. The last time on our way out I passed a Manager who asked how everything was and I told him. This time no one asked, so know I'm telling everyone. PLEASE FIX THESE ISSUES WE LIKE YOUR FOOD, BUT UNLESS THESE ISSUES ARE FIXED I'LL JUST FIND SOME PLACE ELSE TO SPEND MY MONEY.

I was as customer on Sat, Feb 2nd, and now I am getting around to my updates.
Good food for the $$, easy access, and decent, attentive wait staff.  I read all the latest reviews on this place and might I say some of the negative ones must have just been very unlucky. One note: get there early as the closer to dinner the longer the wait.
I was VERY satisfied with my meal! I had the pasta primevera. Very flavorful! You can't eat here in a rush....because they take their time. Not too long, but the wait is DEFINITELY worth it! ;)

This was a pleasant surprise! We really enjoyed the food but did let the manager know the service was sub par. Thomas absolutely made things right. No excuses! We will for sure be back!  That is the way to run a business.

The happy hour is unquestionably the best in the valley of the sun.  the tuscan decor is great with the carpaccio topping the appetizer list for both flavor, size and aioli sauce.  The happy hour wines are valued accordingly.  the main dishes are excellent.

My favorite day of the week is Sundays just because of Brunch! Brio never fails me with their delicious brunch options and Mimosa pitchers. Me & Mom come pretty much every Sunday and enjoy a nice view @ the bar. Jade is the BEST bartender and always makes us feel welcome and no matter how busy they are (& Boy do they get busy), she always give us the best service. 

I cant pick one plate to rave about because all the apps are great (especially the Bruchetta sampler) and the brunch menu has several great options, depending on what your in the mood for. 

All the staff is very attentive and the manager is always walking around checking on everyone. There is usually a wait for a table, so come prepared but its definitely worth it. 

We will keep coming back for the Yummy food, Great drinks & Jade!

What a night!.. My boyfriend and I were meeting up with family for a special occasion and Brio was the spot. From the moment he approached our table, I cannot begin to describe how pleasant Matt was to us throughout the meal. Absolutely attentive, wonderfully personable, and professional. I generally don't write reviews, but I can't deny this man undeniable skill in his craft. Can't praise the night enough!

Excellent Service!  Alberto made great recommendations.  Food was delicious---excellent red sauce---had calamari, tomato soup, margarita flatbread and spaghetti.  Enjoyed our experience.  Will be back and ask for Alberto!

I have eaten at Brio's on several occasions in the past and have always found the food and service to be very good. On our visit last week, however, I found the experience to be exceptional.  I ordered the Carbonara  and it had to be one of the best I have had.  The dish included fresh spinach and chicken, delicious.  In addition, the service provided by Ashley was excellent.

Happy hour rocks!  The food is incredible and the price is right! 

Beef Carpaccio - Field greens, capers, mustard aioli, Parmesan 3.95. My favorite!  

Margherita Flatbread - Fresh Mozzarella, vine-ripened tomatoes, fresh basil 3.95

Sausage & Pepperoni Flatbread - Ricotta, Mozzarella, Provolone, housemade tomato sauce 4.95

BRIO Burger* - Provolone, roasted tomato mayonnaise, housemade chips 5.95

Tomato Mozzarella Salad - Vine-ripened tomatoes, fresh Mozzarella, field greens, basil, balsamic drizzle, lemon vinaigrette 4.95

And more.  Also, The Patio is great when the weather is nice.
Love this place. Food is exquisite and the service impeccable. Right away, as you enter, you notice this place is well lit, clean and crisp. I dislike going into a restaurant and it is dim and dingy.

Great happy hour and yummy $5 martinis on Wednesdays. You can't beat their bar menu either. The beef carpaccio is good as is the shrimp dish. The white bean dip is tasty and feels healthy.  ;) The only slight hiccup in our experience was the so-so service from the bartenders. I sat at the bar for a good 5-10 minutes before being acknowledged by either one and it was only because I caught their attention. I understand they must've been busy making drinks with the $5 martini special, but one generally wants to be acknowledged. When my friend arrived one bartender did the same thing and actually approached people who arrived after she did. Overall, an ok experience, but perhaps a little work on customer service. I don't ever skimp on tip and this time was no different, although I feel like I should have said something. I still like local establishments vs chains that go the extra mile with friendly service better. :)

We sat outside since the weather is getting nicer to do so in Las Vegas!!! Some friends joined up for happy hour as Brio is about the best in town. Sometimes the service at this location is questionable but this visit we had great service and, unfortunately, I cannot remember her name:(  As always, the food and drinks were great!
Food is always great! Sat at the bar and had the best service and Bloody Mary with Jade the bartender! Always great time but this was above and beyond. The bruschetta sampler is awesome.

This is our first time trying this restaurant. The location of this place in Tivoli is beautiful. As well the interior of the restaurant. The server we got was nice and helpful. Stars for the looks but the food was even worse than Olive Garden which I'm giving 0 star. My husband and I have traveled across U.S. and even out of the country and that's how we learned how to love food. And we love love love fried calamari. The calamari we got was too much breading, tasteless and hard. The worst calamari we ever had that we could not even finish it (and I hate wasting food). And the lasagna and pasta we got were OK(i would say applebee's quality)

This place is Very good ! Thank you so much to the Boss, Manager or whoever Run this place. And bIg Thank you to a NOVA the special party planner. He made our get together party very special ! I were misunderstood  on the phone conversation. But got there and he take n care of it :-) Showed me that he cares about he's job how to please the customers, and people ! Thank you very very much !

I  happy Customers ! :-) 10 stars !

We have been visiting this restaurant on a pretty regular basis since it was opened. I must say that this past visit was one of the worse experiences we have had. The waitress was excellent but the food was terrible. Seems that the food preparation has suffered under new management. Steak was not prepared to our asking and vegetables were cold. We have noticed a decline in the food but an increase in price, not a good combination. Not sure if we will return or not. Our daughter loves the wedge salad and is the one that talks us into going all the time but I think we might need to make another choice and disappoint her.

Absolutely love this place. We come for happy hour -- their $2.95 Tuscan tasters are fantastic, especially the spicy shrimp and eggplant, which is probably one of my favorite restaurant foods of all time, and their sliders (hint -- dip the sliders in the sauce from the spicy shrimp and eggplant for a real treat). I also love their steaks on the regular menu. They get it right every time. 

Love the staff, too. They always remember us.

I was not disappointed .......... the service and food were Very Good.

                  You'll find a  Quality Meal ....... with Quality Prices.
                  From the Hostess to the Servers ........ its all Ten's. 

About the Food ...... Throughout my life ..... I've had better Italian.
This is Upscale Dinning ....... its more about the experience ...... then the Food.
Conversations with your tablemates ....... are almost impossible ..... Extremely Noisy. 

        By all means ........ Try it Once ........ Then decide for yourself about return visits. 

                       Me ......... I'll be back ....... every 2 or 3 months.
This place is gorgeous! Food is excellent. All the waiters are hott!! LOL.. i will def be going back for more!

Do not come here. We went to attempt and eat dinner at this place with a group of 6...my 2 friends and my fiancé and her friend. They are both from London and have British drivers licenses. We attempted to order 2 bottles or Prosecco and the waitress said they had to provide their passport on top of the ID or they couldn't be served..we have been for for 3 nights and have eaten out every meal and went to nice clubs and have not been asked to provide a second ID. The lady brought the manager over and she was very rude and cold. I asked to show me the law/article that shows international tourists have to provide a passport on top of their ID, and she said she didn't have it..she pulled this rule out of a rabbits hat. The waitress and manager were so rude and unfriendly and don't know how they work in the service industry..even if you don't have the same problem we had avoid coming here this is a crusty chain establishment with horrible service. Take your business elsewhere there are much nicer places in this price range.

The service is crisp and professional.  It is located in the hustling and bustling new Scottsdale quarter, right across the street from the parking deck.  Outdoor patio seating lets you observe and people watch.  This is our absolute favorite place for a fabulous tasty steak salad.

On Sept 23, 2015 We had a small wedding reception at Brios.  What an amazing experience.  They went into the room and decorated for me because I was at the wedding. It was beautiful. The food and service were top notch.  One dish stood out,  a vodka pasta plate was a big hit! 
A very special praise to Nova the director of banquets.  A very sweet, understanding and helpful young man.  He was there for me when I was breaking down and nervous about the party. He is just perfect at what he does! 
Thank you for a perfect day! 
Sandra Perreault and family

Went there for my birthday the service was horrible we were given dirty utensils also the glasses weren't polished. The pasta was bland and I didn't like the chicken that was in the pasta. Better off eating at California pizza.

The lobster bisque was delicious!  The prices weren't to bad, two adult two children $120.00 after tip. One minor complaint, two of our sodas ran empty and I had to ask for a refill. This is a big pet peeve of mine however I'll cut them a little slack since it is Mother's Day. We will return.

Food and service are excellent!  My wife called me gay for my drink selections, but the flirtini is awesome too. 

The only downfall is that we were told we would have a 25 minute wait, but ended up waiting over an hour.

Really good restaurant. The service is good and the food is delicious. It is perhaps a bit pricy but I suppose  it is slightly a classy restaurant. I often get chicken on the brick and the marguerite pizza. Both are great. The sitting area is nice particularly the outside during the summer.
Stick to the pastas, everything else is poorly prepared. Dried up chicken and overpriced steaks. Prices do not reflect the food quality.

Best place ever! Momma and I are regulars here, and the great food coupled with exceptional service really put this place over the top. From the complimentary bread to the incredible chopped salad to the amazing pastas , steaks, chicken and seafood dishes, you will wonder if any restaurant can ever measure up. Enjoy!

Amazing service all around!  Amanda the server was on point and adorable!  Even told her I like cheese, so she brought a container of extra cheese for my to go container!  Made my friend samantha 's birthday amazing!
This place is so good! They made our anniversary really special with free champaign and dessert. I would definitely recommend this restaurant!

Really, really bad service. My husband and I decided to try this place in a whim. We arrived around 8:30 on a Saturday night. There was no wait and plenty of open tables. We were asked to wait for the next available table. Meanwhile, while we were waiting 3 parties of 2 who walked in after us were promptly seated. When we were finally seated, we waited another 10 minutes with no greeting. My husband and I finally walked out without even ordering. The only time were greeted was by the manager on our way out asking how our meal was. We both have worked in the service industry and were appalled by the lack of urgency.
Amazing good, good service, live music and an amazing interior and setting. Highly recommend!

I stopped in for lunch as I was in the area and had some time to kill.  I was pleasantly surprised by the ambience and the food at the Brio.  It is across the street from Kierland Commons in the Scottsdale Quarter, and kind of out of the way if you are at Kierland.  But I was visiting the Apple Store, so it was a convenient stop. 

It is very nice inside and spacious, although not very intimate.  There are several small areas set off from the main room, but the over-all affect is like a large chain restaurant. 

I was there right after the lunch rush hour, so the servers were not busy.  There were two that were taking care of my table, and they were very pleasant, and very attentive.  Their suggestions were helpful, especially as to the size of the servings and the daily specials.  I had the bruschetta sampler and the Pasta alla Vodka and both were very good. The prices were reasonable, and that, along with the service and quality of food made it a very enjoyable lunch.

The servers did tell me about their bar menu and happy hour, which sounds very interesting.  I will have to stop in next time I'm in the area - I'm always looking for good HH.
Great! Went during happy hour, although they were busy the food and the waiter service was fast and efficient. We had four happy hour items and 5 drinks for $40.

Very good chicken piccata. Portion size was right, good amount veg and cooked perfectly. Skip the Sangria - better of with beer here. Drinks not this place specialty. Bit expensive but the "light" menu is probably the way to go.
Matt was an amazing waiter on our anniversary dinner.   Shrimp and Lobster Risotto was tremendous.   Rich and plentiful - cooked perfectly.

Went with some friends with happy hour and was disappointed. The food was not good, the only fish we enjoyed was the eggplant with shrimp. We sent everything else back unfinished, especially the beef carpaccio. 
The drinks were ok, but had very little alcohol. 
Overall I would not come back.

Booked a reservation for five at 4:30 p.m. on a Sunday.  Our party was there EXACTLY on time but we had to wait just under 10 minutes until the hostess figured out where to seat us...so what's the point of a reservation? Minus 1 1/2 star.

After we were seated, no one came to our table and acknowledged us for 10 more minutes. Huge customer service mistake. The waitress finally showed up but she should've had the bus person bring water and bread while she was taking our drink orders. Again Brio's management, customer service was underwhelming. Minus 1 star.

The drinks were served and our food order was taken then delivered.

1.) Shrimp Mediterranean..5 med/small shrimp on skewer. Small portion, o.k. flavor.
2.) Lasagna..the two members of our party liked the flavor, not the portion.
3.) Spaghetti in red sauce..it's spaghetti, what else can I say.
4.) Veal Milanese...basically chicken fried steak with a small side of pasta. Not worth  it for me. Flavor was nothing special. Pasta was plain.

Meal = Minus 1 1/2 star.  Flavor, portion and presentation are all lacking.

Overall = Total of 1 star given. Brio's is 100% geared towards tourist who would probably never come back so the attention and details of the staff and quality of the food is not a concern. I will also never come back or recommend Brio's to my friends. This is a customer service town with a lot of choices, first impression counts when it comes to where I spend my money.

Our booth still had crumbs on the seats when we sat down (we were a walk-in on a Friday night, so I can't judge too harshly). Other than that, the service and food was great.  We had the Caprese Classico, Shrimp Mediterranean, and 5 oz. Filet Brio from the Light Menu.  Delicious and guilt-free :)
had a drink at the bar. fairly priced.  dinner was very good.  ate here last year when we were in town and enjoyed that visit too.  highly recommend

We came here on the 4th of July for dinner..  There were not many patrons which was great!   We sat right down and had Ashley as our server.  She was excellent. We had the burrata & ciabatta ap w/ a side of balsamic (free w/ Yelp checkin), double pork chop (beyond tender and moist), Milanese (great size), and the pasta pesto.  All of our food was very good, made exactly how we ordered w/ a few changes. I would definitely come back.

Every time we visit Vegas we eat here.  Wonderful atmosphere and great food.  James was our server, who was very friendly. Our table had the lamb chops, lasagna, chicken Milanese, pasta pesto, gluten free sausage pasta, sampler dessert, cream brûlée, ricotta cheesecake, chocolate cake w/ vanilla Ice cream.   Every dish was flavorful, and well worth it for the prices. We'll definitely continue to return....

A group of us went for AZ Restaurant Week. I am not sure if it was all the large graduation parties or lack of experience with the Restaurant Week menu but service was a disaster. We waited 15 min for a first drink and it only got worse from there, finally after our dinner was served before our appetizer and we refused it, a manager stepped in and things got a bit better. We really appreciated his help.
The food was really good which made it extra disappointing that things were so disorganized. Additionally on both of the plates that included vegetables, the veggies were cold. By then we had given up trying to get things right. 
We were there just under 2 hours for a very basic meal. The waiter was very apologetic once he caught up but I am not sure if I would try it again.

I enjoy this restaurant it had the best Caesar salad I've ever eaten. The ambience is nice I didn't really like the valet parking it's an $8 charge to park your car in front there is a public garage directly across the driveway from the restaurant but I found it to be full and was forced to use valet parking the food and the service was good actually the service was a little too good she came back every 10 minutes to ask me if I was doing okay but all in all I would say this is a very good restaurant and I would recommend it

My wife and I have been to Brio 3 times. All three times the wine was served HOT. Not warm, room temp. HOT. Each time the waitress acknowledged the fact and asked us if we would like a "side of ice". Are you kidding me!? When I asked if they receive a lot of comments on the wine, she replied "yes, but usually ice helps". On to the food..... average is about the best it can be rated. We have tried the restaurant 3 times just to be fair. Too many managers, servers, bartenders running around to have mediocre service and average food. Three strikes on this place...

Good food, great prices of Happy hours as usual but again disappointed by the service. No smiles, no sincere services by hosts and server. What's wrong with this place?? It was much better before. It's getting worse and worse every time I go there.

I like this restaurant but it seems so loud. The couple times I've been here it was always crowded and reaaallllyy loud. I don't necessarily like having dinner at a place where I can't here the person next to me. The food is pretty good and price in my opinion is right. Wish that the restaurant had less of an open design so that the sounds done travel as harshly.
Good food and service. I got the lobster tail and shrimp. It was amazing. The spinach dip was good.
The food was so great..not blown away by our server! She didn't have much of a personality. :-/ Think her name was Michelle..

Came for brunch today and had the best experience. Mimosas, Benedict and French toast were all amazing! Seen the manager seating a table , running food and even stopped to fill our mimosas for us :) No wonder it's a successful and busy restaurant .

Took some clients to Brio based on some good reviews from friends.  Thought the food from the appetizers to desert was excellent.  The service was also spot on, i.e. not too smothering and not too spacey.  Loved the place!

Was very upset. Myself and one other family  member are vegetarians. This restaurant does not cater to vegetarians at all. We both ordered a dish with chicken. We asked for the chicken to be taken off and replaced with a side of vegetables. Waitress was happy to accommodate. Manager on duty this particular night did not want to accommodate us. The manager charged us full price for the pasta dish  without the chicken. And charged us for the side of vegetables. We will not ever go back to Brio. Very disappointed in this restaurant. Shame on you, Brio of West Lake, Ohio in Crocker Park.
Great Ambience, Decent Service, Overpriced Fake Italian Food.
I have been here many times for the happy hour menu.  The happy hour menu is supper great with reasonable prices. I enjoy ordering the delicious shrimp with eggplant plate and the the biro burger.

We went here for brunch and when we walked in we thought it might be pretty expensive. White tablecloths, nice decor, just looks a little high end. But we were pleasantly surprised with a reasonably priced menu. Great service, some of the best we have had since moving to Gilbert 3 months ago. Husband ordered eggs Benedict, I got risotto, and sister ordered pasta. All delicious. And since it was our first time there, we were pleasantly surprised with a complimentary bruschetta sampler. I'll definitely go back!

This is now my favorite restaurant.  As an overview, the food is excellent, the service is professional and fast, the noise level is a bit loud when crowded (like Cheesecake Factory), the lighting is low, the prices are on the higher side, and you get seated almost immediately with reservations. We came for dinner on two occasions around 6pm both on Saturday.

The food is one of the highlights.  I recommend the 8oz filet, or the crab and shrimp cakes, or the lamb chops, and the sampler bruschetta, the Tiramisu, traditional cheesecake, and the Torta Di Cioccolata (like a fancy lava cake with Gelato).  I recommend those  since those were the only dishes my wife and I have tried so far and they were very good!  

The beef and lamb were cooked perfectly to order and seasoned just right.  The roasted veggies that came with our entrées were very good although mine were slightly over seasoned. 

The crab and shrimp cakes were awesome...  not too much breading,  not overcooked, and the quality of the seafood was great.  When I took my first bite it reminded me of San Francisco (that where I grew up).  The crispy potatoes that came with this dish was really good and so were the roasted veggies.

The bruschetta was pretty pricey but was pretty good... if you want to skip the appetizers, that's ok because the rest of the food and experience is more than enough to satisfy and leave you with a smile.

The desserts are a wonderful sweet topping to the experience here.  The cheesecake, has no graham crust but I guess that's traditional.  It was still really good.  The Tiramisu was just the way I like it.  Anyways...all of the desserts that I've listed above go well with the coffee served here.  FYI when the waiter presents you with the dessert tray, they are presented in little cups, however they do have the regular size versions of those.

The portions were the right size.  Let me put it this way,  when we left, we did not feel like we overate.

My wife and I have come here twice in the past two weeks and we love it.  The first time was on a date night and we were very happy.  The second time we came was for my dad's 70th bday.  My parent were happy and my wife and I were happy... Good times!

Hope you enjoy it!
Consistently good food and perceptive service. Gluten free menu available. Even when crowded, they provide prompt take away.

Based on reviews and the location I wanted to check this place out. Ambiance is nice...Happy hour might be great, as the bar area was packed...But the food?  Horrible!  Let's just put it this way. I felt like like I swallowed the ocean after eating here. Everything was waaaaaaay over salted. Over seasoned as well. Even the greens salad. We ordered the sampler bruschetta, stuffed peppers as an appetizer and split the risotto with roasted chicken for our entree. The bottom-line is the flavors were just not there. I noticed they have a pizza oven, so maybe their bar food is good. But, I would highly NOT recommend this place for dinner.
I don't particularly like chains, but I tried it. The food is ok, but over-priced.  I have had better Italian food for this price range. I don't go here unless friends meet here for lunch.
