Not impressed with restuarant but they're Happy Hour is amazing - that's impressive! You have to get there early though or you will find not one seat - $2-3 dollars a plate for very good Italian, no wonder it's not easy...Enjoy!

Great food as usual at their Happy Hour. But we were really disappointed by a blond ponytail server at a bar. From the beginning to end she was looking upset and NEVER smiled. No appreciation toward us eating there.  We tried to make her laugh and my boyfriend was extra friendly to her, but he gave up. It kind of ruined our date. We always have been fun and good time so just it was very disappointed.

I've been here a couple time.  The atmosphere is nice, think Bellagio cafe and that is about what it looks like inside.  Food has always been good and it is a little expensive but not overly.  Perhaps the right level for North Scottsdale.  The only issue i have that every time i have gone i get 'JOHN PIERRE' or whatever his name is.  I'm not sure if he is still there but he looks like his name should be 'MIKE' not John Pierre and he makes me totally crazy.  Doesn't come back enough, drifts off, was very irritating.  After the first time i went I thought for sure he would be fired but i went back months later and he was STILL THERE and i got him AGAIN...

I made reservations to go here for my biffle's burfday.  The hostesses were very polite and the place was busy, but still pretty quiet for the size of the seating area and high ceilings.  We were sat promptly and our waitress took our drink orders shortly afterwards.  The service was pretty good, the food was just "okay".  Overall I wouldn't call it a favorite, we may try it again sometime, but aside from this it was nothing very special and I feel as if it was overpriced for what I got.  Visit and see for yourself.

Last Wednesday was the first day of live calls at our call center, so to celebrate the executive and support staff went to Brio Tuscan Grille for a celebratory dinner.

I've never been to Town Square before...driving around in here gave me a feeling of not being in Vegas...more akin to being down on Rodeo Drive in LA (I know it's nothing like it but it's the feeling I got).  

Stepping into the building, I was impressed with the high ceilings and tall back wall that looked like it had been delivered from Rome itself.  It was very loud in the restaurant because of the openness of the space (it's very spacious for seating and the bar area) but I was able to find my group very easily and interact without much trouble.

The wine, appetizers, salads, bread and soup were all excellent.  The choice in breads was nicely done to not bore you with a simple roll.  The entree's were classic italian faire, however I ordered a steak (not in the mood for lasagna or something pasta).  It was cooked wonderfully; I wasn't the only one to order the steak...all enjoyed theirs, too.

Desserts were served in a type of large shot glass with flavors such as Creme Brulee and Tiramisu, among others.  I loved scooping into the tiramisu and finding a different flavor every scoop.

It was a little pricey for my taste; since I was part of a group and the company was footing the bill, I was more than happy to attend.  I would come here only if I wasn't paying.  If I were tasked with taking care of the check, I could find quieter, more intimate places to get the most bang for my buck.

I haven't changed my mind about their rating from my last visit.  It's hard to believe their generousity.  I received a free entree as a birthday gift, no strings attached.  I had no choice as it was for a particular dish (Beef Medallions with Shrimp Scampi, described on their menu as:
Three 2 oz. tournedos with marinated shrimp, served over orzo with sauteed zucchini, asparagus, grape tomatoes and fresh thyme. Topped with citrus garlic sauce and pesto bread crumbs.)  That dish happens to be $21.95! and you know what, worth every penny!!  The beef was cooked perfectly, extremely tender and exploded with taste.  The vegatable side was exotic and tasted as good as the beef and shrimp and were a perfect accompaniment.  My wife ordered the lasagna again, it was better than we remembered.  Great meal, great service, great environment and a great day for me, every birthday I consider a gift from God!  We plan to return and try the happy hour at the bar next visit.

Beautiful decor, very pleasant and attentive service.  I had lunch.  The lobster bisque was absolutely delicious - but it would have been nice if my bowl was filled as opposed to a half portion.  The Caesar salad was nothing more than a few morsels of romaine hearts, one cruton and a a teaspoon of salad dressing.  That was a bit of a disappointment and I left hungry.  I'm sure pastas and other entrees would have been a better choice.

I have heard a lot of good things about this restaurant and felt so disappointed with our visit. I'll start with three positive things. The bartender was friendly and efficient. The young hostess was was also happy and friendly . And, my niece was offered a free dessert for her birthday.
I wish I could say the same things about the waiters as I did about the bartender and hostess. Initially we were told we would have two waiters as our group of 9 people was a large table. Good sign right? Wrong, we rarely saw one of the waiters. The waiter forgot to get drink orders from half the table and then forgot to bring out drinks that were ordered. Before dinner bread was placed on the table. A small plate with 4 pieces of bread...for 9 people. The waiter looked confused/angry when we asked for enough bread for everyone.
Then the food arrived. The food came out at various times, one meat dish undercooked,one pasta dish very overlooked and mushy and one of the salads hardly resembled what was listed in the menu. The rest of the food was mediocre. I don't know what was happening in the kitchen that night. We were there on a Sunday night and the place was packed.
I wish I had better things to say. Like I said, we heard good things about the restaurant. Maybe they were having a very off night.
The service was awful. It toke 20 min for them to bring tap water to my table. Server hardly came to the table to check on us. Food is good but not worth the wait.

Went here for my first time on my anniversary with my boyfriend and my opinions on this place disappoint me so much cause I tried to find the smallest reasons to love it! The service was slow and we got our food before water. Our server also threw back lots of attitude. I asked politely for fresh bread in the beginning and the server rudely goes, "most people here like the bread hard but sure." The food came out and my boyfriends food was cold! And I got the spicy shrimp fettuccine, seeing the price being $20 I expected it to be great, and that being said, the shrimp was hard, pasta wasn't fully cooked, and I found probably 3 lobster. Great sauce. But couldn't be happy eating it. We got the cheesecake for dessert and at that point I was over it as well as to how mushy it was. I'd give brio a second try one day but unbelievable as to how my first time went.

My wife and I went out to dinner at Brios with my parents on Thusrday night and every one of us was very happy with our meals. The presentation and atmospher was equal to or better than any "5 star" rated restaurant in the valley. This was our thisrd time there and as usual the night out , the service and the food were supberb. It's always fun to go out to the Kierland area and this night was no exception. Great Italian/ Continental at reasonable prices. Try it you will love it!

The worst bartenders I have experienced in my life. Did not even have the courtesy of saying hello or any attempt at being friendly. It was like they were deliberately trying to  make me feel uncomfortable . They also said some inappropriate comment under there breath which was out of line and disrespectful for no apparent reason. I noticed they treated those of "color", mexican and black very rudely as opposed to other guests. 

The food at first was okay but later I had to spend a few trips to the toilet. Enough said about that. Will not be giving these ladies my business again.

My family and I come to Town Square quite often and always pass Brio while we're shopping. Finally, after 2 years later, decided to go on a dinner date with my mom after a long night of mother daughter bonding (a.k.a retail therapy). 
The minute we walk in we were greeted with pleasant smiles and warm "Hellos." I was expecting to wait to be seated because the shopping center was busy that night, however, I was mistaken. We were seated right away. 
The atmosphere is awesome, definitely a place I'd consider having a wedding reception at. The decor is beautiful, the lights are nice and dim, the ceilings are vaulted and it makes me feel like I'm eating in a chapel. It's very fitting to have either a romantic dinner or even a casual lunch. 
The food was delicious. The portion was perfect. It didn't leave me still hungry nor did it make me over-stuffed. Started off with bread and lavash and a lobster bisque. The lobster bisque was just a little bit salty but nothing that a piece of bread couldn't compensate for. Shared a Chicken&Quinoa Salad and Pasta Pesto and it was absolutely delicious. And for dessert I enjoyed my favorite, Creme Brulee, made perfectly. 
I will definitely be returning.

You have to try happy hour in the bar...$2.95 for everything on the menu It's madness. I've successfully tried every food item on the happy hour menu, and it's all been amazing. The brio burger is great. The spicy shrimp and eggplant must be laced with crack, or some other addictive substance. I could eat it all day, every day. The bruschetta is amazing; everything is amazing. Happy hour is an amazing deal. Have I said amazing enough times yet? 

I've also eaten dinner here, just for a point of reference, and it was excellent as well. Service is attentive, the food is great. Try this place. You can thank me later.

We held our wedding reception at Brio Tuscan Grille at Town Center. It was so wonderful, I can't recommend this place enough! A few emails is all it took to book our reservation from Washington state. Nova was very helpful and would respond to my emails within a day or so. The evening went off without a hitch. When we all arrived, the room we reserved was all ready and set up beautifully. The service was excellent and the food was amazing and TONS of it! Our guests kept complimenting us on what a wonderful choice we had made for our reception and how great the food was. I highly recommend Brio for any special occasion!
Good food that's consistent at a descent price. Would go to again, try the pasta Brio with extra chicken

I received an invitation to Brio for a Spy on Vegas Event. It was great because of the Free Drinks and $3.00 appetizers. The food was surprisingly delicious. Since it was a SpyonVegas event there was not much seating. People were herding over the drinks and there wasn't even enough organization. Eventually we were able to get a spot on the couches. The server was helpful despite the chaotic mess of people. We ended up ordering everything on the appetizer menu. My recommendations- the spicy shrimp & eggplant platter, steak bruschetta, and Margarita pizza. For drinks, definitely have the regular or peach Sangria.
Came for appetizers and drinks with friends.  I recommend it for at least that much.
Love this place. Always consistent with the food. Love the reverse Happy Hour and the outside seating area. Great to bring family and friends.
Wonderful day here. The bread is awesome and the food believe in the greater heard so many good things about this if that was. Looking forward to it

I'm very dissapointed because I always go and have a drink with my wife at this restaurant, and I never had problems when I showed my id to the waiter, and now I come and the waiter says she can't take my id as valid because is from other country. Im only here for bussiness and everytime I go to vegas, I go to Brio so I'm wondering what they do with all the other tourist that are in vegas? Unfortunately my wife and I will never go back to such place. This is supposed to be a tourist friendly restaurant and we felt discriminated I only hope this didn't happen only because I'm not american.

We visited this restaurant in San Tan Mall on a Friday evening.  The service was very slow - took an hour to get our food and the waitress never bothered to check on us in between.  The pasta was overcooked and clumpy.  This is an overpriced chain, with lousy food that is equally matched by lousy service.

My friends and I have been to Brio several times.  Generally I split the Chicken under the Brick with my friend and we get the asparagus as the veggie and to start we split the Brio Chopped Salad.  Every time it's great.  Several of my friends have ordered the Grilled Mahi Mahi Fresca and the Grilled Salmon; they have all stated it's wonderful and that the fish seems really fresh.  Also the free bread and crackers are wonderful. We generally like to relax after and grab a coffee while we chat; the coffee is really good as well.  The staff is always friendly and seems very knowledgeable about the menu.  I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for a great dinning experience.  Our bill generally ends up around $32 (not including tip) before splitting.

This is a great place to have a finer Italian style meal. I have been here for several occasions and find it to be relaxing. As always large portions adorn your plate. Price is moderate. Reservations are great for those busy times.

The wait staff has always been on the better side. They have consistently checked on us but not being overly annoying. Had a snafu once and they did everything to make us feel that we were in the right and quickly resolved the issue. I am critical of wait staff and it does reflect tipping.

Food here has always been a notch above other restaurants such as Olive Garden and even my other frequent haunt Carrabba's in regards the the more normal Italian dishes. So far out of all the meals I have had here they were all great. I especially enjoy the lasagna.

I do tend to recommend this place to others if they enjoy good Italian food.

Brio is located in the new shopping  mall , Town Square,  which is  about  2 miles south of  Mandalay Bay.  We decided to check it out after reviewing the menu.
 For drinks I ordered the special Wild Berry lemonade which was so quenching. For the entree, I ordered the Chicken and butternut squash Risotto which came with a choice of  Insalata (chopped, caesar or bistecca)  I chose caesar  which was a generous serving.  When the risotto came , I thought, "what a big bowl with such a small portion," but it was actually just enough to fill me.  My husband ordered the soup of the day which was the tomato bisque which he really liked.  For his entree, he ordered the linguine with baby clams and was happy with his choice.  The waiter brought over these mini desserts that looked so irresistible, we decided to order one Tiramisu and one Panna Cotta.  It was so good!  
The staff is pretty attentive and the decor is very nice with plenty of outdoor seating.  I would definitely return in the future.

We had a very nice dinner last Saturday night. The restaurant is a bit noisy but we were by the kitchen which is very open and visible. The service was very good and personable. The lobster bisk we had was ok, I didn't really taste any lobster. My wife's raspberry mojito was sweet but no punch. The dinner itself was very good, and they didn't overwhelm us with to much food. Then we busted the bar, and all the bar tenders were friendly. Over all this restaurant is worth the visit. Make reservations if your going on a Saturday.
I liked this place. Thought it seemed like an Olive Garden on steroids. Very good food, very good wait staff, very great atmosphere. Will definitely return!!

Walking in I felt like I was in Las Vegas. The tables were clean.  Service was on point and food was extremely good.  The dish sizes are beyond the normal proportion I am use to. Definitely a great place to eat


-Cheers-.
This bar has the best Happy Hour in Las Vegas! If you ever stop in, make sure you ask for Bri, she provides the best service possible!

Went with family for dinner on Thursday. Seated right away. Not a lot of people. Next table just got their order, they sent back one, wrong item. We waited for about 10 minutes noone came. Should be a clue. Complained to hostess, a server was sent right away. She's nice. Took our order. Note that no meatball option at all (wanted for our son). Appetizer and basket of bread came within reasonable time, but the same can't be said for entrees. Server had to apologize. When they came, they looked very good. Then wife complained the breaded chicken tasted weird, as it's old frozen chicken. I tasted and agreed. Server was nowhere to be found, needed to flag hostess to send her. She let manager know and he came and took care of exchange of salmon. It was good. Finished and ready to leave. Server was MIA again. Told my wife to take son to go to Barnes and Noble, while I waited for about 10 minutes for the check. Overall, very bad experience and won't be back. Many other options in the area. Sorry.

Service was great he was on top of it! Which was nice because he did have multiple tables to attend. The steak my hubby ordered was mouthwatering & cooked to perfection! My salad was delicious . ..pretty tasty & filling. Our daughter had her own pepperoni pizza,ate the whole pie! She absolutely loved it! Deserts were amazing as well our favorite was the warm chocolate cake. We tried the tiramisu as well but it was ok alot of whip cream if you ask me.

The "best steak salad in town" is now the worst.  Less than an ounce of steak, bag o' greens past their prime and I counted exactly three  pecans on my plate.   At  our table, the floor crunched with crumbs under our feet.  The booth seating was sticky.  The noise level, including unnecessary shouting from the prep area,  is oppressive and I was unable to converse normally with my lunch companion.  The staff  are friendly but clearly overworked and stressed.  All in all, an unpleasant dining experience.  We won't be back.

We had reservations 6 last night, and, based on my experience at the Park Meadows/Colorado location, I was very excited to partake in some yummy Italian food. We were seated promptly by a friendly hostess, but that's where any semblance of good service ended. The waiter completely forgot to bring bread and butter and was very difficult to catch when we tried to ask for some. 

Our starters came quickly. Our entrees also came quickly. So quickly, in fact, that there was no room on the table for any of them, and we were left scrambling to finish our salads while the busboy wedged in main courses. 

I ordered shrimp and lobster ravioli, which I've had previously at the Colorado location. Apparently this one doesn't serve it, so the waiter changed my order to fettuccine and neglected to tell me. I did not want fettuccine. The busboy kept trying to give me the plate I hadn't ordered until, a good 5 minutes later, the waiter showed up and allowed me to order something new. By this point, I was stressed out that the rest of the party would be finished by the time that my meal came out. From what I remember, the roast chicken was good, but since I was trying to inhale it, not much made an impression.

Last but not least, my friend and I ordered the same dessert - creme brulee. My dish clearly hadn't been cleaned properly before the new brulee was made, since it had rubbery, burnt on bits at the bottom on the ramekin. That, however, paled in comparison to my friend.

She found several different kinds of paper inside her dessert - what looked like a sizeable piece of paper towel and tissue. Like the rest of the night, the waiter never came by to check in, so the issue was never resolved.

Ew.

Brio is an Italian Restaurant located in the middle of Town Square on the South Strip.The parking area is a short walk away. It is a large layout containing an inside and outside sit-down bar, plus numerous tables, sofas, fire-places circled by comfortable seating that offer cozy atmospheres. The kitchen is not visible to patrons and there are no emanating smells. The ventilation is efficient and keeps the air fresh. The uniformed staff is friendly and gives a warm welcome upon arrival. We are immediately seated and attended to.  Music is also performed by a small live band in the evenings. The volume is high and on the distractive side .
The dish I ordered was a beef carpaccio. It is served in a sizable platter that surprised me. It is not an immense amount of food. The center is thin and crunchy Italian bread that resembles pizza, but it is not. This is laid on top of a small salad. The outer edge of the platter has the thin slices of carpaccio that is lightly covered with mustard aioli, Parmigian and capers.
The aroma is of a strong and spicy vinegar with no notice of the raw meat. The taste of the meat is mild, but all the other condiments make the meal salty and acidic. The capers give it lively chewy taste. The texture of the meat is very tender and it melts in your mouth, while the crunchy bread is seedy and rough. The ingredients complement each other very well.
To top it off the dessert was hot chocolate cake with ice cream on top along with vanilla on the perimeter. There was also chocolate syrup and raspberry on the side.  It had a strong flavor of chocolate and vanilla combined. Hot and cold ,sweet and bitter makes a great taste.
The wait staff was friendly however to a fault, as they checked on our needs too often. Their timing was about every 5 minutes and it interrupted our dining.
The overall experience was a plus, I would repeat.

My girlfriends and I were in Cleveland for a girls weekend and were exploring Crocker Park on a Saturday afternoon. We were debating on where to eat so we stopped to look at the menu and were talked into eating there by our waiter. 

We decided to try it and we were so pleasantly surprised by the service. We felt a little bit like 'royalty' and were even given some 'special treatment'. We got the bruschetta appetizer sampler and Oh.My.Goodness.... SO GOOD!!!! It took us a good 15 minutes to eat it because we'd take a bite... Then would savor the flavor.  The next day we were still talking about how delicious they were!!! 

As far as our meal went... We all got items from the light menu and the food was okay, but I'm 100% positive if we would have gotten "the good stuff" it would have been great! If you are debating on what to Order... Go fatty:)... Or just order tons and tons of bruschetta and call
It a meal!!

The atmosphere was perfect, the sangria was delicious, the peach Bellini was amazing, and our waiter and manager were spot on with customer service! Thanks for a great experience...best one we had the whole weekend!!

Food was good not great. Service was good but not great. Restaurant is beautiful but far too open and noisy. All in all adequate but not a memorable experience. Server did her best to make it a good dining experience. If I was to spend my time and money dining out, I would look elsewhere. Great for drinks on the patio though!!

First of all, when I made reservations and asked WHERE in Scottsdale Quarter are you located, the sales staff said they did not know. When we called later that evening, we said we were on the south end of Scottsdale Quarter near such-n-such store, where are you in relation to that, the second clerk did not know. When we finally got there, all three in the front hostess station said they only know they are located in Scottsdale Quarter, Very knowledgeable staff -not. 
Secondly, the atmosphere was like a giant Olive Garden, and the food mediocre at best. My friend and I made a mental note to never return. Doesn't matter because they won't be in business very long, at least in North Scottsdale where there is a ton of competition.

Great food excellent service ! Came in for lunch this afternoon with my family to celebrate my sons birthday and had a great time. Our sever Nicole was very friendly and knowledgeable and helped guide us in the right direction on our food choices ,I had the pasta Brio and my son had the strawberry chicken salad both wonderful .Nicole really went the extra mile making sure we were well taking care of our drinks were always full and she had us smiling and laughing the whole time she told us about happy hour special's they offer during the week it sounds amazing. I already have plans to return this week with some co worker .Keep up the great work Brio !Thanks for making our experience memorable.
Great and prompt service,; the food quality and presentation is excellent! Nice atmosphere in a European like setting. prices are reasonable.

You have to try everything once. This place is nice but the steak could have been better. Not something I would do again. The server came off a bit rude not to my party but to another server who was just trying to help out a server who did not help us.  On top of that she only comes when another server stands by our table. They had a wedding party here and they sat us right by the room and they was uber loud it was hard to enjoy. Now when a plate cost  28-30something dollars. A relaxing quite dinner would have been nice.

My boyfriend took me here for our anniversary and man was it delicious. We started with drinks I got the peach Bellini and he got the raspberry mojito. I must say the Bellini was ok but just ok it was really sweet and thick and kind of hard to choke down. The mojito on the other hand was freaking delicious I really recommend trying the mojito it was refreshing and had a nice fruit flavor with not to much mint. 

For the entree I got fettuccine Alfredo cuz I'm kinda picky and it is my favorite pasta dish ever!! It was so yummy! It was rich and the pasta was cooked perfect and of course I got extra cheese. It was very filling and the portion sizes were on point. 

We didn't opt for dessert because we were so full it was ridiculous but the dessert menu did sound really good and I definitely want to try one next time we go. 

The decor is really nice and the service was great we never didn't have bread which is pretty damn awesome cuz you gotta always have bread with Italian food. I highly recommend this restaurant for an intimate date night or an anniversary it was amazing and my only complaint is I wish the Bellini wasn't so sweet! A+ Brio

Decorated to feel like you are in a Tuscan Palace Ballroom.  Swathed in White Curtains attached to the high ceilings, balloon curtains in curved passageways.  
Hot fresh sourdough bread basket & flatbreads - Mmmmm
Salmon was fabby
Potatoes done mashed, pomme frite, shoe strings & chipped.
Brick Chicken grilled to perfection
Yummy Pork Chops fired in wood grille
Excellent Vokda Pasta purses - smack :-)
Most extensive childrens menu I've ever seen!
Great wine list by the bottle & glass - ck out thier partner vineyard with sketchbook.
Bar Bite menu for $2.95 
Cappuccinos done to perfection
Loved the atmosphere - I'll be back - YUM!

Amazing!!! Had brunch for my moms birthday. Service was great. Our server was personable, nice, and patient considering we had 2 kids in the party. Food is always amazing, I'm never disappointed. I eat at brio all the time, love it everytime.

I met a friend for a bite to eat and a shopping day. I got a brunch item a poached egg with a shrimp/crab cake on the side with some potatoes. A mixed berry lemonade. This place was really nice, and the food was really good. I heard from a friend that their dinner menu is good as well, can't wait to try it next time.

Love this place!

Good location, great service most of the food is excellent. Try the Chicken Milanese!  Salads are fresh and the pasta is made in house and among the best in Vegas. Oh the fresh bread is piping hot out of the oven. 

Now for bad news. The lasagna is terrible. The portion is twice what any natural human being should eat the pasta is over cooked and ingredients are unbalanced - too little pasta too much cheese and sauce. 

Definitely come to Brio - seriously good. Avoid the lasagna!
Great Italian food. I ordered a pasta with shrimp. It was super fresh and tasty. It wasn't heavy and I didn't feel gross after like other Italian restaurants. Great food and service.

Had a wonderful evening at Brio with some old family friends. Every one at the table loved their dish, the pasta al la vodka was incredible. Our server, Brooke, was extremely accommodating and warm-hearted. Will return.

Oh goodness, where to start! We had an amazing waiter, Adrian, who started with wonderful manners and suggestions. Now the food-10/10!! My mother and I shared a pasta alla vodka (best pasta I've ever had, I promise), and my brother and father had 14 oz steaks that were not only perfectly charred, juicy and medium, but the veggies and potatoes were also seasoned quite well! I am so absolutely happy to have come to this place with my family; très bonne!

Great potential here with a nicely decorated interior. As you walk in you cannot help but feel like you're in for a treat. In the end you'll need to lower your expectations as this place is just a chain. The food is just okay and competes nicely with other Italian chain restaurants. I can tell you from experience this place comes nowhere close to the food I had in Tuscany. 

Fun fact - the prices are 10% higher here than there location in SoCal.

I love it here at Brio Tuscan Grille!

The service is wonderful. It was crowded tonight and there was a wait even though we got reservations several days beforehand. But the waiters were patient, and they managed their time wisely.

The food was delicious. I love how each table gets a nice basket of bread before the entrées. I ordered the Roasted Red Pepper Bruschetta, which is more on the light side of the menu. It was satisfying and not too overwhelming. 

The atmosphere was casual. Although the interior design of the restaurant was elegant and formal, there were several people that ranged from t-shirts and shorts to tuxedos and dresses. I do love how fancy Brio looks, though. I enjoyed looking at the architecture and the design of the restaurant. 

I knocked off one star because although the food was delicious, it wasn't a 100% wow factor. Maybe if I tried something more exotic / new off of the menu, I would give this restaurant the 5 stars it deserves. Overall, I would probably come here again.

Sat on patio on best day I can remember in Ohio. Blue skies, cool breeze.
Great cold beers: Blue Moon & Peroni
Eggplant fries were awesome.
Great service by female waitress, tall, blond & super friendly.
Best people watching spot in No. Ohio.

Is that the owners daughters?  Can't be - it's a chain. 

Food is decent and service is pretty good - but the front desk foursome acts like they're working the top restaurant in Manhattan. Unbelievably arrogant attitude. We had a reservation and it was a true favor to seat us 20 minutes late - with an unbelievably negative attitude. 

Manager stopped by for feedback - and we politely gave plenty. He was a shoulder shrugger  who seemed resigned to his lousy employees at the front podium. 

Again, decent food for the price - nothing extraordinary but not bad for a chain. Unfortunately, based on the worst welcome staff I've ever seen, and a manager that is scared of his own shadow - they'll never see us again.

We went here the other night with friends and were extremely impressed with not just the food but the service as well. Our server Frank went above and beyond to make this a special night for all. He was so on top of everything that the "spell" of enjoying our meal and company was never broken. Thank you so much for a wonderful time! We will definitely be back!

OMG!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I must say finally a restaurant who understands portions. The service was amazing and funny (like comedy hour) the staff communicated well together and I loved every minute of this experience. I ordered the Salmon dish with pasta, which was to die for. I was able to finish my  entire plate and not waste it or take leftovers. Just enough to feel delightfully full. The tastes and flavors were like a symphony in my mouth. I will be going back  here again and again and again..........

Brio is one of those places you can visit multiple times and every experience is a positive one. Particularly for large dining groups. Whenever family or friends come to town with a large group, or when there is a birthday dinner, we include Brio on the list of eats. 

First off, you can do call-ahead-seating. Bonus. Especially for a group of 12+, which was our case the other night. Shotgun wedding at The Little White Chapel, then down to Brio for some celebratin'! LOL. 

The prices are very reasonable if you consider the competition and what you get. Yes it's a "chain" but c'mon, we're on a budget, we like to drink wine (by the bottle) and there were a ton of us! Also it's not overly chained AND they only do Italian restaurants. Bonus. 

Ok so what to get: 

Lobster Bisque Soup 
Artichoke Dip 
Lobster Ravioli 
Sweet Potato and Chicken Risotto 
Fettuccine Napoli 
Grilled Salmon 
Entree Salad - Steak Salad 
Add on either the Caesar, the Wedge or the Brio salad to your pasta dish...they are all great! 
Dessert - get a variety of the little servings. YUM! 

If you are coming with just a few or alone, I recommend trying the Bar during happy hour. There are some pretty good "bar bites" deals.

It's a high class Olive Garden through and through.
      Just good food, it could be great but they are consistent at least. It's pricey for not much better than OG, then again I've never been here for happy hour. I love that they have tuscan garlic chicken that olive garden used to serve, by another name. I was thrilled with their strawberry basil lemonade, I like to experiment with food and they don't disappoint with variety.
          It's probably because the location is Crocker Park but I find it odd how snooty the staff is without being particularly good at their jobs... I usually have to flag someone down for a refill or a check and when I tried to book my rehearsal dinner here in early April and I was told they didn't have the June book out so there was no way to book it 2 months out. I don't know about you but if I was guaranteed $600 in meals I'd figure out a way to record it.

I came here for the first time for Easter lunch with family.  I understand that it was a crowded and hectic day that may account for the lackluster food, but, still, I think the food should hold up, regardless.  One of us had the brunch item of French Toast; another had a club sandwich; I had the salmon salad.  The food overall was just mediocre.  Good enough, but we won't be back.

My salmon in the salad was quite delicious and cooked perfectly, but the bed of greens was not high quality and the tomatoes were cut into tiny, tiny little pieces -- obviously to use in all the other dishes but weird for a salad.  The grilled asparagus in the salad was withered and too tough to eat except for the very tips. I couldn't even cut the stems with my knife.  The 'shoestring' potatoes were a nice touch, but not too many of these. I chose to omit the feta cheese, so that was the extent of this salad -- good salmon, poor greens, tiny bits of tomato, tough asparagus, and good but sparse shoestring potatoes. 

Beyond the food, the place was really too loud to have a good conversation -- it was crowded, of course.  The decor was outdated.  Service was cordial but slow, but I attributed it to the busy day.  I see others have commented on slow service, so it may not have been due to the Easter Sunday crush, but I won't be coming back to find out.  Too many good restaurants in Las Vegas for me to come back here.

I am currently eating at Brio in Las Vegas' Town Square Mall. I am not sure if this was an off day but the service was  not good. I had to ask for items repeatedly. The food was OK but nothing to scream about. Overall,I am disappointed and will not come back. You rarely get a second time to make a first impression.

Wife and I had lunch for Easter Sunday.  it was good, i started with a Caesar salad it was just ok.  I have had better, and I was thinking the restaurant was ok.  but then for the main course I ordered a specialty veal Milanese with vegetables... wow ,  that was tasty.  I felt the dish was as good as they come, and I was very happy.   my wife had the salmon salad and she wasn't happy with the quality of salmon....  overall, I was very happy with my experience.  thanks brio!  you will see us again!
pretty good restaurant . service average . had the chicken lemon which was very tasty. price seemed reasonable .

Loved this nice, little, restaurant!  Great food!  I had the grilled chicken and veggies that were amazing!  My husband got the lasagne and said it was the best he's ever had!  We'll definitely go back!  I highly recommend!

The only reason I keep coming back here is because my friends like the food. I always get coerced to eat here. The service is consistently horrible. One star just because of the service. The food is decent. Do not try the shrimp scampi - it is an abomination. The lamb chops however are great. Our party gave the server a 28  percent tip and he did not even thank us.He just gave us a stupid smirk like he really deserved it.  What a douche bag!  I always say I would never go back here but my friends keep suckering me back. I always think that it is going to be better but guess what? It never does.

Brio is delicious!!!!  The food is so good, the service is great, atmosphere is very classy, beautiful Tuscan architecture and authentic Italian food makes it one of my favorites.  Get here at around 545 and you get seated right away even for large parties.

Brio's food is just okay. I've had heir lamb chop appetizer, and a few of their pasta dishes. The lamb wasn't the best quality but it wasn't horrible. The pastas on the other hand were so overly seasoned, greasy, and so salty that they were gross. That kind of scared me off from trying their food again. NOW! Their bar is another story. Love it. They have an absolutely gorgeous patio with canvas curtains, string lights, and comfy chairs. They have this raspberry mojito that is so delicious that I get one every time I go there. It's romantic and intimate. The staff are excellent, I have never had anything less than perfect service when i've gone there. It's a more mature crowd and probably one of my favorite places to go on a date. I would try the food again, because it is possible I just had a few bad experiences. But the ambiance, the drinks, the service, and the location is what keeps making me come back for more.

Brio is a great option for a medium-higher end Italian food where you can take the family. It's a bit loud but with little kids, that's fine with me. The carpaccio rivals that next door at Eddie V's and the lobster bisque soup is buttery and superb. I get the lasagna every time. Great béchamel sauce and plenty of food. Sit out front on the patio if you can, great people watching.

The food was excellent, and the service was great.  The place was crowded and reservations are a definite must, at least for a Saturday night.  I loved the decor, on a personal note.  I haven't had Italian food this good since Staten Island.
Good ambience. Looks like the cheesecake factory. This place is super busy on the weekends so call ahead. Got the feel of an upscale olive garden. Not impressive but not disappointing either.

Well not sure what to say about this place no more...... Not sure if we come at the wrong time but the service here has got really bad ..... This has been my go to place fore years and my last 2 visit including today just made me realize it time to let this place go.....what makes me so mad is how they go about the hole thing like all you hear is sorry this sorry that like we will take care of the bill...... Like NO we didn't come here to eat and have our bill taken care of we  come here to eat the good food they used to make and leave satisfied ....But now you wait forever and then when you finally order and they bring food it's wrong..... Like what the F**** we done waited hella long and now they to remake for us to wait even longer..... Smh, heart broken this was my last visit here..... sucked that u my man had to leave without eating his meal, he was so disappointed that he didn't even want to stop anywhere else to get him the food.....
Best HH in Gilbert.  The food is amazing is and the service is awesome.  Shrimp and  eggplant, beef carpaccio, brio burger, chicken parm and Ca press salad all awesome!  Can't go wrong!!

Brio has nice ambiance. Little shopping and a decent Italian lunch. Bellini's are excellent though I didn't have one today, tad cold! But perfect on a hot summers day - they're like slurpees for adults ;)

Today I ordered the Ravioli Di Bella  - portabella mushrooms in ravioli with creminis & tomatoes. Sauce could be thicker and what would make this dish 5 stars would be to add some pancetta! But that's me!
Worst hostess service ever... 45 minutes waiting for table. Unacceptable!! We are planning never comeback.

Go to lunch Here a couple times a month with clients. We are never disappointed by either the service or the quality of the food.
I always get the lobster bisque
Came for lunch. Had the soup and salad combo. Food came out fast. They weren't to busy. They have a good happy hour in the bar area. The restaurant is always clean. People are friendly. Nice patio

My wife and I were completely satisfied with our two salads!  The favors were exceptional and the portions large.  We ate outside and had great service.  The breads were unique and flavorful.  We highly recommend!  We'll be back here next time we're in town.

Don't miss this exception eating experience!

This is in the Town Center in the front center area.  This means hard to park.

Big place (this is Vegas) and good food.  Italian affair so think pasta.  I emptied my pasta plate with a glass of Cab.  'nuff said.

The service is FAST to keep the tables turn so if there is a wait it won't be long.  It's a good place for a high calorie satisfying meal with a reasonable cost.  Seems fitting in LV because you come here to indulge and splurge.

Mangia!

Wow! What a menu! Decisions, desicions. 
I ordered the Shrimp and Scallops Fettucini and it was very wonderful. The staff was very friendly and refilled the table's sodas without having to be asked. 
The decor was beautiful with fabric running from wall to wall. I am assuming that this would be a good place to have a group gathering as it looked like in the back there was a seperate room available for these functions. 
If I am ever in the area again I will try to come back.
Amazing customer service. Employees went higher and further to provide us the most pleasant evening. We will definitely return. Thank you all.

I am so sick after eating here today. The plates and silverware were dirty. I tried to ignore it and just eat the food. The tomatoes were brown. I asked our server if they were meant to be that color and she replied surely yes. It is now 5 hours later and I am puking my meal up and have no appetite.  My boyfriend is just as sick and we will never go back.

I can't believe I'm doing this but they deserve it after my latest dining experience. I went to Brio last Sunday because I needed that steak salad again. I was so disappointed this time! The salad greens were as delicious as ever. I don't know what's in that dressing but I could drink that stuff! But the steak this time. Oh, that steak. It was terrible. I've noticed the portion size of the steaks shrinking over the last few months but this was nearly half the size it used to be! And the perfect medium rare at which it's typically served was more like well well. Dry, hard, completely void of flavor. I honestly don't think I'll ever order it again. And that's sad. So very sad.

I took my girlfriend to brio for a nice dinner and i was impressed. We have been to a number of resturants in las vegas but this on is on my favorites list. To start the decor in this place is fantastic, great settings and lighting. The waiter was kind and knew his stuff for sure! The food was fantastic and reasonably priced. We will definitely be back.

Very nice place. Great food. I tried the mixed grille. I love the spicy aftertaste.
The lobster soup was very good.
Food was good but there was a dead moth in mine, check had items on it we didn't order and took forever for refills on drinks.

Was disappointed that we learned that the happy hour is only in the bar area. The food was good, although it was reminiscent of Carrabas, Macaroni Grill. Maybe they are all part of the same chain? The service was very, very good. I feel like again, as in most places were there may be tourist, the menu is over-priced. 14 for a martini, is a bit much. I bet if someone opened a place like this for locals, a little less pricey, the customers would come in droves! Just be wary of the happy hour thing....only at the bar!

Extremely disappointed by a recent experience I had here. My husband and I very rarely get out of the house, and on our long awaited date day had planned to go to brio for the happy hour that we've heard so much about. I was looking forward to it greatly, but upon arriving the bar was completely packed, not a single chair available. We asked if we could have happy hour at one of the nearby tables and were told we had to be sitting at the bar or on one of the couches (which were also all taken). The bar area was surrounded with 10-15 unoccupied tables that would have done the job, but instead of allowing us to sit and enjoy happy hour with everyone else, our business was turned away. Extremely disappointed in how this situation was handled. Management wasn't even apologetic. Will not be returning... Waste of my time and excitement. Ended up taking our business to yard house, where they were happy to take care of us.

Service, ambience and food was outstanding!  We had my dad's 95th Birthday Partly with 18 people in a private "Chef's Room" that holds 24.  Service by Tamara and the other server's name (sorry I forgot her name) exceeded expectations by our entire family!  Host Sabrina was cheerful and very helpful.  Mgr Nova and assistant mgr Maria was great in helping me plan our event.  The appetizers was yummy and the entrees like filet mignon, tournedos and pastas warrants a return trip to the Brio at Town Square......Mahalo & Aloha!

I really wanted to enjoy this restaurant because it's so conveniently close. The food is ok, but nothing spectacular. The wait staff seemed like robots.  As if they were versed in how to speak.  Something I really appreciate in a dining experience is a person with a REAL personality.  I started with the bruschetta sampler...not impressed.  It lacked in flavor and texture.  I chose the NY Strip as my entree.  It was extremely overcooked, not to my asking for medium rare.  Overall, this was an unmemorable experience. I will not return.

Sat at the bar last night and had an exceptional experience. The food was outstanding and the service even better. The little blonde bartender customized martinis for both my husband and I and they were amazing. We had the Shrimp and Eggplant appetizer since the bartender suggested it so highly and it was the best item i have ever tried at Brio. Finally a place in Summerlin with great service, food and drink. Truly the total package. 5 stars to Brio in Tivoli Village!

Sat at the bar last night at the new Brio in Summerlin. I can truly say it was an exceptional time. Great service, the little blonde bartender customized a martini for both my husband and I, and they were both delicious. Our appetizers and entrees came out in a timely manor and were both outstanding. We were very impressed with such a new restaurant going so smooth. 5 stars goes to the new Brio in Tivoli Village!

I dined at brio last night with it not being my first time.  I am usually more than satisfied.  The dishes are very generous and delicious.  The service is usually top notch and professional.  However on this occasion my guest and I had to make ourselves laugh at the situation.  

The hostesses let us know there would be a short wait which was no problem.  They were polite and welcoming.  A very short time afterwards a basket of bread was dropped off.  This is the kicker.  15-20 mins later we were greeted by our server.  I know this because a party of 10 was sat after us and proceeded to receive their first course before we even had water glasses or even a simple "I'll be right with you".  We noticed a manager walk by us 4 times and didn't notice we hadn't even been given waters.  The busser that had given us our bread must not have brought it to the server's attention.  At this time we were taking bets on the over under on how much longer it'd be before we were greeted.  So we got out our stopwatch and started clocking it from that moment.  Just from that moment we had an elapsed 4 mins.  I unfortunately lost the bet.  I had taken the over which was another 8 mins.  The meal went smoothly from that point on.  The chicken limone was amazing and my friend's filet was also enjoyed.  

After a bottle of true grit petite Syrah, a salad course, main course, and dessert we left satisfied with our meal.  Just please work out the communication breakdowns.

I haven't been here in a while and I don't remember it being this bad.... maybe it was because it was late afternoon & after the lunch rush so the staff was more interested in chatting than their jobs .... We sat on the patio which was filled with empty, dirty tables and remained that way throughout our lunch... Our server couldn't be bothered to open the door and actually come to the table but would just stick his head out, yelling... Didn't offer boxes, ask about the food or even return quickly after asking for the check... My son hated his food and we would have ordered something else had the waiter checked back before we'd finished eating...I could maybe understand it if he was super busy but it wasn't busy at all!! Upon returning after running my credit card he made a big show of shaking each of our hands which was weird because until then he couldn't have cared less about our service or food. Maybe he hoped the show would make us forget the terrible service... It didn't! Sadly I left a 15% tip, which I never do but I don't even think that was deserved. Won't be going back!

I debated between 3 and 4 stars on this one...again one of those times where you wish there was the 1/2 star option on Yelp!  So, officially, I would say 3 1/2 stars.  Slightly better than OK, but not quite "Yay, I'm a fan!"

I have been to Vegas many times to visit family but never to the Town Square development.  I liked the overall feel of the area with many shops and restaurants, and we enjoyed walking around before dinner.   We had a reservation, but showed up a few minutes early so we had to wait.  It was actually quite chilly that night so we really noticed the door opening and closing as we waited in the restaurant foyer, I was feeling sorry for the hostesses and the tables that were seated near the door!

I had the chopped salad to start - quite tasty - and the mediterranean penne pasta, which was vegetarian but you could add chicken or shrimp.  My companions split the caesar and had shrimp scampi and the lobster and shrimp pasta.  My pasta was tasty but  a little too heavy on the olive oil.  My sister in law devoured the scampi and my brother's lobster and shrimp was also quickly disappearing so I managed to reach over and snag  a piece of lobster before it was gone - nice and tender and in a slightly spicy sauce.

The flatbread in the bread basket was DELICIOUS and the service and drinks were fine.  I would agree that the prices are a little high - more like Vegas strip pricing than Vegas mall pricing - but it was a nice experience.

We are a group of about 20 that goes to various bar/restaurants for happy hour.  On Monday 8/31 we were at Brio Tuscan Grille in Tivoli.  Although the restaurant was quite empty we were seated in the bar area with high bar stools and little round tables that barely sat 4 (some of our tabled had to squeeze 5).  There were only 2 servers.  One took the orders and the other delivered.  Unlike any other bar/restaurants we've gone to when it came time to get the bills we were told that we couldn't get individual bills.  We would get one bill for each table and it was up to us to figure out who owed what including each share of the tax.  After speaking to the manager, although she was very nice and smiley it still came down to; that's the way it is.  If you're a group of more than 4 don't go to Brio's happy hour.

I love this place. Good wine in generous glasses, always a friendly staff and the shrimp appetizer is incredible. The bread is great, too great you always want more but they say it's still baking it'll take another 15 minutes...

Feb. 11, 2015 would of gave two stars however our main server helped redeem this place. Arrived around 2pm and the place is not even close to busy. Off the bat the hostess forgot to give us the menu. After we ordered the person bringing the food drops the slice of pizza and puts it back on our plate with his bare hand. Any etiquette please. The food used to be good and the service very respectful, however after today we will no longer be dining here. Pro tip happy hour starts at 3 pm however do not expect great service.

This is the best happy hour in town in opinion for a combination of good $5 wine and absolutely delicious appetizers under $5.   The ambiance is lovely inside and outside.  Sitting at the bar is non-threatening for females.  A choice of low tables, high tops or the bar.  Only downside is that it fills up fast !

All in all it was pretty good. The spinach artichoke dip was good, but the chips that it came out with,(pita chips), had to much seasoning on it already that didn't compliment the dip, so I didn't care much bout the chips, but the bread was delicious. The bread with the dip was yum. I ordered the Fettucini Napoli. It wasn't bad, but not great. I thought there was going to be chicken in my dish, i'm sure I read it had chicken in it, but all I got was ham as the meat. Kind of pricy for what I got, but I still ate it, with some hot sauce just because I was hungry. I probably won't eat hear again unless their was going to be a good reason for it. I am sure there are better places in the Town Square area where I ate.

Another solid meal and overall experience at Brio. The decor is amazing. Upscale with a wide open floor plan.

Service has always been friendly and timely, although today the hostess seemed a bit put off by us coming in for dinner at 4:45pm and wanting to sit in the dining room rather than the bar area (which she had suggested but we declined).

My favorite appetizer is the beef carpaccio. A massive plate of delicious raw beef. Excellent. I have had several main dishes in my visits to Brio, and there are a couple standouts. First, is the the lasagna. Second, the carbonara. Not the absolute best I've ever had, but certainly way up there. I have had a couple dishes that were a little off the mark, such as the lobster & shrimp fettucini, but it still found its way into my belly! So how bad could it have been, right?

Anyway, I can't quite give Brio 5 stars, but it definitely hits the mark if you are looking for a semi-upscale restaurant with consistently good food and service.

Oh my word! I love Brio! The ambiance is gorgeous. Staff is professional [a little stiff at times though]. The food is delicious! Had pasta alla vodka and I loved it. The portions are moderate so you won't go home feeling horrible about eating out. Brio is pretty popular so expect to wait. But Town's Square is a wonderful place to wait in because there are so many tempting shops surrounding.

Pretty much what you would expect from a nice chain.  The food is decent, but not too creative.  The patio is a great location when the weather is decent and the drinks are just fine.  I sampled the Tuscan Stuffed Peppers, the Bruschetta and the Calamari. 
The stuffed peppers were the best with a nice mix of sausage and creamy cheese filling.  Calamari was decent, cooked properly, but not outstanding.  The bruschetta was our least favorite - the bread was very dry, without enough moisture from the toppings to soften it.  This resulted in the entire piece crumbling after the first bite.
Our service was fine.

Only way to make it better is if they put a band in the corner. 

Gotta try the bruschetta. we did the sampler and all were great. I would have rated the steak as the best though. just so much taste on that little piece of bread!

the rumors are true, they will make substitution to portions of the mail, though our waitress failed at the game... the game is one of surprise. It's one of my more favorite games in rating a resaurant to see how well the cook responds with the surprise. Not so good this time. 

But I'll give them another chance next time.

The wife and I had a GC for this place. We visited on a Saturday night about 7:30 and decided to sit at the bar for a drink and soem Apps. There were 2 other couples at the bar and the rest were open seats. I have a beer and the wife a martini. We tried to spark a little conversation with 1 of the bartenders but he was somewhat stand offish. he took our order and delivered the food. The Apps were good but there was lack of conversation/ personality. Now the GC is gone I would prob. not be back.

Brio used to be my favorite restaurant. Lately the quality and attention to detail have suffered tremendously! I have found a fly in my salad and then last Mother's day I found a long black hair in my eggs Benedict! not to mention chips in many of the plates and cups. Very disappointed.

It's been 2-3 years since we visited Brio.  I remember why (or why not).  Great location, comfy decor and atmosphere.  Unfortunately, we were there to eat.  The food isn't bad.  It just isn't good.  Just very boring.  I'm not much of a cook but I swear I could plate better Italian food.  Bland, uninspired food.  Not exactly cheap, either.  Don't think we will be rushing back although I do recall the Happy Hour being a good deal.  At the right price, bland food is not so objectionable.

Went to Brio in Santan Village with my Mom for lunch yesterday. She ordered the Greens Salad, no surprise there, while I had the Romero Chicken Sandwich. My food was tasty and came with homemade potato chips as a side, but overall nothing blew my mind. The staff was nice and efficient. I will probably continue to dine there, but it doesn't stand out as being one of my favorites at Santan. I'll check back in if I have a change of heart.

I came here for lunch mid-week and just wasn't excited with any of it.  The place was busy, but even taking that into consideration service was not very good.  Since we had waited a while to be seated, we tried to give the server our appetizer order right away, but she didn't want that.  Then, only when she came back later to take our order did she tell me the item I had ordered was out.  That felt a little like a waste of time, because now I need to read the menu again.
Since we were seated by the open kitchen, I saw our lunches come up, but our server was sitting down with the table next to us while our food waited under a heat lamp.  That probably didn't make much difference though as it was extremely unexceptional.  I tried half of the chicken club and half of the burger.  The bottom bun on the burger fell apart after a few bites - big burger sin!
The chicken club was dry and both sandwiches had components listed on the menu - balsamic onions and roasted tomato mayo, that sounded great, but were lost in the final result.

Our waiter was either overworked or overmatched.  Regardless of this we had to keep reminding him that we were there.

Outdoor seating was actually quite noisy.

Food was okay, but poor service demands a less than average rating.

'okay for kids' : not sure how to answer this.  I would not say 'great' for kids, I would say 'average' for kids.

Great food, love the environment, and service is fantastic. Try their lasagna, it's amazing. They use alfredo sauce! It's divine. We go often as a family or for business lunches. My only complaint is the wait staff is sometimes uneducated in the difference between lunch and dinner portions, happens all the time.

My daughter and I ate here July 28 and our waitress was a blonde lady in her 50s. She was fabulous!
We shared the Brushetta and wedge salad then had
a steak dinner with a side of Brussels.Service and food is amazing!! My favourite restaurant in all of Vegas!!

Excellent steak salad and tea! There was enough steak for my wife however I needed to order extra steak on the side to satisfy my appetite. With one ice tea and a martini the total without tip came to about $57. Will definitely come back again whenever I'm visiting Santan Village to try out the rest of the menu and report back.
burnt dry chicken, way over cooked prime ribs. Very unacceptable. Price was higher than it was worth. There was no effort put into this food. It was rushed, fast food style. burnt.

the food was stunningly boring, over salted, over cooked and just plain mediocre. I felt like I should have been eating at an Olive Garden in Arkansas.  the server never asked why our food was mostly untouched, and I do not plan on spending time, money or energy in this restaurant again.

Attended happy hour here last night. The pepper shrimp was delicious and had the Razzbertini - very refreshing. This was my second time at this location for happy hour and it was a little too empty for my likings but I won't let that affect the rating :)

OMG this place never fails to amaze me and tonight was no different.  Husband had beef medallions and shrimp scampi and 3 hours later is still talking about it.  I had the penne diavolo with chicken - yowza.  Unbelievable.  Everything, from the moment you sit down in this gorgeous place until you leave feeling oh so satisfied is an incredible experience.

I've been there several times and every time has been amazing.  Happy hour is incredible - $2.95 for shrimp and eggplant which is usually $12 and the most incredible dish that I actually had a dream about it.

Go.  You won't regret it!!!

Delicious dinner options

Excellent service and attentive wait staff

Had the salmon on breaded tomatoes - excellent
Would recommend getting the side salad as there is not much in the way of greens with the dinner

PAsta dishes were delicious and well presented

Attentive to the children attending with us

In Scottsdale on vacation and the bellman recommended the happy hour here.  He was right!  This is a great happy hour!  $5.00 drink menu and $3.95 appetizer menu and the drinks and appetizers were good.  I got the Capri Salad and hubby got the burger with homemade chips, then we shared the Margharita Flatbread.  It was all quite good.  The flatbread could have had a bit more zip to it, it was a little bland.  Both the burger and the salad were very delicious.  The drinks were good too, although hubby's second glass of white peach sangria was very watered down.  No problem though - we told the waiter and he brought another right away.  The service was a bit slow at times, but since we were in no great rush, it was no bid deal.  Overall, a very pleasant happy hour experience.

On a Mommy Daughter date night & the level of service reviewed by Adeline and complimented further by Stephanie, made the experience fabulous. They well exceeded our expectations. The filet was perfectly prepared, service was quick, & the ambiance on the patio ..amazing!
This restaurant is always crowded, which is strange since the food is just ok. Of you are looking for Italian, there are a lot better places to go than here.

Firstly, if you go during their version of happy hour, the bar menu offerings (which is a slimmed down version of their regular menu in both options and portion size) is very good and makes for an affordable dinner. 

Honestly, Brio is just fine. For an neighborhood Italian restaurant, it's pretty good. I like their pasta offerings but they do have some nice non-pasta selections and their crispy potatoes that they serve with some of their entrees are really good. I like their chopped salad and am pretty much addicted to it. It's huge even if you just get the side added to your main dish so splitting it is a good option. I like the pasta Mediterranean and I usually add chicken. It's always enough to make a lunch the next day. The thing I love is that their specials are usually good and they do have seasonal menu items (like a primavera pasta in the spring with asparagus) which are usually pretty inspiring. We eat here pretty regularly and on the rare occasion something has been wrong, they have fixed it promptly with no fuss. 

It's a nice place for a casual dinner that is good and not too expensive.

What can you get for $2.95?!! Appetizers at Brio!! say whaaa!! lol!

On a mission for cheap eats and drinks at town square, some friends and I decided to go to Brio Tuscan Grille since we always go to the usual spots like yardhouse. We actually arrived just in time for HAPPY HOUR (Mon-Fri 3pm-6pm) Niiiiceeeee!!! 

The staff at Brio are super friendly, so helpful. Our server was such fun too. She suggested on what top picks for appetizers and drinks to try - kudos. We ordered the...
**Beef Carpaccio -  (field greens, capers, mustard aioli, and shaved Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese).
**The Brio Burger - (bistecca burger with mozzarella and housemade chips).
**Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant - seared shrimp in a black pepper cream sauce over Romano crusted eggplant).

Yum yum yum! hunger was satisified, not overly full. 
Brio is definitely a MUST in Town Square. They have a nice outdoor seating area with misters for the vegas heat ahhh! and at night, you can sit by the fire pit to set the mood with a loved one (idk if anyone wants to do that now?! extra heat, no thanks) lol.

Stopped in for lunch. Service was extremely slow. We watched our food sit for 15 minutes in the window while our waitress walked by it 6 times.  Food isn't that great to begin with even worse when sitting under a heat lamp for that long.

I love the happy hours here. The best one is the spicy shrimp and eggplants and Roasted Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke Dip. Not to mention their desserts the Torta Di Cioccolata. Its the warm chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream on top. Our servers pretty know us there very well. I would recommend this if you like happy hours.

We celebrated our grandmas 85th birthday at Brio, in Tivoli and everything was perfect. 
We had a large party so we had two servers, Frank & Joe and they were both extremely friendly, polite and on top of everything. 
The food was incredible.. it not only looked beautiful on the plates but everything was piping hot and full of flavor. 
Usually when we go out with large parties something goes wrong, the service lacks or food orders get messed up, food items take too long to come out, or they come out cold, or you can't get your drinks refilled fast enough, etc.. which is why I felt compelled to write this review.. everything was perfect on that night and the staff should be recognized for doing such a wonderful job on a night that meant so much to our family.

Love this place!  My go to place for family night, birthdays, anniversary, etc; I'd eat here any time. Hands down they have the best salad of ANY restaurant, PERIOD!  The Bistecc A Insalata, I could eat it daily.  The Sausage, Pepperoni & Ricotta Flatbread is excellent but their absolute best entree is the Lasagna Bolognese Al Forno. Both my grandparents immigrated to America from Sicily / Italy in 1921 and they would have been proud to eat here.  That dish is a decadent masterpiece.  They also have the best lemonade!  I love this place, best Italian food in the valley!

Not impressed. Waited 30 minutes on a Friday night, which is to be expected. Sat down on some filthy bench seats, which is not be expected. Ordered Morel Mushroom soup only to find not one morel in it. I asked the waitress, just out of curiosity and the manager came out and told me they were in the soup, which wasn't true. Next up, steak salad. I don't recommend. The lettuce mix looked old along with mushrooms. I didn't even eat it. 
All in all, this place comes off as a nice restaurant when you walk in but the service & food don't support it. Won't be back.

I love this place. I love the lobster bisque!! It was delicious, I often think about it. I've loved everything I've ever ordered... The steak, the mahi mahi, the vegetarian ravioli, and dessert. Must. Order. Dessert! Get the sampler, the whole sampler. Yum

I love this place. Perfect every time. They hit the mark on food, atmosphere, price and service.  The complimentary bread basket is fresh and served with real butter. Most recently I had the fettucini rustica (ordered it with rigatoni instead).  Lots of chicken and sundried tomatos, but not oily and heavy like the penne rustica at Olive Garden. Very attentive servers. The only criticism would be the noise level.  This was a business lunch and at times it was a bit difficult to hear one another.  Must have been all the enthusiastic "yums".

The food was bland and barely edible.  The beef app was a joke.  It had no flavor.  Even the mustard didn't help.   The caesar salad was yellow.  Not even a shade of green in there at all.  The lobster bisque lacked flavor.

My wife and I were taken there by relatives who live in Las Vegas.  We ordered the Lobster Bisque, lettuce wedge and Medallions of beef ( which we shared).  Everything that we ordered was excellent. The Lobster Bisque was the best that I have ever had. I highly recommend ordering this.  Service was excellent and the gal who waited on us was very attentive.  Should we return to Las Vegas, I will be sure to return to Brio!

Brio was legitimately me and my wife Leah's absolute favorite brunch for the angel hair frittata. We are so disappointed to see that it was removed from the menu... Seriously???? Can't believe it!! This dish was absolutely amazing and several of our friends and family loved it. We told everyone about it. Sad!! Sad! Sad!!

Please bring it back!!

The service was great from the hostess to the server and I worked in the service industry so trust me I know what's good service and what's not. We ordered a nice Malbec from Argentina which was amazing and wedge salads to start. For the main dish I ordered The Pasta Brio which I highly recommend. The server was highly entertaining and had a good personality. The manager was really nice too when he came by. Every time I come here I get really good service. The bartenders are friendly and cool too. The bathrooms are nice and this place has an all around good vibe to it :)
The roquefort crusted steak was a gourmet delight for a special night out. Brio has just the right combination of casual atmosphere and white table cloths.

My boyfriend and I have had excellent food and good service here. Their free flat bread/crackers and their beef carpaccio are amazing. For entrees their chicken limone and their chicken under a brick (marsala) are both excellent. Their whole menu is a delight and I wish I ate more pasta so I could try their carbonara, vodka and salmon dishes. Maybe some day after I run a half marathon...
Everything here tastes like it came right off a Sysco truck which I'm sure it did. It's not the worst food I ever had, but it definitely not any kind of good.

Mediocre at best!!
If you are looking for bland food and people watching Brio is the place to go..

I've had dinner in the past... It was awful then.. So I thought I would try lunch nearly  24 months later.. 
Bad idea. 

:( the food is grossly over priced for the quality of ingredients & dished offered.  
Thumbs down!

We enjoy happy hour here. The Tuscan Taster appetizers are very good. The spicy shrimp and eggplant varies from time to time in flavor and preparation ie., crispy vs oily. The burger is always a solid choice.  It would be nice for a healthy appetizer option.
You need to stick with the happy hour drinks or else your tab gets sky high quickly.
At the San Tan location, the blonde bar manager is efficient but super serious and curt.  We always leave satisfied but not thrilled.

This place is delicious! I had a flat bred and it was so tasty! The atmosphere is what makes the place unique. It reminded me a lot of Cheesecake factory. This place is perfect for a date night or girls lunch and shopping day. Brio is the kind of restaurant that makes you feel fabulous. Can't wait to try the one in Orlando!
There are so many better choices in the local area.  The food is bland and the service is slow.
Excellent selections. Enjoyed the Beef Medallion.  Only thing is that they should have better lighting in tables that are in the center. Hard to read menu in the dark.

I went here for happy hour and I must say, they have. really good selection of happy hour items. One of my favorites is the beef carpaccio. The items on their happy hour menu are also really cheap (less than $6). Keep in mind that happy hour is only at the bar inside or the sofas outside. The tables do not qualify for happy hour pricing. The service here is decent. Nothing they did really stood out. As a matter of fact, they tried to give us someone else's order. We also had to ask a few times for our check. But regardless of this, I still highly recommend this place if you are looking for a happy hour place after a long day at work with a casual and relaxing vibe.

What happened to this place?  Food was just ok. Ordered the Chicken Milanese (their version of Chicken Parmesan), Carbonara, and Grilled Chicken with Peppers for our entrees.  Besides the Carbonara the dishes were very dry.  Milanese was definitely over peppered. We were there on a Sunday and hardly anyone was there.  Service from "Aaron" was painful at best.  No interaction at all and he seemed distant throughout the meal.  Didn't offer to take our entree order till after the apps hit the table?  Really?  This used to be one of our favorites but now I wonder if we'll ever go back.

Side Note
If someone is dining in your restaurant you should cover the valet charge.  $6 for valet parking in Scottsdale Quarter on a Sunday evening.  Give me a break.

Was trying out this place for the first time after all I've heard about it. I came with a friend for some drinks and dMy food came cold and I was quite disappointed, I didn't wanna be a hassle and ask for it to be remade because it was already busy. The place inside is very nice though. Had higher hopes for this place, not sure if I just came on a bad day.
Just had the Pork Chops....only got one and it was so good, I requested a second. My cousin had the Veal Milanse and he loved it. Our server Karen was top notch too.

Normally, the food is decent, but this time around the sweet potato chicken risotto was flavorless and a kid size portion.  I'm not sure if it was because it was so busy that they were just pushing food out the kitchen and they didn't take the time to taste the food. On top of that they got my daughters meal wrong, which was sent back and took forever for them to make.  But the flavor was definitely sub-standard. Probably my last time eating there considering the cost.  It's not worth paying $18 for a flavorless plate and walking away hungry.

Happy hour review....Really good happy hour appetizers.  Great margaritas.  First-come first serve can be challenging for more than two people.  Going to try dinner menu next week.

Dinner Area/food review....3 stars which would be above average.  5 for happy hour makes this 4 stars.  Pork chops were good but I've made them better before.  vegetables were really good.  mash potatoes were really good.  service was good.

The spicy shrimp and eggplant is amazing, Oliva was great with my 2yr old son. She took the time to make my boy smile and laugh even though she wasn't our waiter. The manager Lucia went out of her way to stop by and ask how the wine was, never expected that but very happy she did and even left me her card. I thought it was great that she explained the dough that was given to us so that my son could play as we waited for his lovey chicken fingers. Overall it was amazing thank you Olivia and Lucia amazing ladies with great personalities!

My friend and I met at Brio for happy hour at the bar area.  Our server Jennifer was so friendly and attentive to our needs.  Made menu suggestions knowing I was a vegetarian.

She engaged in conversation knowing I was pregnant and was very sweet about it.  She also sent out an unexpected delightable, a small dessert with two candles, pink and blue.  I was throw off, how sweet Jennifer was to take the time to get a dessert from the kitchen and bring it to me.  Pink ad Blue candles, because she knew the sex was a surprise to us!! 

Jennifer exceeded my expectations and make my experience memorable.  

I work for Marriott and this is exactly what try to enstill in everyone's service delivery.

Well done!  I will be back!!

One of my favorite places to go. I love the setting of course and getting to sit outdoors and have a drink or food is an option. Always have great service here and GREAT food!. I either go alone or with a couple of friends. So many others things to do BEFORE and after you eat makes this location EXCELLENT.

Stopped in for happy hour today. Not sure what time it ends, but it starts at 3:30. Ordered 3 plates for a total of $17 and some change. Awesome deal! And the food was good too. Will definitely be back.

Had a nice Easter brunch with my family. Town Square was a bit crowded for the holiday, but the weather was perfect to sit on the patio. Brio is kid friendly and outside on the patio is pet friendly. Lots of nice Italian options from appetizers, soups, salads and several entrees. Good service and fresh food, they also have happy hour during the week. 
Great drink options as well!
Buòn Appetìto

I LOVE Brio! I was first introduced to it in Arizona and then they opened in Nevada and now California. I have been to several locations and have had the same great experience. I have gone in groups, with my hubby and alone and each time the experience and food quality was the same - very good. I have tried new things and never experienced a problem with any meal. I enjoy the bruschetta, lamb chops, ravioli, and angel hair pasta with multiple sauces. 

We recently went with a group for my hubby's birthday when we arrived into Las Vegas from California and what a treat it was. We had a great brunch and hung out for a little while before we checked in to our hotels and headed for additional birthday adventures in Vegas! 

I had the lamb chops and a tomato caprese salad-TASTY! The birthday man had the shrimp and grits and it was morningly good-he moaned through his culinary experience. Another party attendee had the caesar salad and commented on the freshness and the great dressing. The pasta Brio and the chicken sandwich rounded off the Brio experience! But wait, that dessert was to die for. The birthday chocolate a la mode cake was great, but that Peach Cobbler was to die for! We are still having dreams of it! Love it Brio!!! It was a HIT!!!!
