Nice environment, very classy. I've only gone for happy hour because the dinner menu is pretty pricey. The spicy eggplant and shrimp is delicious. Try it!
Great atmosphere. Amazing food. Great wine and stellar service!!! Will be back soon for sure.

We visited for the second time to give Brio a fair shot and it is simply overpriced for very little. I had a salmon dish where the veggies looked like they came out of a bag in the freezer aisle of a grocery store. The salmon and potatoes were good, but nothing I couldn't have made at home. My wife enjoyed her lasagna and thought it was good. We didn't order drinks, so when our bill came in at nearly $60 I almost couldn't believe it. 

I simply cannot recommend Brio when the food is simply ok or good but priced as if it is exceptional.

This place is a little on the pricy side compared to Macaroni grill or Caraba's, but it really is quite good. I'm particularly fond of the Sweet Potato & Chicken Risotto. Service was really outstanding as well as the atmosphere.

Even with the higher price point, it is definitely worth the trip.

Had a nice lunch there--love the bread basket, as so few places do that anymore. Had the chicken and wild rice orzo salad. It was a huge portion and was like something I could make at home. The service was a bit slow. They gave my salad to someone else, so I had to wait. Should have comped my iced tea for the extra wait. I would go back again, but I think it is pricey for what you get. The salad is about $13--$11 would be more fair.

First time eating at Brio.  A girlfriend invited me to lunch, great atmosphere, great menu choices and the food was delicious!!  I tried the Brio salad and added chicken, the spices were perfect and the chicken was a good size portion and very moist!  Our server was terrific, prompt, attentive and nice, her name was Kim!  I will be going back!

Called for a 6:30 reservation. The guy on the other end even asked how to spell my name and last name. Only to find out that they didn't have me on the reservation list. What a bummer. I was really looking forward to eating here. What a disappointment especially when you are eating for two.

Start the evening off with the hostess, who you made the phone reservation with, tell us she does not have a reservation for us.  Service was ok. Crackers were stale.  Glassware....narrow on bottom, top heavy...one went crashing to the floor.  Food is horrible.  Market fish minuscule, very lousy piece of fish served with mostly burned carrots, a couple of zucchini, a couple of broccoli pieces.  Kids pasta with shrimp barely edible. Cod...terrible piece of fish. Fettuccini alfredo...put your fork in and the whole lump of pasta comes along. Yuck.  We gave up on Brio several years ago but the kids asked to go back. Big mistake.  How bad is it when it came to dessert, we all said "NO!"

Brio has catered a few events that I have gone to in the last few years. Always fantastic food. But, I had never been in the restaurant itself before.
I came here with my  daughter for lunch. I was not hungry till the next morning.
There is lots of covered parking in the garage. Which is really nice for starters.
The restaurant itself is beautiful inside. You can eat on the patio or inside .
The hostess greeted us immediately  and gave us a wonderful booth.
I was drinking hot tea, but my daughter had a few cocktails. A Bellini which was frozen (a little different) but,she said it was good. Also a Basil gimlet, which she said was OK.
The food was really the best! I got Lobster Bisque soup which that alone was a full meal. Then I got crab cakes they came with vegetables. Wow, very tasty and more than I could eat. My daughter got a salad, and Pasta Pompadour with Eggplant.
Again way too much and she took most  of it to go.
Food was fantastic, service was very good.
Too bad it is so far away from me. But, I never mind driving. It is a win win day or night out here. Plus they play fabulous Italian music!

Wow! I can't believe how good this place was.Surprisingly of the 93 reviews, no one mentioned the grilled mahi mahi with farro, spinach and a tomato basil vinaigrette. The plate was light, super tasty, and addictively good. I actually wanted MORE as I finished my last bite (a rare feeling for eating out). I substituted fries for steamed veggies. I was also surprised at how "inexpensive" it was - $17.50 a plate is less than mahi mahi plates at places of similar caliber (i.e., McCormick's and Salt Creek). Would love to visit this place again next time I'm in town.

I come here often especially for the happy hour..best deal in town , nice atmosphere,  appetizers are my favorite not too mention the happy hour cocktails. The prices on the happy hour menu is really affordable.
I went last night with a group of friends,  I had a Brio Steak Salad, and it was very good. The waiter was very nice and friendly. I also have a cosmopolitan martini that I LOVE it!

I was brought here for an Italian lunch.  I must say that it was fabulous.  I had the Salmon with Angel Hair Pasta.  The Salmon was cooked perfectly, the pasta was a perfect al dente.  The combination of fresh pesto and scampi sauce with a touch of red pepper flakes makes it a very memorable dish.  The staff was very kind and accommodating.  I will definitely return.

Great service, great food.  Our waitress Caitlyn and who I assume was the manager made sure to welcome us and kept coming back to the table to make sure our drinks were freshened and that we enjoyed our meal..

I am constantly surprised with how much we enjoy our time, food, drinks, and the staff at Brio.  Whereas most chains fall short in the personality department, the bar crew here is supreme.  Mandy, Kelly, Jim and all of the rest of the team know how to hustle and entertain while keeping the cocktails and delicious cuisine flowing.
We started coming here for the unbeatable $3.95 happy hour menu (3-6:30 and 9-close weekdays) , but now it has become high on our go-to list of places to feel amongst friends.

Beautiful location!  We have eaten once outside, and twice inside.  The service has been very nice each time.  I've had the Mezza Chicken, Eggplant Pomodoro and the grilled Salmon.  I would order each of them again, very delicious.

The calamari on the other hand was too salty for me, but others in my party enjoyed it.  The Quatro Bruschetta was disappointment.  I did have a bruschetta on the specialty menu with proscuitto and asparagus that was very tasty and I would have again.

I don't recall the names of all the drinks that I have tried; one was a martini with Absolute Raspberry, pineapple juice, and cranberry juice (missing some ingredients).  It was incredible!  The only problem was that it didn't come in a bigger glass, (careful, this one goes down quick).  The other was a strawberry lemonade with fresh strawberries, fresh basil and prosecco.  I know, fresh basil seems strange, but I'm going to try and make this one at home, I loved it so much!

We went for lunch today and it was great.  Our server Sonia was amazing.  She was attentive and on top of everything.  We asked her for recommendations and we tried them and we were pleased with what we ordered.   Good food and good environment.

Great spot in Tivoli village...especially for happy hour.  I had cheese ravioli and it was amazing - and very cheap!  They also serve mojitos, which are one of my favorite drinks.  The scenery is usually pretty good and Tivoli village is a great cozy atmosphere.  Easy parking underneath and easy access from Summerlin Parkway make this a winner...

I really like Town Square.  And Brio fits right in to the atmosphere.  A cozy restaurant that has both a dining room and a bar area.  If you arrive at happy hour, the deals at the bar are amazing.  $3.95 for 3 deep fried cheese raviolis for example.  They also serve mojitos and sangria on top of all the regular bar drinks.  For dinner, their pasta is good.  I had the lobster bisque and it was good, but I enjoyed their tomato bisque even better... but I don't think it's always available.  Overall, it's a classy place at a just above average price range.  Most dishes are $10 - $20.  I think it's a step above Olive Garden and Macaroni Grille...

Yum...

Great Service, Great Food, and they took my "special order well. 

My special order was this:
The Tuscan Chicken Salad. YUM... but it came with mushrooms and Gorgonzola, I am not a fan of either, so i substituted Feta for Gorgonzola and omitted the mushrooms.  The portion was just right, I ate about 3/4 of it and took 1/4 of it home.  So it wasn't over done.  I have nothing bad to say about this.  

this was the most fantastic salad I ever had in my life.  

The wine list was fantastic.

Definitely a must go!

Ronney
Chicken Lemone was pretty nasty. Also the veggies that came with it tasted really bad. Recommended by our waiter. WOW! Glad I wasn't the one paying that day. I won't be back for a second treatment.

Went to San Tan Brio for Breakfast with Santa 2014, we made reservations for 8am. Highly disappointed. Poor set-up for the buffet. Buffet was against the wall, which made the line run through the middle of tables full of guests. The buffet was cold, long line for the buffet, and lack of organization to meet Santa.  Where to meet Santa was right at the entrance of the restaurant, which caused chaos. Server was extremely nice however was not advised by management that drinks are to be brought to the tables, she initially was told guest are to help themselves. After a while, we finally got it figured out, took over half an hour to get coffee. Part of the delay was the drink station was behind the long line of guests waiting for the buffet. Like I said, poor set-up. To top it off, the food was mediocre to unappealing. Example, the muffins were of something you would get from Holiday Inn. Waste of time and money.

I'm a HUGE fan of Brio but lately the SERVICE has become less and less something to rave about.  Last night, Monday 9/18, I met a friend at the bar for dinner and for the second time on a Monday night (in a matter of two months) the bar service was TERRIBLE, food service took forever and they only had one bartender.  Not only was she working the bar but also the well for the dining room.  Many of us sat waiting for food, drink refills, etc. The manager came around several times but seemed to lack the intelligence to realize his bartender was not keeping up with the demands of the customers.  I finally got up and grabbed him to request help for his bartender because apparently they didn't think it was going to be busy enough for two bartenders and called one off before Happy Hour even started.  By the time we got our appetizer (45 min later) it was cold and arrived at the same time as our salads and entrees.  This is certainly not the service we've been used to!!   It's apparent that customer service isn't important to the management at this restaurant whether it be long time or new customers.  Our choices are many for restaurants in Gilbert and I think it's time to revisit our loyalty!!

Great Happy hour with decent prices. I have never had complaints on food and the drinks are always on par. 4 star because the bartenders ignore most of the time, and typically have to wave one down to order a drink or food.

I was in town for a few days and met a friend here.  After we were seated no one came by to get our drink order.  We waited about 10 min too long and my friend got someone's attention and finally got our water.  Another 10 min goes by and a server comes to our table and tells us "our server walked out."  At this point, the manager should have came and told us what was going on and at least offer something or an apology but at least our server apologized.  I finally ordered the pasta Brio which was lacking flavor and dry.  The place looked promising but was a huge disappointment.

I was surprisingly delighted by this restaurant, given the fact it is a chain restaurant.  Every time I have visited this establishment, the food has always been great along with the drinks,  My favorite by far is the chicken limone, the pasta is nicely seasoned and I LOVE capers!  All the flavors are nicely pulled together and it is delightful as leftovers too!  And their white peach sangria can rival Firefly's sangria...lol.  

It's also a great place to gather with friends, as the patio gives you an opportunity to people watch and they have a few fire pits outdoor to keep you warm while chatting and drinking.  I definitely encourage people to swing by and enjoy the food and atmosphere.

I went here for my birthday last year for happy hour appetizers and sat outside on the patio with some friends, we all had great time. We were there so long it was closing and had to leave!

The creme brulee was nothing like id every tasted! Im looking forward to going back for dinner and more creme brulee!
Food, service and atmosphere were ok. Nothing I would rush back for. Prices were high for items served.

The food was good when we finally received it. Roughly 27 minutes after placing our order we were told that they were out of New York strip that my girlfriend had ordered. So it took even longer to actually receive our food. The waiter was moody at best, he would grab our plates with no interaction, didn't respond when I said thank you. Felt very distant. I wish I had a better experience because the food was good.

Brio Tuscan Grille is one of my favorite restaurants. So much so that I drive from Tucson to Scottsdale to go there. Their service is great, setting is fancy and food is perfect. They serve a loaf of bread and chips before the meal. I'm an east coaster who values good seafood and they have one of the best Shrimp & Lobster Fettuccine I've had in Arizona. Their Lobster Bisque is also a favorite. Paired with their new zesty Watermelon Margarita. For dessert I order the chocolate cake that has fudge in the middle.

We craved for Italian cuisine so my girlfriend brought us to Brio Tuscan Grille, an elegant and inviting Italian restaurant located in the upscale Town Square in Las Vegas. 

A waitstaff greeted us at the door as we arrived and directed us to our seats. The restaurant has a certain sophistication to it: chic, elegant interior with tasteful accoutrements, high ceilings, flowing drapery, and well-trained staff -- you wouldn't even think that this is a chain restaurant. 

The menu has a good selection of insalatas, bruschettas, zuppas, paninis, and pasta. They also have a nice selection of house specialties but I didn't order any of that. The wine selection is not too extensive but you'll certainly find the perfect wine to pair your dish with. 

The shrimp and scallop risotto was well-seasoned and flavorful; I paired it with a glass of pinot Grigio. My friends loved their dishes as well, which they generously shared with me (and vice versa).

The price range is very reasonable considering the restaurant's ambiance, the quality of dishes, and the quality of service that we got. Overall, I'm happy with the experience.

I've had great food from Brio. I guess I can't comment on the atmosphere because I always get my food to go, but it's similar to (the decor, table size, general layout) a Cheesecake Factory on the inside (I'm being an asshole-specifically because some guy was all 'I'd pass, Cheesecake Factory atmosphere' am I the only one who thinks Cheesecake Factory isn't so bad? I mean yeah they're a chain, but they're always pretty well kept? Whatever.) - clean, all of the wait staff are friendly. I always deal with the bartender and he's a nice guy. All of the food I've had had been delicious. The desserts have been a personal favorite, but the quinoa chicken pesto salad for lunch was also delicious and decently priced for the area.

Three of us took Mom here for her birthday, to try something new, for lunch.  It's in the trendy Tivoli Square which looks brand new and is stylishly done.  The walls, decorations, art and overall feel screams Italian countryside, complemented by the bright Vegas sun outside.  

We ordered one of the chicken sandwiches with the housemade chips, the mezzo chicken "under the brick", the grilled chicken risotto with sweet potatoes and I had the grilled shrimp with orzo.  Everything was good.  Nothing the blew us away.  The food is noticeably rich with butter and salt (fair warning for those looking for lighter, healthier choices) and is served in smallish portions perfect for lunch.  My family really enjoyed the housemade chips which were not salty at all and perfectly crisp.  

This place might have gotten an extra star if the service had been a little bit more personable and organized.  The waitress was friendly but she came back after our order and handed me a Caesar salad.  I looked back at her in confusion.  "I didn't order a salad."  "Yes, you did.  This is yours."  My aunt spoke up and said it was hers and she apologized but if I told her I didn't order it, I thought that should have been it.  

By the time we started eating, my mother still didn't have her side salad.  The waitress told us it would be right out.  After she'd brought it out, Mom said the girl dropped it on the table and said "here you are" while already looking to the next table and moving on.  Since she believes that service includes making eye contact with your customers when you are engaging with them, I'm mentioning it here.  

Otherwise, it was a good experience.  It's reaosnably close to Summerlin, but I think we'll continue exploring other Italian options before returning.

We stopped in after cruising around the mall area. Not too shabby, but kind of pricey for portion size. Fresh sourdough bread to begin with, along with some stale tasting crackers. 
Started out with the shrimp/chorizo bruschetta--which was enjoyable, but kind of messy! Combo of shrimp, chorizo, red and yellow tomatoes, and creamed leeks. All came together rather nicely. For dinner, I had a chicken parmesan hybrid, which wasn't terrible, but the sauce tasted a little bit like spaghetti-o's and there wasn't enough sauce to coat the pasta, 
Drinks were also on the expensive side--$13 glasses of wine?!
Was ok, not great. Our server was nice and on top of refills/checking in on us.

Salmon dish is fantastic!  Every time I've been there the service is great and the food excellent. Decided to have a bridal shower there and the service was the best . Have not experienced that friendliness and help in a long time. The manager was great and very accommodating.  Would definitely do it there again.

Overall it is pretty good. The food artistry was average and and the overall quality was decent.

The service, unfortunately, was slow with only about 50% of the seats filled. That being said the staff was very pleasant.

Just had a wonderful time at Brio. Our server, Amit, learned our names and used them throughout our visit. I have never seen this level of customer service. He also squatted down and spoke with us eye to eye at least once. I also saw him doing this with other customers.  We dined at a Brio in Virginia a couple years ago. The food was equally good at both locations, but Amit has spurred us to visit on a regular basis!

This was a typical chain restaurant in an outdoor shopping center. We came here for a "rehearsal dinner" before a wedding. I can't lie and say I was excited about going somewhere we could have gone in Cleveland, but it was a good meal anyways. The peach sangria was probably my favorite part of the meal! 

The selected menu we got had a salad, chicken, salmon and pasta on it. The salad was typical and satisfying. The salmon was actually really good. The sauce on it was tart and creamy at the same time and the shoestring potatoes were such a nice unique touch. The roasted tomatoes underneath were so sweet and savory at the same time, too. Overall, it was a tasty dish! 

I really just think I would have been more excited about this place if we weren't in Vegas and surrounded by other options that we don't get in Cleveland. (re: Battista's!)

I'll be honest. I'm a cynic and I find flaws in other people's work for a living. I find it hard giving anyone or anything a 5-star but this review isn't about the awe-inspiring story of how I overcame being so an*l. Well maybe it is.

If I could give this place a 4 and half star I would, simply because 5-stars is reserved for the best meal of my life and I believe that hasn't happened yet. However, since I can't and 4-star would be an injustice, this place gets a 5.

Brio is easily one of the best restaurants I've been too in the past couple of years (tied with Hanks and miles ahead of Napa Valley win train). The food is exceptional! The service is impeccable! The decor is très chic (love the high ceilings) and the staff is attentive. If I had to make one negative comment it would be the unfortunate proximity to the airport. It gets REALLY loud when a plane flies overhead and I'm going to blame the high ceilings for the acoustic effect. Having said that, you're going to Brio for the food. You really can't go wrong with anything here but the Salmon is highly recommended.

Final word - Make reservations and give in to the food.

Very delicious food and the pricing is great too. We order their family bundles for delivery and there is always leftovers. It's really a great value considering the amount of food you get. The salads that come with are always fresh and never soggy. I also use the leftover bread that wasn't eaten at dinner and make French toast in the oven with it. Awesome service too.

Had a quick lunch at the bar on a busy Saturday afternoon. The female bartender was friendly and knowledgable and recommended a win I really liked (Rocca della Macie Chianti). I did think the wine list by the glass was a little limited though. Had a caprese salad -- it wasn't summer so tomatoes were a little mealy but everything else was good. Great fresh and hot bread! It's a bustling place and had outdoor seating too.

I have eaten here before and found this place to be a great restaurant to eat at. This place has a nice ambiance to it. I came here for a birthday party which they had a private section towards the back. The waiters and waitresses were real friendly and helpful.  It was real nice but it was real noisey in the sense that we could here the other people in the whole restaurant. Its a private area but it should have been sound proofed too. We couldn't hear the host or people making speeches. Other than that, the food that was ordered was ok and I would come back to eat at this restaurant.

I was looking for somewhere new to try for my birthday dinner this year and decided on Brio Tuscan Grille.  I was definitely not disappointed.  Everything on the menu sounded amazing and everything that came out of the kitchen looked amazing!  I ordered the Chef Special - Tomato Crusted Blackened Tuna.  It was so good!  Everyone in our party agreed that we will have to make a return visit!  There are many things on the menu that I am interested to try. Next time I will have to save room to try one of the desserts!

I'm posting two stars only for the wine. If you loooove Olive Garden, you'll love Brio. Except in place of bottomless soup, salad and breadsticks, you get one tasteless salad. I ordered the pasta  bolognese and a Ceasar salad. Ceasar dressing should have a bite of garlic and the saltiness of anchovies. This mess tasted like it was pre made and sat in the walk-in for a few hours. Equally tasteless, the pasta. Here's a thought- garlic. It's Italian food for Christ's sake.
And if your diner does not eat the salad, before removing it, ask if it was ok. And when you sweep your section, look at all your tables to see if your guests need anything before running back to the kitchen. That's just common waitress sense.
This is very close to where I live so my gfs and I enjoy coming for their happy hours. The food is amazing, service is good too.

I came here for lunch right after Christmas.  The building is beautiful.  You feel like you're eating somewhere in Vegas.  I ordered the lobster bisque soup and the caesar salad.  The table bread was great.  The taste of the lobster bisque was good but it didn't have any lobster chunks.  My friend ordered the vodka pasta - it had bacon in it which we weren't expecting although it was good.  We ordered the molten chocolate cake - very good - and two cappuccinos, also good.  Because it was my birthday, they brought us a free mini tiramisu.  Except for the amazing interior decor, this place is your standard italian restaurant with standard fare.  I would return again for lunch.

Date/time: Feb 10 @ 9p

My friend wanted to try this place out for her birthday dinner. Online suggested a reservation. I had made a reservation for 845 but had trouble finding it and arrived at 9p. I apologized to the hostesses who were [very welcoming]. I informed them it was my friends birthday and left her name with them. They sat me by the kitchen. I'm very impressed with the atmosphere and maintenance.

My waiter came over to greet me, I ordered a water with lemon. He forgot the lemons and said he would return with them. He returned, no lemons, asked if I would like an appetizer. I ordered an appetizer chopped salad. 30mins goes by and my friend arrived. He comes to greet her and take her drink order, I reminded him about my salad which he got promptly. The salad was excellent. Good portioned and lots of flavor for only 175 calories!

We order the light selection mahimahi and lemon chicken. The mahimahi was very good, fresh, not over cooked and well portioned. The lemon chicken was juicy but not over powering with a generous portion of veggies. Our compliments to the kitchen.
I pushed my empty water glass to the end of the table and watched my waiter walk right by. I said excuse me. He came back. I asked for a refill and the manager.
The manager knew I STILL had not received my lemons, my salad took 30mins, and I was just overall not pleased with my service. She was very apologetic, got my friend a mini birthday desert, discounted our check, and took over our table herself.

Even though it was a rocky first experience I would still come back and suggest this restaurant. I'm very impressed with the management and kitchen.

Don't get the hype. The service is too slow. It takes 15 minutes to get a waiter, then the food comes after 30 minutes and multiple reminders, and now we asked a check 20 minutes and had to double check with the waiter and it is still not here... very disappointing. Not to forget to add that the food is ok but not special worth the wait and be patient about the service. Will not come here next time. There are better places out there.

Came here the other day while I was out shopping with my girlfriend, she had eaten here before so we decided to stop in.  We sat fairly quickly and we're greeted immediately by a friendly server. We ordered some appetizers to start, which were very good, I would recommend the calamari.  After our meals arrived, nicely presented and very nice portions. They even have a lite menu for those trying to be healthy.  The service at times was a bit shaky, it seemed like they had a ton of staff working and the restaurant wasn't even  that busy but our server was constantly running around at times neglecting us.  Overall if you are in the mood for some great Italian food and a great atmosphere I would urge you to try this place.

Okay Brio, I will give you the fact that your Happy Hour 'tasters' menu is quite good. I will even give you your bruschetta (the tasty steak is the best) is fantastic, but your service is seriously in need of some attention. When dining in the dining room, service is your typical average, however every time I have been in the bar for Happy Hour or for a quick bite the service has been some of the weakest in the area. Today we waited for 10 minutes for the bartender (who is the server in the bar) to come over to us to take our order. He hardly said a word and the entire interaction was simply awkward. The interaction did not improve (to my dismay) as time went on. My mom and I had a few giggles over the awkward moments but by the time we finished and had to flag down another server for our check, we were done with the giggles. If you go, try the bruschetta... oh, and avoid a seat in the bar.
Nice place, great service.  The Caesars salad was nothing special but the lasagna was excellent.  Only complaint is that it is VERY loud inside the restaurant.

***Update*** wow. this was my 3rd time here and the service was horrendous. this place lacks professionalism. hey brio, you can't charge the prices you charge without the service to back it up. i HATE HATE HATE the inconsistency of service in this place.

 today i felt like i was being punk'd. is this real ife? where are the cameras?

lemme me help you all out: Tamara is their best server. ask to sit in her section...if she's not working...GO ELSEWHERE!

Phil was fantastic!  My wonderful friends Aluxa C. & Jeff C. sat ourselves at an outside high top.  Phil immediately came by w/ menus & took our drink order.  He had water & lavash brought out, which I skip the water every where.  I'm very picky on water fyi. 

The Mezza Brio pasta & Riccotta stuffed tortellini w/ Vodka sauce was absolutely what we needed.  It was creamy & cheesy.  Also we add lots of red pepper flakes for that kick!   Phil was knowledgeable on the menu since I was indecisive.  I always get the Salmon w/ sweet potatoes salad on the menu & wanted to try something new.  His recommendations were awesome new favorites.  The Benzinger Chardonnay on a hot day is so refreshing also.  

Overall, I've never had bad service or food at Brio.  In Iowa & now at the Galleria Mall there is a 'Bravo' restaurant.  They must be owned by the same company cause the menu & decor is almost exact.  Also the Town Square bartender's are always so friendly!  There are two sisters that work there that are the sweetest nicest bartender's & remember what wine you got last time.  Love it!

Very disappointed today when a party of 6 of us went to lunch at Brio and they would not seat us -- the reason given was that they could not accommodate 6 people.  Many times getting seated at Brio for lunch is frustratingly slow (even when no one else is waiting to be seated), but we've never been turned away altogether.  Seating seems to always be a problem here.  We had to go elsewhere for lunch.

More like a 2.5 rating, but I am giving it 3 stars because you cannot beat the happy hour prices. 

The atmosphere was lovely the food was eh mediocre. The service was not good at all. I was part of a fairly large group. We came in on a Thursday evening for the happy hour menu. The prices were obviously great but keep in mind it is a $3 happy hour menu so don't expect too much! The presentation of the food is awesome, but I cant say the same for the flavor. I ordered the Margareta flat bread, it came out little cold and tasted like tomatoes on matzah. Martinis were $5 which is a good price. I tried the Razzbertini and the Lemon basil. Razzbertini was OK nothing special, however, the lemon basil was delicious! very refreshing.

 I guess we were sitting by a "break" area for the employees. I'm not sure if it was a break area or a little corner they hide at outside and shoot the sh** with each other. Definitely should think about hiring a little bit more mature staff!

The service started off great when we arrived for the 330 late lunch early dinner, that went downhill quickly. Our server Eric C. was either a newbie or shouldn't have been working on a weekend. 
We were consistently asking for water when we asked for a lemon it took 20 minutes to get to our table. 
I found overcharges for a dessert on our final bill which I asked about it was promptly removed but after the entire experience it left me a little uneasy.
I always love it here. The food is not to pricey and good! The service is always pretty much on point. This is a restaurant you could celebrate or spend any occasion at!!

My girlfriend and I finally had the day off from our crazy busy schedules and decided to hit Brio for happy hour. Decided to go to Tivoli Brio because townsquare is always so busy. Came in at 4pm, sat at at bar table, not busy at all. Server, no name was said, zero personality, and walks away before I finish talking. Not sure if he was having a day or was offended we ordered happy hour. Even though we ordered all but one app on the menu and cocktails. Food was so so and service was a complete fail. The 3 stars is for the spin dip and sangria. And the servers name was Clifford. Only knew this because of looking on my check. I'll continue my business at townsquare Brio from now on.
Love the Happy Hour at Brio's. Great food, drinks and people to meet. The staff is very attentive and want to ensure you enjoy your time there.

Had scheduled a Meetup for Happy Hour with a big group of people. Happy hour is only available in their bar area (too small for big groups) & their patio. Well unfort. found out that day due to the Vegas winds they close their patio so I was stuck having a big group coming & expecting Happy Hour menu prices. Luckly I spoke with the manager, Craig who was so nice to accommodate for my group & I & set us up in their Chef's room with Craig as our waiter. They let us order off of the HH menu. Was so grateful that my plans were not ruined & I wouldn't be disappointing my Meetup groups!! Thank you so much Craig!!! Craig, our waiter was great too! They have great choices for drinks & food on their HH menu. Fried ravioli is so yummy! Along with their shrimp & eggplant dish. I was soooo full due to their reasonable servings! The Rosa Sangria is delicious & light! I have been here before & definitely  will go back & highly recommend  this place!!!  Town Square is such a great location too with lots of shopping to do afterwards & walk off the food!

This place was surprisingly delicious. I have to say there was hesitancy when we walked up to the front door and couldn't see anyone at all. However, after the hostess led us into the main dining area the place lit up. Delicious appetizers and a pretty amazing chefs special. Would def recommend this joint!!

I was disappointed. The service was bad.  I opened the wine for he waitress as this was her first time. The food was blah. The calamari was great. The sundae our son ordered was a mini scoop of ice cream with a little chocolate sauce.  Spent 150 for two adults and two kids.  Won't return.

Nice place. Comfortable seating.  Excellent atmosphere.  Food was 4 star (had the lasagna).  Downsides were it was a bit noisy and the waitress wasn't attentive and always in a rush.  She was on top of everything for sure, but very busy.

This place has something for everyone. Their bruschetta is to die for. try the sampler. You'll see what I mean. The shrimp bisque (I think) is good too. I don't remember what I had here but I just remember my meal being quite pleasant.

The food is good. The patio is lovely for lunch but as often as I have eaten here there is always a dirty plate or silverware.  Hmm,  it could be a possible reflection on the overall quality of the restaurant as it happens so often.

Met a girlfriend for dinner here last night and had a great meal! I had the risotto with shrimp and lobster tail. Delish! It also had asparagus, mushrooms and red peppers. Service was spot on. My friend had grilled chicken with charred cauliflower. Also great. We skipped dessert but they all looked yummy.

This is my favorite Tuscan Grille I have ever been to! Laurence was absolutely amazing as a bartender I could not say enough good things go about him! So amazing and kind knowledgeable and patient. Then for Steve the GM he was wonderful! Thank you so so much for everything to the both of you. This experience was amazing and more than anything I have ever experienced! Thank you brio team! Especially Laurence and Steve.

Went for lunch and was seated quickly. The waitress was in such a rush she spoke over you when you were trying to order. We ordered the chicken lemone with no capers and chicken Milanese. We also had the wedge salad which was split for us.
The salad was delicious. The entres came out and the lemone chicken had capers on it and we did not want to wait for a remake so we said we would eat it. I looked at my Milanese and found a 4 oz piece of breaded chicken on top of a half cup of pasta that was dry at the edges with a small amount of sauce. 
I questioned the size of the chicken and pasta and was told this was the serving. If I wanted the dinner portion I could pay up but it is mostly a pasta increase not more chicken. The Lemone chicken came with 2 pieces of chicken and my friend said the breading on the chicken tasted mostly of egg.
Ever since they changed the lunch menu it has been disappointing.
Not worth the price. Very noisy .

Disappointing Easter brunch. Went to what was supposed to be their special Easter brunch today. Was told there would be the Easter bunny, which there was, an egg hunt, and special coloring pages for kids. Well, only the bunny made it. And the food selections were too basic: scrambled eggs, French toast, biscuits, sausages, bacon, potatoes. Also muffins and  Danishes that were obviously not made there. That's it. They even had a nice pre printed menu for the day. It's a pretty restaurant with nice atmosphere, but a real let down for special brunch.

Hands-down, Brio is one of my favorite places in all of Scottsdale and across the country as a whole.  I know that, no matter what city I'm in while on travel, I'll get good food and good wine from Brio and the staff is pretty darn professional.  I love Brio happy hour, especially the ravioli and beef carapacio and the Brio burger is BY FAR one of the best for a chain restaurant. 

I first started going to Brio a number of years ago back east in the DC area, and I've been a fan ever since.
This place is good but I don't think I will be dying to go back.  Happy hour prices are great but other wise its pretty pricey for what you get.

Although the food was decent, the service here was horrific. My husband is allergic to onions and asked about a particular entre. He was assured that there were no onions in this meal. When the food finally arrived (after nearly and hour) it was full of onion. When we said something to the waiter, he proceeded to argue with us then laugh at my husband. Another waiter noticed the incident and promptly stepped in to try and make it right. We ended up paying for a meal that wasn't even touched and not once did my husband receive any sort of apology.

Brio is one of my favorite happy hour places. $5 martini nights on Thursdays is always a good choice, and the $3 appetizers are all very tasty as well. I like the beef carpaccio, ravioli (crispy with a yummy marinara sauce/ tomato relish), the sliders look good as well.  

The outdoor patio has a nice ambiance and a great spot for convos. There's section of sofa with a fireside as well but is normally taken up by a crowd.  A nice and relaxing restaurant to hang out (speaking of the bar and patio area).
Pretty good food.  Appetizer specials were absolutely great.  Interior decor was very nice.  Waiter service was excellent.

We called ahead and told them it's my friends Jackie birthday I requested a piece a cake to be sent to the table with  candles they didn't do anything the service here sucks and I would avoid this place

-Sunday Dinner -

The Good:
     The ambiance is very classy and comfortable. The food is presented nicely and is tasty. Options to eat inside or outside .  I enjoyed the teas, although my husband wasn't to crazy about them (to each is their own).

The Bad:
 This place is a bit more upscale then traditional restraunts. Prices for plates range in the 20+ neiboorhood.  It was also noisy.

The Ugly:    
      Slow service.  This place was busy , we did make reservations and we're seated promptly outside as requested. The location of the seating was close to the walkway along with many other tables. The servers rush powerfully through these isles making for a very uncomfortable hazardous experience to anyone seated along the walkway .    The service also wasn't great, after we were seated we weren't greeted for quite a while .   The wait in between was bad to, we waited almost 10 minutes to order desert, after ordering we waited another 15 minutes for a piece of cake. It was a bit irritating so we caught our server and said forget it , please just bring the check.  Then proceeded to once again wait a while for a check.  

Overall yes I will be back, we enjoyed the environment and the food.  We will just be more cautious of our server.

The food & atmosphere at Brio are great! Your experience will be lovely.... Unless  you sit at the patio side bar and Scott nonchalantly (after he's done chatting with other staff) comes to take your order. Sheesh, what an attitude! After a condescending explanation of no GF bread whatsoever & being called on that attitude, He intentionally ignored & spoke not one more word to us, it was almost comical but quite appalling & immature really. Dang, I wish Mystery Diners was filming him! The gal who manages that area made up for his arrogance & pettiness.  She rescued our experience there! The bruschetta Quatro is divine BTW.

The only reason I put 4 stars was because we sat in the happy our section outside and it took awhile for a waiter to come help us,but once Frank came all was well. He was a very nice waiter and our food and drinks came out fast. The service was great and the food was delicious. The happy hour menu is definitely worth while. We ordered the Brio burger which was perfectly cooked. We also ordered the eggplant fries, spinach artichoke dip,the sausage and pepperoni ricotta flatbread and the creme brûlée for dessert. Everything tasted wonderful. We would come back again for everything! I loved the food and the atmosphere.

I have a love and hate relationship with their happy hour....love the food hate the service during happy hr. We sat close to bar today and still no one saw us, went to the bar and was told the other bartender will take care of us, waited 10 mins before we were offered a drink....another 10 before another bartender decided to take our order. Asked for a bread basket 3 times still nothing, food got dropped off and that was the end of our service. Had to chase someone to get our check, I don't understand why the bartenders or servers can't just look over for a second and see that there are people waiting in the patio area......

No problems here, it might be a little louder than you would hope but no problems at all.  The service has always been excellent as well, something much more high end restaurants in the area seem to be lacking.
Good Italian food for a chain.  The vodka sauce entree comes with frsh pasta and it is delicious.  Service is pretty consistent.  Sangria is really good.

Wow, amazing food and great service. I've been in AZ for 10 years now and I can finally say I found a great Italian food. Had the lobster n shrimp Fettuccine and my wife had the Pasta debiolio and she couldn't stop eating mine and hers.
My favorite Italian restaurant! They have the best pasta, drinks and awesome desserts!!!

Brio is an good Italian restaurant that always seems to miss the mark to being a great Italian restaurant. The prices are great Italian restaurant prices, but the food and presentation, just miss the mark of being great. I say this because I like Brio, but I think it could be better.

We had been to Brio twice before in different states, so we knew what to expect. The decor is pretty much the same as other Brios -- kind of a Cheescake Factory, glitzy Italian Tuscany. The wait staff is friendly, helpful and professional and dressed in professional-looking uniforms. 

We were there because of a birthday coupon Brio had emailed me. (NOTE: Sign-up for Brio emails on their web site!  Before your birthday they will send you a coupon, not for a discounted meal or even a buy-one, get-one free meal...but a complete a la carte entrée for FREE with no purchase requirements!) 

The coupon we had was for the "Beef Medallions with Shrimp Scampi". (One of their mid-priced entrées.) We ordered the "Brio Chopped Salad" with our meal.

The waitress brought us warm bread and seasoned, thin, crispy flatbread triangles. (The bread was fresh, but the flatbread was not. Instead of being very crispy the flatbread was a little soft. Our second batch of flatbread was very crispy, though.) We asked for olive oil and balsamic vinegar for our bread and salad, but only olive oil and red wine vinegar were available in paired shaker bottles, so our waitress had to go to the kitchen and have them pour some balsamic in a small serving cup for us.

The salad was OK. The chopped greens were all romaine lettuce. (Thankfully no iceberg lettuce to be found!) The salad also had sliced red onion, cucumber, little bits of Feta cheese, a couple cherry tomatoes, and a couple olives.

The entrée included three tender beef medallions, cooked to our order, which were very good. The orzo with veggies was a good addition to the meal. The shrimp were a surprise because they were so tiny...Just little cocktail shrimp. I don't know about you, but  EVERYPLACE I have had Shrimp Scampi the shrimp have not been shrimpy...They had always been JUMBO SHRIMP! Even though the shrimp were tasty the whole presentation would have been more impressive had jumbo shrimp been used in the entrée, even if it meant using fewer shrimp!

After the meal the waitress brought me a little birthday dessert topped with a candle. The dessert was a shot glass filled with a chocolate mousse and a rich chocolate cake. I was surprised that instead of being topped with whipped cream, it was topped with what seemed to be Dream Whip! A disappointment to an otherwise very nice dessert.

I don't think I would order the "Beef Medallions with Shrimp Scampi", again, but there are plenty of other things I would like to try in the future. 

Brio is not my favorite Italian restaurant, but I have enjoyed it the times I have eaten there.

I was hesitant trying Brio, as it looked like a generic upgrade to the Olive Garden. And there definitely are points that embrace the chain restaurant blandness (atmosphere), but thankfully, the food is done well. I had the portobello ravioli and my date had the frutti di mare (it was a special). The ravioli was excellent. While the frutti was not as good as Mezzo's take on the dish, it still held up and was satisfying. Our service was adequate and friendly. Overall, most people will be pleased with the restaurant's large menu, quality, and moderate pricing. If you find yourself in Town Square with a group of people, odds are everyone will find something they like here.

Very tasty place! To start, mom had the Sangria rosa and it was light and delish! We simply shared some appetizers for lunch. We chose the lobster bisque, the bruschetta Quattro, and the calamari fritto misto. 

The lobster bisque was wonderful and had diced shrimp on top, great flavor, took the sourdough bread and wiped the bowl clean! The bruschetta Quattro had 3 yummy flavored bruschettas and the seasonal choice, ours was an antipasto bruschetta. Wonderful crunchy bread and flavor! The calamari as always is delicious. It had great flavor with an aioli and typical marinara, but also fried peperoncini!!! Really tasty! Only critique is that the calamari' sauces are not served on the side but on the same plate so they ended up swimming in the sauce on the bottom on the plate...oh well 

Still good and we highly recommend it!!! Brio will definitely have us back for more!
Better than OG but not authentic.  Restaurant is very nice and plenty of outdoor seating.  Service was lacking.  I will try somewhere else next time.
Amazing food and more amazing service. Strongly suggest being served by Frank! The absolute best waiter on the planet! He totally made our night!

After absolutely miserable experience at AMC, my friend and I were in a rather foul mood. 

I wasn't expecting much from this restaurant but was pleasantly surprised. Salmon salads were fantastic. Tomato bisque was tasty. Establishment was clean, well managed, and service was excellent. Coming here salvaged the night for us. :)

The Bread and ice tea are very good but the other meals were terrible. Chicken Lemon was not good at all the server got our order wrong. There were 9 of us so that could have been why. Not sure I am going to us the free appetizer card.

This was my first visit to Brio, it was mid day Saturday in Crocker Park a nice shopping area west of Cleveland it was cold, windy and a few flurries in the air, the crowds were large its the holiday season and the procrastinators are everywhere. I ducked in to get warm have a bowl of something to recharge the batteries it didn't appear busy but there was real confusion at the hostess station laminated table maps covered in dry erase ink we must go and verify each table to see if there are customers seated or if they need to be bused or just vacant never mind the hungry crowd we must verify even before we write the names of the new customers down in the order they walked in, we can always ask who's next yes that's it we will use the honor system.

The crowd was building like it was midnight at Walmart on Black Friday now the staff huddles up to decide who gets a seat it's a lottery I don't feel I have a winning ticket but I'm close enough to get picked like an unpopular kid in a dodge ball game. The part time hostess looks at me, it seems she remembers I was here before this debacle began she grabs the menus and heads my way yes it's me I get a table no wait she decides to double check the vacancy the process comes to a stop I see a server waving they found a table bingo. We arrive it's clean and the silverware is inbound another pours the water and yet another sets down a bowl of bread and I think gourmet crackers things are looking up.

Let's make it easy and fast or fast and easy this is a quick lunch between shopping yes we all will have the soup and salad I want the Italian wedding soup the others lobster bisque. My choice was wonderful I would of liked it a little warmer but the taste was spot on, the tiny meatballs were tasty and plentiful. The lobster bisque was a little heavy on the sherry but also heavy on the lobster chunks no complaints from this group. 

It's Salad time two order the wedge two order steak salads both were very forgettable unfortunately. Wedge was not chilled and the dressing was sparse, light on the bacon and a few cherry tomatoes would not do it again, the steak salads were about the same it seems but they have chucks of tough steak piled on top.

Okay 3 stars for the food to be fair it wasn't a full meal it was a big shopping day and the place was busy yes I am making excuses for them because I want to try Brio again whether it's here or anywhere else.

I went for happy hour. I had the shrimp eggplant dish, brio burger, and the potato skins. I liked the items in that order. The shrimp eggplant is  ridiculously tasty. Brio burger is better than average. The potato skins are forgettable. Service was good and the sangria is tasty.

Came to town square to shop and was hungry for a great big salad so figured I'd just eat here somewhere. I asked for a booth and was seated right away with my friend. The waitress was super friendly and really patient with me as I couldn't figure out what salad to order. I ended up just getting a side of cauliflower because after looking at the menu and their Instagram and realized none of these salads were going to fufill my expectations. My friend got flatbread. The cauliflower looks attractive and has all these toppings on it but it's really so bland and not cooked well (omg have you had cauliflower at Carson kitchen? Bomb!) his flatbread was nothing to write home about either. anyway yeah this is just a middle of the road mall restaurant. No reason to return. Like, ever.

We had a great dinner on a Friday night. We ordered the calamari, which was delicious. The lobster ravioli with shrimp was also excellent. However, for the price, it would have been nice to get a soup or salad with the order. 
The service was a little slow. And the hostess center seemed to be managed by teenagers. Twice I saw the young men seating people just grab silverware and menus and walk off, leaving the customer standing there. I would have been helpful if something was said to the customer like, "Follow me to your table" or "I'll show you to your table."
Love this place. Great happy hour with good food and tasty drinks. Never had a hard time finding a place to sit. Friendly service.

I have been to Brio multiple times and we always leave satisfied. They have cheap lunch specials which are always tasty. Last time I ordered a chop salad and a flatbread for like $7 and I had left-overs!

For dinner they have great pastas and meat dishes. I also love their panini's and salad combo. They also have weekday specials with $5 martini's on wednesdays!

Our waiter was friendly, and recommended a few dishes for us to try. The food was good, but the restaurant was so dark we cld barely see what we were ordering nor what we were eating! One of my fav parts of dining there was the complementary bread basket ~it was good-hot fresh bread and crisps.

My most recent visit was not my first visit. Actually, it is among quite the few. Brio has been a pretty good go-to restaurant for a nice sit down dinner with a variety of meat or pasta choices. 

I was introduced to Brio about 5 years ago. And it has yet to completely fail me. Even with a recent experience of not mine, but two of my friend's Rack of Lamb order, they had messed up the temperature on the meat twice. One returned to the waiter, second time, even the manager and chef had come out. GREAT service and customer satisfaction. 

My most recent visit was for a friend's graduation party. She had made reservations a day prior. Upon arrival, took maybe 10 minutes from arrival to having table ready. Not bad? Had came here for my b-day as well last august, and it took about the same amount of time for getting table ready. 

We were seated in the back room (first time sitting in that room) in a 7 person round table. 

At first, service was pretty good. Quick for drink orders and first round of bread came pretty fast. But went downhill from there. I had asked the waitress for more bread. My friend had asked another person for more bread. Because we had 7 people, the first round's two bread baskets disappeared fairly quick. Let's say, all our entrees came out, and was more than 1/2 way through it before one new basket of bread came out. Could easily say it was at least 30 minutes. This was just bread. If the bread is being baked or not ready, at least tell us ! The bread was good too ! first round of bread, nice and hot. i wanted more ! *sad face* 

I had ordered the Bistecca Alla Fiorentina (14 oz. Strip Steak served with mashed potatoes and roasted vegetables) - $28.45 - Seasoned well. Meat temperature was perfectly medium rare, like i had ordered. Mashed potatoes were creamy and rich. Roasted vegetables were... well... roasted vegetables. Lol. The one thing i dont understand about restaurants is why do they insist on using serrated steak knives? Not only do they rip through the meat, requires extra force to hold down the meat so it wont move while the serrated edge rips through..... Im not sure if its a safety thing or what... id much prefer a sharp non-serrated knife that allows me to cut through cleanly. Even if the meat quality is low and not cut through like butter, it still wont rip through... just make me make a few more passes before it cuts through.. personal little irk that bothers me i guess. 

One of my friends had ordered the Brio Sliced Steak Salad (Mixed greens, tomatoes, Gorgonzola, mushrooms, candied pecans and creamy horseradish dressing, topped with grilled tenderloin and a balsamic glaze) - $15.95 - chopped greens topped with a tenderloin. Salad itself looked good and wonderfully dressed. The amount of meat she got was very little. I dont know if it really is a tenderloin but dang... i'd estimate the amount of meat that was there to be maybe 3 - 4 oz. For such a big salad, it was quite... tiny 

In previous visits, i have tried the Gorgonzola Crusted Bistecca as well as the Roasted Lamb Chops. 

Gorgonzola Crusted Bistecca - (Perfectly seasoned topped with Gorgonzola. Served with mashed potatoes and roasted vegetables.) 8oz filet $29.95, 14oz strip $28.95 - essentially the same as the above listed Bistecca Alla Fiorentina but topped with a gorgonzola crust. Adds a nice flavor but the seasoning on the crust plus possible seasoning on the steak may double up and be a bit salty. 

Roasted Lamb Chops (Full rack, perfectly seasoned New Zealand lamb chops, with red wine veal sauce, mashed potatoes and grilled asparagus) - $29.45 - when done right, perfectly cooked and seasoned. tender and juicy. you get i believe 5-6 lamb chops. decent size. great for lamb lovers who may not want a steak. good alternative. 

Overall, despite the occassional lack of service, its still a favorite place to go among myself and some friends.

So we gave it another Shot

Ordered the Lunch Risotto. ( grrrrroooooosss) came with Bacon it was oily for 14$ i expect better Food
Compared to olives Garden & Carrabas this Place doesnt offer Good Food any more. 
Sems like they Changed the HH menu again. 
My fav pizettas are gone.  
I ordered the margherita flatbread which was so dry & Hard that you cant Cut it with the knive or Even Hold it to eat. Nearly impossible to eat. Dry dry dry & on the tomatoes oily   Who puts oil on a flatbread????

The Dessert : choc Lava cake was ok. Not very Good. Would Prefer a or One with ICE cream but was by far the best Part of our Lunch. 
Cheescake was very Good. Tiramisu too

Drinks. Ok but overpriced. 

Waiter & Bus Boys are very attentive & nice.  
Host too. 

So i will Not go back. We Tried it now so Many Times & for the Same price we had a 60$ Check for 2  i can eat anywhere Else.

Spent some time at Brio last evening with my wife at the bar. Waited ten minutes before being greeted and the service continued to disappoint. Seems the groups with younger ladies received the exceptional service. The wait staff at Brio should all be trained again on what it means to be in the service industry. Will never return to this location. The two stars was for the mediocre food we ordered the service deserved a negative ranking.

Dropped in for a snack at the bar and staff was very attentive and engaging.  I've got a goofy food allergy/sensitivity and the chef was prompted to come out and work with me on items he'd prepare to avoid said allergy.
Awesome.

We were here on a crowded night.. So hopefully it will go better for you.  The décor is very nice. The place looks clean.  However, our waitress was slow and kept screwing up our orders for a table of 12.  The lady next to me had to remind the waitress that she ordered a drink.  Another ordered Chianti but got a Cab.  I just waited.

It didn't go any better for the food.  I ordered the spare ribs which came out luke warm but were otherwise OK.  The lady next to me ordered a pizza that looked like it spent too much time under the hot light.  Two others didn't get their food until everyone else was 2/3rds done.  I didn't hear anyone rave about their dish.

Now the checks.... The waitress told me that she would take off an item that was never ordered.  When she returned, it was still on the check. Another person had a problem with their check.

I do not enjoy providing poor reviews... But this place needs to step up their game significantly for me to want to return...

 With one exception..

I have enjoyed their happy hour at the bar in the past.  I have always enjoyed their sausage flat bread pizza that is offered at a discount.
One of my favorite places great ambiance and always good food.

This is one of my favorite places for casual sunday lunch dining. It is also a great place for dinner before or after a movie at Town Square. The main dining room has high ceilings with white fabric billowing across, while the private dining area is separated in a replica/ re-construct of the colloseum. 

My boyfriend and I ALWAYS order the  "quattro" bruschetta, which  allows the sampling of several varieties, including roasted red pepper and mozzarella and sliced steak with gorgonzola, arugula, fennel, tomato and Italian dressing. There is always one item of the quattro that change. 

A main salad that is a particular favorite of mine is the steak salad. The steak slices are prepared the same as the one used for the bruchetta. The dressing is incredible as well. I have also tried a chef special, which was a scallops with pasta. This may sound very generic, but the scallops were done so well that I now ask if they ever have it available. They do, however, have a great substitute, whichis the scallop and shrimp risotto. This platter is amazing. If you are drinking their chiantis or cabernet sav. it will help bring out the spice of the meal. 

I am a huge fan of desserts, and for me, Brio does not disappoint. One of my favorites is the panna cotta, which is served in small espresso cups filled with the panna cotta, and a small amount of shortcake at the bottom, drizzled with strawberry syrup.  I have also tried the tiramisu, which is great as well. And yes, I have had two servings of dessert during one meal  

The wine list is decently priced with a number of fine choices by the glass.

Again, one of my favorite places to go on a regular basis, but can be pricey to go that often.

Popped in here today for lunch with some coworkers- it's a lot closer to work than I thought! They were in an italian mood, but I was limiting carbs due to the night's Yelp Pizza Party, so I did not partake of any pasta during my visit. 

Service was fairly good- our server was very friendly and made a bunch of helpful chit-chat with us, mostly bonding with my dining companions over their love of carbonara, and discussing the best places in LV to get it. I appreciated his honesty in that he did not try to BS us about how the dish here is the best there is or anything, but he did say it was good- he personally does not like the use of spinach in the dish, preferring beans, but it's not offered that way here.

As it is, I debated between a few dishes- the shrimp mediterranean in particular, caught my eye. But I ultimately opted for the soup and salad combo, with the wedge and the lobster bisque- the salad arrived already doused in a sea of dressing, which surely took it far beyond the listed calorie counts. The bisque was an odd dish- the first bite wasn't that great to me, and I considered asking to switch it out for the tomato, but as I ate more of the dish it grew on me. Guess I'm just not a lobster bisque person? Duly noted.

My coworkers both opted for the carbonara- and both were underwhelmed with it. The dishes were huge, and they easily could have shared a single order instead of getting separate dishes, but one dish had overcooked pasta that was borderline mushy while the other was a good al dente. Both ladies were underwhelmed by their selection and had buyer's remorse, of a sort- commenting that they wished they'd gone with their original choices, but felt like the dish would be better here given the conversation with our server. Womp womp.

Seems like this place is best for a happy hour visit- I may need to take advantage of that, but I don't think I'm likely to return for lunch.

Great birthday dinner at the Scottsdale Quarter Brio.  Enjoyed their bruschetta trio appetizer.  Half priced bottles of wine included some great Napa vineyards.  Dinner choices were all very good.  They accommodated our large party with very good service and honored our request for seating by an outlet for a guest with oxygen!
I love  this place and so does my family. Never had a bad meal and the service is always great. Don't forget to checkout happy hour.

Brio's has always been a 5 star experience before.  Quality has declined.  One of the silverware napkins was dirty.  The appetizer plates were dirty.  One of the water glasses had a black spot on the inside that came off after scraping it.  Asked for another water and the new water also had a black spot on the inside that came off when scraped.  The pasta was cold on top like it had sat too long to be brought out, and the spinach was undercooked.  Wish Brio was the way it used to be.

Ate at the bar due to wait for table "turnover". After a small delay service was prompt and friendly. Correctly sized lunch portions were well prepared and presented. Would recommend the salmon with angel hair pasta.
Allie, our server, was fantastic! Very attentive to our needs and helpful in making decisions on what to order! Highly recommend her!

Absolutely love brio can never go wrong whether it's lunch or dinner here one of my favorite places... And the staff is always friendly and willing to make your order special for you on request I added chicken to a wedge salad it was delicious... Yum

First time going to Brio and it was the most delicious thing ever!
My friend told me to get the Peach ballini, i have been craving it ever since. We ordered calamari, caprese salad, lobster soup i think it was, and salmon with spaghetti and i think a scampi sauce. everything was soo tasty. I cant wait to go back again. The salmon plate was a little too lemony but it was still good. Our server was very nice as well.

Worst service ever!
We went on Mother's Day just me my husband and son, hostess was rude and said they were booked for the night but we could sit in the bar. I had to ask twice about the booths before she stopped texting to answer me. 
We sat in the bar forever before we were greeted. We sometimes saw our waiter even when we stood up to flag him down he avoided us but was in the back where we could still see him talking, dancing and standing around. Even when we tried to flag down the manager he walked right by us twice. My husband's salad never came but we were still charged for it, our pasta was cold and just beyond disappointed in the place we picked for my first Mother's Day. Will never go back or recommend to another person.

Very rude uncalled for service the food was excellent though and that's why i gave two stars. The waitress (lady) outback serving the tables on Memorial day by the bar outside really needs to check her attitude. In the future I will give this place a second try.

First, the seating in the restaurant is beautiful! Sets an incredible atmosphere. There are misters putside in case it's too hot as well. 

The service was slow during dinner rush but once our orders were put in, things came out quickly. 

The bread is served warm and it goes perfect with the tomato bisque soup! The food was great as well. We had an issue with one of the plates we got and he offered to change things around but not wanting to be "those customers" we just let it slide. In hindsight, it's location is great and the prices were well worth what they were offering for food and atmosphere.

Let me start by saying I won I gift card here a few months ago at an event in San Tan mall. I was so hesitant to try this place, because the name just sounded too ritzy for my taste. 

Moving on to my experience at Brio. Walking in the door we were greeted by a very nice hostess. Our waitress Bernice was great! Very nice, helpful and attentive (without being annoying). She was very well informed on the menu items, and even split our entrée onto two plates so me and my husband could share without us having to ask. The waiters and waitresses were all very nice and helped each other throughout our meal. The atmosphere was very warm and inviting. 

The food was impeccable. We had the lobster bisque and it was the perfect blend of flavor and texture. Our main course was the Chicken Milanese, it was amazing. It is similar to what most people call chicken Parmesan only a lot better. Every bite was tender and juicy chicken. 

For dessert we tried the carrot cake and the mascarpone cheesecake. Let me just say it was heaven in my mouth. After eating from that other "cake factory" last night. The mascarpone cheesecake here was better than theirs. This place is a great place for a date or a quick cappuccino and desert. I highly recommend it to everyone to try it at least once.

I enjoy my night every time I come to Brio for dinner. Each time I come I like to envision myself in Tuscany... I know it's nothing close to being there, but a girl can dream ;)

I always get the bruschetta sampler which includes nine pieces of bruschetta. Three of their original, three roasted red pepper, and three of their sliced steak bruschetta... my personal favorite. My favorite pasta dish I have gotten is their Campanelle Carbonara. Their creamy alfredo sauce mixed with the chicken, spinach and bacon is the reason I continue going back. Campanelle pasta is a unique kind of pasta and adds to the dish. 

This past time I came here for dinner they have Risotto on the menu for a limited time and of course I had to try! I got the Sweet Potato and Chicken Risotto and it does not disappoint! I recommend trying out this restaurant soon so you can have a taste at their Risotto!

Came here once never again. I ordered and my food came straight out. It must have been another persons order who had cancelled. The food was warm at best. The staff were very friendly was the only positive.

Came for Mother's Day Brunch, party of 8.  We were prepared and had made reservations a week ahead of time.  We were surprisingly seated right away.  Was greeted by our waiter FRANK L.  He was on it all service long with us.  We ordered calamari and lobster bisque to start along with their bread.  Both dishes came out quickly and tasted good.

Frank made ordering fun and easy.  Called all the ladies dolls and sweetie.  He was just on his game.  I thought this was just a show because its MOTHERS DAY.  But we all were very impressed.  He was a veteran and served our country and mentioned that doing this was something he loved better and I can see it with every table he served.  He sincerely loves his job.  Every dish we ordered was delicious and no complaints from Grandma, who is always the hardest critic.  Shrimp and grits was a hit!!! Seafood pasta was tasty.

Being a busy day, Frank checked in on us frequently refilling our drinks, and was on top of it during our service.  We found out through conversation he had a 1 month old daughter at home and then we knew why he was soo good to our son and always had a compliment for him.  He even brought out some mash potatoes for him without us asking.  

The food was great today but the service was even better.  Thank you FRANK L for making our MOTHER'S DAY even more special for us.  If you decide to eat here, ask to be seated in FRANK L's section.  You will enjoy your experience so much more.

Service was slow.  Food was mediocre. Ambiance was like Cheesecake Factory

I would pass

We went there two weeks ago for my husband's birthday dinner and he ordered the pork chops. They are so tender and full of flavor! That was the best part of the meal. We had he lobster bisque and I didn't like as much as I did before.

My kids ordered the kids meal cheeseburgers and they were HUGE! They loved it and didn't finish all of it. The kids alfredo pasta was my son's favorite also, he ate most of his dish. I had the pasta pesto and didn't like it at all. The sauce was so runny and hardly had any pesto on it. I tasted mostly tomatoes. The chicken was the only thing that was edible on the dish. I wouldn't get it again and we'll probably be back for more of the pork chops!

If you drop by Town Square, Brio is a great place to eat anytime of the day.  The decor of the restaurant is open, energetic and elegant at the same time.  They have a nice private area for large party as well.  The food is delectable, as for the price it is reasonable for its proportion.  

Happy hours are a great time to check out htis place for the first time and it's a great restaurant to introduce out of towners.
Food was cold today and pizza should be hot.  Service was so slow,  by the time it was fixed I wasn't hungry.  Sad cause food and service usually pretty good.

I love this place. I used to come here a lot and my hang out place after work. I love their Salmon salad. The place is beautiful with high ceiling and it is located in one of the best shopping places in vegas. They have happy hour too and the bartenders are very nice. They have a patio with fireplace outside and during cooler weather it is very relaxing to jus sit there and have a glass of wine. The food is delicious. It's a great place to entertain guests or meet up with friends. They also have a location in Summerlin but I love the architecture and design of this restaurant. I recommend all the pasta and salad. They have a variety of selections of desserts as well. I love the salmon salad or the salmon dinner. It gets very busy in this place everyday, if you're a walk in is not a good idea unless you are just going to drink and sit by the bar. I recommend to make a reservation although when you have a reservation you will have to wait a minimum of 20 minutes till you get seated and maximum of 30min as it seems like they overbook.

This review is for their happy hour. Went with some girlfriends after looking at Brio's impressive happy hour menu online. 

It didn't go right from the host stand. The guy there looked at us like we were an inconvenience, no smile, no greeting. We told him we were there for the happy hour. He told us to find a place at the bar, it was open seating. 

We found a spot, really uncomfortable high tops. They have a few booths which were taken. My friend ordered their tropical Cosmo which tasted like syrup, had barely any alcohol. I ordered Pinot Grigio which was good. They have $5 wine specials on Thursday.

We tried the margarita dip, margarita flat bread and crispy shrimp brio. Our server messed up the order and got us potatoes instead of shrimp. I would give 5 star to the margarita dip, was probably the only thing I would remember from this visit that was good. Service was terrible, I would give zero, no one seemed to care about customers, our server was terrible, he never refilled any drinks or checked on us. We had to hunt him down for everything. 

Definitely not worth coming back!

Whenever I want consistently good food and friendly service I go to Brio... It never disappoints. 

The location in Tivoli village is pretty busy on weekends and Friday night so be sure to call ahead to make reservations. :) 

Food Recommendations: 
I highly recommend the calamari! It's very good and comes with 2 types of sauce. 
The Caesar salad is also great! 
For main courses I suggest the steak salad or the Gorgonzola steak medallions. I've tried other things on the menu and always come back to those two! 
The lava cake is also pretty good! 

The service is consistently good as well! We had a waiter (Alberto I think was his name) that was super attentive and made the experience fun! 

If you have never tried Brio I recommend it!

Always a pleasurable experience here at this Italian eatery. The Lobster Bisque is my husbands favorite. I enjoy the Chicken & sweet potato Risotto. Their salads are also very good- especially their Wedge. Try the Bread Pudding- delicious!! Great service every time we visit!

Fantastic setting, away from the strip, for a more quiet non-touristic experience.  Have eaten my way around the menu and love the Lobster Bisque, the brick chicken, and some of the best flat breads outside of NYC.  5 stars, for food, wine, service, and décor.

I went for my birthday lunch today. They were pretty busy for lunch. We got seated within 10 minutes, by the friendly hostess, at a lovely corner table near the kitchen. Our server, Tom, was on his A game. He greeted us and immediately got the drink order. What I appreciate is communication, and he let us know that he'd be right back. While taking our order, I let him know that I had a birthday voucher for Shrimp Scampi and beef medallions and my friend got the Chipotle Chicken & Bacon Panini with to Ceasar salads, in addition. The best was when Tom asked me how I wanted the medallions cooked. I asked Tom what the meat was and he said 'cow'. AWSOME! I laughed. The salads came right away and were delicious. Plenty of dressing and parm (the way I like it), with sweet Romain lettuce. Shortly after, came the fresh flat bread and bread basket with butter that tasted like it was homemade. This Brio seems more open and brighter than it's big sister. The food came the second my salad dish was removed and it looked beautiful. It tasted even better. It was an amazing birthday lunch and I am happy with our service from Tom. Thank you, Brio Tivoli!
great food every time. although a little on the expensive side, the delicous food  makes up for it.

All around great experience.  This place is one of my favorites- great food, atmosphere, and service. 
   We were a party of 5 and had to wait for all to show.  The staff and service were fantastic, being patient and attentive as we waited for everyone to arrive, as well as helping them find us.  Lunchtime was busy although we never felt crowded or rushed.  The food was great and dessert was amazing (I think it was the Dolchino Trio).
     Our Server Victoria was especially good and she really made the whole experience for us.  She was engaging and pleasant, knowledgeable, and helpful, great personality, and she even took pictures for us. 
   We'll definitely be back soon!

Food was great. The ravioli in vodka sauce was excellent. Tiramisu was really good too. Place was packed on a Wednesday night. My boy Donovan said it was Cougar city for anyone who cares. He also said happy hours are great. They also have drink specials like $5 Martinique on Wednesday

Had dinner at Brio on Friday. Not sure if we would be accommodated due to it being a busy day. Even though there was  a lot of people we were seated in a timely manner. Davis was our server and he made sure he answered all of our questions. He guided us on what we should try as our first visit. He kept coming by and making sure our drinks were topped off. He apologized for the food taking long to come out - however it was out promptly. We felt welcome and will definitely be going back soon.

This is one of those restaurants that you shouldn't really decide on based off of reviews that you've read. You really have to visit the place and see for yourself if you like the food. For me, the pasta dishes taste different than what are considered "normal" Italian pasta dishes. The chefs add something to them (I think) that make the pasta taste... I don't know. Just "different". It's just not to my liking. Still, the quality of the food is great (you can tell). The ambiance of the restaurant is beautiful, and service is always excellent. Also, it's clean.
Lamb chops, lamb chops,  Lamb chops!   Great service,  nice patio, and nice environment.   I will return.

Amazing food and attentive service. The inside was nice and my food was amazing. I even scraped all the sauce off the plate. It was moderately priced and I know I'm paying for top notch food and service. Thy also have a rewards program with deals and specials often.
