Spicy shrimp and eggplant         Wonderful 
Service fantastic
Service was atrocious when we visited. Shame too. Because we generally loved Brio when we lived in Denver. Perhaps the customer service standards are different in CO from AZ.

Great place, good atmosphere.  Our server had perfect timing and didn't push us to leave after we finished.  I had the eggs Benedict (they call it something slightly different).  The flavor was delicious-best eggs benny I have had!  The potatoes were seasoned very well-again best I think I have had as a standard potato side and the asparagus was thin but tender.  We then had the chocolate dessert and oh my!  The creamy center, not too rich, not too sugary.  Can't say it was like lava cake, center was thicker but I liked it better! I would certainly come again!

I did not pick up the check but my eggs benny was a good portion for me (granted I am small BUT I can eat) and it was $10.95.

Arrived Thursday Dec, 22, 2011 without reservations at 6:45pm, which may be a bit early for this place. The bar was packed, the dining room had lots of empty but reserved tables.

We got decent service, about 10 minutes till our salads arrived and 32 minutes until our meals arrived. 

Easy parking in the garage across the street.

I would go back anytime, it was a good meal and good service.

I love going to Town Square. The service is phenomenal and the staff is so friendly at Brio. The atmosphere is nice but the prices are a little expensive. I had the chicken parm and it was not very good. The sauce with angel hair pasta was fantastic. I would recommend this place but don't get the chicken parm. With the bread they give frozen butter. Doesn't spread on the bread at all. They should serve olive oil with the bread.

In the past I came to dinner. This time I came here for lunch at 1130 AM. The first time I've ever seen the place totally empty. I needed to get out relatively fast. My server I should make that with the place is this empty, there would be no problem getting the food in a hurry. She did not lie. . I ordered the barbecue chicken pizza from the appetizer menu . In other restaurants when I order pizza there is at least a 15 to 20 minute wait before this pizza is ready. The pizza was on my table within 10 minutes. And it was delicious. The crust was sweet and soft ( a little chewy, just the way I like it). The pizza itself was not overwhelmed with the barbecue chicken sauce flavor. There was an abundance fresh greens that decorated the top of the pizza. A lunch for one for under $10 before the tip. Such a good deal!
Great restaurant! Amazing food!! The shrimp with eggplant is exswiset!!!! Amazing atmosphere! Highly recommended!

HAPPY HOUR TUSCAN TASTER MENU $2.95?!?!!? My fave eat in Vegas by far!!!!! Brio Tuscan Grille is at the heart of Town Square, and since it's a ways off The Strip, it's not bustling with tourists. Sitting outside at the bar on a warm Spring afternoon...=) SO PEACEFUL! 

BEEF CARPACCIO - This one is my favorite! The meat is sliced super super thin and goes so well with the mustard aioli and field greens. 

SLICED STEAK BRUSCHETTA - This one is a close runner up. Some bites you may find the gorgonzola to be overpowering. I think the steak and bruschetta could've done without the cheese. Nevertheless, YUM! 

BRIO BURGER - Okay, but kind of dry and plain. Not a fan of the chips it comes with either. Sliced into fours for sharing!

RAVIOLI CAPRESE - Three giant raviolis. Super cheesy and tastes like it was fried. So unless you douse each bite with tomato sauce, it gets dry.

SHRIMPTINI - I was pleasantly surprised with this! The're very generous with the shrimp! Super cute presentation and uber refreshing.

I looked over at the party of 2 sitting right next to us...turns out they ordered the exact same 5 dishes. Must be a good sign! Our waiter also recommended the SPICY SHRIMP AND EGGPLANT, but we didn't have enough stomach room. 

Where else can you stuff 2 people with such quality food for less than $20, tax and tip included?! I want to tell all my friends, but at the same time, I want to keep this place all to myself ;)

This is a place I visit frequently. The lack of check ins is a reflection of my phone dying or me leaving it in the car -_- i prefers the Tivoli Village location because its prettier and less crowded - oh! and less kids :D 

There is always plenty of parking in the garage either so you can avoid the hot hot sun or the cold of winter. When you walk into the restaurant, the hostess is always there with a smile and walking you to your table immediately. 

I really like the waiters here, because you can tell they're a team and they're always looking out for each other. Whenever it does get kind of busy, and our waiter is running around, another waiter from another section will come help us or tend to our needs. They always saying they're helping each other out, which is nice to see. At the other location in Town Square, other waiters are always ignoring us unless we're their table. 

The lobster bisque is really good and not too fishy tasting. I personally like penne pasta with vodka sauce. They don't have it on the menu though - they have another type of noodle with cheese in it with the vodka sauce. I always ask for the penne vodka though, and they are always more than willing to accomodate and ask the chef for me. I always add shrimp too! Makes me feel like someone important because theyre doing something off the menu for me haha 

My boyfriend has gotten a combination of some type of steak, lambchops, and several pastas, and they are always good!!

We always OD on bread so if youre hungry, you should ask for no bread...because once its on your table, its hard to ignore it!
Great value for the price, nice ambience clean place and service is excellent. The Mgr Ashley super nice very welcoming and accomodating.
Lasagna Bolognese was a good dish. Meaty. Shrimp and lobster fettucine was tasty as well. Nice restaurant inside, good ambiance. I will return.  The cheesecake mascarpone was excellent!

Terrible service. Just awful. Granted, it was his first day. But we asked for water and iced tea and waited over 25 minutes. Our kids got their food before their drinks. The server seemed baffled by our request, after he left us alone for 15 minutes without speaking to us - no drinks, no bread, didn't take our entree order - nothing. Then he did bring our iced tea - after we asked three times - with no lemon, no straws. Just clueless! I asked for a manager and requested a new server, who is doing better but we shouldn't have to get a manager's assistance to get drinks. The manager has been very gracious. As for the food? I have no idea because now it's been almost 40 minutes and I still haven't gotten my appetizer salad. Just ... So disappointed. Maybe starting someone new on the Saturday of a holiday weekend isn't the best idea. Just a thought.

Update: We never got our appetizer salads. Frankly, I don't think the server ever submitted our order. Then my brother's order of stuffed pasta with vodka sauce  came out cold. We had to ask three times for olive oil and balsamic vinegar. The food was good, especially the bread, but I couldn't get over the poor service, even after TWO managers got involved. Ultimately we were comped our meal, partly so I would "stop yelling." (My voice was raised but I didn't think I was yelling.) The sous chef was very nice. And we did leave a tip for the full cost of the meal. I won't be returning.

Brio Brio Brio.... I have gone here a ton of times.  So this is a general review of multiple experiences.

1. Good food, lets get things straight I keep going back because of the food location and people watching, the service is at best mediocre and at worst it just plain sucks.

Flatbread - quite good
Fish specials - Good (usually go for this at lunch)
Chicken under a brick - bad should be left under the brick and kicked to the curb
Pizza - good (if you like thin crust stuff, i prefer just going to the flatbreads though)
Lamb - I like pink lamb I have had to send back as ultra rare lamb is not to my taste, beef yes lamb ultra rare no
Deserts are good I link the sampler (see service below)

i like the ambiance of this place for sitting outside and people watching, there arent enough decent al fresco dining places in vegas (because it gets hot) however it is too big.  Been there a lot and have never been remembered because i rarely have seen the same server twice.

Wait staff seems to be overworked and under-crewed so I never take it out on my servers (tip wise), however I have had to complain about wait times and am usually rewarded with free desert to the table which i usually get the sampler which is quite tasty and varied the apple crumble is very good.

Price to food quality is a very good ratio. Overall it is a decent restaurant,  if you are tight on time, it would be  a no go.  However for extended lunches (booze helps deal with longer wait times) it is a go to place.  Just if the service is slow dont be scared to notify people you are waiting and furthermore dont hesitate to take it out on the manager and not the overworked servers who are really trying their best with what looks like understaffing decisions.

Overall a 3 star would be 4 if their service gets a revamp.

Took my girlfriend to this restaurant for her birthday and she was pleasantly surprised. The eggplant shrimp appetizer is fantastic. The service was exemplary. Not too crowded on a Sunday afternoon. The entrees were good and value seemed in line with food quality. Would recommend to others.

Italian food with a capital D for DELICIOUS! 
Our first time at Brio and our lunch at this establishment is a definite amazement. The food is very hearty and flavorful, not to mention the great customer service that Jen has provided us. She was very patient with us and she made us feel very at ease and welcomed. 
The two salads that we ordered, Kale Cesar Salad and Steak salad are both excellent! The chef pulled out all the stops with the salads alone. 
The Pasta Alfredo is one of the tastiest that I've had and I am an Alfredo pasta girl. I recommend this Alfredo to everyone! Go and enjoy it. 
The ambiance of Brio is very intimate and it's pretty casual. There was a lot of Christmas parties happening when we ate there today which made the place have a festive vibe. 
Two thumbs up to Brio and I recommend this place to everyone to try out.

So glad we picked Brio Tuscan Grille for our Valentines dinner.  Great Location at Scottsdale Quarter.  We had reservations so only waited 10 minutes.  Our server, Chelsea was great! Quick, attentive, but not annoying.  Very knowledgeable about the menu and had great suggestions.  Free appetizer with yelp. We had bruschetta and it was good.  I ordered off the light menu and had pasta pesto and I loved it.  It was light but very flavorful.  My date had the Lasagna and said it was one of the best he ever had.  Then we had to split the chocolate lava cake for desert.  SO Good!  First five star for me, even though it is a chain, they had it all on this night.. Good service, atmosphere, great server, food and price.

Yet another Italian restaurant in Ohio.  Don't get me wrong.  Italian food is ok.  It's just not the be all and end all food that most people in Ohio think it is.  This place is definitely not worth the hour-long wait on a Saturday evening.  And we arrived at 6 o'clock!  Chris the bartender was freaking hilarious though.  Kind of looks like Chris Elliott too.  You can tell this dude loves his job and messing with people.  If the place is too busy just sit at the bar.  You'll have a much better time.  They have $2.99 happy hour specials that might be worth checking out.  The tables are far too close together.  Some retarded baby almost hit me with their bottle.  Wasn't too impressed with my meal or salad but the sour dough bread rocked.  This place might be worth another look when it's not so freaking busy.

With the reviews I've read, I really wish we could have gotten to the food. 

As it is, while we were given water and (yes, tasty) bread initially after giving our orders, we sat at our table for two hours without being served our food. 

We even asked to speak with the manager, but apparently (after thirty minutes of waiting) he was far too busy to discuss matters with a disgruntled customer. 

Ultimately, two hours, one glass of water and two pieces of bread later, our party walked out.

This is based on wait time. Date night was ruined. We came in around 6pm, and shortly ordered. We were told that one of the items we had ordered would come out in like 45-50 minutes. We didn't expect all our meal to come in that same time frame. None of the staff seemed to notice. I literally had to grab a random staff member to ask for the check, and I could see her trying to figure out where the waitress was. Then she asked if we were in a hurry, and I was like we have been here almost 2 hours. Never going back. She said could you please wait while we get you a coupon for next time. Nope, we split, there won't be a next time. 

On a positive note the water there is really good. Definitely not from the tap. The food was good too, or maybe it was because I was forced to fast prior to getting it.

Pasta alla vodka,
and their spicy pannini a must.

Love the decor, can be loud.

My friend ordered a meal that we did not know had garlic in the sauce (she's allergic) and they took back and remade the plate without hesitation. Very friendly staff, comfortable environment, food was delicious, and I cannot wait to go back!

No need to fully gorge on their menu... the flatbreads are excellent enough if are in for a light lunch with a glass of wine. Conducive enough for a group of friends who are more attuned to catching up than gorging.... best thing is they don't rush you to eat your food.

So the management team from Bri Tuscan Grill contacted me after my review. The manager  listened to what I had to say and was truly concerned that it wasn't the best experience. Which I appreciated. They asked that I try the restaurant again and give them the opportunity to show me their great service and gave me a gift card. I appreciated the call and will definitely give the restaurant another chance.

Some people do not know what is good.  Brio is good.  Their food and service is beyond good.
There are so many things on the menu from appitizers to deserts that it would take me forever to write a review on the food.  All I can tell you is that you are in for a treat at Brio

my family and i went here to celebrate my brothers wedding. although we had a big party. first off they forgot our side of the tables drink orders. we didnt have enough waters on our table so we had to share. i waited 30 minutes for our side of the tables drink orders to be taken after telling a gentleman they forgot instead of taking our order he said ill send ur waiter. i asked for a refil 3 times twice to one lady and 1 to a gentleman no one came 1 1/2 hours go by and im still waiting my brother finally got pist and had to get up and get me a refil from the manager. then they wanted to come as ask if everything is ok at that point i had to keep my mouth shut because i was so irritated and disappointed in the customer service there. i would have probably got kicked out and i didn't want to ruine the reason why we were all celebrating. my tia never got the soup she ordered. when our food came it was cold like it was sitting there forever before they brought it out. the only person on point was the bread guy. he didn't fail us. other then that it was a horrible experience and we will never go back. the thing is there wasn't only one person working our table there was 3 and still all these mess ups i don't understand how that even happens.

The food here was good. I had the pork chops and vegetables. The chops were well done. My date had the lamb, which was excellent according to her. The noise level was a bit too much for an effective conversation. The restaurant is lovely but needs to be a more conversation-friendly.

Great food, wonderful atmosphere and fantastic service. The Chef's appetizer special - bruschetta with pinot noir caramelized onions - was incredible. And the key lime shooter desert just the right amount as well as final touch to a wonder meal. The outdoor seating with fire pit adds to the enjoyable experience. Pricing was as indicated - $$, a great value and well worth every penny. I definitely would come back and highly recommend.

The quality is good but the menu is tired and needs to be updated. I don't think I have a favorite item, I wish they had a traditional chicken parm but they don't. The thing I order the most is pasta ala vodka but there's a finite number of times a person can order the same thing before it's terrible.

Celebrating our 2 year anniversary at the Brio.  Love this place by far the service here is excellent.  Not to mention the food is amazing.  I highly recommend this restaurant food and drink are amazing.

We were in town square yesterday, and I and the family got hungry after a fun afternoon at the playground so we decided to have dinner at Brio. I have been wanting to try this place out, and considering it was our cheat day, I was really excited to have some good pasta. We ordered the caesar salad, lobster bisque, lasagna, the campanelle carbonara, and the tiramisu and some fresh fruit for dessert. The Caesar was okay, lobster bisque was mediocre at best (very generic tasting), my son liked the lasagna, but the carbonara was just waaaayyy too salty. I thought at first that the Parmesan made it salty, but even the pasta in the very bottom of the dish was salty. I literally couldn't eat more than a quarter of the dish because of it. The tiramisu was okay, at least it washed away the saltiness from the pasta dish. I was so bummed because I've been looking forward to coming here, and actually having some good pasta, and just regretted my decision of choosing brio over yard house or bone fish grill. I know this is only our first visit, but I am sort of hesitant to come back here again since they messed up something that was supposed to be a staple of theirs. On the bright side, our server was nice and on top of things so that adds another star to my review.

I wish I could have addressed this with the wait staff, but I will in a hurry. I ordered sweet potato risotto and a wedge salad. the risotto was over cooked and under seasoned. this was my first experience at Brio, so I'm willing to give them another chance, but something this simple shouldn't have been messed up.

First time visit we had a late night meal prior going to the movies. Welcomed with a smile and welcoming words by every employee we encountered.  Took our order promptly with out rushing us.  Prompt on the drinks and bread.  Very friendly and attentive waitress with out being over bearing/pushy. Loved her smile and attitude. Food was enjoyed and shared by all of us.  The pasta alla penne was very good. Definitely going back

The food was just ok. I had the chicken limone and the lobster bisque soup and two orders of the white peach sangria of which the second one tasted totally different than the first. I would have said something but the waitress was nowhere to be found. The entree portions are huge! I just wish the food tasted better. So if you're looking to stuff with your face with mediocre Italian food and wanted to be treated by a neglectful wait staff, you're definitely at the right place!

The fried calamari was as cold as the reception by our surly waitress, and the chopped Greek salad was as depressing as the actual Greek economy. If this place produced food as good as the decor I would return but it is not to be. 
The employee eating next to us received far better and friendly service, and given his ample girth, that is something he's taken advantage many times. This place only pretends to be a restaurant.

It was a good meal & a good atmosphere. I had the shrimp-lobster crepes & my wife had the chicken & avocado omelet.  The 2 crepes had two asparagus spears each, plenty of bay shrimp, some lobster, scrambled eggs inside & covered with hollandaise  sauce.  The potatoes were great & the fruit- pineapple & strawberrys tasted fresh.  The omelet also had the fruit dish.  The presentation of both dishes was great.  Preceeding the above was hot sourdough bread which was delicious.
The service was good.  Even though we arrived in the middle of the Sunday brunch hour we were seated immediately.  There was available seating inside and outside. The server was attentive without being intrusive.  The server wrote down our orders rather than remembering them (brownie points for that).
 The house chardonney was good & a new glass of ice tea was delivered rather than refilling the existing glass (brownie points for that).
We could see the bar area and the decore was very inviting as was the rest of the establishment.  Table cloths & cloth napkins on the table give the dining experience a touch of class.
Suggestion for the Grille: The manager should visit tables to inquire as to satisfaction. It is commonplace for most quality restaurants.  We would have given him/her positive comments, of course.
Overall, we recommend Brio.
The food was great.  Unfortunately service was very slow.  The manager acknowledged the problem and apologized.  We will try this restaurant again in the future.

Arrival: Five or six girls dressed in black, waiting around doing a whole lot of nothing.  Chatting among themselves.  No personality.  It was nice, I felt like I was in a fancy, posh restaurant!

Our Seat:  They must have had about 15-20 extra waiters and staff sort of loitering around the restaurant.  It was super awkward.  Here's what is more awkward: having those waiters hovering over your table, waiting for their orders from the cafeteria (or was it a kitchen?), talking about clubs, their nights, conquests and misc. other adventures.

Appetizers:  Very good.  Let's say B+.  Stuffed peppers.  Best part of the meal.

Entrees:  This was where it just got bad.  Two terrible entrees.  Mezza Chicken Limone tasted like I was eating straight egg.  Zero flavor unless you ate a moutful of salt and capers.

Do yourself a favor, if you want a chain Italian restaurant in Las Vegas, head on over to the Macaroni Grill and save yourself some time and money.  (Yes, it was bad enough for me to recommend Macaroni Grill)
Awful food, awful service...my husband and I top this as one of our worst dining experiences.  A tv dinner has more flavor than this so called "Italian" cuisine.

The short and sweet of it is that this a dime a dozen restaurant featuring lofty pricing with ever so slightly above average quality/tasting Italian food. 

It is basically like so many other similarly marketed  'upscale' Italian restaurants I have been to.  

I did like the fresh warm loaf of bread served at the beginning of the meal along with the seasoned toasted pita crisp bread pieces. 

The caesar salad was OK, as it really should have been.  My chicken pasta meal was also passable, but it just didn't blow me away as I had hoped it would.   The rest of my family did not voice any notable displeasure with their meal choices, so all is well in that situation. 

The atmosphere in the restaurant was mellow enough,  even though the noise level was a bit elevated due to the full customer capacity at the time.  I also thought it was decorated tastefully.  The tables were placed far enough apart to allow for a pleasant and private enough dining experience.  

I was only in town to visit some family, so it is fair to assume that it is assured I won't be back.

Went last nite for happy hour.    Weds is also $5 martini nite evidently!   I had the Raspberitini and the Lemon/Basil tini.    Both were excellent!  Our server Brie was happy to bring us samples of the HH wines ...... but my friend didn't care much for them and opted for a $9 glass of blended red from Australia..... at the recommendation of another server.  
We ordered 4 appetizers of the HH menu ...caprese salad .... very good.     Margarita Flatbread ..... excellent.   Beef Carpaccio ..... tasty and beautifully presented.    And the black peppered shrimp  .... we asked for the spicy sauce on the side, which we got.   And we asked to hold the black pepper, and just bring the peppermill ..... as I don't like black pepper or spicy!
Here's where they failed!   The batter/breading mix already has the pepper mixed in!   And it's on both the eggplant base AND the shrimp!!   If only the kitchen had informed Brie of that!
Well she did her best and offered to order something different for us and had it taken of the check.   We ordered the garlic/artichoke/cheese dip instead and it was great.
I believe Brie has only been there a couple of weeks.... she did a wonderful job!

One of the best Tuscan restaurants I've ever been to! Way better than anything on the strip for the price!! My boyfriend and I went to Vegas for the week and decided to try it and we loved it! The ambiance is beautiful and they text you when your table is ready! The servers were really sweet and helpful. I had the tomato bisque soup and it was AMAZING! Go here!

Once again, Brio was a great dining experience. We dined on steak salad, carpaccio and succulent lobster risotto. Delicious sangria and black raspberry martinis were exceptional. Of course, our server, Julio, made the night even more special. His professionalism and attention rate him at the top in people skills, making this dining experience an epicurean delight in a most comfortable and relaxed ambiance. Thank you also to Jesse, manager extraordinaire, for his most personable approach and care. Happy hour is very special!! Dinners are divine! Sunday Brunch is a must!! Experienced them al!! Enjoy Brio!!

My husband and I had another delicious dinner, at Happy Hour, at Brio's in Town Square in Las Vegas.
The professionalism of the staff namely, Brian (manager), Alyssa and Mike (bartenders), is beyond compare.  Besides delicious dishes, such as beef carpaccio and spicy shrimp and eggplant in a delicious spicy sauce, we also feasted on crispy shrimp served on a delicious bed of greens.  The Brio burger is still a must have order, for sure.  I must say that it is definitely worth your time, and you owe it to your tastebuds, to enjoy The Brio Restaurant and all it has to offer. J&D (NYC)

I went for dinner Thursday night and all I can say is wow, food was amazing and service was awesome, I had white sangria and sangria rosa I believe was the name of it, my date ordered the lobster bisque and the calamari and it was to die for  
For our entrees he got the lasagna and I got the balsamic short ribs with creamy polenta on the bottom... the whole meal was superb. Then to top it off, our awesome waitress suggested dessert so we got the chocolate cake with vanilla gelato  it was the end to a very good dinner. Three things will draw me right back
1 - the food is awesome
2 - the restaurant is beautiful 
3 - service was excellent (I forgot the name of our waitress but she was super nice and attentive)

Went for the second time yesterday and beat the weekend dinner rush at 5:30. Our experience was simply average this time. As always, the atmosphere is nice, clean and has soft flowing fabric on the ceiling that makes me feel like I am about to see a Cirque du Soleil show. Our server seemed very unhappy and didn't smile until he brought us the check and knew his tip was on the line. He must have been having a crummy day. It happens. Our Caesar kale salad and lobster bisque were fantastic but our entrees were below average. Wine taste is subjective but we were not fans of our choices (not their fault)and almost $8+ per glass is steep when they don't even fill the glass halfway. 

I ordered the risotto lobster special and my stepmom the salmon and asparagus dish. Stepmom liked hers far more than I liked mine. The salmon was a bit overcooked and the sweet potatoes overly salty but she liked the overall taste and the asparagus were grilled and perfectly cooked. The risotto was over cooked, mushy and soupy, instead of a bit sticky as it should have been. The lobster was a good addition but I could have done without the pre-frozen, chewy shrimp and wanted more vegetables. There were literally three 1/2 inch pieces of asparagus and about five tiny slices of red pepper. The worst part was the sauce, which tasted like a can of Campbell's cream of chicken soup poured over the risotto. Bummer. We felt like the dishes weren't inedible but weren't good either. I do highly recommend their kale Cesar salad, lobster bisque, wedge salad and the sourdough bread they bring to the table. I don't believe we will be back, however.

It's another American Italian restaurant; it's not even close to authentic Tuscan food. The food is overpriced I ordered the chicken breast with fried eggplant which was 18.00 for 2 pieces of grilled chicken breasts and one piece of fried eggplant.  It's not really worth your time.  The food isn't that good, sometimes the exception is the lobster bisque, but most of the time is uber salty.  The lettuce wedge was good, but drenched in blu cheese dressing and bacon.  The service is slow even thou most of the tables were empty when we went.  For 2 people we spent about 55-60.00, I could get 4 dishes for that much in Little Italy!!  the dessert is good, but not great.  The atmosphere is nice and dark, seems like a classy place.  BOTTOM LINE: save your pocket book and you time and get good, relatively authentic food in Little Italy

The food is good, but the service was a bit....lacking.

When i went the staff was fairly impersonal and didn't really seem to care that i was dining there, just saying.

I just love brio..out for the day at Town Square with my other half and had to go in for my fav.  Lunch bisteca salad and risotto yum yum...the risotto is the business chicken, butternut squash, asparagus and more goodness.  Like always great meal at Brio :)

Good Happy Hour OK service!

I like coming for the happy hour but the service could really use some help! I've been coming here for about 4 years since its in a great central location.  It's easy to get people to meet here since its central to Summerlin and Henderson.  

There is outdoor dining as well as inside dining.  You can only get Happy Hour in the Bar/Lounge area and it is first come first serve for seating. It can get busy especially when the weather is nice so try to get here early especially if you have a decent size group. The outdoor area has fire pits set up as well which is perfect at night when it can get a little chilly.

Happy Hour is $4-$6 small plates and certain drinks.  The sangria is pretty good along with the martini (order it dirty and add Blue Cheese olives for a little extra!).  The beef carpaccio is delicious but not very filling so order a few if you have a decent size.  Some of my other favorites are the eggplant fries, and the black pepper shrimp with eggplant.

The problem with happy hour is either the bar staff isn't properly equipped or they are just too aloof to actually give good service. Every time we have to wave down our server for silverware, napkins, to put in additional orders, or to let him/her we are ready to pay.  On one specific occasion we tried to get the bartenders attention for 20 minutes to place more drink orders and he ignored us.  Finally as happy hour was ending he said sorry happy hour is over. Thats not good customer service in my opinion as I know he saw us trying to get his attention since we were sitting directly in front of him.

I have also come for brunch and the service was still a miss. We split the Tuscan omelette and the berries and cream French toast. Everything tasted pretty good.

Over all tasty Italian inspired cuisine for a good price with aloof service from staff members who would do well with a little customer service training.

I actually really like this place. I've eaten here more times than I can count. I'm a sucker for wonderful outdoor eating and this place has it. The food and wine are nice. This is one of the few Italian food places that my husband can go to because he is lactose intolerant. The cooks here are actually skilled enough and have the authority to make adjustments to several of their sauces and dishes to accommodate his allergy and still have the food come out tasting delicious.

I have been to lunch at the brio several times and is usually good. Not great but good.  My wife and I took another couple to dinner this last Sunday night.  We sat down about 7pm.  We were sat at a table for 6 people.  The wait staff did not remove the extra settings and we finally asked them to take them away.  We were given lunch menus and had to ask for dinner menus.  The bread came and it was cold and hard and the breadstick like items were soggy.  My friend tried to order a pale style beer, didn't have one, ordered a lager, didn't have one so he got a Sam Adams.  I ordered a whiskey sour, i couldn't taste the whiskey, drank it ordered another one and it was totally different than the first one, neither of them had a cherry.  They told us when we first sat down that there were only 4 lobster bisque soups left, my friend said he would take one, a minute later they brought us two and we still didn't even have the dinner menus, they took them away and gave them to another table which I thought was against health code.  We asked for more bread and got the same as before.  I ordered the shrimp venuto (or similar) and it when I came it was obvious it sat under the hear lamp for some time.  I thought it was terrible and actually spit out a few bites and didn't finish it.  Our friends pasta dishes also looked like they sat under a heat lamp for a while and no one finished their meals or even asked for a to go box, that's how bad the food was.  Our waters were not filled unless asked.  All in all a very bad dining experience, so bad I felt compelled to yelp.  Hopefully we just experience an off night. But with so many other dining venue to solicit, we will not be going back to the Brio.

Usually like Brio.....not this one.  Waited in the reception area ten minutes.  Finally greeted by a flustered woman who brusquely seated us.  Waited another ten minutes....no acknowledgement, no drinks, nada.  Mid afternoon, not rushed.  Left and went to the Cheesecake Factory and had a great lunch with excellent service from a well trained waitstaff who are obviously well managed.

OMG!  Best thing I ever ate!  The beef carpaccio was AMAZING!  I ate the whole thing, by myself!  The staff and service was wonderful!  I will be back for happy hour this week!  I also ordered the sausage/pepperoni flatbread pizza!  Too full to eat, taking home for the teenagers!

WHOA!!!! Where has Brio been all expensive lunches in my life?!

The 2.95 happy hour is AMAZING! If portion size is too small for you...ORDER ANOTHER IT'S ONLY TWO NINETY FIVE!!! AAAAAAAAAAAAAAWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW YYYYYYYYYYYYYEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

- BRIO Burger - 
For 2.95 i was expecting one or two slider sized burgers. Nope they serve a FULL SIZED burger cut into quarters. The beef patty is pretty darn tasty but there's no condiments so after a few bites it could get pretty dull. Couple this with the salad from the Shrimptini or from the carpaccio and sauce it with the sauce from the shrimp and eggplant. 

- Ravioli Caprese - 
Not bad but no meat. The sauce ultimately makes the dish. Go early and they'll flood that plate with sweet tasty sauce, go late and there'll be a a few slabs of sauce on the plate.

- Chorizo Fonduta -
The 'Meh' of the menu. The fondu is a bit salty and is very rich.

- Beef Carpaccio - 
Thin strips of raw beef with a spring salad on top drizzled with some kind of mustard sauce with capers. WIN. 

- Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant -
Dont really like eggplant very much but OH MAN THAT SAUCE IS GOOD!!!

- Margherita Flatbread - 
Very nice, Very tasty, Could use more basil but overall it's perfect as a starter

- Shrimptini - 
Already peeled shrimp in a martini glass filled with tasty salad. Very refreshing and awesome as a starter or in between rich dishes like the shrimp and eggplant

- Sliced Steak Bruschetta - 
All you taste is the cheese and the greens but still this brushetta is DAMN tasty!!

I ate here tonight with a few of my team members from work. 

I remember eating here about 4 years ago but wasn't impressed at the time so I hadn't been back. Tonight I was pleasantly surprised. 

The location is one of the best things about this restaurant. It is located in the heart of the beautiful Boca Park directly across from the complimentary valet in the south entrance round-about. 

We ordered a round of the Watermelon Berry Mojito special. The drink was poured well with balanced flavors and fresh ingredients (not from a premixed bottle). The fresh watermelon in the drink was delicious. At only $5 a glass I was impressed. 

They bring complimentary bread and Parmesan crackers with butter for the table and we ordered the red pepper bruschetta. The bruschetta was tasty and had a good bread to topping ratio and the bread wasn't overtly crusty which I appreciated. 

I ordered the Pasta Alla Vodka which was a ricotta-filled ravioli in the shape of pouches with spicy tomato Parmesan cream sauce and basil. Surprisingly the ravioli pouches were soft and creamy and appeared to be house made. The sauce was all around pretty tasty. 

One coworker ordered the Crab Cakes which came with roasted vegetables, crispy fingerling potatoes, and creamy horseradish. He ate the whole thing and said he enjoyed it very much. 

Our two other coworkers ordered the Pan Roasted Talapia and the Ravioli di Portobello. They said they liked it as well.

Our server Frank had great energy and had good suggestions for food and drinks. When we had completed our meal Frank took the time to shake each of our hands.

What a treat to find a beautifully decorated, first class establishment right in my backyard! Brio is wonderful. 
The three things we look for in a restaurant are service, ambiance and food quality and presentation.  The service is excellent with attentive greeters, wait staff and bar staff.  The ambiance of the restaurant is that of a Tuscan restaurant.  And to complete the trifecta, the food is presented beautifully and tastes as good as it looks.
It titillates your tastebuds and is aromatic with a variety of aromas, not just garlic, like many other Italian restaurants.

You must make a reservation. Brio is popular and with good reason.  When you are seated, warm bread and flatbreads are delivered to your table.  The servers we have had are all enthusiastic, attentive and affable.  They're knowledgeable about the food and stop by regularly to see how you're doing.  

The specials always are fantastic.  Recommended are surf and turf, penne a la vodka, any fish dish and any dessert )if you have room).  Sauces were distinctly delicious and different.  It's worth trying to find a parking spot in the mall!
Happy Hour is amazing there. The food is always good, and the ambiance is great! The beef carpaccio was awesome and at $4 I think I may have to become a regular!

I have heard good things about Brio, and when my friend asked me to go with her, I was like "sure, why not? Maybe this will be my new place to go". but it's not...

When we walked in, I thought the decoration made the place feel so empty, maybe we went at a slow time? But I don't like the decoration at all. The waiter that served us, according to my friend, was a bit annoying. I thought he was okay, definitely not great though.

We had the spicy shrimp and eggplant appetizer, I thought that one wasn't bad at all, I actually liked it. My friend and I shared a pasta (I don't remember the name), and I thought it was alright, it wasn't appealing. For dessert, we had creme brulee and tiramisu. The creme brulee was good, unlike most people, I like the filling more than the caramel part, and their creme brulee has more filling than other places, so I was very pleased. On the other hand, the tiramisu wasn't that great, there was a strong rum taste in it. Maybe it's just me, I don't like that having too much rum in the tiramisu, so it was bad to me.

Overall, this place is only a one time thing for me, I don't think I'll go back unless I want to give this place another try.

We stopped into Brio as we pulled into town for a fun weekend. We happened to be at Whole Foods and walked around the corner after seeing the 4 star rating. To our surprise, this place is gorgeous on the inside and very roomy. We were able to sit down promptly upon arrival and sat at the bar.  

We ordered 2 wedge salads which were amazing. They were about as fresh and tasty as a wedge salad can be. We also ordered a bbq chicken pizza or flatbread and a risoto. These were top notch dishes that an incredible amount of flavor. 

I would definitely recommend that anyone come by and try Brio. This is a top of the line restaurant.

Love this place. Happy hour is best here. Large portions for affordable price. Bar Plates: $4-6 from 3:30-6:30pm. Dinner  food is great as well. Always good to make reservation around Christmas Holiday. Lots of Parties ! I ordered the Campanelle Carbonara Grilled chicken, bacon, Parmesan, and creamy Alfredo. Must try the Grilled Salmon Fresca* (LT) Grilled asparagus, sweet potatoes, spinach, red peppers, pesto vinaigrette, Feta, tomatoes, and balsamic. Last but not least - the Warm Chocolate Cake with Vanilla with bean gelato.
Love this place, fun for happy hour.  Sometimes overcrowded but it's nice to sit outside.  Great food and dessert!
I love eating here!  The bartenders, particularly Alyssa, are fun and right on top of things!  Excellent tasty food with great service at the bar make for a very pleasant afternoon lunch!

We had the pesto pasta with a side of Alfredo, half chicken and mashed potatoes, and the lamb chops! It was all so delicious and the bruschetta Quattro was amazing! I loved the tomato and mozzarella!

The lamb chops were by far the best I've had, not greasy at all and very flavorful! The mashed potatoes were also cooked so fluffy and delicious!

BEST. ITALIAN. FOOD. HANDS. DOWN. Had a delightful experience of Brio catering to my club's recent luncheon. The food arrived on time and the presentation exceeded our expectations. Yummy yummy. We will be sure to have it again. Shout out to Brian for helping with our needs and being so accommodating on a short notice.

The menu reminded me a bit of Olive and Ivy, so much so that I was sure this was a part of Fox Restaurant Concepts (I was wrong; it's not).  But that's not a bad thing, as I enjoy Olive and Ivy very much!  I liked the atmosphere, it's subdued and relaxed, but I still felt comfortable bringing my baby, and saw several other families.  The food was good and the service was very friendly and prompt.  Overall it was a positive experience and I would go back.
wow!!!outside veranda is beautiful!big choice of menu.the portions is big and delicious .I really liked chocolate cake!!!
Wow! Had my sister 50 bday dinner. Everyone there was super nice. Great food. Thank you guys

Second time dining at this place, first time was a hit and this time was no different. First thing, I noticed about this place is the layout. High, High Ceilings and the Overall decor looks so Grand, Open and Romanesque. Like its decorated for a Wedding Reception or Event of some sort.

We were greeted with smiles and quickly seated. Our hostess, immediately gathered and picked up the extra table settings in Lightning Speed and then handed our menus. WOHO! No more than 30 seconds our Server comes over and hands us the menu with a big smile and takes our drink orders. No more than a minute, a food runner brings us our drinks. A few minutes later, Our server politely comes by and asks us if we were ready to order and this is what we got:

"Primi" (Appetizers):

Calamari Fritto Misto: Big plate (easily shared by 3-4 people)! I loved the peperoncini mixed with the squid. Once in a while I would pick one up to spice it up a bit! Or sometimes it was a spicy surprise! Breading wasn't real golden brown and crispy. Came with 2 sauces on each side -Red sauce/Marinara type and Yellow sauce/Garlic Aioli. Red sauce typical pasta pizza sauce flavored. On the other hand, the Garlic Aioli was Absolutely Divine!! I don't know if its just me but that flavor got my attention real quick! It had a distinct flavor and a hint of horseradish mustard something that I couldn't get enough of! I didn't want to look like a dog but I would of Licked that plate clean with a shine! 

Spicy shrimp & Eggplant: Nice presentation, came on a long rectangle plate all lined up like in a straight line. Overall, flavor wasn't really impressive more disappointing if anything. The black pepper cream sauce wasn't as good as it sounded but the romano crusted egg plant was nice. Basically, after a few pieces, I was over it.. I guess that's why its an appetizer! But this felt heavy and after a few, I threw in the towel..

Entree:

Pasta Pomodoro with Chicken and added their Bistecca Insalata (salad): Another Heavy Weight plate, a generous mound of angel hair pasta, grilled chicken, pine nuts and their cilantro pesto drizzle. Plus some grated parmesan on top. Pretty straight forward dish and pretty good as well. It was just lacking 5 Stardom calibur, just like every other dish.. (Except for the salad, I'll get to that!).

*Bistecca Insalata: The Freshest Wedge of Iceberg Lettuce (crisp and almost neon green), Gorgonzola, real pieces of bacon (not dried bits), shiny red roma tomaotes and their mouthwatering creamy parmesan dressing!! One of the Best salads I've ever sunk my teeth in!!

Couldn't help but watch some of the staff really get to work. During our meal, we couldn't help but notice a vacant table behind us that was getting set for the next guest(s). The busser/server assistant was so precise and jaw dropping fast! I mean like watching a dvd and pressing forward like 3 times/3 arrows!! Just like everybody else here!! It's like the In N' Out Burger staff on a Redbull High!!! Also, I must mention our (Pregnant) Server did not skip a beat from refilling drinks, stopping by to check on the dinner status, to adding the extra Garlic Aioli sauces in our staff wrapped doggie bags! Service 5.5 Screaming Stars! Taste of Food 3.5-4 Stars (Bistecca salad 5+ stars), Value for amount of food 4-4.5 Stars and Ambiance 4.5 Stars..

My husband and I went in there for dinner this evening! We have dined into Brio a few times in the past. We love their food. The pasta vodka is my favorite! We had a wonderful experience, and great service too! We appreciated the manager stopping at our table to see how everything was. Very friendly environment! We will definitely be back to try the layer cake!

Ordered the Shrimp Mediterranean and a wedge salad through grub hub. They were both delicious. Even though it was delivery, the salad was cold and the Shrimp was perfectly cooked. I can't wait to actually go there to eat, though I don't know how the food could possibly be even better.

I don't usually like to rate chain restaurants but Brio was pretty darn good.  The service was friendly and efficient.  The pasta dishes were very good with large poritons.  I really don't have anything bad to say about this place.  Everyone seems to be mentioning the happy hour.  I'll have to come back to try that!

My guy is a big fan of the not-so-chainish-chain, so we went to check out the new location in Scottsdale on opening night.  Thinking it would be busy up til the late hours, we went at 945 and it was empty, leaving us to be that awkward couple left in the restaurant.   The restaurant itself is beautiful, with a great tuscan feel and beautiful draping curtains everywhere; the dining room it a bit odd, however, being just big and open and THERE.

Our server was awesome, ensuring us that we were totally welcome to enjoy and take our sweet time.  Though the wine took forever to get to us, the bruchetta came out quick and was DELICIOUS - get the quattro, thats all I have to say.  Caeser was just ok.  

Pat ordered the Chicken Alla Sorrentina, which though he thought was only ok, I thought was fresh, flavorful, and wicked tasty.  I got the Penne Mediterranean - I had asked for extra tomato and onion; the server made a mistake and it had none rather than extra.  I pointed it out, and the server brought it out - stone cold straight from the fridge.  When mixed into the pasta, it was basically pure tasteless 1/2 hot 1/2 cold crap.  I told the server it was no bueno, and he sent the manager over immediately.  Before I could say anything, she opened with "I heard your dinner was unsuccessful and unsatisfactory - I wanted you to know your entire dinner is on us" and continued to offer to fix my meal or let me order whatever else I wanted!!!  That kind of customer service is rare and hard to find, and though this is not what I would expect every night at this restaurant (it was opening night after all) I was extremely impressed with the type of restaurant they were trying to establish.  

I will definitely be going back again not just for the customer service, but for the satisfying fair priced well cooked food.  Cheers.
Good food, great service.  Went here for just brunch, definitlly going to go back for dinner.

PLEASE go here for dinner ! If you're not feeling pasta they have GREAT steaks ! The service was so wonderful ! Everything about it was perfect ! I was able to cut my steak with a butter knife ! A BUTTER KNIFE PEOPLE !!! Please try it if you haven't ! Not to mention GREAT PRICES !

Just went there tonight for early dinner. Was strolling around Town Square Mall, and my boyfriend was craving for pasta. The inside looks nice. Service is good. Pasta here is good. 

LOBSTER BISQUE - really good. Better to eat it slow because the spices can be strong and the taste may seem too powerful. 

RAVIOLI DI BELLO - I highly recommend!!!! Some raviolis I've had are dry, or has little meat, or has a sauce that's either bland or overpowering. This ravioli is none of those. It's great! It has the right amount of meat inside. Sauce is tasty. The mushroom gives more flavor. The tomato cleanses the palate. 

CAMPANELLE CARBONARA - It's good, but not the best I've had. 

We both had wine too. Total came up to $60+.
The food and service was amazing.  We celebrated my grandmothers 85th  birthday here and it was amazing.  We had a party of 15 and the servers were really on top of it.  Really love this place.

Pros: 
* their carbonara pasta on their lunch menu is great. They mix it with bacon & spinach, and have the right about of cream sauce. 
* get the calamari!!! 
* friendly staff 
* clean, nice atmosphere. Can go for a casual lunch, business lunch as well as nice date. 
* good location. Who doesn't love Town Square? 

Cons:
* their Caesar salad was weak.

I had heard how great this place was so I had to try it. First impression was an arrogant hostess who was more concerned with marking off her floor chart or station map than greeting me. I was sat and ordered the Lobster Bisque which was amazing, the bread was awesome. My server Jade was excellent as well. I ordered the Veal Marsala and it was extremely bland and tasteless. Not even the sauce could save it, Marsala usually has a nice, nutty flavor. It had no flavor at all, very disappointing. After seeing the decor and tasting the bread and the Bisque I was expecting a great meal, it was far from it. A microwave meal has more flavor.....

This is a lively restaurant. It was Tuesday night during the week of the magic fashion trade show and it was a packed restaurant. Everything we ordered was delicious. See the pics. The service was excellent and the manager even came by to see how we were doing. The group I was with routinely comes to this restaurant every time they are in Vegas because they love the food so much. There is some lovely outdoor seating and the restaurant is nestled within a beautiful outdoor shopping center.

The service was what made our experience satisfying. We told Tony the waiter that one of us was vegan and he had the chef make something special which was fabulous. Ambiance was nice. We have been here many times but this was the best. Thank you Tony.

We sat a booth at the bar for about 10 minutes when some guy walking by gave us some water.  After another 5-10 minutes another guy walked by and finally gave us some menus.  No drink order, nothing.  Finally left after about 30 minutes of basically no service.  I could understand if they were busy but there were 2 people sitting at the bar and another lady in a booth.
Loved it, we sat outside in the evening and we had a great time. The service was very friendly with genuine care. The food is outstanding!

For a chain restaurant...I was impressed. We stopped in early in a Saturday and were told it would be a 50min wait but bar seating was first come first served. We decided to look around and found a table in the back corner of the bar. It took a little bit but our server finally came over and took our drink order. He was very knowledgeable with the wine list and my wife went with one of his suggestions for a Pinot Grigio and she enjoyed it. I couldn't decide on an entree so I went with some small plates. I started with the lobster bisque which was flavorful but skimpy on the lobster. Next I had a Caesar salad and an order of calamari. The salad was rather large and a good value. The calamari was excellent except for the aioli. I tried a little and decided to stick with the marinara that accompanied it. I'm a calamari traditionalist...what can I say? My wife had the pasta Brio which consisted of rigatoni, grilled chicken, and mushrooms in a roasted red pepper sauce. She liked it and so did I. I'm not a huge fan of chains but Brio does it right. We will definitely be back the next time we decide to visit Crocker Park.

Ordered Togo they didn't provide me with everything I asked for. Spoke to a manager she sent out a gift card. Next visit I ate there.. my server was so hard to reach and on top of that my son had a bug in his drink. The server didn't apologize nor did the manager and she also knew about it. Food is good, but I don't recommend this location. Town square a much better option.

Finally went to Brio today, for lunch.

First thing I said when we walked in, "are they owned by Cheesecake Factory?"  The atmosphere is Cheesecake Factory-esque, with a Tuscan flare.

The menu is pretty big, nothing really stood out to me on it though.  Their brunch menu items looked like they had some potential but I was not in a brunch mood unfortunately.  Had the Lobster bisque to start, pretty good, but I've had better.  (The Lobster Bisque at Ocean Club REALLY spoils you.....lol)  Sister had the Beef Carpaccio appetizer...which was HUGE.  It's a huge, long plate of thinly sliced carpaccio with a small bunch of mixed greens in the center...it was pretty good, but nothing that I went crazy over.

Had the Pasta alla Vodka for entree and again, pretty good but nothing amazing.  They are little ricotta filled pasta purses (don't know the technical pasta name for them, so that's how I'd best describe them!), in a delicious tomato/parmesan/vodka sauce with smoked bacon.  Very tasty, but not life changing.

Food wise, it kinda reminded me of an Olive Garden, but a little more upmarket.  Maybe if Olive Garden made love to a Cheescake Factory....you'd end up with a Brio Tuscan Grille?

Wow!!!!!!!  I tried this restaurant for the first time and it was WONDERFUL!!!!!!!!!!!!  I ordered the lobster bisque, pasta alla vodka and caramel marscapone cheesecake. Everything was perfection (and I never say that about Italian food other than my own lol).  Very highly recommended and rather than using Door Dash, next time I will need to experience the ambiance of the restaurant.

After reading the reviews I was super disappointed when I finally got here to eat. I was hoping for the four star experience raved about on Yelp but was left really cold by this place.

First, not super friendly or super attentive. They get you what you need but it's at snail's pace and I was starving.

I ordered the calamari and it was okay. It didn't have a fresh flavor and it was mushy instead of crispy. It came out with the marinara sauce to dip in, but there was this other blob of white sauce that looked like mayo had been out sitting on the counter on a warm afternoon. Obviously steered clear of that salmonella-listeria-cyclospora petri dish and tried not to gag. 

Because I had overindulged with the fried mess above I asked if I could just have capellini tossed with olive oil. They accommodated me in the way of a half a cup of spaghetti for $8.00. WTF? They had dishes on the menu that included vegetables, meat and sauce for that price. I felt thoroughly ripped off and will never eat here again.

Like they say, you can put lipstick on a pig...but its still a pig. The food and the service are NOT what I expect from this beautifully decorated restaurant. I would have been better off at Caraba's. 

I've been to Brio about 3 times now. The 3rd (and likely last) time was a recent Sunday for brunch. There were 7 adults and 4 children. Our server seemed disorganized from the time she took our order to the time we had to hunt her down thru a passing server to ASK for the check.  

Our entrees came out in batches. Some at my table were eating 3-4 minutes before my food arrived. I expected all the food to come out at the same time...even if that meant our server had assistance. To top it off, my food was cold. My salad that I ordered for appetizer was over dressed and the lettuce wilted. 

When a woman in my party asked for water, the server only brought ONE water. She didn't ask anyone else at the table if they'd like water also. When the server brought the single water, she made it a point to say "we don't automatically serve water". I know we have a water shortage in AZ, but damn! At least ask! 

Only the kids and the 2 adults who ordered French Toast seemed pleased w/ their food. 2 of the kids probably don't count, as they are 1.5 years old! These growing boys were just happy to be eating! 

Fantastic food can make bad service bearable. Outstanding service & presentation can make "OK" food great. But mediocre service AND food call for a 3 strikes and you're out in my eyes.

Pasta is okay, but the salad is really good I got a harvest salad the chicken was delish and so was the dressing. Service was great but I'm not a fan of their food the ambience is nice. No super expensive it's moderate. Love the location and the parking so close! Thanks to the yelp event I got $25 off yay! Thanks yelp! I don't know if I'll be back I wasnt wowed or anything. My friend did say the lemon drops were exceptional!

My husband and I first ate at brio Tuscan grille in Las Vegas for our wedding reception. Today we are celebrating our wedding anniversary at the scottsdale brio Tuscan grille. The food was great as usual but the service was even better. Our server was Aaron. He was very attentive, answered all our questions and was constantly checking up on our needs. Aaron at brio Tuscan grille was awesome made the whole experience even better. ..
Two words: HAPPY HOUR! great prices on food and drinks here, one of my favorites. My friends love it here, great atmosphere.

These please is very dear to me it's where my girlfriend and I had our first date back in 2013 it's now 2016 and my girlfriend took me out for my birthday these evening and the food is always good you look around and the waiters are fast and always moving the food came out fast and it was nice and hot. What made this evening AWESOME was our waiter ALBERTO he was very friendly and always attentive he had like 6 full tables in our section and he was on top of all of them really kind, efficient, and really felt like we were a priority to him will definitely be going back more often and hopping to have him as our waiter

We went for happy hour and I would for sure go back just for that again! We had the happy hour version of the following: burger, pizza, bruschetta, and ravioli. Each was $3! Only thing better would have been better drinks on happy hour. There wasnt much of a selection of draft beer or cocktails--and the prices werent as good as the food. It was packed when we arrived on a Friday evening. The service was great considering the rush at the bar area.

Im adding this as a heads up for vegetarians.  This place doesn't offer much for us and if you have to ask for alternates, like leave out the meat, price remains high.  For us the price is mid to high.  Server was outstanding, did his best to please us, i wish i remember his name.  The salad I ordered, three tomatos something, not excellent.  Server said without the chicken it gets mixed reviews.  Anyway go elsewhere if you're a veggie cause there are much better "Italian" places with better selections.

We had been to the sister restaurant in Town Square and food is always good there.
Was running errands this side of town and decided to stop for happy hour.
The staff was friendly and service was prompt. Food was delicious and portion was good size.
Will be back

Keeping in my mind that I've done nothing but appetizers and drinks here, and only at the bar area, I'm kind of a fan. The bartenders have generally been very nice and attentive. And the outdoor bar part is actually kind of a nice place to sit. The appetizers have all been ok, but nothing too impressive. What I have found most impressive is their $5 martinis on Thursdays during happy hour. All of the martinis I have sampled have been absolutely delicious. And for $5, well, you just can't beat that.
Jenny went above and beyond to take excellent care of us.  We'll be back.  Thank you for really taking all of our needs into consideration.  I am so glad we didn't go to Echo & Rig!
There are way better original italian places to go...I promise

I've been here for a few family dinners. When I see family ,I'm talking 15 people at the table. For some reason Brio can't handle large groups. It's never easy.  Always chaotic. And the food honestly isn't that great.

I think you have to adjust a little for it being on Valentine's Day and bearing that in mind it was good. We got there 20 minutes before out 8:45 reservation and were hoping to be seated earlier, but unfortunately it was just super busy and we were seated at res. time. We spent some time looking over the menu and it did take a while to order. My gf ordered the shrimp and lobster pasta which she said was very good if not phenomenal. I ordered the filet only to find a few minutes later that they just ran out. So, I went with the New York Fiorentina which turned out to be quite good as far as New Yorks go (not usually my favorite). Grilled and seasoned very well which is a must for the chewier cut. Overall recommended with friendly and professional service.

Always good. Never a disappointment. We booked a room to celebrate my daughter 16th bday and the service was on point. Food was excellent and always at the right temperature. 

Unfortunately we were not offered to take left overs and I didn't realized until the end to ask for them and I was told none was saved. 

A little disappointed on that but I will remember for next time.

I take clients here because it's a place I can always rely on. The food is consistently fresh and expertly-prepared, with a professional and gracious staff, and an outstanding interior and atmosphere.

Had such an amazing experience here last week. 

Dined here after early day from work with my best friend and my grand parents. We had appetizers, lunch (nana and I had pastas, zach and my papa had sandwiches, we had deserts (lava cake, cheesecakes, and tiramisu, wine, and coffee) and the entire meal was exceptional.

Lunch was super busy, but they always kept an eye on us and made sure we were well taken care of. 

I have always had an amazing experience at Brio and love it there. Check it out for date night or for a nice family dinner.

It was my very time eating, the atmosphere of walking inside was phenomenal and the food was spectacular! Service was great and especially eating outside during the night sky was perfect as well. Most definitely coming back again real soon!

Good place, decent happy hour. Good food. I used to give this place 5 stars but every time i come here (which is monthly) Im always reminded of something that somehow seemed to slipped my mind when writing my earlier review (the most important tips often somehow manage to do that, but thats why they have an 'update review' option, thank you yelp for catering to us frequently distracted folk) and thats the extremely weak drinks. Ok people now the frequency of my drinking consists of maybe 3-4 drinks a week and during/with dinner and i weigh about 100 lbs. personally i wouldn't call myself a heavy drinker and NORMALLY at a restaurant a drink or 2 will do me just fine. Not this place. It takes about 4, yes thats 4, and no I'm not exaggerating. I've sent back drinks numerous times (something i freaking hate and would much rather avoid, but this place leaves me no choice really) and the next drink maybe, maybe might be enough to make a dent. But then obviously when i come back again i have to do the 'send the water and ice drink i just paid $6 back and hopefully they send a real drink out next time dance'. Its just kind of annoying and its how it goes ALMOST every time. note the almost is because more often than not when i come here i pay $6 for water, ice and some sugar juice stuff but in the past (but not anymore :( ) I've had a really good bar tender (he has a mustache you can't miss him!) who actually knew how to make a real drink. But for the past few months i keep getting stuck with some other bar tender. If you don't drink then sorry if you read this whole review. Like i stated earlier the food is great and the atmosphere is nice. Despite there overpriced water/ice/juice drinks (they call them alcoholic beverages on the menu) i still frequent here monthly. Definitely recommend it.

Dinner tonight at Tivoli Village:

Beverage: Peach Ice Tea.  Yes!
Appetizer: Roasted Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke Dip.  Yes!
Entree: Campanelle Carbonara.  Yes!
Dessert: Caramel Mascarpone Cheesecake.  Yes!!

Yes, Yes, Yes, and Yes.
I tried their lasagna for the first time and thought it tasted average.  I truly was not impressed.

It is your traditional Olive Garden type restaurant. Service was pretty good. Food was mediocre. I ate there, probably won't go back. It just wasn't that outstanding. If you're looking for a nice relaxing place to eat outdoors, this is a pretty place. 

At the risk of sounding like a fake Yelper....let me tell you about a place I found nearby that was AMAZING. Check out Rice Trax. Wish they'd been open on Sunday, then I wouldn't have had to eat at Brio. ;-)

I've always love Brio it's one of those places that lands in between Casual and Classy. It's perfect for a couple steps above average casual dinner date or a fancy enough dinner party. No matter how you put it it's a nice place to dine weather you're here for a work gathering or dinner for 2 it's perfect and their food is great. 

I was here recently for my father in laws big 5 oh and we had our party in their small banquet room. I've been in this room before for his parents 50th anniversary and it works for a small private group. The service here is awesome and the staff is really accommodating as far as cakes, flowers, decor and slide show goes. 

The food and drinks are always good as expected. We had at this party a four coarse meal. Staring off with 2 choice of salad an Italian chop and a Cesar's wedge with bacon yum! Then we were served the apps calamari and something else I can't remember but their calamari are battered and delicious crispy enough and had great seasoning paired with marinara dipping sauce. The family style entrees were lemon chicken with capers or something like that, steak and this very good cheese tortellini 
Pasta dish. All this and bread and butter as well. 

As usual all the food maws very good and the dessert (2 options) tiramisu and cheese cake were really yummy and presented really nice...not pictured boo. But regardless Brio is always a nice place to dine and the food is always satisfying!

happy hour- yummy
I love the white sangria and the flat bread pizza
spicy shrimp and eggplants it was good
crispy shrimp piccante- excellent

Brio has an amazing menu, Ive tried a few different dishes including eating off my husband's plate and have never been disappointed! The wait wasn't long, when we went on a Saturday night. It was packed but not too loud. Staff was prompt and courteous. Prices were average. Ambiance was very nice, and overall I would love to eat here weekly!

My first time trying This restaurant and I looooved  it... First and foremost I had the best server his name is Frank he gave me and my family an excellent service, he was fast, he asked questions to see what I will like to eat, without asking he noticed that my moms water was almost finished he kept on coming and refilling our water. Frank is super friendly and has 5 star customer service skills. Thank you Frank.... it's not easy to satisfy my parents when we go to restaurants they always find something they are not happy about  the food but they loved the food in Brio it was delicious and we will be back soon...
Reasonable prices, good food.  Nothing overly special.  PLike the fact they now mark light food choices, under 650 Cal's.
One of the BEST places in Vegas. Always great food and service.

Brio is an amazing Italian restaurant! Their service is always friendly, especially tonight, we had Kaitlin, she was just fantastic; warm, friendly and very helpful! 

The ambiance is a classy, yet laid back.  Sometimes it can get a little noisy on Friday/Saturday evenings, but that is to be expected at delicious, popular places.

Food is phenomenal, we always get the bruschetta quattro, and it's always delicious! Tonight I had their Lobster Bisque, and it's was creamy and flavorful! They have an extensive wine list, too!

My Italian fiancé loves this place, too!
(What an endorsement, right?!)

I look forward to coming back here with my family!

Be sure to make a reservation!! :)

Overall Brio was just ok. I would have to try it one more time in order for me to recommend it. Service was no problem, our server was attentive. 
We ordered pesce picatta and chicken Marsala and calamari and wedding soup to start. Wedding soup was very good but, calamari was room temp and over cooked. 
Chicken Marsala had good flavor but over cooked mushrooms and very little of them. In the pesce picatta the fish was cooked well but, the dish overall had no flavor. I was expecting lemon and caper flavor instead it was bland. We had to ask for more Marsala sauce and picatta sauce which made up for initial lack of sauces.

I have eaten at Fleming's, Maestro's, Ruth's Chris, but I have never had a better steak for the price than the one I had here. The Gorgonzola crusted filet is hands-down the best entrée on the menu. The meal should easily be priced in the $50s, but is under $30 with sides. I will definitely be back for more!

Brio did a wonderful job with my bff's wedding reception, so for that, they get 3 stars.

But the gluten-free pasta primavera was hard, chewy and bland and the mushrooms tasted microwaved. And the server only mentioned the complimentary reception wine after making it appear like you could only get cocktails (which were not included with the wedding reception). Y U HOLD OUT ON ME?

There is nothing special about this place that warrants a return visit. Our party of 6 was seated right on time for our 5:15 reservations. The restaurant was not busy this particular Sunday night, but reservations are recommended. We were quickly served hot bread and butter which was a good start because I was starving!  Our server was nice, but she was inconsistent. After she took our orders, we hardly saw her again. Someone else brought our dinner to the table, and we were all shocked that they didn't offer cheese. This is supposed to be an Italian place right?? We had to wait a while for our server to come back and check on us and then we were able to ask for fresh parmesan. After that, we hardly saw her again except when it came time to drop off the check. Even after that, she disappeared for a good 20 minutes and we needed some things on our bill adjusted so we finally had to flag someone down to ask them to tell our server to come back to the table. 

The food, meh, nothing special and surely over priced. I went with the chicken under the brick, which is a grilled chicken breast with marsala mushroom sauce, served with mashed potatoes and veggies. The marsala sauce was really good, I just wish there were more of it. I loved the vegetables that came with my meal especially the carrots, they were a tad sweet so I think they might have been glazed. I also ordered a side chopped salad which was just okay as well. For each side salad it was $4.95! That is for lettuce, a few chopped veggies, and dressing. The bill for just me and my mom was $54! Other people in my party agreed the food was just okay and definitely overpriced. I hear they have a good happy hour, I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here, but I wouldn't be opposed to trying the happy hour.

I normally go to the Brio in Town Square as it is closer to where I live; however, I was on this side of town and decided to come to this location with a friend. It was setup very nicely, although I prefer the look and setup in Town Square (Thats just personal preference). The food was delicious as always and the staff was there to service, very friendly! 

The staff did seem a little "on edge" and checking everything, but that is okay by me! I also think they were like that because it opened very recently, so they are still getting into the routine. Regardless, simply wonderful! I am sure with time this location will be just as popular as the Town Square location.

My 2nd trip to this restaurant.  This time we Celebrated my 19th Anniversary here 4 days ago.  Our waiter was outstanding:). The locations of the restaurant is perfect. The hostess not so much as she had trouble seating us ... The broccoli sprouts that came with the braised beef short ribs were overcooked and I don't recall tasting the pecans.  I was slightly disappointed.  Their seasonal margaritas are refreshing tho:)
Had a lot of fun. Our waiter was extremely helpful and had great recommendations. A little pricey but worth it

We stumbled on this place randomly and loved it. The atmosphere, decor, food and even the location is great. I ordered the lamb chops. Huge portion (no way I could finish it) and delicious. My side was Brussel sprouts and it was made with amazing sauce. My husband ordered the Gorgonzola meat tenders and of course I tried it with mash potatoes and veggies. Everything was delicious. 
The waiter wasn't as amazing as the place and the food - but overall it was a great place in Town Square. 
When we return to Vegas, I'm sure to come back. 

PS they have outside seating with misters! So you don't get too hot.
I just love when there is 15 to 20 empty tables and the snooty hosts make you wait 10 to 20 minutes to seat you, great food anyway

TUSCAN GRILLE - so why is there only 5 pasta dishes on the latest menu??  Which they change like the staff every 5 months - always removing the favos of the regulars of course and wondering why it nowhere near as busy as it was a few years ago.

Yes - I've been going for 5 years now.......sometimes every week...for awhile

But 6 months ago stopped - because they just cant seem to get anything right in this place!!
Always an issue with ordering and getting it wrong as ordered.....then WAITING again while other people eat at your table - which is the ANTITHESIS of why people go out to dine!!

The chefs - don't understand English well - so they don't read the orders correctly....been an issue for years now.....ex staff told me so on many occasions

Went last night - same situation - I mean COME ON!  Got my order wrong - had to wait while my wife ate hers - which came with NO SAUCE  - chicken Limone - its ALL ABOUT THE SAUCE - yet the last 5 times - there is little to NO sauce...have to ask for more...then it take 10 minutes....food is cold.  Same crap. BRIO - Are you guys saving pennies on the sauce???? Is that WHY there is none????

Tired of the excuses and constant wrong items arriving at table.....it was not busy....it was Thurs....

This location's days are definitely numbered....

Wow talk about getting treated like a loser as soon as you walk in the door. First off the only reason I even went to this place is because we were about to see a movie. On any other night I would never suggest this place. FIrst of all the waitress seemed as if she was on crystal meth , she was very rude and not informative at all. Salad was vintage, my entree was absolutely terrible. All the waiters had chin straps looking like a high school football team . Sucky atmosphere. Sucky Music. This PLACE SUCKS!

Date & Time:  Tuesday December 20, 2012 @ 1pm
Dining Companion:  Mommy
Scene:  Shoppers in BodyCon Dresses & Tall Boots
Decor:  Ornate Domes & Striped Booths
Service:  Efficient
Mediocre:  Tomato Soup & Club Sandwich
Skip:  Lobster Bisque & Kale Salad
Total:  $28

AMAZING!  Everyone absolutely loved their food.  Often times pastas are uninspiring more often than not, but not at Brio.  Ambiance is excellent, service was also top notch and yum yum yum to every bite we took.  We will be back again and again!

I'm rating based on waiting on my reservation. If there were negative stars the reservation staff deserves it. Made a reservation, and showed up 35 mins early. Asked if it was better to keep on my reservation or to get on the wait list and low and behold everyone in the lobby has been seated before us, including wait and reservations. This is ridiculous.

Asides from the horrible hostess service, the manager was apologetic about the situation and our server and food was superb. Everything came out on time and tasted great. Drinks were filled and we were checked on frequently. Dishes were large portions so come hungry.

Been to this location a handful of times, always enjoyed coming here. But today we had a waitress who had a unwelcoming attitude the whole time which made my family uncomfortable. I will be back, but please don't give me Erika.

Ask for Gus! He's a great server. He was so friendly and very attentive. 

My roommate and I decided to come here on a Thursday night after a long day of work. We had to wait about 10 mins to be seated. But once we were seated, we were greeted right away by Gus. We ordered: the spaghetti bolognese, beef carpaccio, caprese salad, lobster bisque soup, and calamari.

The spaghetti bolognese was so creamy! It was amazing. The beef carpaccio is ALWAYS on point. So flavorful. The caprese salad was... eh, nothing special. The lobster bisque soup was some of the best soup I have ever had, to be completely honest. And the calamari was nothing short of yum. For dessert we got the chocolate cake with a side of vanilla gelato. It was okay, nothing spectacular. But I'll definitely be back for the beef carpaccio and lobster bisque!
