This was a nice introduction to an upscale chain restaurant that I had been wanting to experience....next time, dinner & possibly cannoli :[]

Had an awesome birthday dinner here for my husband thanks to our server Craig! 
We took advantage of our rewards card and started with the Garlic, Artichoke, Spinach Dip which was delicious (especially those little cheesy triangles of deliciousness they serve it with).
For entrees he went with the Lobster and Shrimp Fettuccine which he couldn't stop raving about and I decided on the Fettuccine with Tomato Compote and Kalamata Olives (which I wasn't too sure about when I ordered, but was SO glad I did, because it was delicious and under 600 calories!) Our 3 year old had the kid's pepperoni pizza which was delicious and more than enough for him (and such a steal at that price point!)
We finished off with a free birthday dessert (thank you Brio for taking that extra step for us!), and the kiddo enjoyed his kid's ice cream sundae.

Our server was wonderful, he was friendly, attentive (but not hovering), and made our dinner extra special. We truly appreciate the wonderful customer service and delicious food to boot. Thanks Brio!

Terrible food, ok service. Worst Bloody Mary I've had in my whole life. For the cost and quality I would've / should've gone across the street to echo and rig...

Got the Sicilian omelette and it was as if they took a pasta dish and added eggs, bad. Lobster bisque tasted like plain butter, gross.

I have lived in Vegas for about 5 and a half years now. My husband and I are foodies, so we have been all over Vegas for dinner, from super fine dinning, to buffets. Brio is our favorite place to eat hands down. The service is always great and the food is ALWAYS terrific. We have never ordered something we didn't like! We love the mushroom di bella pasta, Pasta alla vodka, and the bistecca inselata...the steaks are great as well. They also have the best ice tea in Vegas! Highly recommend Brio!!

We got there at 6:30pm with no reservations, they were busy, so the hostess  gave us a buzzer, so when our table was ready we will get buzzed,in less than 5 min. we were buzzed.(THAT WAS SUPER FAST) The decore inside nice, nice, the place looked great,and the the smells coming out of the kitchen you thought you were back in Tuscany. It felt back home for a while.We sat in the gazibo room, the  lites were nice and dimm, and the atmosphere was great. Sandy was our waitress and she was very polite and spirited. Her recomendations were awsome, the ceaser salads that came out were fresh and the lettuce crisp the lobster bisqe was good too.The basket with the bread that came out was nice and hot. As soon as they  saw our table empty with bread they kept on coming with more, and they always refilled our drinks as well. The pasta dishes with ricotta panceta in a vodka cream sause excellent (Pasta a la Vodka),the brazed beef with cremini mushrooms and homade noodles was great, the flavors were all there, awsome!! The mohitos are a little on the lite side, but it was corected from Sandy.The deserts that came out in little espreso cups [2.50 each] Smart!! Very good idea you can try them all. In general the experience was great and we will be back. For a chain restaurant to look that good and please their customers so well, gets 5 stars from me. PPERRRFFECCTOOOOOOOOOO!

One of my favorite restaurants. The pastas are second to none, the bread is number one and the service is OK. ones in a while the food is a little greasy but over all I am coming back for another dish. Like to experiment new specials.

This was my first time at Brio. Came with a few friends and Ashley was my server! She recommended the Strawberry Fresca and it is my new favorite drink! She was so knowledgeable about the menu. She recommended a few items for me and I decided on the Gorgonzola crusted beef medallions. It was DELICIOUS! Ashley was so warm and welcoming and really made my experience at Brio special. I will definitely be coming back!

First time trying Brio was at Tivoli Village during happy hour. It was nice sitting outside until sunset cuz I felt like I roasted out in the sunlight. Aside from the tanning, the happy hour specials are f*ing great. There's a wide variety of $3 appetizers & discounted martinis to choose from & it turns out that my favorites were the margherita flatbread & lemontinis.

I never really paid attention until last night while out having dinner with my mom, but Brio is a fantastic blend of Carabas meets Cheesecake Factory.  What does that mean? Fixed menu, factory workers as servers, little intimacy in the entire venue, just get-em in get-em out experience. It's like a production line.. granted most restaurants are but they all don't FEEL that way.

Now, I'm not saying things were bad, my server (forgot his name) was very nice and super attentive, food was good (not great, just good), and over all it was a decent dining experience.

I would chalk this place up as saying it's just another commercial chain food establishment with main perks being their happy hour specials and outdoor seating when the weather is nice.

Sorry Brio, I'm just as disappointed as you are.

The shrimp & egg plant appetizer
Is excellent.  Smoking deals at happy hour - really good drink prices and food.  Oh yes - the regular food inside the restaurant is very good too.  (Note that I said very good and gave them four stars - they are very good, but not to die for and think you went to Tuscany.

We continue to have excellent service and delicious food so we will forever be loyal customers! I always recommend this place to couples, singles, and families. It's great for anyone! The kid's menus are great and the kid's pizzas are huge! My son loves it here!

My two friends and I went to San Tan to get some food and ended up at Brio. The weather was perfect, the patio seating was available and the street musician was wooing us with his romantic accordion skills.

We started with a caprese appetizer to share. It fed just two people as it wasn't a big appetizer but the produce was fresh. I would have liked more of a balsamic glaze on it since the tomatoes and mozzarella weren't super juicy on their own (hence the greater need for oil and vinegar).

On to our entrees, I had the Bio salad and my friend had the Vodka ravioli with some added sausage. He had been craving sausage and peppers pasta all day and so this was the closest thing he could get to it at Brio. His ravioli was very tasty- the pasta itself was delicate and thin and the filling was plentiful and very cheesy. The vodka sauce tasted pretty standard- however, the sausage was cut very thin and cooked crispy almost like bacon. It tasted alright but not the thick and juicy piece of meat we expect when we order sausage - hahah who knew describing a piece of meat could sound so NSFW!

On to the less sexy plate, my Brio salad. The red peppers were warm and juicy and the asparagus had a nice grill on it. The rest of the salad was mostly lettuce so there was nothing to rave about there. Meh

If we weren't full enough, my two friends got desserts: the mascarpone caramel cake and the lava cake a la mode. The mascarpone cake was very delicate, creamy and fluffy and had hints of caramel but it wasn't overpowering at all. I thought the dessert was perfect. The lava cake was unfortunately not lava-y on the inside and just tasted like a chocolate cake with ice cream. Nothing you can't replicate at home or can purchase from a box.

Our service was pretty good except for a couple re-reminders of the beers we ordered. It gets 3 stars because I would expect tastier and more interesting food at that price. Nothing terrible, just nothing awesome either. Oh, the mediocre expectations of chain restaurants...

Second time coming here and it's only been for happy hour! It's so great:) my sister and I decided to spend some quality time together. We sat at the bar because all the couches were taken. Delmar was amazing:) Excellent service. He was so nice and even made my sis and I a yummy shot because she recently turned 21. Cute! Kind! And good at what he did. No complaints here lol oh and the food is always good. Next time I go here I'd like to see the actual menu though. I'm sure it's delish. Dessert was also very good! Overall this place is great to go out on date or hang out with the girls.

Went to a Sunday lunch with my mom, but never again.  The service was awful and it wasn't even busy at all.  My mom ordered a chicken flatbread only to find two hairs (not hers) and a piece of plastic wrapper? No thank you...

I remember we visited this restaurant more than a year ago and whatever we ordered was decent,  (my memory plays tricks on me). Well, we decided to go there on 4th of July, and it was a rude awakening for me. I don't know how one person can possibly eat their appetizer and a main dish. The prices are not cheap (for this kind of a restaurant), so Brio Tuscan Grill tries to please people by serving non-human portions. 

Our friend ordered one of their salads ($15!) - it was such a disturbing mess on that plate. I think they put every vegetable and fruit they had in the kitchen. Then I received my bruschetta - it was ok, but too much of everything on top plus I would prefer less balsamic vinegar. If you ever had bruschetta in rural Italy, I can tell you that this was not even remotely close to real Italian bruschetta. Of course, I got 5 big pieces for an appetizer. My spicy shrimp with eggplant was drenched in oil and eggplant was too bready. I ordered it instead of a main course, but couldn't finish it. My husband got himself lasagna. Ok, this was the final straw. Come on, you could feed at least 3 people (and I'm being modest). Lasagna was just ok, but I couldn't stand to look at the portion and the sauce, which came straight from a can. 

What is going on? Why are they oversizing everything? I felt as if I was an animal brought to a feeding before being slaughtered. Apparently, it is just me, because the restaurant was full, and it looks like a lot of people on Yelp really enjoyed it. I won't spend my money there anytime soon, but if you're willing to give it a try, share your main dish or expect to take it with you (considering you like it)

On the positive side, the decor is pretty and their booths are comfortable.  My husband really liked their artichoke and spinach dip. The service was nothing to rave about.

Btw, what kind of Italian menu  has lobster bisque on it? I thought lobster bisque was 100% French

We used to eat here all the time, but at this specific location, my last three meals came back prepared with old food. We are talking about lettuce with pink edges and smelly chicken with a rubbery texture. Not willing to risk foodborne illness, we have not returned. Their other location at Town Square, however has never disappointed.

It was my first and last time at Brio. The service was disappointing and the waiter was not personable or attentive at all until he presented us with the bill. 
When I made the reservations, I notated it was my daughters 25th birthday. Obviously, no one read it so why bother putting down extra instructions?  No one said Happy birthday or offered a house dessert to celebrate the occasion. 
It took 15-20 minutes before we received water or bread on the table.
Drew, the waiter basically ignored us and spent a majority of his time telling the patrons in the booth next to us his life story. 
They ran out of fettuccine noodles and substituted spaghetti in the pasta dish we ordered at the same price. How does an Italian Resturant run out of pasta?
I choose to spend my money at the Mission in Scottsdale where the food is great and server Simone is superb!!

Made a reservation for dinner and they asked if we were celebrating a special occasion. I mentioned that it was my friend's bday and when we were seated at our table, a handwritten card with a voucher for a free appetizer was waiting for my friend. It was a simple thing but totally blew us away. Nice job Brio!

I have not once had a bad experience in either locations an would recommend the lamb chops an chicken parm to die for!! Also for an appetizer you must try the spinach artichoke dip they have its honestly AMAZING!!

I had lunch at Brio on 10-28-16.  Very good service, low to moderate noise level in a relaxed and comfortable atmosphere.  I had a generous and super fresh chopped house salad and a bowl of some excellent mushroom soup at a total of just under $10.  Soup and salad came with a good quality crusty bread and several slices of a crispy, seeded flatbread along with a generous portion of salted butter.  The service is consistently good here but I would prefer if Brio were a stand-alone restaurant as parking is a bit of a challenge.

This was our first time trying brio and it was exceptional. The service and the food was amazing! Our server Jessica was very sweet and was able to recommend great dishes. We had a little bit of everything! The lobster bisque, spicy shrimp and eggplant, and lump crab cakes were delicious and the chocolate lava and cheese cake desserts were to die for! Definitely going back!

Brio's Happy Hour is getting worse and worse.  I would have given Brio a strong 3 stars or a week 4 months ago.  

I still think their Sunday Brunch is solid and the dinner options are fine.  There are certainly better options out there for both.  Their wine list has always been stale and conventional.

The most disappointing thing is their changing quality and quantity of HH items.  HH was the best thing they had going for them.  The first month that their Happy Hour was going the portions were much larger and it seemed as if more care was taken...when their burger was first added it was great for the price.  The patty has changed and it is now a crappy burger covered up in a good I-N-O style burger spread.

Had a romantic impromptu date with my love. If u can manage it, sit at the bar. Most fun. Happy hour was awesome. Great prices for amazing food. Brio burger paid almost nothing was fantastically orgasmic... Med rare! Yum yum.
Great food but my favorite part about Brio is the tiramisu!!! I've come just to have dessert when visiting Las Vegas

My review is not for issues with the food, but the cleanliness (or lack there of) of the restaurant on Friday night when I was there. There was hair on the tablecloth, lots of it! It wasn't on the top, it was on the part that hangs off he table. I brought it to the attention of the waitress and she said that was disgusting. I also pointed out that the hair was greasy and she cleaned that up, but never bothered to do anything about the hair on the table. The plates on the table (for the bread) had so much water that when my friend put her bread on one of them, it got soggy. The food was good, but my experience upon being seated made me wonder about the hygiene in the preparation and service of my meal.

Dear management im hear to inform you that your company needs to follow through. I love your food i order and have recomended my clients to go there for date nights to lunch. I watch want i eat like most people so kids meals are more my portion size . I recently order in the past week i was told that i couldnt recieve it at discounted price which was fine im not cheap i will pay but i dont want to waste food by buying full size. I was told that i will not be served by there manager do to the fact that i gave him more service by sending in more customers . well mr. Manager your rude unprofessional i as well as my team will not be returning. Also i work with well paying clients who are always looking for a new place to eat I will not recommend you guys anymore though your food may be great I will not put up with such despiteful rude people

We visit this restaurant each time we are in town. The ambiance, friendly wait staff and mostly delicious food are the best in this part of Gilbert which seems to have more than its share of fast food restaurants. The portion sizes are more than generous and the value for your money is excellent. 

The bread and crackers they serve almost before you have a minute to catch your breath never fail to please the palette.

Where the restaurant did not earn top points concerns their menu which creates a few challenges for a plant based eater. Almost every menu item has cheese or some other dairy or meat included. They could really benefit from updating the menu to include some truly delicious pasta dishes and create some raw vegetable dishes that are not smothered in oil, cream or both. Even the minestrone which is heavily salted and thick with a heavy tomato paste aftertaste needs a fresh update. The minestrone soup tastes just like the sauce they put on the pomodorro pasta dish. This seems like such a no brainer for the chefs to come up with a few menu items that would be more appealing than ordering some overcooked roasted vegetables and fingerling potatoes without the parmesan cream. 

My husband chose the fish cakes which he loved.

I had never eaten at brio till last night. I was excited because I had always heard great things. I ordered a the chopped salad and lobster bisque. My boyfriend order the shrimp and lobster pasta which I was excited about. Our food came out in a timely manner, but as I was about to eat my salad there was a large hair which was very off putting. My waitress so kindly apologized and brought me another salad. As I was waiting I ate some of my boyfriends pasta but it had no flavor and there was only a couple pieces of seafood. Couple hours later I got home and began to feel ill with the symptoms of food poising. This experience was very off putting and unfortunately I will never be back.

Atmosphere - If the Pope decided to make a bootlegged version of the Cheesecake Factory and build it smack-dab in the middle of the Vatican you would have Brio Tuscan Grill. I know, I know, the Vatican is nowhere near Tuscany, but I think you get my point.  

Service - Have you ever disturbed an anthill and watched the whole colony explode with activity? That's how Brio felt tonight. There were servers, bussers and ancillary staff hastily moving about, keeping everything in order.  Like a finely tuned machine, every angle was covered, every crumb quickly swept aside.  Did that teenager just windex my menu? Henry Ford would be proud, for apparently the US restaurant industry has become a quintessential assembly line operation. If the formula if followed, so too will profits. 

Food - The food tastes great. Is that any surprise? Among other things, my entree contained the following ingredients... lobster, shrimp, fettucini, mushrooms, asparagus and heavy cream.  I am almost insulted they didn't throw bacon, truffles and a few sticks of butter in there. I love food and I was really hungry, so what I had for dinner at Brio would be the equivalent of giving an alcoholic a bottle of Louis XIII Cognac and asking if they like the taste of it.  Effin A yeah I liked it! What do you expect? There are some foods on this wondrous planet of ours that simply taste incredible regardless of the setting. I should have ordered the roast chicken so I would have a better idea of weather or not this place really knows how to cook. Oh, we also had the fried ravioli appetizer. Stuffed with ricotta resting on top of a very good marinara sauce. Don't even get me started.  

Summary - Either way, what I had was very good, but it's nothing that you can't get from about a dozen other Italian chains out there.  It's like the macaroni grill but with larger portions, nicer bathrooms and a 30% price hike.  Next time I am starving, craving a rich, creamy pasta dish and I happen to be in the neighborhood I'll probably come here again. 

And lastly, the red wine served at Brio is effective, as I am sure you can tell from the above review.

i probably had the best service at this restaurant than i have ever had anywhere. Elana the hostess was friendly from the start. Q our server was absolutely fantastic and made some amazing strawberry lemonade for me. MJ the manager was nice enough and came around to our table to make sure everything was fantastic for us. i for sure will be returning to this restaurant. fantastic staff.

Food was on the salty side. Not many vegetarian friendly options. Plenty of paid parking spaces. Just an okay restaurant nothing to fancy. I really enjoyed the bread they gave as an appetizer.  Not really a big fan.
30+ min behind on "reservations?"  You kidding me? Don't overbook. Don't call it a reservation. Don't accept walkins until you're caught up. Jesus.

I saw some friends having lunch on the patio and wanted to surprise them by picking up their tab. I went to the host stand and asked for a manager, they sent me a Megan. Megan was very helpful and I was able to buy lunch for my friends as a complete surprise. Props to the staff for being very helpful in a slightly odd situation. Thanks for helping spread some smiles.

This establishment is in the Tivoli Mall. The service was very good. The food was excellent. We ordered Campanella Carbonara and one of the Risotto specials. Both were very tasty. Also a Caesars salad and a nine oz glass of house wine. Price was reasonable.

Happy hour: love the lounge and patio atmosphere. $5 cocktails and $2.95 appetizers! The shrimptini and spicy shrimp & eggplant appetizers were awesome as were the peach bellinis. The shrimptini was refreshing though a bit heavy on the dressing, and the spicy shrimp & eggplant was gooooood, as in I-want-to-dive-into-a-pool-filled-with-this-stuff-and-eat-my-way-out kind of good! Get the ravioli caprese if you dig Costco frozen meals and hate caprese - i.e. there was virtually no caprese. The formaggio was also kind of bland, which says a lot since I am an asiago lover. I still love you, Brio, and I suppose I can't really complain too much since $30 (including tip) got me a round of drinks and four appetizers. Still my numero uno at Scottsdale Quarter.
Happen to show up during happy hour and was pleasantly surprised with the great deals they were offering! Our server was nice and it was not crowded at 3pm on a weekday. The food was delish too!

Not going to lie, we waited for 15-20 minutes to get service. But, beyond that, the service was great. On person that stood out to us the most was Jaime. He wasn't our waiter but he offered us cheese and had a Huge smile on his face. We joked a bit and laughed and he really set the mood for our party. We spoke to the manager about him and he was very pleased to hear what we had to say.

My husband and I used to LOVE this restaurant.  The last time we went there for lunch will be the last. We  were seated in the back of the restaurant walking by a mostly empty space. We were then ignore for 15 minutes. No one came near us. Of course we left. I see the writing on the wall. Bye-by Brio.

I always like this place.... Thought I reviewed it before.... Good atmosphere and good food. Good service.... Has one of my favorites... Beef Carpaccio. This is definitely better than B&B at the Venetian !!!!
Best Happy Hour in town! It's Martini Wednesday !! $5 martinis. And great food, lots of choices!

Heads up...strictly a happy hour review!

You can't beat a $2.95 happy hour menu.

There's quite a few choices to pick from and if you pick something ugh- well hey, it was only $3.

The BRIO burger comes with Provolone and housemade chips and seems to always be overcooked. It could use a little but more flavor, but I usually can only manage to eat half of one , which actually works out perfect because my gf can eat the other half. I am a man, and I do have the capacity of eating a full burger, but I dont find this burger delicious enough to want to eat the whole thing. The house chips are really good though.

Beef Carpaccio - I didn't know what this was when I ordere it. It said beef so I ordered it and when it came out it I didn't want it. I still ate it because i didn't want to be a d-bag and send it back, but basically what i learned is that this is raw beef. This entree came with field greens, capers, and mustard aioli. I know, i know, i should have probably wiki'ed what carpaccio was before I ordered it - but hey, it was only $3 and now I know I don't like it.

Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant: BOOM, winner. This is shrimp with Romano crusted eggplant and a black pepper cream sauce. Great taste, decent sized portion - order one if not two.

Shrimptini: Another winner winner, chicken dinner. Basically, chilled shrimp served in a martini glass with roasted tomato cocktail sauce and fresh lemon. So gooood.

Spinach & Artichoke Dip: Comes with this crispy parmesan flatbread that is more filler than anything. I didn't much care for it. 

As for seating, it's only bar seating and out of the 3 times I have been here - it's a challenge to find seating. It's like that feeling you get when you're in the mall parking lot during christmas time looking for a spot to park your car....you have to be vigilante otherwise some other 40 something milf will cut you off and take your bar stool without looking back. 

If you're in the mood for a modestly priced happy hour and dont mind a wait - brio is the place to be.

Great Italian food! Atmosphere is so relaxed and comfortable. Come for a lunch break between shopping at Town Square or enjoy a nice dinner out on the patio with wine.  We ordered the roasted red pepper bruschetta, the lobster and shrimp Pasta, and for my 5 year old the kids macaroni with a side salad.  Good portions too. Everything was delicious.
Really good italian food for a decent price! There is usually a long wait.. We had to wait for an hour, but the ambiance and quality of food was worth it! I ordered the pasta alli vodka. Delicious!

I have been visiting Brio at Town Square since a long time ago. Approximately since 2007 or so. This is the place to celebrate family birthdays, bring people when visiting from out of town. I have had very good experience with staff until tonight. My son's 14 bday dinner. The waiter was the most clueless waiter I have seen comparing to restaurants in the level of Brio. From the beginning, he forgot to bring my soup, i didnt bring it up thinking it was an honest mistake. Then, i was without a drink for 21 minutes and when I asked him, he never brought it. My daughter had to go to the bar area to ask and another gentleman who brought my drink while our waiter was high fiving and hugging every girl including the hostesses that would cross his path. When our dinner came out, we usually get a "Did your dinner come out ok?" from a regular waiter. This guy said " Are you all happy now?" After the drink incident which im sure someone told him about it, he didnt even recognized and owned up to his mistake but ignored it completely. To top it off, he comes towards the end to ask if we wanted dessert(Of course we said no) and made a comment if our party of 4 switched places on the table....I just had to make a comment to see if he gets it and I said; "Maybe you should come around more often"...that comment flew in front of his forehead and he didnt even have a reaction to it.....I have never seen this guy before but next time I go and if i decide to go back to this location, I will make sure I dont get this waiter and run away from his area. Tivoli Village location is almost the same distance for me. I guess i will make that decision later. I consider myself a good tipper(20% to 25%) for average service. At the same time, I give less and even $0 if the experience is a disaster like tonight. I am not looking or any freebies or anything like that but i someone needs more info on who this individual is, please feel free to message me or comment here.

Posted by my wife since she doesn't have a Yelp account
"Very disappointed that my review from yesterday shows that I wrote it last September. You're a class act Brio's, own up to a bad review once in awhile. 
I love Brio's in Town Square. My husband and I take out of town friends whenever someone visits. It's always part of the Las Vegas experience we love to share. We took a very dear friend tonight who is visiting From New Jersey. She's waited for years to go. As always, the food was great. However, our server was lousy. First time ever! We had to ask someone else to bring parmesan, a little extra sauce for my crab cakes, my husband sat for 15 minutes with an empty wine glass...we were told she had 'other customers'. It was 4 pm..not busy. She just wasn't good. First time I ever saw my husband leave a 10% tip. Such a disappointment from a place we love so much.":

I love the atmosphere here and had the Pasta Brio for lunch which was great! also think they have the best tiramisu ever!! must try it! i left before happy hour started but heard from other customers there as i was leaving that it was really good. i will come back and try that next time!!

The food has been good every time I go, and the atmosphere is great.

But, there was one time in particular where the service was disappointing. There were only 3 of us, and the restaurant was mostly empty, but we waited at least 15 minutes before our server even came get our drink orders. He was a middle-aged balding man, and he had a HORRIBLE attitude the whole time! He brought us waters, and after he left, I made a comment about how mine didn't have a lemon but the others did (this wasn't an angry comment, I was just pointing it out as a coincidence because I don't like lemon in my water). He came back a few minutes later with a full plate of lemons, set them on the table, said nothing, and walked away. I was stunned. Our food took forever, and he was so rude. If I got him as a server again, I would switch to a different table; he was that bad. For a nicer restaurant, that behavior from waiters is totally unacceptable! I wouldn't be surprised if he treated other customers this badly.

I love the food and the decor is great, but I think some of the waiters probably need a few lessons in customer service!

Delicious food, great portions and kid friendly. I always order the Mahi mahi or whatever seafood dish they are offering. Waitstaff are wonderful and attentive. 4 out of 5 stars for the hostesses. Ive gone in quite a few times and its always teenage girls standing there talking to each other, offer me no smile or greeting upon entering or leaving. Had a nice talk with the manager that was more than open to hearing me out and agreeing there is a problem. I will be back for the delish food for sure =)

You cannot beat the happy hour at Brio....the appetizers are seriously yummy, and $2.95 each works for me!  I met a friend this evening, we sat at the bar and had a fabulous time.  We ordered the Spicy Shrimp/Egglant (YUM!), Margharita Flatbread (light and good) and the Meatballs w/ Polenta (great but slightly salty) with two iced teas and a gin/tonic our bill was $21.00!  It was packed, as usual, great vibe, nice atmosphere, I really enjoy this place!  I have never had a bad experience here...for a chain restaurant, this place really is spot on with a nice, upscale feel.
I have been to Brio several times in the last 6 months. The food is consistently very good. The bruschetta is amazing! The service is always good and the prices are reasonable.

Just had lunch from Brio Town Square. I'm wishing I hadn't. I had the ceaser salad (8 leaves and part of the stalk) the dressing was good. The HALF BURRATA & PROSCIUTTO SANDWICH that tasted as if tapioca had a kid. The complete lack of flavor made it a sad meal. To make the box more appealing baked crisps were put in. A solid challenge for even to eat even one. They have made items that can be used in construction. NEVER AGAIN!!!

Brio Tuscan continues to offer the best tasting, best value Happy Hour in and around the Kierland/Quad area of Scottsdale. The other Happy Hour restaurant we would recommend would be Tommy Bahama's.

Happy Hour at Brio run from 3 to 6, Monday thru Friday. 

They have for $4.00 Bruschetta and Margherita Flatbread (photo); for $5.00 they have a fabulous tasting Beef Carpaccio with capers and aioli mustard (photo), Tomato Mozzarella Salad, Potato Skins (photo), Buffalo Chicken Nachos and a whole lot more. See menu photo. 

Brio continues to offering $5.00 Martini's on Wednesdays and Wine on Thursdays.  Their only shortcoming continues to be their minuscule bar area with limited seating.  What they really need is to consider is an expansion, because the outdoor seating just doesn't work well in the winter, when our snow bird friends arrive. 

Our most recent tab came to $23.75 including taxes, but before gratuities.  Good food, good drinks, good value!

Enjoy!
Brio's is the perfect 4 star restaurant. I always enjoy! Most dinners cost between $22-$29. It's location is excellent so many things to do inside town square mall.
Great food paired with the worst service I've ever had. Received our entree before our drink. Had to walk to the bar to get my water filled. Never again

Ate at Brio last night for dinner and was very pleased with the meal.  We sat in the bar area and the atmosphere was comfortable, absolutely nothing to complain about the service, and the food was delicious.  I had the Lasagna which was served with a mixture of alfredo and red sauce.  It was seriously one of the best lasagna dishes I have had in a long time.  Loved the bread plate before the meal.  One thing that stood out on the service: I dropped a knife while eating, and by the time I was able to pick it up, a waiter was already at the table with a new knife and took the one I dropped.  It's the little things that make tipping feel like it was worth it!  The only thing keeping it from getting a higher rating is it did feel like a corporate restaurant.  In this case, that's probably not a bad thing because I would imagine the food and service remains very consistent.  Brio is definitely above average in both categories.

This was my first trip to Brio and it won't be the last. The bar was pretty packed for a spy on vegas open bar from 6-9. We managed to snag the last 3 seats at the bar at 5:45 which was lucky considering it was standing room only by 6:30. The service was definitely above average, quick and courteous even when they were swamped with all the event goers. I can't comment on the drink prices during happy hour because we were taking advantage of the free peach sangria and cucumber gin gimlets but the $2.95 tasting menu in the bar area is fabulous.  
The Ravioli Caprese arrived with 3 generously sized pieces of ravioli in marinara sauce. Not only was this dish tasty, but for $3 I was impressed by the portion size. The Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant was my favorite of the dishes we ordered. The portion is smaller than the ravioli but the flavor makes up for the size. So good, and only $3. We'll order two of those next time. The Margherita Flatbread was a little bland for my taste but between the other dishes and the bartenders plying us with free booze it's hard to complain.

We enjoyed our Easter brunch at Brio, they took reservations which is great when you have hungry kids.  The kids meals were huge, my son had a big bowl of rigatoni with a full chicken breast which was very tender.  My husband and I ate Pasta Brio and it was delicious, my sister had a great GF meal too and enjoyed her pasta.  We also shared a really good tiramisu!  I have not eaten here in awhile but I think we will make an effort to come more!

Amazing food. Best risotto I've ever had ordered risotto with shrimp, did not disappoint. Amazing wonderful beautiful delicious. Also ordered lobster bisque, Lasagna, A few other things. Everything was excellent, delicious. I make my own lobster bisque from scratch and have for many years, this was as good as mine. Rich and creamy, lobster flavor perfect, fresh. Little pieces of lump lobster in it wonderful.

I will definitely give the an E for effort! Our server somewhat tried. I understand he was busy with three tables but he seemed to ignore me when I was asking about my drink. When he finally came I watched fix my drink as it is instead of making a new one. Now I have a watery him when I told him that it needs to be double strained!! Ugh!!! Our food was ok! I just expect edit to be bigger considering what I have seen in pictures on YELP!! Not very happy with this place! I'm only going to Town Square Brio!! They have better service there! I rarely give one star but this place really deserve it! If the have a no star I'd give that!! No wonder it slow here!! At least he knew the menu well!! Thanks for nothing Alberto! I think that his name!

I have been to Brio before and normally sit in bar area. on this  visit I was meeting my girlfriend and her family from out of town. Monday afternoon not to busy got sat right away. now to be fair I did ask for another table so I was given a different server. took a few minutes for him to come by and he did greet table nicely. there was 3 adults and 2 kids we ordered some ice teas and that took at least 5 minutes. 
our server Josh came by and took our order then brought out bread. food was brought out without Caesar salad, which we had to ask for. one of the children ordered the kids mac and  cheese did not like the food. so I had to flag down another server to find my server to get her something  else to eat. finally our server came by and never mentioned  the new order. I let him know about the new order and he went ànd brought it over. 
overall food was okay but service  was not. server was only at table 4 times including he never checked back to see if we were okay. a man could of been manager only stopped by once to see if second order was okay. I am sure based on business maybe server had off day as the alternative  would be he was not good at his job.

$2.95 tuscan taster menu is where it's at. A great happy hour. My personal fave the spicy shrimp and eggplant. I think I need another order. Loved the brio burger and pepperoni flatbread too :) yummy.

We ate here recently and had a wonderful experience. I got the crab cakes which were delicious. At first my order had gotten mixed up with the crab cake crusted salmon but it was quickly fixed and they gave me a lobster bisque order to tide me over. The lobster bisque is addicting, so delicious. The crab cakes were amazing and I had no problem eating every bite. Can't wait till we go back again.

Brio is amazing hands down but the service is what really puts any restaurant over the top. I've never received such amazing genuine service from everyone that works at a restaurant. I sat at the bar this time and Terri was the bartender. If you ever have the chance to interact with her consider yourself lucky. She is so full of energy, fun, and attentive. She became very busy the day I was there but she always checked on me to make sure I had everything I needed or wanted. She's funny and all around a good genuine person. Every server that passed by me always asked how I was doing and how my food was. Jessie one of the managers is the cherry on top of amazing service. He is always cool calm and collected and I see him running around with the servers helping them out. He's a genuine guy who cares about the way his restaurant is ran. If you're looking for good food and GREAT service this is the place to be!!!

Brio has not maintained the quality standard that it had when it first opened. Crumbs were all over the booth, food was very slow coming, it took too long to pay, and most importantly, the food just wasn't as good as it had been on numerous previous visits.

They are in a prime spot at Town Square and I'm afraid they might be resting on location to keep patrons coming in the doors, rather than improving the food quality.

Our last night in the Phoenix area and this was our last stop! I had already eaten a trillion times that day and the whole week--needless to say I wasn't as hungry as I normally am. On  tjhis certain Friday night after 7pm, the restaurant was very busy and there was a wait. What I did like about this restaurant is they take your phone number and they will notify you via text when you table is ready. We had a 40 minute wait so this gave us plenty of time to shop! The hostess was very nice! After about 35 minutes of waiting/shopping at the mall, a text was sent to let me know my table would be ready soon and to start heading back. My husband grabbed the table before I made it back but the hostess kindly directed me to our table. Once seated it took our waiter a moment to get there---hey were busy so I understand. He finally came and took our drink orders while we looked over the menu. I tried their pink lemonade (not sure what the lemonade was mixed with) which was delicious! One thing that I did not like was our waiter waited until we waited for a while, placed our drink order, had a our drinks refilled, and placed our food order before he brought bread to our table. For the most part he was very nice. Our food arrived and I ordered a Brio Chopped salad and added a side of grilled chicken to go with it (only three dollars or so to add chicken to a salad). My salad, the chicken, and the restaurant dressing was very good! My daughter got the kids pizza which was the size of an adult pizza that could feed two people--at least! Her pizza also had fresh ingredients and tasted good. My husband ordered a Strawberry Balsamic Chicken Salad--which was soooooo good! My mother in law ordered a Caesar salad and barely received any salad in her bowl. The waiter was nice enough to take the salad back and have them add more salad to her bowl. The original salad she received ordered was very skimpy on the portion--I am not even sure if it was a joke or not. Although we didn't order any of their major menu items, the items we did ordered were really good. I am not a major Italian restaurant eater, but when I return to the Phoenix area and have a larger appetite for Italian, I will be sure to give them another try.

We had our wedding reception in the large private room and I am so glad we chose Brio for our event. The food was amazing, our guests could not stop talking about how good everything was. And the service was great, the waitresses were on top of it the entire night. They really exceeded my expectations, our reception could not have gone any better!

First time in a Brio Restaurant. Great ambience and cozy dining hall decorated luxuriously. I am not fond of Italian pasta but the Campanelle Carbonara and the Lobster Bisque was so good and perfectly satisfied my picky taste bud. The appetizer Calamare was the best I've ever tried so far. The Triple Dessert plate was excellent. My family now loved this place. Our waitress Alisha we specially attentive to our needs and has successfully made us all feel at home. She has served us excellently!
Will definitely go back to this place!
Been coming here for years and it only gets better.  I really like the prices as they are reasonable compared to other restaurants that are not nearly as good.

The staff: Somebody's always smiling, so that's a good sign.  They're cordial and they know their menu.  Most of the servers I've had there have been very friendly, got the time to know us and chat it up a bit.  Sometimes we come when it's busy and we don't see our server much; which is fine, I don't like when people hover anyway, but it would help if we didn't have to wait for them to walk by so we could ask for something.

The goods: Incredible happy hour.  The Brio Burger is probably my favorite thing to get but I've tried just about everything on the HH menu and I can't remember disliking anything.  The basic menu can get a little pricy.  I ordered a salmon salad something or other once, $14.95.  I won't say it wasn't worth the money because, oh my God it WAS.  But, I'm just saying, pricy (at least for me).  I love their dessert display.  We do something similar at the fine dining restaurant I used to work at.  They bring the plate over so you can look at your desserts.  Very good eye-catcher.  I always order the chocolate cake thingy (I should really learn the names...but whenever I order I sort of just point and say, "I want THAT.  Please and thank you.")  Their raspberry mascarpone cheesecake is heaven.  It melts in your mouth and the crust is the only thing left to chew.

The atmosphere: I think in all the times I've come here I've only sat inside once.  I love sitting outside watching the shoppers of Tivoli Village.  It always kind of freaks me out though when one of the valet boys starts running for a car.  I have to turn around and see the red uniform before I realize it's not some guy stealing a lady's purse.  Other than that, everything else is great.  The lighting adds a lot to the ambiance, from the restaurant, and other shops alike.  And my friends and I are always listening intently to the music, trying to guess the language and what they're saying.  I think coming to Brio is going to end up being a weekly thing for us.  We're all kind of night owls these days and we've got to start somewhere, best to do it where we can fill our stomachs and prep for the night ahead.

This was my first time at this restaurant and I was very impressed. I went with two friends on a weekday in the evening and there was no wait. The inside of the restaurant was nicely decorated and very clean. The service was also very friendly and attentive. 

The food was great. We ordered a bruschetta sampler appetizer which had a few different types of bruschetta on it. I wasn't the biggest fan of them, but that was a personal taste thing, my two friends loved it (sometimes traditional things just can't be out done). I had a glass of sangria which was decent, but tasted syrupy too me. These reasons are why I took off a star. 

My entree was delicious. The sauce was very light which is my preference (heavy creamy sauces make me feel like a blimp after my meal, some people are into that, but not me). I'd come back and order it again definitely. 

Also, they have a promotion right now if you sign up for their points club thing you get a discount on your meal that night (I think it was 20%), which was a nice surprise. Pretty much 100x better than olive garden, and for about the same price.

My dish was delicious and very well prepared. My partners on the other hand was a bit on the small size for an entree. The size portion for the pastas should be a little bit larger for the price. The atmosphere was ok a little busy, but this location is prime.

calamari was the worst I have had ever in my life. Definitely did not look like the pictures. It was just a bunch of bread crumbs and prepubescent squid bodies  Pasta was ok but had to wait 30 mins even though I had a reservation. For shame..............

Been here before, so this is my second time eating here. The place is nicely decorated roomy and airy, had the shrimp and eggplant and shrimp appetizer, it tasted phenomenal with an incredible brown sauce, a  piece of fried eggplant quartered under a all shrimp, this sauce will make you want to eat a door mat, but the quality of the shrimp, although tasty geared more towards a franchise restaurant not a fine dining establishment. I ordered the fettuccine with shrimp and lobster for my main course. Although again tasty (same small shrimp) and lobster, really? Asked my waitress if they forgot to add lobster to my dish, because I didnot see one piece or taste any half way through my meal. She apologized and proceed to bring me a plate of chopped up lobster chunks which I thanked her for and add to my meal, I finished my meal although good still no taste of lobster, I asked waitress if lobster was frozen and she admitted yes, which I had figured but even with additional lobster I couldn't taste it. The fettuccini tasted home made it was light but they could have made it without the bullshit baby shrimp or the frozen lobster what do you want for $20 bucks. When ordered the meal I had asked my waitress who was attentive and did a great job if there really was lobster and shrimp in the dish, and she said she I should have known you get what you pay for 6 baby shrimp fettuccine and 2oz of frozen lobster

I took my mother out for lunch on Mother's Day . The place was packed and I didn't know we had to have reservations.  But was told that the bar area was open. There were tables there and had an amazing lunch our server Reno Martinez made our visit perfect . He was very knowledgeable of the menu and helped us with suggestions. We where attended quickly and he made us feel very welcomed. I highly recommend anyone to sit at his section . Thank you Brio for hiring such great and profesional help... Thank you Reno Martinez you made my Mother feel special with such wonderful service ...

We were celebrating and decided to try someplace we've never been to before. The decor was lovely and ambiance romantic without feeling stuffy. Service was very good. 

We shared a Caesar salad to start. It's was fresh, crisp and tasty. My husband had a filet mignon that was very tender and flavorful. I had lemon chicken. It was good but not excellent. The sauce wasn't lemony enough and a little shy on capers for my preference.  The accompaniments on our dishes were the same. I thought the vegetable were excellent, mashed potatoes were good. I had enough leftovers for us to share for lunch the next day. My husband had the creme brûlée dessert. Good flavor but served room temperature rather than chilled.  We will gladly come back for the steak. Next time I'll try their "light" chicken piccata to see if that is more to my liking.

Yesterday evening, a group of 10 of us decided to celebrate our friend's birthday by having dinner at Brio. I had been looking forward to trying Brio for a long time as I'm frequently in Town Square. 
When we first entered, I really liked the decor! It was very majestic and beautiful - kind of reminded me of Caesar's Palace!
We immediately ordered drinks. My best friend decided to order a Bloody Mary while I went with my favorite extra dirty martini. Both cocktails were disappointing. 
Our server then brought out several baskets of warm bread which was delicious and probably one of my favorite parts of the meal!
Our group ordered several appetizers to share - the calamari and the spicy shrimp & eggplant. Both dishes were excellent. 
Since my cocktail was unenjoyable, I decided to play it safe and order a glass of wine to complement my meal. I knew that I was going to go with seafood so I went with the Sauvignon Blanc from Italy which was an excellent choice! It was a very crisp and refreshing wine.
For the main course, I went with the Pesce Piccata (wild caught cod), which unfortunately lacked flavor, was rather dry, & overall disappointing. The angel hair pasta that came with it also tasted somewhat undercooked. My best friend ordered the evening's special - sea bass - which was delicious!
Finally, we ordered a few desserts that we all shared at the table. I had the crème brûlée and it was fantastic!
Overall, my favorite parts of the meal were the bread, appetizers, desserts, and overall ambiance. The service was very good too and our server was polite and knowledgeable. 
I plan on returning to try other items and specifically to try their happy hour!

Went here for Easter brunch with my wife and a good friend. We sat outside on the patio and had a wonderful meal. The service was extremely courteous and friendly. Our food was served pretty quickly, and most importantly, it was delicious. We split an appetizer of bacon and tomato jam bruschetta with ricotta cheese and I would do it again in a heartbeat. I wish I could have taken a jar of that jam home with me. It was one of the tastiest things I've ever eaten. For my main course I had Gorgonzola-crusted lamb chops. They were cooked medium well, I asked for medium, but they were still great. The Gorgonzola crust was delicious and the mashed potatoes on the side were also quite good. It's a little pricey for brunch, but if you're not on a budget this is an excellent choice.

This was my first time here and found my experience to be delightful. The restaurant is beautifully decorated big area and bright. We were greeted appropriately and taken to our seats right away. Our waitress came within a minute to offer us drinks. She was very nice and knew the menu. As always I like to ask questions just to see how much they know. I got the crab encrusted salmon which was light and delicious. The portions are good. The only thing I did not like, was that we were sitting right next to where the waiters pick up the food.  Everyone  
  all the waiters and waitresses were standing there whether they had to work to do or not. Some were working hard others were standing around talking and sitting so close to that area they were not talking work. Would  I go back? Of course the food was really good and the atmosphere was  calming and relaxing.

brio!

friendly staff. great service. spacious. huge portions. ordered the pesto pasta - light, fulfilling, and flavorful. great quality!

will come back again and try other things on the menu! check out the picture i posted.
This is a very nice Italian restaurant in San Tan.  Food was tasty and they have a nice beer and wine selection.  A great place to meet up with friends for a night out!

Always delicious. Still has the best lava cake I can find anywhere. The chicken limone is always delicious, as well as the Caesar salad. Pasta alla vodka was to die for! Also, get the bruschetta sampler if you've never had their's before. Guaranteed you will find a permenant favorite for the future.
It's like the Olive Garden made good (autocorrect changed it to "food" originally, and that's not a bad fix).

Cant get enough of their happy hour menu! 

Their blackened shrimp with eggplant was to die for as well as their Beef Carpaccio and their Crispy Tuscan Tots. It was so delicious that we ordered two of everything! The Roasted Garlic, Spinach and Artichoke Dip was ordinary but I do like the Pita like chips they come with.

Im not a fan of alcohol but those Sangria Rosa's are yum! Beware though, two of those and you'll be at a good level.

Trying to make it a weekly HH date with girl friends.

This place used to be great - maybe they are just having one of those days today - but they can't even seem to give you a correct wait time for delivery pick up.  Was told 15-20 min, which seems pretty standard at 8pm -- showed up 30 min after order and was told it would be another 10 min.... this was after waiting 5 for someone to show up at the host/hostess desk...
I was hoping that the food would taste as good as memory served me and at least be worth the annoyance- unfortunately, quality must have been on the chopping block here... $55 dinner for two ... such a waste - I chose this over the Olive Garden for flavor and over Maggianos due to the fact they get my order right only half the time.  BUYERS REMORSE all the way.  Food was bland and flavorless - tasted like reheated Olive Garden and for 2x the price! Plus the wait I would have had at Maggianos along with the aggravation of being quoted the wrong pick up time and offered empty apologies.
Unless you're good with overpaying for a low quality meal, I would recommend elsewhere- there is an Italian place down the street that at least still takes pride in quality food and customer service.
Will not be back ever again; a shame - I have had birthdays here, brunches here, date nights here and it was always fairly decent.  It has been about a year since my wife and I had the taste to swing into a Brio - but will not make that mistake again.
Food fairly basic. Run of the mill Italian.  Came out quick. Our server Cody was very friendly guy.

Las Vegas is not a walking city.  The hotels are far apart.  The suburbs have strip malls.  The heat in summer (and the cold in winter) makes much of the year unpleasant outdoors.  But in the spring and fall we can have some absolutely gorgeous days.  Last night was a beautiful warm spring evening.  It was not windy and the clouds overhead were spectacular.  This was the perfect time for dining al fresco and what better meal to have than something Italian.  A friend of ours who works at UNLV suggested this new restaurant in Town Square.  Although we have been to Town Square several times (and visit Fry's next door regularly), we had not tried this restaurant.

We were seated on the outdoor patio promptly and ordered the carpaccio which was recommended by our friend.  I'm glad we did as it was delicious.  I decided on the lobster risotto and my husband had the Veal Milanese both accompanied by a lovely Italian white wine.  There was plenty of lobster and asparagus in my risotto.  My husband's veal was tender with just enough capers and lemon butter to flavor it, but not to make it soggy.  I am not much of a dessert person, so we skipped it.  Sipping the last of our wine while the the sky grew dark was the perfect end to a beautiful day.  We will be back.

First time dining here.  The service was good except our waiter forgot to bring extra bread then after asking a third time, it showed up and my husband's second drink never showed.  HOWEVER, the ambiance was great and the food was better.  Will dine here again.

The food is usually good here, but I had a very bad experience with a staff person during our last visit and I will never be back because of this. 

We came here to eat dinner outside. I have asthma and environmental illness, and I try to avoid indoor spaces unless I am familiar with them. We asked to sit outside. I waited outside with my kids, by the outside door, while my husband went in to get a table. There were 2 5-top tables open right next to each other. 

My husband was the only one in there. Told her we wanted to sit outside. 4+ a baby. She said "ok, I'll seat you right away." Disappeared, and when she came back there were two men who came in after my husband. She approached them and sat them BEFORE US! Meanwhile I'm Waiting outside with my kids and the patio is busy and I can't go inside! So the kids and I went and stood next to the other available table since we knew she was going to seat us there anyway. 

ELISA the hostess came out and screamed at us and said we needed to come inside. I've never been so embarrassed. 

1. If she seated us right away and in the order of which guests arrived, we would be sitting already, and not in the way. But, she sat the people who came *after* us first; two middle aged men who do not have a disability and did not have to hold a 25 pound toddler (welcome to Trump's America where men are more important...). 
2. She was going to be seating us at that open table anyway- SO WHY DID WE NEED TO COME INSIDE?! She tried to say we were in the way of wait staff but we were standing together, right next to the open table that we were GOING TO BE SITTING AT ANYWAY. My husband started explaining to her why I can't go inside- she wasn't having it at all. Kept insisting we had to come inside. It was insanity! So we left out of frustration and aggravation. 

I called Brio and spoke to the manager, Vina, right after the occurrence. She was understanding and compassionate. Hence the 2 stars. But these staffers need to be trained properly. The way she treated us was outrageous. I was screamed at by a 19 year old in front of a crowd of guests at this restaurant because she was incompetent. Never again.

Decided on Brio for happy hour and was pleasantly surprised that they had a new menu. For happy hour you need to sit in the bar area, either inside or out and there are a few high top tables that are included. We arrived at 5:40 and had about an hour left of happy hour which runs until 6:30. The movie started at 7:30 so we had time to chill.

For drinks waters, a white peach sangria 5/5 and a cucumber basil gimlet 3/5. For apps we ordered the beef carpaccio 5/5, shishito pepper hash 5/5 very nice flavoring with the sriracha aioli and the potato skins topped with cheddar cheese sauce, applewood bacon, green onions and lime crema 4/5. Service was wonderful and very attentive. They came by to let us know it was happy hour last call so we got another round of sangrias and another beef carpaccio. 

Thank you Brio for providing such a nice start to our evening at Town Square.

Well the best thing is that they offer a happy hour at 9pm (last hour before closing) not just drinks but bar foods too. Very nice. Area is nice a little but quite for a Tuesday night. Lol.  Drinks could be a little stronger but for the price decent.

I came here with my dad.  I got a side salad to start which was delicious.  And I got the Chicken Limone as my entree.  It was so delicious!  My dad got the Fish Limone Pasta dish.  It was ok.  I think it would have been better if the fish was grilled or baked.  It was fried fish which made the already heavy dish even more heavier.  The only thing I didn't care for was my drink.  I got the tropical cosmo that was on happy hour.  The happy hour prices are unbelievable.  This was my first time here and I will definitely be back!

Normally i don't bother with town squaresince it's not my scene   but friend wanted to come for happy hour.  Service was great,  our waitress was friendly and attentive. The happy hour food and drinks were good,  the artichoke dip was delicious. The pineapple drink had a good balance of flavor and alcohol, forgot its offical name.  It was a nice atmosphere even when it got crowded.
The appetizer wasn't as good as expected the calamari wasn't cooked enough. The entree was really good and the drink they could use a little bit of more alcohol in it.

Great restaurant !! Went with a large group and service was outstanding would also like to mention that the food was fabulous. Pricing is also very reasonable for the standard of the restaurant. Wish I could remember our server's name she was very great at anticipating the needs of our table.

Yummy brunch this morning at brio. Ordered the Bennie and hubby got the French toast. Amazing!!  Only problem was, we asked for the heater to be turned on about 4 times and then Bloody Mary had to be remade. Otherwise a great time

My wife and I went here Tuesday night for dinner with a plan to come a bit early, sit at the bar, and enjoy some happy hour cocktails.  Our plan was thwarted when we realized this place was some sort of cougar gathering place.  The bar was packed with little hope of somebody getting up.  So, we just took a seat in the main dining area without a wait.

Anyway, everything to say about this place has already been said on here.  I expected much more because of the location but it really was just an upscale Olive Garden that charges triple.

The Gorgonzola Lamb Chops appetizer was great and so was the Bistecca Insalata.  I should have just stopped there and let that be my dinner.  Instead, for an entree, I ordered the Garganelli Carbonara which was waaaay too creamy, oversauced and under-flavorful.  It was not advertised like that on the menu.  Almost everything else on the menu sounds good but I doubt the stuff tastes as good as it looks.  My wife had some sort of shrimp dish that looked excellent but was way to salty and no doubt contained frozen shrimp.

The service was very good but I probably won't be back.  I almost never have pasta so when I do splurge I want it to be delicious and the stuff here is just blah.

Given that 99% of Italian restaurants in this country serve Italo-American food and not authentic italian food (take it from me, I lived in Bologna, Italy's food capital), I will say that Brio's lasagna is the closest to authentic I've ever seen at a casual italian place in the US.  They use not only red meat sauce, but also a creamy bechamel, which is how it's done in northern Italy.  Now, as for the gi-gundo lasagna portion size, that is authentically american!

Walking in, the restaurant has a Tuscan feel.  It had a sophisticated appeal.  There wasn't anything in the decor that set it apart from other Italian restaurants.

The main thing I got out of my lasagna dish was "cheesy."  2 types of cheeses and the alfredo sauce made it pretty heavy.  What I did like about it was that it came in very hot.  It isn't what I would expect from a lasagna and I've had better home-cooked lasagna.

I love the dessert selections.  So many to choose from and all in little bites.  After a heavy main course, having small treats ends the meal perfectly.  I had the creme brulee shot.  The dessert was very rich and creamy, what I would expect from a full sized creme brulee dish.  I wouldn't say it was the best creme brulee I ever had, but the small bite satisfied my sweet tooth without feeling guilty of eating too much.

My suggestion, don't get the lasagna.  Try something different.  But enjoy the small bites of desserts.

went with a co-worker, nice warm evening so we sat on the patio. It was a nice atmosphere, but right next to the airport, so you'll be chatting enjoying the outside lights & warm breeze, then a  plane is directly overhead & you think a wheel might fall onto your table...
food was good, liked the non-booze drink options, free refills, service was very good. 
I would go back.

This is my favorite restaurant. I have always visited the location in Gilbert, but this Scottsdale location is definitely awesome. The surrounding area has tons of shopping and it's a gorgeous area. My personal fav food here is the lobster bisque; I never come here without getting it! The bellinis are also delicious! You won't ever get a Bellini anywhere else. Seriously, I've never had a complaint anytime I've come here.

Went here for lunch today and it was good! The sour dough bread they give you prior to your meal is phenomenal!  I ordered the Campanelle Carbonara and it was delish! Enough to share, especially if you order it for lunch. The Campanelle Carbonara had chicken, crispy bacon and spinach in it, YUMMY!

The only thing I would change on my end was the friend who I had lunch with, that's about all. :)

NOTE: This is  not a 'walk to' restaurant if you are cruising Kierland....hopefully someone will think of building a pedestrian bridge from Kierland.
A Tuscan feel upon entering - to me if smelled of crusty bread too!!

I think the restaurant had only been opened a few days - so everything was quite new - including the service staff. No worries there.

We stopped in for a quick lunch - they had a great selection of salads - good portion sizes!.
Will be back.
I will only come here for lunch from now on dinners are to overpriced for food that is not top notch!!
Alexis was out server and she was the best I've ever had. I'm completely impressed with our experience. You have to go here!!

We booked Brio for a small wedding reception from across the country, sight unseen, and were pleasantly surprised with the venue. Not only was everything arranged just as I had requested for our dinner, but the food was amazing (steaks were cooked perfectly) and the service was excellent!

A good restaurant indeed! I enjoyed the food of course ..the location is at best. The waiter and waitresses were so nice. The ambiance is somewhat beautiful...I loved the one we ordered,that was a bomb...
I want to go back there again if given any chance and order the same dish haha!!
The only thing so so was the Caesar salad I ordered, plainly twas only lettuce and crotons plus they don't have blue cheese, failed..
Otherwise, overall I'll give 8:))

Me, my daughter and three friends had dinner here this evening.  We were celebrating a birthday.  The meal was delicious, the service was excellent and they even let us bring in our own cake.  Our waiter graciously brought it out, candles lit, and served it for us at the table.  I would highly recommend this establishment for your special celebration or an evening out.

I always have a good meal when I'm here. Service is great, pretty big place so don't have to wait a while and they have an amazing HAPPY HOUR! Its too bad its mon-thurs because i'm always free on fridays.. but most of their food during happy hour is So incredibly cheap i end up getting all!!
My faves:
Harvest Salad
Tomato Bisque Soup
Vodka Pasta
Shrimp and Eggplant thingy.. (forget the name, its an appetizer)
Must try the above listed.. its amazing~! So good that i didn't know it was a chain restaurant. Good job BRIO!
**Not the best place for Vegan, but can be vegetarian friendly.

Really? I'm confused by all the glowing reviews. Brio is basically a glorified OG. Everything stinks of a chain Italian restaurant. I did appreciate the fact that they were very accommodating to our need for a speedy lunch. I had a flat bread pizza which was just fine. Tasted nothing like a true Neopolitan thin crust pizza, but its bastardized Italian food and for what it was it was just fine. If you're a fan of the OG this may be the place for you- plus they have a fantastic patio for outdoor dining.

People! What is the infatuation with kale?  I had brunch today and ordered the brunch bowl. It was very good, however, why screw up great taste with bitter nasty kale?  I picked the kale out and enjoyed the rest of the dish immensely. Nice service staff. I definitely recommend Brio for a charming, relaxed and enjoyable meal.

Had dinner here Saturday night and the evening couldn't have gone better.  Our server, Amit, was excellent...personable and attentive without being intrusive.  Made sure everything was on time and just as ordered.  (Would return just to have him serve us again!)  Our meals (pesto pasta, Mediterranean shrimp special and chicken ravioli) were excellent and it was pleasant eating outside.  Glad to see the uncomfortable chairs have been replaced.

i went here will not go back. went with a party of 12. really lousy servixe i ordered veal parmesan it was greasy taisted bad was really a thin slice and the sause taisted canned. we also order seafood fettuccine and it taisted good but  uhhhh where was the seafood? also when i asked the waitress why she kept walking away and not take my order. she said because she didnt like me. Id like to add to this review i received a call from the manager it was sort of strange and hanging said he would call back but never did. I pray i never have to spend good money at this place again. Portions were just cheap.

I would give this place more than five stars if I could. The food is so delicious, and their outside patio is awesome! I love the pasta alla vodka. They have so many amazing appetizers too. The shrimp and eggplant, and calamari are my favorites. The service here is beyond great. My husband and I spent three hours here on our first date, and eat here at least once a month.  Everything has always been perfect.

I'm a sucker for pasta and pizza, so Brio is totally my place! I lunched here a few days ago with my fiancé and his brother. We snagged a table outside and, even though it was blazing hot, we were kept cool by their awesome little misting machines built into the fence. Our waitress was Dominique and she was adorable and very friendly. 

We ordered the Beef Carpaccio to start and it was fantastic. I ordered a flatbread pizza and was pleasantly surprised-- I was expecting a long, thin flatbread with toppings, but I actually received a cracker thin crust pizza with gooey, browned cheese and crisp pepperonis. Delish! We also ordered mimosas, but they weren't very cold... but that's my only complaint.

Ate here for the very first time and it was absolutely delicious! When we arrived we were greeted and seated right away by the Hostess. 
 I had the Blackened Tilapia with grilled veggies which was cooked to perfection. Our waiter was very attentive and was super friendly! I love the ambiance of the restaurant and I look forward to dining here again especially for the price.

We went on a Sunday night it was pretty busy since it's the holidays... It's more of a casual dressy type of place... Our server was very slow he only came by twice to refill our water... We received bread and butter when we got there the food itself came by really fast... I ordered the shrimp and lobster fettuccine which was delicious the lobster bisque perfect for the cold weather. The truck did a great job the only reason it's getting a four stars instead of five because of our server I could  have died of dehydration!!!

Lunch special was an angel hair pasta was really tasty and the shrimp was very fresh. I had the Eggplant Parmesan which was nice & crusty per the menu description with a very light marinara sauce but the buttered pasta on the side was not hot enough. Disappointing. Service is excellent, we got our food quickly.  We ordered the dessert sampler but they were out of the creme brulee and the server was very gracious and was offering us a good choice of substitution.  We ended up ordering the tiramisu which was very delightful!!!  A definite must try place!

Horrible service. If you want to be ignored this is the place to go. The one and only "Hostess" decided to flirt/chat with servers and forgot about the people in the lobby. 
Our server noticed we had kids and kind enough to get us child menus.

Filthy, nasty, dirty, gross.  The cleanliness standards I experienced with my glass reminded me of a Texaco latrine.

 I was served a glass that was disgusting inside, the coup de grace was a 3/4" booger-looking thing that I didn't notice until the diet Coke was consumed below the yellow and black organic mass approximately 1" below the top of the glass.  Upon seeing that vile thing in my drink, I immediately noticed that the rest of the glass was nasty and appeared unwashed before coming back out to me.  I tried to go on with the meal but lost my appetite.  That glass was the most filthy thing I've ever been served in a restaurant or at any meal as far at that goes -and I've lived in Africa where hygiene is a luxury in some places.  I'm still trying to get the image out of my mind and feel sick that I drank from that glass.

This indicates a total breakdown in cleanliness standards.  From the dish washer to the soda fountain operator, anyone should have seen that the glass was nasty but failed to do so and served it to me anyway.

My wife still enjoyed her meal, and it was 3 stars by itself (pumpkin ravioli special).  We made sure to leave a good tip for our waitress because she did a great job under difficult circumstances.

The restaurant didn't charge me for the food I couldn't eat after the nasty; however, they didn't comp us anything for ruining my anniversary lunch.  I try to be gracious when this happens, but wow, that was disgusting.
Love the brunch on the patio. The salmon salad with shoestring potatoes just hits the spot. The egg whites vegetable omelet with fresh salsa is one of the best egg white choices out there.

Had dinner, lunch and brunch here many times. Food is always good, servers are great and there are no surprises. I've also been to parties there and the restaurant is always accommodating in the back room.

My husband and I love coming here for the chicken limone. They also have a fantastic happy hour - the peach sangria is the best. You need to show up before 5 to get a table because it's popular, but well worth it. We've taken our parents a couple of times and they went on and on about how good everything was.

I love the atmosphere at Brio.  Although it IS indeed a chain, which is not my favorite part of a restaurant, it is still nicer than your average.

Their outdoor seating is spectacular.  The misters make it bearable to sit in the summer Vegas heat, the fire pits are great for the cooler evenings.

The food is pretty solid - I love their entree sized salads.  I can't comment on cocktails or desserts, as I've never had one there, but I'm guessing it'll push above average.

Overall, it was a great place for chilling on the patio or for a business lunch.

My family and I went to Brio for a nice Sunday lunch. The food is always good and I love the atmosphere. They gave my daughter some dough to make her own pizza. when she was done they brought back a mini pizza with olives as eyes and pepperoni as a mouth! She loved it! The only downer to a nice lunch was that the restaurant seemed to be COVERED in dust! Even the cloth napkins had dust/lint on them. Not very appetizing to say the least. Brio, please do some dusting and we will be back again!

I ate here with a few friends. I had a salmon dish and it tasted great. The service was awesome, we showed up about thirty minutes before closing and the server was patient with us and made us feel right at home. We were the last ones out of the restaurant. I definitely will come back.

I must admit, I had high hopes for this place... and given the posh, upscale atmosphere, I was ready to be wowed. The only "wow" I had, however, was at how disappointed I was.

The food was far from spectacular; my Caesar salad had very little flavor (even for a Caesar salad,) and my eggplant pomodoro had just barely enough sauce to get some with each bite. The flavor on this, as well, was somewhat lacking. The spaghettini which came with it, however, was well presented and had a nice fresh flavor.

Then, of course, there was the service. I would highly recommend NOT going here for a quick lunch. We ended up being there for nearly two hours, 30 minutes of which was waiting for our check. In addition, the server was rather brusque when my friend asked for recommendations.

Overall, definitely not impressed. For as lavish as the decor is, and given the prices on the menu, I was expecting far better. Most certainly not recommended.

Went for dinner at Brio after a symphony at Tivoli event, I had made reservations. Once at the restaurant thank God for the reservation because it was extremely busy, the hostess was a little on the not so nice side but it was fine, we waited for about 15minutes and then got seated. We ordered the eggplant with shrimp and oh my God this appetizer is delicious. For dinner I got the salmon dish which was pretty good and the bf got the shrimp and lobster fettuccine which was delicious also. Definitely recommend this place, food is great.

Always a great experience when I come here. The staff knows their stuff! They're always friendly and helpful. The interactions are nothing but genuine and the atmosphere is awesome. Keep up the good work all!

Shoutout to Gail for her excellent service!

The generous serving of Bruschetta Sampler was visually appealing and worth every bite. Tummy wishes fulfilled! It was "molto delizioso"!

I ordered the very appetizing and Strawberry Balsamic Salmon Salad, served with mixed greens, grilled-to-perfection salmon, grapes, Gordonzola and herb vinaigrette. Can a fish dish be refreshing? Yes!

My friend ordered the Mezza Chicken Limone (middle picture) with capers, lemon, roasted vegetables, and Yukon Gold mashed potatoes. Lovely!

Another friend ordered the Shrimp Mediterranean (top photo). Spicy, grilled shrimps served with orzo, farro, broccoli, asparagus, tomatoes, spinach, Feta, and drizzled with pesto vinaigrette. Mouth-watering!

I recommend this lovely eat-to-your-heart's-content restaurant in lovely Tivoli Village. Bring your visiting friends & family. They will enjoy it as much as you!

I've been here a few times and really like it.

The food I've ordered has been really good.  They have a big menu with a ton of choices, which is always nice.  Even their dessert has a nice selection that compliments coffee or tea perfectly.

The restaurant itself is really nice too.  Its typical Tuscon decoration but it goes above and beyond.  

I've always had good service here so I have no complaints about that (lets face it, any restaurant can have a bad waiter at any time).
