There is patio dining as well which I like because I love to people watch.

It is a little bit pricy, but the food quality is better than most. 

All in all Brio is enjoyable.

Yes, its a chain restaurant, but probably one of the best ones that makes you feel like you are fine dining. 

Although there is always a wait at the Town Square location, its worth it. 
The carpaccio is one of best in the city... Don't be shocked when you see the platter it is served on.. For a meal for one, it's perfect. 
My friends had the grilled salmon and pasta. No complaints.. 
As for the kids menu, WOW... a large selection with great portions to eat now, and lunch for tomorrow. 
The service was great, and I love the decor! Great place for a nice family dinner!

One word..."Bleh".

I am thinking this is a place where writing a positive review is a condition of employment or something.  However, I do see that many reviews are for "Happy Hour".

My buddies and I took the 129 reviews and a 4 star rating as a guide but were incredibly turned-off.  Really a shame as we didn't have many opportunities to meet-up for dinner on the trip.

Decor like a typical pre-fab faux everything chain restaurant (which I later learned to be true).

Service  by a clueless 12 year-old.  Very sweet girl but clearly overwhelmed and not supported by any of the "managers" walking around trying to look cool.  No server assistant help either (we had to pile-up plates for them to figure-out it might be a good idea to remove them).

Food was horrible.  Yeah, not overly expensive, but how hard is it to make this kind of basic Northern Italian fare decent...if not great?  The bread is a joke, the noodles I had asked for as a substitute for mashed potatoes (yup) were dried out from sitting in the pass under a light too long, etc.  Really pathetic.

Oh well, we should have veered away when we saw it is attached to a shopping mall area.  Our fault (and the reviewers on Yelp sad to say).

So, veer...veer at all costs.

Elegant atmosphere and nice presentation of dishes. Sausage and spaghetti has great hearty flavor and chef Gustavo also will do custom dishes as well. He wants everyone to fully enjoy their dish and he is seen out greeting patrons. Good food with him there!!!
Ambiance is exceptional, just wished the food matched.  Food is underwhelming.

My first time here was on a somewhat windy Thursday. There were 3 groups of people ahead of us and the restaurant was just opening; it was 11 AM.

We were asked where we wanted to sit, and we said outside for who knows what reason since it was quite windy that day. Our meal was delicious. I don't know the names of the two breads they put on the table, but they were really good! 

I spent approximately $60 for two people, during lunch. This included a shared appetizer, beverages, and 2 orders from the lunch menu. I haven't tried the dinner service at this location.

I was posting another review and came across a rather poor review for Brio.  I have been here about 6 times, but have never ordered a real meal.  We are more of the order 6 appetizers and drink a bottle of wine crowd, so I can really only comment on the service, apps, and wine.  Service has ALWAYS been great.  Never had an issue, or a wrong order, anything like that.  Everyone has always been friendly and competent.  The wine list is very good, and I am a wine snob.  Always served at the correct temperature, and nice selection.  The appetizers have always been really good - we especially like the seared scallops, gorgonzola lamb chops, beef carpaccio, and the lobster bisque soup!  Don't let the mediocre reviews here scare you away from trying it... pick a nice night and sit outside on the patio!!
Not bad.  Service was good and food moderately priced.  More of an open concept, so it is loud depending on the night.  I order the crusted filet and it was great.  I'd go there again.

June 10 was my first time at Brio as I was here for a family friend's high school graduation party. For my first time, it wasn't bad, but since there were so many of us in our group, it took a long time for our food and drinks to come out.
Though it was on a Saturday night, parking was decent and the restaurant wasn't really all that busy. Whether it's for another graduation party or a different event, I'll be back another day.
Very Nice place,so good service-fast and friendly staff,pretty view,food is delicious a specially bisque soup.so good for brunch and dinner
Great place for dinner with the family or a group of people. The food was very good. I would definately recommend this place.

This is another one of those places I've visited a dozen times or more in a variety of locations, but seem to fail to check in most of the time.  The accumulated experiences mandate that it's time for a review.

For a chain, I think it's one of the better ones.  Brio's food is consistently good and most of the time, above average for a chain restaurant.  We find ourselves going there with some frequency lately since this location is just a few miles from the house, in the nearby and still growing Tivoli Village.  Easy to get to, great underground parking (a huge plus in the summertime!), and a nice place to stroll after overeating.  (Yep, it's gonna happen.)

The food:  Two visits ago I had the Pasta Fra Diavalo.  Not my first pasta dish here because they do a great job with not overcooking the pasta.  The flavors were wonderful as alway and the dish was served at just the right temperature.  I don't know if they heat their dishes, but I noticed that the bowl didn't cause the pasta to cool rapidly--something that happens too often at many restaurants.  During my most recent visit I was able to sample a number of new tasty menu items:  a fresh Caprese Salad.  It was especially specially fresh and had just the right amount of dressing to allow the mild tomatoes and mozzarella to shine through.  Next the group of us shared a Sausage and Pepperoni Flatbread, cooked well so that the flatbread was at just the right place between soft and too crisp.  Next, Black Pepper Shrimp featuring middle-sized, peeled shrimp served on slices of eggplant and drizzled in a fantastic sauce.  Brio found a great way to combine shrimp and eggplant into what became an instant favorite.  I'll definitely order it again.  I sampled Brio's take on bread pudding for dessert and was pleasantly surprised.  I wouldn't normally order bread pudding, but I'm glad I had the chance to try this.  The portion was just right to follow a full meal and the pudding and sauce were delicious.  I'd definitely get it again.

The beverages:  If you're in the mood for a little wine with your dinner, I recommend the White Peach Sangria.  I'm not a fan of sweet wines or drinks, but this was nice and refreshing, and not too sweet to keep me from enjoying it.

The service:  Top notch for this kind of restaurant.  The staff is always there taking care of you, but they're not in the way or hovering.  I also love that they'll always tell you the specials, then make recommendations if you prefer.  I almost always ask and when recommendations come, they seem genuine rather than what might otherwise feel like they were told to push a particular dish that day.

Overall, well done Brio!

Updating my last review from three stars to five. After a rocky service on my birthday a few months back, my family and I decided to give Brio another go. The experience was just like the Brio I remember and used to frequent so often. Jessie the manager made sure to make everything right and went above and beyond to ensure we had a great experience. Our waiter was so friendly and funny which really made the experience that much better. Kudos to Brio for doing it right and for reassuring me that this is definitely my forever go to destination for weekly girls cocktail nights and business lunches. All of their food is amazing and I'm glad this was such a pleasurable experience. They have excellent misters so don't be shy about sitting on the patio to enjoy a nice dinner or app.

Came here with my boyfriend yesterday, our first time visiting. We ordered from the happy hour menu - and absolutely loved it! Food was great, drinks were great and the prices were surprisingly really well-priced. We also really loved the way it's decorated inside, beautiful atmosphere. Our server was excellent as well! Highly recommend this place!
Went here with the family while checking out Scottsdale Quarter. Food was great. Service was good. Only thing lacking was selection of draft beer.

Came across this place while strolling in Town Square.  It was a perfect day for the patio so we sat outside.  The shrimp Mediterranean, lobster ravioli, and creme brûlée were delicious!  Service was really nice too!  My only complaint is that the lemonade tasted like a cup of sugar, but I generally dislike sweet drinks.  An umbrella toppled over onto another table due to strong winds that day, but luckily no major injuries.  Be careful of those desert winds!
Good food, good service, good atmosphere. 3 stars only because I don't consider Brio's fine dining, but never had a bad experience there. Good portions as well.

Brio is absolutely AMAZINGGGG!!! We love bringing all of our out of town guests here. The happy hour is just so HAPPY! We love the Tivolli location because of the cuteness factor! The drinks and food are great! 
One little thing did happen last time we were in which NEVER EVER happens. They were out of our favorite dish :( the beef carpaccio. It was so sad because we normally both order one. It was still a great evening and we will be back soon for the beef carpaccio!!!

I had brunch at Brio in town center this morning for a baby shower. I was with a large party and they accommodated us well, with plenty seating available for our large party and even a side table for the gifts and baby shower games. Service was prompt, and the food came out quick enough and servers were knowledgable on the menu. The cocktails I had were delicious and the food was good, however I could not tell you my servers name because he never gave it. Overall everything was "good", not great.

We had reservations but arrived earlier and were immediately taken to our table. The server arrived and took our drink order. We decided to have cocktails since they looked appealing on their promotional menu. We ordered the Berry Cooler and the Berry Cosmo and my gosh, were they disgusting! They tasted like chilled cough syrup. I asked my husband to let me try his and it was actually worse! So definitely a thumbs down on those! We ordered the Pasta Alla Vodka with shrimp and the Salmon Strawberry Balsamic salad. These dishes were amazing, totally made up for the crappy drinks we ordered (which were still at our table not to be touched)

Overall it was a good experience, we'd definitely go back. We just won't be ordering any mixed drinks
Just had another great meal / great drinks sesh. Love this place always come back here.

Same compliments I sent to the restaurant as well:

This was our first visit to Brio and we were so impressed. Everyone was so friendly and warm and our server, Alicia was fantastic. She described the menu to us with great detail and almost making it hard to decide because everything sounded so good! We were so grateful Alicia told us about the Summer special (Chicken Milanese and Lasagne) helping make it easier to decide since it was such a good value. She was so knowledgable about everything the restaraunt offered, the menu and how the food was prepared. Way more than we could have asked for, but such a pleasant surprise. I don't usually expect spectacular service at restaraunts, but typically decent at least. She blew me away with her service skills. I am so happy about this awesome experience, excellent service and delicious food. I can't wait to tell my friends, post on Yelp and come back to visit! Thank you so much! Worth every penny I spent in your restaurant tonight!

I would be such a happy camper if this restaurant chain opened up in California!  Their remoulade sauce and calamari is divine.  The shrimp and crabcakes with perfectly roasted vegetables (carrots, onions, peppers, asparagus, zucchini, etc.) are clean-your-plate ridiculous.  The cheesecake alone rivals the best with its cracked sugar crust, creme anglaise and peach melba (sweet raspberry) sauce drizzled all over its decadent behind.  Aww such bliss exists truly in a well prepared dinner!  The staff is also attentive and aware when you want to have a quiet moment or a full on party....

This place is a ten out of ten. The outdoor seating is beautiful (fire pits, outdoor couch/chair arrangements, beautiful lighting) indoor looks like a palace. Service was above and beyond. We were treated like royalty. If you are in Town Square, this is an absolute must try.

Giving a five star review for the exceptional service we received from Jenna the manager and Mauricio who helped make things run smoothly. During Fathers Day we expected it to be busy and it was. The food tasted great and Jenna rescued the afternoon after several mishaps. So appreciated her helping us out and restoring the celebration.

Brio has a great happy hour. It is only valid in the bar and patio area, but the weather is perfect to sit outside right now and it makes for great people watching. You can't go wrong with the Tuscan Tasters for $3.95 each. My favorite is the shrimp and eggplant. Best part of the meal was our waitress, Kimberly. She was so personable and had great recommendations on everything from which Sangria to chose to dipping the hamburger in the sauce that comes with the shrimp and eggplant. We will definitely be back.. And will request Kimberly.

Food was great.... service was horrible!  I've eaten at Brio many times and always love the place.

I went with my daughter yesterday for dinner. We were promptly seated by the host. We waited 10 mins for our waiter to come over. She took our order. We never got bread. Our drinks came timely. Got our appitizers timely. Main course took forever! And the waiter never came back! I sat there with no drink refill for 45 minutes. We literally never saw our waitress after she delivered our drinks (meals are brought by other staff). I had to ask another waiter for our check and he tell us "sorry I'm not your waiter". He gets our waiter and she brings the check over. I put my credit card in it and leave it on the table. 20 minutes go by and she still doesn't take it!!! Rediculous!

Did I leave a tip... yes I did... $0.01. That's right I left a 1 cent tip because that's all this waitress deserved!
I love this place! Eveytime I come to Las Vegas I stop here!

I hate to say this, but this place is lame.

We made reservations for 5 at 8:30. We came in and waited to be seated. There was no host/hostess at the front. Waited for a solid 10 minutes and finally 2 hostesses came and apologized for the wait. Why are there 2 hostesses if they are BOTH going to be occupied at the same time? Fine whatever.

Got seated outside. We made reservations for 5. Got four plates and sets. I asked for one more set... And I got the "Oh did I miss a set?" Yes you did. No biggie. 

Service is really bad. Not even mediocre, bad. Waited forever to get our orders in, very disappointing. I ordered the lasagna, but 20 mins into it (after we were served calamari and carpacciio, the only decent items on the menu), they came in to let me know they ran out. 20 mins later? Whatever, fine. They told me they could make me a spaghetti with bolognese sauce. I opted for that. Everyone's meal came earlier and they all waited for mine to come out (even though I insisted they go ahead and eat). I finally got this "bolognese" but it was like a pasta stew. Everyone knows bolognese is meat sauce and it's not supposed to be mushy and soggy and filled with sauce, but meat. It looked like they threw on the lasagna ragu. It was terrible! Even the meat of the sauce was not edible.

At this point I was done. My mother insisted that I let them know I didn't get what I ordered. I assumed that my voice wouldn't be heard considered the already bad service... but the Manager was the only redeeming quality of this joint: She offered an apology (that's all I expected), and dessert around the table. She didn't have to do that and that was nice. For that, they get one star.

Without it, it wouldn't be anything.

I would NOT come back here again and do not recommend this place for anyone who wants a romantic or nice italian experience. Bad food, bad service.

Food tasted good and was presented very well, however, I am a Celiac and asked for gluten free. Didn't get it. Was sick immediately after leaving restaurant.
Jesse, the restaurant manager contacted me immediately. I'm sure she will make sure this doesn't happen again. I'll be going back for a gluten free experience.

Stopped here with some friends on a Friday evening. The waitress was attentive and friendly without being overbearing. We were seated immediately and water and bread were out for everyone right away while we perused the menus. I ordered a steak and a salad and both were very good and reasonably priced.

We noticed as we were leaving there was a cool outdoor patio with a fire going. Wish we would have stopped out there for a drink. Looked nice.

This is an excellent go-to spot for dinner after enjoying a night at TownSquare.   I have ate here with my wife and kids on multiple occasions without ever being disappointed.   

What we ordered on our most recent visit:

1) Shrimp Risotto with Lobster Tail - 
2) Lobster Bisque
3) Grilled Salmon off the kids' menu
4) Cheese Pizza off the kids' menu
5) Crab Cake as a added side

While some reviews will say the menu is hit-or-miss, you will be happy if you ordered any of the above items.  The lobster bisque was delicious with a good amount of actual lobster in the soup.  The complimentary bread initially served upon being seated was great for dipping into it. 

The shrimp risotto and lobster tail was excellent.  The lobster tail was mouth-watering and the cheesy risotto was bedded with a generous amount of great-sized shrimp.   My kids' loved their dishes and the crab cake, albeit on the small side, was very tasty and not expensive.

The ambience inside the restaurant is nice enough for a romantic date for two but also enjoyable for families or a group of friends.  On Tuesday's starting at 5pm until 9pm, live music is provided which elevates the entire dining experience.   Loud, but not loud enough where you can't make audible conversation at the table.

Our servers have always been well accommodating to our every need.   We have had no problems here.

I will add that on previous visits I've also had a good experience ordering the beef carpaccio, caprese salad, brio steak salad, as well as the chicken limone.   While others might have said  'hit or miss' I've come to note that their menu so far has been one giant bullseye.

Came here for lunch and had a breeze getting seated. 

I really like the fact that our server was knowledgeable of the wine list because I am one to appreciate a good bottle of wine. She suggested the White Oak Chardonnay and to my surprise, I fell in love with it. 

The slice steak bruschetta is a must try!! The steak and cheese complemented each other quite nicely if I may add. 

I ordered the chicken piccata which I felt like you could never go wrong with. It was mediocre. There wasn't flavor that really stood out for me. The salmon has a good amount of seasoning on it which enhanced the flavor of the fish. 

Last but not least, the dessert menu! The caramel mascarpone cheesecake won me over! It was simply to die for! 

I can honestly say that Brio did not disappoint! Kudos!

Five minutes after submitting the below review, I received a call from Jesse the General Manager.  He was very apologetic for our experience, and promised the service would improve.  So, I will be coming back with a follow up review after we visit gain, but I do have to give cud-dos to Jesse for the quick response to my email.

Never again will I visit this location on a busy night with or with out a reservation.  I am so frustrated with the service we received at the Tivoli Village location.  First of all, we had a reservation for 7pm last night which I had made on Open Table.  We arrived at 6:50pm and were told it would just be a few minutes.  We told the hostess we would wait in the bar and we ordered a bottle of wine with the intention of having a glass and taking it to our table.  

By 7:30 pm, we went back to the hostess and told her we were still waiting.  She told us that were a couple of people ahead of us still, so we returned back to our seats at the bar.  At 7:40pm, our bartender Jose notified Jennifer (I believe, tall brunette lady working the bar) that we were still waiting.  She immediately contacted a manager (didn't talk to us, did this on her own initiative) who told her (and then she told us) that we would be next.  Finally, a bottle of wine down, we were seated at 7:55pm for our 7pm reservation.  

I finally asked for a manager and was greeted by a manger (he didn't introduce his name) and voiced my frustration about the delay.  He told me that "we are busy today" and offered an appetizer which neither my date or I were interested in.  Instead, we told him we were ready to order and would like to order a bottle of wine (I made it clear we didn't want a free bottle)  but again had to wait nearly fifteen minutes for a bottle.  

Anyhow, the risotto I had tasted hot but tasted as if it had been cooked early in the day and had been reheated several times.  Honestly, the whole experience was rushed and non romantic.  I was treated as number, and not as a customer.  Horrible experience, and the lack of remorse from the management really made this a bad experience that we will not repeat.

We had such a great experience there last night. Our server Jessica was very attentive and quite friendly.  Jessica made sure our glasses were never empty as well as checked up on us along with Jenna the entire time.  

My lobster and shrimp fettuccine was amazing, and the pasta was very fresh.  The sweet potato rosetteo was also amazing.  Finally, we couldn't have picked a better ending with the butterscotch pudding.

I have to say, this location is my favorite of all the Brios!
Food and service here are fantastic. The managers are hospitable. The bar staff always makes me feel like a regular.
A great place for Happy Hour, sit around a high top, and chat and mingle.  My Red Sangria and Burger were okay, maybe I should have ordered less standard fare.  Next time!

Ambiance: great. Appetizers: also good. The wine list: abysmal. Nothing under $50 was even drinkable. And everything over $50 was grossly overpriced. They have no sommelier on staff either. Next time, I'll just stop by Total Wine around the corner and pay a corkage fee.

Probably the BEST table bread I've had anywhere in The Valley. It was the closest thing to a real sourdough available in this state. Very tasty, and worth a visit just for that.

We had a horribly novice server that made the beginning of our meal frustrating. However, we complained to the manager, and then suddenly we had people falling all over themselves to take care of us. Good save, Brio.

The entrees were also a good save. The whole demeanor of our table changed when the main courses arrived. Wow, everything was really great. Good quality, good flavor, good presentation. We were delighted. The food was definitely a notch above any of the other Italian restaurants around.

Overall, not a bad choice if you live in the area. I don't know if it's worth a long drive, but it's a solid restaurant. Frankly, it's probably at least 4-Star worthy, but too many things went wrong on our first visit. Still, I'll be back (and hopefully be able to bump it up another star afterward).

I have eaten at this location 4 times now and have had an enjoyable experience each time. Yes, it is a chain. It does not try to be, nor claim to be a locally owned & operated restaurant. That being said, it is a very nice chain restaurant with a slightly upscale feel with lovely decor. I always order the Pasta Fra Diavolo with shrimp and have them add mushrooms to it. I like my diavolo sauce extra spicy so I also add some crushed red pepper which gives it a nice kick! It's a great dish so I don't bother ordering anything else. My dining companions have recommended the crab & shrimp cakes & the grilled salmon as well. The bread basket is also delicious, but be careful not to fill up on it! It's tempting, trust me!

HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!! Amazing food! Sat in the bar area on 10/17 got here around 8:10pm, everything seem to start off right bartender greeted me within 2 mins, gave me a happy hour menu. I ordered from the happy hour menu and my bartender walked away when he brought my drink over I had to ask for the regular menu. I ordered an Cesar salad, flat bread and lamb chops to eat. All my food came out in an timely manner but my bartender NEVER checked on me. My lamb chops were VERY tasty but came out cold. I had to physically get up and find an manager to come talk to in which they remade my lamb chops and they came out nice and hot! My bartender was aware that I sent back my dish but never followed up. The manager did come back within mins to check on me! Since it was extremely slow and the service suck that's my reason for two stars, I really wanted to rate 1 but the food was too good

A nice place, with a good location. I liked the atmosphere, the food, and the service! Started with the Kale Caesar Salad, which was tasty. Then, I had the Lasagna Bolognese, which was also very good. A nice, balanced flavor. The Caramel Mascarpone Cheesecake was very light for a cheesecake, so it didn't fee like a brick in my stomach. I enjoyed it! Overall, I really liked Brio. You won't feel awkward if you dress up, or dress down. Definitely, give it a try!

** YELP 100 CHALLENGE: 046/100 **

On our last Vegas trip, my boyfriend and I were in the plaza planning to watch Captain America: The Winter Soldier. We were starving, so we decided to look for somewhere to eat afterwards. Using my trusty Yelp app, I found that Brio Tuscan Grille was one of the highest rated restaurants in the plaza that was still open at that hour, so off we went!

The ambience and decor of Brio Tuscan Grille felt very classy and upscale. We weren't too dressed up, so we felt slightly out of place. However, our service remained top notch, and everyone was very nice, friendly, and attentive. Brio Tuscan Grille is a great place I'd recommend if you want a hearty Italian dinner. My boyfriend and I loved everything we ordered, which was the following:

-Roasted Garlic, Spinach, and Artichoke Dip: One of my favorite appetizers, so I usually always order this.. and Brio's is definitely one of my favorites I've had so far! The Parmesan flatbread they provide for dipping tasted so cheesy, crisp, and perfect. It was a good blend of flavors with the spinach dip, which was neither too salty or bland. Usually restaurants serve tortilla chips with spinach/artichoke dip, so I thought Brio's upgrade to parmesan flatbread was a very nice touch. Highly recommend!
- Lobster Bisque: Very creamy and filling. The lobster bisque I've had in the past had a stronger tomato, tangy taste. Brio's version is definitely more creamy and thick. While I liked it, it was probably too heavy to eat in conjunction with the spinach/artichoke dip.
- Pasta BRIO: I honestly don't remember this dish too well, since it's been months. However, we ordered this to share per recommendation of our server. I do remember the sauce being very savory and delicious, and I most likely enjoyed it. It's supposedly their signature dish, so I assume it's one of their more popular pastas.

Overall, I enjoyed my first dining experience at Brio Tuscan Grille. I usually don't like eating at Italian restaurants, because I'm never blown away by their dishes. However, Brio exceeded my expectations, and I highly recommend it to anyone in the area. If you're fan of spinach/artichoke dip, definitely order this as well!

Service was good. Our server Cinamin was friendly. The restaurant setting is absolutely beautiful especially outside on the patio. Personally, for my taste, the food lacks something. I had the chicken limone and just thought the chicken lacked seasoning. However I did enjoy the shrimp and eggplant appetizer as well as the white sangria.

Very disappointed.  Made a reservation.  Waited almost  15  minutes to be seated.  Was then brought to a table near the kitchen doors and a service computer.  Refused that table and we were told they don't  take reservations.  The tables are on first come first  serve basis.  We were then given a different table.  Seated and waited 10 minutes before our server appeared to take out drink order.  No bread was served.  We asked twice before we finally received the bread. 

Food was good but service definitely did leave something to be desired. Granted the restaurant was busy but no excuse for slow and poor service.

I'm starting to get mixed feelings about this place.  I was first introduced to Brio a year ago when I was in Dallas.  Since then, when there is a Brio near where I'm going, I always make reservations.  

This is the 2nd time I went to Brio at this shopping center.  1st time was OK except when I ordered a glass of house Cabernet and have to ask 2 times and never got.  When I was charged, the waiter asked if I wanted to take my wine to go.  I thought really????  Wine to go???  I told the waiter to just cancel the wine and give me a new bill. 

My daughter and I ordered the following:

Glass house Malbec ($10): if they are going to serve a glass of wine, either serve it 1/2 the glass or serve it in smaller wine glasses.  See my picture, I got 1/4 glass.

Caesar salad ($5) - it didn't come with parmesan cheese.  who serves a Caesar salad with no parmesan cheese????  I had to ask for cheese twice. 

Campanelle Carbonara pasta ($20) - This is my all time favorite.  It comes with spinach, chicken and bacon.  I wanted to go vegetarian so I substituted the chicken and bacon with mushrooms. It was still really good. 

My daughter got the kids rigatoni with meat sauce ($7).  My daughter really liked it. 

I will definitely go back again but don't order wine and make sure that they put cheese on the Caesar salad.

This place has always had amazing service and food. We can only go when we're on vacation now because the last time we went we found that they have no phone service.  We have never had to use our phone until this time. When you're on call and the hospital calls, you can't be running around the building trying to get a connection. In case you need to though, head towards the Apple Store.

Went to Brio to celebrate my friends and my birthday. She arrived earlier than I, and sat for about 10 minutes without being greeted. I arrived and sat for another 5 minutes before our server finally came over and took our drink orders. We were pretty disappointed by this and asked to speak to a manager. The manager came and told us she'd get us another server. We sat for about five more minutes when our original server came back to bring us a bread basket, but not the drinks we had ordered. We were there for 20 minutes and couldn't even get water. We will never be back

Literally had such an amazing server Gus!!! Went in on the 4th of July! We had happy hour right before it was over and he was awesome!! All of our drinks continued to be filled!! I never get such awesome service and as a server myself I am extremely picky! I live in Henderson so about 30 away from here but would come back for him!!!


Thanks;)

I love Brio.  Their outdoor patio is so much fun when the weather is not hellfire.  I recommend that you sit on the patio, order a bottle of wine and cheese, and enjoy the best Las Vegas has to offer.  I've been to Brio numerous times and consistently had wonderful experiences.  

Only once was there something that concerned me (undercooked meat).  Should they have caught this problem before serving the food to my guests and me, yes.  However, the chef and server both apologized and made things rights.  No harm was done, and I've never had any other bad experiences.

This is a place I love to visit.

This is the go to place for my boyfriend and I when we want to have amazing food & look around townsquare. 



a month ago - I take off a star because the last time we were there we sat outside & had the worst service possible. We knew something was wrong when the hostess told the other hostess to sit us outside and she said, " uhh you sure him?" hah.The food was still amazing. Just the fact that it took them forever to bring us our wine at first & when we asked for the check ( From someone that wasn't our server, 'cause OUR server disappeared on us) it took longer as if we were waiting for more food!

We went to have brunch just this sunday and had a great time. I got the Eggs Oscar & he got the Chicken & Chorizo Benny. Add some coffee to the mix, Perfect. Server was awesome ( tall guy). 


All in all, we love this place & our last visit just solidifies why we always come back.

I have been dining here for about 2 years. The carpaccio, steak salad, & tomato soup are delicious. Happy Hour is wonderful for a meeting with friends. My family & I  return for the superb service.  We always request JOHN every time, he is a huge part of the reason we return quite often (so ask for John).

My family and I have been here twice so far and definitely more to come! This place is amazing, super friendly service, great prices and tasty food. Even their children options are great priced and large portions. Sign up for their app to receive free items.

I liked the Town Square location the one or two times I was there. But the food I got at the Tivoli location was mediocre at best. The sweet potato and chicken risotto ($16.25) was gummy and tasted like paste. The fettuccine napoli ($15.95) was better, but nothing stellar. The best thing I tried was the kid's cheese pizza. Yeah, that means the place is kid friendly. The prices are reasonable -- although from what I hear happy hour is the best time to go since apps are $3 each.

I ate here on July 14. I had been wanting to try this place out forever. It took about 10 mins to seat us which was fine. It was just my son and I. My service was horrible through the entire meal. I'm surprised my server even showed up most of the time. My son ordered a cheeseburger that was charred and the bun was stale and crispy. I ordered a Caesar salad and the lobster with shrimp risotto. My salad never showed up and my risotto was still hard. The lobster was cooked perfectly. I will also add that my peach sangria was wonderful. Our deserts were pretty tasty. Overall I wouldn't go back.

Love this place!The decor is Tuscan and beautiful.Best lobster bisque ever!!!Warm and tasty bread basket accompanies the meal with delicious sourdough bread .Cant wait to get back here for happy hour soon.

Aweful!!! Literally tastes no better than my frozen Lean Cuisine lunches....and way over priced. I had the Pesce Picatta. Very bland! I had to add Parmesan, salt, pepper and squeezed a whole lemon on it. Helped a little bit not much. The fish tasted like a frozen fish stick and the pasta was very mushy!!  Italian restaurants should cook al dente. Ridiculous. I would NOT recommend this place.
Good place for sit down lunch l. Service is inconsistent, and will have a wait even if you see open tables. Liked the Roasted red peppers as an add on to meal.

Dinner last night was a big family gathering of 15 adults and 3 kids. We made reservations ahead of time (which was done by another family member and apparently was not the easiest reservation for some reason. The initial number kinda had a shocking effect on the restaurant -20 adults initially, not sure why). 
When I arrived, most of our family members were already there and had ordered appetizers and drinks. I ordered my main when everyone did so we could all eat at the same time. With too many good sounding options on the menu, it took me a while to decide what to order. Craving seafood and risotto, I decided to order one of the more expensive items on the menu, the shrimp and lobster tail risotto. My brother in law ordered the fillet minion and his wife ordered the shrimp and lobster fettuccini. Other members of the family ordered more dishes, if I saw correctly, one ordered the chicken risotto and one of the kids had an order of Mac & Cheese. There were chicken dishes ordered and pasta dishes and so and so forth. 
The food came out in a relatively good time, considering the size of our table. My dish was perfectly done. The risotto was creamy but with a slight bite to the rice, exactly the way it should be done. There was a decent amount of shrimp in the dish, maybe even a bit more than I expected. The dish might have been slightly over seasoned but for me, a person who always has to add salt to everything and likes bold flavors, this dish just nailed it. The veggies in the dish worked very well with the risotto, mushrooms, asparagus, roasted red peppers and tomatoes, everything tasted delicious. 
While my experience was great yesterday, I had to give the place 4 stars (and maybe could have gone for less if I tasted some of the other dishes). The comments on the table was "something is missing, this dish isn't impressive" that was for the shrimp and lobster fettuccini. Our second cousin who ordered the chicken risotto hardly ate any thing from it and refused to pack it and take it with her. The Mac and cheese from the kids menu came in an adult size dish with adult silverware and an adult size drink. This was kinda weird because everything ordered for the kids came out of the kids menu. Not complaining about their generosity but for a kid, this wasn't easy to eat, or drink! The fillet minion seems to have been ok, no complaints. 
Overall, my experience was great & service was excellent. Other members of the family, not too much, some may not even be returning to Brio because of the prices in comparison to the taste of the food. 
I think I would be returning with my husband next time (who couldn't join us yesterday unfortunately) and give some of their other dishes a try. I hope the other dishes will also be as good as the risotto!

This place was alright. I had the chicken skewers and we got the bruschetta quattro for appetizers. The bruschetta was pretty good. The chicken skewers you practically inhale...i.e. small quantity. So I payed $16.50 for these and there were like three wimpy chicken breasts on sticks with a mediocre amount of wild rice. I don't know, maybe this is to be expected from a place that seems to go more for appeal rather than food quality. It's definitely trying to take its place in Scottsdale as the cooler, classier version of the Cheesecake Factory. It definitely doesn't match up in terms of food, and I won't comment on the service because i've only been here once and maybe I had a sub-par waiter. The management is unorganized, but more on that later.

 My dad had two drinks and he loved them. That's about the only sure shot fired by this restaurant. But I mean it's alcohol... It's easy to enjoy alcohol. The generic cheesecake was also good. Again, it's easy to enjoy cheesecake. 

OK, onto the management. I understand that this restaurant is fairly new in Scottsdale so it's gonna be busy on the weekends. That doesn't give management an excuse to give out multiple reservations and not be able to give tables when people show up. OK, fifteen minute waits here and there with a reservation on Saturday is fine, but when it becomes a half an hour, you goofed up somewhere. I don't know who to bag on for this - the highschool hostesses, or the manager that trained them to figure out what time to tell callers when a reservation is available. A couple actually walked out after being waited for I don't know how long. The hostesses didn't even bother filling up the lounge. I'm sure if they told half the people that walked through that door that the lounge was free-for-all, first come first serve, same menu, same service, grab whatever table - the lounge would be filled. Instead people were getting tired of waiting, then asking what that table was doing empty. Then the highschool chick goes, "Oh that's just the lounge, you can sit there if you want. Same menu, same service." WELL s#%t, thanks for telling us now. 

I hope if you try this place you get good service and the $16.50 plate you order isn't meant to nibble on.

This review is for happy hour in the bar only.  If you are lucky enough to grab a table inside or outside before 630 pm you are definitely set to enjoy a budget friendly happy hour.  It was a Wednesday night about 6pm I was lucky enough to grab a table in the bar area.  It was very busy.  There was some weird guy playing a guitar and singing to keep me and my friend entertained while we waited for the table to be cleared and cleaned.  Not sure if this is a regular thing for brio now providing live entertainment but it was the first I have seen. In any case he was ok, not terrible.  Lol. Our waitress I believe it was Monica K. ( at least that's the name on our receipt) was great!  She ended every sentence with..."it's my pleasure".  Even though it was obvious she was slammed, she never lost her cool and never lost her smile.  She came around to let us know last call for happy hour, which was greatly appreciated.  We ended up with three martinis, one spinach and artichoke dip, two brio burgers and one chocolate cake all for $40.87.  What a steal! Especially since the food is great too!  Burgers are juicy. They have a great variety of items on their happy hour food menu.  In addition to a happy hour drink menu, brio offers $5 martinis all day Wednesday's and $5 wines all days Thursday's. Give it a try and check it out. They have a big outdoor patio.  See you there!

This is our go to restaurant, the grilled mahi fish is always good as it is a specialty. WE have yet to have a bad experience, the staff is great and if you come early before 6:30 PM. Minimal  Waiting.

Have you ever gone to a dinner party & EVERYTHING tasted great...even though you had made that same thing yourself before and it was just OK?  That is how I feel about the food at Brio.  I have been to the new Tivoli location a few times now and love the happy hour. Be aware that because this is between Kona grill and Sun City, so there is a wide age range.  It had been a while since I had a 65 year old man hit on me, but it wasn't creepy...(is that creepy?).  Service is great each time but if you sit outside the sun just blares down during the happy hour.  The house white wine is nice and light and a reasonable price.  A nice place.  My friends and I really enjoy everything we have tried.

Not the best experience when they give you napkins to sit on cause the booth is so dirty. And then to find something in your salad that isn't supposed to be there...not a good experience. At least the company was good.

Came for friend's 21st birthday. Caesar salad was so garlicky that it was inedible and left a terrible taste to start off the evening. Carbonara "lightly salted" was delicious, but it appears the portions have gotten smaller. Our server was very attentive and kind. Offered a complimentary chocolate dessert for the birthday boy.

Came here for a Sunday brunch. To begin, parking was obviously chaotic at the fun-filled Town Square. I parked far but enjoyed my stroll over to the restaurant. Once we got to the restaurant, we were asked to wait a few minutes to get our outside table ready. The restaurant is large and well-decorated. I loved the high ceilings and it could be the elder, classier sister of Cheesecake Factory. We asked to be seated outside and the waitress who walked us over was kind and let us pick the table we preferred. Our main waitress, Sophia, was on her third day at the job. She was kind, fun, and considerate. She was respectful and did her very best to provide suggestions and answer questions. The other waiters were very kind, too. The starter bread was awesome, especially the thin, crunchy triangular crackers. The food was good though it was a little cold and could have used more flavor. I got the Margherita flatbread while my friend got the Lasangna that came with a salad. Each of us paid roughly $15 for our meal. One thing I really liked about the restaurant was that the  menu had the calories written on it--helps a lot for the health-conscious people at an Italian restaurant! All in all, food was good but the experience is what would make us come back again. Fun place to do people-watching at, especially while sitting outside!

I love brio so much it hurts. I always have great service. Professional, friendly and attentive! 
My husband and I frequent here for dinner dates since it was the location of our first date when I realized I needed this hunk in my life. 
We've sat outside and inside and at the bar and liked all areas. all their pastas are to die for and my husband usually gets the salmon I believe. Or some sort of fish entire. He always loves it.  
And for. The amazing service and quality of food its such a great price. 
I'm usually not a fan of chain restaurants but I love me some brio!!

We ate here as part of a fixed-menu wedding reception dinner. 

Our servers were very attentive and we never had to wait long for one to come around. I had the Chicken Limone which came with mashed potatoes and roasted veggies (zucchini, carrots, broccoli). It was a MASSIVE portion. It was delightful. I had moscato to drink and as a non-wine person, also delightful. The appetizer was the parmesan flatbread with artichoke dip. It was yummy. The Caesar salad was on the sad side, but the rest of the meal made up for it. I have no idea if the cake we had was by Brio or if it was brought in, but it was also wonderful. 

If I was spending the day at the mall here, I would definitely stop by for dinner on my own dime.

It was our first time coming here for my sisters Birthday. The ambiance was great. The food was ok. The waitress was nice. My complain goes out to the Manager if I'm not mistaken her name was Ashley... from the moment we were seated til we left I observed her going to the surrounding tables greeting them asking how their food was and so forth ,new tables next to us were seated a couple of times and not once did she walk over to acknowledge us. Sounds petty but it left a bad impression being that it was our first time there. The waitress walked over to check on us and I said nicely " What's the managers name the woman who's been walking over to these tables next to us acknowledging every other table besides ours? Is it because everyone else that's here is Caucasian and we're not? " She said oh I'm sorry I'm sure that's not what it is, I know being minority it feels like a racial thing sometimes but I'm sure that's not what it is." I made it very clear that I never ever feel that way because I have a multi cultural family. She asked if I wanted her to address the issue and have her walk over and I refused it. I did not want her walking over to us just because I complained. 
As a manager your supposed to set an example for your staff and I think she did a poor job at that tonight. So thank you but no thank you we will not be coming back to your establish

I love going to this place. I haven't had anything here that I didn't like. Their customer service on the other hand is a hit and miss :(

However, their food speaks for itself so it hasn't dampened my opinion of this place. 

I love their steak salad. It's very, very tasty. Just order the dressing on the side though. It's over powering if you let them mix it in, at least in my humble opinion.

Husband got sick after eating dinner about a month ago. Our daughter and friend went yesterday and the food was awful. I don't usually write bad reviews but this is now twice the food was bad. Service was good and atmosphere was good. Really wished food had been good too.

Went to Brio for dinner early Sat. night. They were on a wait (of course) so we opted to sit in the Lounge. (I have heard  that they offer an awesome happy hour, apps are $2.95. I am looking forward to returning and taking advantage of that!)  Anyways.. This is my second time here and both times I have ordered the Pasta Alla Vodka. Absolutely Delicious!! It was so good, I don't want to venture out and try anything else on the menu!  Our server was great. It was a wonderful experience!

Brio has a terrific happy hour that my wife and I always recommend. All the apps are great tasting and reasonably priced. Hard to believe it's a chain. The bartenders (Brendon gets a gold star) are courteous and remember your name. Good selection of reasonably priced wines with a few great bargains on the list. Too many good appetizers to have a favorite but we often order the carpaccio and shrimp and eggplant (we like sauce on the side) and we usually get a Bistecca salad which is really good. We often eat dinner at the bar because the bar staff is so friendly. Our favorite regular menu items are the shrimp risotto and the double cut pork chop. Lastly the management here really cares that you have a good time. Any missteps are usually taken care of without us ever having said a word.

Recently went for lunch with a couple of friends. Sat at the bar!  What a mistake!!! The food took forever to come out, and when it did it was cold. Sent it back, and took another fifteeen minutes. The bartenders were overwhelmed, and didn't seem to have enough help, came accross with attitude when they had to take the food back! Not a good day here!

This place had some darn good food.  Ate here fir a friend's wedding rehearsal dinner and loved it.  The food was all amazing.  Great appetizers and meals portions are nice and large.  Drinks were good also and reasonable prices.

I had a great experience and would go here on dates regularly.

The unorganized front desk to check-in should have been a good indicator that the rest of the experience would be as bad as that was. Our waitress had to be hunted down by another waiter. During her first visit to our table we ordered drinks and our meals. 

The people that came in after us, and were  seated after us got there food 20 minutes before us. The waitress finally came by and joked about how long it was taking, yet offered no apologies. 

Now, I understand that it's a Sunday, and Valentine's Day, however a little more organization and consistency would have been nice.

This will be the last time I visit this restaurant due to the horrible experience. I do not recommend it to anyone anymore.

UPDATE: Someone from Brio replied to my review that they would message me. 6 days later, I'm still waiting for a message. They must be on the same schedule as the restaurant was that day.
Amazing service, excellent food, definitely will let everyone I know, locals and visitors to not look any further than Brio for an excellent meal. Brio has really met and exceeded my expectations.

Promise next time i will take a picture of the food.
Brio town square is my favorite location than the rampart one. half bar is inside the building half is "outside".
i Love their bar seating area where they offer a very nice Happy Hour deal from 3pm to 6:30pm monday to friday at the bar area only (at the bar or the 4 high tables by the bar or the couch facing the bar)
Love their sangria, white peach or red sangria. Robert handles the bar with his team and he is just Excellent at remembering what you like to drink! Is that bad when he sees you and already prepare your drink without asking?? 
They are so so busy at the bar, no matter what you always get a smile! 
Happy hour time I to order their beef carpaccio, captées salad, artichoke dips, sliders
The lobster bisque and the steak salad are to die for!
The main restaurant is very elegant and cosy! I love the decoration. To avoid the wait, you can always book your table :)
Staff is friendly. Good address in town for good food and great service!

Came here two days in a row! First on a Friday during Happy hour with Nieves D. One of the best HH I've had. 

HH specials are for food & drinks and it's from $4-$6 which is a pretty good deal with the amount of food they give you! For foods we got Beef Cappaccio, Crispy Eggplant fries, black pepper shrimp, Crispy cheese ravioli, and Roasted garlic spinach artichoke dip. All oh so delicous! My favorite would have to be the Crispy eggplant fries which is pretty crazy because I do NOT like eggplant at all. Also I think the Crispy Cheese Ravioli was to die for. It wasn't too cheesy, it was the perfect amount of cheesiness! 

For drinks we got White Peach Sangria, Sangria Rosa, & Mango Mojito. I really liked the Sangria Rosa. Now it's really not real sangria because real sangria is fruits marinated in wine but they just put some fruit in a cup & add wine with vodka. Still good tho.

Best bartender there, hands down is Geoffrey. He accomodated each of our needs. When the door was open and the wind was blowing our hair all over our faces, he shut the doors. We were right under the AC vents which was blowing cold a** air right on top of us making us shiver uncontrollably, he made the waiters turn the vents off. He also made us his speciality shots, on the house! 

2nd time I went was the next day for brunch. Not as good as Happy Hour. I got the Salmon with Angel Hair with Lobster Bisque. Was not that good. It had a sauce that was kind of on the sour side.  & the lobster bisque was on the salty side. There was a fly buzzing around our table that was annoying me! 

This place would be a solid 5 star rating for me if I did not come back for brunch the next day. None the less, I would probably return for HH again!

Went with my family last night for dinner and I was very underwhelmed. The server walked away so quickly after drink orders that I couldn't get in an order for an appetizer. The food was very mediocre, my asparagus had no life. When the food was delivered, all of our meals were given to the wrong person at the table..very odd. Overall, I was not impressed and don't plan on returning.

I tried Brio's offerings (bruschetta and mocha panna cotta) at the Yelp Ultimate Science Fair and was so impressed that I decided to go there last night. Let me start by saying that this place was exquisite and beautiful. I loved the drapery from the ceiling and all the decor. We started by using the free appetizer card we received from the party on Calamari with a lemon aioli some kind of chunky tomato sauce. Both the aioli and sauce were delicious, however, the calamari could have better. The batter was good but I think they were overcooked cause they were a bit rubbery. We also received a bread basket. While the sourdough bread was pretty good, the rosemary herb "crackers" were a waste I felt. For a meal, I ordered the mushroom ravioli while the hubby ordered the chicken Milanese. Both of us enjoyed our meals very much. Both were large portions which made the higher prices are little more worth it. For dessert, I decided to try the bread pudding since I am huge bread pudding connoisseur. I am on the fence about this one. In some areas, the texture and flavor was good. However, in other parts of the pudding, it was dry and no flavor really. Not sure what happened but definitely not making the list for the best bread puddings. The service was impeccable. Would I go back? Yes I would try it again because I really did like the mushroom ravioli and their bruschetta (if its always like it was at the party) is to die for!

Okay experience. The food is really bland and overpriced. Also this location is not very well designed inside. Kinda felt like I was eating inside of an old casino. Service was great however, and their strawberry shortcake dessert was yummy.

So we are not big Town Square people, my man doesn't like crowds much so we don't go as often as I would like.  We were there for a specific item and decided to have a few drinks.  While having these drinks we wanted food.  Looking though the options we decided on Brio.  Which amazed and thrilled me, he doesn't like Italian (because he never knows what to order and picks the wrong stuff) I love Italian especially because I get it so rarely! 

I got the caesar salad, yummy.  Perfect amount of dressing to food.  He got the Wedge Bistecca Insalata, he loves wedges so he was happy.  He finally followed my lead and got what I ordered, the Lobster & Shrimp Fettuccine.  His mouth watered when he saw it and he finished my leftovers when we got home.  So finally we can eat Italian and he will be happy, I can't wait to come back!

Love the food. The service is very good. So far one of the only places that prepare the Pasta just perfect. Down side is that its a bit pricy for pasta.
But I highly recommend it...dont forget the deserts are great..
Best Brunch in Town and Always Outstanding Service!

I'm here with my daughters and friends for my 50th birthday and we were denied alcohol on the patio because we were having too much of a good time. I've lived in Vegas for 10 years and have never been treated with so much disrespect.   Never ever going back to any Brio in Vegas EVER!  Food other than lobster bisque not worth it.
Chopped salad was great and so was the flatbread. Open tables outside but we still had to wait 15 minutes to be seated. Atmosphere and service were good, I would recommend.

The Brio Steak Salad is one of my favorites. Absolutely delicious. Each time I order it, I enjoy every single bite.

Just wanted to add a picture.

Love the Happy Hour.  It would be great to have a couple more low carb options. My group loves the burger and shrimp dishes. I wish they would have converted my burger from buns to lettuce wrap, but it came out with just the meat patty on the plate. It would have been great to substitute the chips for vegetables.  Oh well, still yummy.   

Came again for the Brio Steak Salad. One of the Best in town.

Good and consistent service and food every time.

We usually order the bruschetta quattro ($14.95) for apps unless my little cutie pie decides on the Margharita Flatbread, then we get the Calamari Fritti ($10.95).  My fave is the Grilled Salmon salad ($14.95).  My hubby likes their Lasagna Bolognese ($17.65).  We like the house Chianti or Pinot Noir to go with our meals....or just water.  We may check this place out for their HH.

One of our girls night out go-to coffee and dessert too!  The servers are always very nice and accommodating. We've never felt like we're being rushed.  

The individual size servings of desserts are the main attraction for us:  creme brulee, cheesecake, pudding, tiramisu and milk chocolate cake...Oh my!   Five for $10.95, everyone is happy!

Happy, Happy, Joy, Joy!
We were unhappy with one of the servers here and then moved to Abi's section. She was amazing and changed are whole night. Well be back to sit with abi again :)

Arctic salmon  That's all I gotta say! The food there is great! Nice a fresh and always plated looking good. Unfortunately the service I had at the bar was straight up crap. He got our order after a little bit than didn't even make our cocktail until 25 mins after and poured two waters 15 mins after ordering. The food took a listle while to come out as well. He didn't ask or check up on us really at all until the very end of the meal whitch when i had the plates stacked in front of me. We would definitely come back and give it another shot maybe this time at a dining table.
The chicken under the brick is axing along with the eggplant and shrimp appetizer it's a must try

I really don't get the high average of reviews here.  I think people are being blinded by the location. Sometimes a great ambience will make you feel the food tastes better than it does.  The ambience (decor and furniture) is top shelf.  BUT, the food here is really quite mediocre.  Just a step above a Sbarro's, with more flair.  I've received plates that were not to temperature (too cold), and inconsistently prepared (like the roasted, planked chicken I used to always go for, until I got the feeling that it just wasn't what it used to be.  The location at Town Square still does this dish fairly well).  The pasta is fairly good.  The salads are decent.  Other dishes are decent. The bread is quite good, and the only offering I've had so far that I don't feel I could make just as well, if not better, at home.  (When I go out to eat, I expect to partake of a meal that I could not do better at home!)  I think the menu is a bit too large, and they should do more rotation, and do more specials.  But this is not the reason for a 3-star review.  The real issue is the service.

The service is more miss than hit, in my experience here.  I have rarely felt that my server could care less about me and whomever I was eating with.  And because I work in the area (and professionals seem to gravitate to this place for lunch), I've had the experience of being here numerous times.  I've gotten out of it a few times, though, by suggesting other nearby spots!  (Like Vintner Grill).  I just have never felt especially welcomed or treated with warmth or enthusiasm here on any occasion whatsoever.  Even though I am quite a friendly person!  The girls up front are usually clueless, can't answer any questions about the menu, can't tell you if someone you're waiting for is there, make you feel as though you're bothering them if you sit and wait in the lounge chairs by the door for your party, wear the most ridiculously short skirts or dresses, or cleavage tops, and are snobby, and apparently catty.  Even the young guys give you "I'm too sexy for this place" vibes.  It's so not luxury.  And so at odds with the ambience of the environment.  I just don't GET why you would--out of all of the options at Tivoli Village (e.g., Echo & Rig)--pick this place.
Nice place with ample outdoor seating. Food was delicious but service was a bit slow. Waitress kept blaming it on happy hour. Overall a good experience and the pork chops are amazing

Service is okay. We had reservations and were not seated for 30 minutes. Manager came to our table (16 in our party) and sincerely apologized. She sent us 6 appetizers. Nice recovery. Our server was good, not great. I had to ask twice for a refill, and he forgot my side of veggies. 

Quality of food is good. All hot and fresh. However, nothing special. Everyone in our party agreed food was good but not great.

Prices are too high. We don't mind paying high prices for great food, service, and experience. Brio did not quite make the grade.
Loved the food and ambiance. Only about $80 for a family of four w/wine, appetizers, entrees and dessert. Very reasonable. Will return next time we're in town!

The crab crusted salmon special was fantastic. The portions were just right. The sourdough bread was an excellent compliment to our meal.  The atmosphere is very nice like an Italian courtyard. Will definitely come back here the next time we visit.

This is one of my favorite spots in town. I love love this location . The bartender Jade maybe Jayde I don't know but she is the bomb! Her attitude is always upbeat and her service is amazing . She bartend, cocktail and runs our food. Everything comes out amazing and she never forgets anything. The food quality and presentation puts the icing on the cake. Superb!

Nice atmosphere, upscale decor in Tivoli. Friendly but disjointed service. Our salads arrived but mine didn't.  Was pleasantly surprised by the Bistecca Insalata, crisp fresh greens with the right amount dressing when it finally arrived. My Veal Milanese was a big disappointment, tasted oily and reheated, the angel hair pasta was dry and the veg were either under cooked or dried out and wrinkled. The caper wine sauce was almost nonexistent. 
The other 5 in our party were satisfied and enjoyed their meal.

I went to Brio for dinner today and I had the pork chop with veggies and it was pretty good. Although you might need to order 2 pork chops since the 1 did not fill me up completely. But everything was tasty especially the creme brulee for dessert.

Well I waited more than a month for a response from Brio's corporate before finally deciding to write this poor review. I really wanted to address this with Brio and not the rest of the world, but with no response whatsoever, here I go. I had brunch a month back, and ordered the eggs, home fries, and bacon. It says it comes with brioche toast on the menu. It does not. After addressing this with the waitress, the manager comes over. He stands there for a little while (very awkward) before finally asking what the issue was. Wasn't sure if he was waiting for me to say something first? Anyhow, he told me they don't have or have ever had brioche toast, and I asked him why the menu says they do? He says he doesn't print the menus and that corporate does. Wow!! I couldn't believe his answer! Maybe the correct answer should have been, "You know you're right, it must be a misprint, I should let corporate know." It's very deceptive to advertise brioche toast to people and then serve crappy white stale toast. I rarely bring up anything I am displeased with at a restaurant, but this was Brio's third strike with me. The last time it was a cold omelette that I didn't say anything about. I wanted to give Brio another chance since I have been going here since the opening, (and their eggplant shrimp appetizer is actually pretty amazing), but three strikes and you're out.

One of my biggest pet peeves with restaurants is when they don't expedite properly.... within three minutes of each other, I received my bread and butter, my salad and then my dinner. What's absolutely ridiculous is that the server/bartender all have the same response "Wow, that came out fast" as if it's NEVER happened before.  So, there I was with three plates of food in front of me, not being able to enjoy any single one really. It's almost like they're forcing you to order one single item at a time. I can understand how this might happen when it's busy and they want to get patrons in and out as fast as they can... But, this was a Sunday late afternoon and they were maybe 1/3 full. I'm not in the restaurant industry, so I'm not sure if this is a bartender issue or kitchen issue. Either way, it ruined the visit for me and I won't be back for a while.

Brio Tuscan Grill located in Town Square on South Las Vegas Blvd.  Brio is an Italian restaurant with an American flare and a trendy atmosphere.  Noise levels can be a little loud when it's really busy because of the open air design. The bar area is small but acomadating with full menu.  They also have a large outdoor seating area with umbrellas and patio heaters to help keep the temperature just right during your dining experience.  They have a good happy hour and morning Sunday all you can drink mirmosas.  Good food, great wine good times!
Food is good. Menu is great for dinner but lacks around the lunch hour. Drinks are resonable and good. Order the calamari and the Caesar salad as a combo!

Came here with my wife to kill time while my kids played at the Gameworks right up the street for some small bites. We ordered the Bruschetta sampler which was good wish the steak was more tender. We also got the Brio chopped salad it was also good needed more veggies in my opinion but it was satisfactory. Now what I was most excited about was the prosciutto and Burrata pizza I wasn't disappointed it was good but after I got it immediately wanted the crust to be thinner maybe next time overall it turned out to be a nice time waster and the company was awesome. The staff are nice also they put us out of the way of the other people we also had our giant twin stroller so they do accommodate strollers even at lunch go figure.

Brio is one of my favorite restaurants in vegas my husband and I come here often however tonight I have some different feeling towards this place.   Our server seemed annoyed everytime we asked her for something,  we waited and waited for our apps to come out, one made it to the table one did not, everything took forever, our server disappeared for what seemed like hours,   very poor service tonight and I was not happy.  Get it together brio

Good place for happy hour. I have gotten everything on the happy hour menu. It's always good. Brio burger is the best. Service is great and they have a very nice atmosphere. We will defiantly be back.

We love Brio.

I'm stuck ordering one thing always, Shrimp & Lobster Fettuccine.  I see other appetizing things, but can't not order the fettuccine as it's so wonderful.
4 of us went for a birthday celebration. Very attentive and food was good.

I go here regularly for their salmon salads and steak salads, so good!, never have any issues. I had a little situation last time with my food (my half empty lobster and shrimp bisque had no shrimp, and my steak salad came out with cold steak, half the salad drenched with sauce, the other half dry), and I asked our waiter (who was very nice and a good waiter) if he could get a manager over to us. Being a regular, I was curious if they had switched chefs or something since I was having so many issues. She saw my salad, apologized, and brought me back a new fresh one immediately (waiting there the whole time while it was being made). She also took care of our lobster bisque. Great food, and great customer service, gives then 5stars. Every restaurant has an off day here and there, but the way the situation was handled will keep me a regular at this place!
Kai was awesome.  We were outside alone in the chill by the fire and he picked up our table.  Fabulous!!!
Can't go wrong at this place. I highly recommend the pasta brio. Also during the week if you can get here on time the happy hour is amazing!
I like Brio. I have been there several times but the service in/at the bar is, simply put, TERRIBLE!! very disappointing !! bartenders are rude, clueless.

Stopped here for a late dinner and decided to eat in the bar.  The bartender, Brendan, was great!  Service was fantastic!  He makes the best peach bellini EVER!   During the summer they have a reverse happy hour for the last hour of business.  We had the tomato mozzarella salad, a flatbread on the HH menu, and lamb chops and dessert ... way more than enough to eat, it was served quickly, and everything was great!  The chocolate lava cake is the best dessert they have, and although it came out under-heated the first time, it was corrected right away!  The manager, Vinnie, came by to make sure we were satisfied with everything.  That's customer service!  Always clean and nice decor too.  Love it!

Cons: 1) in one of woman's cabin toilet didn't work light; 2) warmer outside didn't work eather; 3) tiramisu has too much cream; 4) there is a big line but outside and inside is plenty of free seats. 

Pros: 1) big and good food; 2) has a gluten free menu; 3) waitress is nice and welcoming.

A word of warning, this is not what most would consider authentic Italian, and I agree. It isn't. However, it's still tasty enough for me to enjoy and want to come back! Parking is a hassle since it's in the Town Center but just park in the lot about 3 blocks away and you're fine. Assuming you don't mind a bit of a walk in Vegas weather.

I had the Pasta Alla Vodka and it was tasty. It was ricotta filled with pieces of pancetta and a spicy tomato cream sauce. I do feel there could have been a bit more pancetta. The garlic was almost too absent to be considered a big contributor to the dish, which disappointed me because I'm a big garlic fan. 

They have some really interesting cocktails which unfortunately i wasn't able to sample since we were driving back after lunch. 

Decor is nice and dishes maybe be more than moderately priced. Came for lunch and it was about $16 plates. 

But I'll def be back

I have been here quite a few times throughout the past few years, but this is the first time I have decided to write a review. 

Now, normally when I see very fancy places located in popular areas, I tend to assume they are overpriced and over hyped. This restaurant, however; is an exception. While they are a on the pricier side, their food never disappoints. Everyone that I have ever been here with, myself included, finds the food to be well made and very flavorful with great consistency. 

Some of the crowd favorites for my friends and family are: Shrimp Mediterranean, Sliced Steak Salad (my personal favorite), Grilled Salmon Salad, Grilled Salmon Fresca (boyfriend's favorite), and Pasta Alla Vodka (best friend's favorite). Their warm chocolate cake is also divine, and they always serve focaccia and warm french bread as a starter. Although really, anything you order will be good. 

The only reason I docked a star is because we have had a few slow servers that weren't very attentive, and I highly recommend calling in a reservation on weekend nights. Things can get pretty busy and last time my boyfriend and I were here, our server was nice but very out of it. It's just a hit-or-miss in the service area.

Overall though, very nice place for meals and it lives up to its reputation of having fine Italian dining.

Went this evening for the first time actually as a fluke. Was waiting for a table at Postinos, but they had a wait there thay was a hour long. My friend and I were roaming around and stumbled upon Brio. We went in to just get a drink at the bar, but was greeted with such friendly service that we decided to just stay for dinner. Wednesday was $5.00 martini day in the bar area. Had 2 different ones that were great. A lemon drop and a peach one. The yummy basket of bread was a nice treat until our salads came. Great wedge salad. Got the vodka sauce pasta with ricotta, and it was so tasty. Cooked to perfection. What a nice restaurant to just stumble upon, but will be back again soon. yummo

My husband and I recently got married in Las Vegas.  We live in Orange County, CA.  I called several restaurants to host our dinner for 50 people.  The management at Brio was more than helpful and made me feel comfortable and at ease at hosting the dinner.  We had never eaten at a Brio restaurant. Picking a place to eat from out of town is a little scary.  We were more than pleased.   They did an amazing job at securing our group in the back with a semi private area yet still part of the restaurant.  50 people sat comfortable.  We had our own table for two in the middle of our  group.  The tables were beautiful.  Everyone raved about the food and choices offered on our preset menus.  We had our own 3 servers and they did a spectacular job.  Thank you for completing our wedding day.

I love Brio! We come here all the time and are never disappointed. The happy hour is amazing, great options for food and drinks. The other night we had the brushetta Quattro, an all time favorite, minestrone soup, Caesar salad and tomato caprese. The bartenders are great, Larry and Brendan always take care of us. Chef Mike and the manager Kayla stopped by to see how everything was, definitely appreciated. Rarely does the manager AND chef stop by the table at other restaurants! The customer service is on point here and the food always exceeds expectations. I will be a Brio fan for life!

I have eaten here many times. The sourdough bread in the bread basket is outstanding!  I always get the lobster bisque, just so I can eat more bread. 

The chopped salad is my favorite!  Seems like it would be boring, but I love it. Lots of flavor!  The service can be pretty slow, but it's always very friendly. Since the restaurant is so busy, I kind of expect service to be slow. 

Originally, I was going to give them 4 stars. I bumped it to 5 because of how friendly and easy they were to work with. I had to deliver a wedding cake there. Many venues don't allow the cake to get there too early, but they let me deliver it early and they carefully stored it and presented it to the client.  It was 3 tiers. Outstanding business to business service!

Their light menu is fabulous. I had the salmon Fresca and the flavors were so delicious, especially the sweet potatoes and balsamic glaze. Loved the healthy options. Outdoor seating on a nice night is also great! Also recommend the peach sangria, sweet and refreshing.

Great service, outstanding flavors, variety, and huge wine selection!
You can stay as long as you like, there's never a rush to leave!
I love the patio when the weather is nice.
Great decor and very good food!  Service was very mediocre this past visit although the manager saved with a complimentary bisque.  The group we hosted loved the restaurant.

My review is for the Happy Hour. This place is packed for happy hour basically every day. Recently, my wife and I were lucky enough to score a table on the patio. The restaurant, bar and patio are beautiful. The patio has plenty of umbrellas to keep the sun out of the eyes while you sip on some cold beverages. The service was courteous and prompt. I actually felt like a guest.

They have raised the prices on the happy hour bites from $3 to $4. We ordered a Brio Burger with cheese which was cut into fourths and it was huge. Not a bad tasting burger. The Picante Shrimp was excellent as well. The sausage and pepperoni flat bread was just ok for me. But last time, we only spent about 12 bucks for food plus whatever the drinks cost. And of course taxes and tip.

This is a great chill place with a lot of ambiance to hang out with friends for Happy Hour.
I ordered Pesto chicken pasta! What a rip of!!!! When it came, I asked where is the pesto. I was told that it was a light broth. Wish someone had told me I was ordering a bowl of cooked pasta-ugh!

OOOOHHhh My GOOODdNesSSSSs!!! The moment you walk through the doors.. you just know this place is a winner. I am writing this review with a smile on my face because if you have ever tried Brio... you know why. First and foremost, the restaurant is beautifully constructed inside and out. HUGE outside patio with fireplaces and inside you'll find a very open area with high ceilings, flat screens, large booths, and busy friendly servers. I ordered the mushroom stuffed ravioli with brown butter (holy mother.. absolutely to die for!!!) appetizer, lobster bisque (creamy.. just the right consistency and flavor with lobster pieces on top served in a cute white porcelain bowl) and the Sausage Gnocchi (perfect with red bell peppers, browned red onions in creamy red bell pepper sauce.. just a hint of spice). I cannot believe there isn't a Brio here in So Cal!!! The menu is very simple: brunch, soups, salads, pizza, pasta, and bruschetta (perfect portions). I am so sure whatever you go with, you will not be disappointed. I plan on taking everyone I love, here for a scrumptious toothsome Italian meal! BEL CIBO!!!

If I'm craving Italian, I go for Brio. Every time. Their Tuscan Harvest salad is the perfect blend of savory and sweet with the most amazing homemade dressing. Their pasta alla vodka is the most delicate pasta filled with the creamiest ricotta, and smothered in the best vodka sauce you will ever have.

Kept hearing good things about the happy hour here so we finally stopped in. And WOW, can't believe it took us so long to check it out - it's now one of my new fave places. The happy hour is INCREDIBLE! For $3 you get some amazing food, got 2 apps and it was more than enough as a meal.
