The 2 apps I had were the shrimp/eggplant which was so MOUTH-WATERING-DELICIOUS-I-WANT-SOME-RIGHT-NOW good, and also the margherita flatbread (also tasty). 

Hubby had the Brio burger and it was HUGE. 

The drinks were not on happy hour (boo) but I was happy to pay the $8 for the pomegranate martinis because they were delish! 

We loved the place so much we took advantage of their gift card special, buy $100 and get a $20 card free.  Can't wait to go back!

Went here after i got married. We had 19 in our party and the servers were wonderful. All of us were really impressed. We even had a private room. Its a little expensive, but worth the extra dollars. My steak w/mashed potatoes and roasted veggies was around $30. The atmosphere is nice, its very laid back.  Thank god for the private room, we were able to stash away my very loud family of comedians!

Had a really nice lunch with a friend on the patio. All of the hostesses and our waitress were all very accommodating and friendly. I wasn't expecting them to be very friendly after reading some of the reviews but we actually received excellent service. We split the Quinoa Salad with Asparagus and Grilled Chicken. It was very good, filled with flavor and was just right for a light lunch.

I had the lobster bisque soup and carbonara pasta and it was very good! I came during lunch and it was not too busy.  The service was good, although I had to ask for a spoon for my soup.  Also they had a kids menu with activities but no crayons or pencils.  My experience was good overall and I am giving four stars simply because it was not a WOW experience.  I would definitely come back.
Very professional service and food. I came for the cool location. Outdoors can actually get noisy so if you dont like it too loud, avoid.

I've been to Brio twice. The first time I had a decent Caesar salad. It wasn't anything special but I know experience wise, Brio is one of the best and most popular places in Town Square. It's been more than a year until I heard about the happy hour. Their bar happy hour features $5 drinks and $3.99 items. I went with the chips and burger and for that price you can't go wrong!  They also have shrip, ravioli and another 5 or so items on the happy hour menu starting at 9PM. Ill definitely be back soon!

Underwhelming.  Food was just ok.  Maybe because we had a group of 10, but we were there on a Sunday and hardly anyone was there.  Food was cold and service was just ok. They hardly refilled our drinks and never offered dessert.  This used to be one of our favorites.
Excellent menu! Friendly staff and great environment. Would highly recommend.

Been going to Brio for over 6 years here and in NJ. Tonights service during happy hour at the bar with Phillip as our server was the worst EVER. We tip VERY WELL having worked in the industry. This is the second time we have had Phillip as our bartender, the next time we arrive and see him at the bar we will move onto California Pizza Kitchen or Claim Jumpers.

We have had both Jade and Roselle as our servers at the bar and they are both EXCELLENT. Phillip needs to take a few lessons from their playbook!!!

Pros: Delicious food, elegant atmosphere, good service.

Cons: Out of the last 4 times I have been here, I have found hair in my food 3 times. Gross. Lost my appetite entirely.

Ummm... Five stars for Brio's happy hour, am I taking crazy pills?!

It feels odd, but I must have hit this place at the right time because the service was incredibly fast, the food was beyond expectations, and the price was stellar, $3.95 for a Margherita flatbread pizza? I'm in!

I came here after working an event, just looking for a quick snack before hitting the long road back to Henderson. I bellied up to the bar and almost fell off my chair when I peeked at the menu saw the prices; the most expensive item was the Brio Burger for $6. I didn't order this, but instead went with Black Pepper Shrimp, Beef Carpaccio, Tuscan Tots and a Margherita Flatbread. 

Everything was very good, but the Black Pepper Shrimp was the winner of the meal. Seared Romano crusted eggplant with seared shrimp on top and some insane cream sauce, definitely not a low calorie option, but worth totally worth it. The beef Carpaccio is must order, it wasn't too fatty and cut paper thin it will literally melt in your mouth. 

The Tuscan Tots were sneaky. I was thinking these would be your basic tater tots, but they are small mashed potato balls that are coated in breadcrumbs and filled with bacon, mozzarella cheese and fried, I'm done. The Flatbread pizza was great, covered in fresh veggies and flavorful basil, but compared to everything else it was probably least favorite out of the bunch, but still worth ordering.  

The price point was the best part of the whole meal, with two cocktails each and with all the food mentioned prior, our tab didn't break $40. 

Happy Hour goes from 3:30 - 6:30pm and then again from 8pm to close. Great atmosphere, no smoking and great food.... duh, I'll be back for sure!

We have been to Brio at least a dozen times and after this last visit we will not be returning.  We had family in from out of town and we were telling them how great this place was....Well we are so embarrassed that we took them here.  The service was so terrible and the food was not much better.  We had a table of five, and it did not seem to be a very busy evening.  Every meal came except for one and we were told it would be right out.  Ten minutes later we asked about the meal and we were told that the kitchen made it wrong again...What?  We were not even told it was wrong once, only that it would arrive in a few minutes.  We decided to cancel the meal since everyone was waiting to start their dinner so that one person would not be eating alone. The waitress said "let me get the manager".  He came over and was a complete ass.  He said "what seems to be the problem?" So we told him our issue and his reply was " we are making it on the fly".  Well if he knew what the problem was why did he ask? And then when it came to the bill the waitress said "I wish you would have ordered dessert, it was on the house".  Nice to know it, after the fact!  Just a colossal mess.  Everyone makes mistakes, just let us know...Don't leave us hanging.

I ordered scallops on risotto because they had advertised it although I never saw the price. Shrimp risotto was $16 so I wasn't too worried. The scallops were burned black on both sides. I kept waiting for it to improve. It was like a charcoal sandwich with tasteless scallops in between.  The risotto tasted like a can of sauce was dumped on it.  I hated it but kept eating because I was so hungry.  I should have said something right away. When I got the check and saw that the scallops were $25, I felt I had been scammed.  I didn't want money back, just an answer. The waiter didn't help.  I will never go back..not happy hour or anything.   Brio chef's cooking stinks and they serve it anyway. Yuck.

The go to place for entertaining guests. great for a meal with family and friends. The open space is very welcoming with tasteful furnishing. Far above-average fare for a chain, you get your money's worth in both food and atmosphere combined with wonderful service. The place fits well in the Town Square environment.
One of my favorite Italian spots in Henderson.  The food and ambience is amazing

Just wow, Brio, you blew my socks off!

Spinach and Artichoke Dip:
- Has a hearty, cheesy flavor
- Great for veggie-haters too, you can barely taste then
- Perfect chip-to-dip ratio
- enough for six adults

Gerber All-Natural Lemon Pepper Chicken:
- beautiful presentation
- not sure how to describe the vegetables, but the way they prepared it is a mix between fresh off the grill and also steamed (??). My point, veggies were delish!
- the skin in the chicken was crisp and crunchy 
- the meat on the chicken was moist, I didn't even need a knife
- not a huge mashed-potato fan but it's mixed with 'mystery' seasoning that revolutionized my thoughts on mashed-potatos

Our server was genuine and knowledgeable. I just can't give that fifth star because of the hostess though.. It was dinner time when we came in (6 adults and 2 kids) and she told us it was about an hour wait. Understandable. We were all tired and weren't about to walk to another restaurant though. Noticing a few empty booths, we asked to be seated there but she promptly told us it's only for parties of 6. They looked pretty spacious and the two kids are no more than 4. We said we didn't mind cramping together and she told us, 'She would need to ask because they don't set the tables for 8.' She seemed extremely annoyed at our request as if placing two more plates was such a huge hassle -.-

Good customer service is a big deal to me. Brio's got their food DOWN PAT, they just need to work on service and they'll be awesome!

Came here for a very late lunch and got a table easily. It's such a gorgeous space with high ceilings and very old Tuscany look and feel. My boyfriend and I ordered a bunch of plates to share: Bruschetta, Flat bread, and crab and artichoke dip. The bruschetta had balsamic vinegar drizzled on top which I did not like. I don like balsamic vinegar and wish it said that on the menu :( The crab and artichoke dip was my favorite dish, mhmmm so creamy and had huge chunks of crab! The flat bread was yummy but I was so full at that point I couldn't have too much. The portions are HUGE and we were so stuffed after, so much for a light lunch. The orange juice however is not fresh squeezed lol I saw them pour it out of a huge generic brand bottle.

P.S. bathrooms are very pretty. I love me a pretty bathroom.
Love coming here!  Jeffrey, Mandy and Wendy are awesome bartenders! Always service with a smile! Wish I could come by more often! One of my favorite dishes is the black pepper shrimp with eggplant!

It is what it is. A very pretty chain Italian restaurant. If you are looking for authentic or out of the box original, don't go here. If you are looking for solid, safe Italian American fare, this is your place. There was nothing wrong but nothing outstanding either, oh, except the butter, it was awesome. And to Jason B., all the shrimp that we get in Arizona is frozen. All of it!

I have enjoyed lunches here and decided to take my Aunt and Uncle for a special dinner. The ambience is beautiful, the server was cheerful and seemed attentive.

What was disappointing was the cold food. Everyone in the party had cold food, except for my pasta meal. My Aunt's grilled chicken was very dry and seemed over cooked and cold. how does that happen. Was it the server? Was it the cook? 

The Alfredo fettuccini was a side dish and we know why. It tastes like an Applebee's sauce. It's good, but not enough Parmesan cheese flavor. Worse...it was cold. 

My favorite part of the meal was the sourdough bread, special crackers, and butter served while waiting.

I guess we will stick to lunches. The lobster bisque is amazing.

Go to happy hour!! Cheap and very, very good. And the appetizers arrive FAST. You have to sit in the bar to get happy hour prices, but it's worth it. The place is fairly upscale and the restaurant is expensive. The bar packs fast, so go early. Happy hour lasts until 6:30.

$2.95 appetizers during Happy Hour

Great deal because the apps are d-lish!

My table ordered almost everything on the Happy Hour menu and we were thrilled with everything.  The shrimp-tini was light and tasty.  The mozzarella and roasted red peppers bruschettta was not light... but it certainly was tasty.  

You can easily make a whole meal out of the Happy Hour menu for less than $10.

The downside... HH ends at 6:30pm.

I'm not usually a fan of the chain restaurants but this one I love. The ambiance is chill and the food and drinks are consistent. 

We sat on the patio and it was a beautiful night to do so. Enjoyed some drinks, appetizers, desserts and coffee. One of my favorite go to dish here is the Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant appetizer. It's all about that sauce. This dish never disappoints and I usually always get this when I visit Brio. No, seriously!!! A few other favorites I have had before (but not on this particular visit) include Beef Carpaccio, Lobster Bisque, Bistecca Insalata, Roasted Whole Chicken. 

On this visit, we had the Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant, Bruschetta Sampler, Pasta Alla Vodka, Torta di Cioccata, and Creme Brûlée. Everything was good! Our server Jason was very good. Friendly, informative and attentive. We'll be back!

I also had a Cucumber Basil Gimlet which may be one of my new favorite cocktails. Hendrick's Gin, fresh basil, crushed cucumber, Angostura bitters, fresh lemon and lime, on the rocks. Refreshing and light drink.
Brio has one of the best happy hours in town. Awesome spicy shrimp, chicken nachos and tomato mozzarella salad. Great food and all great big portions even for happy hour.
Food & service was okay.  Maybe it was the time of day, but I counted 15+ employees just standing around by the kitchen area. No kidding! Probably wont't eat there again.
This was a top notch dining experience. The food and service was excellent. A tad on the pricey side but worth it for the quality of the food.

Been going to Brio for several years now, used to frequent the Town Square location but recently started going to the Tivoli one more often. I have to say, this location is great! It's an open kitchen and you can see pretty much what happens in there. The chefs, cooks, & servers seem to have a great dynamic -- service is great and food gets out quick.  

I've had most things on the menu, but I'm very partial to the Double Cut Porkchop with Gorgonzola crust. Amazing! Also, the cauliflower side is my favorite. 

Don't sleep on the Mascarpone Cheesecake as well for dessert. 10/10 would recommend.

My first time there this meal was one of the worst I have had in a long time my wife ordered a rib eye medium it came out dry over cooked sent it back then it came out ok but for $32 it was not high quality I ordered shrimp and lobster linguine the shrimp did not taste good seemed like they were very poor quality the manager offered a free dessert which I choose the cheesecake to take home so i just tried that wow horrible so I decided to leave this review $75 dollars later so many other places better could have went to Flemings for $20 more or Cheesecake Factory for less

I want to love this place, but I just don't.
Everytime I eat here, I wish I were eating at Olive Garden....
For a chain, I just don't have any memorable items that I'd come back for (as opposed to Olive Garden's crack like breadsticks)

Meh

solid food, great salads, good service.  comfortable and pleasant setting.. good bang for the buck.  what else do you want?  hot sourdough bread?  they have that too..  super nom nom.     the summerlin location is def mellower than the Town Square location.

Wow - this place has gone downhill quickly.  My son came into town, and we picked him up at his hotel on the Strip, and drove the whole way out here because I had bragged on how good it was.  Well,needless to say, the service was terrible.  The food was mediocre.  We were overcharged ($15) on the bill - and we will NOT be back.  The bill was over $100 for 3 people, and the Pasta Brio which is usually quite good was dry, unflavorful, and very disappointing.  My son also ordered the Brio Pasta, based on my previous recommendation, and he did not even finish the dish.  We had to ask fro butter and bread three different times, and never received it. 
Also, if you are desirous of traditional Bruschetta, do NOT order the Bruschetta Quattro - it is bruschettas with red peppers all over them.  YUK!!  When I order Bruschetta,I want chopped tomatoes, cheese,cilantro and italian seasonings on toasted bread.  

I was embarrassed to have bragged about this restaurant that I have been to MANY times in the past.  However, I would not recommend it to anyone now.  I know my son was disappointed....and it made me sad because I wanted to enjoy a wonderful evening with him.  Shame on Brio for their decline.  We will NOT recommend or be back.  RIP OFF!

We love Brio!  They have the BEST steak around bar none!  And the creme brûlée is phenomenal too.

We have always had great service as well.   

If we could only get in for happy hour it would  be perfect.

I love the food here.  It's fun, it's carbs, and it's yummy.  If you're looking for some good food in Town Square that isn't the typical stops, try this place.  Great decor, great service and a tasty menu.

This place is not worth the money! Went there lastnight and had crab stuffed fish with veggies and my girlfriend ordered the Lobster-shrimp stuffed Ravioli. She said it was the worst lobster stuffed ravioli she has ever had and its one of her favorite foods. So i tried a bite of her food and she was right, it was almost tasteless. My crab stuffed fish was good but, the potatoes that came with it were burnt! Like really really brunt, like almost black. All the veggies were over seasoned to the point that i didn't eat them. And i'm not one to complain, i like a lot of seasoning and i love veggies. 

Over all both our dinners were boarder line terrible. Oh and when they brought our food out they made her the wrong thing. So on top of the food quality being very bad they screwed up the order. They did give her a free desert for screwing up the order so that was cool of them. Nice atmosphere...not very good, overpriced food.

Salmon was great  
Service excellent 
Local beer, ill try again 
This guys never disappoint, this is the care that you get in a family owned restaurant with the highest everything

One of the best happy hours in Las Vegas! And if you don't agree, please message me and let me know which place has a better happy hour! This review is for their happy hour only since we didn't look at their regular menu. Happy hour is from 3:30-6:30 and I believe they have a late night happy hour as well but I could be wrong... so call and double check. 

If you park in the structure near Staples, you can walk through Inglots to Brio. I wasn't expecting such a fancy place but it was! Bar is self seating and they had some couches and benches on one side, and a covered patio on the outside along with a wrap around bar. Service was a bit slow in terms of getting drinks out but our server, Danielle was sweet and checked on us often. 

Brio's sangrias are on the sweet side, but they are definitely tasty! I ordered the white peach sangrias while my gfs ordered the sangria rosa. The white peach sangria was a bit sweeter than the sangria rosa. Brio also offers $5 martini wednesdays and $5 wine thursdays! The martinis that they offer include the classics but also some interesting specialty ones as well. I'll have to come back on a Wednesday to check it out!

We ordered 3 beef carpaccio (yes, it was THAT good). I wasn't too fond of the parmesan flatbread... which was more of like a chip to me. The field greens salad was lightly tossed with a dressing which worked very well with the beef carpaccio. 

2/5 Sausage and pepperoni flatbread: the flatbread was a bit TOO crispy IMO. I think they might have slightly overbaked it. There wasn't enough ricotta on there, but the pieces that did have ricotta were delicious. 

3/5: Brio burger: the brio burger is one burger, cut into 4 pieces with their homemade chips on top. I didn't care much for the chips and neither did my friends. I thought it was too salty. We ordered the burger to be cooked medium, but it came out to be medium well, which wasn't a big deal. The meat was juicy and the bun reminded me of a hawaiian roll. 

4/5: Black peppered shrimp: My friends LOVED the sauce that came with this dish. I thought it was a bit spicy (just a kick) but enjoyed the eggplant. There were about 9 pieces of shrimp in the dish. The shrimp was small, but nicely presented and for the price, it wasn't too bad. My friends ended up dipping the burger into the left over sauce. 

We were all stuffed at the end of our meal and the bill for everything, including 2 white peach sangrias and 5 sangria rosas was about $70. Not bad at all! Brio is our new happy hour spot and we can't wait to come back.

Wanted to give Brio another try with my family joining me Thursday evening for dinner and drinks. The first time we went the food was very good, but the service was terrible at best. Had to ask for everything from utensils, napkins, water numerous times, and they forgot part of our order and still charged us for it. This all occurred in the bar area on a weekend so we decided to give it a try in the dining room on a weekday. Totally different experience... the food was very good and the service was excellent. Glad we gave Brio's another shot.... we will just avoid the bar area and go to their dining area during the week!!!

A bit disappointed... not what it used to be. Seemed very much like Macaroni Grill. Plus the men's room was filthy. They must've run out of paper towels, so the threw a package of paper napkins in the towel holder.  Plastic still around the napkins. Brussel sprouts were virtually raw.. green beans way too saltly. Pasta over cooked. Steak prepared raw, when i asked for medium. Cockroaches outside (i know, but still a big turn off when you know they're walking around by your feet and the sandaled feet of lived ones). This is the second time there in 2 months where the experience was subpar. Bloody Mary's are better on airplanes. Bartenders act like they are doing you a favor by serving you a lousy drink.

We have gone here twice now and love it!!  It is a HUGE restaurant so you probably won't have to wait for a table.  It is just beautiful! High ceilings and big booths. I love the décor. it makes you feel like you are in Italy!

The staff is always great and dressed very professionally.

We got the warm bread to start, then spinach artichoke dip which was great!!

For meals, I got a salad and it was huge!! Enough to take home for a second meal.  My boyfriend got a pasta dish and he loved his as well.

We went back a second time when we had family in town and they were all pleased with their meals as well. So overall, it is a great experience!
One of the best happy hours in Vegas. Food and drinks were great and the service at the bar was no different.
Great happy hour if you can get a seat. Come early, but don't expect a spot if you show up after 530PM. Decent entree's, but overpriced in my opinion.

I once went to Brio and we had such a good food. After that first outing I would give them 5 stars. Then I went with friends twice on a different occasion and I was somewhat disappointed with my steak both times. Well done steak does not mean burned steak. Also, it did not have any flavor.  I had to ask for a steak sauce.  Jumbo shrimp was medium size and a little too garlicky for my friend's taste. 
Calamari appetizer was crispy and not chewy so I would give it 4 stars.  Sauces and wild rice - very good.  Bread also nice and fresh.  Pleasant atmosphere outside on a patio and good service.

Two friends and I just got back from Brio at Town Square.   This was one of the better Italian meals I've had in a long time.   

The atmosphere is comfortable, nice bar area, outdoor patio seating makes this a very nice place for dinner.

One friend had the Lobster Ravioli and we both thought they were excellent, She didn't leave one bit.  Darn it!   (We always taste each others dinner.)

The other friend had the Mediterranean Penne, she loved it.  I thought it was pretty good.

I had the Chicken Limone which I love as Chicken Piccata when I make it at home.  This one was awesome.  Two large, very tender chicken breasts in a creamy butter/lemon sauce.   Sides of crispy potatoes and roasted veggis made this a truly wonderful choice.

The Caesar salad we ordered, (mine with very good anchovies) were a little on the dry side but very good flavor.  The romaine lettuce very fresh.

My Cosmopolitan  was perfect as was the others' Fruitini.  A fruit flavored martini.  

Service was good, except our waitrees forgot to bring me extra lemon for my chicken.   Not a big deal.  The place was full - unusual for a Tuesday evening and she was very busy. 


Valet parking is available if you can't find a spot on the street.  This is one we will definitely return to soon.

I went here the other night for my wife's birthday with 10 people total and the general consensus was that the pasta dishes weren't good.  I split my wife's pasta dish, shrimp and pasta and the pasta wasn't cooked correctly and the sauce tasted bad.  Other pasta dishes at the table tasted the same since we shared dishes.

The service wasn't great either, and we had 2 servers.  The food took forever and one of our friends didn't get her food until well after we did, which is never good.

We tried this place because it looked good and for the location, but there's plenty of other places I'd try before ever going back here based on the service and quality of food.
Italian Moscow Mule is amazing here, so is the lobster bisque and. Everything else on the menu. Definitely a must if in Town Square

First time in this new location.

Meh.

Looks like they've fizzled out. Noting special. Nothing really good.

Walking into Brio is like walking into some kind of palace. 
Its highly ornate decor, combined with the well dressed staff make me feel like royalty.

Princely, I order, with a quick hand gesture shooing my waiter when finished. I'm in full character now. 
All further communication with my server will be hand gestures, either kissing the fingers on one hand to signal bravo, or the back of my palm in a waving, dismissive manner.

I do neither.
Instead, I enter into a vegetative state, still in shock from seeing the shallow little bowl of Pasta E Fagioli they just served up. 
Then I taste it. 
That's when I wish they would have assigned me a royal taste tester to make certain an unruly chef wasn't trying to poison his magnate. 

I get through the soup, but I'm still unable to speak for fear the next thing out of my mouth will be "Off with his head!"

I've learned the hard way it's not pc to invoke the term 'head' when on a date, and in such palatial surroundings.

I hosted my sister's bridal shower here and they were absolutely fantastic to work with especially considering I am located in Los Angeles and not familiar with the area, they were very considerate of working with me in order to make this a fantastic day for my sis.

They have two private rooms for private parties that are very nice and elegant.  Since our group was smaller in size, we opted for the public outdoor patio which was very nice.  They also let us bring in our own desserts to celebrate her.

Our food was great which included an aritchoke dip appetizer and then I had their Citrus Green Salad which was really flavorful.

The service was excellent.  Crystal was our catering coordinator who was great to work with leading up to the event.  Michael, the manager, was also super friendly.  Our day-of server (I can't remember his name sadly) was also great to us and very patient allowing us to occupy the table for a long time.  

Would definitely go back there the next time I am in the Vegas/Henderson area.

When the stars make you drool
just like a pasta fazool, that's amore!..


try their pork chops, freakin awesome!

Big fan of this restaurant! First time at this location and it won't be my last. We started with the Roasted Garlic, Spinach, and Artichoke Dip with a Parmesan Flat Bread. One of the best I've had; the ones I usually get are too salty and lacking in flavor, but this one was perfect.

As an entree I got the Pasta Pesto, my father got the Pasta Brio (his go to), and our friends got the Ravioli di Bello, and Balsamic Braised Beef Short Rib. 

The Pasta Pesto was amazing. Didn't want too hardy of a sauce and too much food so this dish was perfect. It had a light sauce (since usually pasta dishes have too much). The Pasta Brio...there is no wrong with this dish! Again, not an overwhelming sauce, portion is bigger than the Pasta Pesto, but perfect for eating it the next day. I can't vouch for the Short Rib and Ravioli, but I know our friends enjoyed it VERY much. 

Our waiter was great. He made the experience even better. Great recommendations, very personable, made us feel very welcomed. Also, it was my Aunt's birthday 2 days prior and we mentioned it casually and he ended up bringing a small dessert for her without us even asking. Haven't had service like this for a while.
Love love love this place! Its a very fancy place but casual at the same time. Food was amazing. My steak was cooked perfect and my sangria was deeeelish! Cant wait to go back

very nice looking restaurant.  I was going to order the full size chicken lemoine.  we went with the light menu having had a late lunch. Big mistake.  While the full size dinners looked  large.  I was very disappointed! Three in our party  One person had the penne pasta.  nice bowl and i had a taste nice.   one other person in our party and i ordered the light chicken lemon.  I thought instead of  two chicken breasts i would get one. Well it looked like The Kitchen gave the other person 3/4 and I got a piece of chicken  2 inches by  2.5 inches.  Most likely carved from my parties chicken breast.  I was a guest and kept myself silent.  To serve me such a small portion of chicken that  had four corners as it  most likely was carved out of my parties breast.  For 12.95   such an embarassment to Brio.   Short cuts in the kitchen.  No supervision ? And here we were planning to return  Sunday with our family and most likely full plates.  Bad move Brio.  Your kitchen ruined my dinner and Your reputation.  Sorry .  you got one star , the warm bread was nice and my veggies were  just ok.   To short  someone on the  ontray.......   poor kitchen supervision.....   I'm afraid to return!   our waitress was very  good.  Needless to say if wasn't with who i was with i would've screamed.

The Brio  (location #2 west of the strip), is a new favorite stop when we come to Las Vegas. Service was outstanding, our wait staff highly informed and knowledgeable about all the menu items. We were there with a group of 10 and the service didn't suffer at all.  I couldn't recommend this restaurant higher.  Can't wait for my next visit...

I tried this place after hearing good things from my father, and can honestly say that I am glad he recommended it. I didn't have the full service,I just sat at a table near the bar and ordered some of the great happy hour specials they offered.  I had a mojito,mango with rum and some mint, which was very fresh and well made the bartenders are very professional looking (one even had the old time mustache). The appetizers range from $4-$6, and there are good ones at all three prices. The Margherita flatbread is an amazing tasting tuscan pizza like creation with great ripe tomato slices, and fresh cheese and basil,it was light and enjoyable.  We tried to order the spinach artichoke dip but we were talked out of it by our server who recommended something else (besides the ravioli) so we ordered the shrimp, which came with a great flavored sauce (a bit peppery) and served over a delicious fried eggplant which gives it great texture and another amazing flavor. We also had a small salad that came with a big slice of prosciutto and some greens with a fantastic vinaigrette dressing which I would recommend you try on any of their salads. The overall presentation of the place is great,it's in the Scottsdale Quarter so it's tucked away. Inside its amazing,large shelves encase some fantastic pieces of italian cookware in a rustic manner, and the temple style ceiling that raises to a point in the center of the floor is amazing as well. I would like to try the regular menu,it's quite expensive but I'm sure it's worth it,and the service will make it all worth while for you,I highly recommend you drop by for appetizers at least, they are great priced and well worth it.

We came here 1/1/09 right after viewing a traditional New Year's Day movie next door @ Rave Movie Theatre.  Since it was 10pm, it wasn't crowded at all.  I picked up a card right at  the entrance to the restaurant for a free appetizer with purchase of an entree (score!).  We ordered the fabulous mussels (usu $11.50) that came in a bacon cream sauce.  The entrees were delish but my dining partner didn't like the lasagne due to the fact that it did come in a cream sauce but I thought it was great because it wasn't thick & lasagne noodle-y.  My veal milanese classico was tasty & is lemony with (in a good way).  Our waiter, Allen, was fine, not weird as was mentioned in previous reviews but forgot to fill our water & ice tea.  Pretty decor, plentiful food, had a lot of leftovers for the next day so all in all would definitely return but I'll also ask my Italian colleague what she thinks

Seriously Taylor, worst customer service ever! Not only was I on hold for 10 minutes, you passed me around 6 times and had everyone tell me to hold. Then they say your in training, so be honest if you don't know what your talking about.
I left 4 star reviews previously, decided to come back to this place. Being at the restaurant for the third time, I am convinced that Brio became one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.
Delicious food! Have been a regular for years and the food keeps you coming back. It is also one of the best happy hours in Vegas!

We showed up with two cranky hangry toddlers and were blown away by the service Tony and staff provided on a Friday night. When I say blown away, I REALLY mean it y'all. The coloring tablecloth and play dough brilliantly kept our toddlers busy and happy. Happy kids equals happy parents that got to enjoy their drinks and yummy dinner in peace. Thank you Brio, we shall return!

The name is more marketing than a showcase of authentic Tuscan cuisine but the menu is full of items that are tasty to the American palate. Attentive service, serviceable ambiance,  and a menu that probably has 20 dishes I'd like to try.  They also have a great "light" menu for those of us paying 'lip service' to diets.

My golfing buddies and I were starving when we arrived.  The waitress was bright and cheery.  We ordered the calamari appetizer and surveyed the wine list.  We ordered the wine and our entrees.   The waitress returned with our wine.  She said the calamari was coming and left.  Then, the servers brought our entrees.  Still no appetizer.  The waitress apologized and offered to get it, but we told her not to.  I had the Pasta Brio--excellent.  More than I could eat.  The other guys were very pleased with their meals as well.  We finished our meals and received the check.  We were charged for the appetizer.  

Summary:  Nice decor.  Good dining atmosphere.  Cheery but poor service.  Very good food.  I've eaten at Brio a number of times (in Birmingham) and have never been disappointed.  Highly recommended

Amazing! Located at town square on LVB. 

I've only had them for delivery but still was happy most of the time. Few times was delivered late (not the restaurants fault and that was addressed)but was still good luke warm. 

I don't care for lobster that much but love the lobster bisque! 
Loved several of the pastas. 
Chicken meal and others all impressive and flavorful. 

Give them a try! Enjoy!

What can I say, the ambiance when you walk in looks like a nicer, more upper class version of Cheesecake factory. It has high ceilings, drapes, expo kitchen... everything you'd want in an Italian-american spot.

The wait staff seemed kind but a bit "above the rest"... if you know what I mean. Just because the location is in Scottsdale doesn't mean you need to act out the assumed local attitude.

In the food department, the food looked beautiful. Plated for a photo opp, so that was nicely done. As for flavor, it doesn't stand out to me as a place that is AMAZING... it is more of a 'good' place to eat. I would definitely not drive out of my way for this restaurant. But if I'm again in the area and craving this type of cuisine, I'll most likely stop in

I love this place when I'm in the mood for back home Italian. I have to say, I've been here a handful of times and have only ever sat in the bar area and had apps (I'm a creature of habit!).
The Italian Wedding Soup is some of the best I've ever had (seems to be served most Saturdays) - it's what draws me here.
My PIC says the lobster bisque is just as good.
The calamari is delicious, and is compete with banana peppers!! Finally, Vegas!!
The bruchetta and flatbreads are also delicious; my favorite is the sundried tomato or the margarita.
My only complaint: the wedding soup is a soup de jour, but should totally be available everyday.

I work at Scottsdale Quarter and this little gem never disappoints! I always receive Outstanding Service! I'm constantly stopping in for my quick lunches which they accommodate by being quick with my order! Also, several peers I work with enjoy meeting up for drinks or a snack on the patio!!

Came here with my mother late night and was surprised to see that it was quite readily available and busy enough to enjoy on a weekday. 
Loved my wait staff: chef accidentally placed chicken in my salad, and my waiter caught it just as it hit my table. Super awesome. 
Ambiance: beautiful outdoor patio with mist so you don't get too hot. Trendy/casual vibe. The tables are really big and round so it's nice for conversations and food sharing with groups. 
Food: got the pesto pasta with salmon. Super good! Love how you can make your own pasta. Just wish there were a few more flatbread options.

I have to say the whole reason I give this restaurant 5 stars is because of our server Adrian- he was so personable and friendly!! He catered to our large party and was very consistent with his service, I really appreciate a restaurant that hires someone like him who truly cares about our experience. I will be back thanks to him!

Happy Hour Heaven. Bríos happy hour is wonderful but be prepared to wait a while. It's always packed because it's always good. I came here with some friends and we ordered the red sangria which I thought was delicious but my friends said it was too bitter. I think to each their own. They preferred the white sangria. 
We started off with the tomato and mozzarella salad, the beef carpaccio and the black pepper shrimp! Everything was delicious of all three my favorite was the shrimp. 
Next we ordered the dessert trio and a dessert. I have no idea what we were thinking, I guess we were hungry at this point the alcohol had set in and our server convinced us. The trio had mascarpone,creme brûlée,and a strawberry short cake mason jar. We also ordered the brownie sundae. Delicious! My favorite was the mascarpone. All together our check was less than 50. What a steal. Definitely coming back!

Brio is a good chain italian food restaurant. Food is consistent, service is good and has nice environment. It is not the same as going to your neighborhood italian spot but does a nice job.

Brio is always willing to make modifications to dishes as long as they are able.  I usually order the Penne Mediterranean and change out the sauce and cheese they are always willing and able.  The dish the way I choose to do it is so good and I have even had servers tell me that it should be on the menu that way.

Brio can get pretty busy, especially on weekends so get there early or wait.  The dining room is very large and there is a pretty large patio as well.  There is also dinner service in the bar area.

Brio offers a solid menu and service therefore making it one our favorites.
menu has nice variety for those who like to eat heart healthy. Happy selections are tasty.  Friendly staff and very professional.  Worth a visit...

A more authentic Olive Garden. 

I like the place, just not blown away. There are so many great Italian places in the Cleveland area and I just don't think Brio can compete. I guess for what it is, it succeeds. It is a more original and authentic chain. It takes the crazy over-Italian of the OG and brings it back a bit. 

I am a fan of the bread for starters. It isn't that greasy white garlic bread at the OG. The atmospheres kinda cool, lively and spacious. 

I generally get some pasta dish here. They have a good version of a chicken Diablo like dish. The savory sauces and spices are always a plus for pasta. It is good food, just not great food. 

The desserts and drinks are always on par. The wine menu is much more impressive than most chains and even some small shops. 

The fact that this one is in Crocker park really makes it feel more chain-like and less authentic. I like coming here but there are so many great options out there, it is hard to justify.

This place is our "Go-to" girls night out location and tonight we had the pleasure of meeting James. He was our server and he is TOP NOTCH!! Thank you, James, for not only putting up with us but convincing us you actually enjoyed yourself. We'll be back (sorry James).

Long story short:

The food was pretty good: 4 out of 5
The ambience/atmosphere: 5 out of 5
The service: 2 out of 5

Based off the reviews I'm reading from this place, the service is pretty mixed. You'll either get an attentive waiter who'll fulfill your needs or have someone who seems like they'd rather be at home than waiting tables. You can tell which type of waiter I got.

With that said, I'd come back though. The food is pretty amazing, but like I said, the service varies here.

My Four Stars is for the bar area and Happy Hour Only which is from 330-6pm & 9pm-close . 

I would of given it a five but place was pretty packed and seating is limited cause they closed the patio area due to it being a bit cold outside. Went here with my mom and brother . We ordered 5 drinks and 4 appetizers which totaled about $56. Not too bad. The appetizers were really really tasty and the portions were decent. Service was pretty good as well ESP for it being happy hour. I would def check this place out again for another happy hour and maybe even dinner .

A few days after the amazing Yelp event at Brio, I decided to go back to enjoy my FREE bruschetta! This visit was yet again, AMAZING! First off, Kimberly, our waitress, was the most personable, helpful, awesome waitress ever! She was very insightful and suggested some pretty tasty appetizers. I'm not a fan of eggplant, but she assured me it was to-die-for. She was not lying, it was delicious!

They also had the same live music as the Yelp event had and he was just the perfect sound for a happy hour date on the patio.

Then, to top it off, the manager that was hosting the Yelp event came over and introduced himself. Thanked me for going to the Yelp event and for coming back! So hospitable! I felt like I had a second royal treatment!

Thanks Brio, you guys are awesome!! :)
wife & I thoroughly enjoyed the happy hour appetizers while receiving excellent attention & service from Ken the bartender. We have to go back now & try the dinner menu.

Good was very average . Mines was actually cold but this is not the reason for the 3 stars only . I just don't see the hype at all for this place . Wasn't bad at all . Wouldn't return though . Just my opinion

Not worth the money, I have made better pasta myself. We went last night and 3 of the 4 of us didn't like the food whatsoever, the other person wouldn't pay that price again for the small amount they received.

This is my 3rd time coming to Brio since it's opened and unfortunately I'm never really happy with my experience. I always try to give it another try but my experience is usually the same. The servers are not very friendly almost feel like they get annoyed if you ask for something. I got the chicken limone didn't care for it much. I'm so picky about Italian food... I really wish restaurants would focus on seasoning. My food was pretty bland. My mom got the pasta pesto also very bland.  I wasn't really impressed with the Calamari either. The presentation was wonderful but the food itself was not. It's a beautiful restaurant....Maybe for cocktails but not to dine.

I'm half and half with this place. I went in expecting that there would be a least a few pasta dishes on the menu, but there wasn't. Grudgingly, I settled on another dish of lemon chicken with vegetables. It was good, but it wasn't anything I was amazed with or would encourage me to come back. The same with the dessert: delicious, but not anything amazing.

Oh and they give you bread and the weirdest baked tortilla like thing??? I'm not quite sure how to describe it, but it was just weird and personally, it was kind of a mess to eat.

Lastly, be prepared to wait, not for a table but at your actual table. I felt like the waiters could have been a little faster with the drinks. I don't mind waiting for food, but it kind of sucks when you're super thirsty and your waiter is MIA.

I went on a saturday early afternoon. I noticed alot of staff, but service kind of took awhile. Maybe it was because most of the party weren't at the table, and they (waiters) didn't want to repeat herself. ( i don't know).

Food was different. I wanted some fettucini italian dish. But the one i ordered had ham, and some other pork meat. It was sweat as well. I'm more used to Olive Garden fettucini alfredo. So it was different. I will go back again. Try something else.

Went were walking by and decided to stop I got a few drinks. We had the sangria and it was amazing, if you're in town square and need a refresher on the weekend I'd suggestion stopping by. It's only 8$ per drink and it's well worth it.

Went out to dinner with my son we had a wonderful time sat on patio and we had a wonderful view even The valet parker was nice and helpful The waitress Shell was friendly and engaging recommend it some excellent choices the food was great even the bus person with amazing hair was wonderful The manager Tiffany came over and introduced herself with a bright smile upon receiving the check we excuse ourselves and went to the restroom. We had yummy leftovers that we planned on devouring I'm at the end of our night at home. When we came back to the table all our food was thrown away accidentally. The hostess Alexis was very apologetic and immediately found my server and the manager. Shell was very apologetic and wanted to accommodate us in anyway. The manager Tiffany came right over and apologize and prepared a whole new meal how great now that is some customer service I will be back! The food was wonderful but this service really made our evening thank you for great  great customer service !!!!!

Came here twice with my husband and daughter. The waiter recommended for my daughter, this very yummy gourmet like Mac and cheese. It was so good my husband ate half of it. I got the prosciutto and burrata mozzarella sandwich. It was delicious. My husband got the cheeseburger and he enjoyed it. Waiters are very good and friendly. Definitely a lovely place with a nice atmosphere for lunch or dinner.
Great food. Not your traditional Italian menu. I bit pricey, but large portions. Service was excellent.
Thanks for a great evening and wonderful service by Jess! Food was great, and I loved the suggestions! Definitely will be back

I have eaten many times at their Gilbert location and usually enjoyed the food.  Today was National Lasagna Day according to the restaurant, in the email they sent to me almost daily this week.  Lasagna at half price folks, who could resist? I have not missed this holiday with Brio in the past 4 or 5 years and always enjoyed their take on lasagna.  I remember it being better in the past but it has slipped from a 4 to a 3, still quite tasty, perhaps a bit too salty this time.  There are better choices on the menu but it was Lasagna Day!  The locale itself remains elegant and upscale.  The wait staff friendly and efficient.  We had a doctor's appointment to get to and I told our waiter that we needed to be out in 40 minutes, and we were.  Can't wait for Ravioli Day, better than their lasagna.  As usual, it was quite noisy and difficult to have a conversation.  It is good enough to return to fairly often, see you there perhaps:)

Well I guess I'm a pretty patriotic kind of guy!  My last review of this great restaurant was National Lasagna Day last July and this time National Ravioli Day which might mean that I just love a bargain at half price.  We ordered the two half price ravioli dishes on the menu, Portobello Ravioli with Cremini mushrooms, tomatoes, Parmigiano-Reggiano and fresh thyme in a light champagne brown butter sauce, $8, the better of the two, and Lobster & Shrimp Ravioli $10, prettier than the first but not as great tasting.  Service was impeccable as usual, cleanliness too!  An attractive environment and usually very busy, people know good food. I guess I need to get back here more often and not wait for half price meals :)

Had a reservation for 5 for 6:30 pm.  We arrived and within 5 min were seated.  It was Friday night and it was totally packed and about 50 people hanging in the foyer and out the front door waiting for seating.  The noise level was UNBEARABLE.  I could not hear my husband talking to me and he was right next to me.  The people at the next table were trying to talk but had to yell and they did...non stop...as were everyone in the restaurant.  We were waiting for our other guests but could not take it anymore and gave up our table, called our guests who were just getting out of their car and told them to meet us at Twin Creek that this place was not acceptable to a social evening.  What a shame...it is so beautiful inside.  We have only dined for Brunch outside in their really nice patio...and for that experience I would give it 5 stars...but definitely not the place for a social Friday night .....at least inside the restaurant...outside it was pouring rain, so not an option.

Soup tastes like it just poured from the can. Salad is small and tastes super-salty and acidic, they put some marinated kale all over. Service is slow and pushy for sells, if they make mistake- don't expect apology, they will try to make you buy something else to keep the dinner price up.

I never realized how good the service in Vegas was until I moved out. Aside from the good food, the place itself is beautiful and the waitresses and waiters I've had have always been kind and knowledgeable. I will definitely miss this place :')

Loved this place service was excellent waiter was ver thoughtful we went there Thursday Jan 26 party of 5 food was great the only thing we couldn't find a handicap parking anywhere close outside matter of fact never did find one anywhere atmosphere was very nice  I has had the lobster and stuffed shrimp everything on the table was excellent

Went for birthday dinner with my daughter, along with wife and mother-in-law.  Had been here before for happy hour and it was pretty decent but we only ate appetizers that time. Decided to give it a try for dinner.

Since it was a special day, we went all out.  Drinks, appetizers, salad, entrees, and one dessert.  All in all, the food was only fair (except the shrimp and eggplant appetizer-wonderful!) and we were pretty disappointed.  Over $200 with the tip left me with sticker shock as well.

Bottom line - if you want Olive Garden quality food, go to Olive Garden and save yourself a bunch of money.  Or...stick with happy hour and some appetizers.

Went in for lunch and was "waited" on by the world's least attentive waitress. For $30- no appetizer, lunch lasagna and one glass of wine- I at least expect the service to be good. I'd like to point out that she didn't seem particularly interested in any of her tables. The lunch lasagna comes with a wedge salad. The salad isn't bad, but it sucked that she dumped both that and the lasagna on the table at the same time. I'm not sure if the lasagna was served hot since by the time I got to it, it was lukewarm. Also- no offer of a refill or grated cheese, in fact the next time I saw my server was when she dropped off my check- still no offer of a refill, dessert, bread, etc. Taking her not-so-subtle hint I put my card in the booklet and then proceeded to wait, and wait, and wait. During this time I picked at my lasagna and ruminated that it looked like cat food and tasted like school cafeteria food. Ugh. I left her a standard 20% tip and told the manager how pissed I was at wasting $30 and a good tip on this crappy restaurant. Save yourself money and time and find anywhere else.

The Happy Hour at Brio is extremely jolly!  We love the offerings at the Brio at Town Square in Las Vegas, and thought we would try the Phoenix version of the same restaurant.  We dropped in on a Wednesday for Happy Hour  before going to a film, and were astonished by the size of the portions.  Some of the items were similar to Vegas" menu, but the servings of the Shrimp and Eggplant and the Pizza Margarita were twice if not three times as big!  Delicious spicy shrimp and crispy flatbread pizza accompanied by two large Margaritas made for a great preview to coming attractions.
The space at this restaurant is also more generous, and we were able to eat inside in unhurried luxury!

Okay, I wised up and had a Bellini, the beautiful Italian cocktail combining peaches and Proseco (sparkling white wine).  It was smooth as silk, icy cold and slid down my throat.   I had just had the pleasure of the drink at Harry's Bar and the Four Seasons in Florence, so the Bellini had some tough competition, but withstood the test!

We chose the scrumptious and spicy shrimp and egglant, the shrimptini, and punctuated it with the sliders, which turned out to be one big burger cut in quarters.
We preferred the steak bruschetta, but enjoyed the happy hour fun before our golf lesson across the street!

Funny waitress, and a great table in the shade near the bar!

Last night (New Year's Eve) was my first time at Brio, and my friend and I came in for dinner before going out. It was busy, which was expected, but were able to find a perfect little table for two in the bar area. I'm not going to sugar-coat it - once we sat down, we waited for a really long time to get our order taken, to get our wine and bread, and to get our meals. But on busy nights even at good places, things can go wrong - and I'm a firm believer that it is 100% about how staff and management handle themselves. Brio did an excellent job at recovering our experience. Our wine order wasn't put in and we had to flag the manager down after 15 minutes of wondering what was up, but she got our wine to us, and took the glasses off the bill. In fact, while we were having dinner, our server even brought us over two extra glasses. (The wine was delicious, one of their pinot noirs, but I can't remember exactly which one.)

I didn't know what to expect out of our food since I'd never been here, but I was really impressed - the food is so good! I had a hard time deciding between their chicken pesto pomodoro, the pasta alla vodka and the pasta brio, but I decided on the pasta brio (rigatoni, roasted red pepper sauce, mushrooms and grilled chicken) since it's their signature dish and came highly recommended by our server. It was SO delicious and very flavorful - it wasn't spicy but still had the kick I crave! My friend had their chicken pesto over angel hair and didn't really love their pesto- according to our server it isn't true pesto - its base is chicken broth? So maybe that was why. But he ate it and had some of my pasta brio, and we both agreed that dish was incredible.

Coming in on such a busy holiday, I think everyone at Brio handled themselves very well, even when there were mishaps. The atmosphere was really nice - had good lighting and seemed sophisticated but also jovial. And you can't beat the location - Tivoli Village is so pretty. I loved our experience here and can't wait to come back and bring my husband!

My favorite Italian restaurant in Gilbert! The service is great and the food is so yummy! Especially loving the new items on the menu! The Burrata & Ciabatta, always love the bruschetta sampler, kale caesar salad,   Espresso Rubbed Ribeye, the salmon Fresca, and the strawberry shortcake!

We've been here several times.  Usually for happy hour, or "reverse" happy hour (after 9pm).  Note that happy hour on Friday does NOT include drink specials, just food (go figure).  One time we ate in the dining room.  This review will be about the happy hour and bar menu.

The food here isn't really authentic Italian.  But it's good.  They're shooting for "high class" while remaining "casual".  We've sampled everything on their bar menu, and it's all good.  The "Brio burgers" are tasty, the flatbread pizzas are almost authentic and pretty good, I didn't really care for the dip but my wife liked it, and the beef on bruschetta is really good.  And you can feed four people for under $20 pretty easily if you are doing happy hour.

The bar area is a little loud, and a bit small.  It can be difficult to see any of their TVs because you have to twist around and/or crane your neck to see.  The booths are about the only places where it's easy to watch, and they only have two of them.  It is not uncommon for the bar area to be full, but they will honor happy hour specials in the outdoor seating accessible from the bar area.

Love their food! We had my daughter's baptism party here and the manager Jenna was very nice and helpful during the arrangements.  The staff was very attentive the only thing is that it seemed they tried to get too many of us to sit in a too small of space so we were a bit squished. Other than that the food was of course excellent. 
We also have been there for brunch. Their breakfast food is not as good as their regular stuff.
Love the location. So nice to sit outside in the evenings and look at the surroundings.

The happy hours here Rock. Get here early otherwise you'll be waiting for a seat so Mike and Madison can take care of you. You won't be disappointed. Everything from the pepper shrimp to the Beef Carpaccio to the Caprese salad to the Brio burger and potato skins.
I love this place ... It never disappoint .. The food always delicious and the Sirvece is really nice and the atmosphere just amazing
Excellent Italian Food!  I've been a few times and the Happy Hour is the way to go for value!  In a nice/new shopping center Town Center Mall.

My husband (the lucky one of us) won a gift card to this restaurant, so we planned a nice meal here with another couple for double date night.  Normally we wouldn't venture so far from home base, but we weren't disappointed.  It was a lovely experience.  (Did I just use the word "lovely"?  Yes...I think I did.  Huh, that was weird.)

We'd made reservations for a Saturday night and were seated right away.  All the hostesses and servers were super friendly and polite.  The restaurant was very busy, so the open dining area was somewhat loud, making conversation a bit challenging at times, but we'd been there before so knew what to expect.  It has a very open feel.  Certainly not intimate or private, if that's what you're looking for. 

We ordered an appetizer of Spinach Artichoke Dip, served with Parmesan flatbread, which was very good...but the bread seemed more like large pieces of cracker.  I wasn't a huge fan, felt like the dip needed some thicker, fluffier bread to really make the most of it.  But it did all get eaten.  The couple we were with ordered a single glass of wine, mentioning to the server that they would be sharing it, so the server brought out two glasses and poured very generously for each, which was nice.  My friend ordered lobster bisque and said it was delicious, although it was only lukewarm when it arrived, so she very sweetly asked if she could have it heated up a bit.  The server was gracious and accommodating, did not make us feel as though we were putting her out at all.

For main dishes, I honestly don't recall what the other couple ordered, but they did seem pleased.  I ordered the Ravioli di Bello...yum!!!  My husband ordered the Whole Roasted Chicken and let me tell you, that was a LOT of food.  The plate they brought out for him covered about a quarter of the entire surface area of the table.  For a guy, that's probably alright I guess, but if I'd ordered the whole chicken and they brought that plate out to me, I personally would've wanted to crawl beneath the table from embarrassment.  Anyway, my hubs is a pretty big guy and even he couldn't finish the entire plate, so he ended up boxing some of it for later.

Both times I've eaten here, I've really enjoyed the food and service.  The prices are to be expected on that side of town, so at least you get a lot of food for what you pay for.  All in all, a great experience.  And don't forget to check in on Yelp for a free Tuscan Taster with beverage!

It's nice to go to a restaurant that remembers how important the little things are. The food is awesome and the service is great as well, we sat in Michelle's section and she is hands down one of the best servers we've had in long time!

Been here 10 minutes and every single wait person walks by with eyes averted. No acknowledgement whatsoever. Debating whether to leave. 

UPDATE: We finally got noticed! The nice manager apologized and gave us a free appetizer. When our nice meal was done, our server said she talked to him and they comped the whole meal! 

Food here is very good. Not the best ever but we've been before and are never disappointed.

Food is very good, service is great.  Always been treated well here.  

My favorite things about this place:
-the bread basket
-drinks are good
-tiny decadent desserts

Hmmmm. I would say our visit was a 6/10. We had a party of 10 with two waiters. Food was a 8/10. Decor and setting 8/10. Problem was food was missing from different orders and my husbands lamb dish never made it to the table until everyone else was finished eating their meal. (We were eventually told it would be a little bit before it would be out, so he asked everyone to eat while their food was warm.) The staff was polite and helpful, offering to comp my husbands dish. That is nice, but he came to dine with his party. We will pass and try somewhere else next time. There is a lot of establishment competition out there to make mistakes like forgetting someone's entire meal.

First time coming here and probably last... the moment we got there no host was in the front to sit us as I had to go walk to the bar to tell someone to sit my daughter and I. Finally we got seated and began to look at the menu, dinner time. My daughter was set on the shrimp and lobster fettuccini. Took me awhile to have my mind set as the menu choice was great. Many things to pick from. I ended up getting the beef short ribs. Quite a wait must I say. Very upset too our server was just rude (wish I got the name). I kept looking around and saw there was bread at the tables with people eating and we did not get any so I figured it wasn't complimentary. We got our food after a wait and my daughter politely asked our server if the bread was complimentary and why we didn't get any and she straight up goes, "it is but you should've asked earlier, your meals already here." I had to bite my tongue as I know my daughter didn't want to cause a scene. My short ribs were dry right off the spot. And I expected a thicker meat. I look over to my daughters and it looks great! But where was the shrimp and lobster?! It was just sauce, pasta, and tomatoes etc. she loves seafood too so she was pretty bummed out. We both just ate it as we were about to spend money on this meal we could've made at home. 

I wanted to get her dessert because she's been with her mother a couple days so I just wanted to make the dinner better but the "warm chocolate cake" wasn't even warm. We were over it already. Slow seating, rude sever, and disappointing food. Would I go back to try it again? Possibly. But this whole experience was just sad.

Writing this as I am sitting at the table waiting for the waiter to come back, it's been over 15 mins and our server is no where to be found. The food was very good, but the service was lacking. I could understand if the restaurant was really busy, but it's almost closing time and there are only 3 total tables seated right now. If I could split the rating for service and food separately I would give them a 5 for the food, and a 2 for service. I've come here many times, and always had great service, but tonight is definitely is far from it.
A great place to eat, but you will be wanting more after your meal. Unless you are already full out of your mind, that is.

Went to Brio's with my bday group of 8 girlfriends.  I, and 2 others ordered the calamari, and unfortunately we were disappointed in it. The manager came over and took replacement orders from us for the steak salads. He then credited 3 out of the 9 lunch orders to apologise for our initial disappointment.  What can I say, service like that makes me very loyal, and all my friends agreed we would continue to visit Brio's where the food is always tasty and the service is impeccable. Thank you to the manager for making my lunch special for me instead of the disaster it could have been.

3.5/5. Stopped in before a movie for a few drinks and appetizers today (Sunday afternoon). It was pricy, but we knew that in advance. I might have given five stars, but we listened to several female bartenders complain over... and over... and over again about what a bad day they had at work. We get it- it was busy. Please be more mindful of what your patrons are listening to. The side of the bar we were on was empty- there certainly wasn't a wait for the restaurant. It was a bummer to listen to them complain. They were VERY nice to us- food was amazing- the mood was just a bummer. We'll think twice before coming back with so many other nearby options. No weekend happy hour.
Seems too foo foo to me.  not sure why.  the food is fine but it seems like upscale for the sake of upscale.  If it had a view of something other than a mall maybe it would feel different.

Been there twice for dinner and both times were good. Big open room which gets kind of noisy, but it's a fun place. This is a chain, somewhere between Carabas and Maggianos. I tend to get the veal piccata type of dish at Italian places as a measure, and the veal here was very good. the wines were reasonable, waitstaff attentive, food was good. I looked over at my friend's lasagna and it looked gooey, sloppy, whatever to me. He enjoyed it. The prices were reasonable enough to put Brio on the list for a night out during the week.

The reviews are all over the map so far for this recent entry into the Kierland-area restaurant scene - and for good reason. It seems that for each pro there exists an equivalent con. 
On arrival, you will find a choice between extremely inconvenient parking or $6 valet service. Not unusual in this area, but nonetheless irritating.
I have visited twice now, both times for lunch, mixed results. Generally speaking, the food is constructed of quality ingredients, presented in an appealing way and won't leave you hungry. 
Service both in the dining area and the bar was amateurish, as is normal for a chain. Timing was way off.
Once seated, we were presented with a bread basket as we ordered drinks. The bread was fresh and warm, and a nice start. Drinks arrived correctly, but I have had better coffee at .... well, everywhere.
We placed our orders, each of our party of three finding something on the menu that we were interested in trying.
As we waited for our meals, we observed the operations throughout the dining room, as seperations between tables were low. While this made for interesting people-watching, conversation was nearly impossible, with nothing to buffet the cacophony of flatware meeting dishes. 
Salads arrived, and they were fairly large if uninteresting. Entrees followed: pastas were very good, hot, tasty and with no shortage of garlic. Pizza however was a flat, soggy mess. 
Dessert tray consisted of a collection of espresso cups filled with a variety of standard offerings. One of the two selected contained a little surprise - a piece of cardboard. I did not order a replacement.
They might have garnered another star, but then we got the check. At about $15 per person, not including tip, we were left feeling quite underwhelmed. 
Altogether, I am left with very little reason to return.
The best food I have EVER eaten!  My mouth danced the whole time.  Beautiful and unique admosphete and exceptional service. Ahhhhhhhh!
Delicious! Pesto pasta, shrimp Alfredo, spinach dip by the fire. The atmosphere is very mood setting with dim lights and decent music. Price is reasonable. Loved it!

Excellent food and a great atmosphere. It's an excellent place for a date. 
The bruschetta is incredible to start and save a little room for dessert to top it all off. 
It'll be a regular for us. Very highly recommended.

Went for the happy hour (Monday-Friday 3-6:30, Monday-Thursday 9-closing). Must admit was very impressed with the apps for $3.95. Ordered the burger, artichoke dip and the ravioli. Bartender was friendly enough to tell me the eggplant shrimp is the best thing they've got, so I take him up on it.

He was right, the eggplant shrimp was very, very good, and I don't even like shrimp that much. Ravioli was good too, I'd probably get it again. Burger had a charred taste to it I liked. The burger was pretty simple, but hey, it's $3.95.

For the drinks I believe they only have Sangrias, Martinis, wine, and Mojitos for $5. No beer as far as I could tell.

The bartenders seemed nice and knew the regulars by name, the ambiance is good, parking is easy in Tivoli Village, and the prices for happy hour are worth it. Nice spot for a slightly more "upscale" happy hour at cheap prices.

I had heard good things about this place and was really excited to try it but my experience was awful. I never write negative reviews but this was exceptionally terrible. The waitress acted like she was bothered serving us, she almost stabbed my mother (slid a sharp knife across the table instead of handing it) and didn't bring us silverware after we asked several times (not sure why it wasn't already on the table). Anyway the food was mediocre at best, I've had better Italian food at Olive Garden. I had a Caesar salad, but I tried the chicken and penne ala vodka. My chicken was burnt and the others were just ok. Aside from a hair in the food and sticky silverware. Will not visit again.

Love their happy hour. Once of the best ones in town. It use to be 2.95 awhile back ago. They raised the appetizer prices to 3.95... but seriously, it's worth it. 3.95 is still a steal especially for this girl! 

Not much of a bar area compared to their other location at town square. It's also quite busy so if you don't go there early, you may not get a seat. 

Appetizers we ordered:
1) Brio burger: Cut into 4. Simple burger.. but really well done. A fluffy bread with a juicy patty. 
2) Ravioli Caprese: 5 pieces of breaded cheese ravioli. Fried to perfection. 
3) Beef Carpaccio: MY FAVORITE DISH. Thinly sliced salty meat. What more could you ask for?
4) Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant: Another delicious dish.
5) Crispy Shrimp Piccante: Boyfriend l

It was more than enough for the both of us but we seriously wanted to try everything. 
The drinks are delicious. Just martinis mostly. No beer. But well, it's all good. Cause I have my 3.95 appetizers.

Oh Brio, I wish I met your happy hour sooner. 

For your dining pleasure (during M-F, 3 to 7 & M-Th 9 to close), TUSCAN TASTERS FOR 2.95! Woop woop! Good quality food for such a little price. 

The service was great despite the fact that the server was by herself (or so I overheard). Sarah was her name. She managed to keep a smile on her face and was very polite.

The best plate from my happy hour was the Spicy shrimp and eggplant. The crusted eggplant had a sligh crunch and paired nicely with the black pepper cream sauce. However, the shrimp tasted spicier than the eggplant for some reason. 

The Brio Burger was decent.. Go for the other tasters instead. 

I also enjoyed the sliced steak bruschetta. The tender pieces of steak were topped with yummy gorgonzola.

I wish there was drink specials on the menu... ::sad face::

The seating area in the bar was very nice. There was two lounge areas complete with a love seat and arm chairs. Luckily, I got there in time to bag one!

The mini desserts looked so good but I choose just one. The vanilla creme brulee. The strawberries tasted so well with the vanilla custard. I which I ordered three of them! One was simply not enough!!

Brio! I've never been to Italy but I think you just gave me a small taste of it!

It was good, but not good enough to justify the prices. I will admit that the service didn't seem like a franchise place, it felt more intimate and welcoming and the setting is nice. The price to food quality ratio was a little off though.

A very nice restaurant. If you ever wonder about a good appetizer you've got to try the Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant is hands down the best appetizer there!!!
It is a little spicy because if the pepper, but it is delicious! I think that the eggplant just adds an amazing flavor to it and your palate will thank you. Try it and thank me later
The Tres Leches is just delicious! It is really a challenge to get it right (the Tres Leches) but they pretty much nailed it! Basically a good place to come with the kids and let them pig out lol
The Sourdough was amazing, the server suggested Olive Oil and Parm, fantastic. Food amazing (Shrimp Mediterranean) and shout out to Tony the server, really great!

My husband and I going out for Happy Hour every other Friday night.  We go to a different location every time as there are so many different places in Las Vegas.  
Brio had advertised a $5.00 Martini. I selected one of the specially priced Martini's but when I received the bill, I had been charged $8.99 for it. I asked my server and she ignored me.  
The $2.95 small plates were good but after being charged incorrectly and ignored, I'll never go back again.

My friend and I came in for brunch for our birthday month brunch celebration.  We went in around 3 pm on a Sunday and the wait was only 10 minutes.  (Just a little side info: the pager that they give you to tell you that your table is ready will work across the way at Victoria Secret!)  Once we sat down, we were greeted by our server who immediately asked what we wanted for drinks.  Although it wasn't listed on the menu, they offer a carafe of mimosas.  When we asked the server about it, she wasn't sure if they do that and had to go and check if that was possible.  The server returned saying that it was possible and she told us that it would be $18.  We felt like that was a better deal amongst the 2 of us.  One glass of mimosa was already $6.  The carafe ended up being 2 and a half glasses each! 

I ordered the open faced chicken avocado omelet and my friend ordered the ravioli di bello. Since we came for brunch, I decided on a brunch dish, but was also interested in the ravioli.  My friend beat me to it!  While we were waiting for the food, bread and butter was brought out to the table. The food itself was delish although I wished that I had gotten the ravioli di bello! The flavors in that was amaze! It made my chicken avocado omelet seem a bit bland.

What to say...  The appetizer we had at lunch is the only reason they are getting two stars instead of one.  The artichoke dip was pretty good, nothing super, but pretty good.  Had the shrimp and crab crepes for brunch.  Scrambled eggs, shrimp, crab, and asparagus rolled up in crepe served with fresh fruit and fried red potatoes.  Sounds awesome.  It was far from it,  To start off the smell of the over ripe melon in the fresh fruit overwhelmed my plate with a horrible smell.  Strike one.  Next I moved to the potatoes, over cooked to the point that  they were black and burnt to a crisp.  Strike two.  Next the crepes, the eggs were over cooked and dry, there was not crab or shrimp in them, the asparagus was flavorless and overcooked, and the hollandaise sauce taste like something out of a box or package.  Strike three.  Sadly they had a fourth strike as well.  Everything on my plate was the same temperature, the crepes and the potatoes were cold, and the fruit was warm.  I try to give everyplace a second chance, but I am not sure this place is worthy of that.

The food is good but the service was not good at all. Our server was annoyed most of the questions we had. Believe me I get it.....it can be annoying but we literally asked 4 questions, maybe 1 too many for her. (I wish I could remember her name) 
I asked about the raspberry mojito and told her I didn't want it that strong if they can please put extra raspberries. She looked at me like I asked her for her social security number. Lol
My drink was beyond strong. Of course she didn't make it so it wasn't her fault but I asked if she can have them put a little more of the raspberry syrup in it. She said "it's not syrup it's fresh actual raspberries" (with attitude) woah! Okay then we'll can you ask them to not make it strong please. 
She charged me for 2 drinks. By the end of the night I was exhausted talking to her and we paid the bill and left. 
I don't know if I would go back.

Had a table of 12 for a birthday celebration. Ordered some appetizers for the table, artichoke dips, bruschetta etc. All were good, dips came with a nice bread and lavosh. Salads were tasty, portions average. Orders varied from cod with grilled veggies and pasta  to Beef Medallions with Gorgonzola. All was very good, dinner portions a little small. Service was very good, friendly and quick. Definitely recommend. Dishes were a little pricey, but that is to be expected with the minimum wage increase.

I've had lunch here a couple of times and dinner once.  I love the patio seating and people watching.  The food is good, and the service is better than you would expect from a chain.  I love the different items on the lighter side menu.  Great place do dine with friends.
Good food and service. Not the best, but a lot better then Olive Garden or Macaroni Grille.

Great dining experience.  I typically love Brio for business lunches but decided to bring a date for dinner.  She loved it.

Started with the bruschetta quatro.  4 different types of bruschetta.  All delicious.  I ordered the crab and shrimp cakes.  Very tasty with large pieces of crab and shrimp throughout.  My date ordered the tilapia which was cooked perfectly.  

All with a few glasses of sangria thrown in made for a lovely date.

Brio is amazing.  I've never had a bad entrée or a bad experience.  This is across a couple of locations and a good stretch of time.  

Love coming here for lunch, business or personal.  The strawberry chicken balsamic salad... wow.  Maybe my favorite salad ever.  That being said everything is good.  Try the salmon,  try the gorgonzola crusted beef medallions.  It's all good. 

Bottom line, come here, eat well and have some vino.

No greeting at the front door from the hostesses (of which there were 2). Two other couples were waiting to be seated upon checking in but no one acknowledged us until they were sat and that acknowledgment was gruff and unfriendly. Our server made up for it with a great attitude, wonderful suggestions, and a genuinely positive attitude. I had wanted to leave but am glad I didn't because of the service once we were sat.

I give two stars strictly because the customer service was TERRIBLE, I guess we came late and agitated our server, but who knows.
