The food was very good I had a flatbread that was excellent and the carpaccio was also good and HUGE. The mall that Brio is located in could really use a jolt of electricity, but that seems to be all too familiar these days with the funky economy.

This is as good as it gets for Happy Hour. I am only rating Happy Hour. Brio, Monday to Thursday, 9pm to close at the bar, $2.95 per Tuscan Taster, which are supposed to be appetizers but are the size of entrees. $5 Martini Thursdays can apply to the Tuscan Taster Happy Hour special, and if it's not Thursday, but you have a card to show that you're in the food and beverage industry, you can get $5 martinis even if it's not Thursday. 

They used to have the Steak Bruschetta, but they took that off the menu and replaced it with the Mozzarella Red Pepper Bruschetta with Arugula. Anyway, to the food.

Brio Burger: ordered this at medium, came with crisp chips and a nice plain brioche bun. The meat was delicious and fresh. The chips were really crispy. Dip this in the tomato sauce of the

Ravioli Caprese: 3 pieces of ravioli, circular, with cheese topped with basil and tomatoes. 

Beef Carpaccio: paper-thin slices of raw beef (about 6) with a little aioli, capers, some leafy greens, and a pizza-shaped slice of crisp flatbread. Everything was fresh and tasted great.

Sausage and Pepperoni Flatbread: Crisp flatbread baked in a wood-fire oven comes topped with bits of sausage and pepperoni cut into four triangles.

Food deserves 4 stars. Service from Nicole M. deserves 5 stars as we only had happy hour items and raspberry iced tea, but she still treated us like any other guest, and ambience and happy hour menu deserve 5 stars. I have been to Brio Tuscan Grille about 5 times for their night time happy hour.

Give this place a shot if you haven't tried it yet for happy hour. You'll be surprised - pleasantly while enjoying the view of the Colosseum and the background Italian music that so dearly reminds me of Firenze, Italia.

I have now gone to Brio several times and my experience is always the same, GREAT!! The ambiance is sophisticated but laid back. I had a party of 3 and we were offered the outside patio or inside for seating with little wait. The menu can be a little intimidating but our waiters have always been very helpful. You receive warm bread that's freshly baked. Their lasagna was super rich but you could definitely taste all the cheeses and meat. The Filetto Di Manzo Toscano steak is always cooked perfectly! I have never had a steak cooked and done so well! We also asked for the grilled salmon which was just as delicious. All the plates came warm and in big portions. I recommend the peach sangria! You can't go wrong with any of their dishes. Fabulous work their chef is doing!

My boyfriend and I love coming to Brio whenever we're in Vegas. The food is delicious, the service is efficient and friendly, and the ambiance is very classy. The last time we ate at Brio for lunch, we were starving so we ordered an appetizer, entree, and dessert. 

Steak Bruschetta - The bread and arugula tasted so fresh and the steak had great seasoning. I definitely recommend ordering this for your appetizer! 

Pasta Carbonara - My boyfriend loves ordering carbonara whenever we go out for Italian food and has ordered it from Brio in the past. However, the carbonara during this visit was very bland and tasted like it needed more seasoning. 

Pasta Alla Vodka - Delicious! The creamy marinara sauce was very flavorful and the ricotta filled ravioli were so good. I'm definitely going to be ordering this next time.

Chocolate Molten Lava Cake - One of the best lava cakes we've ever had. The caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream paired perfectly with the rich chocolate lava cake. We scarfed down the dessert within minutes. 

Overall, Brio is an excellent Italian restaurant and the quality of the food and service is always up to par.

If this review was solely based on the happy hour it would be a solid 5 star . So if your like me and you hunt for the best happy hours out there this is definitely one of the best ! They have huge portions and the food deals are $4,$5 & $6 . 

I like the beef carpaccio $4, black pepper shrimp $6, caprese salad $5 and the eggplant fries $4. They also have good deals for the drinks . But keep in mind that happy hour is available only in the bar area ! It's from 3:30-6:30 Monday - Friday . 

I've eaten here non happy hour a few times , and it was okay , it's a totally different experience in my opinion. I had the risotto and it was okay portions were good but it did not wow me . 

The main area is really pretty and they have outdoor seating as well so you can people watch if that's your thing . For hot days , they also have mists to keep their patrons cool on their patio. 

I love you brio !

Fancier than olive garden but not stuffy.  A little overpriced for Italian food that I can make at home.  It's really yummy though and sitting on the patio during a cool night is sublime.  Nearby shopping makes for an entertaining evening and a nice after dinner stroll.  Servers are very accommodating.  We asked to move to a table near a heater and they were more than happy to move us.

Ok food. Ok service. I had the lobster bisque which was good but only one piece of lobster. My husband had the rotisserie chicken, good but dry. Our server was nice but every time she approach d the table she must have decided we were ok, so she turned and walked away before communicating. Food came out quickly but almost too quickly between courses. I will probably try out another place in Scottsdale before returning.

Brio is an Italian restaurant whose main view overlooks the parking lot, but the patio is spacious and perfect for cooler nights.

I love Italian food, so I was stoked to try their Tuscan recipes. I 'm not sure I ever want to dine there again after my experience, though.

Our server was wonderful (actually, all the servers who came up to our table were wonderful), and the food and drinks came out promptly. We received freshly baked white bread first, which was soft with a crispy crust. It was good but nothing exciting.

I then dug into a Brio Chopped Salad ($4.95), my favorite part of the meal. It was so huge, I should have just ordered that alone. I loved it-it had tomatoes, olives, onion, cucumber and Feta cheese, and I had it with ranch instead of the usual red wine vinaigrette it usually comes with. It was a really well-rounded salad, and the portion was a great deal for the price.

I had still ordered Mushroom Ravioli Al Forno ($14.95), which I got with BRIO's tomato parmesan cream sauce instead of alfredo. The sauce was really bland to me-usually it's my favorite sauce because of the kick it has, but this had none. Also, the pasta was sort of rubbery-definitely not handmade. I took most of my meal home, which was boxed for me.

When I ate the rest of it later at home, I almost (thank gosh I didn't) bit into a pea-sized piece of ceramic. I have no idea how that got in the box, but it was buried under the pasta and would have chipped my teeth if I hadn't have noticed it before biting into it. That, combined with my lack of enthusiasm for the pasta, leaves me with no desire to rush back, no matter how awesome that salad was.

My friend got Smoked Chicken and Portobello Brushcetta ($11.75). She said the consistency was weird, and to me, the presentation also looked sloppy, as well.
 
I'd recommend going to True Food Kitchen before BRIO.
I always enjoy this very pleasant atmosphere at brio and my spaghetti with spicy sauce I come here for a special occasion to spend time with my family

I really love brio and have been coming here mug too often lately. Their food is always good.. lunch, dinner or weekend. Ranch.. yes they served brunch, who would have thought. My favorite is their happy hour, you can be sealed anywhere and don't have to fight over a chair in the bar like typical places, you can actually bring the whole family and enjoy the great food at reasonable prices.

I've been here over 6 times and the food is about the same as the Cheesecake factory. Lunch time is a good time to come because the salads are cheap and the carpaccio is a good portion.

Fish dishes for dinner are quite good. I've tried several and none have been overcooked. That's good for consistency.

There's nothing special about the wine list but the choices are alright. The great thing about this place is the outside seating.

Brio has fantastic food. It's great for brunch, lunch, dinner, bday dinner, etc. 9/10, we get great service. Love their happy hour. Love their bread and cocktails. Outside seating is awesome when the weather is nice and they even have an outdoor bar.
Excellent!  Service was great, food was delicious.  We highly recommend the pork chop it's huge and juicy. The Alfredo was perfect!

This place it's better if you come by yourself , because it's great , amazing staff delicious food but it is &
$$ if you don't want to spend more then 20$ don't come here . I usually don't repeat restaurants , but definitely I will come again . I got Fresca Salmon which is potatoes , tomatoes , asparagus , spinach I was surprise with the ingredients  cause it also had fresh cheese which was odd for me but as soon as a taste it I fall in love for dessert don't forget to ask for warm chocolate cake as well as the white wine collection

Brio is the perfect restaurant to visit after a long day of shopping! In fact, when the Quarter first opened up and H & M arrived, my sister and I made it a girl's night out and after several hours of shopping at H & M, enjoyed wine and dinner on the patio at Brio. It was such a fun night and the Brio patio was calm and relaxing. 

Fast forward a couple of years and now the Quarter is thriving with many more shops and restaurants, but Brio still remains a favorite to me. I think this is the perfect restaurant for families who have kids and want to have a nice dinner at a restaurant, but in an environment where the kids won't stand out if they get a little louder than normal. This is also a perfect restaurant for a date night on the patio or when you have friends in town or need a nice dinner spot for one with the parents. It's really a good all-around restaurant, especially the patio! 

The food here is hearty, filling and tasty Italian cuisine. My go-to favorite dish are the lobster raviolis. I don't know what they do to the sauce, but it's a perfect combination of creamy and sweet and goes perfectly with the ravioli. I really enjoy their chopped salad as well and it has a perfect blend of fresh veggies. For dessert, you must try the chocolate souffle. Oh my! I go into the evening planning on having one bite and find myself having 10!

It just keeps getting better. The Sweet Potato Risotto is amazing, and so is the Tournedos Di Manzo. I have yet to have desert still... I really need to get on that.

I've decided the Town Square location is much nicer than the Tivoli Village one- although the service at Tivoli seemed slightly better.

I've come here many times and have always had a great experience. However this time was a bit different. We ordered our food from the server in a timely manner and waited for the food to arrive. When it did one of the items was incorrect and I pointed this out to the service staff but was told no this is the item you ordered. After checking the menu it clearly was not. That was quite frustrating. No one checked back to be sure we were enjoying our food. When we were done eating we asked for some to go boxes. The server brought two boxes but nothing for the pizza. We waited 20 mins for the server to come back. We asked him for another box and the check. We proceeded to wait another ten mins before we were paid out and ready to leave. Very slow service and frustrated with incorrect items ordered.

This is my first time eating here and my second time eating at this chain. I wanted a Cesar salad with the same steak they out on the steak salad. The waiter who was rude from the get go said then I should order the steak salad with Cesar dressing with only romaine. Kind of odd but ok. When my salad came out it's had romaine lettuce, blue cheese Cesar dressing and a vinaigrette on it. We told him this is not what we ordered. He tried to argue with us and walked away mad. My salad was finally brought out correctly. 

Bad customer service and slow service
Awesome place for lunch. Very nice atmosphere and love the patio area.  Highly recommend.

Great manager, Marlin, great server, Jennifer.  Pasta and other dishes were excellent,  2 night in a row. Will definitely come back.  High recommendations!!! Beef carpaccio excellent,  great pasta  and veal milanese!
Food is always amazing, I've never had a single complaint. One of my favorite Italian spots!

After recently returning from Italy I discovered the Brio Tuscan Grill while shopping at the Apple Store.  With a new appreciation for Italian food I tried the Risotto and Insalata on the lunch menu.  

The Bistecca Insalata (a quarter cut of head lettuce and creamy ranch dressing with tomatoes and bacon) was crispy and tasty.  It could almost make a meal by itself with a glass of red Tuscan wine along with the seed filled crackers for extra taste.

The Risotto with Shrimp and Scallop was a small but adequate portion.  A little more flavor but not nearly the size nor quality of fresh shellfish I had along the waterfront in the Fishing Village below the town of Sorrento.

All in all a good new spot for lunch on the patio as fall finally approaches the Valley of the Sun.

How is it that we find ourselves in Scottsdale so often? Ugh. But, when you have an opportunity to partake in some lunch with a bestie.... 

We had heard that Brio was really good, and it did not disappoint. The hostess at the front was nice, sweet, and had a great sense of humor. We were seated promptly, and ordered Arnold Palmers and water for 3 as we waited for our 3rd. The lemonade is fresh squeezed and made in house. Honestly, the AP's were BOMB!

I ordered the Chef's Special pasta, which had bacon (MMMMM BAAACON!) and carmelized onions in it. It was good, but the Lobster Bisque I ordered before my entree showed up was exquisite.

GF ordered a breaded chicken salad, which I had a couple of bites of, and I thought it was great too. 

Service was top notch, and the price was fair. All together a great experience. 

I love the interior decor, as well. It is well lit from above, but not too bright from the sides. The lights are super cool also. 

Looking forward to going back for Happy Hour.
This place is very nice inside. Fancy. The food was good but I wouldn't rate it more than 3 stars. They do have a pretty nice presentation though
Happy hour was great! Food was great too. Everyone was very pleased with the quality and portions were pretty big.

Service was great, the bruschetta was decent but rest of the food was so incredibly bad. We ordered two main entrees and a kids meal- all were not worth eating. I really hope we don't have to eat here again. Sorry brio!

The dining room is comfortable and offers a variety of seating. Also there is a shaded outdoor patio. Happy Hour  lounge indoor and outdoor seating  is a great deal with food and drinks.
On this visit we had dinner in the dining room. The room was conversation friendly. For a starter we chose the Bruschetta Quattro which was wonderful. Our entrees were the Chicken Limone and Cioppino. The Chicken was a large portion, very moist
and perfectly cooked. The Cioppino arrived with 2 clams and 1 mussel that were not open. Our waitress apologized and reported the problem to the chef. She returned with a large plate of clams and mussels and again apologized. The Cioppino had a good variety of seafood and I would order it again. Overall Brio has a large menu with something for everyones taste. The service is professional and timely.

Spontaneity kicked in.  I'm here; I'm hungry!  Feed me, BRIO!!!  Take me on a mental escape to Tuscany! Okay too quick...  What happened to my food?!  

I ate it.

I'll have to return for another escape.  Signed up for their loyalty card.  We shall see what perks are upon me in the future.  Though I found it odd the form asks to write down our password access to sign up for it.  Fine.  Make it kooky.

Stacy, the waitress attending to my table, is super sweet and smiley.  I hope you get her as your waitress.  Was polite and checked on me enough; not overdone.  Even looked cautious about asking cuz I was on my phone... Yelping ppptthh :P

I enjoyed my short rib & white cheddar open faced sandwich.  Challenge was not being able to eat it like a regular sandwich nor like a pizza.  Made use of the interesting fork and knife.  Plus it's cleaner for the face.  I didn't want 'BBQ stick face'.

Really nice interior decor and high ceilings.  Booths are pretty spacious.  Bar area was quiet for a Saturday, but loungy.  It'd be nice to hold a small party here.  Patio seating has umbrellas and palm trees.  An enjoyable space.

Now if Italian music were playing instead, that might make it feel more like another country ;)

While I do frequent Brio, it truly is hit or miss.  Typically the service is always great but this past week it wasn't even busy and the service was awful to say the least.  

Brio is the perfect spot for a date, celebration, or just a good meal.  They have reasonable prices and the food is always good.  

I typically always get the sliced steak salad.  It's delicious.  I have gotten the lobster bisque a few times and it's overly salty and doesn't have almost any lobster meat in it.  

My friends have gotten several different dishes and always enjoy them.  This past time we had the beef carpaccio which is presented very nicely but it's definitely not the best I've ever had.  

A huge plus to me is Brio's loyalty program.  Almost every time I dine here I have a $10 off on my card which is great!  If you don't bring your card they can easily look it up with your phone number as well!  How convenient!

While i'll definitely be back I think they have a few things to improve their overall customer experience.

I love the food and drinks here but the bar back showed more attentiveness and better customer service than my bartender Jennifer did. She took my drink and food order quickly but never followed up with me. She was working hard to help others but didn't give me the time of the day, for some reason. Customer service is much better at the Town Square location. Not once in an hour and a half did she ask me if I needed anything.
Absolutely fantastic food and service!  Only a few minutes away from the strip.  What a great value!

Nice atmosphere. Reasonable service on a very busy night. The roasted veggies were good. The lemon chicken was hard and dry, not at all warm and they were stingy with the butter. We had to ask several times for more bread and butter. This was not my typical experience here, the lunch experience was much better.

I have eaten here several times, only for lunch. The latest time, I had the "Chipotle Chicken & Bacon Panini". At first, I wasn't sure about the texture, but the flavors that melded together really worked well together. I think the sandwich would have been better had there been a chicken breast or cutlet, to give it a little more texture, otherwise, very good.

Good food in a nice and relaxing setting.  I come primarily for the Beef Carpacio - a huge platter of very thinly sliced raw beef, drizzled with a delicious aioli, a healthy sized salad in the middle, and big Parmesan crisps.  It's delicious!!!

We've had the pastas, lamb chops, steaks, and other entrees here.  Generally speaking we find them to be a bit salty for our taste, but the portions are healthy and the quality of ingredients is very good.  

Overall a pretty consistent restaurant in a nice setting.  We've been to both the Town Square and Tivoli Village location and have enjoyed them equally.

I haven't been back there in a while and things have gotten a lot worse since my last visit.  Some genius decided that billboard size menus were a good idea.  They are seriously rediculous in size.  Also the food is good, but they raised prices way beyond the quality. They also deliver smaller portions while SIGNIFICANTLY increasing the cost!  This was my last visit unfortunately.

We had a 15 minute wait and I only had 10% of battery left on my iPhone.  The reception counter uses two iPads for reservations and one of the cords was not being used.  I plugged my iPhone in and was going to let it charge.  Nobody noticed and it wasn't even visible, but I felt that I should just mention it to the receptionist.  

She said that I could NOT charge my phone there.  I asked why, and she said that she didn't know whether my phone had any viruses.  I asked how my phone could infect their system thru a charger adaptor?!  She had no answer but said no.  Wtf?!?  I've never had a bar or restaurant refuse to charge my phone.

The food was good as it usually is.  Started with calamari and steak carpaccio.  Entrees of veal milanese, pasta brio, pizza, mac & cheese... All tasty.  

Service was good from our server but they don't have bussers or other servers touching tables.  It took forever to get plates cleared off our table.   We had our empty app plates stacked on top of each other until the end of our meal.  Plus it took forever to get refill on drinks and order more cocktails.

This is our favorite spot to go to for happy hour. Monday through Friday after 9 PM is an amazing happy hour where we always get the burger and the shrimp! Go here and it will not disappoint! 
I have eaten in the dining room many times and have always been very happy and pleased with the food that was prepared.

My wife and I also have our rehearsal dinner her at Brio! I can't say enough good stuff about this place.
My sister, Mom and girlfriends come here for girls night and James K was amazing and attentive! Brio and staff never disappoint, we were spoiled and pampered beyond belief.  Cheers!

Great food and pretty darn consistent when it comes to quality and service. It's become one of our monthly spots.

The only reason it's not five stars is the AC is clearly not working well today and it's over 100° outside.

My family and I came to Brio for Mother's day dinner.  We decided to sit outside as the weather was great.  Our waitress came right over took our drink order and returned with a bread basket about 5 mins later.  Please note that at this time we still did not have silverware. After 15 minutes of her returning with our drinks (2 Waters, chocolate milk, Sprite) and no silverware my family decided to leave throughly upset.  I then decided to call the manager to let her know my experience as a 1st time guest.  She immediately apologized and insisted that my family return as we were 5 minutes away.  

Upon arrival we were immediately seated with silverware, drinks and bread.  The experience from this point on was top notch customer service and good food.  My family will return.  Not pictured is the eggplant and shrimp app., Spinach artichoke dip.
Service sucked!! Food is salty and the price is expensive. The three main category of a restaurant! Just did not do it for me. Will not come back ever!!

One of the best Italian restaurants I have ever been to. or shall I say "Tuscan". this place has AWESOME happy hour mon-thurs from 3:00-6:30 and 9-10 pm. and the menu is awesome for happy hour the brio burger is a MUST HAVE!.. also the diavlo pasta is excellent as well.!

Located in Town Square which is a ways off from the strip but since we were a big party and had kids with us this was what we were looking for.  There's patio seating with mist for the hot Vegas weather although we chose the air condition inside.    Made our reservations on open table for a large party of 17 for my mom's birthday.   We were seated earlier than our reservation and Heather our server was very attentive from the moment we sat down.  

Everything we ordered was amazing from the rib eye steak with a lobster tail on the side, shrimp risotto with a lobster tail, braised short rib, shrimp and lobster fettuccine.   The mac and cheese on the kids menu was not your normal kids Mac and cheese and actually tasted like pasta.  It was a portion for an adult or even three kids!   

Now for dessert, order the caramel marscapone cheesecake.  We ordered the creme brûlée, tiramisu, chocolate torte di chocolate but the cheesecake was my favorite.  

It was my mom's birthday and they even gave her a birthday card.  Very nice touch to already great food and great service.

Went there for lunch today.  Had a soup and salad,  excellent.   But I have to say our waiter was probably the best I have ever had in any restaurant.   I mean ever.   He was probably 30 or so,  but he was phenomenal in all aspects of serving.   Kudos to Brio,  great hire!!!   It is so nice when the food great and the wait staff if equally as great.   Totally enjoyable lunch.

I visited Brio for about the 5th time the other day. Once again, a delightful and satisfying dining experience. Whether you're in the mood for a hearty Italian dinner or something light and fresh, Brio does not disappoint! 

The menu was slightly different the last time we went. We had the roasted red pepper bruschetta. The balsamic glaze is amazing. I had the grilled salmon fresca. It was definitely fresh and extremely delicious!

I was in Las Vegas for the first time.  A friend took us to lunch at Brio, and since I'd been looking forward to meeting her there the entire trip, and the experience was awesome, they could have served Peanut Butter and Jelly, and I'd probably rave about it.

But Brio serves much better food than that.

The setting is cute, very tall ceilings, Mediterranean style, chic.  The service was friendly and attentive.  The menu had enough of a variety that I had a hard time making up my mind.   Well, that and we gabbed away for 20 minutes before even looking at the menus!

We shared the Brushcetta Sampler and Lobster Bisque appetizers.  (I can't resist Lobster Bisque)  Brio's version was rich and creamy, with good lobster flavor.  I do like more large chunks of lobster meat in my bisque, though.  The bruschetta was a total winner.  There were 4 different types, which our server described as she set down the platter.  I loved the BLT bruschetta.  There was also a Roasted Pepper, and a Beef and Arugula.  They were all fabulous.

Our entrees were:  A chicken and veggie pasta in a light cream sauce (Friend), a Chicken and Applewood Bacon Panini (the Boy), and Scallops with Arugula, Roasted Tomatoes, and Lemon sauce (Me).

Could we be any different?  And yet, each entree was great.  The Scallops weren't overcooked.  (BIG Plus)  The pasta was huge, and the cream sauce wasn't cloying and heavy, and the Boy's panini was crusty, savory goodness.

We shared their dessert sampler (Photo) consisting of miniature cups of selected samples.  Tiramisu, Raspberry Cheesecake, Brownie Sundae, Blackberry Rhubarb Compote, and Apple Caramel Ala Mode.  HOLY YUM!!  (Tiramisu was rated the Best, followed in my opinion by the Blackberry Rhubarb Compote.)

The experience was awesome, the company was fabulous, and the food was great.  I can't wait to visit the one we've got at HOME!  In Denver!   I'm so excited!

My kids favorite place to eat. My favorite is the 3 medallion fillets with fried tomato, the kids favorite is the pasta Brio. I love sitting on the patio when the weather permits. Desert is awesome here as well. Wait staff is always fast and nice. I love the peach sangria too.

Best part of the meal was the Carpaccio!!! 

The steak was okay and the caesar was okay, by okay I mean much better than I'd get at many places, but not the best. The flatbread crackers they serve before the meal are delicious.

I think the service correctly resembles anything I'd expect from fine dining, there's no rush and a lot of room to breathe and relax. Usually there was a server within eyesight and they were eager to help.

The atmosphere is all that, great for a nice night out or once a year family gathering. 

Overall, worth the trip!

At Brios grille tonight with my wife and girls. Our server Jessica is great very friendly and quick with the order and did not push us. My meals lately have been ask the server to surprise me just nothing to spicy. She did a great job tonight plus it had bacon. The sauce was silk smooth with good flavor a vodka sauce with stuffed ricotta. The three other meals were good and big servings. We sat outside since they have the misters. Inside has great A/C and ambience was inviting but a lot of people so a little loud. Plus tiramisu was great.

We usually come to Brio for dinner and drinks, and this time we decided to stop in for brunch (and drinks, haha!)... so glad we did!

I ordered Berries & Cream French Toast and he ordered Eggs Oscar... um, well, I ended up eating half of his plate. 

The waiter was so friendly and incredibly patient with me, as I could not make up my mind and was ready to order three or four different items. He recommended his favorite and also whipped up fabulous for-the-morning drinks.

I also have to mention valet service, as this is usually a hit or miss for most restaurants. Brio's valet obviously figured it out because they're fast, friendly and go off of tips... with an ATM machine nearby if you don't have cash.

Definitely impressed with brunch selection and dinner was always five stars!

The dining room at Brio is warm, casual, and comfortable.  Service is quick and friendly.  Our party sampled several dishes:
Pasta Brio - very good and perfectly al dente
Lasagna - solid but not phenomenal.  Huge portion.
Bread basket - delicious rustic loaf and crackers
Steak carpaccio - excellent.  Must try!  The sauce and salad that accompany it are great.
Florentine steak - juicy with a crisp seared exterior.  Excellent!
Shrimp Mediterranean - here's where the experience fell short.  The shrimp was ok and had a lot of kick.  The orzo and farro that came with it was extremely oversalted.  It's as if they put a canister of salt into the cooking water.
Dessert trio- very good.  The cheesecake was my favorite.
I'd definitely come back.  Just skip the Shrimp Mediterranean.

My family eat here pretty frequently. Every time we come here, we have amazing service. I really liked our waiter tonight, Frank. He continuously checked up on us to make sure we were taken care of. He served our dishes with a smile. The shrimp and eggplant appetizer and mascarpone cheesecake are the best!

Saturday, Brunch. Outside. Mojitos. Perfect. Service was great. Not too pushy to get us out of there. (they were busy) I hadn't tried this part of the the menu before and wasn't excited about it but the omlet was just fine. I usually eat the crab cakes at the location at Town Cener. But, the service there has gone downhill. It's like McDonalds Ronalds playland when you sit outside there. It sucks. You try and have a great meal and surrounding you is kids crying and running. Yes, I said running, around you. Nobody seems to notice ? I told the server I wouldn't be back since that was the 2nd dinner I had that experience. Apparently is not just a family restaurant,it's kiddie land....So, stick to the location on Rampart, so far, they haven't gone downhill...

This is one of my usual happy hour spots when I need a good drink and some good food. Came tonight expecting their $2.95 small bites menu and found a brand new HH menu :/ the prices are a bit higher but some portions are bigger than before. I ordered two strawberry mojitos (Yum! One of the few places that carries Cruzan Strawberry Rum) and toasted Ravioli. The BF got a Keylime mojito, a Manhattan (aka Bourbon on the rocks, or that's how it tasted lol) and the Brio Burger. Food and drinks were great and service was quick since we sat at the bar. Only downside was the higher prices - our bill came out to around $36 for happy hour - for two apps and four drinks....might not seem so bad, but I think we were just used to the old menu and prices. Oh well that's Scottsdale for you! :)

Haven't been here in a while so went back to renew acquaintance on a Thursday night. Dinner for three of us was excellent - fish and angel hair pasta for dad and son, chicken limone for mom. All were very good and just as expected. Service was fine with no slip-ups.

The food here is good, upper end for a chain. The steak I had was done perfectly -and the pasta vodka with ricotta filled pockets was very nice.

Now the reason for the low score...

The place was single large room packed with people. Not great if you want a semi-relaxing meal... and when I'm spending a decent coin I don't want to be crammed into a massive room with a few hundred people and hear everyone's conversation from all over the place.

We had coupons so the price was fine but at regular price, for the same $, I'd go to several other places with better food and a better, relaxing and more quiet, atmosphere.
Oh my, lobster bisque! Bring me 3 bowls please, and 2 loaves of that bread too. Everything here is delish, great outdoor seating and nice bar area for colder days. Highly approve!

Grilled Salmon Fresca!

I'm on a very strict diet preparing for vacation and this dish is OUTSTANDING!!! Get all dressing and feta on side.
We visited Brio Tuscan Grille about 20 times. I always enjoy the steak salad, lamb chops and my 6 year old grandson  loves the lobster bisque soup.

Never fails! Anything and everything is delicious! One of my faves, is the Gorgonzola filet mignon... Always cooked perfectly and try their Bellini!!!  And it never hurts that the staff is always friendly!

Love the happy hour. Out door seating is awesome, fast service and great food. The flat bread pizzas are great, but my favorite was the beef carpaccio. Only had the apps, but they were tasty enough we didn't need to order entres.

I really like this Brio location.

The high ceilings give it a large feel and the food is always good.
This is an awesome happy hour spot.  Food and service were good.  Sit out on the patio.  Order flat bread and eggplant fries, yummy!
Delicious food and good service.  My son was especially delighted that his burger extended all the way to the edge of the bun :-)

I have been here several times and I have mixed reviews about this place. There are times when I have been here where the food and the service is just not up to par and the last time I was here, was not any different. 
   I brought my sister here for her birthday dinner. We decided to sit outside since they had the misters outside turned on to cool things down a bit. We didn't order any appetizers but we decided to get drinks. The peach and raspberry sangria with moscato in it not only looked good but it was very refreshing. My sister ordered the shrimp risotto and I ordered the angel hair pasta with pesto sauce and shrimp. The risotto dish seemed fine, each dish had jumbo shrimp in it but my pasta was dry and had little to no sauce on it.  
   In the middle of our dinner, the restaurant decided to turn the misters off, even though it was only 7:30. At that point, it just got too hot and uncomfortable to even enjoy our meal. We were just ready to go but our waiter seemed really busy so we just sat out there in heat waiting for him to come by with our check. 
    May be next time I come here, I will sit inside so I am not melting in the heat and can try to enjoy my meal.

Food is really good,  like always. ..  We come here often but tonight is just an exemption.  We brought our niece from Italy for her birthday and to impress here of our food and service.  Like I said, food is phenomenal but absolutely no service at all.  We have to ask three different servers just for a bread.  Can't get no water and our main server had to ask the birthday girl if she wants a surprise dessert.   I thought its called a surprise.

My sister and I had passed this restaurant on the way to my job and decided to try it out. I had the calamari fritto and she had the salmon. Both were terrific with just the right portions and seasonings! I would strongly suggest eating here as it is well worth the try.

Boy did we stumble upon a gem.
One of the best all around meals we have had in a while.
Started with a great Peach Bellini, then we split a very nice chopped salad. Our waiter, Cody( he was excellent) suggested the Lasagna and he was right on, it was one of the best ever. I ordered the braised short ribs, and again, they were outstanding. Included mashed potatoes, roasted carrots and mushrooms, again they were super.
If you are in The Kierland area of Phoenix, this place is a must. 
Prices are very reasonable.

My husband and I went here last night for Valentine's Day and ate from the Valentine's Day prix fixe menu. I had the lobster bisque and the crab stuffed shrimp and lobster tail. Both of these items were DELICIOUS. My husband had a cesaer salad, the filet mignon, and the fingerling potatoes. His steak was devoured pretty quick, but I did get a chance to try his potatoes and they were great. For dessert, we got the dolcini trio consisting of the caramel marscapone cheesecake, creme brûlée, and a seasonal banana pudding. The pudding was my favorite-so good! Our server was Jenny and despite the fact that they were extremely busy and she was hustling, she never let our drinks get low and she was very attentive. We will definitely be back in the future. We had a great experience!

I love this place. I've tried both locations on town now (Town Square & Tivoli) and I've had 2 great dining experiences.

Very cheap happy hour at the bar from 3:30pm-6:30pm and reverse happy hour from 9pm-close where all the food on the happy hour menu is only $2.95! The only drink specials I saw were $5 martinis on Thursday's.

Service was friendly and very welcoming and the food at is amazing. I recommend the Pasta Brio, which is rigatoni with a seared mushroom and peppers sauce, the Pasta alla Vodka, homemade pasta filled with ricotta, and the seared shrimp risotto is also delicious. Portions are good for the price and the menu has a lot of choices.

This is my favorite Italian restaurant in town. Everything is a hit in this place and if you haven't tried it yet you should get in your car and drive down there right now.

Average at best.  We went during brunch on a Sunday and stood at the front counter for a good five minutes without a greeting.  Then when we finally got seated and it took another 10 minutes just to be greeted by a waitress.  From there we get our menus and complimentary bread and wait another 15 minutes for our waitress to deliver our drinks and take our orders.  

Next, we were not given silverware or plates for our bread.  And unbelievably our waitress could not be found and was not even in eyesight until 15 minutes later.  So we ended up eating bread off of our menus (which she for some reason didn't even take away once we ordered) with no napkin or anything.  

The utensils finally came along with our meals.  The food itself, an omelette and brunch quinoa salad, was just alright.  The portion size was good but the eggs themselves didn't seem anything too great and probably not worth $11 each.  I guess you're paying for the ambiance of Tivoli in that case.  Buta gain the waitress struggled when we asked for some extra condiments and it took her so long to track some down that we were halfway done with our meals by then.

We overheard the waitress talking to another party about getting some food comped since her service was so bad for them, so I'm guessing we just got stuck with a new waitress who was having a bad day or something; but still, it gave the restaurant a very poor first impression from my point of view from her service.  

I hear the Happy Hour is worthwhile so I could be back for a drink or two in the future, but it's not likely I'll ever come back for a full meal, especially at the Tivoli location.
Food was delicious and service was quick.  The waiter checked in periodically but also gave us time to sit and talk.  Great evening, great food, great friends.

I had noticed  this place and had been meaning for awhile to try it but forgot about it until a week ago when I was at the San Tan mall shopping. I told my hubby we would try soon to go there and it happened to be today. OMG I can't believe I did not try this place sooner! Food was absolutely fabulous! It is even close to us YEAH!We loved the decor and the staff were very nice and accomodating. We had the spicy shrimp and eggplant app to start. Heaven on a plate! In fact, our server told us in the future we could ask to have this served with pasta and asparagus as a main dish in the future. (I guess this is popular among staff) The sauce is wonderful. I so wish I could get the recipe. Eggplant was cooked crispy to pefection.Topped with a single perfectly cooked shrimp. The sauce is so Yummy! Creamy, hint of wine.Has a bit of spice to it. Loved the bit of heat that lingers in the back or your throat.We lapped up every last drop of the sauce with extra bread she brought us. Today we brought our two kids. I had a hard time deciding what to order so it was good we were all together to sample each others dishes. I had the mediterranean pasta.Wonderful. Plenty of garlic. Feta cheese, mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes spinach, pinenuts and plenty of basil. Nice and light. Daughter had the pasta with vodka sauce,Her pasta was perfect. Shaped like a little sache. Perfect texture with the wonderful Vodka sauce. Son had braised beef fettucini.The beef portions were like butter. If I had no teeth I still would have been okay. Lastly hubby had the mushroom ravioli. Creamy and rich, but not overly rich. Nice sprinkling of panko on top. I loved that the ravioli was not overloaded with cheese. I like tasting the mushroom.All were excellent. It would be really hard to decide which I liked best. Every dish was diffferent and full of favor.Prob would be difficult going there in the future without the 4 of us  if I had to decide on one dish. I am  almost embarrased to say we all cleaned our plates. However,don't be scared for my waist line, this was our only meal for the day. We ate our days worth :) Dont worry kids did eat light dinner) We decided we could not leave without trying dessert. We ordered the creme brulee trio and a single serv of cheesecake. The small servings are perfect. Creme brulee was light and lovely. Dinner with tip for 4 was$104.Not something we could do every week however when I go out I want it to be worth my money.Would definitely be a great place to take a date or to impress family or business clients.  We will definitely go back. My birthday is in a few weeks ;)

Because its in Crocker Park, I've eaten at this restaurant several times, due to the convenience. 

The service is terrible. Four girls at the hostess stand that just stare at you and take 5 minutes to figure out if you can get a seat or have to wait. The person taking you  to the table rarely speaks or makes eye contact.

The food can hardly be called "authentic". Very bland and over priced. Same with the drinks. And if you forgo alcohol for water the server is very slow to refill the water. 

The positive thing about this place is the location and the nice patio.
The desserts. Delicious. The setting was upscale casual, food was good, nothing superb, but overall a good place to enjoy a nice dinnner

Came in for lunch on a Saturday and although it was pretty busy, we were seated right away. I ordered one of the lunch specials that includes a soup/salad with an entree. I got the wedge salad and the portion was HUGE and it was delicious. Really a meal itself. I also ordered a simple tomato basil pasta that was perfect. My mom ordered the flatbread and it was also delicious. I was really impressed with the quality for the price. Also, the children's entrees are HUGE. More than enough for an adult. Great dining experience.
I like the vibes of Italy @Brio, the food is great especially the happy hour @the bar! Check it out!
My server julio and the food was awesome!! I will comeback for sure, the place have a nice location and friendly stuff, prices are very affordable, i will recommend this place to all  my friends

Went here on a Saturday night with a friend.  I was impressed.  The wait to officially sit outside was like 45 minutes so we opted to go to the outside bar and found a table there.  There was waiter service.  We had a few cocktails and ordered an appetizer and a salad to share.  It was just what I had hoped for for a girls night out.  The cocktails were interesting and very tasty.  The food was good, and what you would expect from a place like this.  The outdoor patio was nice and the service was good.  We implied that we wanted to just drink and be mellow and he left us alone for the most part.  

I would go again, very nice place.

Yes it's a franchise and blah for a unique culinary experience but man, they always deliver a good meal, good service and always plenty of seating in a lovely restaurant setting. So for a mega restaurant it's great. Plenty of Kids options, family friendly, decent prices and the food pleases everyone. If you want farm to table, well, this ain't the place. But I love their huge plate of beef carpaccio, calamari, flatbreads and love their selection of small plates.
The Lobster Bisque at Brio is amazing! I always order the soup every time I dine in. I also order the Salmon Fresco which is also good, however, the Lobster Bisque is truly amazing in my opinion.

I'm not an Italian food fan, but I simply come here for their Beef Carpaccio. Its SO deng good! Their servers are very knowledgable of the food they offer on their menus, and we always get A-Plus service when we come here.

For now my review is five stars. However! I did not have a full dining experience. Me and two coworkers went here after work on Friday around 1:30pm and we just had sangria and appetizers. We sat outside in Town Square because the weather was beautiful. We ordered the white peach sangria, which was excellent beyond belief. I'm typically a red sangria person because the others are too sweet but this was just perfect. I ordered the steak bruschetta. My goodness. It was so awesome. It had a touch of Gorgonzola cheese on it but it wasn't too strong as it sometimes can be. It had arugula and Parmesan. The steak was so tender and flavorful. I was legitimately impressed. 

Our service was very good and attentive as well and she split the check three ways for us which I appreciated...considering this is sometimes a painful task. 

I was glad we sat outside where is was quiet and shaded. I saw a glimpse of the inside and it just wasn't inviting. It looked dark and loud.

Happy hour at Brio is awesome.  The ambiance is amazing, and the food is extremely inexpensive, while being decent portions and absolutely scrumptious.  If you're curious, my personal favorite is the spicy shrimp and eggplant.

Aside from regular happy hour attendance, I've also hosted a special event on the covered North patio.  Everything was absolutely perfect, from the decor to the personable and knowledgeable servers.

It rained and was a bit cold, but the heaters more than made up for it.  Additionally, the rain made it so that or event was significantly under-attended relative to our predictions.  The management staff was extremely gracious.

Whether it's for an informal happy hour or an important exclusive event, Brio is a great choice!

For starters, the place is pretty..  But!!!!!  The food was terrible.  The Cesar salad had almost no dressing.  I ordered the lobster, shrimp fettuccine and the noodles where under cooked.  No not aldente!!!  Under cooked and sticky..  the lobster on the other hand was OVER COOKED.  Cooked till it was tuff with no seasoning.  The mushrooms where almost raw and the shrimps had no flavor either.  As for the service.... well the service wasn't very good either!!!  And where my lemon for my Fricken water??????
A favorite for happy hour.   Great food, service, atmosphere and cost.   Love the energy here.

I've only been to Brio for special occasions. The first was my 21st birthday, the next was the night I got engaged, and the last was for dinner after my husband and I had our civil wedding.

Brio does special occasions like a buncha pros. On my birthday, they made me feel so special, with a free dessert that said "Happy 21st" and a coupon for a free appetizer on my next visit. We didn't get engaged until after dinner, so they didn't do anything for that, lol. But it was still a really romantic date (as far as I knew at the time!) Then, for our wedding dinner, it was me and my husband and our parents, and they really went out of our way to make it a celebration. The waiter was so friendly, and we got an entire dessert sampler complimentary. My husband was wearing his dress blues since we came straight from the wedding, and the staff was thanking him for his service, which we thought was cute.

Bottom line, I love this restaurant. Eat here!

Foods I love: the spicy shrimp and eggplant appetizer is to die for, the caesar salad isn't too anchovy-tasting, and the mushroom ravioli is my favorite dish. :)
Happy hour and a martini is always good here.... And at night or in the winter they have a fire pit...!

wretched and overpriced. i'm embarrassed to say we even ate here - but it was here or cheesecake factory so i figured, italian! how bad could it be. the answer? VERY. if you consider yourself a person even remotely well versed in good food - avoid avoid avoid.
Tasty, well sized meals. Pricing was a bit overpriced but it was a very lovely atmosphere.

The boyfriend and I were around San Tan village so we decided to try this place out. The restaurant reminds me of carrabas and Olive Garden put together. We started off with some calamari which were really good. It came with a marinara and spicy tarter sauce. I liked how they had some fried peppers with the calamari. Then my boyfriend ordered the lobster and shrimp fettuccini  and I got the shrimp Mediterranean. Overall great food, great service and atmosphere

been here many times and service always good.  Food amazing.  love the ravioli and the medalions.  atmosphere always spot on.  dessert of the warm chocolate cake yummy  we add an extra scoop of ice cream and devour away!!  Love this place

The service was great, but the food was meh.  We had the bruchetta as an appetizer.  The flavors did not blend well at all.  They SHOULD be considering it's an italian resturant.  We ordered the shrimp lobster fettuccini to share.  Well, there was only one tiny piece of lobster. One piece of lobster does not make it a shrimp, lobster fettuccini, so of course my dinner partner was sweet enough to give me the one tiny piece.  The sauce was just okay.  Could have used more flavor.  On a plus side, the bread is pretty awesome.  Too bad it looks so pretty on the inside.  Won't be enough to bring me back unless there are no other options and it's extremely convenient.

Nice atmosphere, pleasant and attentive hostess and wait staff.  Had the Pesto Pasta, enjoyed!  Angel hair compliments the spinach, red pepper and chicken.  Very light! We parked in the garage, but valet is available.  P.S. watch the parking meters - take quarters with you, and limited to 2 hours.

My experience with this restaurant was not as I expected. The feeling I got as soon as I walked in and asked a simple question was as they were doing customers a favor by letting you in. 

I choose to ignore their lack of courtesy, asked for patio which faced towards Victoria Secrets and behind their bar, they said it was closed although there we people sitting there. Then they took us instead to another outsite section which basically had no one sitting in the area.

I simply left this restaurant and inmediately ran into California Kitchen, which had a much better attitute towards customers.

Maybe some badic manners trainning would help this hostes at the entrance representing Brio.

I really hate that I have to give Brio 2 stars but based on my visit this weekend I have no choice. I have been here a few times years ago and the experience was much better but Saturday was a disappointment. The wait for a server to say hello was not acceptable. Being that this is the first impression and setting the stage for our visit I say it was a fail. The wait to get drinks and bread basket was longer then it should have been as well. The food.... Oh how I was excited for the food to come but wow was I disappointed. I got the Mediterranean Shrimp dish that cost $16.25 and it was so bland. The shrimp were dry and rubbery, the  veggies on the plate were fine as was the orzo pasta but this dish needed some sauce or a heck of a lot more of the vinaigrette that was just in spots on the sides of the plate. Overall very boring dish for way too much money. My son liked his chicken fingers but we told the server he wanted ranch. At that time the server should have told us that Brio doesn't have ranch but rather uses a Parmesan dressing.  He didn't tell us this and my kid was rather disappointed when he dipped his chicken in it. My point here is the lack of communication from the server. I felt like we were just a nuisance to our server. When we left the restaurants was up front and didn't even say goodbye. This experience was so disappointing for us. I hope no one else has this experience.

They have a really great brunch on the weekends!

I had some crab stuffed crepes that the bartender recommended and they were better than I could have hoped for - yum!  I also tried a few signature cocktails and they were just as good.  It's nice to see something different on a drink menu.

Service was excellent, very clean, nice decor.  All around a great dinning experience.

I joined my mom, sister and grandma here for a ladies lunch. The inside is beautiful and the patio looked cute. One thing I really like about Brio is they do brunch Saturday and Sunday all the way till 3:00. (Some of us are not earlier risers on the weekend and like to do our brunching later in the  day.)
Although, on this trip I was feeling more lunch so I had one of their lunch platters which came with lasagna and your choice of salad. I had the chopped salad which was very fresh and yummy. The lasagna may not be authentic but you could tell it was made with real ingredients, not thawed and cooked like at the OG. 

The other ladies at the table tried the risotto which received several mmms and ahhhs. They have two different kinds of risotto scallop and shrimp or the chicken with sweet potato. I tried both and they were fantastic. My grandma had a gin martini and she is VERY particular about her cocktails and she said it was made perfectly to her specifications. 

I would come back here for brunch or lunch but I do think the dinner prices were really high. Go in the daytime because you get dinner sized portions but at reduced lunch prices.

Salmon salad for the win! No cheese and gluten free, this fresh salmon salad is phenomenal. Paired with a good dry white wine it's perfection! 

Carpaccio and shrimp and eggplant apps are amazing as well, mine and Andy's go tos! 

You also can't beat the happy hour. Everyday I believe 4-6:30pm. Get there around 4 and you should be golden!

I love this place atmosphere.
The food was delicious  and service was quick. Also one of my friend can't  eat gluten but they had gluten-free food.
Definitely we will come back.

The food is great but to me the best was the service! Joey was our waiter and he is the best! He was very quick and he knew what to help us out with. He gave the best suggestions and he was not wrong! I loved Ravioli Di Bello!! SO GOOD!! My dad loved the Lobster and Shrimp fettuccine and my mother had the grilled salmon fresca and was delighted. She said Joey was one of the best waiters and when we go back to vegas we are going in his section ONLY!!! Go to Brio and go for Joey!!

My uncle took my mom & I to this restaurant over the weekend to celebrate her birthday & my graduation. I'm usually pretty skeptical with Italian food in general because I'm allergic to gluten and can't eat much...but I figured I could find something to  suit me.

Loved it here. It's located in this high end outdoor mall (which we didn't see too much of, thanks to scorching Vegas weather...) and the restaurant itself is beautiful. I loved the building with it's high ceilings & open space. I made me feel like I was dining in a castle :)

It was still a little early for dinner (about 5:30), so we were seated right away, although we had no reservations. We were given a bread basket with some flatbread crisps to munch on while we were looking over the menu. I didn't try any of it, but my mom & uncle said the bread was yummy. I ordered the sweet potato & chicken risotto and a  salad, my mom ordered a flatbread pizza and my uncle got the crab cakes. We all decided to share the spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer.

The salad was amazing. Best cesar salad I've had, and I've had quite a few in my time. The dressing wasn't too salty...and the tanginess was perfection. The dip was a bit too salty for me...but I tasted a little bit of the parmesan crisps that come with it & they were great. 

When my food arrived it was very pretty :) The risotto wasn't gummy (which is usually the case) and the flavor was great...but I was a little weirded out because they used dark meat chicken. There were ligaments still attached, like they used a chicken leg instead of a chicken breast. Not that there's anything wrong with that, I am just used to seeing white meat used, as opposed to dark. It tasted fine, tho...I took it all in stride.

I ordered a creme brulee for dessert and it was pretty good. Not the best, but definitely up there.

All in all, the ambiance was nice & the waitress was very friendly. We had a good time here. I'm don't usually visit lavish restaurants when we're in Vegas, but I'd definitely give this place a try again. I'd love to try some pasta here, but I really would hate to land myself in the hospital...
I don't understand all the great reviews on Yelp. We had bad service and very bad food tonight. The waitress was rude, the food was cold and very bland.

That's is my to go place! I love to chill on their patio during summer. I usually go during happy hour, I recommend you guys to take the black pepper shrimp with black pepper sauce.. if you want a refreshing cocktail during summer, you can't go wrong with their white peach sangria!! Oh!! And I almost forgot the lava cake who's excellent :)

So, I'm not big on chain restaurants, but my experience with Brio over the years has allowed it to remain on our list of family-friendly options.  My most recent visit did nothing to dispel that notion.

Thursday night dinner...place was relatively busy.  Fortunately, I was seated right away.  The reason for the fourth star is our server, Kristen.  She was very friendly, and generally had our food and drinks to our table in short order.  She was also very nice to our kids, a touch that means a lot to the parents of three kids in their single-digits.

The food is not bad.  My lasagna tasted the same as my last visit (very filling), although a bit pricy at $18.  My biggest complaint (besides the price bump) was the calamari appetizer.  The portion was much smaller than we remembered, and for $11, they shorted us a bit.  We were willing to overlook it because everything else was okay, but it didn't start our meal off on the greatest foot.

There are a few better options for Italian in the area (which I haven't tried yet), but Brio is perfect for families.
Just had lunch here today and the food was amazing!! Service is great and the outdoor sitting area was refreshing! It is a must try!!

Vigor's of Tuscany.....and grill...eh! Eh! ....oooh

Lazy Sunday after missing the movies since I didn't want to stand in line. Attended this place since I heard great things about their HH -- I had no Vigor in me this day so HH sounded awesome.  However, no HH on Sunday!  Errrr -- well I was not dissatisfied.  We order some drinks and appetizers.  I had the Raspberry Mojito -- definitely cooled me down!  We ordered some Calamari and guess what the star of the dish wasn't even the Calamari -- the fried peppercini peppers did it for us.  So we had a special request for just that and guess what -- they obliged - Thumbs Up!  My friend ordered the Steak Bruschetta's and I don't remember her eating it....just saw the empty board haha! 

We said outside on the bar patio with the misters while people watching.  Service was great and the drinks flowed.  What can I say; I'm coming back for HH next time. - Enjoy!

I have to say the food was a letdown this visit.  I think I always remember Brio to be better than it typically is.  My husband ordered the Vodka pasta, it was thick and rich.  It was very good however the pasta and chicken seemed dry.

I ordered the scallop risotto and although the risotto was very tasty the scallop I tried was both undercooked and very gritty and sandy.  I told our server who was horrified and quickly allowed me to choose something else from the menu. To be honest I'd lost my appetite and just chose a wedge salad. Our server offered us the warm chocolate cake and it was the best part of our meal.  Rich and indulgent.  The sourdough bread was also amazing.

You may ask why I'm still giving Brio 4 stars.  The food was a 2 and our awesome server Alex offered us 5 star service.  He was dynamite!  Thank you Alex!

This was a terrible lunch experience. We sat out on the patio by the door. The waiter wouldn't even come all the way outside he would just stick his head out and ask if we needed anything. The food was awful and if the waiter had actually come out we would have told him. Or possibly a big clue would have been no one finishing their food! Awful place, not ever going back!

Very nice ambiance and the staff was friendly and attentive.  The food was mixed. Some of the dishes were very good (especially some of the appetizers) but my entree was very disappointing (had the shrimp/lobster fettuccine). As a result I have to give it 3 stars but it is the type of place that I would be willing to try again while ordering something different.

A good family restaurant for a night in Crocker Park. Even though its a chain, it doesn't taste or feel like one. This location is a little less well lit relative to other locations but the food is equally as good and the outdoor patio is very nice on a summer evening.

Great server! She was attentive but not overbearing as we had to wait almost an hour for another person in our party to show up. When our food arrived, my food was cold and it was the special of the day. The other two people with me said their food was very good, especially the port chop. Being in Vegas, the atmosphere is wonderful, especially if you sit out on the patio which stretches around 1/2 the large building.

Wonderful atmosphere especially on the patio on a warm, breezy, day in Vegas. Our waitress was great! She was new but very friendly, efficient and attentive even though we waited almost an hour for the 3rd person in our party. I ordered the special on the menu insert, salmon. The flavor was good, but unfortunately, it was on the cold side. The others in my party were very happy with the steak and pork chop.

Meh. As my fellow Yelper said to me a few days after we ate here: "No Brio review, I'm shocked!" 

I didn't jump on writing this review because I was pretty underwhelmed by the experience. The ambience sucks, the service wasn't very good and the food was totally average. 

My cursor is blinking at me and I still don't know what else to say about my time spent here. 

Ambience- looks like an Italian cheesecake factory. Why are the collumns so huge?!

Service- the bartender kept interrupting us to take our order when we STILL weren't ready. Jeez, does it look like I've moved my menu in the 53 seconds it's been since the last time you checked? And then disappeared when we were finally ready. 

Food- 
-carpaccio, not bad but does it seriously need to be that huge? The two of us didn't even come close to finishing it. 
-Mediterranean pasta, pretty much the only one without a cream sauce on the whole menu. They split it for us which was nice and it tasted all right with mushrooms and chicken and stuff. 
-tiramisu came out frozen. They were super apologetic and didn't charge us for the replacement, but it was still awkward. They obviously just heated up a piece which made it melty and just not that great.

So yeah, that's that.

Nice ambiance inside and outside but just OK beyond that.  The service was good but there ends the pros. The beer selection was minimal (and no IPAs) and the food OK but nothing special.  When I think I could have made a much better meal at home I realize why we don't eat out that often.  The salad was Iceberg lettuce which to me is a turn off = no nutritional value and no flavor.  In summary, our first and last visit here.

Beyond 5 stars!!! The service was amazing. The food was spectacular. If the pumpkin ravioli is on the Specials menu I highly recommend it. It was the most decadent dish I have ever had. It has an Amaretto cream sauce that is so unique. I would order it again for sure. It was so hard to pick what to order, everything sounded so good. And the calamari appetizer.....oh they fry peperoncinis in with it. It was a really good combo. Highly recommend this restaurant. Pricey but worth it. Can't wait to go again.

Thank you Brio Tuscon Grille for great lunch earlier this week.
Thank you fellow yelpers for your check in and reviews.  When fellow yelpers check in, I do look up and if it is something interesting for me, I book mark. I do enjoy reading reviews online, otherwise I would not have been able to experience so many yummy dishes. This place is no exception, when one of the yelpers checked in, it sounded so interesting, I had to try for myself.

We arrived here around noon, and it was about 80% full when we got there.

I glanced at the menu and almost decided on salmon when my friend kindly pointed out on today's special menu.   My eyes were glued to the pumpkin ravioli from the moment I saw the today's special menu.

I must tell you, if you haven't tried the pumpkin ravioli, try once. You will not regret it. First of all, it's fall, it's pumpkin season. Second, pumpkin is so good for you with vitamins.  Ravioli is served with many vegetables to make this dish more healthy.  And best of all, this was the best pumpkin ravioli I've ever had. I especially like the sauce used in the ravioli, nicely complemented the pasta dish.

Don't forget to check in on yelp for free appetizer with two orders of entrees. We ordered tomato salad (Caprese salad). I thought they used really good quality of mozzarella cheese, I enjoyed the salad very much.

For desert, I ordered mini-size tiramisu. It was so moist, I ate this small desert very quickly. I had to go jogging for 60 mins that night to burn all the calories from my desert, but it was so worth it.

Coffee was very good as well. I like when restaurant invest in good coffee, saves me a trip to coffee shop after my meal.

Service was very good as well. They were busy but they kept moving very efficiently.

Looks like I found my new favorite place to eat, I will definitely come back again.

Went there last night and had a better experience than prior.   We started off with the Roasted Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke Dip with parmesan flatbread.   YUMMMM!   Not too much of a garlic taste to feel as thought I would have garlic breath but just enough to taste it.   Correct combination of spinach and artichoke hearts.   Chunks of artichoke that I appreciated.  My companion had the Shrimp & Lobster Fettuccine  and I had the Shrimp Mediterranean.   Both dishes were delish!    I had the shrimp dish prior and enjoyed it; therefore, I had it again since I had basically pigged out on the warm sour dough bread and flatbread and the dip and parmesan flatbread.   The fettuccine had the smaller shrimp than mine and lobster and the correct combination of cheeses and spices.   I would order that next time.

Our server was Jonathan in the bar since we would have had to wait for seating in the dining room and there were plenty of booths and tables in the bar with no wait.   Jonathan was very competent, efficient and friendly.

I definitely will be going back, that's for sure!

The service here is hit or miss. More misses than hits, unfortunately. I love their steak salad but it took them 3 times to get it right. There have been times where we were completely ignored. No water or bread for 30 minutes.
I just don't know what's going on here:(

AMAZING!! My husband and I were doing some holiday shopping at the San Tan Village and decided to try out Brio for dinner. We were greeted by a very friendly hostess and were told that it would be a short wait. We were seated within 10 minutes and were given a very comfy booth. The wine list was small but had some great options. Our server was very friendly, knowledgable and answered all of our questions on the menu. I had the salmon and my husband had the pork chops. My salmon was cooked perfectly and was served on top of a breaded tomato. It was to die for! For dessert we had a mini tiramisu and a mini cheesecake. Both were very tasty and the perfect size to finish off the meal. The service was excellent. They don't rush you or forget about you. My only complaint is that it is too far away! We will definatly make the drive again just to vist them.

I decided to take my wife out on a week night and it was totally worth it. The service was excellent and our server Viviane made the night wonderful. Her timing on everything was perfect as we never had to ask for anything. We love apps and found the steak bruschetta and margherita flatbread quite tasty. My wife tried the shrimp risotto and lobster tail and I the pesce piccata and they were both delicious!! "We share" I would totally recommend going to Brio if you are in the Scottsdale Quarter's area. We will be back for sure.

Brio is definitely my favorite chain Italian spot in town! If you didn't know you would have no idea it's a chain joint. Everything is solid, great portion, and tasty just a bit over priced in my opinion but well worth the visit during happy hour. I love their bruschetta so I got the bruschetta sampler which was really tasty and a great variation of flavors. Their bread assortment is quality as well as their soups and salads. I ordered the chicken pesto pasta had tons of flavor however they went a little light on the pesto for my liking so if you really like pesto make sure you ask for extra! My friend got the crab cake entree which looked amazing I tried a piece and I will probably order it next time I visit. All in all a solid Italian restaurant that I would recommend if you are in the town square area!

Good happy hour. Our server was friendly and very good. One of the other servers that helped bring out our order gave us a little attitude (brunette) when we asked for another setting. Bartender seemed a little slow....took a long time to get our drinks. But even with that, we'll be back.

Me and a friend  were shopping in town square. Decided to stop here for lunch. As we walked in I was impressed the restaurant is nice and classy. We were greeted right away and seated immediately, since they were not that busy. The ambiance of this place is great it's very relaxing. They have a variety of choices on the menu to choose from and the price is very reasonable. My friend had the pasta brio with Alfredo sauce. I  went more traditional and ordered the Americana burger. Both dishes were very good. Now as for the service it was very good our waitress always made sure we were taken care of. I really enjoyed this restaurant and suggest you give it a try.

Four stars although my experience was up at the bar and we were entertaining each other talking like school girls. Strawberry chicken salad was big and tasty. Calamari good. Bread yum m, pasta dish my friend ate but I didn't pay attention too. Good price drinks and glasses of wine.

I've been here twice, firstly on Dinner time and recently for Happy Hour. (pictures) Food was spot on both times. Ambiance is beautiful, setting (plates and utensils) was clean - no spots no nothing, cheerful and knowledgeable servers. It was a great experience from having a family dinner or a date to a kick back after work - this is the place to be. Their happy hour prices are unbeatable: quality of the food was outstanding hand in hand with their low prices. I have yet to give another star when I come back (most definitely will soon). So look out for my update. I'll probably try their lunch time and see if everything is consistent. So far so good though. Worth the drive from Chandler. I left the restaurant happy and satisfied. :)

Food was great, but service was horrible! Got seated outside with our waitress Robin, should've known how the service was going to be when it took close to 10 minutes just to get our waters. Chicken limon was EXTRAORDINARY! I ordered the salmon freshca no red peppers and what do I get red peppers all I got from Robin was oh they don't seem to be listening tonight. Had a bite of my friends chicken limon and I wished I had ordered that mmmm so yummy. Then we ask her for a dessert menu and again a 10 minute wait only for her to come back and apologize that she's taking long. Then another 10 min wait to get our dessert, creme brûlée is fantastic. Overall food was GREAT, however the service made my first time here not so pleasant.

So these stars are for the way my complaint was handled. After waiting three days for someone to contact me I decided to call and ask to speak to a GM, he was not in and I spoke to Adam who is a manager. Adam refunded my charge, invited me back with a guest for a meal, but MOST IMPORTANT,  listened to me and apologized for my experience last weekend. I will come back and give this Brio another try. This is how my situation should have been handled that night. This is customer service.

$4 happy hour apps and a $5 Aperol spritzer? Ain't mad at ya.

Maybe the magic is a bit built up, hailing from a state with zero drink specials (thanks Blue Laws!), but stepping out of a blustery, sleet-driven Friday in to the warm, fabricated hearth of a Brio set the stage for success.

Cheap food that's just cheap food? Hardly. We dabble in a spinach dip, sliders, ravioli caprese, crispy shrimp and a sausage & pepper flatbread, all at the paltry price of 400 pennies each. Keep your expectations in check, and the shrimp and caprese will pleasantly surprise you.

The atmosphere is a kick-up from the ultra façade most mega chains spit, and the servers were attentive without being obnoxious (whereas the bussers were perhaps too aggressive with plate snatching and stacking).

Brio is not the place I'll beckon any shopper in Crocker Park to make a B-line for, but would I kick the $4 bar apps out of bed for eating crackers? Not tonight; it's cold outside.

We are fairly new to the Vegas scene and we came from a town that had bee limited options. So this is one reason why I love bug cities...the eateries!!! The food! This was our first sit down Italian restaraunt and it was pretty good. They gave you good size proportions and we had to take it to go.  The pasta was very yummy and soft..almost like homemade pasta. And the deserts were delish!!! Planning on going back soon to get the lobster and shrimp fettuccine again!

Sat at the bar on a Wednesday night.  $5 martini's and fairly good appetizer specials.   Short rib nachos were tasty but not enough cheese.  Bartender (male, short dark hair) was efficient and friendly.

This is not Olive Garden........I don't mean that in a bad way. Here it is a little more classy. More relaxing and great food! Nice place to take a date or the wife to enjoy a quiet meal and just relax. Servers are very good and nice here.

BAD SERVICE AND if u want a gathering don't think of this place I will never again
