Customer service is horrible here. The server had an attitude like they didn't want to be there. The food was bland, the soup was warm. Bad experience. I read the reviews I guess I probably came at a bad night.

I went here for lunch today with a friend.

The marlin special sounded good so we both ordered it.

Not such a great idea.  The marlin was overcooked.  My friend said it tasted like chicken.  The roasted veggies were just ok as well.

Next time I'll stick with one of the pasta dishes.

So first of all we had the worst waiter we had ever had in our experience dining out. He was more concerned with his hair than asking my Mom just once if she wanted a refill on her coffee. He just stood in the corner and messed with his hair. We never received bread with our meal and when asked about it he said he would bring it which he never did. We asked about the menu change and he seemed annoyed at the question. On our way out we mentioned to the Manager that we were disappointed with the service and all she said was I'm  sorry in a very insincere way. Will never return to this restaurant chain again

This is a solid restaurant. 

I've been to a location in Orlando, and now the one in Las Vegas. Every time the food has been consistent, flavorful, and served hot. This particular location has paid close attention to the aesthetics, which from a designer's point of view is always appreciated. 

More important however, when considering any restaurant with multiple locations and above-average prices is the food and service. Again, I have yet to be disappointed. Considering the brusque treatment I got at the Grotto in the Golden Nugget, I was afraid that might be par for the course. Thankfully it isnt. 

Brio's Vegas location in a walking mall is a nice change from the more parking lot-oriented locations in other states. Its nice to be on a patio that isnt overlooking only cars but real pedestrians going about their business. 

For a nice bite of Italian close to McCarran, Brio's Las Vegas location gets my nod.
Absolutely love this place great atmosphere and very friendly staff. I had the veal Marcella with fettuccini Alfredo wow just wow it was perfect and tender and enough to take hone for later

Let me start of by saying if I could give 0 stars I would. This was my first experience at Brio. My boyfriend searched on yelp restaurants in town square and we saw it had great reviews. When we first were seated, the chairs had food on them and we had to switch them out. We decided to order drinks, which took about 20 mins to come. For our entrees 
My boyfriend ordered the chicken limone and I ordered the pasta pesto. It took an entire hour to come to the table. In between the wait, the waiter and manager came over at several times saying it was "coming out soon " when the food finally arrived, they informed us they had no angel hair pasta and instead gave us fettuccine. It was old clumpy and not cooked. The meal looked gross and even the waitress agreed it was terrible. The manager came over and apologized but never offered us anything except to remake our food that would take another hour. I will not be returning here ever again!!!!
Awesome food! Lobster Bisque is amazing. Food was delicious. Would go again.

Wow.  What a nice surprise.  
My husband and I were vacationing in Vegas and were sick of the constant stimulus of the strip.  This place was recommended for a quiet meal with a romantic vibe.

Let me tell you--Service is important to those who've worked in the service industry. (I used to be a waitress. I know how hard the job is!)

Boy, did we get blessed.  Tamara was our server.  Her bubbly and genuine smile really stood out from the glazed and frozen grins we were starting to get used to.

My husband ordered the salmon salad and said it was a large but perfectly filling light meal.
Tamara dealt with my modifications to their Garden Salad and handled it like a CHAMP! The grilled chicken added to salad was so juicy!  It definitely wasn't some 'garbage' chicken that couldn't be used in another dish. (Again, I know how restaurants work...)

Tamara  wasn't miffed that we weren't drinking and ordered Pelligrino.
But, THIS is Vegas and she did tempt my husband to stumble...off his low-carb diet! 
Per Tamara's suggestion, John ordered the light cheesecake bite AND the peanut butter cup. (When he falls off the bandwagon...forget about it!) He said Tamara's taste buds were right on the money KA-CHING! Her cheesecake won top billing.

If we lived in Vegas I could definitely see us coming here a lot.  In fact, every time we stop by Sin City, we will be nabbing a table here. 

Great job, Tamara. You made this incredible restaurant an experience we will definitely remember. With a smile and attitude like that, the world is your oyster!

Dear Brio,

After giving you such rave reviews back in 2009, you have kindly let me down in the most unexpected way. See I do understand that you do not take reservations for happy hour, and I totally respect that. However the fact that I came to give you a courtesy head's up that I was bringing around 40+ people over the three hour time spam for my birthday happy hour a week in advance and you kindly but adamantly let me know that you could not accommodate me left me speechless. Your friendly manager kindly explained that he did not want a "rowdy" group and that he wanted to keep everything orderly.  He let me know that no I could not hold two tables once I arrived and that my party would be seated separately as they came in to keep everything orderly. So no standing around and being unorderly, et al. Again the look on my face was priceless. Last I check I was almost 40 and my friends don't get "rowdy" but ok whatever. However I still had a friendly smile and thanked your manager for letting me know that in so many words he did not want my business and that I needed to find a new venue.

Yea hmm wow. No worries. I found another place that welcomed me with open arms for my birthday happy hour and they don't mind if we stand around and get a little "rowdy".  

Love,
Ebs

Me and two girlfriends were out and about in Vegas this past weekend and after all the window shopping we had done, we realized we were famished. So we drove and came upon Brio. The first thing out of me and my friends mouth was HAPPY HOUR SPECIALS!!!! See we frequent the Brio in Scottsdale and we love their happy hour special in which a select few of their appetizers are all $2.95. We snag a great parking spot and walk into Brio where the sign says happy hour 3-7 in the bar. SCORE!

We are immediately seated and our waiter comes over to take our drink orders and we say may we also get the happy hour menu. He proceeds to say that happy hour doesn't start until 3:30pm but I say your sign says 3pm.  He proceeds to tell me still needs to be changed but happy hour does not start to 3:30pm. We say fine, we will wait the 20mins until happy hour starts. He proceeds to walk away but what he doesn't realize is that I am still watching him and I swear the look on his face was like these bitches.... So needless to say when he came back I called him out on it. He let me know that if his face conveyed that then he was very sorry and that he apologies for the misunderstanding. Hmm suspect... (however he got back into my good gracious later)

We order Brio Burgers, Ravioli Caprese, Roasted Red Pepper & Fresh Mozzarella Bruschetta and Sliced Steak Bruschetta. Now we have had this before at the Scottsdale Brio and each time the burgers have been perfect and the bruschetta has been divine. This time not so much. The burger was perfect on the inside but burnt on the outside, the Ravioli and all the Brushchetta came out lukewarm at best. Our waiter came over to ask how everything was and I was like eh do you really want to know? So we told him that we weren't happy but we were hungry and we would eat it anyway. He offered to make everything again but we declined as we had already waited for about 30 mins for the food after we ordered. He says I will tell the manager and she may come over to talk to you.

Well the GM came over to talk to us and asked how things were. We told her that we were use to how great everything was at the Scottsdale location and we came here because of that notion and we were disappointed but hey for $2.95 per appetizer, we cannot complain too much. She said that she had just spent a month at the Scottsdale location and this was her first day back and she apologized for the meal and she said she would take care of it for us. We were all like wow, thank you that is very generous. She asked if we wanted anything else and we declined and thanked her again.

Little did we know that when she said she would take care of it for us, she meant the entire bill!! Drinks and all. We asked for the bill thinking we had to at least pay for our drinks and our waiter let us know that the entire bill had been taken care of. WOW! We did leave our waiter a nice tip and left out of there shaking our heads. 

So maybe this Brio was having an off afternoon but I give it 1.5 stars for the food but 5 stars for the GM for being extra generous.

I know two reviews for the same restaurant. Hey it was different locations so they each get their own review.  :) 

Unlike the Scottsdale location in which I was there for happy hour, for this location, I was here for lunch and let me tell you they did not disappoint. The decor was really nice on the inside, however since it was such a nice day outside, we decided to have lunch outside. Our waiter was a sweetheart who could not have been a day over 16 tops.  I think we made the poor kid blush on more than one occasion. 

So onto the food. Me and my friend Tanya ordered the same thing, Crab & Shrimp Cakes. OMG they were so, so good. The came out nice and hot and were filled with lots of shrimp and crab. Unlike some places you just get alot of filler. Here, they definitely did not skimp on the amount of shrimp and crab they put into these cakes. I swear if we could have licked our plates we probably could have.

You would think that that the yummy lunch would be enough. Oh no, we just had to have some dessert as well before we started on our shopping excurision. (Note to self, don't eat so much before going shopping or nothing you try on will fit quite right). Ok so back to the dessert, although I am not sure it is still on the menu as we visited during the summer, the dessert I chose was the key lime pie mini dessert. Now can we say that was just a huge tease! lol. Seriously it was very good and it took everything in us not to order another one each. All in all, I had a great time while visiting Brio and I look forward to going to visit again soon.

We had a discount coupon for this restaurant and visited for the first time. Upon arrival we discovered the majority of the seating is outside on an enclosed covered patio. Even though they had heat lamps it was chilly. We decided to wait for an indoor table. The wait lasted almost 30 minutes and there's very little area to stand in while waiting.

This restaurant has a VERY lively bar that you can also dine at. It was full and loud. The layout of the restaurant is laid back but accommodates few tables in the main dining area. The entire end of the restaurant restaurant is taken up by the trio that plays on the weekends. Fearing the noise we were happy to find that the trio played familiar but low keyed music that didn't interfere with the dining experience.

Now the food. It was very good with emphasis on Italian naturally. We ordered different items and all were quite good with enough left over to take home. Our waiter was outstanding, friendly, competent and kidding. Every time he brought out a dish he would say, "Take a Picture". It was funny.

Anyway I don't think we will go back. While we enjoyed the food, the atmosphere just was found wanting. When you make a reservation that should ask if you want indoor or outdoor seating.

Although the Lasagna remains one of the best in the valley- the overall  condition of the restaurant and the lack of server professionalism prompts this less than stellar review. A past favorite however, the restaurant needs a serious deep clean! The  floors, chandeliers, silk plants and even the wall areas around the kitchen vents (clearly in view from the dining area) seem neglected and in my opinion unacceptable in a restaurant. It made me feel - what is the food quality?  It was fine by the way!
Our server, Ashley- needs additional training on service as she constantly walked up to our table and abruptly interrupted our conversation.  
With so many options nearby - this location needs attention to stay in the mix !

I've frequented Brio plenty of times with friends and family, and it has always been a good option. With that in mind, there are a few"Dos and Don'ts" that I'd recommend:

~ Don't be afraid to explore the menu. I enjoy a myriad of different dishes ranging from the steak to the pasta. My friends also enjoy dishes such as the pork chops. 

~ If venturing for dinner, I would avoid the basic salads as the price doesn't warrant the size. Lunch time is a much better deal. 

~ GET THE CARAMEL MASCARPONE CHEESECAKE! IT'S F***ING AMAZING!!!

~ For this specific location, I've found that during peak times, their service seems to slow down quite tremendously--more so than you'd expect. Off-hours are best and quick if you're in a hurry. 

Overall, if you're looking for a good restaurant with a wide variety of options, Brio is a solid pick. And remember...GET THE CARAMEL MASCARPONE CHEESECAKE!

I love this restaurant.  That being said, I was ultimately surprised when our waitress in the bar section was a little too sarcastic or trying too hard to be nice, like it was physically hurting her to do so... She explained our menus like we looked confused as to what she even had handed us.  I was turned off immediately by how apathetic she was being.  We were done with our meal and two other waiters asked us if we wanted the bill.  15 mins go by, four servers stood by the checkout while we painstakingly waited at our table.  We honestly could have just got up and walked out with no discrepancies...  Also I bartend, my fiancé is a competitive bartender as well so we know professionalism.  A older bartender got woodford reserve out and left it on the bar for 5mins... He free handed the sketchiest old fashioned I've ever seen... And then did not put the bottle back in its place.  The second bartender came around and poured water yet did nothing about the bottle that was still out.  The original tender passed it four more times without putting it back.  He also proceeded to stick an unopened straw into a shot he poured but had found something in the drink that wasn't supposed to be there. It was an unpleasant experience.

I am a little disappointed. My friends were bragging how great this place is and how wonderful the food is to eat.

We sat on the patio and the seats were not very comfortable. I thought for a nice restaurant, the seats would be more cozy. They were not very comfy on the seat part. I also noticed that they were snug on the sides which could make it tight for those with bigger hips.

Next was our waiter. He took our order then he disappeared. He never came back for refills. I ordered a wildberry lemonade and got my dinner first before getting my drink. I had to remind our waiter about my drink. I guess they ran out of berries.

Next I ordered a chicken risotto. Good, but it didn't seem like very munch compared to the rest of the dishes at the table. I finished first and ended up watching my friends eat. Our waiter came back, took my empty dish and my water cup. No refills were offered. When he came back asking for anything else, I asked for a water while my friend ordered a cappuccino. I had to WAIT again, this time just for water.

I probably wont come back here again and I WILL not recommend this place to friends. It's a shame what a bad experience can do.
Valentina was a great server very polite and efficient. The food was great also it was my first visit and would recommend it to my friends.

Came here for my little cousins birthday yesterday for lunch, all 30 of us! Let's just say our server did pretty well accommodating all of us, and was pretty attentive. I ordered the carbonara and I wasn't too impressed, but my spouse got the alla vodka and it was delicious, will definitely order that next time. Pretty atmosphere and food came out in a very timely matter!

Brio is your typical Italian chain. It's ok, not terrible, not great. They have a gluten free menu, which is good news. My daughter was able to order GF Mac n cheese. She was happy but it did taste pretty salty. They have a huge beef carpaccio which is pretty tasty. Their carbonara sauce doesn't have peas in it and is not as fresh tasting as I would like. My other daughter had salmon, she complained to me that it was too cooked on the bottom. The food obviously wasn't great but our waiter was fantastic.

Well, I picked this place for our 22 year old daughters birthday dinner.  Thought it would be a nice little place for our dinner.   Service was horrible. I waited tables back in my youth, just like most of us have, and this guy was just incredibly rude, snotty and a complete jack ass.

The worst part of this nightmare was I had to have my husband pull over 3 times on the way home so I could vomit.

When I got my meal I wasn't quite sure what was wrong with it but I ate it.  BIG MISTAKE.  Then everyone at my table tasted it and all said it was sour.   Yes.  The second time around I can confirm.  It was sour.  Very sour.

And to think I paid well over $100 to vomit.   On the side of the road.  Three times.  

Wouldn't go here again if it was the last place in the valley serving warm food.  No thank you.  I'm going to brush my teeth and never think of this place again.
I have to say this place gets ALL FIVE STARS!  Delicious!  I've eaten at a lot of places in Las Vegas and Food is good, service is great (in particular our waiter Justin), everything is top notch.

Tivoli Village location has horrible service. That alone made this place so terribly annoying. I have eaten at Brio all across the U.S. because its consistently good food and service. Not this location unfortunately. 

Waiter took 20 min to acknowledge us. Was nowhere to be found during the meal and filled our glasses once. I had to get up and look for the guy in the front of the kitchen to get him to come back to our table. And to top it off my $20 plate of Chicken Limone was nothing more than chicken on pasta. Missing the lemon completely on taste and only present in presentation. 

I should have ordered what I normally order but I was feeling adventurous. I live in this neighborhood and am here daily so I expect to come back and have better service. You need to if you are going to stay afloat in Tivoli.


I'll revisit and update, hopefully with better news.

Another review started the beginning of December... I'm seriously falling behind! Server was great... Crab cakes were ice cold inside... GM Chris was awesome. Tried his best to make it right but I have a strict 'don't eat sent back food' policy... Appreciate the effort but every time I try this location, I am disappointed. The pasta always tastes like it was partially cooked and then was re heated but not all the way? Like rubberie...anyway, great patio location!

I choose poorly. Came here today on a business lunch. My first time here. Everyone raves about it. Beautiful restaurant. Great waitstaff. Everything on the menu sounded great. I choose the shrimp risotto with tomato bisque. The soup was the best thing. The sourdough bread was fantastic, but my risotto was disappointing. I think it was a little over cooked. The shrimp were great. Cooked fresh to perfection, but I think the risotto might have been sitting around awhile. Seemed more like oatmeal. A bit bland too. For an $11 lunch item it was very small. Smallest portion at the table of five. The club sandwich next to me was at least twice as much food. I cleaned my plate and was satisfied but not full. The guy next to me couldn't finish his sandwich and homemade chips, which were pretty good.

While shopping one afternoon around the mall on a warm day, my friend and I decided to have a light bite at the Brio Tuscan Grille. We started with the ever so delicious raspberry mojito. It was light and crisp; just not so heavy on the alcohol and just the perfect amount of sweetness. We ordered the Beef Carpaccio with extra field greens. To our surprise, thank goodness we ordered the half portion, the plate was pretty big. The mustard aioli was very good. 

The very next day we decided to go back for dinner, which is the reason why I gave this restaurant 3-stars. The afternoon quick bite experience wasn't as great as the dinner one. For dinner, I ordered the Shrimp & Scallop Risotto and chopped salad and my friend ordered the Pasta BRIO. Unfortunately, the chopped salad came after we were served dinner and the risotto was almost like uncooked rice. Yah, not so much! So, the manager of the restaurant brought my plate back and brought me out another order. This time the risotto was better, but not great. I wasn't that impressed. My friend enjoyed the Pasta Brio very  much. 

All in all, the location, the ambiance, the service were good, but the food was ok. I guess I'll order something else next time.

Shout out to nick at front desk. After a mishap at carry out. He owned the mistake and offered a full refund. For a young guy he already understands the importance of service recovery. Also provided a teachable moment for my kids. Thanks Nick you will always be successful in service with this type of attitude.

The food is so good. 
Service was on point 
Parking is good, only if the mall is not too busy!
The food portion was good. 
I ordered children's plates & they were full. 
The ticket for 3 adults & 2 kids was around $100.00

I'm giving this restaurant five stars because they went out of their way to make our party of 20 a perfect evening. The service was outstanding and the food was delicious and they took care of 10 adults and 10 kids with no problem. If you have a large group I highly recommend this restaurant. We sat in the north Terrace and we had the room all to ourselves. Thank you all including the general manager who came out and greeted us as well for a great experience.

I visited Brio last saturday; and we were treated like royalty; the service was perfect; food was delicious; wine recommendations were also divine!  This restaurant is a must for Italian food/service!

Good atmosphere and beautiful venue. The bread app that they start you out with is to die for. Server was very attentive and very friendly but I forget her name. I got their ravioli pasta and at first glance, it seemed small but by the time i was done, i was full.
Olive Garden is better for way less money. The food is nothing special and the pasta is too well done. The bread was good however. The decor is good but I can't eat it.
Solid spot good for large groups. Menu and food is nothing to remember but wouldn't expect much more given it is a chain.
I like to come to Brio when in Cleveland. A nice menu, good staff, and reasonable prices.

This is a chain restaurant located off the Strip in the Town Center shopping mall.  The food is consistent and the atmosphere is good.  Prices are not bad either.  If you want good Italian food, come here.  We had excellent service, and they had live music outside.  We had the iceberg wedge salad, a pasta dish and shrimp mediterranean and all was excellent.  They have large deserts if you want to share, or small ones if you want to have something different.  The area is nice to walk off your meal too.
5 star lobster risotto if there were 7 stars I would give them all. Perfectly al dente cooked, very nice taste. This dish is top 5 on my bucket list.

Went in for happy hour . Seated ourselves in a booth . Sat for 12 minutes before we were greeted . Sat 10 minutes before water , then asked to order . Waited about 45 minutes for our appetizers ... 
 Sat another 10 before we received any utensils to eat our food . Wanted ketchup ... waited 10 minutes before our waiter told us they are out of ketchup LOL .  
Honestly it was slow service and ok food .... waited wasn't nice or rude . 
Probably don't be back .

Best Italian restaurant that I've been to in Arizona the waiters and waitresses always greet you with a smile and they take very good care of you and every time I go whatever manager is there is always very involved in the customer's experience they're always visible and walking around asking everybody how's it going there's nothing that I would change

Wow. I was pleasantly surprised. I was expecting the Olive Garden but this place is much better than that. Their food isn't anything groundbreaking, but it is good. I had one of their dinner specials, the blackened scallops on pesto risotto, and thought it was great. The scallops were large and weren't gritty at all. The risotto was a pretty good consistency (not the best I've ever had, but still good) and had some bold flavors with the pesto and mushrooms. This dish is different than the shrimp and scallop risotto on their daily menu, by the way. 

I love the fact that you can get small samplings of their desserts for 2.45 a shot. They're large enough to satisfy your sweet tooth without feeling like you're bingeing on a huge piece of cake or whatever. Most of the desserts are tasty, but not spectacular. The tiramisu and cheesecake are probably the best. I was impressed with the food and the interior of the place. It was a nice casual atmosphere and a relatively inexpensive meal.

Love this place, food is good and price is good. 
I love the strawberry salad, pasta la vodka, risotto are my favorite.
Highly recommended

Really slow service, manager nowhere to be seen. Staff caught lying and give you inconsistent stories and excuses about a request to move to a different table or to at least open the umbrellas so you don't fry while you wait 20 minutes for a mimosa or 30 minutes for a simple caesar salad or a total of an hour for your main course. If you go, hope all goes magically well but don't expect unsatisfactory situations to be fixed or be handled properly.

Great restaurant...I work with someone who lives in the northwest part of the valley and since I'm in the southeast...it's a great location for us to meet in the middle for lunch or dinner.

The food is excellent - not on the inexpensive side, but definitely worth the money for such good quality and taste.  I'm particularly fond of the Mezza Chicken Limone and end up getting that almost every time we go, although I've had the chopped salad as well and it's great.

I like that the menu flags a number of items that are under 595 calories so if you are counting them at all or just want to know what might be a healthier choice - they make it really easy.

Love the outside seating (and there is plenty of it) - especially if we're trying to get some work done...the inside can get a little bit noisy.  Service is excellent...beyond reproach, in fact.  Definitely the place you want to go to for a business lunch.

Beautiful restaurant with a great ambiance. However, with that being said, the perfection of the decor and space did not match the food. We had a party of 6 and we ordered different things and all dishes were mediocre at best. I ordered the lasagna and my mom ordered the fettuccine and both dishes were very dry. My mom had to ask for more sauce for her dry noodles. No where close to traditional Italian food, very disappointing. The wine list was decent though. Also we had excellent service. Just wished the food lived up to the beautiful space and great service, since the food is really what I'm paying for.

A franchise restaurant in a mall adjacent to the airport posing as Le Circe with prices that are far too expensive for a dressed up Macaroni Grill with vaulted ceilings that are unable to mute nor dampen the subway station levels of noise on the main dining floor.

Called and spoke to Crystal who was going to have her manager Brian contact me. I was looking for a place to do my co-workers retirement party. Never received a phone call back. This was going to be a party for 15+ people. Makes me laugh that they have all this money that they don't care enough to pick up the phone and call. Thank gosh for Maggiano's, they were awesome and excited to accommodate us. So if your looking for a professional place that can handle a big party. Maggiano's is your place.

5 star food and service. My wife and I come here all the time. An awesome place to eat, people watch and enjoy in town square. I have been coming here for a long time, I guess today was the first time i'm writing a review.
I've been to brio several times and I'm not sure why but I never leave feeling like the food was great, just okay, and I've tried new things every time. I'm not sure what it is to be honest

We were very disappointed by this restaurant. We expected to be impressed, and simply were not. This place does not live up to its hype. 

We came here for a birthday dinner, and I had a certificate for a free Beef Medallions with Shrimp Scampi. We also ordered the Brio Chopped salad and Calamari. 

The salad was delicious, but we weren't impressed by much else. The calamari was tasteless to say the least. The beef medallions were not cooked to our preference- we ordered them medium rare and they came out well done. The shrimp scampi included only a few shrimp on top of the medallions, all sitting on a bed of orzo pasta and small pieces of roasted vegetables tossed in a sauce. 

We were just disappointed. I would suggest going somewhere else.

My department of 8 came here for lunch on a Monday afternoon.  Without a reservation, we only had to wait 5 mins prior to be seated.  The lunch menu was pretty decent.  Many options to chose from, such as salad, pasta, paninis, flatbreads and more.

I decided to go with angel hair pasta with salmon.  The angel hair pasta was cooked perfectly, not too soft, not too hard.  The salmon was a a tad bit more cooked than I would have liked, but because there was a nice scampi butter sauce, it was still delicious.

I will definitely return to try their items on the happy hour menu.

Good food 
Amazing atmosphere 
But such a slow servers. 
It's took as almost 45 min to start eating
The manager was very friendly and try to help as out but if they can't handle full dinner let as wait outside better than have a bad service

Gave it another shot, and we had a better experience. 

Salad was great, and my chicken was great. 

Still not at the top of our list, but a good quick date night. They also do reservations! Nice for this area of mormon food junkies.

Best tasting happy hour food by far!!! Came after work with some coworkers & will def be back. 

The egg plant fries are BOMB!!! The shrimp is BOMB!!! The burger is BOMB!!! All off the happy hour menu. 

Not a disappointment when the food is delish!!
Service was very slow. Had to flag down server for more water and to order wine. Crab Cake Entree came out cold. Caprese Salad has tomato with the sticker still on it.

One of the best place I've been in Las Vegas. We sat outside at the bar. Despite the heat we had a great time. The food was very tasty. The portions generous for the price and the staff very friendly. The wait time isn't bad for such a good place. Will return for sure.
El fresco. Patio dining at its best.  Celebrating my birthday with two special friends, Pat and Joan. Can't go wrong at Brio.

I don't get a date night that often.  Gave it a shot with this reputable brand but was disappointed.  Food ordered was calamari, caprese salad, and the nine ounce filet with Gorgonzola crust and roasted vegetables.  I ordered a planned dessert of creme brûlée to be brought after our dinner was consumed.  Meat was phenomenal.  Was cooked well done despite my tastes, yet retained juice and texture.  Amazing bite.  The accompanying veggie partnership was well thought of.  

I found no issue with the caprese or the calamari.  Both were well made for a hometown Italian place like this.  I was impressed with the flavor profile of the mozzarella and the crisp texture of the squid.  

My issue was with the timing.  We received our apps, salads, and main course simultaneously and then never received our dessert at all.  The timing had put off my date, whom said Brio is fired.  Despite my likings for this menu, I probably won't come back much, due to this experience.

I decided to get myself some dinner after a nice day of shopping in Vegas yesterday.. I should've went to the whole foods around the corner instead of this Italian restaurant because the service was horrific !!! the bread was  stale I ordered penne alla vodka with no pancetta and the gentleman brought me a gnocchi ravioli with ricotta cheese ....when I went to send it back he tried to argue with me to tell me that in the menu it says something else ....and I told him that I know what the menu says because I ordered Penne alla vodka  he then sent the manager over who was very nice she offered to pay for my entire dinner asked me if I needed anything else and I told her that she needed to hire people that can read and write... Let me add that I specifically requested penne pasta with allla vodka sauce no ricotta cheese and no pancetta ..if The waiter or the chef had an issue with my order they should've told me but instead of that my order was completely disregarded and that's to the gentleman who decided to message me privately who is now blocked

Can't say that I have had a better Italian meal.  The veal was awesome...I inhaled the scrumptious pasta and roasted veggies...the bruscetta sampler was very tasty and the dessert/dolcini sampler was over the top outstanding....too bad I was too full to competely enjoy.  The wedge salad was also tasty and the lemonade was so good.  Best service in Vegas....Q was the most attentive waiter ever...he even told me...we will make anything you want....who says that?  Can't wait to return in November ...our new favorite! !!!
Excellent service and food.  I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great meal.  The portions are big too.

Pretty solid place in Town Square  for lunch or dinner.  Good food with a nice flair, pretty noisy because it is usually crowded.  Happy hour has some cheap dishes if you want to try some different things.  I recommend the Chicken Milanase and the Caesar salads.  Average prices for the type of restaurant.  Great place when the weather is nice to sit in the patio with the fire pits.  Great place for groups as well, very accommodating.  I recommend this, one if my favorite places in Town Square.

I have no complaints for a change. Brio had a lively atmosphere, and the host brought me to my table. She was sweet and talkative, very nice indeed. My server came and discussed the specials then brought me my ice tea. The bread was warm and delicious and then I ordered my meal... 
For starters I had minestrone soup, it was rich and savory, I could taste hints of bacon, ground beef,Garbanzo beans, and so much more...Delicious. Then my ceasers salad, the croutons were the best. 
For my main course, I had blackened Tilapia with potatoes, and it was PERFECT. The server was spot on with my ice tea refills and I have no complaints. It was a very good dining experience and the food did not disappoint me.
Beautiful place inside of Town Square. Usually order the Lasagna but went with the Crispy Chicken salad. Really nice place. Waiter was very friendly & knowledgable.

This restaurant is a solid 4.5 stars but I had to bump it up for the location. This spot is definitely one of my favorites close to the strip. Town Square is such a great place to walk around and shop and then to stop here and have a bite to eat of some bueno Italian food with a beer or a glass of wine is a great way to top off the night unless you go see a movie afterward which is great too. 
I like to sit outside and enjoy the Vegas summer night and watch people walk around as they go in and out of stores while I eat my food. If it's to hot outside the inside is very well designed and looks extremely fancy with good A/C and it's not as expensive as it looks like it should be.

If you order the family pasta Brio for delivery, be sure to request extra sauce or it's DRY when it arrives.  Hope the kitchen adapts the recipe for delivery.  Also beware of the sharp tin lid to avoid cutting yourself on it. Grub Hub provided prompt service and it was nice to have tasty food without heating up the kitchen!

Around 4:00 on a Sunday my boyfriend, brother and I go in and we get promptly seated because there weren't too many people eating that early. Our hostess and the woman who sat us were pleasant. However, after over ten minutes of not being acknowledged by any of the severs walking by, we got up and left. The hostess and woman who sat us watched us walk out with no acknowledgement-no longer pleasant I guess? I can only assume this is how they treat anyone who doesn't look like they "fit in" to a "nice" restaurant like theirs. We are young and although we were dressed appropriately, it must not have been nice enough. I only assume this because I couldn't see any other reason we didn't get served. I have been on the other side of the food business and know that there is a stereotype against young people and them not tipping which I have always found ridiculous because I know it's not true. But, good thing The Cheesecake Factory is right there and that server seemed to appreciate our business.

For a chain restaurant Brio is always on point. The food is excellent quality and well prepared. The service and experience is consistently good. Service was most excellent at this location. We enjoyed the appetizer flat breads and my salad was excellent. We were in a business meeting so the waiter was great about keeping water and soda glasses filled without interrupting us. Great experience.

The food is outstanding but the experience is big chain restaurant unfortunately. Let me be clear, there was nothing wrong with the experience of lunch today at this wonderfully located spot, but there is an opportunity to give an experience that is special. Our experience was nothing short of average - staff act like we are out of town tourists who won't come back again. A little training on service and delivering a good experience would go a long way to make this spot 5 star.

With that said the food is outstanding - fresh, properly flavored and displayed. The food will bring us back, the overall experience needs work.

Our night started off with a 25 minute late reservation, but in spite of getting sat so late, the food and service were exceptional. 

Our waiter was super friendly and knowledgable about the menu. He made some good suggestions. 

I had the bruschetta quatro along with the salmon Fresca. I wasn't feeling in the mood for salmon so I swapped it out for chicken. 

Overall this place is good. Love the environment, the food is great, and we liked the service.
Great food and greatt service! The restaurant is beautiful! Makes you feel like to are in Italy!

After the day I had dealing with lousy customer service reps, this was an oasis of awesome. Our server Michael was truly excellent. Funny, attentive and knew the menu. Made great recommendations. We loved our food. I had the lobster fettuccine and my husband had the pesce piccata. Love! Also try the raspberry monitor. A prefect experience start to finish.

Part of the national chain.  Great place to go before or after a movie since you can make reservations on Open Table.  Great for Sunday brunch.  Good selection of appetizers and pasta and non-pasta entrees.  Good wine list.  Attentive service.  Solid choice

Wonderful food, everyone in our party enjoyed their meals, from cheese stuffed ravioli to lamb to veal.

Service was attentive and prompt.

In my opinion this is one of the best Happy Hours in town. Hours are 3 to 6:30.   I had attempted to try Happy Hour here once before but it was packed and now I know why.  All the drinks are $5 and the apps are $3.95.  I had the Strawberry Mojito and the boyfriend had the Mango Mojito.  For food we ordered the Margherita Flatbread and the Ravioli Caprese.  Everything was good.  This is a spot you need to get to early to secure seating but well worth it!  Five stars if  it ended at 7:00!

I feel I have given Tivoli Village long enough to get their shit straight. I don't know if the cost of rent in this place is so low it invites the kind of "who cares if it fails" culinary experimentation, or if it is so high restaurants are forced to try and sell you crap at a premium. 

As an outside observer, it would seem as if Brio Tuscan Grille is the only restaurant that has managed to survive the Tivoli Village curse. Unfortunately, its mere survival does not preclude the fact that the restaurant as a whole is, well just blah. One look at the main photo on its Yelp page speaks volumes, the burger looks like something I would expect at my third cousin's "backyard birthday bonanza" for her 6 year old - they even cut it up in sections for the kiddies.

The food is not bad, and quite honestly I am impressed with the portion size of their appetizers, as they simply whet your appetite, not drown it. The unfortunate part is that the appetizers are only good if they are half off during happy-hour - I can't imagine paying full price for that. Which leads us to the rest of the menu, where the price points are where you would expect them to be if you were dining on the Strip. Not that I don't have great hope that Tivoli eventually becomes a great dining destination worthy of the high-dolar restaurants, but if it is Friday night and your place is half empty - well I'm just saying.

The service itself was okay, but one doesn't feel an abundance of warmth from the staff. Don't get me wrong, they did everything right and in a timely manner, it's just that there was no warmth there.

I won't go as far as to say that Brio Tuscan Grille is a disappointment, I just can't imagine waiting in line for this place, which is probably why there isn't one.

Went for the Happy early happy hour.All the food items are $2.95 from a selective menu at the bar area so we tried a few.
I enjoyed the Ravioli Caprese the Burger,ans the Shrimp and Eggplant. They were nice big portions and full of great flavors. The steak brushetta was ok, a liitle overwhelming with the cheese. I had 2 beers and my wife had a mixed dink and our bill was only$30. Great place to have a few drinks, a bite to eat and a cool scene if your lucky enough to get a seat on the couches outside. Give this place a try!

Came here for a quick bite and shared the Bruschetta Sampler, Bisteca Salad, and a Fettuccine dish that was a couple minutes shy of al dente...

Luckily the Italian peach tea helped me wash the pasta down. The dessert tray didn't look appetizing, so we passed on the sweets.

Next time we're in the area, I'd rather dine at Yard House instead...ALOHA!!!

Right up there with good non-chain restaurants. My daughter and I had the salmon salad and gluten-free grilled chicken with mashed potatoes and veggies. Everything was done very well. My salmon was cooked to perfection, crispy in the surface and yet tender and juicy inside. Her chicken was tasty and moist as well. Solidly good wine list too, if a bit pricy for such an establishment. Service friendly and efficient. I'd definitely go back again.

The location is splendid.  Truly elegant, despite being a fast casual restaurant. The food is a bit uneven.  Not sure they are the most fastidious with the cleaning and service, either.  But if you're out shopping and touring, not a bad place to stop in for a bite.  Desserts are large and filling, as are the pasta plates.
Great for a lunch salad with girlfriends...  if you're not into rabbit food, the pasta lunch specials are tasty too, but be prepared to nap the rest of your workday... :)

The interior is sooooo much cuter/nicer than I would have expected from the outside. We sat on the patio which was really nice, although, you do hear all the planes flying overhead the whole time.  Service was fast and polite. The bread brought out before our entrees was really delicious and warm. I don't know why, but I thought I would mention that...
I ordered the brunch special which was Eggs Oscar - two poached eggs with a shrimp  crab cake over potatoes and veggies. It was very tasty and the eggs were cooked perfectly. My sister got the pesto pasta which she said she really liked. I tasted it, a little bland for me, but she really seemed to enjoy it. 
We didn't try it but I have been told by a few people that the white peach sangria is really good. 
We got the little desserts in shot glasses - tiramisu for me (good) and key lime for her (amazing!!!)
I would love to come here with a group and sit inside because the atmosphere is so cute and the menu seems like it would have something for everyone.

Wonderful experience at Brio.    Here for a volleyball tournament and was asked by the captains to set up a dinner for the team and parents.    

Made a reservation for a party of 30.   They were very accommodating and didn't even demand that we order off of the catering menu.  So we were able to sample from the dinner menu.  

We were amazed that they were able to serve us all at the same time, the food was hot and everyone enjoyed their meal.    For 30 people that was a feat.  Service was exceptional.   The restaurant was beautiful.    Their mini desserts was wonderful as each of us could sample something yummy without overdosing on sugar.  

Would highly recommend Brio Tuscan Grill to parties large and small - For special occasions, first dates and groups.

What a joke! I've wanted to go to this place for quite some time. So yesterday a friend and I planned to go for happy hour. Well we went and was quite disgusted about the way they handle the seating arrangements for happy hour. You can have happy hour at the bar or at designated tables with fire pits on the patio ONLY. Oh you can sit at a table right next to the ones with a fire pit, a mere 3 inches away; but you have to order from a regular menu and pay full price. Who's hair brain idea is this? Poor business practice and well, just plain fucking stupid. So save yourself the frustration and go to Tommy Bahamas or the Blue Martini as every table and person is offered the happy hour menu and pricing regardless of where you sit, just so long as you go during the designated hours. I'm still in shock.  Completely disappointed.  I'm spreading the word to any one that will listen. I will never give this place one dime and I would encourage those reading this to do the same. They need a new business plan and manager.

My 93 year-old Father-in-Law, husband and I have lunch every Thursday somewhere in town and Brio is one of our favorites.  Not only is the Valet parking virtually right outside their entrance to make it convenient for Dad's walker (and stamina), the greeting we received by the host and hostess was genuine.  From the moment we sat down the waiter and other staff were very attentive and made us feel welcomed.  From the outrageously good sourdough bread to the coffee at the end of the meal, we enjoyed our time together in a relaxing, beautiful atmosphere.  Thank you Tom (our waiter) and Jesse (manager) for a special day at your fine restaurant.  We will continue to come back more often.

Where do I begin with this one!? Okay, I know - the atmosphere! The Town Square location is the grander of the two in the Las Vegas area.  There are dramatic high ceilings with beautifully draped material flowing from the rafters.  The place is huge and although there is a wait at times, it moves along quickly.

The food has been consistently good. Being Italian, I dislike Italian chain restaurants, but this is not one of them.  The ravioli is superb as is all of their pasta dishes judging from the reaction of our guests and our own experience.  Their desserts are wonderful, and they even have "tapas" size to make you feel less guilty.

The newest location in Summerlin is smaller and a little less showy than the Town Square site. However, this just makes it a totally different experience; same great food, but "cozier" feel.  Lots of fun on a Saturday when the Farmers Market sets up at the site!

For lunch or dinner, this place is a sure hit.

I love Brio!
I eat here several times a month, sometimes lunch, sometimes happy hour and often dinner. The staff is always friendly and efficient. I voted for Executive Chef, Joe Milbert's fabulous Autumn pasta dish and he won a trip to Italy over all the other chefs who entered. He is now the acting General Manager and is doing an excellent job in an extremely busy position. 
The food is always delicious. Today I am wolfing down my favorite wedge salad anywhere, the Bistecca, but at happy hour, my choice is often the super good burger. All the servers are upbeat, and give us extra good service!
I will be looking for you, join us at this lovely restaurant.

We have a group of friends who love Brio's and often enjoy the Scottsdale location but we agree unanimously that this San Tan location is even better. Not only is the room much fresher and quieter  but the staff is outstanding! We were greeted at the front door by GM Joe Milbert who escorted us to a very nice table location and made sure we were all comfortable and had everything we needed to make our visit perfect. We had a very skilled waiter named John who showed us just the right combination of constantly attending to our every need but not smothering or bothering us. He was most charming. The lobster bisque I ordered was so delicious and had more lobster meat in it than any I have tasted. Their wedge salad is the best ever. I try to order it often because of the huge chunks of tasty blue cheese, bacon and tomatoes. GM Joe explained that they used to call it the Bistecca because it is served with a really big steak knife. He also backed up our waiter to make sure I got my birthday discount and that we all had a separate check and our Brio Club visits recorded. We all felt like members of a special Italian family by the time we left. Thanks Joe and John for a 5 star lunch.

The bartenders rock!! Brandon, Mike, and Christine rules. They always remember their customers. That's best of the best.  Also those flax crackers are unreal. One of the waitstaff always keeps me loaded.

Food was good but nothing exceptional, the restaurant is quite busy and noisy on a Saturday even when the rest of town square is calm. Good wine and apps probably a great place for happy hour given the wine selection but generally a bit overpriced for the quality of service.

We've always enjoyed this restaurant! We've been here for corporate holiday dinners and just normal night out at town dinners. If you go here for brunch on the weekends I recommend coming in around 1045am. They open at 11am but the doors open at 1030am. 1045am will only be a 15min wait.. if you come right at 11, the wait time might be longer. It does get busy at open, especially Sunday mornings. For the quality of the food, the price is excellent! Great food for a reasonable price!

What can I say about this place.... 5 stars without a doubt! The food, service, parking, people... I love every single thing about it. This place is a place you would want to take a business associate ... Or you significant other... Or your best friend... Or your... Or your... Just about anyone that wants to enjoy and awesome fresh made meal! I had the salmon salad that was to DIE for. I asked for my salmon medium... And it was perfect!  The service was impeccable and the place was clean as a whistle! I loved that they didn't have a bar scene with a bunch of bar flies hanging around. This place is clean and classy!! I will be back EVERY CHANCE I get!!

EPIC Happy hour. Soooo I came to this place a few years ago to meet a girl friend of mine for happy hour. EPIC. The food is great and cheap and the cocktails are the same. The location is CLEAN and open and busy.  All of the locations have a bar that wraps around from inside to the outside patio with a cover and misters... since it gets so darn hot in Vegas. I love that and love to sit out there when its not soooo hot. 

Parking here can be a challenge depending on the day, so you will want to park in the South Parking Garage and walk across the street.

Now, if you start with an appetizer and a few cocktails and decide to move to the main dinning area for dinner, they are more than happy to accommodate you. Or.... if your fine in the spot you have choose, DONT want to move to the dinning room.. you can do that too. 

The Staff here is AWESOME!  I cant tell you how many times I have been here looking to get a booth in the Bar area for happy hour, to meet some friends, and the waitress or waiter has made it a point to watch out for me to grab the next open one :).  I love it when people are nice and looking out for you.  

the food is GREAT, Service is GREAT, location is CLEAN and Bright AND... It can accommodate a TON of people. 

This is my Favorite Happy Hour spot for Vegas... so far!

Basically Brio is basically a slightly upscale Olive Garden. It is slightly upgraded in every way. The decor is more handsome and there are some expensive materials used to help justify the pricing. The unlimited bread sticks have been upgraded to seeded flatbread (which I actually find quite addictive). The pasta is presented with slightly more flair and maybe even a bit more flavor. None of it is better than you could make at home buying ingredients from Fresh & Easy. The prices are high for the portions and particularly the quality that you are served. It is all passable and passionless.

It is rather popular, as there is not much that passes for fine dining in Gilbert. The food is by no means terrible and the servers are friendly, if forgetful. However, it does not compare well with an authentic passionate italian restaurant,

Brio is a great option if you're at the Quarter looking for Italian. Plenty of outdoor seating in addition to their large dining room inside. I ordered the pasta alla vodka - ricotta filled pasta with a tomato cream sauce. Either my appetite is gigantic or the portions have been average at the Italian restaurants I've been to in the valley because I licked my plate clean. 

Entree prices range from $13-20.

I remember the Brio restaurant chain when it first opened more than 10 years ago and the food was really good. Unfortunately, the quality of the food has deteriorated over the years. it's just meh. The service is always good, and it's a busy place -- just wish the food was as good as it used to be back in 2006.

Came last minute for a bite to eat and it was brunch time. MImosa was good but no specials on drinks for brunch. My husband's omlette came out wrong and my daughter's cheeseburger was over cooked. However our server brought out 2 new dishes and really made up for the mistake! On a Sunday afternoon when they are busy, I can get over the mistake especially when they do their best to make it right. Carlos deserves 5 stars for that! Thank you.

So far, I've tried 3 out of the 118 Brio Tuscan Grille's.

I've tried their location in Alexandria, Virginia, which I previously reviewed (3/5 Stars), a couple visits to their location in Gilbert, Arizona (4/5 Stars), and was close to this location, and thought I'd try it.

BRAVO BRIO RESTAURANT GROUP

Bravo Brio Restaurant Group is the parent company of the Bravo! Cucina Italiana, Bon Vie Bistro, Brio Tuscan Grille, "Brio Coastal Bar & Kitchen", restaurant chains in the United States. 

The company owns 118 restaurants and trades on the NASDAQ stock exchange under the symbol BBRG. 

It was established in 1992 by Rick and Chris Doody in collaboration with Executive Chef Phil Yandolino, and is based in Columbus, Ohio. Brian O'Malley is the company's chief executive officer and president.

Bravo! restaurants have a Roman ruin style décor and an open, Italian style kitchen focusing primarily on pastas and pizzas.

The company's goal is to be the "Best Italian" restaurant company in America.

THE STORY & SERVICE EXPERIENCE

On this occasion, I had a training class in the area, and wanted a quick bite. 

I had never been to this location, but I've enjoyed their other locations.

Although the decor is a little kitschy-over-the-top, I like it. 

My server, Kelvin, was super fun.

I had the shrimp appetizer, which I always love, and it was practically free with the Yelp check-in voucher.

Everything I had was OUTSTANDING. 

CONCLUSION

Are they the "Best Italian Restaurant in America?" 

I'm not sure about that, but, so far, every visit to this location has been fantastic! 

The food is good, the restaurant is over-the-top cute, and the service excellent.

4/5 RECOMMEND

OF NOTE

*Plenty of parking in the garage across the street.

*Valet parking available.

*Gift cards available.

*For more information: brioitalian.com

So far, I've tried 3 out of the 118 Brio Tuscan Grille's.

I've tried their location in Alexandria, Virginia, which I previously reviewed (3/5 Stars), a couple visits to their location in North Scottsdale, Arizona, and this location I've been to several times.

On this occasion, we wanted a girls only lunch, and we picked Brio Tuscan Grille in Gilbert, Arizona.

I had been to this location a number of times before, and thought it sounded great.

We had reservations, but we didn't really seem to need them, as the place was only 1/3 full.

Although the decor is a little kitschy-over-the-top, I like it. 

Our server, John, was super fun.

The drink menu has all sorts of specialty fruity drinks, so we ordered them all just to try them. My favorite was the watermelon martini. VERY TASTY INDEED. 

We split the mediterranean salad, the shrimp appetizer, and the calamari.

Everything we had was OUTSTANDING. 

CONCLUSION

Are they the "Best Italian Restaurant in America?" 

I'm not sure about that, but, so far, every visit to this location has been fantastic! 

The food is good, the restaurant is over-the-top cute, and the service excellent.

4/5 RECOMMEND

OF NOTE

*Plenty of parking out front (usually).

*Gift cards available.

*For more information: brioitalian.com

This place sucks big meatballs(see what I did there) service is bunk as hell. We sat there for 15 mins with no one helping us. So me and my party left. On our way out,We then told the manager what was going on and her response was on some half ass "I'm sorry", "we can get you menus now". She needs work on her managerial skills cause she seemed as if she doesn't have that.(she might need to take a class) Maybe it was because we didn't fit the "look" of her crowd. In any case, that's the first time and last time at that spot...just go to yard house for happy hour!

I am sorry to report that I had a terrible experience here last night and it was my birthday!!!  It was 103 degrees outside and the front door was open.  The restaurant was hot,hot it must have been about 83 inside.  I asked the hostess to please turn the  air conditioner up and she told me that I was the only one complaining. How rude can you be.   Meanwhile I saw employees fanning themselves with menus.  She finally told me that she asked the manager and he said he would adjust the temperature to 68 and see if that helped.  CLOSE THE DOOR.  If you can't adjust your temperature you should close shop and move on.  We had already been seated and we did not want to relocate.  I was miserable and so was everyone else.  There are more polite places.  I must say the waiter was wonderful his name was Yanni.  I will stay away and suggest you do the same.

Not terrible, but not great either... this place has a really nice atmosphere & service isn't bad. However, it's overpriced to say the least. Not a great menu selection compared to pretty much any other restaurant of equivalent size/style. Overall I'd say this is more the type of place you go to when you're trying to enjoy a nice & impressive layout, as apposed to just getting a good solid meal & leave satisfied.

Just had a great brunch with hubby Howard at Brio Tuscan Grille in Scottsdale. Had their beef carpaccio. 
Large enough fo two with capers, special mustard and olive oil and forcaccio crackers. Fabulous and two great bloody Marys. The perfect Sunday light brunch for under $25. need I say try it!

Have been to a Brio before and remembered it to be very good but no such luck last night. I had the Chicken Limon and we also had a double Pork Chop. The Chicken was dry, did not have any of the sauté sauce as would be usual, and had very little flavor. The vegetables it was served with were inedible. No idea what was wrong with them but bitter and terrible tasting. My partner only ate 1 of the 2 pork chops as he said that was not good either. Disappointing. The bread was good, the server was very nice and attentive ... only positives ... ahh well.

Had lunch with some friends that live in Summerlin area.  They said Brio is a mixed  bag, sometimes good, sometimes average...Service was good, food better than Olive Garden.  probably would not go back.....

Whoa, I enjoy this place. Never have I ever thought I would enjoy this place. Abby Q was a very pleasant server. I would recommend her to anyone who is trying to dine at this restaurant. Much gratitude!
Stopped off here on a recommendation from a local. We were not dissapointed. It was delicious. The best brunch we have had in a long time.

M and I have eaten here many times over the years. We went back Thursday night so we could have dinner and then do some shopping in the mall. The menu has changed and I was sad to see the chicken and sweet potato risotto was gone from the menu. The free-range chicken they used was marvelous!
Anyway, now they have calorie counts on all their dishes listed on the menu and I LOVE that!  I was able to make a smart meal decision and it tasted really good. I had the Salmon Fresca. The portion size was so much better that I finished it without being stuffed or needing a to-go box. It came on a mix of chopped tomato, spinach and red bell pepper. M got the grilled chicken breast but wasn't that impressed. However, he made a lower calorie choice as well. 
The service has always been good there and we mostly sit in the bar. We used to go for happy hour food and drink, but now we can make better food choices.

You can't get any better than $2.95 special plates during happy hour!  The menu is small for happy hour, but the food is AMAZING !  
We had the Margharita Pizza, Steak Bruchetta and the Burger.  It was enough to fill our tummies.  The drinks we got weren't on happy hour, so we paid more for beer/ wine than food.  LOL.

I suggest sitting in the bar and trying out this happy hour.  It seemed popular, and the price can't get any better unless it is Freeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!

I can't say enough good things about Brio Tuscan Grille.  I recently ate there with my husband and kids. The food was fantastic and, even though, the atmosphere indicates a more upscale restaurant, my kids were welcomed with no hesitation.  The chocolate dessert that I shared with my daughter was out of this world - so gooey and delicious.  I can't wait to go back.

It is rare that I have a dish that is unlike anything I have ever had...that makes me think I only wish I lived locally so I could have it again...but that is how I feel about the sweet potato and chicken risotto!.  It was extraordinary.  Fresh asparagus, pancetta, and pine nuts mixed in make it all just delicious- bite after bite.    And we dropped off our kids across the street at Safari Kid Care and all together it was a great vacation evening!!  Kids had fun, we ate well and had a nice short walk across the street to our car.  YUM.

I've typically gone to Brio for their happy hour ($3.95+ for small plates on weekdays), so I've never really gone here during regular lunch & dinner hours as I thought their prices were quite high.

However, I came here for lunch with my coworkers & I didn't realize they have a lunch menu (from $10 -$17), and their prices are very reasonable. It's not fast food cheap, but for its quality & ambience, it's definitely worth it.

Overall, servers have been nice & check up on my party in a timely manner. However the food takes a little longer to come out compared to other restaurants. Nonetheless, their complimentary bread & crackers satisfy one's appetite while waiting.

Honestly, everything on their menu is pretty tasty & delicious.

Sad day for me today service has never been bad today it was awful what's up brio I don't know how many people I've told about the great service there and today I got treated like a dog yesterday my bar tab was $17 and I left a $10 tip the same guy behind the bar was there they treated me like you didn't even know me we have gone there probably 25 times in the last 4 months oh well maybe we'll try one more time see if it gets any better

We recently had our wedding reception here.  We are from Los Angeles and had never been to Brio Tuscan Grille so I didn't know what to expect.  The food was delicious and all my guests keep telling us how good the food was, how beautiful the restaurant was and how the location was perfect and so nice to get off the strip.  Everything went so well from booking to finish.  The staff is so amazing and so accommodating.  I can't thank everyone enough for making our wedding so perfect and easy.  P.S.- We had our reception on the outdoor patio and it is so pretty on its own that you don't need any decorations.  It's perfect.

Wow. What can I say? The place is boomin, so there was a short wait understandably, but only 15 minutes to seat 7 people? That's no time at all. The atmosphere, with the old paintings and Roman look, is great. I would decorate my place like that if I could. Next, the service. Our waitress' name was Kimberly, and she was great. Very attentive and a fantastic personality. She got a good tip for sure. Lastly, the food. Frickin fantastic. I had a mushroom ravioli with an alfredo sauce that knocked my socks off. I also tried the tortellini and lasagna that was also just as good. I would recommend this place to anyone, especially lovers of Italian food.

Yummy! Brio's bruschetta was soo good. I got the Bruschetta Quarto which featured four of their delicious bruschettas. I also tried their lobster bisque and the caesar salad. The salad was boring and lobster bisque came in a neat bowl, but had a weak flavor. For dessert I had the caramel creme brulee - very tasty! 

Brio is a loud restaurant - not a good place for conversation, but even with all the bustle and noise we still ended up having a great time.

Maybe it was just us (M and I) that had an very off and weird visit.  They told us that it will be 15 mins for a table.  Then they came back in 5 mins and said a private area is open & will sit us there.  Ok, they sat us on the patio.  Cool.  The heaters were on and I was melting, so we moved to another table.  

We were enjoying view and noticed the table we moved to was not cleaned yet.  OK, it was not dirty, it just had a used cloth napkin in the corner of the table.  We placed our order and talked.  Then I noticed a feather in M's hair.  I was like where have you been?  I removed it out of her hair.  When the appetizer and salad show up, M was pooped on by a dove.  YIKES!  I heard it was good luck?  She moved to the chair across the table.  When she sat, I noticed a fold white item underneath her chair.  I was like OMG, it is a maxi pad.  Where the heck did that come from?  

Here is the low down on the food and service:
Appetizer:  Pepperoni & Sausage Pizzetta - YUMMY!!!
Main course:  Chicken Milanese - Was pretty good, but not GREAT...
Main course:  Whole Roasted Chicken (M's meal, but I had some) - Flavor was good, but the chicken is DRY!
Dessert:  Chocolate caramel something - It was ok.
Service:  It was ok too.

Came here of a business dinner with my crew, and regretted this choice. Seemed like an over priced Olive Garden with tacky decor. Yikes!

Wish we went elsewhere.

My favorite thing about this place is their Happy Hour!  $3.95 food specials and now $5 drink specials (that's new it think)!  Can't beat that. The bar area does get very busy, and it's not that big, so be prepared to wait for a seat/table.  We have eaten there for lunch and dinner also and everything has always tasted amazing!

Went here for lunch today and ordered the chicken Marsala. It was amazing and the vegetables were fresh. I love grilled veggies. I wasn't disappointed at all and the service was great. Definitely will come here again

Meh. Chain restaurant... 'nuff said.  8/6 visit.  None of the food was that good - I ordered the Balsamic Braised Beef Short Rib which was under-seasoned, bland and absent much flavor (er... saaaay Balsamic vinegar!?); my daughter ordered Pasta Alla Vodka which was slightly better.  Substantial portions, neither was worth taking home as left-overs.

The wine pour was mediocre.

Appitizer of Artichoke Dip was the star of the show; dessert of Dolchino Trio was great.

Server was friendly enough, but service sucked (disappearing for long periods of time; needing to be reminded of our requests numberous times - frankly I think he may have just had too many tables, despite the nearly 7p seating and a 1/3 full restaurant).

Hostess was wonderful, both being on the ball once we arrived; stewarding a late arrival back to our table; offering to charge my phone at the front when I was looking for an oulet.

Bigger price for an Olive Garden experience.

Always love coming here for happy hour, prices are awesome $5-$6 food and $4-$6 drinks! Happy indeed! Lol service is pretty great also, the workers are nice and makes sure that you got everything you need.

I just don't like how dark it is at night when you're dining inside it's a little hard to see, maybe just because I don't like to use my glasses but a little more light and it'd be great!
Wonderful staff and amazing food. It's a bit loud if the restaurant is full but you forget all of it when you're served. Love it!

This was me and my husband's first time eating here. I ordered a frozen alcoholic beverage (can't remember the name) but, it was amazing! I ordered the chicken lemon and my husband got the shrimp and lobster fettuccine! Both absolutely amazing, outside of our amazing food was the amazing service. Our server's name was Alex (aj) you could tell he really loved his job, the food, and I making our experience one of the best we would ever have! We will definitely be back and will be asking for the best server there, aj!

I give Brio Cacina Italiana 4 stars simply because they deserve it!

Have frequented Brio Cacina Italiana many many times.  Have even celebrated my birthday here! Great fun!  What I love about the Brio is that they have a variety of dishes that I find delish!  From their Beef Carpaccio to their Eggplant & Shrimp appetizer to their perfect pasta! Just love them... if you go during the week, you can catch their Happy Hour & get the Beef Carpaccio for $2.95, baby! Yes, I said it! I went one early evening  for appies (appetizers) & drinks with my girlfriend and our bill was a mere $30 something when we finished! How can you beat that? We noshed on the Carpaccio, Shrimp cocktail and wine!  Also, the environment is great - I love chilling by the outside bar on the lovely spring / summer evenings... always a Gem in my book!

to be more up to date: Saturday, 29 Jan 2011 was date night - even tho our mood was less than nice... we still enjoyed our meal! :)

your constant companion,

~dee

Great food, great happy hour. Five dollar martinis are killer. Gin with blue cheese stuffed olives , beef carpaccio appetizer , and chicken and quinoa for entree. Everything was so good, service was even better. Special thanks to bartender Diane and manager Cory for going well above and beyond what they needed to do to take care of me. See you soon!
Best Italian food I've had in Vegas so far! Great service also. They are usually very busy, but it's well worth the wait.

Great food in a fun, upscale atmosphere, but you can come here dressed in anything.   Restaurant can be loud, but you can still talk, so that is good.  The food was excellent, although the service was slow for our table of 6.  The restaurant was busy, but our server seemed overloaded.  All the food we ordered was great, though and everything we saw that went by looked yummy.

As good as it gets.We're in town for the Drags and staying near this area. Our server Frank was friendly, informative and efficient. The food was delicious and presented well. The Salmon fresca was absolutely delicious. The chopped and wedge salad both had a perfect combination of ingredients and dressing. We plan on eating there again tomorrow. Highly recommended!!

I started visiting Brios about 7 years ago and fell in love with anything and everything they put in front of me.  I'm afraid the love affair isn't what it used to be.  Tonight was a deal breaker for me.  The steak salad used to be exceptional.  Unfortunately, the quality and recipe has changed over the years.  I think this evening may very well be my last order.  It's very sad and disappointing.   I don't know whether the restaurant is looking to cut corners and save money or whether a change in chefs over the years may be behind the changes, but overall it's not the same restaurant I grew to love.

We ordered through Door Dash this evening.  Delivery was late but we are talking about Valentines Day. . . so they deserve a bit of slack here.  When the salads arrived, we noticed right away that the lettuce looked more like what you'd expect to find in a buffet added as an afterthought to a taco. . .chopped up into very small pieces and very light in color.  Not much nutritional value.  Looked more like scraps than a nice mix of romaine and other types of lettuce thrown into the mix.  I'm not sure I understand why the pieces were so small unless they really are scraps. Sarcasm aside. . .The dressing recipe has changed considerably.  Unfortunately, that's what really added the WOW factor to the meal back in the day.  You honestly could not find better.  The small containers of dressing that they did send was about 2/3 full. . .barely enough for a third of the salad provided.  We wound up digging in the fridge for additional dressing just to finish the salad.  I'd like to say that there was enough to at least hint at the taste of dressing, but that would be a stretch.  Walnuts were nearly non existent as well.  I will say that the steak was cooked to perfection, but that's about it.  Two salads delivered came to just over 51 dollars with roughly 20 coming from taxes, fees, delivery and tip.  We would have been happier driving through Jack in The Box for one of their salads and saved a few bucks. 

Very sad. . .I'm in mourning.  :0(

I typically shy away from chain Italian especially in Vegas but Brio is always a favorite for a casual meal with great food. I love their beef carpaccio, the presentation is awesome, it's like boat of beef. I enjoyed the chicken and quinoa salad. The chicken was a little cold and overdone, but it totally satisfied my cravings. I love their bread too, for some reason it's so addicting. The service was nice, cook time on the food was a little long especially for a party of 6 (mostly salads), but I love the environment and the parking is easy.

Had a meal here yesterday afternoon about 3:30-ish with my daughter as we had $10-off coupons for lunch entrees.  I have to agree with another reviewer, the prices are truly out of line.  $14.95 for a lunch entree is ridiculous.  I had the blackened tilapia with the side of seasonal vegetables and, while the fish was just luscious, the veggies could have used some more time in the steamer, particularly the carrots.  When will the chefs learn that carrots take longer to cook than zucchini?

Since I was driving, I avoided alcohol and ordered a cranberry juice and soda with lime.  The first one came in a tall glass with the lime on the lip so I could squeeze it if I wishes.  When I asked for a refill, the bartender chose that time to take a break, so the other waitress (not ours) went behind the bar to prepare another one, which she put into a wine  glass and squeezed the lime herself.  Consistency, thy name is NOT Brio Tuscan Grille.  

My daughter had the Mediterranean Shrimp and said it was very good - I had a small bite of shrimp and it was quite spicy/bitey, but good.  She said that she has eaten at this location several times and has never had a bad meal -  I'll take her word for it. 

The food was good, I think I would rather have sat at a table than at a high-top in the bar, as we were witness to a couple of not-so-nice remarks from one waitress to the other.  I think they need a lesson in how to behave around customers.

Since I don't live in this area. I probably won't be back.  If I lived here, I probably wouldn't be back anyway.

AND I STILL WANT TO KNOW WHY EVERY DAMNED RESTAURANT WITH A BAR AREA TRIES TO BE A SPORTS BAR!!!!!!  Turn off the televisions and let the music play.

Me and my friend decided to try out brio at the quarter on Sunday very disappointed on the service we asked for one thing and the waiter brings something else after two hrs. The  food was nothing special, I will not recommend......

Came here for the first time Monday night for a birthday dinner of a friend. The service was fantastic don't remember his name but looked like a young Charlie Sheen.  Answered all questions on our meals and they were delicious.  Compliments to the chef and his team. Will tell people to come to your great restaurant.

Terrible service! Called in an order was told 15 min so I waited 10 before driving giving 25-30min time I understand it's busy dinner hour on a Friday. 
When I walk in the hostess is polite tell her I'm here to pick up etc.. she takes my cash money says I'll be right back going to grab the food... now this is where we start going wrong.. their are to go orders in the corner but I don't say anything, she comes back says it's almost done perfect!.... 10 min go by 2 people who ordered amazon come and go me on the other hand nothing, so I ask excuse me  any info on that order she asks me was it on amazon... I just gave you cash and you said my food was almost done how And why are we talking about amazon. She says the manager is taking care of it so it will be another 10 min! Nope I ask for my money back she has the nerve to ignore me go sit a table. I keep asking for my money without becoming angry because it's just food but ALL OF SUDDEN. My food appears no manager (even tho he came up looked at me and walked back) NEVER AGAIN BRIO SORRY SERVICE !!!

just ate lunch there. super good and highly recommended. the food was delicious, the service was wonderful and the environment was very appropriate. the filet is delicious. as well as the shrimp on eggplant, and I HATE shrimp. the desserts were good too. try to get in chris' section, he was probably one of the best servers I've ever had.
My wife and I had a late lunch today and really enjoyed it. The bread, soup and lasagna were incedible. The service was perfect.  Had a great time.

I love this place their choice selection for italian food and pasta is great!
