I came for happy hour, and I tell you their happy hour really makes you happy! they have a $2.95 happy hour menu for your basic appetizers, finger foods, and a regular sized burger. Although they don't have a happy hour menu for drinks. I think the over all quality of the food makes up for it all. The BRIO burger is awesome, and definitely a steal for the price! The buns are toasted, and the meat is so tender and juicy. Full of flavor! We also ordered a bunch of chorizo fonduta. I would highly reccomend that along with their margherita flatbread. You will definitely get full fast, and still have some left over!

Brio Is just one of THE BEST places to go for happy hour! You sure do get your fillings with only ordering all their Tuscan Tasters. I mean $3.95 appetizers and $5 martinis, sangria, and wine? How could you beat that? You'd really have to decide which would come first, a food coma or a drunken state.

My personal faves here are the Beef Carpacio, Ravioli Caprese, and the Eggplant. For the drink specials-it's all about the Peach Sangria, and the Mojito. Best believe they don't hold back on the alcohol either!

Also, their angus burger which is also on the happy hour menu is definitely a double BANG for your buck. I took my aunts here for happy hour and just got a kick out of it1 They loved the decor, and the ambiance, and most of all they loved that they were full off of yummy appetizers. 

Our server was also very helpful and friendly. She even went out of her way to separately send out our dishes so we weren't overwhelmed with food. Not like thats a bad thing or anything!

I will crave you again soon Brio.

As many of you already know, Tivoli Village has a ton of great restaurants. Brio Tuscan Grille is one of those restaurants. Their great food and other awesome features certainly set Brio apart from many restaurants.

Brio's food was 10/10! My friends and I ordered 9 different plates including 3 kids items. There was not a single dish that we weren't satisfied with. We ordered 2 appetizers and 4 different main dishes. I cannot remember the exact names, but we ordered a variety of items in different categories. Everything from salad and pasta to seafood and steak. All dishes tasted very fresh and well-put-together. Even their kids items were impressive. They had better selections for kids than most other restaurants. We also had some of their mix drinks, and they were good as well. Absolute 10/10!!

The service could not be any better either. The server was very kind and friendly. He knew the entire menu by heart and gave us great suggestions. The drinks that he recommended went well with the food too. I especially liked his friendliness to the kids.

The atmosphere was elegant, yet comfortable. The noise level was not high, but it was not uncomfortably quiet. 
 
Brio Tuscan Grille is one of my favorite restaurants in Summerlin now!

Brio is a great place for lunch not too busy, dinner on a weekend you may have to wait.They do alot right, I don't have anything negative to say. 

Free WiFi also..(hope they still have it) 

Brio bakes and cooks most things in house so everything is fresh, You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  I love the smoke chicken sandwich, and pasta's at Brio.
Very comfortable setting and reasonable prices.

Came here for lunch today and couldn't be more pleased. Great service, great decor, great food and an exceptional Bellini. 

The soup of the day was tomato bisque and it was the 2nd best tomato bisque I've ever had, just delicious. I had the lunch special, Mezza Chicken with mashed potatoes and roasted vegi's and it was good, 4 stars.
The 5th star was for the amazing peach Bellini and tomato bisque. The next time I am in Vegas, I will definitely be back!

Best Italian food I have experienced in Arizona and I was surprised because it's a chain. My guy and I were ooing and ahhing throughout the meal. I had the Lobster and Shrimp Ravioli with Crab insalata and it was a perfect portion, perfect flavoring and al dente! AMAZING. The only thing this place needs is Spumoni (minus the candied fruit)!!! Our server didn't even know what it was! What? i know!

We go to this Brio all the time because it's more convenient for our family get together. Food is always good but the service can be improved on. They seem to get our orders wrong and do watch out for the bill and double check. There has been several occasions that we got charged for more things than we should. But the kids love the food and we don't have a choice when they choose this place. Maybe the Summerlin location has given us a better experience in the past...

Perfection!  Bartender Ken, General Manager Joe and the entire staff provided us with an incredible experience. Friendly, well trained and very efficient. Then comes the food-- we had the  shrimp lobster ravioli and the Mediterranean Shrimp. Both were exquisite!  We will be back, maybe tomorrow!

Although, I like Olive Garden...Brio is definitely a step above

I got the Pasta Brio to go & it was so delicious! The dish had roasted red pepper sauce over rigatoni with grilled chicken & mushrooms. It was very flavorful & not heavy  pasta dish.

I also got the chocolate cake & it was also a winner! It was rich with flavor yet, it was still light.

I've only been here once, but it's on my list to visit again next time I'm in Vegas. 

It has been quite a while since my visit, I wasn't even going to review, but there is a dish that is still on my mind, even today, so I feel it's worth a shout out. The best thing we ate here was the roasted grapes. My folks kind of looked at me cross-eyed when I ordered it, but it is easily one of the best dishes I have ever had. My parents still talk about it. This dish was perfectly executed. The texture and flavor of these sweet little gems was so delightful, I forgot where I was and went savage with my fingers. I just could not get enough. 

All of our food was very very good. I'd give 5 stars, but our service was lackluster. Not sure if someone called out or our server was just not good, but we seldom saw him very and when he did stop by, he wasn't very helpful. 

Despite that, Brio is a beautiful restaurant with great food that will be a pleasure to visit again.

I've been to the Happy Hour twice in one week!  This is a really great HH, but let me warn you, it's a girly HH.  Because as my husband said, "There's nothing but martinis and mojitos on this damn drink list!"  It's true, 95% of the menu is sugary and girly concoctions, but sometimes I like me a good lemon drop!

Opinions on the drinks:
The drinks are nicely made and tasty and they're all only $5.  My favorite is one of the special ones they have on Wednesdays that is like a lemon drop with basil.  The sangria rosa is better than the white peach sangria.  The strawberry mojito tastes like fresh strawberries.  The red wine is a good, dry one.

Opinions on the food:
This is the money maker right here.  During HH, they have a special food list where everything is $3.95.  My husband and I ordered a hamburger to share.  Wowza, when it came out, it was like the size of a Carl's Jr. burger and it came with homemade potato chips.  What, what, what?  This whole thing is only $4?  And it was a delicious hamburger with melted provolone cheese and a zingy little secret sauce.  The gentleman next to us ordered the spicy crispy shrimp and a sausage flatbread, both of which were also generously sized for the $4 pricetag.  When I went with my friend, we ordered the ravioli caprese.  Very tasty, but it only comes with 3 ravioli.  Come on...you give out a huge burger and chips, but only 3 ravioli?  I was a little disappointed in that.  We also ordered the shrimp and eggplant which has a really nice smoky sauce to it.

It does get crowded during the HH, and sometimes you have to wait a while to get the bartender's attention, but that is what you have to expect when it's a great HH.  My advice: get there around 3:30 so you can find a seat and put an order in before the rush!

There are many things that come to my mind when I think of Brio.  Interesting food, great quality, elegant atmosphere and friendly service.  But one thing has stood out recently since I have gone there and that is, $2.95 appetizers in the bar until 6pm.  When you think something is $2.95, you probably think it is either a small portion, not good or both of these things.  Well it is neither of these things.  The appetizers are generous portions and great tasting with several selections to choose from.  I want to just make it easy and say to the waiter, I'll have one of each please.  I love a good cheeseburger and the Brio Bistecca Burger is definitely my favorite right now.  It comes on a tasty bun with mozzarella cheese and is served with well done potato chips...yum!  You don't even get messy eating it because they cut it into quarters for you.  The bruschetta is also easy to eat because you can just pick it up and bite it.  They have two different kinds on the happy hour menu.  Roasted Red Pepper & Fresh Mozzarella Bruschetta with fresh basil and a balsamic drizzle and Sliced Steak Brushetta with Gorgonzola Dolce, arugula, fennel, charred tomato, shaved Parmigiano-Reggiano and Tuscan Italian dressing.  There is also a Margherita Flatbread that is prepared with Fresh Mozzarella, vine-ripened tomatoes and fresh basil cooked in an authentic Italian wood-burning oven.  I don't eat calamari but my friends ordered the Calamari Fritto Misto which was fried to a crisp golden brown with peperoncini and they liked it.  This is probably just either half or less than half of what they offer for $2.95.  I still haven't tried either shrimp appetizers or the eggplant appetizer.  The Beef Carpaccio served with field greens, capers, mustard aioli and fresh Parmesan cheese looks excellent as well.  Tuscan culinary creations are perfected at Brio.  If you decide to go, please save me a seat in the bar.  As you can imagine, they go rather quickly.  Buon Appetito!

Let me start by saying that I like the Brio. It's really a nice venue and they have great outdoor patio seating. Also, their entrées are a cut above for an upscale fast casual restaurant, and their prices are reasonable. The entrées on my previous visits have been consistently good. Not so much on my latest visit. I ordered the Ham & Biscuit Benedict, $10.50 off the Brunch Menu. It consists of two poached cage free eggs, Cherrywood smoked ham, housemade biscuit and hollandaise, served with brunch potatoes. First, I was disappointed in the fact that my breakfast was not hot and was served cold. Bottom line, hot food should be served hot. The Cherrywood smoked ham had no flavor due to it being over cooked, as a result it was tough and chewy. Likewise, the house made biscuit was hard as a rock. On my previous visit their brunch potatoes were a big hit with everyone. This time they were over seasoned and very salty. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the hollandaise was good. Two other people in our party had the same entrée and made same or similar comments. Service was great. Our server was friendly and attentive. In closing, I recommend the Brio. However, I do not recommend this entrée.

Simply put, I have never had a bad experience coming here. I've come here for happy hour, for dinner, for lunch, and I've even been to their Sunday brunch.

One Word: Amazing

My parents actually attended the soft opening and they told me that I HAD to come to Brio. Best advice my parents may have ever given me. I've come here for my last 2 birthday and that's a pretty high honor in my family. 

The best part of Brio is that there is really something for everyone and for every food mood. When I'm feeling pasta I order the Pasta Alla Vodka or the Mushroom Ravioli. When I want to eat healthy I order one of their amazing salads (hint: their balsamic is delicious!!!). When I want meat i get their Mezza Chicken "under a brick"

One of the best things about Brio is their desserts. They offer some large "full size" desserts and they offer little dessert shots. There are some desserts that they always have, but they also add new ones from time to time. I appreciate the variety the offer.

Everyone I've taken here has loved it and I will swear by this restaurant

I have only been here for happy hour but tonight we decided to sit down for dinner and I'm glad we did.  We had some of the most amazing food.  I highly recommend the gluten free chicken pesto.  We had amazing service with Kirsten so if you get a chance ask for her.
Excellent food! Went on Mother's Day and the good and service was excellent! They went above and beyond and we enjoyed our experience. We will be back! Some of the best food in San Tan Village.
I've been going to brio for quite some time, and i really like this place. Beautiful patio, good service, and great food would describe it all. My friends and i are regulars already!

We decided to go there for lunch as my wife had a work outing there and enjoyed the food.  The restaurant was less than a quarter full and the waitress was friendly.  The food was decent (calimari, lobster bisque and salads) and the portion sizes were fine.  I was just puzzled why it would take over 30 minutes to receive our salad orders and soup.  Since the restaurant was empty I did not expect to wait that long for a rather simple order.  We then had to wait over 15 minutes to pay.  My final impression of my experience was having 3 hostesses (or waitresses) hanging out by the front door gossiping and ignoring me.

I've been to brio at town square and selected items are good.  Others not so much.   I was totally turned off by just coffee and dessert here.  Coffee want memorable and cheesecake was old and disgusting.    Our server was coughing up a lung and should have been sent home 

I am giving it two stars just because my experience at the other location was ok.  Otherwise it would not even get two!

Came here for the lunch happy hour and I have to say that Brio maybe possibly have the best happy hour I've ever had! The food portions are very large, the prices are great, and the service was phenomenal! Our waitress (I believe her name was Mary, short reddish brown ponytail) was so sweet, she constantly had a smile on her face and was so attentive even though she was very busy. So excited to have discovered this happy hour and my boyfriend and I are looking forward to coming back as soon as possible! Thanks Brio

Brio is a typical chain restaurant.  Everything is pretty consistent but nothing stands out.  I had lobster bisque which was way too salty and carpaccio which was fine.  Lunch service was quick in and out.

Great try.... Missed the mark (but worth a second look)

My wife and I tried Brio on the recommendation of a friend.  When we arrived we were greeted by an overly perky hostess who directed us to our table.  The place is decorated like a Coppola film, red velvet sashes and all.  

Earlier, we had a heavy lunch so my wife and I opted to just share a couple of appetizers.  While reviewing their menu I noticed they had one of my favorites, carpaccio.  If you are not familiar with Carpaccio, it's super thin shaved beef loin seved with mustard aioli and some sort of cracker or toast points.  (If you want EXCELLENT carpaccio, go get it at Fleming's - it's the BEST carpaccio)  So, I ordered the Carpaccio and my wife ordered the "Chef's Seasonal Bruschetta" which is described a "Housemade, using the finest and freshest ingredients".  

After we ordered I had to remind the waitress that we had ordered drinks from her earlier and that we would still like to have them.  Aside from having to wait 10 minutes for our drinks, they were very good.  My wife had a pomegranate martini and i had a slightly dirty gin martini.  

Our food arrived shortly after our drinks.   As the wait staff  presented our food, i had to insist they bring us silverware and couple napkins.  

The first thing that i noticed was the portions were huge!  The next thing i noticed was that the Bruschetta my wife ordered was sizzling - as in it just came out of the oven.  The bruschetta was actually 7 little sausage pizzas.  They were very tasty and I did enjoy them, but it was not bruschetta made with "the freshest" ingredients.  

The carpaccio was disappointing.  The meat that was used was not as good as it could have been, it was overly salted and the aioli was overpowering.  Additionally the over-sized portion came with 3 large crackers, not nearly enough (had i wanted to eat the entire portion).

I was underwhelmed with my first visit.  I will have to return as my friends tell us that we just "ordered wrong" and need to go back...  I guess will as i will try anything twice.
Great service and food. Highly recommended and perfect casual lunch and dinner place for everyone.

When I walked in I felt like I was in a restaurant in the Venetian or Balaggio hotel. Realy nice and the host staff and waiters gave the best service you cuould possibly get. I ordered the homemade tortellini stuffed with a ricotta mixture covered in a pink vodka sauce. The dish was right on, 5 stars for this dish alone. I only wish there were a few more tortellini cause i could have eaten them till i exploded. Anyway dad got the pork chops topped with gorgonzola . He loved them. My mom and girlfriend got the steak topped with hollidaise. They both liked that but the steaks were over done a bit. They had a huge party they served before us and think our steaks were forgotten about and were a little over cooked. We told the waitress and they took both dishes off the bill and gave us free dessert. We got the dessert sampler and molten lava cake. Freakin unreal desserts. I will be back I would have given them 3 stars cause of the over cooked steaks but they made up for that in a big way and I will be back.

Dined at Brio last night with my husband to celebrate our anniversary. When we checked in with the hosts, they asked us if we were celebrating anything and we informed them of our anniversary and they congratulated us and made us feel like we were royalty. They sat us in a nice big booth, so big we could have had other diners join us! I ate the Gorgonzola medallions and let me tell you, they were AMAZING! The meat was so tender and tasty my mouth is watering just talking about it. My husband ordered the Lobster and shrimp fettuccine and he loved it, he cleaned the plate off. the manager kiya (im sorry if i chopped that up) came up to our table while we were eating our entrees and checked on us and made sure everything was on point and she also congratulated us for our special occasion. Our waiter Pedro was one of the best servers ive ever had! He was attentive to us the moment we sat down, friendly, and made sure we had a great experience. The atmosphere at brio is lovely and comfortable. Im glad we decided to go to brio to celebrate, we definitely plan on going back very soon. Thank you Brio!!

LOVE this place!!! The Salmon salad is superb. They have gluten free menu, great wine, great variety of foods that are all delicious! Desserts are worth saving room for!

They also have a frequent buyer app which is awesome! $10 off after first visit & discounts after every few meals.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
Good food, good service, nice decor. A little on the pricey side but overall a very nice place for dinner.

I love this place. I've eaten here a few times now and there is not one thing that has not been above standard. When ever we are not sure where to go out to dinner this is our go to place. just love it!

I've always loved this place, and tonight my love grew even stronger. Although it's rather loud inside (and hot outside!) I was able to have a great business meeting where I could hear my partners well. Had the lobster with crab and pasta, mmmmmmm!! Will be coming back for sure!

We have come to Brio's on several occasions and each time we've had a very pleasant experience. The food is consistent and good. I guess we have been lucky with our service because it's always been great. Or maybe it's just Jermaine...

I will say you will be hard pressed to find something else worthwhile at San Tan Village. I guess there are those who settle for Panera and Chipotle.

All in all this a great spot and we will be back
Personally my experience was awesome,  the food is really good,  they doesn't have a lot of wines for be a place with an Italian name and serves pasta,  the wine's menu is not so extended.

This place is amazing. My husband and I came here after our wedding ceremony with our group of 29 people. There were a couple more people than we had anticipated. I felt awful because we had to ask for more table space for an already large party. But the staff was on it. They were so understanding, and when we apologized, told us not to because it was our special day and we shouldn't be sorry for anything. They were so accommodating and gracious. And the food was amazing. The lobster bisque was phenomenal. My best friends husband hates seafood, and even he loved it. I also have a friend who's vegan; they  crafted a dish just for her. My sister-in-law has a shellfish allergy, and they accommodated that without hesitation as well. By far some of the best service I've ever had at a restaurant, and the food was beyond worth every penny. So delicious!

We have been going to Brio in Tivoli Village since it opened. It's the place we bring the many guests that come to visit us in Las Vegas and they always tell us we made a great selection in choosing Brio. We recently went to Brio with friends from Florida. From the moment we were seated we were impressed with the attentiveness of our server Bre, the presentation and flavor of the food.  Our guests were raving about the service we received and the beautiful atmosphere . Having spent several years in Italy during my military career, I know excellent Italian food when I taste it and Brio has it all together. A nice  touch was added by Brio Manager Prado who stopped by to ask if we were satisfied with our service and food. With so many restaurants in the surrounding area to choose from, there is little wonder why we choose Brio when we are looking for an exceptional night out

Loved this place! Had a nice lunch with my aunt and the food was delish. I had the pasta pesto which was to die for and the portion was just right. My aunt had the Caesar salad and margarita pizza which I tried and was yummy. Service was good and seating was roomy.

This was my third time at Brio in Scottsdale. The quality of the food has taken a nose dive. 
We were a party of 5. My pasta dish was served warm - not hot. The side kale salad was mediocre - at best, One of my friends ordered a pasta dish with chicken. It was served without the chicken (Hello). My guess is that the chef has never had real Italian food. They seated us a the only table in the (fairly empty) restaurant on which the sun continued to shine. So my friend had to keep shifting her chair around the table to avoid being blinded by the glare. Sadly, I was the one who recommended Brio, as it was my birthday. I must say that the dessert was delicious. The waiter was attentive, but he should have moved us to another table. Disappointed BIG TIME.

Sorry....but this place was an utter failure.

I know all places have bad nights but there were too many issues from different parts of the house to ignore.

First..and foremost..the waiter. Careless..and almost like he didn't give a rats ass we were there cause he deserved a tip anyways.

My wife asked for the a pasta dish and NO mushrooms...of course it came out with mushrooms. Mother in law ordered the steak with veggies and mashed potaotes. Whoever was on the line was horrible. Veggies and mashed potatoes were ice cold and never should have left the kitchen. Another order of the fish was a letdown with over cooked and dried out fish.

Come on..the line failed, the person on the gill failed, and the server was a joke. Another example of over trendy and overhyped Summerlin crap.
We love this place....great pasta dishes and we love the ambiance!

Latest visit was pretty awful.

Came here for lunch one afternoon with a coworker and there was a huge line of people waiting to be seated. Luckily we had reservations and so we were taken to our table. We each ordered an entree, since I'm part of the restaurant's loyalty rewards program I get discounts and promotions in my inbox regularly, I was informed by the staff that I couldn't use my promotion due to some weird random company policy. 

The prices have increased significantly in the last 6 months, AND the food quality has definitely gone downhill. The chicken dish I got was rather stiff and over cooked. Service seemed very absent, and not very friendly. 

Really really disappointing, and I will very likely cancel my account and never set foot here again.
My family and I love brios food, but the service is awful every single time. Making the restaurant unbearable to visit even though it is one of our favorites
The pasta brio is absolutely delicious. Always consistent regardless of the location.

If you're looking for a decent Italian place, Brio is one to check out! Located just South of the Strip, Town Square is a great place to relax, hang out, and shop. The ambiance of the restaurant is relaxed and quiet and put together very well. Their outside eating area is huge and borders the restaurant along a couple of walkways for pedestrians. It's a really nice place to relax and enjoy your meal.

I've had quite a few dishes here. The lasagna is great as is the lobster bisque. I've never had a problem with quality or taste here. They also have a great wine selection to pair with your meal.

They're service has always been on par and friendly. This is a great place to have business meetings or to take business persons you want to have an intimate and business-friendly meal with.

The restaurant can get quite busy during the holidays so make sure you have a reservation in place before you head here.

The atmosphere is good. The music is a bit loud for conversation. The pasta with Vodka sauce was creamy without losing the marinara flavors. The chefs special of Braised Beef Pappardella was excellent. The long ribbons of Rosemary infused pasta paired well with the braised beef. The beef fell apart with each bite. Nice offering from the kitchen.

Three of us just went to Brio this last Sunday to take my mother-in-law out for her birthday. It was my suggestion to go there because I have enjoyed it in the past. I ordered the chicken marsala because that is a standard I like to order when I go to an Italian restaurant. How disappointing! I received what looked like a prepackaged grilled chicken breast with a small amount of marsala sauce on it and beside it. The chicken was so highly seasoned with herbs and tasted like oregano that it was so out of place in this meal. If they aren't going to make it from scratch they should at least cook a plain chicken breast in a garlic butter sauce not oregano! I never expected this to happen at an Italian restaurant like Brio. I spoke to the manager and made it clear that I wasn't trying to complain but just to ask questions about how they normally prepare this. I thought for sure they had run out of their usual chicken and substituted this instead. He said that's how they make it. I saw another review from 2013 which said something very similar to my post. Crocker Park has other options for dinner so I'll probably go elsewhere in the future or at least not make it my suggestion to choose Brio. They took the marsala off my bill which I didn't ask for but which was appreciated. The manager also said I could have asked for the chicken to be prepared plain. I didn't think I had to tell them how to prepare chicken marsala it is such a standard Italian dinner item. Olive Garden has a very good chicken marsala and I thought I was going to get something similar here.

Would have liked to try the food here but we wait at least 20 mins for someone to come & take our orders (& this was just drinks) the people that got seated after us were already getting bread & appetizers. & still no one approached our table, even though my aunt made eye contact with some of the waiters who still probably couldn't get the hint that we we're obviously waiting for someone to take our order. Of course we just left & just went for Yard House. Disappointing for a nice restaurant.

Amazing: optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people work here and make excellent suggestions on food. I always get the best service and food here. Our friend complemented the Moscow mule made by Sara: very sweet and talented bar tender. The manager is pleasant as can be and booths are ambient and comfy. Thanks Brio and keep doing amazing work on pleasing our taste buds

Brio has great service and very friendly staff. The food quality is a bit inconsistent depending on what day you visit. It's a great family place and the portions are large so expect to have leftovers.

Bartenders John and Chris were awesome! Super professional staff that makes you feel so welcome. If you have any questions these are the guys to ask! The restaurant was very accomodating to my Celiac (gluten intolerance) with yummy GF pasta. 10/10 will come back!

I'm glad there are so many great reviews here.  Too bad mine won't be one of them.  Went there for brunch and I ordered the Ham & Biscuit Benedict.  The only thing warm on the plate was the hollandaise sauce and even then it was barely warm.  I would have liked to have told the server that everything was cold but, sadly, she didn't bother to check back to see how everything was.  I don't know when the potatoes or asparagus were prepared but I'm not even certain that they were made the same day.  Tasted like leftovers that I could pull out of my own refrigerator.  Maybe it's that particular dish that they don't prepare very well but I did not enjoy my meal or the service.  Atmosphere is nice though.

Tried the Bruschetta Quattro...SO GOOD. I only got the Brio Chopped Salad because I was full, however my husband got the Gorgonzola Crusted Bistecca - PERFECTION. So moist, succulent and ;....I'm drooling. Best ever. My BIL ordered what I wanted originally, Sweet Potato & Chicken Risotto. AH-MAZING! So flavorful and innovative. The BIL's gf (haha I love acronyms) needed gluten free dishes only and the server was most accommodating. Actually, the service was the best I've had in years. Overall the ambiance is in a beautiful setting in a 'strip mall' look of Town Center, but I am now craving for the bistecca and live no where near a Brio :( Will definitely go again!

I've ordered takeout from here twice now and both times have been full of noms. However, it's a little pricey for my expectations--I don't think they are probably using any higher quality ingredients than Macaroni Grill, Olive Garden, or Maggiano's, but it seems to be quite a bit more expensive.

Yesterday I had a lunch combo... a half salad and a small portion of risotto. The risotto was really great with a lot of veggies (squash, asparagus, tomatoes) and pine nuts. What's not to love about that? The side caesar was good too, and the combination of the two filled me up without being too heavy of a lunch (even though it was a generous portion of creamy risotto!). 

I would love to go back and not have it for takeout--I'd like to experience the food fresh out of the kitchen instead out of plastic to-go boxes. However, it is a good option for takeout in Town Square!

Tasty brunch / lunch of shrimp & grits with a perfectly poached egg. Our waiter Kelvin was very nice. He did great at keeping drinks full & was present as often as possible without being obnoxious. Overall great visit.

Great cocktail menus and a go-to place for my friends and I when we visit Las Vegas.  Happy hour is a great deal, but you can only enjoy the deals in the bar. 

They have a new option on their menu where you can order 2, 3, or 4 small dishes of appetizers or side dishes for a decent prize.  Although listed as a small dish, the size and portion is more than enough for a group of 3.  

Best thing I've had here and a must for anyone to order is the spicy shrimp with the crusted eggplant.  So delicious and flavorful!  One bite, you'll want to eat the whole dish.  Not too spicy but definitely full of mouth-drooling flavor.  

Their brussel sprouts and caprese salad is also delicious as well.  Something I'd definitely order again. 

From their cocktails, I got the Cucumber Basil Gimlet with the Hendricks Gin.  Very refreshing and great palate cleanser as well.  Their sangrias are also decent as well.  

Service is great and no complaints there.

I absolutely love this place. Their happy hour is definitely one of my top picks in Las Vegas. The quality and portion of the items on the HH menu are very well worth your money considering they start from $5. You must try the beef carpaccio, period. You definitely will not be disappointed and you'll probably order more than one. Another favorite is the Bruschetta Trio, very flavorful and savory!
Aside from the food, the inside and outside is really comfortable and sleek so it makes it easier to stay there for a good amount of time.

This place has a nice ambience and has a classy feel to it. We started our meal with a Calamari Fritto Misto which was delicious fried Calamari! They're bread was pretty special, one was made like a "pizza" shaped fried bread with spices on it.  We ordered a Lobster Bisque that was very tasty as well. My girlfriend ordered the Campanelle Carbonara which had grilled chicken, bacon, Parmesan cheese, spinach and Alfredo, it was done very well. I ordered the Pasta Mediterranean which had grilled chicken, mushrooms, feta cheese, spinach and tomatoes in it. So good! Definitely recommend this place!

Let me say I come to Brio especially because of their super delicious tomato bisque I can't get enough of! My only wish is that they served it more often during the week and on weekends, and not only on Tuesdays, a weekday when I rarely go because it's about 40 minutes from where I live and weekdays are always super busy. I also love their beef carpaccio, it's amazing and a must-have. It's all I ever eat (plus the soup) when we go there. Service may be slower sometimes but we keep entertained and fed with their great bread. Brio is one of my faves but please make the tomato bisque available more often!

Definitely one of the best happy hours around. Just be there early to get a seat and if you're at the bar you may be sat a bit close to another customer. The food here is good and the cocktails are well made. My main criticism is the service. It really is one of the worst of places I've been to for slow service. The last 2 times I went, I waited over 40 minutes for my class of wine and the other time it took so long to get the menu that we nearly walked out. They really need to step up their game with the service here, otherwise this place would be fantastic.

I really only want to give 3.5 stars.  Went last night for happy hour.  There were 9 of us.  The food was awesome!  Really loved the black pepper shrimp and the burger!!  The busser was attentive as well!!  Unfortunately the waiter seemed to not be very interested in taking care of us.  I specifically told him when there were only 3 of us there that I wanted what I ordered to be on a separate check that would be brought to me.  At the end of the evening I asked for my bill only to be told that it was all on one.  He then stated he hadn't heard me.  Did say that he would handle it but then STILL brought a single check.  Had to ask for bread three separate times which was finally brought by the bus boy.  We will be back ONLY because the food was really hood but will hopefully get a different waiter!!

We came here to celebrate my "last fling before the ring!"  Not only was the food fanastic, but without us even requesting, they put us in a private area away from the rest of the diners and gave us a wonderful server, Danny, who took care of everything we could possibly need.  It was a great way to spend my bachelorette weekend with all my of closest friends!

I normally have a great experience when I come here, not this time.   The food was not up to it's normal standards and we had to send a dish back because it was cold.  They changed the noodles to a sticky so called angel hair..  If it ain't broken don't fix it.  Service was slow and he forgot to bring a salad to one of our guests.   I miss the old Brio and will give it one more chance hoping it was just a off night for the staff.

Had a wonderful experience with my friend. Roy was our server. Honestly, I wish I could give him 100 stars. This guy is awesome, friendly, and chill. Got he wedge salad; and lobster bisque. IF YOU HAVE TO CHOOSE BETWEEN THIS RESTAURANT and another one (Tommy Bahamas) CHOOSE BRIO.!! Lol you won't be disappointed. We were sat out on the patio. Beautiful weather. Busy night. Good vibes. Servers time management was on point. TRY THE PEACH BELLINI!! Yass

Perfect place for date night or after a long week at work or a get together with some of your friends. Ambiance is casual but can get loud when it gets crowded. I made reservations online and got seated right away when we got there. I noticed some people who were waiting to be seated had to wait a little longer than those with reservations. It pays off to plan ahead!

Me & my boyfriend started off sharing a the chopped salad, which was tasty but would have liked a little more.

For my entree I got the shrimp Mediterranean, very nice presentation. It was grilled shrimp over a bed of orzo and assorted veggies, all super tasty and the portion was just right for me. 

For dessert we shared a snicker doodle peach cobbler that was topped with vanilla ice cream. It was sweet & fruity, nothing short of satisfaction.

I want to come back, perhaps for happy hour or try something different on their huuge varietal menu.

How can I not give this restaurant five stars after trying to dine at their neighbor, Kona Grill and being ignored the whole time? We were seated promptly and our server acknowledged us right away. He got our daughter a high chair and even asked if she wanted juice. Service was excellent! The calamari, peach sangria and the lobster ravioli was excellent. It was a perfect dining experience and definitely what we needed. Thank you, Brio!

Every time I visit Vegas, it is always a struggle for me to find a good restaurant to hang out with friends or family, be as loud as I can be, have a trendy atmosphere, reasonably priced, not on the strip, and the food is packed with flavor. 

I'm from Las Vegas - and there isn't a single time where I think I NEED to go to a restaurant.  Since leaving this place, I have been to restaurants that I never knew could exist - restaurants where you can hang out in a trendy restaurant, eat phenomenal food and not spend more than $30/person? What?!

I don't know what it is about Vegas. Maybe it's the fact that Vegas values the bright lights, brand names, glitz and glamour before anything else. 

Anyway, a group of us (10 + 1 baby) needed a restaurant that can hold us, have great food, reasonably priced, trendy, and away from the strip.  My friends even though they've lived here all their lives can't even give me any suggestions (I'm flabbergasted). Where I live (Phoenix), I can give you my top 10 and then some. So I decided to on Brio and I've eaten at this restaurant before in Phoenix and was not impressed. Restaurant reminds me that of a Cheesecake factory, chain restaurant.  

They did seat us right away, which was nice. The bread came out and the group was having a fun time.  We are loud as ever and the noise level of the restaurant was loud so we didn't feel like we were bothering anyone with our obnoxious rants an laughs so that was good.  I ordered the gluten free grilled salmon with lemon and caper sauce. The flavor was ok. Nothing to rave about.

I wish I had better options to fit what I was looking for in my dining experience. At the end of the night, it wasn't the flavor of the food that made the night a "good" night.  It was the fact that a group of 11 was able to get together, talk and laugh as loud as we want, not cringe at the bill, and still be happy and full.

Amazing food, excellent wait service, and accommodating staff: we had to change tables because of the boisterous atmosphere (my dad couldn't hear due to hearing aid issues), and they were amazingly sweet about it. The pasta aka vodka was creamy yet had a mild red pepper kick--the pasta itself was done perfectly. We also got the trio dessert plate--to die for.

I have sent the restaurant a private message as well, shall see if we hear back.  Went for dinner here with a party of 9 a few weeks ago. The place was packed, while we were seated quite promptly for our reservation, everything from that point on was far from prompt or good. Sat down at 7, finally were able to place our food order at about 7:40, by 8:30 still didn't have our food. Everyones luke warm food finally came, except for my husbands, he waited another 7-8 minutes for his, lucky him, he had the only hot dish. It was like everyone else' meal sat under the heat lamp, like a gooey mess of pasta and we even had a rare lamb chop in the mix :-( Manager came over to apologize and say that he was sorry and would take care of us. Had a few creme brulee's comped and the lamb chops. Will not be dining back here again, manager just seemed to be putting out fires and we were one of them. Our waitress tried her best and was apologetic. Very unimpressive, pricey meal for what we got.

This is a great place to come in the Spring and Fall when you can sit outside on the patio with great weather.  During the Winter time, we like to come here and hang out in the bar area and have a glass of Wine or three.  We normally don't eat dinner here, but enjoy meeting friends and colleagues for lunch.

The last time we were here, I had the Bistecca Insalata (Wedge of Lettuce, Gorgonzola, Bacon, Roma Tomatoes & Creamy Parmesan Dressing, $5.25).....I love Gorgonzola Cheese and find it difficult to resist a Salad with it.

Overall, it's one of our favorite places for lunch.....looking forward to Spring and the outdoor dining!

Return Factor - 91%

Service was great from the moment we walked in until the moment we left! 

We were seated outside, our drink orders were taken promptly and the bread basket was brought to our table soon after. We started off with Caesar salads, then I ordered grilled lamb chops with mashed potatoes and my gf ordered angel hair pasta with grilled salmon..... everything taste great!! Cooked to perfection. Our drinks kept on getting refilled, they were never empty and dish pick up was quick.... they were "on it". For dessert they brought out a variety of dessert samples to our table for us to decide on . We ordered tiramisu and berry cheesecake... they were very good.

How to have a 5-Star experience at this 4-star chain restaurant:

Bruschetta Quattro 5 star
Spicy Shrimp Eggplant 5 star
Steak Salad 4 star

Our dinner here was part of a Vegas deal that included dinner & a helicopter ride at night above the Vegas strip. So the shuttle dropped us off here before the flight informing us we had about an hour and a half before pick up. We were seated and then given a ticket receipt to show our server and then in turn order from their prix fixe menu. Our server some young guy was obviously annoyed by our dinner package and kept making it clear that gratuity was not included the deal. For drinks I ordered a bellini and for dinner we had a caesar salad & a wedge salad , along with their lasagna & a pasta dish I can't remember. The white sauce with the lasagna was a bit strange since I'm used to red sauces but it was good, everything was good. The restaurant seemed like a fancier version of olive garden but I enjoyed Brio's much more. The server was the only thing that made this visit unpleasant, his presence was scarce and I knew dinner included a dessert which he claimed to forget but seemed like he just wanted us out. Would like to return and experience a better dining experience.

This review was meant for another Italian restaurant. Until I can update one for Brio or delete this, I apologize for the mistake. I am human after all. I would have caught this sooner but we had a family tragedy the following day and I have been unable to be online until now. 

I sincerely apologize to the owners and management of Brio Tuscan Grille for my mistake. I don't have time to do a full review right now but we have eaten at your establishment, your food is delicious and as I said I will give a more detailed review in the near future. Please accept my apology. Thank you. 

As for the woman who sent me a very nasty message, perhaps you should think before you write to people. The words you spoke were very mean spirited and uncalled for.

I'm going to have to say the food is absolutely delicious!  Everything that was ordered satisfied my taste buds. Atmosphere outside is quite enjoyable.

On the service side, we thought it was strange and a bit rude that one of the waiters came through the gate outside. Which was right next to our table with a sign that read "this is not an exit" and moved a chair to get in and did not say, "excuse me." I guess it was an entrance? Lol

Also our waitress could have been less splashy on the water refills as she dripped all over the floor and splashed some on my friend and the table. 

Other than those little things it was great. Nothing that would stop me from eating here again. Do recommend!

We celebrate most birthdays at Brios. The food is good,  the waiters are friendly and the environment is nice.
I recommend it!!

After a terrible dinning experience somewhere else last night Mandi at the bar cheered us all up. We walked into reverse happy hour and a bright and helpful smile from Mandi. Thank you for turning our frowns upside down. A consistently great place to eat as well.

Brio was the 1st leg of our progressive dinner last night (8-14-2013)  It was my dining companions birthday celebration and he had never been before.  I chose Brio for appetizers.  We were greeted promptly and seated.  I had stopped by the restaurant earlier in the day to drop off a birthday card and flowers for our table.  At that time I explained that we were only having app's there and moving on to another restaurant for our main course and a 3rd for dessert. All was well when we were seated, card and orchid in place (whew).  I ordered the Carpaccio and the Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant for appetizers.  Wonderful was the food and service.  Until the server offered a dessert for the birthday boy.  Just an oversight, but all was well.  Thank you to Brio for making it a great start to our evening!!!

Lobster bisque should be renamed to tomato bisque. There was no lobster flavor or pieces. Coming from New England I've had the best and this was not. Takes a long time for your food to come out. My daughter had a simple cooked salad and the lettuce was not fresh. Staff were ok. Not friendly enough but ok. Didn't fully hate it but won't return.

Brio has been a reliable lunch spot whenever I have guests in town. It never failed us! 
Ambiance - Check
Service - Check
Food - Check
Location - Check
They have it all~~

Happy Hour with the girls.  Arrived Brio early and the place is empty.   The snowbirds are mostly gone and we have the place to ourselves.  Greeted and seated quickly.  Waited for our 4th person who arrived shortly.  We decided on 3 orders of Pepper shrimp, carpaccio, and potatoes.  The service was slower than usual but not sure why.  The food arrived all at once.  Nice presentation and good eats.  The place got more crowded as the hour got later.  We enjoyed a nice eve out.  Happy hour prices are great and you get a lot of food.

One of my favorite Italian restaurants in town. I have been here for lunch, dinner, and happy hour. 

My favorite drinks are the Tuscan sangria and the strawberry basil smash. 

Both the Caesar and bistecca salads are good. Very fresh. 

Favorite pasta dishes are the lasagna, carbonara, and salmon angel hair. 

The chicken limone and lobster bisque are also very good. 

For happy hour the spicy shrimp with eggplant and the fried ravioli are my faves. 

I never have room for dessert here so no details there. 

Great place to eat outside on the patio or by the fire pits before or after shopping at Town Square.

Went for brunch and sat at outside patio. It was a great mother daughter  day for shopping and brunch. The brunch menu was nice I had the Tuscan bowl without the  sausage  but instead  avacodo which was delicious.  The quinoa was cooked well with the kale, mushroom  and eggs made it a velvety delight. My daughter ordered the french toast which she said was fluffy and sweet. Nice meal the server was scarce at times but the overall experience was great.
Great food when you're craving italian. Their house dressing is also delicious.

Ok. First time at Brio. Excellent first impression by our server Amit. He was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and what suggested items to orders. Salmon was fantastic. Excellent presentation. My boyfriends cod was slightly dry, but we decided not to say anything.

It was two birthdays and we were surprised with two desserts. Creme brulee and caramel cheesecake. Delicious.

Overall, everything was wonderful and such a pleasant experience. Will definitely return for another dinner date

This place never let's me down. Consistent good food. I usually get the steak salad, which is always perfect. I try and sneak a couple bites of my friends food, so far I've tried the lasagna, shrimp risotto, both have been excellent. The bruschetta is the best in town. And the outside seating with fire pits puts this place on my number one list to eat at when I'm at town square. This is a pretty good spot for a chain restaurant.

Best Tuscan restaurant I have ever been to! I had the gluten free pasta and it was very good. I normally can't eat pasta at restaurants due to my gluten and dairy allergies but the Brio staff were very accommodating and knew exactly what I could have. I didn't have to sacrifice flavor for a stomach ache, and that is a rare occurrence. Not only was the food excellent but the staff were delightful and very fast. Can't wait to come back next time I'm in Scottsdale!

Me n my boyfriend decided to do a little early birthday celebration for me  so we decided to try brio  ,the experience was very beutifull and amazing, we wore very satisfied with our service, the food and wine was amazing, we are looking forward to repeat this amazing dinner again. .great job for the service n to the cook,

I have always had good luck at Brio in Town Square for lunch, Happy Hour, and dinner.  Service is always good and the food and drinks are well made and full-flavored.  If you like Brio, I reccomend joining the MyBRIO REWARDS club.  You get a free meal on your birthday and various discount offers throughout the year.

This trip we came for lunch to try the new Lighter Side Menu.  About a 5 minute wait...not bad for lunch time.  Our server arrived right after we were seated for our drink order.  She was very attentive and super sweet.  I wish I remembered her name!  

I had the 5 oz Filet Brio with asparagus, cubed sweet potatoes, spinach, and roasted red peppers.  $19.95 and 365 cals.  It definitely tasted better than 365 calories...and was more filling as well!  The filet was cooked to a perfect medium rare, juicy and savory.  The portion size was just enough to share a few bites with my friend without feeling like I needed more.  For some reason I was expecting mashed sweet potatoes, but they were tiny roasted cubes and were delicious.  The asparagus, spinach, and red peppers were also prepared superbly.  All the ingredients complemented each other and the meal was delightful.  I will definitely get this again.  The price point seemed a couple dollars too high for lunch, but the meat quality was very good, so I cannot complain.

My friend had the Shrimp Mediterranean, also from the Lighter Side Menu.  $14.95/ 470 cals. It came with orzo & farro pilaf, feta, broccoli, spinach, and asparagus.  She let me sample her dish; it was very tasty and something I would order if I was not super hungry.  I think mine was more filling because of my protein choice.

All in all, another good Brio meal!

I can't begin to say how much I enjoyed this restaurant. If I had the money I would open one. The ambience was amazing and the food was delicious. We had the bruschetta sampler and I couldn't pick my favorite. The lobster bisque is out of this world. Service was a little slow but he was very nice and helpful. The best was the mini Creme brûlée. Yum. Found there's one in Irvine, I'm going again very soon.

Brio is a nice Italian restaurant in the heart of Town Square. The prices are affordable and comparable to any other chain restaurant found at a mall such as Cheesecake Factory. I like that they offer a number of gluten-free options including their pasta. The restaurant itself is huge with a nice high ceiling. Service was prompt and our waitress checked in on us frequently.

Lunch started off with a couple of appetizers including the beef carpaccio and calamari fritto misto. Although the carpaccio color appeared on the paler side, the actual beef mixed with greens, capers, and mustard aioli tasted delicious. I was disappointed that the calamari was on the soggier side. We were served the standard bread and Parmesan crisps, but I was annoyed by the ice cold and rock hard butter, which has always been a major pet peeve of mine. 

Lunch specials included a two course meal featuring a soup or salad plus a pasta dish. I got the lobster bisque, which was good, but on the salty side. I had a feeling that it was mostly filled with the shrimp to cover up for the lack of lobster meat. Nonetheless, it was a nice excuse to eat more bread. For my pasta dish, I got the campanelle carbonara. The plate was less than a full entree, but by that time I was getting pretty full. For drinks, they don't carry any beer on draft.

Although, I wasn't super impressed with the food, given the service, space, and prices, Brio is pretty fancy for a mall restaurant and a nice fit for Town Square.

Great Italian style eating!
Dinner with family valet parking lots included!
Anthony waited on us and was very pleasant and efficient ! 
If you are in Summerlin  county this place is a must!!!

I really enjoy eating here. One of my favorite's in Town Sq. Especially if I am in the mood for Italian. I believe this has overall a much higher quality of food than some of the other Italian chains out there. Decor and ambiance is also very inviting and pleasant. Its easy to wait for  a table as you are in the middle of town square or even head to the Brio bar and hang out. Overall a great experience every time I have gone.

Great location, reasonable prices and impressive decor BUT mediocre food. We celebrated our anniversary there and are fortunately still married. A typical chain...won't be on our revisit list.

Update (9/20): met a friend there for Happy Hour because it was convenient...how bad could their appetizers be...they were! In fact, when the waiter acknowledge that receiving only 2 out of the 3 appetizers that we ordered was "not bad", we knew that our expectations (fair at best)  were met. 

NEVER AGAIN!

I came here for a wedding reception and I was very upset with the service. 

First of all if your planning on having a wedding or any reception here, I don't recommend Brio Tuscan Grille for it. The room isn't very private, they don't have doors to close it off, they just have curtains. You can hear everyone in their main dinning room. The worst part was my table was by the kitchen. While the wedding party was saying their speeches, all I can hear was plates being bang left and right, the staff having LOUD conversations and overall a ton of feedback. 

The food that was severed was family style. We had a chicken dish (very dry), fish was pretty good (that's what my one star rating is for), pasta (was alright) bread and salad (not enough dressing). The food presentation was so messy and dirtying looking. 

Very upsetting on how they rushed us the whole dinner. They should have slowed down on clearing our plates and focused more on customers service and filling up our water. 

Lots of other restaurants in the areas to choose from.

This location is very pretty, is great for people watching (if you sit outside) and has some good food! The patio area is gorgeous and they do have some delicious appetizers and drinks. It's a great spot for meeting friends. 

Their brunch is also delicious. I was surprised that we were able to get brunch reservations for Easter Sunday the day before! 

Both times that I've visited the service was great - the second time our waiter was especially good with the toddler in our party.

Excellent time for 3 couples to dine and catch up.
We had may great entrees and some outstanding wine.

Or only challenge was that they had a great fish special and 2 of our party was told at 5:55pm that it was sold out.  so for a weekday the specials are suspect.

The service was kind and attentive.  The value was good and great taste in the food.
Worth  the drive from Tempe
Tom

Absolutely fantastic place!  My wife and I were recently in Las Vegas and stopped by here with a friend.  The server was excellent...and even brought some pizza dough to occupy my daughters attention!  I had a bruschetta sampler that was amazing.  Their wine selection was excellent.  We were even visited at our table by the executive chef.  After all was said and done, he paid for our meal and drinks!  Food, service, and decor all top notch in my book.  I do not give 5 star ratings easily!

Brio is a very pretty restaurant, and the food is not bad (although far from outstanding)....but it's so damn crowded, and the wait for a table is so long that I won't go there anymore.

On Wednesday, it was so jammed that when I asked the hostess how long the wait for a table would be, she said "oh, just 30 or 40 minutes".
I told her to never, ever, put the word "just" in front of a "30 or 40 minute wait".

There are many other Italian restaurants in Las Vegas where you will get better service, and better food.
Happy hour food and drinks are amazing! Great prices! Shrimp tasty and dirty martinis all night long

Very average experience. One of the places that mostly charges you for feeling all grown-up in white cloth napkin paradise which is fine except most people come to restaurants for the food and it was very mediocre. 
My red sauce pasta with overcooked chicken didn't feel like anything worth more than $5, and nevertheless it was $15; bruschetta was missing the zest and freshness. I guess wine and bread were good. Service was very attentive ( almost as if they also tried my pasta and knew it was a rip off). In general this place is as far from perfect as Cleveland from Italy.

I could eat here three times a week. Since I don't live close by I always seem to order the same thing. The beef carpaccio and spicy shrimp and eggplant are so good it is hard to go off the beaten path. The desserts are all delicious especially the tiramisu and cheesecake with berries. The wine list also has a lot of great options. There is not a better option the next time your at Town Square.

My boyfriend and I went last night and our server was very hospitable. I'm a server as well and it made me appreciate her patience with our dietary restrictions even more. Just a suggestion to mgmt is to keep staff up on table maintenance and cleanliness. When we sat our table had not been wiped, there was still coins on the table from a prior guest and the floor below us was filthy. It is a great & beautiful establishment. Keep up the good work. :)

I have been to this Brio location a couple times and each time has always been a great time! Whether with big groups or with just one other person, I've always gotten great service!

For this experience in particular, I decided to sit at the outside bar sonce the bar on the inside was already packed (also because the inside bar was a little too dimly lit for me). Upon sitting down, the bartender immediately greeted me and my friend and provided us with happy hour menus and asked if we had any questions regarding the menu. Her attitude was so nice, friendly and happy it instantly made me happy! I wish I had gotten her name. 

I ordered the sangria rosa which was honestly so yummy. It was just right and not too strong. Definitely wins my heart over the white or red sangria. 

For food I ordered the blackened shrimp with the eggplant. It was literally sooooo good and sooo filled with flavor and spice that I had to order it a second time. Definitely love coming to this Brio location especially for their HH!

Outstanding service by Chase. Truly exception for our group of six adults and 2 tired kids. 

The atmosphere is comfortable and food was tasty, as always at Brio. We had the Gorgonzola beef medallions, 5oz filet, pasta far diabolical with chicken and chicken Milanese. Several substitutions (fries for mashed, etc) and no problems at all. 

Service was quick and friendly. Food was hot. Overall a great experience for a family on vacation. It was my sister in law's birthday and it was the perfect place for a nice evening. The free app with Yelp check in is also a nice perk. 

With the free app, Chase made several recommendations and adjusted it to our needs. We ended up with the bruschetta sampler with 4 steak and 4 roasted red pepper. Omitting the ones with bacon. 

I highly recommend this location.

Ordered to-go for a group of people at work. When I arrived, the hostess was rude and kept trying to look around me at people coming in. She handed me my bill, and when I handed it back with the credit card - she replied that it would be a few minutes in a snobby tone. 

The food was fine... probably the only thing that made me round up to 3 stars. 

Strawberry Balsamic Chicken Salad - good, lots of chicken, could use a little more Gorgonzola cheese. 

I also noticed that the Fettuccine Rusticca looked good. 

To go order was well prepared with utensils and napkins. Also included a bag of bread and crackers - both were pretty good.

One of my favorite spots to hang out at and do work. Very calm atmosphere, staff is friendly , food is good. The white peach sangria is my favorite on a hot day. It's typically my go to spot to meet my girlfriends, or can be a swanky place to meet for a business meeting. I've went to multiple locations and love where the owners have chosen to build the restaurants. Will definitely continue to go to brio.

I've been here twice since moving to AZ and have had bad experiences both times. The first time I ordered a lunch special and paid extra for a salad. When I got home I noticed that I only had a half portion of pasta and no salad. I called and spoke to a manager who was very nice and apologetic. She told me that the next time that I was in that I would get lunch on the house. My husband and I decided to visit after shopping and it was his first time coming. We ordered the calamari and asked if our son's pizza and fruit could come out first. The calamari came out and the pizza didn't come out for another 10 minutes, then we had to ask our waitress for his fruit, 10 minutes later we got his fruit. An hour went by and we never received our pasta, yet the table behind us received their food and they arrived after us. The waitress acknowledged that it was taking a while and kept saying "it will be out shortly" after waiting over an hour for ravioli and having our son become tired and upset,  we decided to just pay for the calamari and pizza and leave. My husband happened to run into the manager to see if he could pay our check, in which I told her that we never received our food at all. She was very nice and comped the check, our waitress never even told her that we had been waiting that long. We certainly won't be back. Not a good experience on separate occasions but the manager was very sweet.

As you can see I do not review very often (or at all). I felt this place should be reviewed though. I work long  hours and many days of the week and I happened to have some time off to spend with my wife and my 2yr old son. I thought it would be nice to go "try out the Italian place in Town Square." They have outdoor seating and I love Italian food. I have ate at many of the other restaurants there in Town Square but not Brio.

When we get there we asked to be seated outside since that was one of the reasons for choosing the place. We sit and wait a few minutes but not too long for the waiter to come by and take our drink orders. He leaves and is gone for a while but then comes back with waters which we didn't order but that is ok. Still waiting on my beer though. He eventually makes his way back to our table with my beer and takes our orders. 

After he leaves I take a nice big drink from my beer to realize the glass is dirty!! Now I'm a aircraft mechanic, I don't mind being dirty and have a certain tolerance for dirty, but when you charge 8 bucks for a beer I would like it in a clean glass or at least one that isn't sticky!!

Now I wait a while for the waiter to come back to let him know the glass is dirty so he can replace it. Once again he finally shows up so i could inform him of the issue. He apologizes and says he will be right back. He does come right back with a new glass and proceeds to pour the beer from the dirty glass to the "clean" one. No bullshit. Isn't that like scooping water from the toilet bowl and calling it clean? Needless to say I drank the water. 

I ordered one of the 14oz steaks since I was happy to spend time with the family. I ordered it medium because thats the way I like it. However, I got it well done, so well done the edges were burnt to s crisp! You got to be kidding me. A 30 dollar steak that you cooked all the flavor out of! I eat it because I am not the kind of person that will fuss about an overcooked steak only to get a properly cooked steak with spit in it. Especially after the dirty beer incident. 

I don't normally turn back food or complain since I am easily pleased but I think for a 100 dollar meal you should be pretty damn happy with all aspects of the service. 

I will never go here again! There are plenty of places to eat at Town Square and new ones are opening all the time. I'm hoping soon there will be a new opening in the Brio location. 

Do yourself a favor......eat somewhere else.

This place is spectacular. Great atmosphere and fantastic food. Our server was phenomenal and gave us great laughs while enjoying our meals. They even gave me an iced latte, which isn't something they typically make, and it was made perfectly. This place is great and I will certainly be making a trip back here again.

We came here for Valentine's Day and they were slammed. We had to wait 20 minutes after our reservation time to get seated. I understand the wait because apparently they had 1200 reservations today! We sat outside and our service was outstanding. Our server Joey R was awesome! He made sure our food came as quickly as possible and was just right. He was very funny and kept making jokes which is a huge plus in my book. He made handling so many customers seem easy and still spent time talking to each table. I love this place and had a great experience tonight!

My family and I were celebrating my mother in laws birthday, when a pigeon that had gotten into the restaurant pooped on my sister in law!  It did it twice; the first time we thought someone had flipped sauce on her, and three of us helped her get it out of her hair.  The second time, we looked around and noticed the bird above her head.  The staff was disgustingly unprofessional, insulted us with a 20 dollar gift card after we spent 500 dollars on food (that's not even enough to go back and have the meal paid for!!), the waiters and waitresses laughed, told other guests, swore, and mocked our family.  Your staff implying that a filthy disease ridden animal defecating on guests near the kitchen of your restaurant is out of the company's policy to make things right makes me shudder to think what else you would not help on.  I've had better customer service in every single other restaurant I've ever attended.  To make matters worse, when posting complaints on your Facebook wall, after talking to my sister in law who ever manages that account LIED and said she was fine with how things were handled!  Your customer service is disgusting and as we now see on more than just your one restaurants standard.  We are a family of 20 adults with in laws, 30 grandchildren and have been established in Las Vegas.  Your lack of class and neglegance has lost all of our business and all of extended family and friends business.
Worst ever! Filing complaint waitress was horrific the worse experience ever another couple was just as ready to leave as us. Very sad people can be so rude

Perfect place for a nice, classy, ladies night.  Drinks, and good food are always fun. Love drinking their sangria on the patio even though service does tend to be a little slower. Have had several dishes and their menu and all were good! Love the bread and oil! I really did enjoy their calamari and stuffed mushrooms! Lots of flavor and different selections! Fantastic deserts to chose from!
 I will say that it's not the best Italian food but, the ambience and service does make of for the food not being the greatest.

Ordered several items and drinks to try.  Some items tasted a bit salty to me. But overall had a nice experience.  The waitress was extra friendly. The high ceiling tuscan dining room was much more impressive than anticipated. Next time I would love to try the crab cakes.
I wasnt impressed but the wife enjoyed it. Meal took a long time to come out. Waiter didn't ask us for refills until food came out. He forgot my soup. I had chicken, she had salmon.
This is a great place to eat . The food is amazing and the service is top notch .you'll the the happy hour as well.

I was coming here since this place (finally) opened on my side of town.  The happy hour is just amazing.  It was $2.99 for like 8 different dishes, but I recently went back and was disappointed to find that happy hour dishes are now $3.99.  The bartender told me they have some newer items, and the portions are bigger.  I wouldn't know as I went for the burger, which did not change in size.  They also told me they added $5 cocktails, which also didn't matter to me as I was drinking a regular priced Stella, if I remember correctly.

I came back a few weeks later and had two apps, the beef carpaccio and the crispy shrimp.  I almost always get the carpaccio, so I was pretty excited when indeed a bigger plate arrived.  Except once I was digging in, I found that they had sliced the meat thinner than before, and so it seemed like the same amount... or LESS!  The meat kind of stuck to the plate, so it wasn't the same enjoyable appetizer that I was used to.

The crispy shrimp were a nice addition to the menu, though.  Tasty, plentiful, and not too much breading.  I definitely enjoyed that.  I also tried a $5 sangria rosa just so I could sample their drink menu, and it was good, but it didn't blow me away.

This is still one of the best happy hours on this side of town, but it's not the "oh my god we have to go there" deal that it once was.

All I know is that I sampled pizza throughout the Rise Up Japan bake sale, and it was pretty delicious pizza.  All the workers were pretty friendly.  One day I'll have to actually try this place out, though I'll probably wait until their Boca Park location opens.

The food here is pretty good, I had the pasta alla vodka which was delicious and my boyfriend had the pasta Brio which he finished. The issue with this place is the service and price. We came here for my boyfriends 20th birthday and I specifically let the server know. When we had finished our meal, the server offered us a dessert menu since we were celebrating. What kind of restaurant doesn't give out a birthday dessert to a customer specifically deciding to spend their birthday at their restaurant? Even if it's just a cookie or small scoop of ice cream. For the price of the food, they should at least have the decency to give out a birthday dessert. Will definitely not be going back here for any special occasions because they obviously don't care about investing in the lives of their customers or what they're celebrating.

I've been to Brio 2x in the last month.  My first time was because I had a gift card.  The second time was on my but obviously enjoyed it enough the first time to return!

This place is busy right up until 10PM on weekends so call ahead and make a reservation.

Very neat ambiance.  Reminds me of the Venetian in Vegas.  Upscale and wide open so the noise level is slightly above average.

The food....  Yummy as can be!  I'm one who counts carbs so why am I going to an Italian restaurant?  The salmon is to die for.  The steaks are to die for.  Even the salads are yummy.

Service is average to a bit above.  Bottom line is that this is not the place to go to if in a hurry.  Great for a group.

If I could give 3.5 stars I could. We visit often as we work at Tivoli. We came for dinner on a Sunday night. Chicken Parm was good. Could have been great with more melted mozzarella. The short rib was a total no go. This is the second  time the majority of the short rib was fat and lite to no meat. Posting the before and after pic as I had to share my chicken parm because there was no meat on the short rib.

The food was awesome as always. However, this is the second time I've sat in the bar and had the bartender as my server. He is awful!! I asked for my check and it took him 10 minutes to bring it to me and then it took him another 5 minutes to pick it up. I was on my lunch break so I was in a bit of a hurry and he just didn't care. He did this the last time I was there too. Just awful service...

What a great experience we had at lunch today at Brio Tuscan Grill at Scottsdale Quarter. Our server Scott was very professional and service was great. It was extra special when the Executive Chef Joe Milbert came to see if we were satisfied with our meal and if we needed anything. Bravo for Brio. Recommending to my friends to frequent this establishment.

4 of us had to go to Gilbert and have always loved Brio. Being from Ohio it's like being home. The GM Joe Milbert greeted us and made sure we were comfortable. Very welcoming and very professional. Our server John was top notch. Service was impeccable and fast ---John was very knowledgeable and quick. Next time we are in Gilbert we will definitely come back to Brio Tuscan Grille

Great food, excellent service, hits the spot every time. A+

Definitely recommend. Try the New York steak
Great hh here. $3 appetizer menu!  The quality was pretty good too. Drinks r only .50$ off tho

Olive Garden?

Italian restaurants are a dime a dozen and this is yet another chain eatery to add to the list.  BUT, it is a notch up from Olive Garden.  Food was good, drinks were passable and I left wishing I had spent my money at Montesano's instead.

I've had my eye on this place before it even opened and finally got the chance to check it out! 

Inside is just BEAUTIFUL (see pics) An upscale but casual feel.
They also have a spacious patio area.

All the staff that I came in contact with were very friendly and informative. 

I ordered an Ice Tea........it was good. 
They served me hot crusty bread with these Fabulous Rosemary Cheese Crisps.......I asked for more they were so good!! ;-) (see pics) 

The waitress told me I could modify any item on the menu if I needed to or special order anything I didn't see.... 

..that is a HUGE plus when a place is willing to go above and beyond to accommodate you and also means they obviously are preparing these items fresh if they can change any item. I definitely appreciate that. 

I decided on ordering the Roasted Chicken and Butternut squash risotto, Lunch portion comes with salad. (see pics) 

OMG.....SO Delicious and piping HOT, it had such amazing flavor depth, topped with crisp prosciutto and fresh basil chiffonade. 

I was in heaven, I'm gonna dream about that dish for sure! 

Now for dessert, they offer about ten different things in a mini teacup size...........WOW! That is so cool, you can try more than one thing without being a total pig or spending a fortune! LOVE IT!! 

I decided on one of the many creme brulee' flavors, I got the brown sugar (see pics) Perfect size Perfect Flavor, truly!

I noticed on their website that they serve a Brunch menu on the weekends until 3pm. I'd like to try that as well.

http://www.brioitalian.com/

I honestly can't wait to go back!!

Everyone's talking about this place and I finally had a chance to go with my girlfriend's. We went during their happy hour and the food was great. Each of us ordered the Brio burger and let me tell you, I was impressed that it had great flavor, yet it wasn't heavy like some burgers at restaurants like this. My only compliant was that I ordered it medium, but it was slightly over medium.  However, it was still moist and juicy.   The beef carpaccio was delicious and so was the fried cheese ravioli.  For drinks I had the peach white sangria.  It tasted great and was very refreshing. The prices are the best I've seen yet for happy hour.  I spent about $13 for the burger, carpaccio, and drink.  Not too bad, especially when you're on a budget.  The service was also good. I'll definitely be back.

This place was amazing! I was actually so full with my portion and I couldn't finish the whole thing. There are so many flavours and it touches every single centimetre of your Tuscan palate. Calamari is fantastic and we got out reservation within the half hour we called it in. Perfect service, and she was fantastic and talked to us a lot. The only problem was that no birthday wishes were sent to my mother--who had her 50th that night. I called it in through the phone and they said they would wish her a happy birthday, but nothing happened. 
Maybe I'll pull the waiter aside next time!!

First time in, food is very good, staff is very friendly, I would give it a 5-star but, they need a little more assistance with the food servers. Even though our server was very nice and very helpful, you can tell that she was rushed, Not stressed, just rushed. She needed some assistance which I didn't see anybody else helping her. Besides that, I would highly recommended for a very good experience in dining.

I've visited this place a few times.. Went last night, and noticed their menu was different and that all their pastas and entrees do not come with complimentary soup/salad anymore! You have to pay $5 extra if you want a soup or salad!!! And all the prices went up!! My pasta dish was $19!!! It used to be about $16. My boyfriend got somewhat of a chicken Parmesan and that was $20!! And nothing special might I add! I will not b going to this place unless it's for an event or something it's definitely NOT WORTH IT!!

My friend and I were driving looking for a bite to eat and went in last min tonight for Pasta, Happy Hour Food and Drinks.  We sat in bar area..Megan was our server and a guy named Dillion (her busses) and  another guy who was the food runner who's name I can't remember (although I wish I could) but my service was amazing.
