My friend and I BOTH work in the industry and were so blown away at the TEAM work!  We ordered two orders of beef carpaccio, spinach dip and a pasta vodka dish along with several drinks....one drink I even asked Megan our sever to surprise us and it was a delicious concoction I would have never thought to create.

I've been to Brio twice. Brio's pasta with vodka sauce is at the summit of the pantheon of great pasta dishes. Their appetizers are all superb. Don't miss enjoying great food in a wonderful setting. Five stars all the way.

The best happy hour! Yes, they have good items in their non-happy hour menu but MAN for the quality + price in their HH menu u need to go!

HH is @ 3:30-6:30pm but I can't remember if it's mon-fri or mon-thursday, always call and ask!

HH FOOD 5/5:
-Beef Carpaccio ($5): WOW this was amazing. It's like raw meat but it's flavored really good. The plate they serve it in is also huge.
-Black Pepper Shrimp ($6): This plate doesn't taste like there's eggplant in it. IT IS SO DELICIOUS. Super soft and the shrimp doesn't taste fishy.
-I heard all the other items in HH are good, but I haven't ventured out to try them.

Talking about a disaster. I am writing this review immediately after one of the worst services i've experienced ever. I have never been so ticked off by a server in my entire life. The service provided by this server named Monica (as indicated on the receipt) in the outside area was just pathetic. 

Our friend arrived at the table early and got a table on the outside. But when we arrived, because we had our dog, we requested a different table where my dog could be better isolated from the rest of the crowd and the two other little puppies near by. The reason for this was that even though my dog is friendly but she loves food too much and she begs other people for food. When we asked for a different table, what we got was a sarcastic response from the host that "well your server won't be (name)." nevertheless, she reluctantly left all the menus and left. I was pretty annoyed by that response but decided not to let something like that messes up our perfect morning. 

Well that was just the beginning. Our server Monica was just awful. I don't think she knows how to smile. My mother asked if there was any breakfast entree, she snatched the menu from my mom's hands, turned it around and tapped on the menu to show her the two breakfast entree. I almost stood up in my seat to confront her but my mom kept me on my seat. I then said I am not ready to order yet because we just sat down, Monica just turned around and left. There was no "I will give you guys a minute to decide." 

The service remained laughably bad throughout. She only gave us two water even though we had a party of 3. I needed a coffee refill; I gotta ask someone else for it. I needed water refill; Glgotta ask someone else for it. I needed a change of your drink because a bug fell in it? I asked politely and she gave me a dirty look, turned around without saying a word. She then came back 5 minutes later with the drink and left it on my table without saying a word and then turned around and left. It was like if I was causing her the biggest trouble in the world. Never once did she come by check how we were doing like the other Brio servers would do normally. Never once did she come by to refill any of the drink we ordered. 

The only thing that stopped from me going to a manager just now is because we didn't want to mess up our perfect morning with a friend we haven't seen in awhile. But the more I think about her pathetic service, the angrier I get. Her service was unacceptable. 

My family is regular here and they said this was an isolated incident. But still this was the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. I am in disbelief that this type of service is allowed at a Brio resturant. I am reasonable so I will give one star for the good food and the other servers who were great at helping us becuase Monica couldn't. In all honesty, the experience deserved not a single star.

Happy Hour: Monday through Friday 3-7 pm and then again from 9 pm to close.

The Details (taken from Internet): While we were surprised that they offer no drink specials, we were delighted by Brio's menu called Tuscan Tasters, which features a variety of hearty appetizers for $2.95 each. The standouts on this menu include the Steak Bruschetta ($2.95), with a balsamic sweetness to it, and the Sausage and Pepperoni Flatbread ($2.95), with its thin crispy crust, was easy to eat and very flavorful. The servers, weaving their way through the crowd of people waiting for tables, were helpful and ever present. They seemed to work as a team, and help each other run food, fill water, and give other general support. Each of them claimed the Brio Burger with homemade chips ($2.95) to be their favorite.

BEST BRUNCH IN WESTLAKE.
While the food is generally pretty good at any time, the brunch is definitely my favorite. A little on the pricey side for the portion size but quality ingredients.  Their fresh fruit sangria is amazing paired with the Tuscan Omelet! Very healthy also!

This place was so great! Food was delicious, very good quality. Our server was super professional and took great care of us. Alcoholic drinks are good and reasonably priced! Would recommend and I would return.

I used to work at a nearby store in Town Square and have been in this store for a few times now but only managed to write a review now due to the amazing service of our waiter Amit or Ameet (not sure exactly how you spell it). He was very accommodating, patient, and great with his recommendations (the eggplant/shrimp was sooooo good)! 

The location is great too, feels very fancy but welcoming. You can either dine inside or outside depending on the weather. 

The only thing I wish they would change is the complimentary bread coz it lacked a little bit of flavor and it wasn't warm, plus the butter they served was cold so it was a bit disappointing trying to spread some on the bread. I prefer a side of good olive oil and balsamic vinegar as opposed to cold butter.

Nice place to eat and good food.  However I don't appreciate being rushed through dinner. The past two times we've gone three the server(s) have wanted to take our drink, appetizer, & dinner order all at once.  Last Sunday the waitress tried to take our dinner order after our drinks arrived I had to tell the waitress that we would order our meals after the appetizers arrived.  Our meals were good but the minute we put our forks down she was immediately there asking if we needed boxes & wanted dessert.

We had lunch yesterday and we were disappointed. For the prices we really expected better. My friend and I shared the Brio chopped salad. It was a mediocre salad with a smidgen of feta cheese. There were a few sliced black olives clearly from a can. Overall a very disappointing salad. I had the Shrimp Mediterranean which was very tasty. It wasn't pretty but I enjoyed it. My friend had the Lobster Ravioli.  There was a sign outside with a picture that looked delicious. The plate served looked nothing like it. The ravioli clearly was from frozen and proved to be so in our opinion by the lack of flavor. A big disappointment. Honestly we would have been willing to pay a bit more for something much better but what we were served made the price far too much. 
The service was okay. Yes just okay. We had Iced tea and had to ask for lemon. I guess asking before bringing our drinks wouldn't have been efficient. We were asked if we wanted another serving of iced tea after our meal, yay! Of course we had to wait and then ask for more lemon. The tea was fresh and so was the lemon so there's that. We did leave a generous tip because our waitress was young and maybe just learning. 
I gave 3 stars but honestly with those prices I won't be back even though the ambiance of the restaurant is very nice.
I still love this place. Their happy hour (330-630) is so bomb. Great martinis, sangrias, blackened shrimp, flatbread pizzas, and nachos.

My bf and I came here for our anniversary dinner. It was very easy to make reservations online.

The restaurant is very dim, interior was beautiful and classy. We went on a Sunday night and they seemed to be pretty busy but their service was very fast. We got our drinks and appetizer right away. Our food came not too long after that. Which was great! Usually places being that busy take quite awhile. 

We ordered calamari as an appetizer and blue moon and moscato for our drinks. My bf wasn't please with the blue moon coming from the bottle. But I was very pleased with the moscato and the calamari was good. For our entrees, I ordered lobster and shrimp fettuccine and my bf had the 8oz filet mignon. Although, my bf was disappointed that the steak was almost smaller than my fist.. both entrees were delicious!

Would come here again whenever I crave Italian!

We discovered this one after shopping the west elm, and stopped in for a snack, had the meatballs, which were tasty, and served with polenta, which we liked, Decided to come back and try the happy hour, had their burger, really good, shrimp cocktail, not that interesting, more meatballs, still liked them, and the service was efficient if not overly warm, The place looks like an Italian version of the Cheesecake factory, all big and fancy and chainlike, but the food is definately pretty good, so we ll go back and try dinner soon,

I met a friend here for lunch, and we ordered the soup and salad, the Bistecca
 salad, and minestrone soup, really good price, and the salad was chilled, it was delicious, the soup was pretty good too, I think I like Olive Garden's Minestrone better, my girlfriend says their Happy Hour is really great also !

I was very pleased with my experience at Brio. This was my first time in the town square area. My friend suggested coming here before dropping us off to catch our flight back home. I assumed they are a bigger city franchise, but it was still fun to try a place we don't have in lincoln. Service was exquisite and our waiter was very nice in answering our questions and frequently refilling our waters. We all opted for the lunch combos-reasonably priced and ended up being the perfect amount of food. I got the pasta brio with the red pepper sauce, chicken, and mushrooms over rigatoni. It had really good flavor in the sauce and was evenly portioned with the chicken and mushrooms. I also got Caesar salad for my side and loved it. It was the type of creamy but yet still oily homemade Caesar I expect at Italian restaurants like this. My husband got the fettuccini Alfredo and liked his dish as well. My friend said the tomato basil soup was one of the best she'd ever tried. They made sure we had enough bread and got a second basket as well. I really enjoyed the seasoned flatbread, in addition to the traditional bread that was served. This was a great meal to have before getting on the plane-filling but not overly stuffed or something that is going to make you feel sick after. I'd try brio again! Nice, clean ambiance similar to that of an Olive Garden but still with a casual feel so you don't feel obligated to dress up.
Great food. Our waitress was awesome. All in all this was a very good dining experience.

Came in and my friends had already been seated, and actually ordered already.  As soon as I sat down, our server handed me a menu and took my drink order (strawberry lemonade FTW!);  She quickly returned with my beverage, and I was ready to order... Steak salad.  Weird, I thought, but it turned out to be soooooo good!  Our service continued to be on point, and we left quite satisfied.  The mini size desserts are perfect to complete any meal.  I had a cute sized creme brulee that didn't leave me overwhelmed.  I will be back here next time I'm in Vegas. The location in Town Square is great.  There's meter parking right outside.  Covered free parking also available for those who don't mind a short walk.

Went with my girlfriend to this place! We got a seat out by patio and waited about 15 minuets and No one showed up!! Got up and exited this place!! They try to be upscale but its a joke!
Would never return!!

Came here for dinner with the family the day after Thanksgiving.  It's located in  Tivoli Sqare,  The food was above average, restaurant is very nicely decorated, and the service was ok.  The price, $$$ not worth that.  I'd come back if there is no other place to go.
Pretty delicious reasonably prices. Went for brunch. The chips with the chipotle chicken sandwich not the best rather have had fresh fruit instead.
Great Food, Great Service! Not one bad thing to say. Two thumbs up all the way around

Amazing restaurant with outstanding service.  Had a ladies night there and they accommodated all our needs. Loved the buffalo chicken nachos they were delicious!! If you are looking for a great place to meet up and enjoy great food with a fun atmosphere Brio is your place.

Ted was an excellent server! We were there Wednesday night. Had the salmon with crab cake topper, diced sweet potatoes & asparagus. It was phenomenal. Please add to your menu! Would come every week for that dish. Birthday dessert trio was very good.
My family loves this place. We go here for a lot of celebrations and holidays. Only complaint is the wait is a little long even if you've made a reservation.

Yelp Challenge! Started 8/20/2011 (33 of 365). I have a lot of catching up to do!

This 5 star review is for their Sunday Brunch. Although, I can say that their week night dinners there are just as yummy.  But their Brunch I have to say, is super yummy!  For dinner, I like their lobster ravioli; exceptional!

As for my lovely brunch, they mix their early morning mimosas and bloody mary's real well.  They have like 3 different kinds of eggs benedicts.  My friends and I decided to order all of them to to try.  We had your normal canadian bacon, another one with shrimp and crab, and a very different one: chorizo and chicken.  All of them were so good.  You must try them all!

To top off our buffet of eggs benedicts, we shared the Rasberry creme stuffed French Toast.  Nice 3 big slices that we each had or own good individual piece.  All of this was to die for.  We will definitely be back for Sunday brunch!  

Fair warning: there is quite a wait for the brunch.
Quickly seated and served but the overall quality of the food was very poor. Killed the mood for the rest of the night.
We were there for a birthday party. Service was great, as was the food. We really enjoyed ourselves and the ambiance contributed to the good time.

Food has never failed on my visits to Brio. Since we had such a rainy day yesterday I craved non other than than their famous Lobster Bisque-a harvest colored creamy goodness in a cup. I always order this and so should you.

Sauvignon Blanc was crisp and cold, warm sourdough bread basket was a perfect compliment. We shared some Caprese-sliced buffalo chunky tomatoes, olive oil, drops of balsamic vinegar and arugula was fresh and a perfect start.  

The hubby can't resist a wedge salad and I can't resist trying it. The creamy blue-cheese dressing was mild and the big slice of ice-burg was covered in bacon bits, tomatoes and onion. MMM.

Service was friendly and atmosphere always lovely.  I'll be back.

Brio Tuscan Grille has become our new hotspot.  We love it.

Food is always fresh and delicious

Service never fails and the restaurant is gorgeous!

Sourdough and crispy thin bread basket is fabulous, but don't fill up save it for your entree!

Risotto with chicken and sweet potato. Yum!

Caprese just like I had in Sicily...fresh tomato and greens with buffalo mozzarella, olive oil, and balsamic with the perfect amount of S&P.  

Amazing service-everyone was smiling and very friendly, nice hostess, great waitress, love the kids menu which offers healthy alternative like salmon, broccoli and mashed potato's one of the reasons we come here...it's my child's favorite!

Four Seasons Service!

I will be back!

I figured this was another one of those places that spent more money on decor than quality of food boy was I surprised.  We started with the bruschetta sampler I snagged a steak one with tomatoes parm and a nice hint of balsamic that was great the best thing I had that night.  Also got one of tomato and goat cheese ones which were pretty tasty too.  Next a salad with their creamy parm dressing which was balanced very well also.  Just enough cheese, onions, maters it was great.  Some others had the lobster bisque and said it was fishy even to seasoned fish eaters.  On to the pasta they had a fruit of the sea special which was great hint of spicy red pepper flakes a light sauce that didn't drown out the seafood.  I did have one problem with the dish I got 4 mussels maybe 3 oz of fish. Cut to the size of baby scallops and the scallops that were supposed to be in there were AWOL which is probably why the fish was cut that way.  Now the 4 shrimp I got in there were tender tasty and perfectly cooked just like the rest of the seafood were great but for me I would like to see alot more fruit of the sea. Service was friendly but not best I've had.  Overall a good place great tasting food and one of the few places that I've seen give more than a few raviolis in those dishes wanna go back and try the lobster raviolis and if that plate is smaller than mushroom ravioli plate I'm gonna be pissed.

Also the kids plates are really good and the portions are pretty big.

Came here to meet up with a couple of yelpers.  We sat at the bar area to try their happy hour bar food.  I had a strawberry lemonade and as far as happy hour food goes I had the spicy shrimp and eggplant, beef carpaccio, and shrimptini.  

The spicy shrimp and eggplant wasn't that spicy, it was perfect.  The sauce was great, if I was at olive garden I would grab a garlic bread and wipe the plant clean.  The beef carpaccio was delightful.  I wanted to chew on the beef like a piece of bubble gum until the flavor ran out.  The salad had just the right amount of dressing.  The shrimptini is your regular shrimp in a martini glass.

The happy hour goes: 
Monday - Friday from 3:30pm-6:30pm & Monday-Thursday 9pm-Close.

Stop by, if you can find a seat, and enjoy a quick snack while you shop around!

This is my favorite restaurant. The food is delicious and the service is always good. They stay open until 11pm. I finished my meal off with two deserts: cheesecake and cream brûlée! Delicious I must say!!!

The wifey wanted to come back to Brio after her and her girlfriend came the week before for Happy Hour.  Honestly, it was just OK.

I agreed to go because since its opening I still hadn't been to Tivoli Village.  I'm for 'yuppie-ism' in many cases, and seeing how rich people sometimes like to spend their money just amazes me (and somewhat annoys me at the same time).  But to each their own.  Who am I to tell the local Summerlin millionaire that the restaurant chains they visit are often vastly inferior to the local Mom & Pop Italian deli down the way?  They'll probably just scoff then go back to their yuppie gym (I'm looking at you David Barton) where apparently only people with 8+ abs, and Armani workout clothes can sweat it out.  Yes, I am in fact wearing last, last, last season Adidas sneakers (but in my defense they are a rare blue pair) and a pleather jacket.  

Tivoli Village was nice, but I was right in that it caters to specific clientele.  I like window shopping (unlike my homeboy 50 Cent) and wow, 'what-I-cannot-afford-even-if-I-tried' syndrome took over.  But I digress on back to eating (and fantasizing I was P-Diddy's hidden 16 year old bastard son).

Seems like Brio is one of the only restaurants that has survived the turmoil of Tivoli Village.  A number of eateries here have come and gone over the year.

Now I can only comment on their late night Happy Hour after 9 PM in the bar area.  I will have to try the regular restaurant some other time if we ever go back.  The hostesses were nice, showed us exactly where the bar area was in no time.  Seats were open, and we were told to sit anywhere in the bar for Happy Hour.  We chose a nice little table towards the wall section.  Our waitress was quick, and asked if we were interested in some drinks or if we were going to stick around for Happy Hour.  We told her we indeed there for Happy Hour and were immediately offered one of their bar plate menus.  

There are a decent number of dishes available during Happy Hour, around 10 or so.  The pricing is good, between $4 - $6 each.  There are a number of drink specials as well.

I stuck with a Peroni beer for $4, not exactly a value, but apparently it's cheaper than normal.  Really?  Damn markup must be massive!  The wifey and I wanted to share the Black Pepper Shrimp plate, but according to our waitress they were out of the cream sauce for it.  Huh?  How hard is it for a kitchen to whip up a cream sauce exactly?  I certainly hope you have an ITALIAN kitchen that can make cream sauces all day long!  Alfredo, anyone?  Was just beyond me but OK.  We opted for the Roasted Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke Dip instead.  We also got an order of Beef Carpaccio, and two BRIO burgers.

Plates took around 20 minutes to arrive, average for most restaurants.  But it wasn't exactly busy when we were there so I don't know what the holdup was.  I gotta say though that our plates weren't exactly news to write home about.  Yes, I know it's Happy Hour, and yes I know the pricing is considered 'cheap', but come on now.  These were some ugly looking plates!  Poorly executed for the most part.  The Roasted Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke Dip with flatbread triangles was alright.  It seemed to be sitting under the heat lamp for a bit on the long side, top layer of it was hard.  It tasted ok, but should I be ashamed to say it tastes like something I can pick up at Costco?  Let me get on with the BRIO burger.  Wow.  $5 for this?  A thin burger patty with Provolone and roasted tomato mayo on what looks like a Costco hamburger bun?  And a side of housemade 'chips', once again, that could be from Costco?  Now before you get your panties in a twist, I adore Costco and shop there weekly (and drink a kale shake almost daily).  I'm just saying, if I can make the same stuff from ingredients at Costco, why go to Brio?  Why?  And this BRIO burger was plated funny too.  A 5-year old can make a plate better than this.  The burger, no lettuce, no tomato?  Cut into four pieces, and chips stuffed in the middle of the plate?  Rookies!  It didn't taste the greatest either.  Burger was overcooked and dry, the cheese was near non-existent, the roasted tomato mayo was barely there, and there was too much bun!  For the price I could have gone to Wendy's right nearby and gotten a bigger burger.  Just so-so for me.  The best item of the night was the Beef Carpaccio.  Ultra thin slices of raw beef, topped with dressed field greens, capers, a mustard aioli, and shaved Parmigiano-Reggiano.  This plate was DELICIOUS.  Beef was nice and cold, greens had great crunch, capers and the mustard aioli added a nice bite, and the cheese gave it an extra layer of flavor.  We heartily ate this up.  All for $4!  Next time I won't waste any effort and just get two orders of carpaccio.  And maybe a Peroni.

Rant done Brio.

We got there at 11, just as they opened do there was nobody there. That was awesome! Our server was awesome too. He never let our glasses get empty, brought our appetizer out almost immediately, was ready to make suggestions on lunch, and brought out a dessert to celebrate my birthday after my hubby made sure he knew we were celebrating! The food was delicious! We loved the spinach and artichoke dip. The meals hit the spot too. The Alfredo sauce was super-rich and I couldn't finish it. My hubby also filled up in the dip so he couldn't finish his club sandwich. Yummy leftovers!!

We go here often and have had pretty much everything on the menu.  Great food, good service with friendly wait staff.  Bartenders are cool also when we sit in the lounge for happy hour which has good deals also!!  Can't go wrong here with a 5 star rating!!

I've been 4 times now.  I continue to have a "meh" opinion.  Food is OK.  Certainly overpriced.  Comparable in quality to other chain Italian joints but higher in price.

The service is always great and the happy hour is really nice.  Worth a visit but don't expect GREAT food.

Had a wonderful experience tonight- sat outside to enjoy a glass of wine and appetizer- our waiter was the best- so polite and professional.
Clifton made our experience special!
Love going out and being able to enjoy the beautiful outdoors.
Thanks Clifton ~ we will be back soon and will hope to have you with us again.

When I hit up Vegas I don't usually hit up restaurants.  I know some of you are probably thinking... Why not?  Don't they have tons of great restaurants out in the City of Gluttony?   True that... But!  Remember!  This is also home to endless scrumptious buffets as well!  How can I let that slide right?  Ok... so I ended up at a restaurant this time around... Buffets I'll see you on my next trip.

Stopped by this hidden shopping plaza near the South end of the strip... Yes!  There is one real nice shopping mall and it's not an outlet!  (Town Square)  This plaza is totally nice and especially during the winter time coz it's got such a cozy feel to it... since we were looking for food, we came, we searched, and we landed at Brio Tuscan Grille.

Initially I thought I wasn't going to like it, but I'm glad that I was wrong.  Let me tell you why this is definitely a place that I'd go back again...

Décor:  Awesome!  Interior design at this place rivals those at the Grand Lux café except much fancier!  Dim, beautiful lighting, and awesome outdoor patio with a fire pit for a nice little gathering should you have a large party.

Food was actually more tastier than I was expecting...  Here were just the few that I've sampled

-Calamari:  Flash fried to perfection with aioli dipping sauce, yum!
-Penne Gorgonzola:   Off the hook good with just the right amount of sauce
-Fettuccine Rustica:  Just ok... not enough sauce for my taste
-Chipotle Chicken and Bacon Panini:  One of the best sandwiches I've had!  The bread was toasted beyond perfection to a point that it is crispy yet chewy!!! Not sure how that happened but I really need to try more paninis and see if they all taste this good!  Then the chipotle flavor coupled with load of chicken was just awesome!  (Yes, this was my dish!)

Service was wonderful too!  Water was always filled to the rim without requesting them to come by to do so, and they also allow dogs to be right by the gate so our buddies can share some food with us!  (not inside but at least near us)

Price:  Very reasonable!  Majority of the dishes for lunch runs no more than $15 and good portions too!

If you are in the Sin City and craving Italian, do help your wallet a favor by giving this place a visit instead of some fancy Italian joint inside the casino... you won't regret it!

So glad we ended up here last night!

We started off at Texas De Brazil but the wait was over and hour and a half! Then we tried Tommy Bahamas and they were closed for a private event!

Finally we happened upon Brio and their wait was over an hour!

We slipped into the bar and as fate would have it a table was getting up to leave right as we walked in!! So we swooped the table like the stealthy women we are and all was right with the world.

We had an amazing server! We had a few drinks and I have to say their Raspberry Mojito is a must try!

We started with the Carpaccio appetizer and it was absolutely heavenly. Like I'm crazing it right now at 8:00AM just writing about it good.

For our main course we had the Steak salad and the Salmon salad. Both were ginormous portions and incredibly tasty. Neither of us were able to finish them and we left incredibly satisfied!

This will definitely be a go to for girls night!

Wooo, very great food and great service. Thank you Mary! I applied a coupon on yelp, then I ordered a tomato mozzarella(appetizer) dish which is good for diet( low calorie). And it was very delicious! After lunch, I was told the lunch was $0 balance! A surprise!   I will definitely come back with my friends and highly recommend!
Loved loved loved it. Great treatment, great food and atmosphere! A top favorite of ours to visit and order delivery from with #doordash.

Great meal. I had the shrimp and crab cakes. They were a bit small but quite tasty. If you are very hungry, I would order an appetizer first. The spinach and artichoke dip was very good. A little on the pricey side but well worth it for a nice lunch meal.

They have an awesome happy hour, but unfortunately we missed it by 5 minutes. No one else's fault but ours. I had a corona and my husband had a couple long islands. The bbq chicken flat bread was good, nothing special. This place kind of never hits the spot for me, and the food is always just O.K. This time we even knew the assistant manager but it didn't help that the restaurant was so crowded and servers looked a little overwhelmed. I really like the atmosphere thought, so might go back again for happy hour.

Nice restaurant food is great . My advice is don't sit outside , there were Pigeons all around our table , so gross ugh .Their Sangrias suck they are so bitter my friend had to doctor hers up not cool .

I have lived in Europe and wanna-be-Italian restaurants in the States are just always disappointing to me. The only thing I liked there was the fresh bread. My husband ordered the grilled salmon over angel hair pasta and I had the risotto. The grilled salmon was very plain and almost dry.. really nothing special. A small piece of salmon over a bed of pasta... The risotto almost made me cry.. It had BACON in it! The bacon flavor was so overwhelming I really couldn't eat it. Don't give me wrong I do like bacon BUT not in ITALIAN risotto... Thats just wrong! Sorry! Service wasn't perfect either.. We paid about $40 for 2 people (small appetizer included) no drinks and I left the restaurant hungry and unsatisfied.

The staff is always very attentive and the food is solid. There is nothing amazing about this restaurant it's consistent. I feel this 
may be my most ambivalent review yet but I am just not moved emotionally either way on Brio. I will go pro vs con and see if that helps. 
Pro . Nice beef carpaccio 
con. Not many anti-pasta you would expect. Marinated Veg, Charcuterie, or maybe roasted carciofi 
pro. Nice size pasta bowl 
con. Although I love Ricotta and Vodka sauce this dish was a little 
blah. 
pro. Outdoor seating 
con. chair was so tight and uncomfortable I found myself fidgeting the whole time
pro. Cold Peroni and glass
con. Dirty glass
pro. location is very convinent
con. Chain(BBRG)
I am gonna go with 3 strong stars just can't go 4 on this one.

On a recent trip to Town Square to return some items, a friend and I decided to eat lunch at Brio Tuscan Grill. It was around noon on a Friday, and since there was a wait to sit inside we decided to sit on the patio. 

The overall attitude of the hostess worried me a bit... She wasn't welcoming, did not try to engage us in any conversation, walked way ahead of us, and did not check to see if we were ok with the table she put us at. And we weren't, as soon as our waiter came to take our drink orders we asked to be moved to an area that was slightly shaded. 

After checking over the menu I was unable to decide so I decided to ask  our waiters to help. We had multiple waiters, one was being trained by the other. Between the snooty hostess and trainee-waiter this could have been a disastrous lunch but thankfully the waiters  did a great job together. They convinced me to to try the citrus garden salad with shrimp. My friend had  the mezza chicken under the brick. 

The bread did not come out until after our food, but our food did come out pretty quickly. My salad was huge, had lots of perfectly cooked shrimp and the linguine was surprisingly good, which made me happy since I was worried I wouldn't like noodles on a salad. The dressing was a light lemon vinaigrette, and the dried cranberries and pecans were nice compliments to the cilantro and peppers. 

Based on how quickly she devoured it, I think the mezza chicken under the brick was pretty good as well! 

Total damage for our 2 lunches and 2 ice teas was right around $30 before tip. I am looking forward to visiting Brio again during happy hour.

My first time to Brio Tuscan Grille.  I know, I know...I've been missing out.  I love me some Italian food, even though I don't get to eat it much.  Based on their menu, there's enough of a selection for everyone.  

There's even a "Lighter Side Menu", which I chose to partake in. Lighter side choices range from lean steaks, chicken, salmon, salads, and some white fish (i.e. Mahi Mahi and Tilapia). Of course, I went with their 5 oz Filet Brio.  This was served with asparagus and sweet potato.  You can't go wrong with grilled asparagus and their sweet potato was amazing.  My only issue with both...wish I had more.  As for their 5 oz filet, I had this cooked medium-well.  In the last 2 weeks I've had steak at least 3 other times at well respected steakhouses.  No joke...I think Brio's was up there in tenderness, taste, and presentation.  My entree was less than 400 calories and a little over $20.  Bang for your buck without a bang on your nutrition!

The ambiance was great. You gotta love the tall ceilings.  Our server was great as well. I know that this is an Italian restaurant and I didn't get anything Italian.  But their steaks are good and for that alone, I am a fan.  


YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE 2013 - (485/500)

Me and my girlfriend went here for restaurant week and this was a good choice. The deal was good and the food portion wad a lot, we took food home so that's always a good thing. For appetizer we had the tomato bisque and the bruchetta. For the main course we had the lobster and shrimp pasta and rock fish they were both good. For dessert she had the termusu and I had the cheesecake. Food was so good we will come again for sure.

Started with the Lobster Bisque which had just the right zing of spice followed by a caramelized pork chop cooked to perfection. My lovely wife had the Mushroom Ravioli de Bello which was outstanding. The seating in this restaurant and outside patio was spacious with space to pull out your chairs without touching the adjacent guests. Service in the restaurant was fast but not so much in the bar. Overall it was a great value and experience.

We were looking on Yelp for a good seafood restaurant near the Phoenix Mayo Clinic tonight and found Brio Tuscan Cafe had good reviews. Not only that, but Yelp offered a free appetizer. We were so glad we tried it! Our appetizer, Roasted Garlic, Spinach and Artichoke Dip, was yummy, and our entrees were uniquely prepared, presented, and delicious. I had the Grilled Salmon Fresco, and my husband had Shrimp Verduta. Can't wait to return and try some of their other wonderful options!
Nice Italian place. Food is nice, service is amazing, and my girlfriend and I all had a great night at here. Thank you Brio.

5 star for the best resturan that i ever gone for great pasta , kind castomer and good location . My husband and I usually go there we had a great times every time, I recommend to going there  my favorite juice is lemonade strawberry

Matt r was a great server it was my first time coming and had a great experience to be honest we were going to Texas day Brazil but for some stupid reason they're closed at lunchtime on Mondays and Tuesdays so we ended up here and it was probably better the Hostess were hot too 


Back again and LOVE jessica from Ohio.  Great service.  So friendly.  She was so nice I'm not even gonna leave the comment part about how they messed up my pasta and it came out 15 minutes later....    oppps just did.   But the food and service was great

Indulged in happy hour today! Great drinks and very reasonably priced appetizers (under $3) until 6:30 at the bar, who could ask for anything more? The bar was busy, but finding seating was not too difficult. The service was great and bartenders attentive. We tried about half of the appetizers on the happy hour menu and all were great! The steak brochette, their version of the shrimp cocktail, breaded ravioli's exceptional. I had a Bellini (which is a frozen drink at Brio), which was perfect sitting at the patio bar on a warm evening. Brio is going on the "must frequently visit" list!

We went to this location on Christmas Eve we were celebrating our anniversary. Everything was good but later that evening I got really sick! Violently sick! My husband called and told them but we have not got any kind of response back! I would not recommend going there!
Beef carpaccio, lobster bisque, any of their salads. Awesome happy hour. Mmmmm bellinis! Chocolate peanut butter pie! Now I want brio!

Planned on dinner with the hubby tonight and we sat in a booth in the bar area.  Waitress takes 10 mins to come by.  This should have been my first clue.  We ordered water. We finally are able to order about 20 minutes in.  We ordered an app and 2 entrees. Oh and the app is free cause I used the yelp check in. As we are waiting and starving another 1/2 hour goes by and still no food. Then the power goes out. I see the waitress tend to all the other tables and I'm trying to flag whoever I can in the dark for an update. The hostess walks by on her cell phone and she said that they are still cooking food. Another 10 mins go by and still no food and I see the waitress on her cell phone and tending to the tables outside. Now the tables around us, the waiter places candle so they can see but not our table. I started to get up to talk to the manager and as soon as I got up she ran over. She said that she's been busy with the tables outside. And I said that we are sitting in the dark not knowing what's going on. She said last time this happened it took 3 hrs for power to get back on and that they are not cooking any food now and we could wait. So almost an hour in, we get up, starving and leave.  I know the power outage is not her fault however the extremely poor service is no excuse. So the one star is for the awful service.
great food..spicy shrimp with egg plant and lamb chaps are amazing

Love to come here for HH and all their great appi's. Tonight was first time coming for dinner and we were not disappointed.  Our waiter, Danny was personable and attentive and only here to make everything to our pleasing. The spicy shrimp and eggplant appetizer is our favorite and what keeps bringing us back. And we love to bring our out of town guests in to enjoy it as well. Enjoyed Danny and the whole staff!  Thank you.

Last Sunday I paid $70 to get good food and horrendous service. I guess if you're ever on the run from the cops and want to hide in plain view then sitting at the bar top at Brio in Gilbert could be a very viable option for you. I even reached and emailed their corporate office and not surprisingly I did not receive a follow email or call. I will certainly not be returning here.

Service was lacking. It seemed like our table
Didn't matter. We ordered food the waiter didn't remember and we never got. We had to keep asking for things and he would never remember. It seemed like our money wasn't important enough. The floor ma anger came by with the same lame concern. Wasn't good enough. 

Finally got food, SALTY, Salty, salty! Yuk. I love Brio, but Town Square has better service, and food was much better.

Very nice (read fancy) ambiance, even in the bar area.

My BFF and I came here for dinner one night. The raviolis were sooo good. My BFF had the chicken pomodoro, but since she's a vegetarian they had no problem subing in eggplant (which she said was delicious). Their raspberry cosmo is really good, and not too strong. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. All in all a great visit. We'll be here again!

A much better place than CPK. 
The food quality is better and the customer service as well. 
AND THEY HAVE RAVIOLI!!! I love their fettuccines. The flavor, texture, everything is perfect. My favorite is their artichoke dip appetizers. Omg, i get this every time before i order our entrees. I am a very loyal customer so once you get me going, i will return. And this is my second time here. 
My first time was the best. The waiter was also the server and he looked like he enjoyed working there. If i was able to request who my waiter is, and if I remembered his name, i would have done it in a heartbeat. Unfortunately, i cant because the second time, the customer service was so off. My waiter was great and friendly, but my server was not. He just threw the bread onto the table(it even slid upwards). Like wtf? Crapper server. Pissed me off. And then when he brought my dish, he left the plate half hanging off the table in front of me. It could have easily fallen all onto me but I grabbed it and pushed it in. Something he should have done because I can easily burn myself from that. Usually, all the waiters will tell you to not touch the plate. This guy just leaves it half hanging from the table and expect you to take care of it yourself. Also, when he came to pay time, i waited for a long while and had to ask someone else if I can get the check and to go box. :/ my waiter just disappeared on us. 

However, i will still leave this a 5/5 because i personally love all the other waiters. Especially the waiter from our first time being here. He was so ecstatic to serve us and take our order. He has really good opinions on what to eat and everything. The food itself has always been delicious. The first and the second time, I can honestly say I rather go to brio than cpk. The pricing is only $2-$5 more expensive than cpk but its also $2-$5 worth more than cpk.

*edited, changed it to 4/5 since the manager here completely avoided my concern about how the server during my second visit was rude.

Pleasantly surprised at the quantity and quality of food here.  The kids meal portions are HUGE!  I cannot see a kid actually finishing their meal here.  Though I thought the food here was a bit on the salty side, the food was tasty.  Service was average.  Prices a little on the high-side.

Love the decor in this restaurant- it makes it seem very upscale and authentic to European cuisine. However, the prices are too steep and portions are too small (compared with the nearby Maggiano's). The service is nice and the complimentary bread has some variety, which makes it quite interesting. Here are some dishes we've tried:
- Pasta Brio: the most unique of the bunch & quite tasty
- Shrimp & Lobster Fettuccine: rich sauce, would've liked more seafood though
- Campanelle Carbonara: slightly disappointing and very run-of-the-mill flavor

Great food, reasonable price, good ambience.  Always some talent to see. I would recommend either a Friday for the bustling energy or the happy hour specials. Best time to be here.  I will have to say that the service could be better.

I love this place. Its good simple Italian Food, drinks are great and the service is on top of it. The moment you walk in they are very welcoming and happy. 

The Best: Food Food Food
I love a simple pasta with great service.
My girlfriend and I especially enjoy the desserts! Lava Cake! Amazing

Brio Rocks
Was okay.. Very generic menu . Entrees do not come with a starter salad or soup.. Service was okay had to ask waitress for Parmesan .. Not attentive and felt like we were avoided  and rushed

I love the little shopping center in Tivoli Village.  Patio seating, bar, and regular dining is offered.  I came here expecting Italian food (my usual is the lobster & shrimp ravioli) but went with the 5 oz. filet instead.  It was cooked perfectly - honestly one of the best steaks I've had!  It cut through like butter, the flavor was amazing, and I gobbled it down.  The portions are really small at Brio.  I was expecting my plate to be a bit more loaded for the price I pay compared to hole in the wall Italian restaurants found in Las Vegas.  I'm not talking about the filet, but the pasta dishes are rather small.  Otherwise my experience was positive from the food, the server, and the restaurant setting.

My wife and I received a gift card to Brio and since we had heard great things from a few people we decided to stop in for a quick dinner. 

We only had an hour due to a conference call that was scheduled for 6:30pm. When we arrived we told the waitress that we were short on time and ready to order right away. She seemed annoyed at us and said something like "well I'm taking drink orders now." I replied that she could get our drink and food order at the same time. She seemed miffed!

We ordered the bruschetta sampler to start, thinking it would come out quickly. It did! The bruschetta was for the most part pretty good and a good value. It wasn't as authentic as I would have hoped - the chef's seem to decide what they think bruschetta is themselves. We might be a bit biased because my wife and I had sampled bruschetta all over Italy during our honeymoon in October. Bruschetta = B+

I don't even remember what we ordered for a main meal, which we decided to split (another goofy look from the waitress)... What we got was plain pasta and a brick of over cooked chicken-something. The good news was it came out fast. The bad news was it wasn't worth eating. I was too hungry and in too much of a hurry to send it back so we choked it down, refused dessert, got our check and left. 

I hope to try Brio again some day. All of my friends said our experience wasn't typical so maybe we just caught a bad waitress on a bad day, and a bad cook on a bad day. It could happen, right? 

Oh and one more thing. I'm only 155lbs and the chairs on the patio squeezed the crap out of my rear end. Those are the most uncomfortable chairs I have ever sat in. Unless you are 110lbs you should sit inside. Come to think of it - maybe they did that for a reason to keep the skinny people on the patio and the "regular" people hidden inside. :)

Our server, Robert, was great. He knew just when to approach our table and when to give us a moment to have our dinner and socialize with our friends. I would give 5 starts if the salmon salad I had was better. The salmon portion was delicious. However, the salad portion needs some changes... for one, the asparagus still has its stalks and therefore you had to spit out chunks of the end instead of being able to consume it whole. The salad was also a bit mushy... I'm not sure how to change this, but if it can be done, I would highly recommend it. And lastly, the forks can use an upgrading. I was thankful to have an extra fork to use when the first one felt as though the prongs were bent in different ways... unfortunately, the second was similar in fashion although not as severe. 
That being said, the atmosphere was great! We'll be back and I'd love to try a different dish.

I ordered through door dash and had it delivered. I had the camponelle carbonara, nothing special about the dish, the Alfredo sauce is very bland, greasy, and basic. There was barely any chicken and for the price, proportions are very small. You are better off going to the Cheesecake Factory for pasta. The calamari frito misto is overpriced and basic. I love calamari and this is probably the worst I've had. There wasn't even lemon to squeeze on the calamari. Everything is overpriced honestly except for the kids meals. The best thing they have is dessert, both of their cheesecakes specifically. The tiramisu is dry and awful.

1. I love that they now have a GF menu. 
2. I love their shrimp and crab cakes (not GF but worth cheating with)
3. Staff is always friendly, helpful and on time.
4. Beautiful terrace seating in the Summer.

This location is great after a few hours of shopping.   Since we were there fairly early, we were able to sit out on the terrace which was really nice.  Trevor was our server and was there promptly to take our drink and food order.  He mentioned fresh bread would be coming out of the oven in 3 minutes and sure enough, it came out piping hot and fresh.

I had the lasagna, which is a huge order and came out hot and gooey, just like I like it.   My husband had the veal milanese with a side of linguini Pomodoro.   The veal was very tasty, and the only complaint he had was that his food was not very hot.

All in all, good choice.    Service was excellent and food was very good.

Brio Crocker Park was disappointing November 18th.  The lobster bisque was too salty, very thick and fishy smelling and tasting.  Three of us sent it back to the kitchen.

The shrimp and eggplant appetizer (which I've ordered before) was horrible.  Again, the shrimp salty, overly-seasoned, and the shrimp were over-cooked, shriveled-up little things,  lacking taste.The sauce - drowned the shrimp & eggplant- and was meh.

Not returning to this location.  Legacy Village will be my go to from now on.  Or, until a new head cook is hired!

We had a luncheon for a friend's birthday today at 11:30am and all went well. I had an appetizer the shrimp and eggplant - it was delicious.  2 waiters were great. I think I would give 5 stars if we didn't have to ask for bread and coffee. The parking garage is a bit confusing and seemed to be busy today.  We had a few empty chairs, but 11 people is a good size group.
Thank you Brio staff for a good lunch!!!

Booked my 8 year anniversary dinner at Brio via their website which linked to Open Table. I made a note that it was a special occasion AND called and spoke to one of the hostesses around 5pm advising of this.
The atmosphere of the restaurant is very nice, if a bit loud for a romantic dinner. The spinach artichoke dip was the best I've had, the desserts were amazing, the drinks were well made, and we were asked by two managers how everything was. All good things.
Unfortunately, I ordered the shrimp and lobster (I think) pasta that was pretty bland and did taste like it could have come from Olive Garden. My wife ordered a chicken risoto which she seemed to like. 
Overall it was good, but nothing special was offered, nothing was comped even with ordering 4 drinks, 2 main courses, and 2 desserts. I even wrote "Anniversary?" on the credit card slip hoping it may prompt a call back. It didn't.
My overall feeling: so close, yet so far- especially for the $110 we spent.
Went here for afternoon drinks and appetizers. Our server Andy was super nice! The outdoor atmosphere was perfect for a beautiful Saturday afternoon. Both the food and peach bellinis were delicious!

My boyfriend and I received a gift card to brio and we decided to try this place out for an early Valentine's Day lunch. Everything from the ambiance to the service was fantastic! The decorations all around were beautiful, and the high ceilings with the curtains really caught my eye. 

Our server, Cortney, did an amazing job coursing out our food and handled all of our requests. 
We had calamari and the shrimp & eggplant for appetizers. The runner who brought them out even said they were the two best things on the menu for appetizers, and he was right! The shrimp and eggplant had a peppercorn sauce and grated cheese. SO DELICIOUS. And the calamari had fried peppers in it and came with two sauces, one that was tomato based and the other mayonnaise. For entrees, my boyfriend had crab stuffed shrimp and lobster tail. He didn't care for the orzo and broccoli on the side, but I found it delightful! It also came with lobster bisque!!! And I love lobster bisque. I had the chicken limone. Delicious was an understatement. It was seasoned perfectly & nice and tender. I am so sad that I was too full from the apps to finish it, but at the same time, i can't wait to warm it up later  Cortney boxed up our calamari and my chicken and even gave us to go sauce for the calamari. Her kind smile and great service really made our first time experience a great one! 

Overall, from the low prices, big entrees, cute decor, and amazing service, we will definitely come back!

I have been to Brio a few times for happy hour, full-on dinner, and just drinks when shopping at Town Square. As another reviewer mentioned, I am not especially 'jazzed' to be writing a review for a chain like this.. but it is what it is. 

Had this never been a part of Town Square I would not ever have heard of it I don't believe. So having said that.. I had come in for dinner a few times. I am that guy when it comes to a non-belief in "American Style Italian" or whatever Brio claims to be.

As for the quality of the food.. it isn't bad.. just nothing spectacular. Lately My friends and I have been dropping in for Happy hour on Thursdays as they have a $5 'martini' menu along side their daily happy hour of $2.95 'Tuscan Tasters'' .. 

The thing is, they get so swamped with customers during happy hour, that the service gets seriously patchy. I'm totally down for someone hustling amongst the tables they are waiting on, just trying to do the job and make some descent money.. in fact I can appreciate it. It's the consistent mistakes on the bill, the negative attitude, especially fromt he bar staff, and the disregard for any style of customer service from the staff. There is constant conversation about everything but work, and in a very loud way. 

I honestly know that this is literally a step in some direction from a place like 'Chili's" or 'Friday's" but with the environment of a bit higher end restaurant that they are trying to create.. you would hope for more is all I am saying. 

In the end of it all, I would be back for the Happy Hour.. as it's good prices and descent nosh when you are shopping or heading to a movie.. but I think I will be looking for other options when I am next down at Town Square. Happy Eating!

We always enjoy our dining experience here...
I love the atmosphere-the high vaulted ceilings,the lighting,outside seating is neat too accompanied by a fire pit for those chilly nights. It is so pretty inside like you are about to be a witness at a wedding!!!
The service is quick & I never encountered  a rude employee (yet)...

This place is one of the few places that my daughter enjoys (too picky)!!!
There hasn't been a dish that I have sent back. The bread basket is not only filled with soft bread but you get crispy flat bread with sesame seeds as well...The Pasta Fra Diavolo (Spicy Shrimp wih Angel hair pasta), Cheese Ravioli, Ravioli Caprese(Crispy Cheese Ravioli) & the Wedge Salad are just a few of our favorites. 
I just tried Fettuccine Napoli which has Smoked chicken,carmelized onions, broccoli, tomatoes,& chili flakes. The chili flakes is what sold me and sadly, I felt these chili flakes were just flakes minus all the chili. Not spicy at all-what happened ? I also had to add salt (I hate having to add salt to anything).
So even though this dish was a miss for me I can still appreciate that just because this is a good restaurant doesn't mean you are going to like everything. Brio can tend to be pricey....
We will be back....

My husband and I love this place! Food is always amazing and the Lobster Bisque is seriously addicting it is soooo good!! Gustavo the executive sous chef has gone out of his way to accommodate my sometimes very particular requests! We have always had great service but a huge shout out to Valentina who did such an amazing job and was so sweet! Probably one of the best servers we have ever had!!

I went here last night for a business dinner and was quite impressed. Our table had the Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant appetizer as well as the assorted Bruschetta Quattro - YUM!!  We were also treated like royalty, I might add, by the staff. Of course, it probably didn't hurt that one of my new co-workers used to work with the General Manager! LOL

For dinner, I ordered the Citrus Chicken w/Shrimp Scampi and Orzo. Wowwee wow! Tasty - went well with our bottles of White Oak Chardonnay. 

I didn't have any dessert (I'm trying to lose 7 lbs), but did try my new director's Creme Brulee and it was HEAVEN in a dish!

Came here for a friends birthday.  It was about 12 of us in total.  Everything started off great until it was time to recognize the birthday boy.  (I'm going to rewind about an hour into our dining there was a birthday party in front of or table. About 4 waiters sang happy birthday and lit the birthday dessert as well as clapped and celebrated which is what I've always been accustomed to when parties are being celebrated at restaurants). Proceeding with our dining it was time to celebrate our birthday boy with the same song and excitement.  1. Our waiter LIED and said the restaurant DOES NOT SING HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO GUESTS.  2. THEY BROUGHT OUT HIS CUPCAKE, QUIETLY SO PPL AT THE OPPOSITE END OF THE TABLE DIDN'T EVEN REALIZE IT HAD BEEN BROUGHT OUT. The reason this irritates me is don't lie to me after I just witnessed your courtesy to other patrons and don't hush hush a celebration that was shared at your establishment.  3 stars because the food was good.. took long to come out though.  No refills on drinks,  waiter seemed overwhelmed and irritated.. felt rushed out even though people were still ordering desserts.. I won't be back.

I've had several very enjoyable meals here in the past.  I would strongly suggest the spinach artichoke appetizer!  I've never been disappointed!

My mom and I decided to stop for a snack while we were in Town Square.  We tried the tasters menu...$2.95 each.  So good!  We had the raviolis and baked mozzarella brushetta.  Very satisfying!  Hit the spot!  Nice little portions, perfect for splitting.  We agreed ordering 1 or 2 more would've made for a filling meal.  

We both really enjoyed the food and portion sizes.  However, our favorite part of coming here was the service!  You have to sit in the bar or outside on the couches to order the tasters menu.  We sat at the bar and actually had 3 different bartenders waiting on us!  Each was more pleasant than the next!  Very nice to have attentive service!  Each of us are planning on inviting co-workers or friends for a happy hour to enjoy the tasters.

Tried Brio for the first time tonight. It was good. I very much enjoyed my dinner and the atmosphere. Came in around 6:15pm and we were seated right away. Our waitress was attentive and got our drinks out quickly. I tried the berry acai Italian soda which was just okay, I probably would not get it again.

The bread that was brought out before our entrees was very good. A combination of sourdough and a crispy baked focaccia type cracker bread. My sister and I both had Caesar salads before our meal and they were great. I ordered the pasta fra diavolo which had campanelle pasta with a spicy vodka cream sauce and chicken. I asked for it extra spicy and it was delicious. My sister had the ravioli di bello which was a portabella mushroom ravioli with a mushroom cream sauce, I tried it and it was also very tasty. 

Service was great throughout the meal. Food was wonderful. Prices are moderate but worth it. Overall good. I will be back.

Not impressed. I'd been to Brio twice before (once here and once in California) and this time, out with friends, will probably be my last time. While our waitress was very nice, she was forever missing in action and when she would take our table of 8 drink orders, she'd return with only 5-6 drinks, the others would sit thirsty. We'd flag her down and politely ask if our drinks were coming and she's look through her notepad and look confused, then 10 minutes later deliver our remaining drinks to our parched friends. Salads and appetizers ordered, again, a salad is missing and as two of the three appetizers are brought to the table, the third elusive appetizer never arrives. Meal orders placed, all miraculously arrive. I ordered the Pasta Fra Diavolo, which, by its name alone signifies it is a spicy dish. Ugh, no. Quite flavorless honestly. Bland as the napkin on my lap. My husband ordered the Under the Brick (or something like that) Chicken, he said it was not very good, again, lacking in flavor and depth, he was disappointed. Other items ordered was steak which was said to taste very gamey and sat on the plate next to the watery mashed potatoes. Lobster and Shrimp raviolis were said to be okay, but not fantastic. The friend who ordered the Blackened Tilapia said it was very good, however the plate next to her was the Chicken Milanese was not good at all, overly salted and dry. 
Our check took forever to be delivered. Once we paid it was $113 per couple, including a cocktail each. I usually am not super high maintenance, but I felt like I had to beg for a refill of water or the check. The food was not toothsome as one would hope. Big let down.

Three separate times my girlfriend and I have had issues here.

1. We came on a day when the restaurant was fairly empty, maybe 5 tables in the whole place. Food took forever, waitress would disappear for a long time.  Everyone has an off day but this did leave a sour taste.

2. My girlfriend wanted to have her birthday party so we wanted to go visit the restaurant and while there set up the party. We arrived and the wait was 45+ minutes.  No biggie but we didn't have time to wait.  She asked if the manager was available to discuss a party of 20+.  The hostess was extremely rude. Had she said, "I am sorry, the manager is busy right now so may I take your information?" then that would have been fine.  But she was like "The manger will not see you right now. We are in the middle of dinner rush." in a very rude voice.  We called later and the manager said he would have been happy to see us and that she was indeed being rude.  He did not try to salvage the party reservation.

3. Last night we went again. It started off great with the waiter seeing to our needs. We got our appetizer and soup and then he disappeared for a long time. When he returned he informed us that he had forgotten to put in our dinner order.  He took off one soup, which was nice of him, but in this situation the manager should have visited the table.  We were there for a long time and left with a bad taste in our mouth.

We love the lobster bisque but will not return.

My wife and I had been to Brio twice in 2013 and loved it both times! Unfortunately, this year was a major let down. We were quickly seated upon arrival...and that's when the speedy service came to a halt! We waited ten minutes before the server came for our drinks order. Upon receiving our drinks, we quickly placed our food order. During our wait, we received a basket of stale, old bread, which stayed at our table until we were finished with our meals...it was a waste basket by this time, but the server left it there anyway.

At this point, our expectations were low. And when our food finally arrived 35 minutes later, we were even more disappointed. My wife ordered the rather expensive Beef Medallions, which she had order before and loved. The presentation was sloppy and the food was simply flavorless! It tasted neither good nor bad. I ordered the the Carbonara...an Italian classic. It was mediocre at best. I would compare it to perfectly microwaved Marie Calendar!

I do NOT recommend this restaurant. The only good thing about our time was the conversation we shared with each other...we can pay a lot less money for good conversation.
Beautiful interior.  Nice patio area.  Staff was very nice.  our food was very good.  Our server had nice suggestions, everything was delicious.

Went into Brio the other night as SQ is close to home.  The restaurant was very nice looking and being as it was happy hour I took a seat at the bar.  The bar staff was very friendly and I was happy to find out they had some awesome deals for happy hour.  I tried their shrimp and eggplant appetizer and it was amazing.  I'm not usually a big veggie guy but between the shrimp and sauce this dish is delicious.  The bread was warm and fresh and I ended up using too much of it to sop up the sauce from the appetizer dish and made myself full.  Can't wait to come back and try more.

Our waitress was awesome!  She had us right at a little table next to the bar at a couch where I could put my feet up.  They were busy back there making drinks, yet she was super attentive and down-to-earth.  I had the margherita pizza and it was heavenly.  My husband had a pasta dish that was amazing and I kept stealing his side of vegetables.  The bruschetta is amazing too!  This is a great place to stop any time of day if you are doing a little shopping in Town Square.

The staff goes out of their way to make sure we have a positive dining experience. Servers are always pleasant and attentive. The kids menu has excellent and well priced options. Thanks Brio for feeding us!

The service was great, very attentive to our needs.  The food was fabulous, flavorful and elegant.   Cooked to perfection.   We had the Gorgonzola created steak medallions and spicy shrimp with eggplant.   If we lived closer I'd eat here all the time.   Way to go Brio crew, Chris was our waiter and did an excellent good meeting our needs.

Hands down my favorite Italian restaurant! I probably eat here 2-4 times a month (especially happy hour, can never go wrong with happy hour), it's just that good! Once you come in, there's kind of like, an Italy-feel atmosphere. Which I love because it feels like I'm eating lunch or dinner somewhere in Italy. 

Their service is PERFECT, they're very welcoming and always introducing themselves in a friendly manner. I come here too often to the point where they recognized who I am and my order, kind of embarrassing but at the same time, am proud to be a regular! 

Unto the food, so far I've only tried their tuscan grilled pork chops, beef carpaccio (this appetizer is a MUST), filet mignon, and some pasta. ALL of it were perfectly cooked. I'm very picky when it comes to eating meat and I'm just so glad I found a restaurant that are consistent with grilling their steaks. Although, I've been ordering my usual (pork chops and carpaccio) the last couple of visits, I think it's time to expand my options, but I shouldn't have to worry about getting something that I won't like because brio never disappoints. I highly recommend this place!
We thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant.  The ambiance was wonderful. The food and service were amazing!
Great food and ambiance.  Amazing service. We would go back and request our server Whitney.

Resonable price 

Service team was challenged being short handed

Food was good for the $$

Not bad 


yelp requires a novel for a review to get posted - Its like yelp is a frustrated former English teacher make you write a 10k word term paper when a one pager covers the topic

Nothing worse than ordering your food, going to the bathroom to wash you hands, and watching a server walk out of the bathroom stall and then walk straight back out without washing his hand and start serving people's food. While you stare at the sign that says "all employees are required to wash their hands" . . . . Never eating at this location again.
THE best Italian food . Decor and a service are 5*.Eggplant appetizer is one of my favorite ever. Everything tastes delicious.

Brio is one of my favorite places, especially for the Lasagna, but today was a huge disappointment! I ordered the Eggs Benedict with asparagus and potatoes. The eggs were fully cooked through, the potatoes were cold and hard, and the asparagus was dry and wilted! The best part of the meal was the Mango Mojito! If I return it will only be for the Lasagna and Mojitos!!

I love Brio! We were there to celebrate my daughter's birthday last night. The restaurant is pretty the food is good but last night the service was above and beyond! Our waiter was AWESOME! He worked hard to make it a special night for my daughter and her friends!
Despite the noisy open air atmosphere, I loved the food. Calamari is awesome and pasta is fresh.  Cheesecake was so-so.
Amazing service, fantastic food. Manager stopped by and was so pleased with how happy we were he comped our drinks as a thanks. Will definitely be back!

I've only been here for happy hour, but it's great! 3-6pm and 9-11pm, $2.95 taster menu with 8-10 items on it, drink specials on wednesdays. I've had everything on the taster menu and it's all amazing!!!  A friend and I shared 3 items and were stuffed.  I've had the pasta a la vodka, also amazing.  Definitely worth a visit!!!

We came on the evening of Black Friday - there was a 20 minute wait for the indoor seating but they could seat us right away outdoors. We were hungry so we chose to brave the elements. It was a bit chilly - to be certain. We were glad for our jackets and I ordered a hot chocolate.

The decor was nice, outdoor tables could maybe use a few more heaters on the cold evenings. We loved the idea of the fire pit though it's not super comfortable for dining - better for drinks/appetizers I suspect.

We started with the ravioli appetizer. It was quite good, though perhaps could have used just a tad more tomato/marinara sauce.

I ordered the steak and I have to say it was one of the best steaks I've ever had. Perfectly cooked, much larger than I expected, perfectly seasoned.  Nicely done sides of mashed potatoes and vegetables.  Really outstanding. The rest of the table seemed to enjoy their dishes as well.

Service was friendly, professional and attentive.  He made a small mistake on the check in not crediting our free appetizer coupon but immediately recognized and fixed it with an apology.  

The only downside I can think of was it being a bit chilly, but we can't fault Brio for the weather. Look forward to going back on our next trip to Vegas.

Came here for my brother's birthday last night. It was my first time and I heard good reviews so I was excited. The sourdough bread and crackers they brought out first were delicious. There's a Yelp check in offer for a free appetizer with purchase, so I ordered the roasted garlic artichoke and spinach dip. So yummy! It comes with a Parmesan flatbread. For my entree I got a Caesar salad and the Fettuccine Campania (fettuccine with spicy marinara, capers, kalamata olives, basil and parmesan). Really good! I normally don't like pasta but this was an exception. I didn't like the salad, too much dressing and cheese. My brother got a mini dessert, key lime pie. Yum. It was great overall. I loved the nice decor and the bathrooms are swanky and smelled good. They have a private dining area and a type of sunroom with a fireplace.

We will call this Strike One. It's hard as busy parents with 3 kids to get a night out.
Came here on Friday night, Expecting it to be busy. We were told a 30 min wait for a table for 2. After about 15 mins we received a text message (great idea and system) to let us know our table was almost ready. We returned and checked in at the hostess stand. We were told we would be seated in the next 5 mins. After 30 mins had passed and everyone else waiting had been seated the hostesses overheard my wife and I discussing the wait time. Then one of the hostesses came over and asked what our name was. We told them. They went back to their screen. Then they asked us if we had checked in with them as if we had never existed. (Pretty much looking at us like we were no longer in the waiting que.) At this point it had been 45 mins since our arrival, but 30 mins since we were told we would be seated shortly. They looked at each other like we were not going to be seated anytime soon. As the 3 hostesses looked at each other like "uh oh what do we do" we said we will find somewhere else and we walked out.

Unfortunately my family and I had the worst experience eating here tonight. The only positive was the view while eating outside. The lobster bisque soup we had was not only cold but tasted terrible. Then my brother had the lasagna which was also cold and tasted terrible he couldn't eat it. My pasta had no flavor whatsoever. Very disappointed. Why was that kind of food given out. I'm just in shock.
Love the environment and set-up. Trendy with a bit of class. I had there egg plant apetizer and it was amazing! The sauce was great!
Went here for Mothers Day with the family.  Up-scale italian food.  Service and food were good.  I would go back there again.  Check it out some time.

Went to Brio on 1/24th for my birthday dinner. We were seated right away with a very friendly hostess staff. The restaurant was busy for a Monday night with several large parties going on. Our waitress was outstanding and very knowledgeable concerning the menu and timeliness of expediting our food. The food was outstanding, lobster risotto and scallop risotto was very good. Thank you Brio for making my birthday so special.

Really 2.5 stars...

Ok. I would definitely say do not come on a holiday. We came here for Father's Day. I made reservations a good week in advance knowing that it would be busy. We were seated 10 min after our reservation time which was 11:30. Our server did take our drink order fairly quickly about 10 min after we were seated and took our food orders about 20 min after that. I knew it would be busy so I expected to have some kind of wait. We were seated right next to the kitchen and so I could see what was happening. We finally got our food around 1 pm but the part about it that bothered me was that I could see my kids pizza sitting underneath the light for a good 20-30 min. In my opinion, I feel that they should have served that pizza right away since they know it's for a kid. So we finally got our food and it seemed like everyone enjoyed their food minus my kids because the pizza was rock hard. I made a comment to the server about it but he didn't respond. Ok, it's whatever at this point. I think there should be a better system when it's a holiday or just in general. Food shouldn't be sitting underneath that hot lamp for the long anyways! Overall, service was lacking (I was trying to find my server a few times to ask about the pizza and to get refills) but we only saw him twice after he gave us our entrees. I'm assuming it's better when it's not a holiday but I would definitely skip it on a holiday.

I do like Brio regardless of its "chain status." It has never been a disappointment to the palate. I decided to come here for lunch....I've never been! I ordered the Crab/Shrimp Cakes.....delicious! If you are starving, I wouldn't recommend this plate or you can order an appetizer if you are that hungry. There were large pieces of shrimp and it was tasty, but a lil on the small side. It came with crunchy potatoes (much like potato chips) and some zucchini, carrots, onions and red pepper mix. My favorite entree from Brio are the pork chops. Their pork chops have always been so tender and juicy...its literally to die for. Yum! As always, me and my sweet tooth....loves the creme brulee sampler. I like Brio and I can't deny it.

I always enjoy my time here. The food and ambiance is amazing. What I order: Artichoke Crusted Fliet Mignon with mashed potatoes, house salad, Shrimp Verduta (angel hair tossed in artichokes, shrimp, garlic, sun dried tomatoes, feta, spinach, with pesto and bread crumbs), and their white peach sangria. My family usually orders all of these and splits. My mom always asks if I want to check out other restaurants when I am back home, but I always insist on going to Brio.

My friends and I have been coming almost every Wednesdays for months. We come during happy hour and sit on the patio. Usually, the host is very helpful and we are sat right away. The happy hour prices are very nice, their Tomato Mozzarella salad is awesome! That's what I get all the time.
However, we do not come here for the service, that's for sure, to be honest, it is quite horrible. Which is the reason why I only put 4 stars.
I came here for dinner a few times as well, their pasta are delicious!

Welp...I don't even know where to start. I have eaten at this exact location several times and always enjoyed the food, service and atmosphere. Had reservations for Easter Sunday at 4pm. Really it wasn't very busy at that time. Our server had one small table and ours (party of 8). He was so odd, weird, said all the wrong things while trying to joke, put in wrong food orders, some of our food came out, others were not ready. The set up they had for larger parties was horrible...The servers have to walk by with trays over the customers heads...it was super dangerous. Just an overall bad experience and definitely will not be back here for awhile!

While I love this place & the food is great as is the service, I find being seated beyond irritating. In an empty restaurant, consistently being offered the worst table because of "server rotation" is just unacceptable . How about customer preference?

Came to Brio for their happy hour. It was Bomb Diggity! Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant is a must! Outside seating is sooo pleasant. 

As for service that depends on the person. I sat in two different areas. The first server wasn't too pleasant, but the second was phenomenal!

One BIG complaint... although outside seating is wonderful, there happy hour outside seating is not so nice... limited to about 12 - 20 people. One star off for that one.

I'm going to agree with my friends Stefany and Clint. 

 I must quote Clint, "The food is medicore at best".

We went there with my son and his wife. The last time I went to a Brio was the Town Square location, with my wife, on our second date, four years ago. It hasn't improoved in that time. 

My chopped dinner salad was a good portion, but very dry and tasteless.  My wife had the "big" pork chop. It was big and meaty, but very dry. My daughter in law had a chicken dish worthy of a cheap buffet. I forgot what my son ordered, but I tasted it, and it wasn't very good.

The service was very good. Our bread baket was constantly refilled, our drinks always full, and when my wife complained to the manager about her dry pork, the manager did offer a substitute, but we were already full (mostly of bread).  She did send a comp'd desert as a way of saying "sorry".

Even though the service was very good, I would say it was a Rich Man's Bucca Di Peppo, with smaller portions, and an alternative for a High School Date to The Olive Garden.

Ordered the Mezza Chicken Limone, and it basically was coated with an omelette. It was supposed to be a piccata, but instead of an egg wash and flour dipped chicken, it was coated in a thick layer of scrambled egg. Sent it back but was given the same again. 

I'm a big fan of piccata, and have ordered the same dish here before, but sadly they've forgotten how to make it. 

I googled an image of this dish to verify how it should be made, and there are loads of Brio images that don't include the coating of omelette. 

I'm now left disappointed and with a rumbly tumbly.
I come here for happy hour often and in my opinion they're the best in Vegas! Great happy hour prices, wide selection  of drinks and plates, and big portions! This location doesn't hurt either ;)

I'm totally coming back here y'all, oh lord. Right off the bat, the place can be loud and busier than other restaurants, but given the location, I think this is expected. 

I came here for dinner with my mom and her friend and we started with a round of drinks at the bar. I ordered my usually Moscow Mule and was underwhelmed. Maybe it's because I had been sick a little earlier in the week, but it definitely did not rank as one of my top favorites. 

The food totally made up for the drink though!! We started with the Calamari and the Bruschetta Trio Sampler.
