I've never had bruschetta, but I really enjoyed it, especially the one with the prosciutto, ricotta and bell peppers. I think this was the chef special for the night, but I hope it's available for more than one night. 

For dinner, I had the Lobster and Shrimp Fettuccini and WOW YALL. So good!! Slight spice, wonderfully creaminess and a portion that was out of this world ($22.50 I believe and I still took some home). 

For dessert, we had the New York Style Cheesecake and Creme Brûlée. I love me a good creme brûlée, and this was def one of the best ones I've had. I wouldn't have ever come to this restaurant on my own, so I'm really glad my mom and her friend decided to take a different route for dinner.

Came here for the happy hour which recommended by my friend that lives in Vegas but I guess we came on the wrong day because it wasnt happy hour. She said that all appetizers were $2-$3 and drinks and that was what i was hoping.....well, since we were all already here we just order some drinks and some appetizers.  Suprisingly it was not too expensive but would rather have it during happy hour though!

Pretty nice atmosphere especially the female bartenders!! They're pretty hot!! Great location which is right in the middle of the mall but the parking is horrible.  Maybe because we came here during New Years weekend, bad choice.  Highly recommend this place.

We've been to Brio every time we visit Vegas and never had a bad meal or service until the evening of Monday April 20th. We were disappointed with the lack luster service (if you could even call it service) and room temperature food. Cold mashed potatoes are just gross and a server that is never around is just sad. It's to bad because the food is usually awesome and in the past we loved the creme brûlée enough to make a special effort to go there when we're in town. With so many other restaurants to choose from, Brio will not be one on our list again for a long time if ever.

I've been to this restaurant numerous times over the past few years and I just can't resist coming back. Whether I'm meeting with friends for an early Sunday brunch or grabbing a quick cocktail after work during happy hour, I'm always thrilled with the quality service I receive. Not to mention, their happy hour prices are insanely cheap! My favorite combo is the red sangria and the black pepper shrimp, which are a part of the regular happy hour menu, but if you're looking to spice it up a bit, each location has their own set of chef specials so you can always try something new to please your tastebuds and add a bit more variety to your pallet.

My partner and I decided to give Brio a second chance. This time, our experience was so great! Our waitress was super sweet and attentive. The food and drink suggestions were accurate based on her observations.  It was a much pleasant visit.  We were very satisfied about the entirety of our food and our service.
I want to thank the general manager for taking time to make sure we were taken care of.
It made us feel welcomed and comfortable.
I will continue to give my patronage to Brio.

Had our friends birthday dinner here the other night and it was great. Fast service. Food was delicious. Anthony was our server and my wife and I ordered the salmon salad to share and he came out with it already split for us. Our water was refilled every time we got half way empty. Thanks for the great service Anthony! Definitely recommend this place.

Went to brio for a nice dinner. it had great service (as to be expected). Server knew his "script" well, but didn't know much else about the dishes. I ordered the Shrimp Verduta and my girlfriend ordered the sweet potato something risotto. we also had the quattro appetizer of bruschetta.

The bruschetta was ehhh, nothing special it, was all really standard dishes. The steak one had a nasty smokey tanginess to it that i didn't like. Overall i was not impressed by any of the four types of bruschetta.

My dish was alright, i could have made something a lot better on my own. I would eat it again, but i would not order it (if that makes sense to anyone). Shrimp was cooked nicely, the sauce was just there.. it wasn't anything to tell anyone about at all.

My girlfriend's dish was wack. I didn't like it at first. It tasted a lot better as a leftover the next day. I don't think it is something i would order again or even eat if i got it for free.

This place is nice to go, but not for a romantic date. It is too loud, i would call it a step up from carraba's. It was really busy there, 20-30 minute wait for a table for 2. Next time i am going to do italian food in that area i'm going to maggiano's.

At least i had a free appetizer's ticket from the yelp event earlier this year! sweet...

Love this place. I've only been twice but everyone wanted to come grab something after a movie. It was a little chilly by walked over from Harkins (nice that it's close) and we go to walk by the stores on the way. Got the lobster bisque and Cesar salad. Was great. Lots of flavor and seasoning. It was a little bit fishy but wasn't a problem. Awesome environment and just fun.
That is the worst food ever I ate in my life. my God chicken was raw not cooked the mash potato is cold the a asked them to switch the beans to pasta they forgot oh triable.

There was nothing overtly above-average about this restaurant that would warrant a solid thumbs up. We walked in with no reservation, and when we were seated prior to our estimated wait time we were pleased. That came to an end by the time we were seated. We waited around 10 minutes to be introduced to our waitress and get our orders in. There was an average of 20 minute increments between getting our drinks (besides water) food, any refills and the check. This was a Thursday evening towards the end of the night, no reason at all for service to take that long.
As far as the food goes, it was okay. The spinach dip appetizer was hot and full of flavor, definitely a large enough portion to share with 3-4 people. I had the Campanelle Carbonara which had an overwhelming flavor of bacon. It literally took over the entire dish. My boyfriend had the Chicken Limone which was a nice well-rounded entree between the meat and veggies. Dessert was a Torta Di Cioccolata and was the best part of the entire meal- melted chocolate inside the cake complements very nicely with the scoop of vanilla gelato.
Maybe we'll come back for Happy Hour next time, I've heard good things. Hopefully we score with better service than this evening.

When ever we come in, it's always beyond busy so rather than wait an hour for a table, we usually request to sit at the bar bc there's hardly ever a wait, service is quick and they have tvs for those days when we wanna watch a game.

Carpaccio is my FAV here, I crave for the damn thing. Unfortunately I get too full off of that and the dinner bread that I don't really get the chance to try anything else. DISCLAIMER: I don't eat very much so appetizers usually do me fine as an entry-- don't judge me.

The ONLY complaint that I have about our visits to this restaurant is that the parking SUCKS. We end up putting the car in Valet than bother with parking.

Ambiance was good, service was good but the food was forgettable. Nice outdoor seating for the fall or spring season, view of the passing traffic, foot and vehicle. Their dessert was their savior and only reason why I am giving them 3-Stars. 

They had shot glasses filled with different desserts: Vanilla Creme Brulee, Milk Chocolate Caramel Cake, Tiramisu and Strawberry Cheesecake. We, husband and I, shared them. I like little samplings like this in places that you're unfamiliar with their food, it allows you to taste some of their desserts without having to order a large portion of something that you may not like. 

Brio isn't a place that I'll be visiting again, at least any time soon. I wasn't wow'd by anything that they had. The dessert was good but not outstanding.

I'm writing a review solely to the HH. 
I was able to try a few items when a friend hosted a BBQ and had the food catered. I was really surprised at how good down of the dishes were, and went to the restaurant the next day. 

Their happy hour deal is AMAAAAAAZING, since you can try their signature dishes for a potion of the price. Too bad it's only on weekdays, but it is definitely worth checking out.

I was not fond of the alcoholic beverages whatsoever...the mojito didn't taste like a mojito. They hadn't crushed the mint leaves so the flavor was one noted. We had to ask for mint too, since there were two leaves in there. 

The Manhattan was just terrible. 

Let me move onto the food though...
Flat bread pizza - 5/5 stars
Shrimp and zuchinni - 5/5 stars 
Beef carpaccio- 5/5 stars 

Everything else was 3-4 stars delicious!

3 Stars - Food. The bruschetta was good but not outstanding.  Insalata caprese was very good with nice mozarella.  The pasta vodka was overspiced, overcooked, and unimpressive.
2 Stars - Atmosphere. Much of the silverware was dirty and had to be sent back before we even started. The restaurant itself was very loud and felt more like a shopping mall than a restaurant. 
1.5 Stars - Staff.  Bored, unattentive, and seemed bothered when we ordered. 
1 Star - Price.  Go elsewhere to get intimate or authentic.  Come here if you want to show off poor spending choices for a friend or relative you don't particularly like.

Husband and I went here today on a whim. Hungry for any lunch and driving down Scottsdale Rd. we found this place by accident. Never heard of it before and if the menu wasn't appealing, we were going to go to Sol for Mexican food. The menu had Lobster Bisque and we were sold. 

The inside is vast and very open, with high ceilings, enormous "chandeliers", and draperies. Everything is burnt yellow and pale orange colors with simple artwork decorating the walls. It was nice, but not my favorite. Looking around, I think we were the only diners under 30 - except for the one baby. Everyone else was either in their 40s or much older. This didn't look like our typical lunch crowd, but we didn't feel out of place.

I ordered the crab and shrimp cakes with roasted vegetables and hubby ordered the soup and salad - lobster bisque and Caesar. A bread basket came out, with half a mini loaf of sourdough and 3 pizza slice sized crackers with miscellaneous spices on top. Sourdough was good - hot and fresh. Hubby liked the crackers, but I didn't try - too messy.

The food came quickly afterwards. Mine was really good - especially the crab cakes. Only two cakes came on the plate on top of sauce, but there was a heaping vegetable portion. The cakes were soft and moist - the crab and shrimp very apparent throughout and delicious. Hubby's bisque was good, with visable chunks of lobster. Certainly not his favorite, but he said he would eat again. 

Overall, the food was good, but it wasn't spectacular. Also, later we found out Brio is a chain restaurant and for the most part, we try to avoid those and eat locally. If in the area again and have a craving for lobster bisque, we'd eat there, but probably won't be back.

Surprisingly uncrowded for Sunday afternoon.  Big portions, lunch prices for the win!  I wouldn't go for dinner because its overpriced IMO, but avoiding the crowds by going at off times and hitting it up for $14 lunch size pasta is a fair price in a non-chaotic environment.

My wife and I came for a quick lunch during one of our visits to LV.  Knowing that we were in a little rush, they brought our food quickly with a smile. The service was courteous and speedy. Try the creme brûlée!

Nice discovery ! Kitchen and service was professional and clean. Just no time to finish our dishes that the server has removed our plates...
Good place to eat quietly outside !

This review is only for their happy hour. I came here a while back for their dinner menu, but I don't remember my experience then. That'll be a future review.

Their happy hour is legit. I would say better than Yardhouse happy hour, but then again I'm not a big fan of Yardhouse. Their food menu is great. Multiple options for only $3.95 each!!! And drink specials are only $5!! And they aren't little skimpy appetizers either. Order about 2 or 3 items along with drinks, you'll definitely get full (well at least I did.) 

We ordered the spinach artichoke dip, shrimp piccante, margherita flatbread, brio burger and 4 cocktails. All came out to $35!!! Not bad for an afternoon of food and drink. Their peach sangria was definitely tastey and I was already on my second one even before the food came. All the items we ordered were delish. Good portions with a lot of flavor on each. Easy to share and reasonable on the price. The bar was busy so the bartenders weren't really on the chatty side. In conclusion, I would say this was a successful happy hour!!!

There is a thin line between taste and haste I rarely get to Summerlin met a friend at Brio we ordered the chicken limone Got Served the pesce Piccata decided to just roll with it... the presentation was delightful the dish was so uninspired even after asking for crushed Chili Peppers short of dumping Himalayan salt fresh ground pepper maybe a bit of garlic or something on it I just found it the most bland dish I have had in ages

Honestly,the best place I've eaten at! 
Definitely the best Italian place we've ever eaten! 
So so SO good!! Our server was amazing as well! Just great time overall. Can't rave enough!
Came her on a family dinning trip and food was very good, my wife loves the lasagna here. Service was good. We will definitely return
All their food are super delicious, love the ambiance, and their waiters are friendly and will be there whenever you need them.

Brio is one of my favorite places in Town Square. The decor is beautiful and they have great food. I have been here several times and the service is usually great. I feel like it is better when you sit at table rather than the bar. I prefer to come here during happy hour (3:30 to 6:30 pm) because the prices are more reasonable. They also have a late happy hour which I believe starts at 9 or 9:30pm. They have the most delicious shrimp and eggplant dish that is available for happy hour.  It is called the SPICY SHRIMP & EGGPLANT Pan seared shrimp, Romano crusted eggplant, black pepper cream sauce for $12.75 regular and half off for happy hour. I also love their Imported Bottled Peach Tea peach tea. SAN BENEDETTO for $3.25 each. They also have a nice kids menu with activities and crayons to keep them busy when I bring my 8 and 5 year old. They loved the food and feel like we are going to a fancy place because everything is so clean and nice. Town square has a lot to offer so if you drink here you can head to Blue Martini afterwards to dance.
Great lunch at brio! Get the quino and chicken salad and skip the fruti de Mara. Really nice atmosphere

Located in town square. 
Wonderful ambiance and awesome happy hour. 
Great place to grab a bite to eat after doing some retail therapy. 

Outdoor patio. 
Full bar. 

Brio is somewhere in between Olive Garden and an authentic Italian restaurant. Not horrible, but not quite THERE on the amazing Italian restaurant list. 

All the waiters are incredibly friendly. If you aren't in the mood for pasta they have healthy salads and meat dishes available as well. 

Come here after shopping in town square, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come to this restaurant.

Went here with my family for dinner on a Saturday and I would definitely recommend making a reservation, as it is extremely busy on the weekends. There's an open bar with first come first serve seating. It took us about 10 minutes before getting seated with a reservation, and the service was friendly and our food came out fast.

For an appetizer, we ordered the Bruschetta Quattro. It was a little overpriced and overall just okay. For entrees, all the plates were huge and sharing is probably best. I ordered the Chicken Milanese and thought the crust of the chicken was very crunchy and made the overall plate delicious. Other entrees ordered were the Bistecca Alla Fiorentina and Gorgonzola Crusted Lamb Chops. The steak was cooked medium rare (medium is probably good if you only want a little pink) and very flavorful. The lamb plate came with 6 chops and the gorgonzola flavor was a little overpowering, but the lamb was tender and still good. Both plates came with creamy garlic mashed potatoes and some steamed vegetables. For dessert, we got the tiramisu. The whipped cream on top was carbonated which was an interesting surprise, but not necessary. The cake itself was very delicious though. I would come back to try other dishes!

Consistently good.  Good service.  Good location.  They messed up my order, but made it right and took care of us.  We left happy.  Even if something goes wrong they make it right.  The food was great.  We will be back again sometime.

I wish they had an option for less than one star-- my mom and I came in for happy hour and found a high top- sat and waited for over 15 minutes without anyone even greeting us. We walked out and they lost a customer out of both of us.

The best happy hour menu! Their beef carpaccio and brio burger are my two favorites! The only thing is that their happy hour is only at the bar and its first come first serve. It gets filled up pretty fast so you have to get there early.

Service was terrible. Horrible. 
I spoke to the manager about it at the time and he was unwilling to do anything for us, explaining that "the person was new and it was a busy day."

then I yelped it, and the manager or owner (like on several reviews here) wrote to me assuring they'll make things "right" if I'll remove my Yelp review. 

I did so. That was four months ago. We tried again, but were treated about the same.

I wish I hadn't taken down my original posting, but I do have the letter here on Yelp, that was written by Brio, saying if I'd take it down, they'd make things right. :(

Never again
I can't even describe how much I love this place, service and everyone who works here period. Been coming here every Wednesday for past 2 years. It's literally my second home.

Okay, it's a chain. Finding a restaurant that's not a chain in Phoenix is a challenge, to say the least....for the most part it comes down to finding one that's part of a smaller chain (rather than, for example, an Olive Garden or Red Lobster), and that's what Brio is. 

That said, the food is quite good. We got invited to a free lunch here just before they officially opened, and it was good enough that we returned as paying customers. The dishes are reasonably authentic compared to what you'd get in Tuscany region, and the service is superlative. Great appetizers, great desserts....in short, one of the few places in the area that's not a carbon copy of everything else. Pricey but not unreasonable, and certainly worth it.
The best adka vodka pasta I have had in a long time!! To die for. Service was great and love dinning there every time! I haven't had a bad meal yet!

What a pleasant surprise that I received a phone call from the general manager and when I  return from vacation I'm taking him up on his. offer for a complementary lunch/dinner. The general manager was warm and friendly on the phone and I look forward to meeting him!

Came here for an early dinner with a friend I ordered the steak salad, The cauliflower, and the brussels sprouts. The salad was very good however I did not like the Gorgonzola it was a little overpowering. I was told that the sangria, white sangria,was very very good but did not try it. I saw a few state dishes and even a lobster dish that looked delicious so I will be back to try Brio for dinner. The ambience is very pleasant especially with the outdoor seating just be prepared to have sunglasses if you decide to come on a sunny day.

Met my POPs for dinner here while in town for the evening. Started at the Bar with a lovely Mendocino Petite Syrah.. moved to a table where our crew joined us after shopping all that Tivoli Had to offer . What a nice experience. We each ordered something different and all were delicious . Therefore, it's a safe bet that since we had 5 completely happy satisfied bellie's.. whatever you order will be perfect. The staff is absolutely wonderful. Everyone smiles and greets you no matter where you are in the restaurant. 
Since this is a regular place for my POPs.. I will make it my destination dinner each time I come to town. 
Cheers!
This is one of my favorite places! I've been coming here since I moved to Gilbert 3 years ago. The service is always great and TJ is the best bartender ever! Always entertaining!

-happy hour regular; so posting just for HH, not restaurant. 
-can get very crowded to no seats in happy hour area, and people don't move that quickly to vacate.
- bar service can get slow, two bartenders for HH rush hour?  not enough. 
- HH food is a good deal.  pepper shrimp!  
- sometimes the food can come out cold, my flatbread pizza is hit and miss

Came here for my cousins rehersal dinner and the first dish out was the lobster bisque and it was one of the best things ive ever ate !!!!!! AMAZING, I could have ate 10 more bowls of this and forget the main dish.
the main dish i got some chicken dish that i dont remember that well. I do remember that it was over pasta and the pasta was great, 
I also had 2 GREAT dirty martinis ,

My wife and I went there on a week night the food was ok but the service was slow.
My wife had there signature salmon dish which was good and I had there signature Shrimp dish, shrimp was excellent but was buried with rice and vegetables.
The employee at the Apple Store across the street had more personality then our waitress. Asked for a second glass of wine when my dinner was serviced and when I was done eating they serviced to me told them no thanks them the waitress came back and said it was on the house again told her no thanks I just wanted it with my meal, oh well.
They told us they have a location in our home state but don't think we will be visiting that location.
Need to do something about the wait staff big time.

We have eaten here twice so far during their happy hour special. We have enjoyed every bite! We tried every appetizer on their happy hour menu and especially enjoyed their burgers and shrimp cocktail.

Omgeeee so good. It was my first time me and my kids enjoyed our food and experience. Service was good. They did forget to bring us a high chair but it was no big deal, so we didn't bother to bring it up to our server. Over all it was great we will be back

Wow. I had the Lasagna this time, and let me just say one thing about it: Amazing. What's funny is the kids spagetti was good too lol - I think next time I will get it ... It was good AND big enough of a serving after eating all the bread and stuff.  I love Brio and can't wait to keep going back and trying more on the menu.

Cheesecake Factory is way better. This place has very slow service and the hostesses seemed stuck up. The food wasn't all that great either, but the appetizers are pretty tasty. I think this place is way overrated.
Great food and beautiful location. Perfect place to chill with a drink and an app. Would recommend to anyone.

Brio had great atmosphere and food!

Cocktails: cucumber Basil gimlet, was so super tastey.  It was like freshest, coolest lemonade I've ever had. My favorite item by far and it was only $7.50!
I also had a glass of Sketchbook pinot noir and it was nice with dinner and reasonably priced at $9.00 a glass.

Food: The caprese salad was good quality ingredients and reasonably portioned. My only complaint is it def needed more balsamic. Their balsamic is a good one by the way.
We also had the lasagna bolognese. This item was really tastey. Nothing crazy extravagant and certainly nothing to complain about. It was just a great item 
The prices were pretty good in my opinion. 10-20 a person without drinks.
When we got there we were seated on the patio. The weather was fantastic so that only added to the awesome atmosphere. 

My only complaint for the evening was our waitress. She was a total bug a boo. I felt rushed and like she wanted us out of there. 
However, the staff was amazing other than her and I can tell she was the only annoying staff member.

This review is on their happy hour. They have really good food and drinks for cheap! The ambiance is also nice. The outdoor seating is cute and a great place to hang out. It gets pretty crowded for HH though so you might need a little luck to find a good spot.

This was our first time here and we were celebrating a very special occasion. So we were hoping for the best...and that is what we got! The service that we recieved that night was awesome and the food was delicious! We will definitely be back!

5 stars all the wayyyyyyy!  Cinnamon was a great server!  She made our time there the best!  She was so attentive and pleasant!  Next time we are there, we will definitely ask for her.  I asked her to bring a small dessert to my friend who was celebrating her birthday.  She made our time there so fantastic!  Food was awesome...  So glad that we chose Brio's.

I love the food here, but the service is never good. We come  at least once a month, have different servers and it's still the same story every time. The water never gets refilled, we have to wait way too long to order and way too long to get our check.
The Parmesan crusted chicken salad is to die for. My husband just had the Smore's dessert and it was amazing! You have to try it!

Brio Tuscan Grille is a chain of formula restaurants serving Northern Italian  inspired food, much like Maggianno's Little Italy  is a chain that serves more Southern Italian inspired food.

It has about 30 locations and is HQ in Ohio. There is another one in Gilbert, AZ.

The decor is sumptious and large, with high ceilings, dark woods, draped white cotton materials in archways and to the center of the dining room, with Tuscan marble color inspired motif in beiges and terra cota, and faux terra cota wall textures in golden orange hues.. 

The bar is a classic marble top with dark wood storage canopy overhead, and several booths where there is no wait. The dining room is very large, almost ballroom size. There is also a large patio for snowbirds to enjoy the Scottsdale winter weather. 

I-Pop plays incessently on the speakers. (I-Pop is Italian top 40s music, not the latest music player from Apple!)

The food is Tuscan inspired but has an American slant to many dishes and ingredients. And like Maggiano's, the dishes are HUGE!

I sat at the bar for lunch and ordered from the Primi portion of the menu (meaning first, or appetizers) a Beef Carpaccio ($9.95) and Spicy Pepper Shrimp on Grilled Eggplant ($9.95).  

They were served in long narrow oval dishes. The Carpaccio was in a plate about 18 inches long! Nice raw beef, covered with olive oil, capers, and a streak of Aioli. In the center was a stack of arugula in a nice, sweet, but light dressing, and served with 2 triangles of brittle cheese infused bread crackers.

The Shrimp came in a rich cream sauce, with each shrimp laying atop a breaded and grilled Melanzone, or eggplant wedge, with a healthy dose of black pepper throughout to spice it up. The flavors were great, but a little overdone in richness and peppers, and too oily in the eggplant. 

They serve fresh warm bread and herb seasoned cracker wedges with butter, complimentary. Iced tea was $2.50.

Service was very friendly, and professional. All staff wear white shirts and Ties, like you would find in most restaurants in Firenze, Italia..

This is a great place to bring family and friends in the beautiful new Scottsdale Quarter mall, which is still under construction and right across from the higher end Kierland Commons on North Scottsdale Road.

Duh Solid!  I love their ambiance and their food is very tasty.  I've heard complaints that it is a chain resto but seriously doesn't feel like there is any lack of service.  The waiters are usually very well mannered and competent.  One quick tip is to check out their Happy hour (even on friday nights!) totally worth it and the prices on the food is RIDICulous for the quality you get!
Always consistently pretty darn good! the menu is huge! prices are a little more then olive grade, place is ginormous with an amazing patio and bar!

I've been to Brio a few times.  This was my first visit to this location.  I had a chicken and Quinoa salad off their low calorie menu.  Very good.  Also had the tomato bisque  which was excellent!!!  Service was good.  Everything about lunch was good. Good spot for a business lunch.  I would definitely come back.

We went for the amazing happy hour deals, but the bar was too full for us to find a table for our girls night out.  We sat on the patio instead and had the greatest server ever, Brandon.  

The strawberry basil lemonade was incredible and the food was so tummy.  But the true highpoint of the night was Brandon.  He was kind, funny, knowledgeable and clever.  

If you have Brandon as your server be kind, he deserves it.

Great food with a lovely view of shopping area on outside table service. Only problem I had was keeping my napkin on my lap due to the wind! Brunch is served til 3 pm. If you're in Vegas check out this restaurant!

I've eaten here twice now for dinner about 6 months apart and my experiences have been similar (not bad, not outstanding, and I would go here again but it is not at the top of my list). The place is expansive, loud, and has an upscale chain-like feel to it and it is very busy around the Happy and Dinner hours. My group scored some seats in the bar on my last visit while waiting for our table and I will give them good marks for some straight forward and affordable adult beverages. 

The luster decreases a bit in the dining room. The decor is upscale in appearance but the service and volume detracted from that. Servers were not always around when you were looking for them and the noise level was so high that our table of 4 could barely hear each other and had to keep leaning in throughout the evening to ask the person speaking to repeat themselves. It was my impression that the servers were short-staffed (I literally saw 2 of them at close to full sprints on a few occasions trying to get back to the kitchen to pick up ready meals at the pass) while our table sat unattended to. The noise level was accentuated by the lead chef who was expediting by occasionally yelling (literally screaming) at the kitchen crew. It was entertaining at first as I like to watch chaotic kitchens get their rhythm but this did not occur throughout our meal and the outbursts became a little distracting after a while. 

The menu is a bit unfocused in my opinion and seems like it tries to offer something for everyone as American chain restaurants like to do. Portion size is good and the food was tasty but not over the top great. One gripe is that their $6 side of Brussels sprouts was pretty measly and it took about 45 min for food to hit our table. That sort of confirmed for me that the kitchen did not have its act together on my last visit.  

In the end, I think an "A-OK" rating of 3 stars is right on. I've had better and worse meals in my life and I like enough aspects of Brio to go back but it is not the place that I think of first when searching out dinner in Scottsdale.
Food great but the best happy hour in Vegas!!! Price is really low & great sizes to share. & the drinks are like the price of a soda

I'm a regular here and the past THREE times I've come here something always goes wrong mostly the food isn't right and it goes back to the kitchen then I have to wait and eat my food and it's cold. It's get tiring ridiculous it makes me not want to come back to this restaurant because they can't handle someone's order....

I wanted to LOVE this place since we were planning to reserve a room for our daughters birthday but we've had a change of heart. While our server was a bit slow, which was understandable since it was a busy night. But my husband's order(short rib) was frozen! Seriously frozen inside. How does a restaurant charge $20 something for a frozen meal?! This place is nothing but an overpriced Olive Garden. Without the awesome soup and bread!

Located in Town Square on Las Vegas Blvd. Let me get this out of the way, I am not a big fan of pasta (It's boiled dough for cryin' out loud) and ordering chicken at a restaurant (unless it comes in a bucket), that being said they many other options, and just salmon, actual beef! This is a great date place, only because women really like it, as a matte fact I may be the first male to review this place. And the only reason I have ever been here is because of a date many months ago. (the date turned out badly, the meal however was quite good). So fellas take your lady here, you will both be happy. Oh I almost forgot download their app for groovy deals and offers. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

I love coming to Brio when I wanna be casual classy. Ya know, classier than Yard House, but not paying Fleming's classy prices. 

One of my favorite date night restaurants. Great decor inside, good food and good selection of wines. Awesome service. 

My 4 stars is mostly for the ambiance and not so much the food. The mushroom ravioli is pretty good, but when I went this past weekend, it was so-so. I'm hoping the next time it'd be as great as when I tried it the first time. Orrrr I should probably order something else. 

Who doesn't love free bread? I usually wait a while to eat mine so I can use it to soak up the sauce from my pasta. 

Overall it's a decent experience here as long as you don't set the bar too high. But it's great for any occasion: catching up with friends, date night, family dinner and I even came here for my birthday once. 

Good place to check out while you're at Town Square Mall.

I love this place, my food has always been wonderful. Hats off to the chefs. Unfortunately like I have seen in previous reviews the bar is definitely not the place to sit. Being in the industry for more than 15 years and a bartender I generally sit at the bar and can be critical I am sure. The problem is a server had to actually help me. When the bartender came finally I was never greeted. She never checked to see how my food was until nearly done. I sat without a drink for awhile. I am usually forgiving but I am one of two people here and the fact that most of the time she just kept gossiping with a fellow worker. I know all the juicy news. I know this happens but it shouldn't to the detriment of your two customers. I still recommend the place maybe just not the bar area! Shame!

This restaurant is located in Tivoli Village, an upscale mixed-use retail and office development. The restaurant offers classic Italian fares, such as Bruschetta, pasta pesto, pasta carbonara, etc., in addition to a nice selection of appetizers, fish, chicken and steak dishes. I tried the pasta carbonara; one of the best I've had this side of the Atlantic. The serving was generous enough that I had no room left for dessert, so I am determined to go back for more...

One of the many restaurants located in Scottsdale quarters. Mix of American and Italian food. We went for lunch. The pasta entrees were great. One of the salads came without the dressing but that was taken care of immediately. Checking into yelp does get you a free appetizer. Service is friendly as well 
This place has an excellent happy hour with several great food items.

Celebrated our 35th wedding anniversary at this restaurant. The place reminded me of Cheesecake Factory, but on a higher level. The dining area is adjacent to the bar so you can see the three TV's. It's not a very romantic restaurant, used Open Table to make reservation and added a note about our celebration.
When we arrived, we had to wait about 10-15 minutes because they were backlogged. When we were seated, the table had two red napkins shaped as a rose. The manager came by and gave each of us a complimentary glass of champagne.
When I logged into Yelp, there was a coupon for a free appetizer which we used for the Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant. It was delicious and not that spicy. 
I ordered the Shrimp and Lobster Fettuccine and my wife had the Jumbo Lump Crab Cake dinner. The fettuccine was cooked al dente, excellent and the sauce was superb. My wife's crab cake was awesome with the tasty fingerling potatoes.
To top the dinner off, they offered us a free dessert to choose from three. We selected the Brio's Famous Cheesecake. That hit the spot. I ordered coffee which came half full.
The server needs to pay attention and ask additional questions: Do you take cream with your coffee, (so I can get a full cup) and when I ask for a knife, don't wait 20 minutes and get remind. 
With our check, we received a note from the manager congratulating us and offered us a free appetizer on our next visit.
Now this restaurant knows how to entice their patrons...customer service is what it's all about.

Weather was perfect for outdoor dining. Had the shrimp & lobster ravioli with a Caesar salad. Salad was perfect. Ravioli was delicious; tender shrimp with lobster ravioli and a sauce with a little heat. Service was quick! Great dining experience!

We went to Brio for our 4 year anniversary and were very disappointed. It was our first time ever at Brio and we've heard good things so we thought we'd try it. Our server was great, but the food not so much. We don't mind spending extra money on good food but we ended up spending extra money on mediocre, bland food. My boy friend got raviolis which were 16 dollars and came with 5 bite sized raviolis. My pasta was bland and I ended up adding extra pepper to it just so it could have some flavor. We ended up spending over $100 on bad food.  Needless to say, we won't be going to brio ever again.
I've been here a few times for happy hour and am never disappointed. The appetizers are amazing and the drink specials are very well priced. I recommend the spicy shrimp!

The food is great but the hosts are nasty. At the Brio's entrance two young guys (host) giving arrogant look and waited until we ask them for the table. Excuse me, not me, they have to be hospitable to ask if we want to have a table. Anywhere in Italian restaurant hostess speak first not the guests.
Great Italian resturaunt off the strip.  Didn't go during Happy Hour but everyone says it's a bargain.  Food quality excellent and nice decor.  Had the lasanga and it was awesome.

Had lunch with my boss at this place last week. Very nice on the inside, surprised to find out this place was a chain.

Had the tomato bisque and split the bruschetta sampler. Both plates were excellent. Everything was freshly made (our waiter reiterated this fact several times). My favorite bruschetta had the caramelized onions on it. Also, I loved the mini deserts. Great way to have something sweet without paying/eating too much. I ordered the Bread Pudding and it was AMAZING. I

The food was great however, the service was horrible. I am a server at a fine dining restaurant myself and I must say.. the service here was below average. Rachel was our server.. She had no personality nor did she try to up sell a single item on the menu. I like to offer my guests a glass of wine or a beverage to start. It seems like she just wanted us out of there because we had 2 young teens with us. I felt like we were rushed and not given the proper service we deserved. I made a reservation through open table and noted a birthday.. She could've at least greeted us with a happy birthday? Instead when dessert time came around she just left the dessert menu on the table without even explaining to us what was on it. I'll be back for the food.. But definitely get out of Rachel's section! I have better customer service at McDonald's. At least the workers there smile and are polite. I'm now on my way to have drinks elsewhere

I've been here a couple of times, but most recently I ate here for a work dinner. Each time I eat here I am reminded that I shouldn't judge chains so harshly. This one is doing it right with food and service.

Our service was very good, especially for a large group. Our drink orders were taken immediately and brought out quickly. They also did a good job of keeping up with fresh drinks for the heavy drinkers. Our starters came out quickly and meals followed shortly after. Every need was addressed right away by our waitress. 

I started with Lobster Bisque and the Chopped Salad. The Lobster Bisque is well flavored and the serving is perfect for a rich bisque. The Chopped Salad has a nice variety of vegetables and black olives with a tangy vinaigrette. I liked that it's chopped for easy eating. 

For my main entrée I ordered the Pasta Fra Diavolo with Shrimp. There was plenty of large shrimp in the dish and the sauce packed the heat I was looking for in the dish. The portion was plenty. Paired with starters I was only able to eat half and enjoyed the other half for lunch the next day. 

All of the dishes ordered at the table looked delicious. The next day everyone discussed how happy they were with their entrees and that we were pleasantly surprised by our Brio experience.

Let me just say do not order Chicken Under the Brick. Without the marsala on it (I ordered sans due to a dietary restriction), you can easily tell it is a very cheap, flat cut of chicken. Not whatsoever worth the price. It looks okay in the pictures I've seen on here but again, without the sauce it's pretty pathetic. 

That being said, it was quickly replaced with a house salad that was excellent, my grandmother ordered the steak salad which looked fantastic too. I took a couple bites of the steak which was a well-prepared, good cut of steak.

Our server was really great too!!! The bartender was also accommodating even though we had a server. Excellent service here all around. 

They have a *very* small craft beer selection but had what all I needed. 

Despite the chicken mishap, I'll definitely be back. They probably would have been a 3 star, but their excellent server saved them. I'm docking one star for the chicken, but if I had an entree comparable to the steak salad in taste/quality I wouldn't have a problem updating with a 5.

This place is pretty dang awesome for a chain!

We went here for an early birthday dinner celebration in the later evening. They were pretty packed, but service was still good. It's very pretty and romantic inside, so it's a nice place for a date or a bachelorette party. 

We ordered the chicken milanese and the sausage pomodoro. Both dishes came out fairly quickly, and tasted wonderful! It's probably hard to go wrong with any of the dishes though.. everything smells really good! I also opted for the peach bellini, which was fruity, sweet, and totally did not have a hint of alcohol! 

They also have a pretty good menu for happy hour on weekdays! :)

Love Love Love Brio.  The food here is delicious and original, not to mention they have a fantastic Sunday Brunch menu that can help kill even the worst of hangovers.

Service is prompt and the prices are all extremely reasonable, and there's always a ton of seating and I've never had to wait for a table.

Huge portions that I always have a hard time finishing, though I always try really hard!

Went in for lunch the other day.   Nice place. Service was very good.  The food tasted great.  But i guess the lunch menu the portions are smaller.  For the price. Its not worth eating there at lunch.  I ate all my food and walked out hungry.  As good as food was  i cant see going back for those prices. Our bill was 50 dollars for 2 lunch meals and 2 iced teas.
They have the best frozen peach Bellini drinks for brunch. The stuffed French toast is also delicious!

This has been the BEST restaurant we've ever been to in Vegas and I've lived here my entire life!!! We had the sweetest waitress named Mary and the General Manager made our visit incredibly inviting. The food was insanely good! Not one thing was off on our visit. Our kids had a variety of dishes and raved about it the entire night. They loved the pizza dough they sent out for them to play with. I ordered their wedge salad and everyone wanted to have some. It was the BEST salad I've ever had!!! Seriously, if you haven't tried this restaurant then you're REALLY missing out!!! We live 55 minutes from this location, but will make the trip just to enjoy quality food with our friends and family. 5 stars really doesn't do it justice. Keep up the GREAT work Brio Tuscan Grille and staff!!!

I give the food a 3, and the service a 1. We went for happy hour and our service was a joke. Empty plates sat on our table, it took forever to get our drinks, our food was cold, but was otherwise pretty good. It took so long to get my husband's glass of wine that our friend had to walk to the bar to get it. My Italian margarita had so much sour in it I couldn't drink it, the mango mojito tasted like club soda. After dinner my friend called and told the manager about the service and her response was, "I'll talk to the food server." I won't go back.

Food is good, Service though definitely needs improvement!!  This was my second time here, and unfortunately I'd have a tough time coming back.  Even for happy hour.  (which is a pretty good happy hour).  Our server, (Alecia G.) might have just been having an off day, but as mentioned above my previous visit, was a male server, who had no clue how to describe the food, or to suggestive sell on martini's and or cocktails.  This visit though was on a slower night, and I expected better service, than just having to ask for water refill (it is hot in AZ... you'd think water would be almost a given each time I got a cocktail).  We had to ask for the 4th place setting when our food came, and by the time we got that, the flatbread pizza was cold, and pasta the same.  At least there are other restaurant options in the direct area, (SOL, Eddie V's, etc)

One of our go to restaurants. The food and service is always great and occasionally you will run in to a celebrity. I met Kim Coates (Tim from Sons of Anarchy) there and he was super cool. 
The food is always good. I love their carbonara sauce. 
Great wines by the glass and bottle and an awesome selection of apps.

I came here for HH to see what the hype was all about, and it surely does live up to it!

Drinks are $5 and appetizers are $3.95.  We started with their white peach sangria and beef carpaccio, spicy shrimp & eggplant, and four cheese pizzeta.  We thought that the food wouldn't be enough, but boy were we wrong!  The portions are HUGE for the price.  One appetizer for each of us would have been enough.  The flat bread pizza was good and paired well with our sangrias.  But our favorite dishes are the spicy shrimp & eggplant and beef carpaccio.  The spicy shrimp was laid on top of the eggplant with this creamy sauce ladled around it.  The beef carpaccio is definitely a star all on its own.  Its such a steal to get a huge plate full of thinly sliced beef for less than 4 bucks.  I've carpaccio at sushi restaurants, but this was way different.  The beef melted in your mouth and I could've probably scarfed down the whole plate if I wasn't sharing it.  

My first time there did not disappoint.  I'll definitely be back for a beef carpaccio of my own and try some other things on the menu.

Maybe we just got a bad night ,but the food was not that good very salty. I gave a 2 star for the service the waiter was outstanding. The prices were very high for what you got. Definitely better Italian food restaurants in Summerlin.

We were visiting Vegas from Seattle.  We met up with some "local" friends who took us out to Brio.  The patio was packed and the inside was pretty busy too.  We had to wait four approximately 30 minutes for a table (Saturday night and lots of prom goers to contend with).  Once we were seated our waiter came right over and took our drink order.   We also received a bread basket that included herbed, baked cheese crackers which were an excellent alternative to bread.  I ordered the steak salad - PHENOMENAL! The flavors were amazing, lettuce, arugala, steak, feta cheese, balamic drizzle and a delicious dressing.  I will go back next time we are in Vegas.  I would never have known about this place if not for our friends that live there.  We wish there was one in Seattle!!!

I really dislike this place and I'm always surprised to hear I'm in the minority here. It's got a very grand setup with nice looking menu offerings. But I've had so many bland, boring meals with forgetful and unfriendly servers. I was polite and even agreed to come here recently for happy hour on the patio, only to find our favorite part of the late afternoon happy hour food and drink being the cover singer and guitarist who played for us. 

Brio is certainly better than Olive Garden, but it has that similar chain restaurant flavor. Underwhelming, especially for the price. 

I pray that my in-laws find a new favorite restaurant before our next family get together.

We had no prior knowledge about Brio, and decided to check it out because had a free appetizer coupon.  I'm curious if Brio is owned by or related to The Cheesecake Factory because the interior and ambiance is very similar.  We didn't have to wait very long to be seated.  We were seated outside, where there are heat lamps (cold this time of year in Arizona). We chose the bruschetta sampler for our appetizer - each 
and every one was delicious. Brio is a bit pricier than say, Olive Garden, the appetizer itself was $15, but relatively reasonable considering the food quality, service, and restaurant ambiance.  We both chose pasta dishes. The serving sizes are hearty, and food was good.  Have never been for happy hour, but sounds worth checking out!!

Even though Brio has the cookie cutter chain restaurant feel, the service and food was good, and enjoyable will definitely go back.

Had a reservation for 13 people. After we sat down, there was a 20 minute wait for our two waiters to just take our drink order. After we FINALLY got our drinks, they took our food order. Halfway through the order, a different server took over. Then, we waited an hour for our food. Two people in our party ordered the lasagna. As they were delivering the food, they informed us that they only had one serving so they split it in half and served it. We had two children under the age of 5 with us and we asked for dough for them to play with four times before they brought it over. Also, had to ask for drinks several times before they were brought to the table. The manager never came over and talked to us. From where we were sitting we could see that he was looking at us and talking about our table. When the brought the bill, there were still the 2 separate orders of lasagna on it, even though they took one full order and split it in half for two people. I was highly disappointed in the service. Not once did they apologize or ask if there was anything they could do. I will never return back to this restaurant or recommend it to anyone.

I like to review my entire experience.  So this is what I have to say.

First the bad, or not so wonderful things: it is CROWDED.  Of course it's loud (would never come here for a romantic dinner) and the tables are spaced far enough apart, but the walkways are tiny.  All of them.  It made for a couple almost embarrassing 'run-ins' with servers.  It was very busy on a Monday night too, so there was a lot of hustle and bustle.
Second and this is more of a 'miff'.  I understand the bar menu is separate and that's fine.   What I don't like is when a restaurant does not carry over happy hour pricing into the dining area, at least just the drinks.  The bar area is very small.  So for those of us that have a family...most of us aren't going to pay $15-30 per entree and plop down $10-15 for a glass of wine.  I really wish you could at least offer the happy hour drinks throughout the restaurant. 
The decor is very much like a Cheesecake Factory.  It's pretty, I like it.
It's a little pricey for what you get.
The sourdough bread is good but about the furthest thing from Tuscan bread.  
Now for the good.  The food.  It was delicious.  Salty..but I love salt.  For those who don't it might be verging on the edge of too salty.  But my party enjoyed everything they ordered.  I would return.  I know it's a chain, but the quality is better than a lot of standard chain restaurants.  Our service was good as well.

WTH BRIO you broke my heart.

I have visited brio in town square numerous times. but the Brio on Rampart is so much closer to my home. I came to enjoy their wonderful happy hour and great sangria and was heartbroken by the WORST SERVICE I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE.

1) it took the waitress 35 minutes to take our order. fine fine i'll let that slide..
2) the waitress didn't bring us any bread. we thought it was because it was happy hour but all the surrounding tables had bread. 
3) we were sitting at a tiny cocktail table with 3 cups of water pitcher of sangria with 3 wine glass plus the salt/pepper sugar... summary. Not much room. when our food came he wouldn't take other dishes away. we asked him nicely to if he could take some dishes away and even passed it to him and he just walked away! HOW FREAKING RUDE. i thought he was going to put something down and come back because we CLEARLY had no room on our tiny little cocktail table to put 4 giant plates on the table and eat comfortably. but guess what. he left. like the jerk he is. 
4) when we needed the bill to get out of this place the waitress was no where to be found. this was suppose to be a quick drink eat and go that ended up taking over 2 hours because the waitress forgot we existed. 

the food was still consistent and delicious as expected. but nothing ruins an eating experience worse than bad customer service.

the worst part of this visit was not only was the waitress terrible and inattentive. the food server guy was also terrible. it wasn't just one person that ruined my night. it was TWO. TWO TERRIBLE WORKERS. i couldn't believe the lack of customer service we received at this place.

I'll never come back to this Brio again.

My Shrimp and Lobster fettuccine was delicious! I also ordered the Sangria which was amazing. Great service and a great atmosphere. It has about the same atmosphere as Cheesecake Factory, and it's in Tivoli Village. That means there's a lot to do after dinner.

I love this place. Me and my mom come here all the time for happy hour. We love it. It is hard to find seating for happy hours since it's only available by the bar and they do get busy but once you do so worth it. My mom usually gets the peach sangria it's her favorite. I get different things. But we always. Always get the spicy shrimp sauce and eggplant appetizer. It's to die for.

Brio is a pleasant surprise.

I thought it would be Olive Garden on steriods, but it wasn't.  Thank god we made reservations, though, we would be waiting forever.  This place was jam packed (on a Thursday, 7:00p).  Maybe because martinis were $5 a pop?  

Our server was friendly and informative.  I was scared my friend wouldn't enjoy the food because she is vegitarian.  My girlfriend and I ordered the roasted red pepper and mozzarella bruschetta (which was delicious!) and the mushroom ravioli (to die for).  We couldn't say no when he brought the dessert tray.  Bread pudding warm and glorious!

All in all, a success.

Went during happy hour, which was totally loud and busy!  We got the last bar table.  It took a little while but finally someone took our drink and food order.  They forgot one of the apps, so we had to ask the waitress.  We also had to ask her repeatedly for refills.  Other than the waitress and staff who need a  bit more training in customer service, we thought the food was very good (vegs and hummus, spinach/artichoke dip, shrimp, caprese salad).  There are pita chips with everything, I'd like to see them offer something that's gluten free.  Overall, a good experience.

This restaurant is awesome ! Everything about it from the moment we were sat down by our server to the moment we left.  Great decor, wine selections, appetizers, entrees and of course desserts. Our waiter Chuck did an amazing job making sure we had everything we needed. He was very attentive and informative.  Chuck made our visit all the more pleasant.  Definitely going back!!

Brio is one of our loves and the place we like to go for birthday dinners, family get togethers. It's very pretty inside and the beautiful decor reflects the good food.
They have a full bar and happy hour and a wonderful outdoor seating area where you can people watch while enjoying your meal.
I have a great affinity for the flatbread that comes in their bread basket. Crispy triangles that are coated in herbs, sesame seeds, and cheese full of flavor and texture.
Our favorite is the Pasta alla Vodka. That is why we come to Brio.
My heart skips a little beat when they put this dish down in front of me and shower it in finely grated parmesan cheese. The aroma of the vodka sauce is one I have not experiened in any other Italian restaurant. Can't quite put my finger on what makes that distinctive delicious Brio Vodka sauce so special. Maybe it's the garlic that's been shaved thin (with razor blades?), or the fresh basil that perfumes the sauce, or it's the star of the dish...the soft pillows of heaven...the delicate ricotta filled pasta purses that melt in your mouth and go oh so very well with the sauce. I swear someone else must be eating my dish because it goes too quick until you devour the last of the pasta and reach for the sourdough bread to sop up the rest of this amazing sauce...it would be a sin not to!
This is all I want to write about Brio, because when you come there you must order the Pasta Alla Vodka :)

Dog friendly patio. Wonderful atmosphere, pleasant staff that executes good service, quality food at reasonable prices. We love the carpaccio. Valet staff is super and remembers us from previous visits.
Just had the most amazing lunch I had the carbonada it was great... the most friendly bartender Rosel  and Jackie the manager was on top of everything we has a pleasant experience
I was in the mood for a really good salad and this place totally satisfied my craving! great service, nice atmosphere, tasty food. Ill be back.

The food was ok, but the service was POOR at best. Only 8 tables with customers at the time and they couldn't handle basic service. Our waiter poured our waters and asked what we wanted to eat. He took our order and disappeared. We flagged him down after 5 minutes or so and asked for some bread. He said it was still being made then disappears for another 10 minutes, shows up with our 2 entree salads and a chicken Marsala and said the bread is almost done.  2 minutes later he drops off the bread and disappears for the rest of our meal. He never asked for our drink order, didn't check on us during our meal, or even refilled our waters.I asked for the manager and explained what our experience was like so far. He apologized and said he would be right back to refill our waters, which he did. Even though we told the manager that our waiter never took our drink order, HE didn't even care to know what else we might want to drink besides water. We gave them the benefit of the doubt and figured Brio was out of sodas, teas, coffees, beers, wines, and liquor for the rest of the weekend. They offered us free dessert, but at that point we were just done.  Remember, this was when there were only 8 tables that were occupied. I can only imagine what the service would be like if the place were slammed, but then again maybe that's why the place was empty on a Sunday afternoon.
After doing a little shopping, decided to stop in for a bite to eat!  Service was great, and the ambience was nice!  Wasn't too hungry so just had a salad and a cocktail.  Great experience!

We really enjoyed happy hour here. The Sangria was excellent and would highly recommend it. The pricing for the happy hour really makes it a worthwhile stop.  However, I did not like the spinach and artichoke dip.  The rest of the appetizers were decent.  Overall the restaurant is much better than the happy hour at the bar, but the price is right to hang out, have a Sangria, and a few appetizers.
Always great service, accommodating staff, service with a smile! I'm addicted to their steak salad. The Best!

Excellent food & service ~ ordered the bisque (divine!) chicken Cesar salad & the brio pasta with caramel marscapone cheesecake for dessert YUM!! 
Loved everything

Food was excellent as always but unfortunately the portion size has greatly gone down & incidentally making brio overpriced. It's too bad because I used to really dig this place but now I feel like I'm get'n rip'd off! Everything we ordered look'd like It was either off the kids menu or was the size of an appetizer. Don't get me wrong though, if money is no object, then party on Wayne! I personally can't enjoy anything that makes me feel like a glutton lol
The Risotto duo was GREAT...one was lobster one was scallops....beautiful presentation and both were delicious

You can really never go wrong with Brio. Hands down the best local Happy Hour IMO! 

Brio has Happy Hour Mon - Fri from 3:30P - 6:30P. HH is available at the bar/seating around the bar indoors or outside. Bartenders and servers are incredibly attentive on a consistent basis and the HH bites and drinks are so worth the visits to Brio.

Below are my go to recommendations:

- Beef Carpaccio $4
Thinly sliced carpaccio topped with greens, capers, and mustard aioli. I will be honest... There has been a few times when the carpaccio has been chewier than preferred but I'm hoping those were a few one offs. The past two times I've visited, the carpaccio has been on point! 

- BRIO Burger $6
Never disappoints. Comes already precut in quarters to share and the patty cooked to your liking. Also served with a side of homemade chips which are always delicious 

- Black Pepper Shrimp and Eggplant $6
My favorite!! I don't think I've met someone yet who hasn't enjoyed this dish. Sautéed shrimp paired with small pieces of breaded eggplant - smothered in a creamy reddish black pepper sauce with just the right amount of spicy kick to it! I can easily devour an order of this myself 

- Tomato Mozzarella Salad $5
Slices of tomato and mozzarella topped with basil and greens tossed in a light vinaigrette. Balsamic drizzled on top - a very light and refreshing salad

I personally indulge on their wine during Happy Hour - $5 for quality wine is quite the deal and the pours are great. Love their house Chardonnay. 

I've been to Brio for lunch and dinner (they have a delicious bleu cheese steak salad and a variety of tasty pastas) but I'm definitely more a promoter of their Happy Hour!
Great happy hour!!!  We tried most of the happy hour items and they were all delicious.  The sangria was outstanding.  Our waiter Danny provided very attentive and professional service.

Oh my goodness.  Happy Hour.  So good, so inexpensive!!  We took a group of 10 for happy hour to celebrate my birthday.  Not only that, but there are Brio gift cards at Costco.  So it was quite the deal.  Between all of us, we tried everything on the happy hour menu.  Everything was really good.  My fav, beef carapaccio  was terrific and so plentiful.  There are lots of decent wines on the 5$ list.  The favorite mixed drink of our group was the Italian lemonade (vodka).

Had lunch there this Sunday, and we liked the experience. I wasn't impressed by the décor, but didn't bother me either: as long as it's clean, I'm fine with it. I care more about the food and the service :)
The field greens salad was simple and nice and the bf loved the lobster bisque. We shared the vodka pasta, and even though it looked small, it was just enough food for the two of us.

Lunch Menu/Service Review

I met a client here for a lunch meeting, along with a couple other co-workers. Luckily we arrived before the lunch rush at 11 AM, right when they open. We were seated in the expansive dining area at a large booth. The server arrived right away and took our order.

Bread service - comes with sliced white bread, kind of dry, and seasoned toast points. Olive oil/balsamic come along for the ride, as well as butter. OK.

Next up - raspberry iced tea, incredibly sweet, obviously some sort of soft-drink style concoction, not great.

Main entree: Pasta BRIO - "Rigatoni, grilled chicken, seared mushrooms and roasted red pepper sauce" - $14.85

While pasta was well-cooked and sauce was delicious, chicken pieces had something to be desired. Mushrooms however were a nice addition, although I didn't get any hint of the searing, it seemed like they were just cooked in with the pasta. Overall, OK, but for the price kind of deflating.

Price points my party felt were a little out-there compared to the quality and quantity of the food we were served. 

Coffee service after the meal - a very strong brew accompanied by individual creamers for each person in the party (I liked that).

Service - good and on point.

Atmosphere - Nice when we arrived, but as the dining room filled up it became VERY loud and it was hard to carry on a conversation, especially business-related since we didn't really want to yell into any other person's face over the noise.

Overall - A-OK. Better than most chain Italian restaurants out there.

Let me start off by saying this isn't just your average Yelp review, we actually had our wedding reception at this Brio location this past Sat, Aug 16th 2014, and we could not be happier. We live in Los Angeles and were planning a wedding in Las Vegas, so I was very nervous about planning this via email and telephone, however the GM was extremely kind and helpful. First off, lets start with the fact that this location doesn't even have a "wedding"/or banquet room, the first time I called the manager informed me about their other location closer to the strip that had space to accommodate large parties and I explained to her that because our ceremony was in Summerlin, we wanted our reception to be there too so that guests wouldn't have to drive so far back and forth from the strip. She completely understood and welcomed our business. So, instead of taking up the majority of their restaurant on a Saturday night, they gave us the patio as well as a wrap around lounge area. Again, I was a little skeptical about the idea of my reception being on a patio, but we were running out of time and options within our budget and we booked Brio mostly because of their kind professionalism and because the food sounded delicious.

So, we began planning our menu, I emailed the GM probably around 20-30 times in the course of 3 months, and every time she responded within 24 hours and never seemed bothered or irritated. She allowed us to have table decorations and when I explained I was worried my family member would miss the ceremony due to setting up the tables, she offered to have some employees set up the dining area for us, and never even mentioned a service charge. Amazing. Also, she accommodated us with our menu choices completely and everyone in at our reception said the food was amazing and that they were going to look up the nearest Brio in their areas.

 I'll save you all the sob story, but basically we had some hiccups at our ceremony (insane photographer) and we were about ready to tell the limo driver to just keep driving and not even take us to our reception when we pulled up to this amazingly beautiful, twinkly lit patio that took both of our breath away. We ended up having the most amazing reception. We danced. We drank. We laughed. We cried. It was everything I wanted for my wedding and I have Brio to thank for it. Not only did our reception at Brio make up for a pretty lousy ceremony, they also told us "not to rush" and to "stay as long as we're enjoying ourselves". That is amazing. The servers not only went above and beyond all night long, they were attentive, personable, extremely quick and one of the girls even danced with my brother who has Down's Syndrome. She was such a sweetheart. I have never experienced such great service along with such amazing food in such a beautiful restaurant. Brio truly has it all. We are eternally grateful because you gave us the most beautiful wedding reception we could have asked for.

Lobster bisque was Amazing!!! I went back they changed the menu around. I tried the new stuff but it was bland or burnt tasting and I loved the old menu but I was really sad and disappointed perhaps it's a new night chef but the lobster bisque didn't taste the same either... I will give it one more shot though...

Happy Hour is the only reason I come to Brio- where you can stuff your face for less than what one drink costs! You have to sit in the bar area to get the happy hour menu. Bar service is always fast, but you will be within earshot of the employees which is always a fun time. They talk a lot of crap about one another or their personal lives, which shocks me every time! I've sat with a couple of friends in the booths in the bar area and occasionally had female servers with bad attitudes, but I suppose I would too if my customers only came in between 3 and 6:30.
we come here all the time for happy hour. love the food and service! I highly recommend the spinach dip and the flatbreads. So yummy!

My mother and I tried Brio for the first time today. The customer service was outstanding from the moment we stepped foot in this place. Our waiter took his time to let his General Manager Jesse know it was our first time and he personally came to greet us and suggested his favorites on the menu. The food was amazing! To top it off Jesse even had dessert sent to us on the house. BEST cheesecake you will ever taste! I will definitely be coming back! 
Thank you Jesse and your team for exceeding our expectations!

Awesome service, awesome food! I met some friends for a late lunch and had the chicken marsala, wow!! Very flavorful & good portion. Our server was on top of it too and had a fun personality. I will definitely be back!

Oh well, Brio is one of my favorite restaurants for the happy hour meals. Everything tastes delicious, I would recommend the burger, the eggplants, shrimp cocktails, 
each dish is 2.29$, nothing can beat that
cheap and the food is good
strongly recommend

I love to come here for Happy Hour from 3-6 pm or 9- closing because everything on the menu is so good. My favorite is the Carpaccio, I ate 3 orders myself in one sitting. Only con for me is that the happy hour menu is pretty limited and anything that is not on happy hour menu is a little pricier than I'd like. I would definitely keep going back for happy hour!!

I'm a sucker for good service. Brio delivered.

Once we got seated, we were shortly after greeted by our server with two waters. Seems small, but understand the difference between being asked would you like a water, and the anticipatory service of deciding for you, "here is a water. You need it to live. Drink it... or not. It's there for you to decide." 

Our server was a bald, white gentleman who referred to me as "my man" a lot. It made me feel like he was the Caucasian Denzel Washington straight out of 'Training Day,' and if I'm being honest... I didn't hate it. Endearment aside, he was also incredibly attentive, hospitable, and patient with my indecisiveness. More on that here:

I couldn't decide what to eat. The menu was one page long but it was intimidating. I'm an Olive Garden loving Italian food kind of guy (aka basic AF). I wasn't ready for foods I've never heard of, cheeses I can't even pronounce, etc. It seems all to much for me. Our server quickly took note of that and took it upon himself to create a pasta order from scratch collaboratively with me. It was incredibly kind of him to do. Shout out to the White Denzel! He's a real one.

I ended up getting a fettuccine pasta with both alfredo AND marinara sauce, with an order of grilled chicken breast and grilled shrimp as add ons and that meal was F-I-R-E! I probably would have been the loser that came here for soup and bread if it wasn't for him out of sheer intimidation. 

I'll be back for happy hour next time. I hear its poppin.

The food is always consistently good, BUT the service at the bar is horrendous.  My friends and I come here often and sometimes get the same bartender, Nicole M #224.  She is not attentive or pleasant.  It's always the same with her, so I finally decided to speak up.  I'm not sure how management allows this.
The beef carpaccio is the best thing on the menu. With those free crackers they bring. They should bring more. Seasoned to perfection... Way more!

really good food & a good bar.  the location is good too.  definitely gone back numerous times.  parking is a bit of a pain, but not horrible and they have valet, although i think valet is the biggest scam around.

I was quite pleasantly surprised by my meal at Brio. I had the salmon al Fresca and it exceeded my expectations, it was quite delicious. Bread was just ehh at the beginning of our meal. My house salad was fresh and tasted pretty good. Our server was pretty good but it was obvious she was super busy all night. I had to wait until after I finished my meal to get my 2nd glass of wine because she was so busy... Wasn't sure what the point was then but oh well. My sister had the chocolate cake which was pretty phenomenal and I had a mocha crumble gelato. Overall, not a bad meal!

I frequent this restaurant and the hostess continually is extremely rude. It ruins the experience when the greeter is rude to you several times. It is otherwise a nice place, however I don't recommend it due to poor customer service.

We went on a Wednesday for $5 Martinis and for Happy Hour in the bar area.  Almost every seat was taken, except for 2 chairs at the bar.  They were located on Rampart Blvd in the Tivoli Village in Las Vegas.

We ordered 3 appetizers and a couple of Martinis:

Spinach, Garlic and Artichoke Dip:  The dip came in a small bowl with parmesan flat bread.

Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant:  The bartender recommended this dish and it was very good.  The egglplant was lightly breaded.  We needed some complimentary bread to soak up all the sauce.

Shrimptini:  We ordered one each.  There were 8 good sized shrimp on a bed of lettuce in a martini glass.

My friend ordered a Pomegranatini with a slice of lime and a Flirtini with a cherry.   She liked the Pomegranatini better and would order it again.

We would order all 3 appetizers again and will be back soon.
Love this place. Great surprise. Took clients there and family and was always great food and great service even when crowded. Good overall value
The Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant appetizer is to die for!!! A must try when dining here!

Hand-Made Pasta in house... Great creamy Red Sauce. Crab Cakes with real Lump Crab Meat... Appetizer calamari was light and flaky with the right amount of Breading. Our waiter (James W) was awesome and delightful, like he wanted us there.

Though we live pretty close to Tivoli, this was our first visit to Brio for dinner.  Our last attempt was for Happy Hour a year ago, but we bailed when we were directed to sit on the side of the patio in which every seat was in full sun -- and it was 112° outside!  Happily, though the temp was five degrees hotter tonight, we ate in air-conditioned comfort.

We were with friends who are soon-to-be locals (if the husband ever gets his way), and our waitress, whose name I unfortunately don't remember, was extremely attentive and efficient throughout the meal.

For starters, we ordered the Bruschetta Sampler platter.  None of us realized until we were biting into different tastes that it was made up of all the different bruschettas they offered.  Some had prosciutto, some broiled tomato, and some were heavy on the balsamic (this is a good thing).  We enjoyed it a lot.  We also liked the Spinach and Artichoke dip, with the crunchy triangles of flatbread that accompanied it.  

Brio tends to have a Mediterranean flair that tries to up it a notch from straight Italian, but for me this wasn't a plus.  I do love the food at Mediterranean restaurants, and am also a fan of Greek cuisine, but I'm not keen on feta cheese.  While trying to decide on an entree, almost everything I wanted to order had feta.  Happily, I was able to substitute gorgonzola in the Mediterranean Shrimp dish I settled on.  I could have also changed it to parmesan.  Four nicely-broiled shrimp sat atop a delicious melange of orzo, farro, broccoli, and artichokes.  I haven't had farro before (though I have a package of it in my pantry waiting for me to cook), and I liked the nuttiness that it added to the mixture.  If I hadn't already been full from the appetizers, I might have thought that there should have been one more shrimp on the plate.  Then again, it was 14.95, the shrimp were meaty, and I was stuffed before I started.

Two others ordered Chicken Milanese, and the third had Filet Mignon, which came with veggies and his choice of crisply roasted potatoes instead of the mashed it came with.  I didn't taste them, but they looked like a small version of potato skins without all the toppings, and he really liked them.  The Chicken Milanese was covered with mozzarella, which is unusual.  Add some red sauce and they would have had chicken parm.  That was served with a side of linguine in a plain tomato sauce.  The chicken was reported to be tender and perfectly cooked.

We shared a bottle of California Riesling; I think it was Wente, and wasn't overly sweet or dry, just right.  My only nit was the bread, because the dense bread with the hard crust that I love turned out to be sourdough.  I don't like sourdough, but others will disagree with me.  Other than that, it was a very enjoyable meal.  And we'll try Happy Hour again if the heat wave ever breaks.  Like in October  :)

Went here for my daughters birthday, small portions, overpriced. We had to fill up on bread because they were so tight with the food portions, I got the crab cakes 23.00  and I had 2 small greasy crab cakes a few green beans and maybe a few pieces of roasted potatoes.
Whenever we go to a restaurant we have leftovers, not here we had to keep asking for bread because most of us were still hungry. I had to ask for a water refill 2-3x so the service was not that great either. It was a Friday night and it was so so noisy it was hard to have a conversation.
Very disappointing.

I love going to Brio's happy hour ! There are select plates for $3.95 and mojitos for $5.00. I typically get the burger ,crispy shrimp and the pizza. It works out great because my coworkers can order one item each and we just share of each others plates. The Mojitos really hit the spot after a long day at work . They are nice and sweet! The patio area also has comfy couches you can sit on but I would suggest bringing sunglasses when dining in the patio area because the sun can be  quite strong. Brio has the cheapest Happy Hour I have experienced. You would think for the price they would skimp on the food but their portions are big enough to share!

9/18

Checked out their happy hour- select apps $2.95 each!  However, no specials on the alcoholic beverages, with a quick glance at the wines-by-the-glass revealing prices of about $9 and up.  Thank goodness Total Wine and More was holding its grand opening (w/ a penny wine-tasting!) that day...
