Arrived back in the country and planned to top it off with a nice meal at out favorite restaurant.  9:30pm I'm guessing isn't their favorite time. No receptionist, waited about 5 to 8 min. People around but no one paying attention so we figured we could sit at the bar and get service there. No luck. Went to the front  to search down a menu and was confronted with a server that was kind enough to give me two. For the next 10 min with three to four servers and bartenders within 10 feet, we were totally ignored. Shocking to me, not the Brio I know. Waited a little longer and there was no attempt to acknowledge us by anyone. We stood up and slowly walked to the door and it seemed they were happy to see us go. Lack of awareness was stunning. Can't rate the food or service , we never received  either. Wake up Brio you are better then that.

Stopped here after we went shopping for some clothes over at H & M and I'm glad we came in here :)

The space speaks for itself. It's large and open with vaulted ceilings. 

Customer service is very formal and inviting. 

Portion sizes are generous as well as the costs haha.

If you feel like stepping it up a notch from your average dining experience but still don't wanna break the bank then this is a good choice for Italian food lovers :)

I went to Brio for a work dinner, and as usual I loved it. We started off with the spinach dip and the bruschetta and both were really tasty. For my entree I ordered the Filet and it was well seasoned and cooked to perfection. I highly recommend this dish, if you're in the mood for steak. I went with a group, so I was able to try several other items as well. The pork chops were delicious, but I don't eat much pork these days. If I did, I might order this myself. The lobster bisque was just okay. The last thing I tried was the Shrimp Mediterranean and it was the best of all. It's served with orzo pasta, which is my favorite.

I've been to Brio several times and I have yet to be disappointed. It's a place that I know I will visit again when I'm in the area.

The food was ok, but the desert was FANTASTIC.  Try the Creme Brulee cups - it came in pumpkin, peppermint and cocoa flavor. 

Would come back to the Square on my next trip to Vegas.

I came here for Happy Hour with my girl friends for their tasty appetizers and drinks. Happy hour is served only at the bar though, so it was a bit cold when we had to sit outside during the winter. Luckily they provided heat lamps and had curtained off the outside area.

My favorite appetizer is the black pepper shrimp with parmesan eggplant, it has a very flavorful sauce. I used the complimentary crusty bread to sop up all that deliciousness. The crispy eggplant fries are served with a fantastic creamy horseradish sauce is very tasty and the beef carpaccio with capers and topped with mustard aoli and shaved parmesan cheese was also very good. 

The tomato margherita flat bread is simple and straightforward, nothing special. The Brio burger is decent and was sliced in fours to share. The roasted garlic, spinach & artichoke dip is served with parmesan flatbread was also good. And of course you have to wash down all those appetizers with a dirty martini or two. They have pretty good happy hour items and prices and I always have a good time here.

I enjoy Brio every time I visit. The service is often top notch, the bread and butter at the table is delicious, and it has some of the best lobster bisque in town (pairs perfectly with that bread and butter!). Sometimes the food is a bit salty or has an unexpected kick. Otherwise, the experience is great. Don't be surprised if one of these days you find me devouring some lobster bisque in the corner like a scene from Beauty and the Beast... Don't mind me...

I don't know what it is with national or regional restaurant chains lately.  I've had nothing but bad dining experiences there, as compared to smaller 'mom and pop' family run local eateries.  In any case, we have been going to Brio's for years, and do like the food there.  However, two weeks in a row, my shrimp dish (Shrimp Fra Diavolo) was served undercooked and even raw!  This might be excusable once, but TWICE?!?!  I think i'll lay low for a while before I even consider returning.

UPDATE (October 2014):  Well, we did return, but i'm afraid I cannot upgrade my rating.  I have nothing against many of the kind and competent servers, BUT our food was served merely warm (not hot, as it should be), and our bill was much too high!   BRIO's prices have gone WAY up, and it cost us a little over one hundred dollars (tip included) for 3 people, whereas in the past, we would typically pay fifty to sixty dollars for the same food.  And we have been customers since they opened, probably having visited BRIO's at least 40 or 50 times over the years.  At this point, we just don't feel that they are a good value, and this is probably our LAST time there!  BYE BYE BRIO's!

Excellent food and wine.  The guy who brought our water and soda was funny and attentive.  Our server Julianne (girl) wasn't very impressive though.  My son is autistic and he shook her hands, after she took our drink order, my son wanted to shake her hands again, and she said "no more, we already shook hands."  I was shocked!

WOW What a experience I had with my fiance. The Chef Sous Michael specifically came over our table to welcome us. (This does not happen to me)

Michael has a warm, friendly personality that anyone would like. We spoke for a while and I felt I knew him for years because of his magnetic personality.

I ordered the Grilled Salmon Fresca and my fiance ordered the sliced steak bruschetta and this food was the best I have tasted in years. 

I want to compliment the Brio for having personal like Chef Michael. 

We liked it so much we are going back Saturday !!!

Thanks again Chef Michael  !!!!!!!!!!

Now all of you reviewers need to tell me what you did for service?

Regardless if happy hour is discounted pricing, you all understand that's probably one of their busiest times of day. 
Considering its the time of day people are getting out of work, if you hand a menu to someone and disappear for 30 minutes it's hard to sit still. 

We came in at the beginning of happy hour! Seated ourselves near the little booths by the bar. It took 13 minutes just for a menu. NOT COOL.luckily my boyfriend and I have some amazing conversations or else I don't know how else to let the time pass. 

We eventually got our menus l, took a look. In a matter of minutes, especially after waiting so long for a menu, we finally are ready to give her the rundown on everything we want. 

We keep seeing the same server rush back and forth so we keep waiting. After we see her and have her tell us she's about ready to take our drink order, she looks over and sees a party of 20 rush outside. 
Where do you think our server went?!

Never got to put that drink order in :( 
All we wanted was a nice happy hour!
After all, grandma had the little one all day so we might as well take advantage. 

After being so patient to try out this elegant restaurant, we thought maybe yard house was a better choice. They know us there so there's never waiting for a drink! 


Maybe we gotta be dressed lookin like a million bucks, or go with a fat group! 
I wanna try it again, my man was just really tryin to get that happy hour on so it might take a little convincing.

An old friend of mine turned me on to Brio and I fell in love! I have never experienced bad service at the Tivoli Village location. The down fall for my husband and I is that the bill can add up quite quickly, by the time we have added drinks, salads and a few of those little mini desserts. It's worth it though, the peach sangria (get the pitcher) is yummo, and those mini desserts are even better! 
My husband can be a picky eater too, and he is always able to find something on the menu that he can eat. The kids menu is pretty good too, the kids hamburger is huge and they love the fries!

I have been to Brio a few times prior to this and each time has been nothing special so I never thought to write of those experiences. On Monday a friend of mine and I decided to eat here after some shopping. There was no wait and we had the pleasure of being seated in Amanda's section who was an absolute delight!! I could not have asked for a better server or better service! She was extremely knowledgeable of the menu, engaged in some wonderful conversation and even joked with us when appropriate. 

We started with the amazing Bruschetta Sampler which Amanda recommended, perfect choice! My friend went with some sort of pasta and I chose the lamb chops with Maple Balsamic Brussels Sprouts. 

After the food was delivered, Amanda checked up on us to ensure everything was great. I actually finally was able to convince my friend to try lamb for the first time. She actually loved it  and we expressed that to Amanda. After a couple of minutes Will, some sort of manager came over and asked if everything was ok, we confirmed that it was and he continued on his way. After I finished the first lamb chop, I took a break to show my friend something on my phone when we were rudely interrupted by Will, the manager. He immediately asked if we wanted boxes. We hadn't even had our main dish for longer than 10 minutes and I told him that I was not finished and I was still working on it. He then said he would go get the check, he returned a few minutes later and said "No rush!"  I was kind of confused because there wasn't a wait for seats and there were several tables that had been at their enjoying their dinner longer than we were even in the restaurant. 

Amanda came over and even was confused on why he was bothering us, we explained that we felt that we were being kicked out and were not even offered the dessert menu which we were actually going to order, but since we were made to feel unwelcome we would just pay and leave. Amanda decided to get another manager to come over and apologize for the experience. Jenna came over and apologized and offered free dessert but our experience was already ruined and since we were made to feel like we were not wanted we just wanted to leave. 

We paid the tab and decided to leave. Again I cannot tell you how amazing Amanda was, Jenna was very sympathetic and tried everything change our experience. 

Honestly, Will should not be allowed to work with the public. I do understand why we were basically told to leave before I was able to even taste my side dish.  I definitely will not be back at this location!

I forgot to mention that after this was posted, I did receive gift card in the mail as a way to make peace, but also a personal phone call from Will informing me that he was bothered that someone would feel this was about him, he apologized profusely and even offered to buy me drinks, i kind of feel weird that they gave him my number and he kept me on the phone for a good 30-45 minutes trying to win my approval. It was strangely uncomfortable but at the same time nice to be able to tell someone they were the reason for a low review, just weird he has my cell phone number.
Food was excellent, service was great! About the same level as Carraba's, but quite a step up from the likes of Olive Garden. Fresh and modern interior, great service and great food. We will be back!

Been about 3 years since I came for lunch.  Tried it again for a business lunch on Friday.  The place was very busy.  Had the salmon lunch entree with angel hair pasta.  The salmon was good, but the pasta was drenched in too much butter sauce.  The meal was decent for the price, but nothing wowed me.

This place is a disaster. Went in for lunch on a Sunday and it was dead. Our waitress was fine but the food made the Olive Garden look like a Michelin star restaurant. I sent back my salad because it was wilted and slimy. The minestrone was super salty and tasted like it came out of a can. My sister's ravioli wasn't good... It tasted like it was heated up in a microwave. My mom got a caprese salad and it was okay but nothing to write home about. The flatbread was cold with very anemic looking tomatoes  and tasted like it had canned Parmesan cheese on it. For $60 with tip, even with the salad taken off, it was like highway robbery. Absolutely the worst italian food I've ever had.

Their service is always great at this location.

I planned a large group dinner for a birthday party & we were able to get a private room. They also helped me surprise the birthday girl.

I always find myself at their happy hour because their drinks are so good. They have $4, $5 & $6 plates & pours to choose from.

I have tried everything on the food menu. If you're with other people, I suggest getting the "Brio Burger" for yourself & another plate to share with each other to have variety.

As for drinks, the "Sangria Rosa" & "White Peach Sangria" are my go-to. They're only $4 & they taste amazing.

Shout-out to Danielle who has been my server a few times & is wonderful!

i was really disappointed at the price for the food we got.  My "spicy" pasta had little flavor.  The pasta itself was mushy.  Hubby got the lobster ravioli, his favorite meal, with a vodka sauce.  Again, no flavor, just mush.  The two starts comes from our server Frederick who was on top of things.  Drinks were always full.  Bread refilled.  He also brought us a free dessert.  The chocolate mousse was wonderful.  I would not go back

My husband and I arrived in Vegas on 5/15/16 and decided to eat here for dinner. My husband had the lasagna and I had the salmon. My husband said the lasagna was absolutely amazing. My salmon was cooked well and was tasty but it needed more salmon and less veggies. The lasagna was made with a white sauce and it was really good with it. My husband scarfed it down in no time. 
The upholstery was a little outdated,cushions at our booth was torn and the back were worn and stained. Other than the upholstery, everything was good.

The happy hour @ the bar is a lovely experience! The little menu has great pricing (anywhere from $2-$4 I believe) and the bartenders are always witty enough to mix up a drink of your own concoction. The bruschetta & brio burgers are always pretty satisfying.

Great ambiance and service was impeccable. The food is just okay, definitely over-salted. We had the kids cheese pizza (which was generous in size), ceasar salads, the roasted vegetable panini and risotto.

Alex was the BEST! 
Great happy hour and small bites !!'
Try the soup - lobster or musgroom!

I was pleasantly surprised by brio and found most everything there to be above my expectations. We went on a Monday night during restaurant week a little later in the evening, around 8 o'clock as I didn't get off work as early as I would have liked. So brio was close to home and felt a bit on the safe side. I guess my expectations were somewhat low because it's Italian food and most Italian chains aren't known for their quality.  We sat in the dining room because it felt like there was more atmosphere than there was on the patio. Our table was great, like a private booth with barrier walls on each side. The ceilings are high and chad and I were both reminded of Vegas when we sat down. Our server, Jonathan, was wonderful. Funny and attentive without being intrusive. We both had the bruschetta samplers to start and chad really enjoyed it but to be honest I was less than impressed. I mean, I ate it all and it was by no means bad, I just didn't love it. The bread wasn't crispy as is customary with bruschetta, it was just cold, but I just assumed this is how it's done here. Also I had no idea what I was eating. I should have held onto the paper. For entrees, chad had the filet and I had the lobster and shrimp ravioli. Chads filet was wonderful, even though he omitted the Gorgonzola cheese. Cooked to perfection and tasted fresh. I thoroughly enjoyed my pasta dish. And it was huge! Once again we both gobbled our entire meal right up. On board for dessert was a creme brûlée for me and caramel cheesecake for chad. Once again those were gone in a matter on minutes. 
Brio really has the feel of a grand ballroom and I enjoyed the atmosphere immensely. Overall the food was good and tasted fresh, which isn't often the case with Italian food. Even the bread at the beginning of the meal was good. And for restaurant week they offered a glass of house wine with the meal that was a nice added, and appreciated, touch. However, no Vegas style Italian restaurant would be complete without a little bit of tacky. The paper on top of the table clothes? Saves on laundering costs I supposed. And the way the plates say "brio!" across the top...? Just in case we forgot where we were. 
I would definitely come back again for restaurant week or some other offer, but I honestly can't see myself going out of my way to come here. Good experience but nothing super special.

I'll start off with a positive. The food! First time getting lunch at Brio, I got the kid's portion chicken with mashed potatoes. Well seasoned chicken, amazing mashed potatoes.

Unfortunately, that is where the positive ends. Customer service, mostly on the order ahead/pick-up end, needs improvement. Personally working in the customer service industry, it is my passion to give each and every customer a great experience, and leave smiling. There were several issues, from 'uh-huh's' and eye rolling, to taking 10 minutes to print my receipt. Picking up the food ate 15 minutes into my lunch break. I didn't feel as though the hostess or manager on duty cared to hear my concerns, and suggestions. I would recommend a moral booster for the team! Because the food is delicious, but because of the service, it is unlikely I will be a returning customer.


From,

A hungry college student who just likes smaller portions (hence the kid's meal)

I must say this is one of my favorite happy hour places. It starts from 3pn to 6:30 p.m. Monday through Thursday. There are a lot of appetizers and drinks on the happy hour menu. My favorite one is the Beef Carpaccio, and the eggplant shrimp. The drinks on the happy hour menu were decent and I think it's a little diluted on the alcohol. If you want to check out this place try to come early as it tends to get pretty packed during about five or six mark.

Nice environment, clean establishment.

Wouldn't recommend for food. 
They don't accomodate vegans very well.  
Food has no Wow factor to make it stand out for the prices. 

Go to the Bootlegger bistro up the street another 5mins or panevino.

Sorry brio. I only come here to sit out side really.  Happy hour is OK.

We sat at the bar last night at Brio and it was wonderful! The two bartenders Marian and Brenden were the perfect hosts!! They were friendly and beyond helpful in deciding on what to eat! Thank you so much for taking such good care of us. We are most definitely coming back to Brio of Scottsdale!!

Came here the other night and MAN! Is this place worth yelping over or what. First of all, great ambiance, great location. 

The menu had lots of choices and was very busy. We were on our way to the airport and told out waiter that we were kind of in a rush. He punched in our food and it came out I would say within ten minutes. I was extremely impressed.

Not only did the food come out timely and our server was very attentive, but the food was DELICIOUS! I had the Tuscan Harvest Salad and it was so delicious. It had chicken, bacon, dried cranberries, fresh apples, and a nice vinaigrette to top it along with other things that I can't remember.

For the price, this restaurant exceeded my expectations and I will DEFINITELY be coming back!

Chef John and Server Samantha,  treated us like Kings and Queens.  The entrees were scrumptious. 
Chef John even created a Scampi dish for our 
young diner.

Really pretty interior! It was all decorated for Christmas when I went today.

I went with a friend because we were in the Scottsdale Quarter and were craving bread. We went in around 4:30 and it was pretty slow (awkward time). We got a bread basket and it had a half loaf of white bread and some crispy flax/rosemary crackers. The bread loaf was warm and good to satisfy our craving. It wasn't crusty bread, but it was good enough. We asked were oil and vinegar and they brought it out promptly!

We ordered the Strawberry Balsamic salad ($15) to split. It was good, but standard. Came with strawberries, gorgonzola cheese, balsamic dressing, grapes, and candied pecans. Definitely overpriced, but it's all we ordered so whatever. Service was good, we had Ethan.

Might go back for happy hour, but it probably won't be my first choice restaurant--more of an "in the area so it's convenient" type.

Brio Tuscan Grille is located in a very random shopping area that is a little further away from the strip. If I wasn't going to dinner with my family I probably wouldn't have come here. It is just too out of the way, especially if you don't have a car or you would rather go wild. This is not the place for you. The patrons who come here are mostly an older crowd or families, so this is not a party spot.

The food here isn't too bad. It isn't gourmet, but it isn't trash. We ended up ordering the Pasta Pesto (Angel hair, grilled chicken, caramelized onions, spinach, tomatoes, red peppers, Feta, basil, light pesto sauce) and the Fettuccine Rustica (Fresh egg pasta, spicy marinara, capers, basil, Kalamata olives, Parmesan). They were both just ok, nothing special. A little on the bland side.

Overall, I would probably try this place again if I was in the area.

I have been to this Brio a few times and everything is always great!  I am a huge fan of the lasagna.  The different sauces really sets it off!  The service is great too.  Great food + great service = 5 stars!

We absolutely love the brunch here! The stuffed French toast is sensational and they have a variety of delicious cocktails like sangria and bellinis. We always enjoy sitting outside. Sometimes they bring the kids a little plate of pizza dough to play with, which keeps them entertained until the food arrives, and they'll even bake it if you choose. We've gone back many times and have always had great service!

First impression was that this was going to be a great meal. I was right! Our server was Tamara and she was excellent,in fact everyone who worked here was outstanding. The food was fresh and served as it should be. Tasty,hot, promptly delivered in order not ahead and not too slow. Tamara went out of her way to see that our meal was excellent and it was appreciated in my tip. They also have the best tasting flat bread to nibble on while you wait for appetizers and main course. To my shock I discovered that this is actually part of a chain. This is the best chain I have ever eaten at for Italian food. The impression was more like a fine dining experience in beverly hills or pasadena. I think that they have an incredible future if they stick to this formula. Meticulous attention to detail and of course great tasting food. I will definitely be back as I live in summerlin and I discovered they have a place at tivoli.

Good solid establishment. Friendly, good serve, clean. Lovely outdoor seating.

Our server, Ashley, was friendly and competent. 

Thanks, Brio!

Town Square is always a fun choice. Brio has a lot of options and whether dining at the bar or dining room you can't go wrong. 

One of the better happy hours in town square and the reverse is even better. When the weather is great sit outside and people watch!!

Brio reached out to me to come back to make up what happened last time back in February.  We haven't been back to Brio since Valentine's Day.  We normally go here once or twice a month before Valentine's incident.  Service here has changed from what it was years ago.  It's always a hit or miss.  We tend to spend about an hour to an hour and a half here, depending on how the service is and how busy they are. 

We came on last Wednesday night with the same couple we went on Valentine's Day.  I didn't tell them we were invited back.  We all weren't too hungry this time around and only ordered 3 glasses of wine and an entree each.  I did have a gnat in my glass of wine.  They replaced it right away.  Service was much better this time from the hostess to our server.  I added one of my friend to the dinner and asked the hostess to tell our server to hand me the check at the end, so I can pay for the bill and tip properly on what was being taken care of.  We didn't order so much food and drinks, maybe this is why they took care of our visit.

I really do appreciate the kind gesture from the management.  After being a loyal customer of Brio since 2010...  Either this location have to get better in customer service or we'll have to suffer through the service.  LOL
Great service by our server.  Calamari was off today.  Spicy Shrimp Bruschetta description much better than actual item. Chopped salad great and fresh! Pasta alla vodka was very tasty.

Love this restaurant!  From the crusty fresh hot bread to the yummy desserts, Brio is the best.  Our waiter, Danny, was phenomenal - great attitude, super customer service, very attentive and professional.  It was the perfect evening to sit outside, sip a cocktail, people watch and enjoy a good meal. Highly recommend!

Went here on a tuesday night with a group of 4 after one member of our party declared she'd been burned out on spicy food, and required some pasta. It was 9:30 at night, we didn't want to spend $32 a plate on the strip, and so we decided to give long passed-by Brio a try.

The verdict; upscale olive garden that knows what Al Dente means. So 3 stars at least for that. We had hoped to sit outside, but after putting our names in for a table, got so quickly ushered to a seat next to the miniature Colosseum replica (?!...Why would you build that?!) that we sort of gave up on asking.  Very much has the same "upscale chain that doesn't want to be considered a chain" vibe as a Yardhouse or a McCormick and Shmick's. 

There was absolutely nothing wrong with the food. We had a calamari appetizer, 2 basil gimlets, a lemonade, 3 pasta dishes and a salad. We might have all been really hungry, but we also finished everything, and then nibbled at some of the crumbs. I actually wish they would have offered a refill on the bread, as my jerk tablemates ate all the french, and left me the crackers, but this offer was not forthcoming. That was sort of the modus opperandi. Nothing extra or surprising or special, no extras extended. You get what you ask for, you pay for what you ask for. Nothing wrong with that, just nothing to get super excited about, either. 

I had the sausage and tomato pasta, which was good; the pasta actually had flavor and texture, which I had hoped for but not expected. The tomatoes were actually fresh and the fennel sausage a bit on the dry side, but crispy and very flavorful. I ate the whole thing and enjoyed it. I just doubt I'll remember anything about it a month from now. 

Brio seems like a very safe bet; I'm sure if I went back in 6 months I would have a very similar experience. It would be a great place to take my utterly unadventurous friends and relatives when they visit from out of town. If I was still doing the dating thing and on a blind date, had to do a working lunch, or meet an estranged relative I knew nothing about, this might be a good place to avoid judgments.

We came in with less than an hour of closing- the lady who seated us was professional and very kind! Bread was at our table quickly from when we sat. Our waiter, a guy with some cool funky hair, was wonderful! He got our apps and dinner to us quick. The eggplant and shrimp- so delicious the shrimp is seasoned perfectly, and I don't even like shrimp that much. The lobster bisque- my boyfriend loved it so much. Not disappointed at all. I got a chicken and angel hair pasta dish- I'm kinda a snub when it comes to pasta, but there was nothing to complain about! My boyfriend got the crab cakes- the veggies were pretty salty but the cakes great! We got mini cheesecakes to go we didn't want the staff to have to wait on us past closing: not really fair. My only complaint about dinner is that our table wasn't cleaned off completely. But will be returning again.
Every time I'm in Vegas I hit this place up. Everything delish!!!!  Reasonable price, beautiful decor great service.  Great outdoor area. Plenty of parking. Cheap cab ride from the Strip

Went for a graduation dinner. Very disappointed!!  I'll start with the service which was the highlight. She was great!!  Now the food. For appetizers Calamari C-, artichoke dip- B, caprese salad B. Entrees Halibut special- dry, minimal flavor D,  shrimp Mediterranean-shrimp dry, flavor ok C, filet with lobster tail- Filet B- cooked proper but no seasoning. Lobster tail TINY and DRY.  , vodka pasta- B+, pesto fettuccine-F. No pesto to speak of, flavor blahhhhh. 
Sides were ok at best. 
Won't be back

WooHoo! As good as it gets!  That's an understatement!

This place is a triple threat.  The decor is warm and relaxing, the service was great, and the food was spectacular!

We enjoyed the bruschetta for our appetizer.  The various flavors were great and the balsamic vinegar glaze couldn't be more flavorful.  

For dinner, I had the gorgonzola crusted lamb cutlets.  AMAZING!!

You cant have that good of a meal and not indulge in a little dessert.  The creme brule  and terramassu were awesome.  

It takes a lot to wow me but this place came through!

I have eaten at both locations in Las Vegas and they're both excellent.

Pros: Food is always great. I've never had a single bad dish and tried many. Lasagna is my absolute favorite and it's smothered in cheese, it's incredible. Drinks are always good and if you sit on the patios you get great views at either location.

Cons: None, place is pretty great

I will definitely continue eating here as often as possible

Great family friendly menu and very helpful wait staff.  The portions are very large, even on the kids menu!  We hit this place on the way out from Vegas back to LA and were very happy with the food and service.  At first we were not sure it would be a good place to take our 2 year old but everything was great!  I had the red fish with potatoes (daily special) my wife had the mushroom raviolli and our daughter had the pizza (of course!)
The food seemed thoughtfully prepared and fresh.  The atmosphere was great for lunch and it was not overly crowded.  Our waitress was VERY attentive and our glasses were never empty.  
I would definitely revisit Brio and recommend it to anyone looking at Brio as a possibility!

Came here on Father's day at 5PM. It was a pretty full. The decor is very nice, reminds me of typical Cheesecake factory. The main dining room is a little loud, fortunately we got to sit in a round room in the back of the restaurant that was very nice and quite a bit quieter so that a normal conversation could be had. I ordered the espresso ribeye steak with mashed potatoes and grilled asparagus. The steak was cooked perfectly and the seasoning was mild. It was Very good. I tried a few of my neighbors dishes, cod over angel hair with lemon caper sauce, and Brio pasta. They were all pretty good but I felt I made the BEST choice. Most of their dishes range in the $20-30. The sourdough bread is warm and crusty. delicious.

This place was awesome, the decor was very nice. The staff was very friendly. And the food was great. I loved the flat bread and bread loaf they brought to the table. Bruschetta Quattro appetizer was really good. I had the Pasta Pesto, but asked if I could have some alfredo sauce on the side. They obliged me on that. It's definitely a place to go for a special occasion. And we definitely go back.
I just love Brio....they are very consistent. I can always count on Brio to serve me up some tasty vittles when I'm hungry for some good Italian fare

Well the food is good the service staff leaves a lot to be desired. I work in the plaza, was looking to have lunch. Because it was just 1 person I was asked to sit in the bar I wasn't offered a table outside. Basically turned away


Update the manager contacted me, I've tried them a couple of times and the service and food has been outstanding

LOVED THIS PLACE! My girlfriend and I were really bored one night and were driving around and just spontaneously decided to come here for dinner... 

We were seated right away and we were able to pick our table we wanted outside. They were very nice and accommodating. Our waiter he was really nice however I think he was a little overwhelmed that night.. we got forgotten about a couple times, but seriously the food made up for it 100 percent. 

I ordered a Mango Sangria and ohh let me tell you how tasty that was! Best Sangria I think I have ever had. 

Definitely worth checking out. For a chain this place was awesome. The food was outstanding our calamari was cooked perfectly.. I hate when it comes out rubbery. Their caesar salad is so amazing as well as their Pepperoni and Sausage Flatbread... just writing this review is making me crave the flatbread again..

We went to Brio for the first time to celebrate an anniversary. The hotess sat us at an intimate table. When we arrived to the table there was a card waiting to congratulate us. The atmosphere and decor was great. The server seemed a bit overwhelmed at times, but the meal and sangria were delicious. At the end, the server surprised us with a cheesecake with two candles. It was a great evening!

WINNER, WINNER, NO BRIO FOR DINNER!!!

Ok, here's the overview: Brio is one of those swanky, but casual kind of joints...A businessman in an Armani suit may be sitting across from a college kid wearing a t-shirt and flip-flops. The interior kind of has a Cheesecake Factory meets Bellagio feel to it. The average dinner runs $18-20.

So here's what I liked: Brio has hands-down the best after-dinner mints in a jar near the front enterence. Don't feel intimidated sticking your hand in the jar because the hostess is staring you down, heck, they're free...take advantage.

Now, here's the dirty: The last two times I went here (about 2 months apart), I had chicken dishes, both of which were undercooked. The first dish a couple months ago was grossly undercooked and had a very cool pink center. My most recent chicken dinner was just slightly undercooked...but pink enough to complain, nonetheless...Total gross-out!!

What sealed the deal for me to never go back is the manager telling me the reason my most recent dish was pink is that Brio brines the chicken for 48 hours!! Are you kidding me? Ok, I know that when you brine chicken it will turn a little pink. However, the time factor now becomes the problem. 48 hours will darn near cook it (chicken ceviche)...not to mention give you a stroke.

I'm not sure what to think...Brio was quickly becoming my favorite Italian restaurant in the East Valley, but these two most recent visits have got me looking for alternatives!! I am also a little bitter they stopped selling canoli's.

Recommendation: Want to impress your date, but don't have a lot of loot? Load up on Brio's free dinner bread and water and get the hell out of there. The sourdough bread is pretty tasty and the herbed cracker's (yet while messy) taste high-quality. Before actually order dinner and spend your hard earned money here, have an instant recollection about someone you know who almost got salmonella from eating raw chicken there...twice.

Recommendation #2: While Brio doesn't offer wi-fi, there is an open wi-fi connection (with a strong signal) from one of the restaurants near-by...I won't mention the name of that business, but I found you get the strongest signal if you sit to the west side of the building. :P

I think at this point I may not check in but I have been going into Brio for quite some time now and I have to say the service here is phenomenal! The food is also just as amazing as the staff! The atmosphere at this location is awesome I prefer it over the other location on Rampart. Always come here with my mom. Definitely a hot spot! 

Kai....just go see him! He makes THE BEST cappuccino! and you'll receive the best customer service from him! :D He checks in at the right times, he makes an effort to suggest other items on the menu. It is nice to see servers know their menu and can suggest other options to explore as well. Great job! :)

I have eaten hear previously and the food was good except for the last two times. 

We had reservations for dinner as it was Mother's Day. Our waiter was great . Appetizers were good we had brochette sampler . We ordered two orders of the fettuccine with shrimp and lobster and shrimp and lobster risotto. Also the six ounce filet. 
The Pasta in one of the entree's had been left sitting and was cold and rubbery looking ,as the person eating it is a manager in a restaurant she was not happy.The lobster in all three pasta dishes was mushy . Therefore none of us ate the pasta. Mothers day dinner was bread and appetizers. The steak was also burnt. 
The manager took all off the pasta dishes and apologized but that did not make up for not having  dinner.

I have dined with Brio Tuscan Grill in the past, but this time felt compelled to review.

I arrived at Brio Tuscan Grille  just before noon on a Friday and to my surprise did not wait to be seated - the restaurant, albeit busy, provided immediate space.  The restaurant is that of a large, open floor, high ceiling dining space.  The "Tuscan" décor is immediately apparent and the high ceiling with streaming tapestry is a nice touch.  Regretfully I felt as though I spent the entire meal yelling at my colleague as the roar of the patrons is stifling.  The dining room rumbles with dialogue from the tables, each seemingly attempting to talk louder than the next.  This may be the result of the large dome-like space.

The team serving us was friendly, not unlike the hosts, but did unfortunately need to be reminded of extra table flatware, indications for drink refills, and simple things like a spoon to stir my coffee, however, negating these oversights with accommodating pleasant demeanor.

I cannot speak on my friend, but I ordered the Mezza Chicken Limone and would recommend it to anyone that enjoys characteristic chicken.  Aside from the elegant name, this lunch fare is simply Lemon Chicken with Campanelle Florentine.  The chicken was flavorful, with lemon obvious with each bite, and the bed of greens accented the capers nicely; the portion size is perfect for a healthy lunch as well.  I would also like to note the Campanelle Florentine was just a bit overcooked, but not enough for most to notice.  Again, I recommend the Mezza Chicken Limone and Brio Tuscan Grille to all - we'll see how things are next time: at dinner.

We went to Brio at Tivoli Village last night to celebrate my father in law's 60th birthday. I wish I could remember our server's name because she made the night (white, dark blonde hair pulled back, funny)! 

The food was great. 2 of us got the gargonzola crusted beef medallions. YUM! One got tortellini and one got the gargonzola crusted lamb chops. We also had calamari and caesar salads for appetizers. All food was great. We had cocktails and then got a bottle of wine. The wine selection never disappoints. Toward the end of dinner, they brought out creme brulee with a candle for the bday boy which was nice. The table ordered dessert drinks (I had an amazing port wine!). 

So why only 3 stars? We loved the service and the food. The problem was the fire alarm. It went off not once but twice during dinner. So loud thay everyone was plugging their ears. Strobe lights flashing. It took a very long time for it to stop each time. I understand that this might be out of the restaurants control, but they could have done something to appease the few tables of people in the restaurant. After the first alarm, a manager walked around apologizing. After the second, nothing. There weren't many people in the restaurant at 9:30 so it would have been a nice gesture to at least offer a drink on the house or something. No more apologies or compensation. It just seems a little unprofessional when we're spending $300 and had to sit through alarms twice. 

If you can go and avoid the alarm (or don't mind them not caring if it ruins your dinner), everything else is great!

Love love love this place!! It's my husband & I go-to place on our date nites. The food is delish, the ambiance is nice. Alittle loud for ur typical "date-nite" setting but u can have a normal conversation w/o yelling. Service is great & quick. The wait staff know the menu and will help u choose if ur stuck, regardless of what u end up with u won't be upset! My hubby fav is Tomatoe Caprese and I get the beef carpaccio as our 1st sides always! 
Ty Brio!!

UPDATE: Brio was very quick to respond to my post and stated a member of management would contact me. I then received an email from William and we spoke about my experience.  He was extremely apologetic and concerned about my experience.  I provided the details of my visit and again he was very apologetic.

I am very happy that Brio reached out and responded with an apology.

Thank you to William and Brio for listening to my experience and apologizing.

I think who your server is can make or break your view on this place...I've been here numerous times and always in the dining room and had exceptional service...My friends and I went there last night for a birthday celebration and sat in the bar for happy hour- which the prices are fabulous for that! Our server was ok at the beginning but as the evening went on the service went way down hill- we didn't see our waitress for big chunks of time and had to wave her down to ask about the free dessert my friend should have gotten for her birthday and after we paid our bill, we never saw her again- which turns out was at least 45 minutes!! We even had a friend join late and she never asked if she wanted anything- dumb move since I would have ordered another drink and my friend wanted food- Note to servers: If people are going to take up space in a booth anyway, sell them food and drinks at every turn, bigger bills means bigger tips ;)

After a horrid experience moments before at a nearby restaurant, it has felt good to relax and enjoy a nice meal here. Eating outdoors with misters keeping things cool, pleasant music, and wait staff who knows the difference between hovering and serving, very very nice.

Disappointed in the chicken (too dry), but everything else was great. No wine cooler on the menu, but that didn't stop them from serving that when I asked.

Bread is top notch, worth the price of admission.

No dessert this time, maybe next.

Server's name: Trevor.

I have eaten at this location before and it was always ok.  This last time I dined the service was terrible and the food even worse!  We couldn't get anyone to give us refills on our water.  The steak salads were missing the tomatoes and candied pecans and just didn't taste right.  It was rather disappointing after dining here in the past then having this experience.  We usually go to the location in Tivolti Village and will continue to go there as the service is excellent and the food amazing!
I like this restaurant! Come here every time I'm in Scottsdale. I like the food and the prices!

First time coming to Brio, and don't think I'll be recommending it to anyone. Food was really mediocre. Felt kinda sick by the end of it because my braised short rib just didn't taste good or outstanding in any way. 

Strawberry lemonade was decent. If I could rate the atmosphere, I'd give it a shrug out of 5. Just a shrug.

Great Restaurant! I went with some friends and tried the brucshetta sampler! awesome!. 
I had the lobster and crab meat ravioli. Was delicious. Very classy place and nice decor. a dress up place for sure. I would recommend this place for a special occasion for sure.

Great food, great service! 

If I do return, I'll be wearing DEET.  If you're going to leave the front door open, you need to deal with the damn gnats.

Liberi degli insetti !  (Get rid of the bugs!)

Had to pick up some walking shoes for our upcoming trip, so we decided after seeing this urban style mall several months ago to check it out, that way we wouldn't have to drive to N Scottsdale for the Ecco store.  After our 1.5 hr drive into the valley we were starving and as we approached the San Tan mall we thought maybe there might be a non-chain we could get a bite at.  Well this is totally a chain mall with not one independent anything.  So it was between the Mexican or Italian chain.  We opted for Brio, thinking we could get a panini or such for lunch.  It was an early weekday and they were slow.  Opted to sit on the patio, which was on the N side, so it was a little shady.  Why don't these places plan better when in development and put the patio on the E and S sides of the building.  Okay my designer fundamentals are showing.  We quickly perused the menu and say they had a lunch special of several items, opted for the pizza and a chicken/portobello pasta, both $7.95.  I thought at that price I won't mind that it isn't great.  The server brought out some bread and Italian herbed crispy flat bread that I really liked.  A short while later the manager came over and told me they had made my pizza incorrectly and they were remaking it and it would take a bit longer.  I was pleased of the fact that they notified me and I wasn't just left wondering what is taking so long.  The food arrived and I must say I was impressed.  The crust on the pizza was slightly sweet, baked perfectly and the toppings added nice flavor to the crust without overwhelming it.  The pasta dish featured their homemade marinara, which was chunky with fresh roma tomatoes and lots of oregano.  Paired nicely with the grilled chicken breast/portobello smothered in melted provolone.  Surprisingly a great priced lunch in a chain within a chain mall.  A first for me!
Went to this restaurant few weeks ago.  The food was great including the desserts.  The service was very good.

I've been here twice since it opened, with good memories of one of their locations in OH from years ago.  Good service, with experienced waitstaff that recover from gaffes easily (such as not knowing their own drink menu during dinner service).  First time I had the shrimp and scallop risotto, which was poorly executed to say the least: rice was still overly al dente, sauce was thin and overall just needed a bit more TLC and it could have been good.  The second time I had the shrimp and lobster pasta, and putting aside the miniscule amount of lobster present (two small chunks for a very large pasta portion) the pasta was fresh made and done well and properly sauced.  For apps I have tried the carpaccio (not dressed with any olive oil or lemon and cooked) and the fried calamari which was passable, but not even to the standard of Cheesecake factory.  Finally, most things have been heavily seasoned.  All in all, I will probably end up giving them one more shot

Beautiful ambiance.  Very good service and delicious food.  The menu is extensive.  I can always find items I'd like to try.  It has a resort atmosphere with the high ceilings and lush decor.  It's definitely a place to bring someone for a special event.  There is a happy hour but I've never been there during that time.

Oh Brio's HAPPY HOUR is probably one of my top HH places! You can not beat their $3.95 appetizers and $5 drinks! Well actually before their apps were only $2.95 but hey it's only a $1 increase.. I can handle that! Haha my must haves when I go are the beef carpaccio & spinach artichoke dip! My man and I usually share the burger as well.. The sucky part about this place would be that you can never tell if you're going to be able to get a spot or not.. The best place to sit is inside in one of the booths or outside by the firepit if you have a big group but it can get pretty busy.  ... Boo! But hey what can you do..!?

Tip: It is right in front of the COMPLIMENTARY valet! easy and fast~

I can handle that! Haha my must haves when I go are the beef carpaccio & spinach artichoke dip! My man and I usually share the burger as well.. The sucky part about this place would be that you can never tell if you're going to be able to get a spot or not.. The best place to sit is inside in one of the booths or outside by the firepit if you have a big group but it can get pretty busy.  Another negative thing is that sometimes there are lots of pigeons out on the patio... Boo! But hey what can you do..!?

Happy hour not so happy!! We arrived just as happy hour was starting.  Bar was not full by any means.  We saw our server a total of 4 times over 2 hours.  

Food was room temp.. Drinks were not flowing.. I even had to pick up a drink order from the servers area at the bar since the server was no where to be found.  Not a good experience there are better happy hours around that area..

Just fabulous food, waiters and bartenders and the atmosphere is outstanding.  Happy Hour is the best I have seen in Arizona.  REALLY FIRST CLASS.  Can't wait to go back.  Their dinners must be fabulous.

I've gone to Brio a lot but just never gott around to writing a review.  Lunch here get's so crazy that I rarely go, but I was meeting some ladies for a little early for a business meeting so we decided to go here.  They had already gotten a table when I got there so there wasn't a wait.  However, there were only two place settings at the table and our server never even offered to bring me one or a menu or anything once I sat.

We ordered our lunches and still no place setting.  When our food came I had to ask for silverware, which he brought, but no napkin, which I had to ask for so he finally brought it.  I had ordered the steak medium rare and it was medium.  I ate it anyway and didn't complain since I wasn't paying for lunch and I knew these ladies were in a hurry.

If I had to rate Brio on all my visits together, I'd give it 4 stars, but based on this last visit alone I have to be honest and say it was only a 3-star visit.

Our staple happy hour place for Italian!  The $2.95 appetizer menu is so great!  Try the Brio burger, the ravioli caprese, and the sausage and pepperoni flatbreads pizza!!

Great outdoor vibe to just chill when it's decent weather :)

My company hosted our annual Holiday Office Celebration at Brio. Our event coordinator, Nova, was extremely helpful and accommodating. Our server, Jessie, was very attentive and professional. The food was prepared perfectly. The ambiance was very nice. We had a wonderful time and I would recommend anyone to this place, weather it be for a nice dinner, a happy hour treat, or any event. Thank you to the staff of Brio who made our evening!!

I want to start off by saying my wife and I love brio. We usually come about 6-8 times a year and even did our rehearsal dinner for our wedding here. We got seated right away, 4 total in the party, and for about 10-15 mins no waiter or anyone noticed us or said anything until I finally asked a bus boy to grab her. Not a good start but whatever, the service was bad for brio standards tonight, at least she was friendly. 

So the good, the reason we come. The food was great. We had calamri and sausage pepperoni pizza to start. Great. I got the lobster bisque and as always great. For dinner I had lamb, great!!, my wife had rissoito, pretty good, my friend had shrimp Vodak pasta, very good and his girlfriend had steak salad, which she enjoyed. For dessert we split tiramisu and creme breleu, both very good. Overall great meal and mediocre service. Will come back as the service is usually much better than today.

I visited this place during happy hour and it is one of the best in the area! The happy hour goes from 3:30-6:30pm and it includes a selection of drinks and food. The wine glass is $5 and it was good to see that they offer more than just the house wine during the happy hour. 

The food is simply amazing! I ordered the crispy shrimp (spicy Remoulade, green onions), the margherita dip (four cheese blend, tomato compote, Reggiano, basil, grilled ciabatta) and the black pepper shrimp (romano crusted eggplant, spicy black pepper cream sauce). All three of these dishes were delicious. I would order all three again. 

When I visited this restaurant it was a Thursday afternoon. The place was really full and it was difficult to find a table (even at the bar!). Because of how busy it was it was sometimes difficult to get our waitress attention in order to place an order. Even though she was swamped with work she was very friendly. 

This is a place I am def coming back. Thank you for the awesome food!r
Great food (Average for a chain) and service was really great!  Again, for a chain, great dining.  :)  Outdoor seating was wonderful on a late July night.

I ordered a salmon dish and a glass of great wine to pair. The waiter seemed new but I liked that they had the lighter calorie menu to choose from. You don't typically get that from an Italian style menu.

The prices aren't cheap, but I felt that my $37 for meal and wine was reasonable.

Good for groups.

Great service ( Anna) and great food! We had the flatbread  for appetizers and with a party of 6 had a variety of entrees.  I had braised short ribs with Brussel sprouts ( no pecans - I'm allergic)and polenta.  Others at the table had salmon, crab cakes , lasagna, chicken Caesar salad and shrimp alfredo.

We love Brio and come here pretty often for good food. Tonight we had the usual spicy shrimp eggplant, as always it was spot on. We also tried the sausage ricotta flat bread, was pretty good. My husband ordered the sausage tomato pasta, spicier than it looked. All in all the food was good. Would be giving 5 stars but our service was a bit slow. All of us were very thirsty and our server seemed annoyed that I wanted her to take down our visit credit. So that was a bummer for one of our favorite places to eat.
THE BEST LOBSTER BISQUE SOUP, the best service, best brunch and chicken lemon caper pasta

Dinner is always good but I love Brio for lunch...they have a Short Rib Sandwich that I CRAVE!  You always feel like life is good when you sit down at Brio. The service is good and the food is amazing. Enjoy!

Let me say this
Roasted Chicken Rissotto !!! So good!
My favorite item on the menu!
The flatbreads are very good as well. 
The service can be hit and miss depending on the night. 
Elevated Itailian Chain Food.

First experience as we were shopping at Town Square. While this place was very crowded it only took 5 min to get seated.The service was super duper and a cut above the best of most restaurants. The menu selections had something for every taste. I selected the 
Lasagna which I must say was The Best
my discerning palate has ever enjoyed.
My 3 guests also enjoyed their selections as well....and only left the design on their plates uneaten.
The prices are a little bit higher but well worth the quality and quantity proved.
Try it I'm sure you will enjoy it as well.

Tonight my boyfriend and I had one of the best dining experiences we've ever had. Craig B. was just brilliant. From the moment we sat down, he was so friendly and personable. We had never been to Brio before, so he explained the menu to us and answered my (many) questions. Craig was very attentive and went above and beyond to make our experience memorable. He even brought over complimentary tiramisu for the both of us, which was delicious. I had the Vodka pasta and my boyfriend had the lasagna, both were absolutely amazing. My favorite part of the evening, besides the wonderful server, was the atmosphere of the restaurant. There are lights strung in the trees and you really feel at home. Coming from a couple who dines out frequently, please don't hesitate to visit Brio in Town Square, you won't regret it. And ask for Craig, I cannot put into words just how wonderful he really was.

Went a while back for a little birthday dinner and order the mushroom ravioli. So delicious I cleaned the plate! The servers and bussers were friendly and helpful without interrupting too much and even turned on the heaters outside and set it up real close to us because it was cold out that night. Much appreciated. We got the dessert sampler and all three were so good, especially the creme brûlée. Definitely a nice spot for dinner that doesn't have to break the bank.

The happy hour is awesome! Great price for awesome food.  My boyfriend and I were just running errands at the apple store and we stumbled upon this amazing italian resturant.  We decided to sit at the bar during happy hour.  We ordered eggplant fries, beef carpaccio, and a burger. 

eggplant fries- breaded and comes with a yummy garlic aioli 

beef carpaccio- really yummy.. super thinly sliced beef with fresh arugula

burger- we were pretty blown away by how good this burger was.  Great price for great quality!

We will be back to try more items on the menu :)
I gave them 3 stars because I couldn't believe that ordering a burger and didn't want lettuce and tomato on there they said they couldn't do it that way. They had to put it on there. WTH.

I don't want to give this place 1 star but after last night I have to. I've eaten here many times and it's always so good and the service is good. I made a reservation for 8:30, checked in with the hostess and she said we would be seated soon. Unfortunately we sat there for 45 minutes past our reservation time. Not happy with that at all. 

The only explanation we were given was that they were running behind because it was Valentine's Day! Well obviously that's why I made a reservation. Maybe you shouldn't double book your reservations so you can seat people that expect to be seated on their specified time.

Disappointed!!!

Update (5/19/2008)

For my original review, see below.  However, an update and upgrade in rating is called for.  After submitting my complaint to Brio's management, they took exceptionally thorough remedial measures to correct the issues I had.  They talked to the waiter and offered a discount on my next meal.  I understand that screwups happen, but when a restaurant takes the effort to mitigate the poor experience, that's worth a lot to me.  It means the restaurant does care about your dining experience.  The management staff was very attentive to my concerns and I would go back to give them a second chance. :)

(Prior Review)

For 75 dollars for a group of three, this place is was a major disappointment.  The decor is nice with vaulted ceilings.  The ambiance is loud but acceptable.  The problems with this place are significant.  I can recommend the carbonara since it was the only dish that was properly seasoned.  My two associates ordered the lobster risotto and veal scallopini.  Both dishes were sent back for being underseasoned.  The risotto was overcooked and thereby mushy with only a hint of lobster taste.  The scallopini was so underseasoned that my associate had to cover it in vegetables to give it some flavor.  The service was equally disappointing.  Our bill was mixed up with another table.  If I didn't check the receipt, I would have overpaid.  I informed the waiter who corrected the mistake.  However, when I asked for the receipt showing the prior charge was voided, he argued that the receipt was fixed.  I think he was too busy trying to argue with me that he wasn't listening to what I was asking for.  He then blamed me for not being clear.  Holy crap.  Are you serious?!  I left a 4 dollar tip only because leaving ZERO is reserved for particularly egregious service but this case came close.

My Hubby and family and friends take me out to Vegas for my birthday and I have to say this one was the best place I have ever been. I loved the atmosphere and the food was so good the service was top notch. You start off with salad bar lobster bisque and they have sushi too. The waiters come round with all sorts of meats and sliced right at ur table and all the varieties of the meats I can't count em all... However my favorite was bacon wrapped filet mignon . I even had a birthday cheese cake and everyone sang to me. I highly recommend you try this place when out in Vegas . I will be coming again and I'm bringing my kids. What an experience .

Wow, 5 stars food and service!! I am here from out of town I sat at the busy bar for food and drinks - both bartenders so attentive and made the best drinks.  The food was delicious and came out in a timely manner!

Ordered:
Pasta alla vodka (taste was as expected, but pasta was overcooked)
Sourdough bread (normal)
Chocolate molten brownie (a bit dry)

Service was good, but they are being pulled down by food that is not that great.

First time here at this restaurant & I will be coming back. Awesome experience. Awesome customer service & they have a beautiful clean establishment. Lovely staff. Kai was my server & he was amazing. Thank you!

My guests and I were seated and we asked for bread, as one couple had just gotten off a plane and they  were starved.  We got it 20 minutes later after asking 3 more times and threatening to leave.

The Calamari appetizer was the worst ever.  50% of the plate (not exagearting) was old breading, and the calamari was tough and overcooked.

I ordered the Shrimp Risotto, which used to come with shrimp and scallops.   No more scallops.  But of course they raised the price on the dish anyway.   Welcome to new American dining.   Cut the food.  Raise the prices.

Brio presents a nice atmosphere because it was physically well designed.  Problem is, they forgot to hire anyone who can cook or provide nice table service.
Pretty good italian chain restaurant. The outdoor seating at this location is really nice.

Got to try this place because while in Vegas - we met up with family and they recommended this place to meet up and I am SO GLAD they did!

I had their Brio Sliced Steak Salad - This was SO GOOD and I LOVED it.  The salad had tender slices of steak with a chopped salad that had a delicious balsamic dressing along with tomatoes, gargonzola, mushrooms, spicy pecans and I think there was a bit of creamy horseradish that gave it that perfect BITE with the steak!! Wish they had this dish at home! 

We also had the special which was the Seared Scallops with Risotto - I think my hubby pretty much inhaled this dish and the plate licked clean!  Other family members had the Lobster and Risotto!  The TAIL was HUGE - they LOVED it and each of the risottos were paired with wine which went perfectly with each of the dishes!

We were so stuffed we couldn't eat dessert but i have to tell you - the food, service, atmosphere was PERFECT! We sat around and enjoyed our meal and company with water glasses getting filled and just great service all around.

I actually wish we had a Brio Tuscan Grille in the bay area but at least now we know a go to place when in Vegas!!

Just had our anniversary dinner at Brio with our family..,in one word, FABULOUS!  This was not our first time dining here , and as usual, it was not a disappointment! Three of us in our party had the Chicken Marsala and one had Pasta Brio.  The Chicken Marsala was tender, large size portion, Marsala sauce was flavorful and good consistency, plus they don't scrimp on the mushrooms. The asparagus was seasoned to perfection and cooked perfectly, as well. We all had Caesar salads that were fresh and with a great tasting Caesar dressing ! The Pasta Brio was also a huge hit... rigatoni with grilled chicken, and seared mushrooms , in a roasted red pepper vodka sauce! Just a winner of a night all the way around! Fantastic dinner, outstanding service, beautiful ambiance,  and lovely company to enjoy it all with!  Anytime you want to awaken your taste buds with a flavor-bursting meal, Brio is definitely the place to go! :)

My first visit here by recommendation and oohhh why oohh why don't you have a location near my home?? 

I had the medallions encrusted in artichokes, fresh grilled veggies and yummy mashed taters. I most often alter my mashed but these were so buttery and creamy they didn't even need salt. 

My boyfriend had one of the specials for the day. Grilled yellowtail with mashed taters and grilled asparagus. The fish was grilled just perfect and the seasoning was very good. 

We also had their signature bruchetta which I am still dreaming about and trying to figure out a way to make it myself since they are not local to me. 

I also here they have a great Happy Hour but e were here on a Saturday s we did not partake.

Town Square is the place to be for happy hour!  With so many choices - Brio Tuscan Grille is a great place to get your grub on for cheap!

Their Tuscan Taster Menu is available in the bar area only and runs
Monday through Friday: 3 pm to 6 pm
Sunday through Thursday: 9 pm to close

All nine of their mouthwatering items are only $2.95!!  What a steal!

* Braised Meatballs & Creamy Polenta "Topped with Marsala tomato sauce, Reggiano and parsley." - Three generous sized meatballs in a tasty and tangy sauce.  The polenta is a minimal amount the covers the bottom of the dish, but a nice touch.  The Husband really enjoyed this and was about to get another!

* Beef Carpaccio "Served with field greens, capers, mustard aioli and shaved Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese." - Our favorite of the ones we tried, so we got two orders.  So good and tasty, and the field greens are a nice complement to the dish.

* Margherita Flatbread "Fresh Mozzarella, vine-ripened tomatoes and fresh basil." - Very basic flatbread pizza, no fancy frills here.  A nice simple crunch.

* Sliced Steak Bruschetta "With Gorgonzola Dolce, arugula, fennel, charred tomato, shaved Parmesan and Tuscan Italian dressing." - Four slices of bruschetta makes this a hearty dish with the cheese and beef.  Good flavors though and sauce adds a nice sweetness.

Unfortunately, their happy hour only extends to the food so there are no drink specials.  (When I called, whomever answered said there were drink specials but it wasn't so when we sat down.)  

The bartenders took our food and drink orders, and the food came out promptly.  We had no issues with service as a result unlike the other reviewers.

Overall, it's a nice place and we enjoyed ourselves here.  The dining room looks like a grand hall with all the drapery.  I suggest getting your grub on here and getting drunk somewhere else if you want to save a few bucks.

Update! 07/15/09 - Went back again last Friday and finished off the entire Tuscan Tasters menu.

* Brio Burger "A quartet of BRIO's famous Bistecca Burgers, with smoked Mozzarella and housemade chips." - A very decent size burger for three bucks that was tasty and cut into four, perfect for sharing.  Chips were yummy too!

* Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant "Grilled shrimp with Romano crusted eggplant and a black pepper cream sauce." - A surprise goodie!  Came with eight shrimp/eggplant stacks and definitely would definitely order again.

* Sausage & Pepperoni Flatbread "Fresh Mozzarella and housemade tomato sauce." - Good pizza where they aren't shy about the toppings.

* Shrimptini "Chilled shrimp served in a martini glass with roasted tomato cocktail sauce and fresh lemon."  Uneventful of the bunch, fine for simple shrimp but lacks any excitement.

* Roasted Red Pepper & Fresh Mozzarella Bruschetta "With fresh basil and balsamic drizzle." - Tasty bread bites with four pieces of bruschetta.

This time we went with a group of four and ordered one of everything.  It pretty much filled us for the most part, although if you're hungry, just double up on the burgers and meatballs.  We grabbed a little table this time in the bar area inside and our waitress was fine again.  It took a bit of time to get the table cleared and for the orders to go in, but nothing to complain about.  

Overall, they did well again for filling our tummies on a budget!

I used to go to the brio in town square every time I was in town, but this one is just as good, without the crowd. And it's closer to where I stay. 

PS...I've recently stopped eating meat. When I ordered my usual dish (a pasta with chicken, pine nuts, tomatoes, idk what it's called but it's delicious) but asked for it without chicken, the waiter asked if I wanted to sub anything in it's place. Yes please! I asked for eggplant. I think I enjoyed it more with the eggplant than I ever did with the chicken. Hopefully if I end up at another location at some point they will do the same.

I walked in and felt like i was in a hotel. Maybe bellagio cafe or something. not sure. But it didnt feel like any italian restaurant ive ever been to. not that thats a bad thing. the bread they put on the table was somewhat epic. im not sure ive ever said that about bread, but it was. the butter was on the sweeter side but the bread was so good it didnt need butter. for an entree i ordered the chicken pomodoro classico. probably the best pasta dish ive ever had in vegas. Direct from the menu..."Angel hair with grilled chicken, tomatoes, pine nuts, basil, Parmigiano-Reggiano and pesto drizzle 14.15"...yum. the pine nuts were a really nice touch.

what i dont understand though is why they dont have gingerale. the waitress was really sweet and tried to make it by mixing pepsi with sprite. but it didnt taste like gingerale. so i just had a pepsi. 

overall really good for lunch. im told lunch here is better than dinner. who knows. get gingerale!

Brio hands down is fantastic. From this location, patio, bar and restaurant, food and drinks, we always find ourselves coming back here. We either sit on the patio or at the bar when Mandi is working. She's so awesome and pays equal attention to all of her guests. Very down to earth with a fun personality. Her espresso martinis are one of the best. Trust me on that! The food has never once when disappointing and the flour less chocolate cake is one of the best! Also to note they offer a rewards program! They have an AWESOME Happy Hour with food and drinks. Plz check out the menu as there is almost something for everyone. The patio is casual with tables and also offer laid back lounging with cushion patio furniture. 

Also note the patio is not puppy friendly so no pooches allowed there.

Other then that this restaurant is great!

I've driven by Brio many of times and never really had any desire to visit this place. My family talked me into it the other night. So it was game on for this place. 

Walking into Brio I was a little surprised. It seemed like a more upscale Macaroni Grille. They use butcher paper for their table tops but fancier than MG. They have high ceilings and somewhat reminded me of some of the Las Vegas places with high ceiling and huge lights. Very nice decor. 

We started off with their bread basket of hot sour dough and flat bread. Really good. Down right outstanding. So if this was good I can't wait for our meals so come. 

I ordered the Sausage Peperonata Pomodoro. Very nice dish. Nice amount of sausage that had a little kick with tender pasta, cherry tomatoes, and Broccoli. The cream sauce was really good. It was really tasty and I really enjoyed it. 

I would say the star of our dinner was my wife's Balsamic Strawberry Chicken Salad. Wow. Outstanding. My wife was raving about it and everyone tried it. Both of my kids said that next time they are going to order this salad. It was the BOMB. I don't remember what was in it but it was booming with flavor. 

My daughter really liked her Chicken Pomodoro Classico with the red sauce. Looked really good and she just gobbled it up. My so ordered the Raviloi Di Bello and it had mushrooms and tomatoes. I tried this and the Raviloi was so fresh with cheese in the middle. It was very good and filling. 

We had a really good meal and everyone enjoyed their dinner. Our server was Dane S. She was really good. She welcomed us very quickly at our table and brought us our water cups. She was always paying attention to us. She did a great job but she was all business. She didn't show no personality but that's okay. 

So let's see. Nice decor, high ceilings which makes the place a little loud (that's okay), very good food, and excellent service. What more can you ask for.  So I enjoyed a great meal and will definitely be back. Enjoy.

I was initially let down that there was too long of a wait for the patio as it was a gorgeous day outside..nothing their white peach sangria couldn't fix! I'm normally a red wine kinda gal, but seeing as this was recommended by both my boyfriend and the server I decided to give it a try. It was good until (almost) the last drop...last few sips tasted like straight soda. 

    On to the food. I have had quite a few beef carpaccios in my day but none come even CLOSE to comparing to the one they have at Brio. It was about half the size of me, unbelievably fresh and drizzled in what tasted like a garlic aioli. Mind. Blown. The Caprese salad was pretty tasty as well but needed a bit more balsamic glaze; I was too emanored by the carpaccio to remember to ask for more hehe. We also had the bruschetta quattro, Pasta Brio and the special bruschetta, which was a spicy shrimp with lobster butter. I, being allergic to shellfish, could not have the special bruschetta, hence why we ordered this way.

    I deducted a star because the shrimp bruschetta was on the serving plate with the other assorted bruschettas. My allergy is not deathly so I simply avoided the pieces on either side of the shrimp, but as a server they should be a little more careful when a guest states they have an allergy. Hives aren't exactly my idea of a "fun" Friday night. 

   On a side note: The Pasta Brio tastes just as good cold as it does fresh out of the kitchen.

I had the chipotle chicken and bacon panini- it was the bomb! Also had a bite of the risotto chicken, and it was good. Some of the decor and ledges were a little dusty, but overall really great dining experience.

Horrible service, it was my second time I was excited to bring my mom here for her birthday but the service just sucked!

We came in around 7pm & was seated right away. Our table was far from everyone else kinda in a corner but 20 mins after they sat a bigger party on our side. But it felt like we didn't matter, kinda felt embarrassed bringing my mom here for her birthday. 

Our server couldn't remember her name but she would forget things, they were having specials about steak and lobster that we were interested in she had told us she'll bring us the brochure never did, when we asked her for it she said there wasn't any left but I don't think she bothered to check...
It took 40 minutes for our food to come out, at the 30 min mark she asked how was everything? All they brought out was our soup & salad, we had asked where our food has been she had no idea.. she knew we were frustrated so she had her manager Hannah apologize to us... but what's apologize going to do when everyone is starving on top of that getting horrible customer service??
She also kept refilling the coke my sister had ordered but not once refilled our water until we finally had ask the MANAGER.

Over all not a good experience coming from a restaurant like this...

Brio is one of the best happy hour restaurants around. The food is a great deal! The shrimp and eggplant dish is my favorite. The burgers are juicy and full sized at happy hour prices. The sangria, both red and white are delish! If you want a deal, and quality food, look no further!

Great food and atmosphere. A bit loud that's why it's 4. Otherwise the service has always been great. The wait is not too bad. The food has always been good. The lobster bisque is a bit too oily but other dishes are great. Would definitely recommend it. In fact among all the restaurants at Crocker park, I would recommend Brio for quality. 
Oh by the way the happy hours is also great. They have the most amazing burger.
The fresh bread is to die for, I think I have gone to Tuscany heaven!!! I had an  omelette, this time. Nice flavor served open face. Great atmosphere and service.

I come here for lunch and a glass of wine every time I am in Las Vegas. Are usually opt for the shrimp Mediterranean which is a very tasty low calorie option on their menu. It is plenty of food to feel satisfied and still healthy. Add a glass of rose and that round out the meal very well. The cracker bread and sourdough loaf that they serve or both delicious as well.
Today I just stopped in for a glass of wine and to use the Wi-Fi so I could get some work done while waiting to check into my hotel. I found a comfortable seat in the bar area and couldn't believe how great the service from both the bartender and the support staff were. I had to write a review just to comment on how wonderful they were even though I wasn't eating. 
Great job and I will return next month!

Did an online order and I picked it up.  First I waited 30 Min beyond scheduled picked up time.  They forgot the salad that I ordered with my $35 steak meal.  Ordered medium rare and was given well done...not edible.  Called the manager and was told if I come in regularly to find her and she will give me something extra.  Well I won't be going back...can afford to pay for another wasted meal

Follow up:  I actually never experienced such good customer service to resolve my issue.  I was contacted by Brio and really received a sincere apology.
LOVE Brio. Food is always great service is always on point. And let's not forget how awesome the bellinis are!!! Highly recommend even if just for a lunch for one.

It feels like if you're not willing to shell out big bucks for the extravagant restaurants, you're going to eat crap. I was very grateful for this restaurant because food was reasonable and tasted reasonable as well.

I ordered the pasta alla vodka, and it was delicious. I love stuffed pasta, and this didn't disappoint stuffed with ricotta. The portions aren't as large as you'd expect from Olive Garden or some other pasta place, but larger portions doesn't always mean better food anyways. We saved half of our entrees to save as leftovers and munched on an extra serving of fresh bread. Yum!

Brio is very pretty, light, quiet, not the best place if you have rowdy kidlets. 
 The Calamari is VERY good, and the Lobster Bisque is uite tasty. The desserts are smal enough to be crazy, except the cheesecake, but if you're prdering cheesecake calories may not be your focus. heh
 We had two great servers, and were checked on often, but my daughters coffee never got refilled. There was a chari in a sitting near us LEAKING. Dripping onto the floor. No one knew why and the servers stared at for a long time after I pointed it out, but no one cleaned it up.....? Really?

I was here last week for Happy Hour with friends. Staff was friendly and helpful as always and the food was spot on.

I've been going to Brio for years. They are always consistent. Regardless of when I'm there, the food is always flawless.

The convenient location in Tivoli makes it the best place to stop for a quick bite before a movie or routine Summerlin shopping trip

Highly recommended.

I was initially concerned because it is located in a shopping area but was extremely impressed when I walked in.  The restaurant is beautiful and very inviting!
