I absolutely loved the ambiance...if you like Tuscan Mediterranean decor with wrought iron, rich colors, and beautiful architecture..this is the place....it is loud, but hey everyone one seemed to be enjoying themselves...Our waiter introduced himself as Mr. Meat and he had a great personality and made great recommendations..we started out with the calimari..loved the marinara on the side but not a fan of the white sauce though.  Their chopped salad was fresh, and crisp with chopped olives, tomatoes, cheese and mouth watering vinaigrette.  My husband had the shrimp mediterranean...grilled prawns, spinach, cherry tomatoes, tossed in a delicious light sauce over a bed of orzo..loved it!   I had the creamy cheesy bacony chicken carbonara with baby spinach tossed into the mix!  Bread was delish..  Loved the experience..will definitely be back when visit Vegas again..

We had our weeding dinner in their banquet room. Their staff was top notch and accommodating. The banquet planner had everything set up well and the food was outstanding.
It created an experience for a lot of my family who were not accustomed to a dinning experience like this.
We are very grateful to their whole team for making this day memorable.

This place was really just ok.  Its overpriced Italian food but with a beautiful ambiance.  Went here and made a reservation.  Thank goodness we did because the wait would have been over an hour!!  And even with a reservation they sat us 15 mins later.....

We got water and menus promptly and decided to order the pasta tuscano, the vodka pasta, the shrimp and eggplant appetizer and the beef Carpaccio.  Food came out relatively quickly and we got everything at once.  The beef Carpaccio was plated beautifully.  It was in this gigantic plate that took up the whole table space.  Beef was sliced super thin and stuck to the plate.  You can't even pick up a piece of it without tearing.  I don't know if that's good or bad.   But it was delicious and fresh.  The eggplant and shrimp was probably my favorite dish.  A little salty but the eggplant was perfectly fried and crispy.  It was not mushy at all even though it was smothered in sauce.

As for the pastas, the noodles were cooked well.  It wasn't aldente and I actually liked that it was softer.  The tuscano pasta is Bolognese made with sausage instead of beef.  I was disappointed because it tasted overly cheesy and the sausage is overwhelming.  I think I like the original version with beef better.  The vodka pasta was very good.  It was ricotta stuffed pasta in a creamy tomato sauce.  The ricotta was light and airy and the tart tomato sauce balanced it well.

Overall, this is not a place I will come to again on my own.  Its a nice ambiance, but too expensive for the quality of food.  Our waiter was also super FORGETFUL.  Had the ask for water, plate, fork, check TWICE.

I originally intended to hit up their happy hour, but it being a Friday night, it was too packed. Decided to get a table for dinner instead. I was hesitant because it seemed a bit on the pricey side for some of their dishes. But after tasting the food... no regrets. I had the pasta alla vodka. Our waitress said that it is their best selling dish. I can see why. Oh, and the marscapone cheesecake? OMGRN. My only qualm was how loud the dining area was. I will try to go back on weekday for happy hour.

OMG, I LOVE LOVE LOVE this Brio location! Practically every single time we go there, we have exceptional service and tasty food (the bread is to die for!). If something's not right, they fix it right away. 

My favorite dish is their beef medallions...I don't know what's in the sauce, but it's addicting! And their desserts are good too. The restaurant has a very nice ambiance to it, it's very rustic and relaxing. 

I highly recommend trying Brio out if you're in the mood for some good Italian food and great service!

The food was great and the dessert was excellent. We had the Dolchino Trio dessert plate. Best of all was our server Alexander. He did everything right. He served us the night of 11/11/2017. We didn't have to wait for anything. He offers us bread after we finished our first bread plate, filled out waters frequently, recommended plates.

Went for dinner with my bestie n had great time. Food was delicious! We Had my favorite beef carpaccio as appetizer. My entree was shrimp & lobster pasta which was so yummy!! Service was good n the place wasn't crowded this time. Dinner was very yummy as usual.

We went for happy hour and were pleasantly surprised. They have a $2.95 food menu for happy hour and the options were very good. I had the Margarita flatbread and my companion had the Angus burger. Both tasted great. The burger, although on a $2.95 menu is a full size burger cut into 4 pieces. I also had a mojito which was very good, although this can easily vary by bartender.

Stay away from this place. The food was horrible. I complained to the executive chef who was working last weekend. He didn't even have the courtesy to come and see me when asked. Found a band aid in my food. The management criticizes employee's right in front of you. I would hate to be an employee there. A manager Tony belittled a female employee almost to the point she was crying. How extremely unprofessional. Eat at Claim Jumper next door!!!! I would gave NO STARS but I had to give 1.

My wife and I have been to Brio in Tivoli Village and Town Square for happy hour, lunch and dinner many times over the yrs, sometime with our friends, too, and always have good experiences. 

This evening my wife and I went for an early dinner. The pleasant hostess took us to a nice and quiet corner table. The dining room was not crowded, yet, so was pretty quiet, although the bar area was hopping, as the patio was a bit too cold, even for the tough young crowd. Our server, Kim, was very friendly and helpful, and got our beer orders (Blue Moon, $5.25) started immediately. Good thing she did that for us, too, because the barkeeps were kept super busy by those happy yuppies, who "never seem to have to work!"  Boy do I envy them!  ;-)  
The wait staff quickly brought us our favorite bread basket with warm and delicious rolls, which we enjoyed over our beers. And I started feeling great!

BTW: Brio's STILL  DON'T serve Blue Moon on DRAFT, yet, only in a bottle! SIGH! 

For dinner, my wife ordered the "Sliced steak salad" (15.95), and I had the "Mediteranian shrimps" (15.95). Both were delicious! The steak was tender and juicy and in good quanty; shrimps were cruchy fresh and very tasty! Their presentations were quite appetizing - I totally forgot to take any pics of our dishes, being distracted by our hunger and discusions on our travel plans for 2014! Trust me, our dinners looked good! 

Our sweet server Kim (no, she is NOT Korean) was attentive and pleasant; her crew was efficient, keeping our water glasses full, and putting our finished dishes discreetly away. Kim also did us a great favor, taking the time to straighten out the mistakes with my Brio's reward account and honored my $15 reward credits - very nice of her!

During our dinner, the hostess (perhaps also mgr) came by to say hello, and later helped the waitress out with our check. [i.e., taking it to/from the cashier, but NO, she did NOT really help out with the $Check, You Silly!]  ;-)   - A nice business practice! 

The Brio brand is characterized by its reliable, good italian style cuisine of VALUE; spaciousness, comfy ambience; vibrant bar scene; excellent service. Hmm...table cloths also add a touch of elegance. Of course there are other comparable restaurants, but I think Brio stands out in ITS CLASS. 
- My friends say, it's like dining in a "Mid-Upscale" restaurant at Olive Garden prices. 

For me, the Brio's in general and this locale in particular is one of the places I would go on a whim for happy hour (their $4 tasty small plates, Wed Martinis...are hard to resist at times) and/or for a tasty meal - NO SURPRISES!

Jan 2014

As we were still dining, I literally thought of those award shows where the recipient thanks everyone including their kindergarten teacher for helping them become the success they are now. That is what it's like to dine here. The hostesses were friendly and greeted everyone warmly as soon as you stepped inside. 
     The waitstaff is knowledgeable about their menu, friendly, and attentive. Seriously. You can gaze around you and see that at every table. 
     The place itself is nice and they make sure that it stays looking that way. The people busing the tables were prompt and thorough. One second it seemed like their were dirty plates on the table next to us, and the next, gone. 
     The food! Everything we ordered was cooked to perfection and tasted wonderful. When you leave thinking about what other things you want to try as well the next time because it was so good... 
     By this point I'm sure that you get the reason for the 5 stars and why I recommend this place to anyone reading this review.  They do have outdoor seating, although we didn't see anyone dining outside at the dinner hour we were there. Dress seemed more casual with those who looked under 30 and casual nice to a little dressy for those older than 30. Just what I observed.

The food was good.. the only thing I'm taking couple stars off the review is because our waitress kinda sucked.. I understand that it was dinner rush but she hardly checked up on us after the food was dropped off..
This time was good, I ordered porkchops. Service was good. I've ordered some pasta dishes in past but I think I'm going to stick with the grill menu items if I am coming here.

I went in during happy hour with one of my friends the selection was fantastic and the bartender was so friendly the only thing I would say is there was some other lady behind the bar that wasn't the bartender I don't think and she was so unfriendly I was nervous to ask for a to go box I would definitely come again and one bad apple doesn't spoil my experience I loved the soup

Although this is an Italian chain restaurant, I really think Brio is above the rest of its chain competition.  An old friend reached out to me the other day and suggested we do dinner, so we decided to visit this place last night.  

The place is dramatic.  There's linen draping the entire top of the inside.  The lighting is dim and super intimate.  Great place for a date!  Our server was cordial and didn't bother us much during our meal.  I appreciate very personable service and a lot of interaction, so it was a little quiet for my taste, but not bad to say the least.  

Tonight, we got a bottle of the Tavolo Matto (house brand) pinot grigio.  It was good enough for a house wine at $24 for the bottle.  I also go the sweet potato & chicken risotto for $17.65 which is a weird price.  One thing I can always count on Brio to deliver is an awesome risotto!  So creamy and perfect!  I LOVED the big chunks of sweet potato, asparagus and chicken.  Brio tends to change what they add into their risottos however, I don't mind.  Whatever they add, I know is always good.

I don't tend to visit this place often because I consider it on the higher end of my budget.  I don't really think spending $30 a meal (including drinks) is spending my money effectively, however, it's a great place to visit once in a while.  Tonight was a special occasion and I'm convinced that Brio will be a great place to return to on another occasion!

Attention: Their Happy Hour Menu is BETTER than McCormick & Schmicks!

I thought I would never say this, but for the quality (better) & price (same) you can get more for your tummy & money here.

Monday - Thursday 3 - 7 PM, 9 - 11 PM + Friday 3 - 7 PM you can enjoy their Tuscan Tasters menu for $2.95. You don't even have to purchase a beverage to get this deal either...just sit in the bar area. 

The bar area is half-inside and half-outside with a bar, but also high tables and even some nice chairs (but they go fast!)

We tried the: 
*Brio Burger - great "soft" burger w/ homemade chips
Ravioli Caprese - crusted ravioli w/ tomato/mozzarella drizzle
Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant - seared shrimp & breaded eggplant
Sausage & Pepperoni Flatbread - self-explanatory on cracker bread
Steak Bruschetta - steak & arugala on french bread

Liked all of them...burger & pizza were the most filling. Shrimp was small, but tasty. Bruschetta & ravioli had a nice taste to them.

Dessert Trio: hazelnut/chocolate cannoli, caramel cheesecake & choc chip bread pudding. 

This dessert was awesome! We were about to leave, but I saw the dessert tray (better seeing what you're getting in person - great marketing tactic for visual learners like me) and was hooked! 

Each dessert had tons of flavor that you had to take small bites to enjoy each sensation in your mouth. 

I can't say enough great things about this place. The fact it was off the strip and mostly locals went there was one of the best parts. I learned that waking the strip is quite overrated....

Service was great and I am definitely hitting this place up EVERYTIME I go to vegas...

This place is really beautiful.
My date took me here on my birthday. 
We were seated in a huge round booth in the back facing the whole restaraunt, it's so beautful especially from that view. I love the ceiling decor.
It was $5 Martini Thursdays! so of course I had a caramel chocolate martini and he had a dirty martini with blue cheese olives
he gave me one of the olives, so good!
for Appetizer we had Lobster Bisque Soup and Spicy Shrimp with Eggplant, both were delicious. I don't even like Eggplant, but this was actually good.
The appetizers were filling so we shared a entree of Gorgonzola Lamb chops (not on the menu) with this great spinach salad. I definitely recommend BRIO, those lamb chops were to die for. They pre split it up for us and we both had 4 miniature lamb chops and a side of spinach. That was thoughtful.

For dessert they bring over examples of all the desserts they offered. I ordered Butterscotch Pecan Bread Pudding and another caramel chocolate martini.

Then they surprised me with a Raspberry Mascarpone Cheesecake with 3 lit candles on it. That was so sweet. I made a wish and blew them out.

Was there while ago with my girlfriend, we ordered Vodka pasta and fillet mignon. Server was nice, complimentary bread, to be honest, I touched a bit and did not even pay attention onto. bread was cold, and hard. And it did not go well with butter either. But what made us our day was the main dishes.

Vodka Pasta - Flavor that I never tried it before. Creamy, flavorful, usually if you eat pasta, it sometimes does not have flavors that smothered into the pasta. At least the pasta that I tried, it was just so good and the cheese inside really harmonized well with the pasta and sauce. Which was one of the best pasta I have tried.

Fillet Mignon - Ordered Medium Rare, and it was cooked perfectly. I have never tried fillet mignon that is as juicy and tender as the one that I have tried here. And also, their side dish, I don't know what its called, but side of the potato and sauce on the top was just a killer. Something that you must try.


overall, it was a great experience and after I have tried all the other steakhouse, I will for sure come back to eat pasta and steak again.

We came in and were told it was a 45 minute wait or we could sit on the patio and be seated immediately. Seeing that it wasn't 120 degrees outside, we went for the patio. Our server was friendly and promptly brought us ice water and we ordered our spinach artichoke dip appetizer which was so good! My husband ordered the lasagna while I chose the shrimp and lobster fettuccine and a lump crab cake. So this is where disaster could have struck. We finally realized we had been waiting over 30 minutes for our food and the server finally arrived. While my dish was great, my husband's was ice cold. It looked congealed and just gross. We asked for a manager and he came out and we explained the situation and I said I wouldn't pay for his dish. The manager apologized and asked if he could redo it and make it to go since it was obvious we wouldn't be waiting any longer. He said the meal was on him and I said that was nice but really, just remove my hubby's dish. He ended up comping our meal and I had to get a soda to go so I could tip my server since we had no cash on us. I'm not going to punish her when it was an issue with the kitchen! That is the type of manager more places should have; it was apparent he cared about his guests and place of business and went over and beyond what he had to do. I really really hope he is recognized for this and we will be back again since we love coming to this place.

I came here with a big group from work for lunch last week. There were 3 servers assigned to our table, and they were all friendly. They were also pretty good about keeping all of our drinks filled, especially considering there was 12 of us.

I was trying to be healthy, so I ordered the tilapia and roasted vegetables. It was surprisingly good and had a little spicy kick to it. Plus, the portion size was very generous. Everyone else seemed to be pretty happy with their food too.

Although I had a good experience, I don't think it was anything special, especially considering the prices. If I had to actually pay, I think I would have been a little disappointed. All in all, it's not a bad place, it's just missing that certain something to push it up to 4 stars.

Ahh, Brio. The finer side of dining. It is one of my favorite place to eat pasta and salad. But not at this location. Town Square is much better, and nicer too! 

Ambiance: 3 - I mean, since you have the huge one at Town Square to compare it to, with TS's nice, high ceilings and romantic lighting..this location would be average. Tivoli seems like it caters more to families than the couples, adults, and tourists that crowd Town Square, sipping on wine and fancily buttering their bread. 

Service: 4 - Our server was extremely funny and had a great personality. If there's one thing about Summerlin..they know customer service. 

Food: 3 - First thing that has to get out: Food is a bit too pricey for what it is. I mean $15 dollars for a steak salad?! Come on now haha! 

I do admit that I am really into salads lately, and Brio's sliced steak salad is one of my favorite combinations of meat and greens. But I do remember thinking that it was wayyy better at TS. 

It was the meat that was -just slightly- better in quality at the other location. JUST slightly. It just tasted better at TS. 

Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad. It was average. Brio Tivoli is still a fair place to eat. But if there was a race... Brio Town Square would win.

I had a really good experience here at Brio; the food was warm and good..the dessert was delicious, but the menu isn't anything really special. they are just regular, run of the mill items.

It's clean, the waiters are nice and it's not very crowded! it's in a pretty cute area that you can spot it from the street. 

my opinion is that the one thing that stands out at Brio is the steak salad and the alcoholic beverages. those are my go-to favorites!

This is a sad story of a restaurant that when first open had great food, service and prices.  Unfortunately, I have seen the prices go up and everything else go down hill.  I hadn't been there in some time because I was not impressed with the last few times I had been.  But, as someone who goes out to dinner several times a week, I thought I would give it a try.  I ordered the salmon and could not believe what a small portion it was, but even sadder was when you flipped it over it was char BLACK on one side!!!  The waiter did take it back but it should have never been served and how awkward is it for the other people at the table to eat their food???  Don't think they will see me again!

This is one of our favorite happy hour spots and usually it's the first place that rolls off of our tongue on our Friday date night..everything that we have had is very good and so far we have been able to come right in and sit at the bar or around the bar.  So my 5 stars is worthy and we have been coming here for since they opened.

We had a great time at Brio the server Max was on top of everything very friendly and the manager Joe was very gracious and welcoming. We had ordered the lobster tail shrimp and risotto was an epicurean delight   We all 6 plan on returning soon and will be hosting a birthday party soon and plan on taking our friends there.

Have the opportunity last Monday to go to Brio Tuscan grille santan was warmly greeted by the general manager Joe who directed to our table John was our server he was did a very professional job the food was amazing and we will come back more often thank you for your friendliness having such a great general manager and server. You are the best.

I was wanting an inexpensive but good steak. I went with Pork chop plate instead-it was delicious! The vegetables did have an interesting flavor...
This was our second visit and not our last. Good variety of options for the good price

A double cappacino with artichoke heart dip and caprese.  Dining outside on Easter Sunday...here's a tip. No wait for outside dining and fortyfiveminutes for inside. Inside is noisy and your words bounce off the wall 

Having a salmon salad.  Oh yum. Lots of options under 500 calories by the way

I have wanted to eat here for a long time but my boyfriend is not fond of Italian. My mom and I Planned on coming to town square to hang out and do some shopping and we we're both hungry so I remembered Brio had a happy hour and it was almost 4 so perfect timing. 

We came in and sat by the bar for happy hour and I was kind of worried it would be too hot since it was hot outside , but the bar area is shaded so it worked out fine. Even if you do sit by the patio by the walkway and street they have misters and umbrellas. 

I decided to have a white peach Sangria which is $4 on the happy hour menu it was so refreshing and perfect for the hot weather and presented very pretty. My mom had a virgin Italian Lemonade because she was scared to drive with a drink in her :). For food we decides to go with Crispy Eggplant Fries ( recommended by a friend on yelp Thanks Nieves ! ) crispy ravioli and Tomato Mozzerella Salad just to start. The eggplant fries were perfectly crispy and super yummy. The pomodoro sauce for both the ravioli and fries was so yummy. The raviolis lacked flavor in my opinion. The tomato Mozzerella salad was really fresh and the balsamic glaze was perfect. It could have had more basil and glaze but that's ok. I just asked for some more glaze ;). I'm glad we only ordered those three dishes because a few raviolis in and some fries later I was stuffed. 

All the servers were friendly and food and drinks came out fast. Despite how busy it was. I suggest coming early and seeing if there is a wait because it filled up fast for happy hour. I will definitely be coming back to try the regular menu as I'm lasagna lover and I'm out to find the best in vegas. That I'm yet to find maybe it's hiding here at Brio. I'll find out sooner or later.

An excellent place for an early lunch as it fills up fast! It's huge inside and will remind you of a cross between an Olive Garden and a Macaroni Grill.

Similar food as the above mentioned restaurants with a tad nicer dining room.

Service was VERY good and FAST.  Food comes quickly.

Meals that include the salad are few, but for what it's worth, the chopped salad is incredible!  It's a meal by itself so make sure to share it.

The bread and crackers included with the meal aren't memorable and aren't served with any oil or spices.  Just butter.

Excellent evening, and wonderful spot for a date. We were seated quickly and greeted right away by our server. She got us waters while we looked through the wine menu. Brought us back bread and waters. We ordered wine and shortly after, our meals. Our meals came out quickly and hot. It was delicious. He ordered a steak and I ordered a pasta dish. Our server checked on us several times, bringing us more wine, more bread and refilling our waters. After eating, we paid our bill and sat and talked until we noticed a line forming at the door. We felt bad for keeping a table so we moved to the bar area for more wine. The staff there was attentive as well. The bar area is a nice area on the side, I think next time we might try sitting outside by the fires. We'll definitely be back.

I came here for Valentine's Day with my boyfriend and we loved it. Food was great and our server was so friendly and energetic despite probably having worked a long shift for Valentine's Day. Food came out promptly. I had the Lamb and my boyfriend had the New York Strip. 

The Lamb was seasoned well with lots of flavor and they were big shanks. I got the Brio potatoes which were very big and had this white sauce drizzled in which our server was a mix of ranch and cheese. Would recommend these. 

My boyfriend got the New York strip which was cooked perfectly however was lacking flavor. It wasn't anything to rave about and could've used even just a bit more salt and pepper. This is the reason Brio doesn't get 5 stars.

Dessert was a chocolate lava cake and it was so darn good! Molten chocolate inside and the cake just fell apart and mixed in with the ice cream. Definitely recommend this as a great way to top off your meal. 

Brio was not as romantic as I had expected. Don't get me wrong it was a beautiful restaurant, but it was very open and big. I was hoping for something a little more dark lit and intimate, but Brio better represents a nicer Olive Garden. I would say Cheesecake Factory is a better choice for a romantic dinner.

Came on a Monday and had to wait 20 minutes. After waiting, walked inside and half the restaurant was empty. 

After being seated and ordering, we waited 40 minutes for our food. When I asked how much longer our food would take she said "it takes 15-18 minutes to make your food" in a very snarky tone. 

When the food came out the steak was cold and the salad was soggy like it had been plated and left too long. The 2 pasta dishes we ordered were fine. 

In years of dining out, I've never had to speak to the manager of a restaurant to complain about service. The manager wasn't very helpful either and said she would check with us to make sure everything was ok but never saw her again.  The restaurant was obviously understaffed and mismanaged.

Went for lunch today. I can't wait to return. Had a strawberry chicken salad. They serve you warm bread. Happy hour looks really good. I plan to return for that. The service was 5 star and the ambience 5 star and food 5 star. Everything I saw coming out of the kitchen looked so good. I will be back soon. Tivoli village is such a beautiful place too.

Hadn't been here in several years. They do a solid job. Food was prepared just right and service was pretty good. Nothing to complain about other than my personal bias against chain restaurants as they all seem to have an institutional feel and there's never anything too exciting on the menu, just stuff that appeals to the masses. Overall pretty good and reasonable price for what you get. Good spot for lunch.

Planned my wedding reception in the round private room in the back here in 2011. When arriving to go over things the night before my wedding which was already hectic, the service I received was crap. However the next day the pulled it out and did an outstanding job. The day before is my only reasoning behind not giving them five stars. Without mentioning the total amount I paid...lets just say a small fortune. That erked me. The food was delicious and the prefixed menu came out nice. They did screw up the seating chart but who cares. The ambiance were nice and all and all it was a good choice.

I love coming here for happy hour! $2.95 food menu :) 

The only thing that sucks about happy hour is that it's only in the bar area only and the bar area can get packed really fast so come early to get a good table. Also, another thing I love about this place is their chocolate mints haha I think it's so much better than olive garden too. 

The staff here can also be a bit slow and lazy. Because every time i come here and there are empty plates on the table, the server would not pick it up unless we handed them the plate ourselves. It's a bit obvious that we're done with the plate when there's nothing left on the plate

My husband and I decided to sit at the bar today because we didn't have the kids and it made our experience so amazing! Bri was one of the beat bartenders in Vegas we have ever had the pleasure to meet. Thank you bri for turning around our opinion on service here!!!! We will definitely be back just to spend time with her and indulge in the delicious food! To top it off we ran into Alyssa who was an amazing server in another restaurant months ago. Good job Brio for hiring experienced personable servers and bartenders it makes the difference especially when we only have a couple hours alone!!!!

I just experienced the sea scallop risotto and it was delicious.  As was the chopped salad. As was the bread and butter...lol.  I was greeted with a smile.  Served with friendliness.  Best place I've eaten in town square so far.

Visiting Scottsdale with my girlfriend and went to Brio for dinner. Had the pleasure of meeting Chef Jeffrey Perin, who gave us some fantastic recommendations. We started with the Bruschetta Quattro, a nice sample of their house-made bruschetta. We then moved onto the Fennel Sausage & Roasted Tomato Trecce Pasta, which was very flavorful and satisfying. Next, we enjoyed the 14 oz Gorgonzola crusted Bistecca, which was outstanding. The meal ended on a sweet note with a petite, peanut butter & chocolate mousse. All in all, it was a great experience and a delicious meal! Next time we're in town, we will definitely return.

This is the worst restaurant I have ever been to. Have been there several time and every time: Horrible service. Food is mediocre and overpriced. Also, the veal is extremely salty. Not sure why it has so many stars....lol working for the food industry for years, I can't understand how they have such good business. One of my coworkers even left to work there and came back to the original job within a month. Not worth it to go there, don't waste your money.

We were in Vegas for a wedding and this was the reception. We arrived and I was skeptical because we we're at a mall and I was like "Really?". Turns out I was totally wrong! We arrived and we were taken to the back for the reception in a big open room. Food took a while but it was worth the wait! We received two different salads. One was a blue cheese with bacon and the other was your normal Caesar salad. Next came was fruits slices of grapes, blue berries, pineapples, and watermelon. The entrees finally came and it was freaking insane! We had asparagus seared with salsa salmon, creamy mashed potatoes, filet mignon, and their house pasta. The chicken pasta was my favorite dish because I had never eaten anything like it. Super delicious was the steak, tender and juicy with each bite. The salmon was a bit dry and the asparagus was sweet and crunchy.  Desert was a little coffee cup with cream, caramel, and cake. Very good place to eat and I would definitely go there again!

I went here with my sister one afternoon, and the service was a little off putting, seeing as I go here a lot. I was disappointed in my experience and told management about it. 
About a month later, I went in with my boyfriend. Got a nice bottle of wine, and we ordered some amazing food! I really liked the blackened tilapia. Our server was really awesome. Because of my experience last time, the management came to our table and was very apologetic. And discounted the whole meal! (Which I said I'd pay for the majority of it.) I was so impressed with my visit this time around I had to tip the waiter nicely, seeing as I got my meal comped. Will be back around to possible drink 2 bottles of wine :P

I don't usually review a chain restaurant but this one is special.  Although it is located in a "mall", it offers great outdoor seating in a comfy environment.  

Big plus, its meant for Vegas residents so its inexpensive.

They have a great tasting bar menu from M-F 3:30pm-6:30pm and M-Thurs 9:00pm till closing where all items are just 2.95.  Not just talking fries or chips either.  Great burger, sausage and pepperoni flat bread, beef carpaccio, spicy shrimp and eggplant, etc.  

Don't make the mistake of ordering the entire menu like a buddy and I did.  First your server and bartender will laugh at you (noob), and second, no way you will finish it (wasteful noob).

Wines are very inexpensive.  Large by the glass selection and generous pours are the norm.

If its a cooler night, sit outside by a fire pit and make some friends.

Service is very friendly (its a locals place).  Family friendly.

Oh yeah, the regular menu for lunch and dinner is also very good and fairly priced but you cannot beat the bar menu for price.

Well worth it.

I gave this place three tries over the course of a year.  I really like the decor, so I added a second star.

For Italian, it is Olive Garden grade at best at twice the price.  I have tried pasta, sandwiches and steaks, all of which didn't impress.

Tonight, the fettuccine was mush, stuck together and pasty.  It was obvious that my shrimp and lobster fettuccine was the first of five entrees complete and sat too long.

As they served, they handed me my plate and told me watch out, it is very hot.  Wait, what?   How about doing your job and presenting my entree to me on the table.


More disturbing, I ordered a bottle of wine.  The server poured and I took a couple of sips. I them noticed a two inch crack in the glass.  These things happen, but the waiter wanted to pour the wine from the cracked glass into another glass.  Wait, what?  (Again)

Overall, mediocre food, mediocre service, VERY LOUD ATMOSPHERE and pretty pricy.

Go to Olive Garden and save your cash.

My fiance and I went to Brio for our fourth anniversary.  We had nothing to complain about - the atmosphere, service, and temperature were really comfortable.  We ordered the artichoke-crusted beef medallions, bistecca insalata, and stuffed peppers.  The food came out faster than I expected and each course was well-timed.  The waiter did a great job keeping our table neat and checked on us appropriately.  Everything was cooked to perfection and very flavorful.  We had a great time and will return for another special occasion... we're poor college kids, so we can't really afford to be "regulars!"

I'm not the biggest fan of chain restaurants. Olive Garden, Cheesecake Factory, Outback--you catch my drift? To my palette, everything tastes the same--buttery & salty. I've sampled the Brio dinner menu on numerous occasions and I will not be returning for any entrees.

THE BAR: I frequent Brio for an entirely different reason: a half indoor / half outdoor bar that brings refinement to the ever frowned upon day drinking. In the Spring & Summer, I can be seen in my designer heels relaxing by the bar with a book, sipping on a glass of over-priced shiraz or moscato on a bright, sunny Tuesday afternoon. Town Square is such a pleasant place. A little pop-up of class down the street from what I consider to be the tackiest shopping mall in Las Vegas (Premium Outlets South). 

BAR FOOD: I can't help but jump for joy at cheap food. Brio has a bar menu that's only $2.95 a plate. I've sampled everything on that menu. At 3 bucks a pop, I think I can afford to do so. Serving size is pretty big too. I always order the beef carpaccio: thin-slices of raw beef drizzled with olive oil and other delectables. The flat-breads and ravioli are mediocre. The spicy shrimp is too salty. The burger is a burger. And the ravioli is pretty basic. Then again, at those prices I wouldn't expect anything too fancy.

In short, olive garden food at cheap prices, alcohol, and a pleasant drinking environment to make your day-drinking the slightest bit more upscale.

Beautiful atmosphere, the decorations alone in this place is super nice.  I really enjoy seeing the italian coliseum, wood floors, hanging lights.  Something you would see at caesars palace but off the strip.  The food we ordered were a bit lacking.  I ordered the burger which i immediately regretted as i should have ordered something authentic.  My gf ordered the flatbread sausage and pepperoni and you think this would be good, but unfortunately the taste was just okay.  Flat bread pizza tasted like crackers.  The lobster bisque was good.  The lunch menu had some decent pricing though and the meal was quite inexpensive

I would try the raviolis or pasta if i coukd next time i go.

I often come here for happy hour and though there selection is good, I am specifically writing this review on my bartender (nicole). Being as an employee in the industry, a Vegas veteran, and etc. I have to say that Nicole is the sweetest bartender I have had. Now of days (especially in the summer when your working out in the heat) bartenders are short and crabby, Nicole was very sweet, and made my visit comfortable!
Always a pleasant  experience. Above average chain restaurant, very clean, servers are nice and food is delicious! Can't go wrong

1 star for the server in the bar and the manager. Went in early during happy hour. Was seated immediately, greeted by male server and drink order taken. Server said he'd bring a happy hour menu. Another food runner/server brought the cocktail to me and I waited 15 minutes...for a menu. 

5 stars for the hostess (all of them, actually--every time). I asked to be reseated and the hostess was extremely apologetic and quickly took care of the issue. She had the manager take me to a new table. When I explained what happened to him, he said nothing, but "Would you like to order off the bar's happy hour menu in the main restaurant?" While I appreciated that offer, an apology would have been the appropriate action, talking to the offended server would also have been an appropriate action (I doubt this happened). I've eaten there dozens of times and this manager is severely lacking in customer service skills. 

5 stars for Jennifer the new server. She was friendly, knowledgeable and turned my dining experience around. Thank you Jennifer and the hostesses. Brio almost lost a neighborhood customer.

Fantastic restaurant. Service was great. Food was excellent. Their happy hour from 3-7 is great. 3.00 entree's.  Everything from a 1/2 pound burger to margherita flat bread pizza is just 3.00.  

Amazing appetizer is the shrimp and eggplant in black peppercorn sauce.
Good food and cocktails went for happy hour had the blackpepper shrimp and the black berry martini. Good bartender and the quality and portion of food is very good

I'll save you time having to read the rest of this review with this right here:

Good food
Small portions
Big forks

If you want to continue...this place is pretty tasty and for franchised Italian I'd place it above Carraba's and way above the Italian Denny's they call the Olive Garden.

So why 3 stars?

I felt the portions were really small compared to what I can get at a mom and pop Italian joint...perhaps two ravioli entrees for one person would have been sufficient. Also, although the flavor was excellent, I found the sauce accompanying the lobster and shrimp dish a little watery, but the shrimp on top of the raviolis were cooked perfectly. My date liked her Ravioli alla vodka but felt it was small for a dinner portion.

Also the warm bread wasn't bad but wasn't anything amazing and the butter wasn't soft...and the atmosphere is a little dark, but I guess that's what they're going for.

On a bright note, the food came out fast, the waiter was attentive and I went during "Ravioli Week" so the 50% off was a great deal...had I walked out hungry paying the normal price of $55 (tax+tip) for two small ravioli dishes I'd have felt ripped.

Did I mention I like their big forks?
Just had a most delicious strawberry chicken salad at Brios.  Very good service.  Enjoyed the mango tea as well.  Busy place.

We LOVE this place. One of our favorite happy hour spots. Goes til 7:00 so we even have time to go if one of us gets stuck at the office later than expected.

Food is incredible on the happy hour menu. Do yourself a favor and order the Margarita dip for an appetizer. It's unbelievable and super affordable on happy hour.

Probably the best part of coming here is the service. Amber is our favorite waitress and always takes great care of us. Ask to sit in her section if you come!

Not bad but not incredibly good, especially considering the prices. Most entrees were 18-25 dollars.  I was annoyed that my pasta was undercooked but the dish, Shrimp Verdata?, was pretty good overall. The lobster bisque was excellent. And the waiter and staff were extremely friendly and helpful. When we went there, they were full and booked solid. One friend was 30 minutes late but no one pressured us to hurry. So it's not a bad place to go, but you can get the same quality for cheaper elsewhere.
Great food ...good value...nice portions...great service....first time customer gets a free appetizer....wow

Seeing a familiar place made me very happy.  i was able to order what i knew best.  The service and atmosphere was what i expected.  

Only fault i saw was the bartender failed to explain their specials and had to find them on my own by remembering that i saw signs outside as i was walking in.

On a crazy busy 'day after Christmas' restaurant hunting expedition, our family in Scottsdale took us to Brio.  The food was all-around excellent, and the appetizers were out of this world.  The spinach dip and beef/shrimp appetizers were particularly memorable.  

An extra star for being so kid-friendly!   Our children were crazy/screaming by the time we were finally seated, and the waiters pushed the kids orders through quickly to maintain our sanity.  Thank you!

I ate there on the 4th of July and the service was excellent they had a special running with salad dinner and dessert only $30 the food was excellent worth quite a bit more than the $30 we paid for it my girlfriend me my mother and father all we're stuffed afterwards and decided the food was the best we had a long time the dessert was absolutely incredible the service was speeding the server was polite and pleasant all in all a fantastic restaurant in the Fantastic location Tivoli square is a beautiful little shopping area so much nicer than some of the other locations in the valley

Came in for the famous lobster bisque. The burrata plate with roasted tomatoes and toasted baguette is awesome. Service was energetic, enthusiastic, and speedy, followed by a check back to make sure the food was up to par. 
          Las Vegas is hit or miss for good service. This time at Brio my wife and I had a fantastic experience. Ask for Josh. Bearded guy with glasses. The guy is just precise.

Brio is definitely a house favorite for my family and I. We're definitely a regular for multiple reasons! 

From the lovely ladies who greeted us to the front to the gentleman that continued to monitor our table to make sure our drinks were refilled as well as our bread basket. Our server was and always is very friendly and needless to say patient. We're pretty indecisive mainly because every dish is so great. I usually don't step out my comfort zone and try new things but here I have no issue picking something new! Yes, I'm that annoying customer who will ask the server what their favorite dish is. I wanted something spicy so I got a pasta dish and as I write this review I've forgotten the name. The point is though you can't go wrong with whatever you choose. 

One thing I will recommend to fellow yelpers is you have to, HAVE TO try their Spicy Eggplant and Shrimp. Don't let the eggplant part scare you off. I know it's not everyone's first choice but you can't go wrong with this dish. It contains pan seared shrimp, Romano crusted eggplant and the best part the black pepper cream sauce. It'll immediately turn into one of your favorites. 

Also, this location had a great happy hour with live music on the patio! It seemed like everyone was enjoying their time while we choose to sit in dinning area. 

Great service, great dishes and a nice atmosphere; WINNING.
One of the best happy hours in Las Vegas. Great food (spicy shrimp, caprese, flat breads). Great drinks. Can't beat the prices. Great ambiance inside or outside.

Such an amazing experience. Came back to this particular Brio because of a prior great experience. The waiter Pedro was really good!! The night went smoothly because of him. He provided great customer service. I keep coming back because of the hospitality that is provided. Fantastic establishment.

LOVE coming here! Nicole M is the best bartender ever! She takes great care of us and is very precise and attentive, even on the busiest of nights! The food is great and the staff is very friendly! You won't be disappointed!

I have only been here for appetizers and sat at the bar each time.  The bar is big and has an indoor and outdoor space to choose from. The bartenders are friendly and attentive.  The appetizers are all pretty good.  I enjoy the different types of bruschetta a lot.  They have good drinks and happy hour specials as well.

Friday night was the second time I've visited this place. Atmosphere was nice, pretty dark, servers were very attentive but the food was not something that I would go back for. Especially a third time. Prices are pretty high but I was out with a friend and didnt have the family so that was ok. But the food once again was just mediocre. I ended up having the Sweet Potato & Chicken Risotto. Sauce drowned everything out and made it very soggy tasting...The only thing that made up for the food was that I wasnt paying and my peach bellini (AMAZING)...
I am super picky about my martinis and have never been disappointed. The food is good but they have hands down the best dessert....

I love, love, love this restaurant! My husband and I go almost every weekend for dinner or brunch(both are equally great), but my favorite time to go is during their weekday happy hour. The staff is very friendly and efficient, the bartenders know us by name and even remember our cocktail order. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting or who is new in town:) 

p.s. Try the black pepper shrimp and eggplant

Great off Strip restaurant. Great staff and service. Food is always great. Being Gluten Free is always tricky finding somewhere that caters to intolerances but this place has a great Gluten Free menu.

My review is only for their happy hour, which happens to be AWESOME. $2.95 deals such as a hamburger, shrimp cocktail, steak and gorgonzola bruschetta, and so much more. I must come back here and try everything they offer. It all tasted great. They also have a wide variety of drinks. I ordered the white sangria, which was good. Next time I want to try the strawberry drink. They have wonderful unique options and some have fresh herbs in them. The service was also great. It doesn't get better than happy hour here. I must tell you that if you order the food, there is no special prices for the drinks. However, the drinks are around $7, making the overall deal well worth it.

Nice place..great svc. brad the  server wa great . Yes, food was good. veal marsala with pasta.  the. ac could have worked better. My friends chicken dish was fine;
No free birthday dessert,   boo.

Got a table using the open table app! Had their ravioli, with a Caesar salad that was soooo good. My wife ordered some fish which was also really good according to her. Glad we found this place and had this great meal.
Came in for lunch with some friends and everything was great. Had a couple appetizers. Food was amazing as well as the service. Perfect place for any outing.

We've been here several times and have never had a bad experience.  They have plenty of different food options.  Good beer, wine and mixed drinks and great service.  They don't have a bad salad on the menu.   The burgers are great and all the appetizers are on point.  If you want a small meal and some drinks come check out the happy hour.  You won't regret trying Brio.
Brio's food is always the best! A small group of friends gathered for a birthday dinner one slow Tuesday night. The service was great! I recommend the pesto chicken pasta dish!

Coming here during Happy Hour is like getting a Gourmet-five-star-meal at McDonald's prices. But Better. Much Better. 

A friend and I looked at the Happy Hour Menu ($2.95/item) and ordered: 
1) BRIO Burger - Absolutely so delicious. We split this in half and got full of it alone. I still can't believe it was $2.95. Seriously? That's like 10x better than that 'fancy' Six-Dollar Burger at Carl's Junior. 
2) Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant - My favorite dish. I could have licked the plate til the sauce was gone. The spices and shrimp were so good I know I have to come back here for more. 
3) Sliced Steak Bruschetta - Also another delicious dish. 
4) Quattro Bruschetta ($14.95 value, and we got for free!) - This is the second time eating this bruschetta and the bread was moist with some of the most delicous toppings on top. 

And, our meal only cost $9.63 before tip between 2 people. That's under $5 a person! I highly recommend this place for anyone!! Next time I'll have to try the drinks -- its $2 off during happy hour too!

Tip: Sign up with Brio on their website and get a complimentary Quattro Bruschetta for free!

Evening before New Year's Eve, my kids, husband and I were hungry after a long day of walking the strip and sightseeing. Been in Vegas countless times but usually for work, so know the restaurants and bars in the hotels. Rarely do we ever leave the strip but the teenagers were asking for Italian so I got on Yelp and found Brio Tuscan Grille. We drove over and found a cute strip of restaurants. We were seated immediately even though they were busy. The decor is cool, the service excellent and the food was on point! Salad was fresh, pastas were made to order. Everything was top notch. Definitely a staple on our future visits to sin city.

location is good, Service was great but my food I have to admit was ok ordered the seared shrimp risotto was salty and oily, unexpected?? But i was hungry and ate it,as I came with a big party and did not want to complain,, but it seems the chicken and sweet potato risotto,looked more like risotto, mine look like a red mess,, maybe I will go back and try  their martini thursday, happy hour...

I enjoy coming to Brio from time to time. The interior decor is astonishing. High ceilings, beautiful tables, lots of choices for seating. It's quite appealing.

The food is delicious. Calamari is crunchy and very flavorful. It comes with two sauces, one being marinara. Yum! I usually order the Lobster and Shrimp Fettuccini. People, this entree is beyond this world. My taste buds went on a ride and never came back! Also, the lobster bisque is quite fascinating. Best I've ever tasted.

Service is delightful. I usually get the same server which is just my luck. Happy to say I'm pleased with the staff here.

The price is a bit on the higher end, although you pay for what you eat. Which is royalty.

There is free WiFi, no password needed. No bike racks nearby. Outdoor seating is optional. Reservations aren't required but they always help expedite your seating.

Overall, I'm pleased with the service, food, and amenities here. I'll be back in a few weeks.

Brio, what can't you do!!! My pasta comes out amazing every darn time! Happy hour is boss because you not only save paper on drinks, you also save on food items!!! You can dine inside or outside, or even at the bar. I prefer inside during the day and outside at night. The decor is phenomenal. It feels like I'm dining on the tank. No joke, it's extremely appealing and favorable to the eye. Also, there's tasty candy on your way out by the door. Snatch a pack and enjoy the final touch of your dining experience.

Pros: Delicious food, well priced, great decor, great service, free wifi, takes reservations, clean bathrooms

Cons: Food takes some time to reach the table

Overall: I'll see you shortly! In love with this spot. I can come here alone, with a friend or even with a date! It's great for all occasions!

I visited this location and ate the Roasted Vegetable Spaghetti (Add chciken breast)on the recommendation of the server. The meal was very good. The service from Amanda F was great, super friendly and very efficient. The atmosphere was pleasing, modern, and the dining area was clean.
Great place for lunch!  I loved my flatbread and my friends loved their meals as well. Service was average. I haven't tried their dinner menu so I'll definitely be back to try that.

Happy Hour: 
Monday- Friday from 3pm-7pm 
Monday-Thursday 9pm-Close.
Special Menu of $2.95 items.

I finally made it here to try their "Tuscan menu", and had the beef carpaccio, burger, shrimp cocktail, bruschetta, flatbread.  The burger was a little dry but worth $3, everything else was great!

I am not especially jazzed to be writing a review of Brio as it is more of a chain establishment; however, it has a couple of things going for it that elevate it a couple of inches above Wal-Mart, so I am doing it.

These things are atmosphere and tiny desserts. Let's start with atmosphere: the place is giant and perhaps bordering on tacky, but at least they tried, and they have probably the largest, most impressive patio in Las Vegas featuring not only tables but love seats and plenty of umbrellas. It must be at least a solid two blocks of outdoor experience. Of course, all of this is undermined by the fact that Town Square sits solidly underneath the flat path for McCarran, so every ten minutes you have a 757 flying over and rendering conversation impossible for about a minute. After about 15 minutes of this, my mom commented, "I hope they got a good deal on this property." I would say this makes what could be a five star atmosphere a three star experience, possibly even two if you are sensitive to jet engines.

Yet, they have one more trick up their patio: tiny desserts. Really, this is a brilliant idea, and I am not sure why more restaurants do not do this. Brio offers six miniature desserts. They come in what is best described as a sweet shot glass, which is probably the volume of 3 shot glasses. Each mini-sweetie only costs $2.45! My mom and I had the Peachberry Crostada topped with pecan streusel, vanilla bean gelato and Melba sauce. My mom wanted to order five more, and I can't blame her.

We both had salad and soup for our lunch, and those were done well. They also have a nice happy hour, but you have to sit at the bar to get those deals. I recommend just creating your own secret happy hour: grab a table on the patio and order $2.45 desserts until your sweet tooth begs for mercy. It's a good plan.

Great food. Great service. The atmosphere is lively but a bit loud. We were seated close to an outside door, so it was cold whenever the door was frequently opened - overall 5 stars. Our server was Abby - she was great!, ask for her section :)

Had lunch at BRIO today. Food was good as always. Unfortunately it was freezing inside the restaurant. We noticed that three large double doors were open to the outside patio where two guests were having lunch under two large space heaters. We asked our waitress, then the hostess and then the manager if they could close some or all the doors. We were advised that the fire code REQUIRED that all three doors remain open if there were any guests on the patio. Seemed strange. After more guests inside complained about the temperature (61 degrees) in the restaurant they closed one of the doors. Still freezing. Seems that the manager lied to us about the fire code or he broke it when he shut one of the doors. Does anyone know?

By the way as we left we noticed another restaurant next door where people were eating outside on their patio under heaters and none of their doors were open.

This place is excellent! Great patio seating and if it's a hot day seating in the patio I recommend seating there at night time. Food is good and service is excellent. Food selection is plenty even if you are vegetarian, pescatarian, carnivore, whatever over acting wanna be healthy not really you are... there is a food item here for you. Okay... ambiance haaaa, good vibe. And there are plenty of wine and cocktails to choose from too. You can burn everything you eat afterwards by walking around the shops in the area. I recommend this place. Happy Italian eating nom noms! :)

Not impressed! With a reservation we still had to wait 15 minutes for the table. Once escorted to the table there was foid spilled and left over from before on the carpet. I guess they don't clean in between customers. Someone had a food fight before we sat. Out of six dishes , three pasta dishes were okay. The other three , one was sent back to the kitchen and the other two were nothing to write home about. In between the appetizers and salad, we had to pile up the dirty dishes in the middle of the table to make room and finally ask the waiter to please take it away. Not impressed and will not go back!
I've come here a couple times since my last review, and I no longer feel like it's too crowded. Food is excellent and service is superb. I definitely recommend the pasta brio!!!

My wife had a friend visiting from out of town so last night we decided to go out to eat at Brio.  My wife had eaten there once several years ago and my wife had purchased some Brio gift cards at Costco.

We were very disappointed in the food.  For a fancy restaurant we expected a lot better.

I ordered the Chicken Milanese, which is basically Chicken Parmesan.  The chicken is sliced very thin and then breaded and fried until it is quite tough.  It's probably over-fried.  3 weeks ago I had a root canal with a permanent crown attached 10 days ago.  I was seriously scared that chewing this chicken would knock my crown off.

My wife got the Balsamic Braised Short Rib.  She liked her meal and because she liked it, this rating is 2 stars and not 1 star.

My wife's friend got one of the pasta dishes.  I'm not sure which one.  But much of the pasta was all stuck together. into a solid lump.  She only ate part of the meal.  She complained to the waiter who told her that that's how the pasta should be because the sauce forces the pasta to stick together.  But after he cleared the plates, we could see the waiter showing the plate of pasta to someone from the kitchen.  Soon the manager came out to our table explaining that the pasta was over-cooked and offering to get her more pasta.  She declined as we had already finished our meal and had been in the restaurant an hour and a half by that point.  The manager wasn't offering to bring her the same dish prepared right, but  just some more pasta.  Like she wants to eat some pasta by itself.

The manager said he'd give us a discount on our bill for the bad pasta dish.  When we got the bill, it was an insult...  a $3 discount on a $79 bill.  When something bad is served and the manager admits it was prepared wrong,  it should have a greater discount.  With this insult, it would have been more respectful to have not offered any discount and just let us believe the quality of the food is bad.  Now we know the quality of the food is bad and the manager is disrespectful.

And I didn't even mention how bad my Chicken Milanese was.

But my wife was happy with her meal and one thing I've learned in my marriage is if my wife is happy, then I'm happy.

When I am in Vegas I always make it a point to stop at Brio once or twice for either lunch or dinner!  The Tuscan style decor is awesome!  Like you are in an old Tuscan vastly, with super high ceilings.

If you like a frozen drink, the peach Bellini is the best frozen concoction I've ever had hands down!

They have a salad on their lunch menu that is bomb!  The Romano crusted chicken salad.  Basically, mixture of fresh greens, kale, romain, cucumber, quinoa, feta and a few other ingredients.  Along with two crusted chicken breasts.  It is amazing.  Service is always fast and upbeat!

5 stars

As a rule I'm not a fan of chain-restaurants. It's kind of a thing with me. 

Brio is one of the rare exceptions. I LOVE this place. Great atmosphere and service ...and of course, GREAT food! A+ anytime you go. 


They have an outstanding happy hour deal for small plates and drinks from 3-7pm in the bar area. 

Some of my favorite dishes there include the Beef Carpaccio, Pork Chops, and beef tips. The sides and flavors are always on point. 

It is a bit pricey for such a cooky cutter experience (as apposed to a unique high end or boutique dining experience) but it has a comfortable consistency. 

Whenever I'm hungry at Crocker Park or Legacy ..Brio is my jam. Lovely patio during nice weather too!

Consumption of Italian food is one of my favorite pastimes, and I've found Brio to be a pretty good spot to do that.  It's location within Scottsdale Quarter, which does not have the best parking situation, is really the only negative here.

I'm usually coming here for dinner, and most recently we treated ourselves to a bruschetta sampler plate as an appetizer.  It came with three different variations, three pieces each, and all were spectacular.  I especially like the mozzarella and red pepper.  The bread was crunchy and the mozzarella was pure deliciousness!

For my entree I went with the Lasagna Bolognese.  Portion size was great.  I find a lot of places usually skimp on the meat with these dishes, but this one had a lot, which was fantastic.  There was a little too much cream based sauce topped over it for me, but that is a relatively minor complaint.

All in all I've enjoyed every meal I've had here, and I'm sure I'll be back for more!

I was at Brio on 9/25 and Joey was our server. He made the entire experience, I've never been so impressed by a waiter or waitress in my life. He seemed like he really wanted us to enjoy our dinner. Aside from the excellent customer service, the food is remarkable. If you are ever at Town Square definitely check out Brio!

Fantastic Happy Hour! The Caprese salad is to die for. I've only been here for happy hour but what I've experienced service-wise is top notch. Will definitely be bringing friends so they can be wowed too!

This absolutely earned 5 stars from my husband and I. The food, the service, the atmosphere were all outstanding. The beef medallions with shrimp were served with vegetables that were perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned, and accompanied by a rice pilaf that is every bit as delicious as Mama makes.

We have been to Brio several times with the kids and I am been to Brio soooo many times on my own.  And here is a hint, take the kids with you and share the food that is served for the kids.  The portions are huge for children and half the price of adult entrees.  While my husband and I did not do this the two times we have taken the kids, we keep joking that "next time" we are going to do just that!  The food is consistent.  I typically hate chain restaurants, but I will make a slight exception for Brio, if I am craving the lobster bisque.

I travel a lot for work. Came across this  restaurant after a 15 mile bike ride in the desert. Food was awesome, wait staff was excellent, I think my waiters name was Michael.
Will be back on  my next trip.

I had an incredibly lovely weekday lunch here. Their lunch specials, while not cheap are filling and delicious. I had one of the paninis and was quite pleased. The atmosphere is nice, and the outdoor patio looked awesome. I will definitely be back.

As my wife and I are partial to Italian food we gave this restaurant a try. We found the interior brightly decorated but a bit noisy. The restaurant was very busy at an early dinner hour (~6:00).
We had the foresight of having made a reservation, however. Our service from Jazmine was quite good throughout our visit. I ordered the Pesce Picatta and the wife ordered a chicken dish with pasta. Her meal was very good. My seafood was either overcooked or prior frozen, or both. It was very chewy and hence, disappointing. On the positive side, the manager came by and laid a complimentary sampler of bruschetta on us - a nice surprise. All in all, the experience was less than I was expecting from what appears to be a popular restaurant.

The spicy shrimp and eggplant is an addictive appetizer. You will come back! If you are looking for a patio seat, ask for the patio by the bar.. not crowded. Great night out and romantic setting with awesome service!

Great place for lunch after walking the mall or to even make the trip solely to come here! 

Tuscan inspired food with well developed flavors and plenty of attention to detail in the presentation as well as the preparation. 

To start, the bread... oh my... the bread!  Warm bread with perfection when it comes to the outer crust vs. soft inside ratio.   I should mention that there was also a crispy flavored flat bread  but honestly, I just could not get passed the Italian bread and butter!

We shared the Roasted Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke Dip
 Served bubbling hot with Parmesan flatbread  ($8.95).   It was good, pretty standard restaurant dip but the flat bread served with it definitely kicked it up a notch. 

I enjoyed the Pasta Pomodoro with Chicken
 Angel hair with grilled chicken, tomatoes, pine nuts and a cilantro pesto drizzle ($13.65).  It was fresh with the chicken prepared and seasoned well.  The flavors complimented each other very well and made the dish satisfying but not overwhelming.

My companion had the Brio Bistecca Burger*
 With bacon, Provolone, lettuce, roasted tomato mayonnaise and Pinot Noir onions. Served with housemade chips. ($12.35) (sub fries for the chips)  Yes, a burger and fries at an Italian restaurant!  He seemed very impressed with it and commented several times that it had really good flavor. 

Service:  Very helpful, extremely pleasant and very accommodating.  

I should mention, if you sign up for their email club you receive a free meal of Steak and shrimp scampi for your birthday.  Being that I don't eat red meat and don't like shrimp they allowed me to substitute my entree for that.  By the way... definitely worth signing up for the email club! :)

Love this place whether for a casual lunch or would be a great date place too!

the food was exceptional and the waiter was awesome...everything was timed perfectly...my wife said her chicken was one of the best dishes shes ever had...i had the lobster and shrimp linguini...excellent...the strawberry shortcake was fresh and very tasty...definitely would go again

Brio
You made me order way too much good food
Highlights:
Tomato Mozzarella Flatbread- yummers
ITALIAN wedding meatball-yessers
Chicken Pomodoro and Milanese- ok I eat a lot of chicken, and I will always prefer chicken. BOTH of these dishes are great

Dessets- I love chocolate anything and all their mini desserts are awesome

This place is always packed but they seat you pretty fast.

I can't wait to come here again, very nice, romantic and lots of good looking people come here

THE END :)

Trying to be nice since we moved from the Columbus, Oh, the home of Brio/Bravo/Lyndeys(founder) etc.

In the few months we have been here, we have had dinner, carryout and happy hour.   It does not seem to be the same quality food and attention to detail in any of the 3.  The worst is the "happy hour" food which per other posts is inferior quality.  The portions are just right and the prices are great but if the food sucks so what's the point?   Also, they broadcast Happy Hour but the bottle of wine was full price and we were not given other choices.The carpacio is always excellent and not bad at happy hour as well but everything else is salty, greasy and lacks the freshness and zip that I can't believe I am saying, from the midwest locations.

Went with my wife and 3 yr old daughter.  The greeter highly recommended the Pasta alla Vodka, so we split that along with a Bruschetta Sampler and lobster tail.  For the kid, she got a cheeseburger with fries from the kids menu.

The decor is great.  Kinda reminds me of Cheesecake Factory.

The service was good.  The waitress brought out some dough on a plate for our daughter to play with.

The Pasta alla Vodka was great!  Slightly spicy which I enjoyed.  We did like the Bruschetta of course.  Wife said lobster tail was ok.  

Surprisedly the kids cheeseburger was adult size.

It was a pricey dinner but we enjoyed it.

You cant go wrong with Brio, I have been to both locations Rampart and Town Sq and they have a good happy hr menu along with a lunch/dinner menu.. if you are looking to eat dinner at one of these locations, I recommend making reservations. Service is always on point and there is always something for everyone with in your party..

Brio has a fantastic happy hour with everything $2.95 and drinks resonably priced!
You can get a hamburger, pasta, pizza, artichoke dip, caprese, etc. 

It is worth going early to find a nice spot in the bar since seating can be limited!

Loved our food but what made the date night special was Meagan!  We asked her opinion on all of our choices & she was spot on each time.  She even recognized that my 2nd Cucumber/Basil Gimlet looked wrong but had me try it before taking it back.
She made our once another outing great.
The food oh yeah the food was fantastic!  Pasta Pesto was so light & perfect for a hot night & my hubby's was heavier, beef & pappardelle but oh so yummy.
Thanks Brio for making our evening away from a toddler so awesome!

First, I have to admit this place ain't cheap. However, the experience was very good.

1. Food was good. I had Lobster bisque and a Lobster and shrimp fettuccine. No complaint.

2. Service was excellent. My uncle's lamb chop was over cooked, they pleasantly replaced it right away and offer a lobster bisque while he waits. Excellent service.

3. Wine price mark up is also reasonable. But you can't bring your own wine.

Caprese was excellent. Delicious tomatoes and nicely portioned mozzarella. Had the frittata for brunch and although good, there were so many rich components.  Ask for the Alfredo sauce on the side. Service was okay. The general environment felt a little unorganized and off.

This is one of our favorite places for Italian food!!! Such a good fancy dinner for a reasonable price. Our waitress Samantha was clearly trained well and super personable. She did such a great job and made the experience fantastic!
Place is nice and big. Service is pretty top notch and their food is pretty good. Be aware that you might spend a good amount, but don't worry. Their quantities were pretty good.

A step up from the typical Italian chain restaurant.  The food was very good, the service excellent, and the ambiance very nice.  Had the pork chops for dinner and the apple crisp for desert based upon a friend's recommendation.  Glad I did because was one of the best chops I had in awhile.

Happy Hour visit. Return trip, the prices are half off so you can't beat that. The mini burgers were tasty, the carpacio also very good. I get it with all the stuff on it and its always been amazing. Also had a taste of the shrimp and zucchini (get it unbreaded). The Blueberry Martini also very good, had two (hey its Happy Hour). After all that was actually quite full, The bill was about $20. The atmosphere was good, we sat at the bar so we can talk with the bar staff who are very pleasant. Miss out gal Lara though what used to be there she was always awesome and knew what you wanted.

This was my very first experience at Brio and I had heard really good things about them.  We were promptly greeted and seated immediately. We did have reservations so I'm sure that helped because on a Saturday evening this place was busy.  Our waitress was great in explaining the specials and anything we had a question about on the menu. Prior to our meal we were served a bread basket which had a nice sized piece of warm sourdough bread and real butter. It was really good. We decided on Peach Bellini's and they were delicious. We also had lobster bisque, which had a bite of lobster in every spoonful. Next the entrees were served.  We had the Brio pasta, Salmon and asparagus with a crab cake, and the lasagna bolognese. All were delicious. We had a temperature problem with the crab cake but it was immediately corrected. An awesome dinner and a beautiful dinner area made for an amazing first time. I will return.

Very disappointed by Brio last night. Had horrible service from the get-go when entertaining clients. 2 different parties of 4 who came in after us got served drinks long before we did. After we brought this to the attention of our waitress she was extremely unapologetic and in fact showed a markedly soured attitude towards us after that. We flagged down an also unapologetic seem-to-be manager, who first pointed to our waters joking that we "did have our drinks" and then got very busy describing how he kept glancing over at us during his walk thrus and everything seemed okay... weird that he was so defensive. His (wrong) "impression" is besides the point. .. He offered to "buy us the round" but never checked on us again. In fact,  we had to ask that the drinks be taken off when the increasingly snarky waitress didn't know a thing about it when presenting us with the check. All in all bad, unfriendly, non-empathic and disrespectful customer service. No fun to encounter flippant staff with an attitude. I will be telling my friends about this experience.

An upscale Italian restaurant.  Today a group of  us decided to try Brio's brunch out and we were pleasantly surprised.  The breakfast side of the menu was very small, yet simple. It contained the typical eggs, potatoes and bacon dish.  However, the brunch side of the menu contained a number of their top selling menu items.  They also have a small brunch section of paired drinks as well.

The Bottom Line: Great service with decent food and a nice atmosphere make Brio a good place to grab lunch or dinner with friends.

Try:
Pasta Alla Vodka
Mushroom Ravioli Di Bello

Pro:
With quick, friendly service and a well appointed interior, Brio makes a great first impression. The food itself was flavorful and substantive, and you definitely feel like you get your money's worth. 

Con:
No big cons to think of! It's a solid place.

A group of seven of family went to Brio for a birthday/reunion get together. The meals we had ranged from pasta to pork/beef to fish. I had the beef medallions with a marsala mushroom gravy, which was excellant. The pasta, pork chops and braised beef short ribs were also liked. The pesca piccata was somewhat bland though. The appetizers we had were the eggplant topped with shrimp and the calamari. They were large servings and very delicious. Good wine, good food and good coversation was had by all. The resturant has a large dining room with adequate seating for larger groups all the way down to couples and family dining.

First time dining, wow the ambience is beautiful, takes you to another world... food is sub-par, bread was very good. Wedge salad, the dressing was just ok. Don't get the lasagna, WTF! Creamy on top not your traditional layered lasagna and the ground meat was more like mush, no flavor. 
Service is clueless. Mistake after mistake. 
Maybe great for tourists, families and non-foodies.

Brio is really relaxing, elegant and has excellent food.  You will enjoy looking at the kitchen in the distance and the buzzing of the location and its staff. Its big enough to get in typically very quickly.  The prices are very competitive for the quality and location.  And you are right in Crocker Park to then, before or after, window shop or check out some of the stores.
Best happy hour I've been to yet! Awesome prices, generous portions, tasty dishes, and yummy white peach sangria.

second time here
 the salad is great
service is fine
not too expensive for somewhat formal dining

The food was so yummy and served in good sized portions. The price is very affordable. The place is very nice and has great customer service. I definitely recommend this place for lunch or dinner for friends, dates, or for the family.

Our food was good, atmosphere was nice it was an early dinner so not that crazy busy. Overall I would definitely like to go here again. I had the Pene Alla vodka which was very good and we shared the beef carpaccio which was delicious! My cousin had the steak and my sister in law had the carbonara which she really enjoyed.

Surprised I never wrote a review. I'm going to be forward only go for happy hour. It's amazing besides that I went to the dining area last week and the entree's were not fresh and  my server ordered the wrong entree from me and I was hungover so I was starving and wasn't thrilled to wait 10 more minutes. My salad was bitter and lots of brown lettuce and it was not good at all. Like I said only go for happy hour.

PROS: Happy hour, decor, ambiance
CONS: service, salads, beef tartare not fresh, mahi mahi dry

I keep trying every here and there when a friend wishes to go.  Another chain restaurant as if we aren't saturated enough with these in this town.  No matter the time of day or evening, whether or not I am in the bar or patio area or even the dining area the service is mediocre.  Always inattentive bartenders, and the bar only had a total of four people there including myself and my friend!  Until a try it again next year (I usually wait a year).  I will stick with my regular haunts for TS (town square) Killer Shrimp, Tommy Bahamas and Double Helix.  Always friendly and attentive service there;)

Accommodating hostess Kylie and the most wonderful and helpful server, Jessica, we've ever had!  She made a suggestion for just a little more food knowing we were already full on appetizers, which were already out of this world, to try the lobster bisque soup. Yum. We will definitely come back to this location again.

Visited on Valentine's day. This place was pack and it didn't seam like things where being handled very well. Well we didn't know that the system went down and they just needed an extra min to get a work around plan together. After being seated we had Jennifer as a server. Super nice gal. We've never been in a place where the sense of urgency was so high. The food runner was actually running at some points, (it was scary) managers where bussing food as well. For it being so busy the food came out with perfect timing and tasted fantastic. Huge applause to the guy who was bussing the food out way to hassle I hope the waiter take care of you.

First time dinner experience last night at Tivoli Village with family made my day. 
Serving staff were wonderfully helpful and with 8 of us and a vegetarian nearly everyone chose different items from the menu. Not a complaint anywhere. The service, Food, Wine and Tiramisu for dessert. Everything was exceptional and the portion sizes were very generous in every dish. 
Will be back very soon. Thanks for creating a beautiful family evening memory.

Everything that I have had here is great.  I've had 5 things and tasted a bunch of others.  They do pasta right and have great service.

The little desert cups are a fantastic idea.  I can get something good and sweet that is small!  Other restaurants expect you to commit to a $12 piece of cake the size of your head right after eating a big meal.
