Frequent here often... great food... great service...nice Italian dinner that won't bruise your wallet...

Brio is very good especially for the price. The lemon chicken is excellent service is good staff is mostly friendly. Bartenders pour a good drink especially if you are sitting at the bar and are specific about what you want (strength of drink and what not)
I loved the atmosphere.  However,  the food per dollar value was not there.  It was tasty, don't get me wrong. I just expect to be full when I spend this much.

We come here all the time for happy hour and normally have amazing service.  However this time we had Danny R as our server.  He failed to refill waters after asking a few times.  Was to busy chatting with servers to drop a glass of wine at our table while holding it for at least 5 mins.   Asked us 30 mins after we got our food if it was ok bc we didn't eat much of.  Then we waited another 10 mins for our bill.  All in all the service this time was subpar to previous visits.

After note I speak with the manager he credited the bill back.

Food is average or less than average. Pastas are all a little oily. Had a reservation, showed up five minutes before res time, still waited an hour and 15 minutes for a table. That alone prevents me from ever going back. It's dishonest. Food took almost 45 minutes to come out. Their consolation? A free desert. No thanks--we were ready to get out of there after 2 and a half hours. Our waiter was polite and did everything we could. We tipped well and we move on with no hard feelings, but a lesson learned.

We come here often with family and the portions are generous. The flavors are authentic Italian and they will customize a dish if there's something you don't like. We had the pork chops, which were excellent, and the ravioli. Their meat dishes are actually better than the pasta. Of course we also love the appetizers, especially the calendar, which is flaky and not rubbery.

The customer service I experienced at the San Tan Brio was phenomenal. There was an issue with my entree and the waiter immediately picked up on it. He sent the chef out to apologize and re-cook my food. The Manager also came over, apologized, and comped our appetizer and entree without us even asking. They really did a great job taking care of my group.

There are few places I can eat in Vegas any time of the day no matter what I'm in the mood for and this is one of them.  

Their Happy Hour menu in my opinion is the best! It's inexpensive and full of options.
Sliced Steak Salad and Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant are a MUST. Service is great as always- ask for Amanda she is super nice and attentive!

Great, refined quality of food. Friendly service. So-so prices. Not so Italian.

The reason I gave Brio a 3 star rating is because they don't have traditional Italian pizzas! This shocked me and put me off quite a bit. I'm 100% Italian and for an Italian restaurant not to have traditional pizzas is just a huge no-no. Like a burger joint that doesn't serve burgers and fries. However, they do have 4 choices of American style flat-breads that can be ordered on pizza dough. But it's just not the same. 

I've been here before and the other few dishes I've tried are very tasty. Although, I do not consider this to be an Italian restaurant. More of an American take on Italian cuisine. Still good but not what I was looking for.

Brio has never done me wrong.  We go here all the time and it's always good. Thank you for being so consistent.  My fave starters.   Lobster bisque and blue cheese wedge salad.   The healthy menu item with the chicken and quinoa is so good.
Fantastic service from Sarah at the bar! She is so funny & friendly. All our food was delicious! Definitely coming back here again soon.

Service was good, however we made a reservation for 11 people at 5pm but were informed upon arrival that happy hour pricing is only available at the bar or outside (105 degrees) and although there was plenty of seating in the bar area our large group would not be able to actually sit together and enjoy each other's company from multiple tables. So we sat outside dripping in sweat until we couldn't take it anymore. Sorry Brio, your loss. Luckily Double Helix can accommodate our group and happy hour is until 7:30!

Great food , the salmon was to die for.
The waiter was informative and had a stupid attitude when we had questions ,good price  4 star since it was my first time here and I hate rude and very unfriendly waiter

We were so excited to have Brio come to Summerlin.  We decided to give it a shot and thought we would have to wait for seating.  We were very pleased we did not have to wait long at all.  We were impressed with the menu selection and had heard many great things.  This set our expectation high.  The food was good we ordered steak and pasta.  The service however was lacking.  Our water glasses were not checked and we were seated right next to the kitchen.  The manager was on her cell phone in the open kitchen having an emotional conversation and the staff did not appear to help each other out.  One of the waitresses was crying and two appeared to be angry at each other.  We highly value service and on our visit it was lacking.  By the end of the meal we were discussing that we would have enjoyed a meal at Carrabbas more.  It may have just been the evening we decided to go and we have discussed giving Brio another try, it wasn't bad but it was only OK and we were hoping for WOW!

This restaurant has a ton of reviews so I'll make it quick. This is one of the best italian restaurants in the area and they are consistent.

Amazing bread/crackers? CHECK! Amazing service? CHECK! AMAZING food? CHECK CHECK CHECK!

This is the best italian food I think I've ever had and this is the premier restaurant I will take guests to.

Came here with my wife for our anniversary and were pleasantly surprised. The food is excellent. I got the crabcakes (crab and shrimp) and they were awesome. My wife got a chicken dish where the chicken was breaded and skewered over mashed potatoes (don't know the name of the dish) and it was a ton of food.

My only complaint, but it was a minor one due to a pet peeve of mine is that our server seemed a little aloof. Never around when I actually wanted him to be. Not sure where he was since the kitchen area is all open so you can you the server's stations, etc. I think we could have been out of their 10-15 minutes sooner had he been around. It wasn't just at the end of our meal, but also during. Seemed kind of weird for the type of establishment. I still give it 4 stars and will for sure try it again, but may have to change my rating if I end up having a similar experience.

I am definitely a foodie, therefore it was hard for me to write thie review. The food itslef was beyond stellar! I had the Shrimp crusted salmon with Quinoa. The appetizers were amazing as well. So why only 1 star? The service... We had a party of 7, and the waiter took forever to take our order. we sat there starving ffor 30 minutes before they took our order. The place was beautiful, but yet dirty. They weren't eager to clean off tables, it was food and things on the floor. I was dissapointed for such a beautiful establishment to be so dirtly.

Lastly, the waiter knocked over an entire glass of water inside my purse ice and all... He handed me a napkin, apologize and that was it. I was there cleaning out my purse, trying to get the ice out. He never mentioned it again, checked if I was okay, nor tried to help me clean my LV $1236 purse. I was pretty disappointed. The only good thing was the food, and the decor. The service, cleanliness, and staff are not nearly up to the level of expectation of the environment, and or the food.

I've been coming to Brio Tuscan Grille since they've opened up at Town Square eons ago. I know, I like to write my reviews late. Even when I relocated for three years, whenever I visit Vegas, I would always have dinner at least once at Brio. I would always suggest Brio as an option to my out of town friends. And more than once did we celebrate birthdays with dinner at Brio. 

Honestly, I've never really had a horrible experience at Brio. If we had any issues with our meals, once we bring it up with our server, they'd always manage to get it fixed right away. One of my most recent visits to Brio, our waitress was a blast -- we had a lot of fun kidding around with her. 

However, I am a little sadden by the fact that a few menu items have changed, such as the steaks. They no longer offer the surf and turf or just a filet mignon with veggies dishes. Though the steak dishes they have right now are still pretty good. I gotta say, the price you pay is a whole lot better than what you pay for if you eat at the strip. Brio has awesome prices (even though the prices have gotten bumped up within the past three years). 

It can get loud while dining in though. There are tons of people talking, laughing, etc. But it never really bothered me. 

As for what to get to eat at the Brio? I'd say try anything you want. Everything I've tried was very good. Some of my favorites are the steaks, rack of lambs, and the carbonara. I also enjoy their bruchetta a lot. One of my favorite drinks at the Brio has got to be their peach bellini -- it's always so yummy!!! Don't be afraid to try anything there :)

Brio is DEFINATELY one of our favorite restaurants to go to be it brunch on the weekend, lunch or dinner anytime. The quality of the food is very high and the service is excellent from the time you enter until you leave  
Matthew, the manager, is now like an old family friend. He was the reason we started coming to Brio. We were out looking for a place to lunch and were browsing the outdoor menu when he came out, highly recommended a couple of appetizers, telling us we wouldn't be disappointed and invited us in. He was so right!  But, to be invited in was like someone you knew inviting you into his home. We've been fans ever since.
Food is very consistent every time. We get emails telling us of specials and get a birthday entree free!  
The bar area is great and that menu is awesome!!  
Gotta love this place.

Came here on a Tuesday night to celebrate my birthday and sat on the patio. Service was sooooooo slow. I don't mind spending a decent amount of money for a good dining experience but it doesn't matter how good your food is when your server doesn't seem to care, is overloaded with tables and you can't get a water refill. Such a major let down, especially on my birthday.

Came for happy hour and could not have asked for a better experience. It is worth mentioning, however, that happy hour usually PACKS the bar area... and in our case had to wait about 20 minutes for a table. If you are planning to come here for HH, show up right at the start so you can get a table right away.

We enjoyed some white peach sangria, mango mojitos, and appetizers, all of which were great. The spicy shrimp and Brio burger are by far the best dishes, but anything on the menu will be great for sharing at the table. Next time you are looking for an early dinner or share some drinks with friends, do stop by this awesome restaurant.

This is a great spot to hang out with your friends and enjoy great drinks and tasty food. I normally visit during their happy hour (M-F, 4pm to 6pm) when their prices and portions are quite generous. Here is my happy hour breakdown.

Ambiance: High energy and BUSY!! Their bar area is spacious but plan on waiting for a table if you are not there right at 4pm. 

Service: Fast and friendly... The way it should be! 

Food: AMAZING! Their $3.95 dishes are tasty and come in large portions. Do not leave their happy hour without trying their burger or the shrimp and eggplant dish... You will be sure to love them!

Drinks: The mojitos and sangrias are awesomely refreshing... Depending on the bartender. I wish they were more consistent with their flavor profile and alcohol content of their cocktails. In fact, their drink unpredictability is why I give them 4 stars. 

I will most definitely visit again and again!

We arrived last Friday, 4/21 at 4:30 & seated ourselves outside.  This was to begin my partner's birthday celebration which always goes on for 5 days (like mine).  The place was very busy & had a few new servers; thus, we waited too long for our water & drinks.  In fact, the couple next to us received their drinks before us.  So, while my partner went to inquire, the food arrived (shortly after my wine)...   beef carpaccio, cheeseburger & the mozzarella salad.  He returned to the table with Chef Mike who profusely apologized & proceeded to take care of us with the old favorite eggplant shrimp.  If you've not tried that, do treat yourself !

The special surprise was birthday TIRAMISU which we gobbled down in 3 minutes because it was sooooo good!  And all the other food was equally as delicious.  I love the addition of that mozzarella salad which is substantial and, unlike 90% of the other happy hours in town, is a healthy menu item.

Our new server, Ashley, is from Oregon & a wonderful new staff member.  Chef Mike is from upstate New York & loves fishing, which subject will quickly engage him.

We've been frequenting Brio's since its opening and all these years have rarely, only rarely been disappointed.  With this little glitch, how can we complain?

I went to Brio 3 times already so this review is long due.
I was always very pleased with the prices, variety, quality, the smaller plates menu, mini desserts...

I came here once with my bff and twice with chris before his bball games (he likes to have a big plate of pastas first for energy)

I always have smaller plates from the low carb menu,
My favorites are so far: beef carpaccio, lobster bisque, shrimp Mediterranean on orzo and spinach bed and mini creme brulee served in espresso cup! The tiramisu is very good too, it's my friend's favorite!
The shrimptini is just ok, the shrimps were small and a bit watery but the shrimps from the entrees are huge, nicely grilled and delicious.

The service was always great except one time when our waitress never refilled our iced teas until we asked for it again and again... Then had our refill finally when we paid our bill. Not cool. I am not asking for extra attention,  just for drink/water during my meal.

The service the other times was perfectly on point and everybody else was very friendly.

So we will come back tomorrow night for sure and I will make sure to update my review by then.
Lunch (soup and a salad) for under $15.  The service was very good and the food was excellent.  We will be back

So the inside looks like Cheesecake Factory.  The servers were friendly enough.  One of our guests just wanted water and was asked by another server and the manager if she needed anything to drink.  Attentive, but kind of annoying.  
The bruschetta I tried was tasty.  The bread was more soft than crusty, which is what I like.  I'm not a fan of bruschetta  that tears up the roof of my mouth, so they got props for that.  The florentine reminded me of spinach dip.  I also tried one with prociutto, figs, and asparagus.  I think they should have cut the asparagus in half to cover the bread rather than run down the center.  It was still good.
I was brought a chopped salad, but I ordered a Ceasar.  The food runner tried to convince me that I actually ordered the chopped.  This is a pet peeve of mine.  It's ok to make mistakes; just correct them.  Don't try to convince me I've lost my mind and can't remember what I said 15 minutes before.  The food runner seemed to have drank about 13 Red Bulls before his shift; so that may have had something to do with his intensity to force chopped salad on me.
They definitely took the name of the restaurant literally when creating their food.  My pork chop tasted like the grill.  It was weird.  It reminded me of when you cook a hot dog on a grill for longer than a minute and it's covered in black.  My pork chop tasted like the grill burns.  The mashed potatoes and asparagus were good.  Nothing to write home about.  
They set down food 3 other times to try to serve us that was meant for other tables.  We all said if they did it one more time we'd just take it and ask for a box.  I don't know that I would care to eat it though.
If you're looking for a place to dine in the Kierland Corrider, you have many many better options to select.

Worse meal I've ever had. After a hard week at work, I was hoping for a nice meal to relax.  Was told their salmon is no longer fresh but farm raised,  server told us not to try their cod.  We ordered the fish and chips.  It came greasy, dipped in oil, and my husbands portion was partly frozen,  we were told it was fresh.  Yeah, freshly frozen.  I was afraid to order anything else but my husband opted for a cup of soup and I had the Caesars salad.  Part of the lettuce was wilted and couldn't eat it.  Hostess had the nerve to tell us we weren't charged for the fish and chips.  Why would we when it was so bad we couldn't eat it.   No care in their preparation and customer service sucked,  now I know why the place is empty but weeday nights. Horrible,

Great food. Great atmosphere. Great prices. What more could you ask from an Italian restaurant? They have almost everything you could think of Italian. From the various pasta dishes to the unique entrées to the unforgettable appetizers, this Italian restaurant stands out when compared to other Italian restaurants you may find around the city, especially Olive Garden. I was never a big fan of Italian food until I discovered this place. Definitely recommend this place if you're into something Italian.

I visited Brio a few weeks ago with my friend for lunch. She was actually my best friend from 5th grade in California and she moved away when we were in middle school and I hadn't seen her in 14 years! Anywho, she moved to LV last year and when I was in town visiting she hit me up for a mini reunion. 

My friend had been to Brio before and she suggest this place for lunch. This place looks really nice! Picture a step up from Cheesecake Factory. I can see a bridal shower or a special event being held here.

 I ordered the prosciutto and burrata pizza, it was delicious! For some reason I thought I tasted hints of fruit in the pizza sauce. I liked it though and I would get it again if I ever come back. 

We had a wonderful lunch catching up. Service was great, they give you nice warm bread upon seating. 

Overall it's a nice restaurant and I would recommend it for a nice lunch or dinner.

Update:
Their happy hour is still great. I went back recently and sat outside on the couches. The appetizers have gone up in price to $3.95, but are still a great value. They now offer a happy hour drink menu for $5. I'll go back for their happy hour anytime. Still not crazy about their regular meals, but I'll probably give that another shot soon. 

I was sad to see that they changed their happy hour menu and took off the steak bruschetta, which was my favorite, but they still offer some fantastic options.

I like pork chops. I like salt.

And I like them not to have a sweaty orgy on my plate.

I get it, Brio, you like salt too. Guess what? I'm not a horse. Even though my penis will confuse you, I promise, I don't like salt enough to just show up, whinny, and start to canter because you knocked a tube of Morton's Iodized into your marinade.

Great ambiance, lovely vibe, VERY friendly waitstaff.

But that porkchop was saltier than a pirate's thighs.
Great Happy Hour, great service, really nice outdoor area, no-charge valet parking very near, many little shops near.

Brio is a hit or miss. Living in Vegas we get spoiled by all kinds of foods and standards I must say this Brio is he best in town. Food delicious and very flavorful. Service not the best no matter the occasion they don't disappoint

Came back with a friend and had dinner here. Ordered the pesto pasta dish. I must say for under 700 calories it was delicious - especially for it being pasta and all the yummy stuff that came in it. Tried the Strawberry Fresca alcohol drink and that was good. Would like to try the Peach Sangria next time. Had to order the spinach artichoke dip from my last visit. Was as good as I remembered it. Thank you!

I arrived today at 11am & was greeted with a warm welcome from the very tall hostess.  She was sweet & had a nice smile, too.  

We were seated within 5 minutes and our waitress seemed sweet, as well.  We ordered our food & i go the salmon w/ angel hair lunch entree.  I dont remember the exact name for it (but thats what it had).  Anyways, our food arrived and all I could see was how oily the pasta was. GAA-ROOSSS. Good thing, I was hungry and didnt eat any breakfast, yet. So i ate at least half of my entree, but  after eating all that oily pasta, I wanted to barf.  The salmon was cooked almost perfectly & I enjoyed it.  

The waitress was so great, either.  Though she seemed sweet she never came back to check on us and took forever getting the check to us.  I dont know if I would come back here again, since this is the second time I tried Brio but who knows, I think I might try it at least one last time.  Hopefully, the third time is a charm

Of the two locations, this is the better. Happy hour is the only reason that brings me to Brio. For Italian food, there are better venues around Vegas. As for HH, this is one of the better. 

The offering of drinks tend to sway my judgement. The Town Square location lacks drink offerings. For $5, a decent size list of specialty cocktails has something for most. 

The two food items I ordered was enough to tide me over. The beef carpaccio with mixed greens is one of my regularly favorites. The shrimp with eggplant was a solid option as well. As an in between snack to banish hunger, a better deal is hard to come by. 

One drink and two appetizers for $14. Check please.

For happy hour, it is one of the best in Town Square. Monday-Friday 3:30-6:30 and Monday-Thursday 9-close. They have a set menu of certain appetizers for $2.95. A few of these dishes will make for a perfectly good meal. The special is only good for the bar and it is first come, first serve. Since the weather is getting chillier, it is easy to get a seat on the outdoor side. They close the curtains and turn on heat lamps, so it is not bad.

The offerings consist of Beef Carpaccio, Spinach Artichoke Dip, two styles of Flatbread, Fried Raviolis (3 large pieces), a Burger (cut into quarters for sharing), Spicy Shrimp with Eggplant, and Shrimptini (Shrimp Cocktail). The carpaccio was my favorite and so inexpensive.The burger was also good. It is very simple, topped with cheese and a special sauce with a few chips. I usually like mine with all sorts of veggies, but this was nothing to frown upon. The raviolis were the last item I had ordered and they were decent. Getting three of these dishes makes for a perfect dinner and will cost less then $10. 

I looked at the rest of their regular menu and many of the pastas were cream based or had it as a listed ingredient. I like my pastas to be on the lighter side, so I tend to skip on them here.
Still an awesome Happy Hour. Love their new $5 Martini Thursdays. Now I really won't be able to stay away.

This is probably the best place to go for Lunch or  even Dinner.   First of all our waitress with her name as Cinnamon (whether that's her name or just a made up on), she's bad ass.  She was like a hawk with our refills, orders and the bill.  The whole team there at Brio works so in sync with each other, so dynamic, it was a nice calm melody, how they worked as a team. Management must be great here. 

Food was amazing 
The pizza for our daughter was so good. 
My wife got the Strawberry Balsamic Chicken Salad and that was amazing. 
I got the Lobster Bisque that was out of this world and the Campanelle Carbonara that was finger licking good!

Thank you guys, for an awesome lunch!

This use to be my go to place when I lived in Gilbert. My favorite dish was the baked angel hair spaghetti with mushrooms and meat sauce. It's not on the menu, I always had to ask the server for it. They knew what I was talking about.

Lots of flavor and a large portion. 

I would come eat here more but it's so far from me now! 

Trendy spot to have brunch with friends or a romantic date night spot. Location in the Santan Village Mall.

The place has a beautiful design that would satisfy most occasions - from a romantic date to a nice family dinner.  

The food is what you'd expect from a borderline upscale chain with entrees priced between $20-30. The food won't blow you away, but none were disappointing. See pictures :)

The service, from the hostess to our waiter, could improve... a lot.  Our hostess forgot to seat us until we asked (probably due to a shift change). Our waiter was very, very inattentive... we never got complimentary bread, our water weren't refilled, and we felt he was inpatient with our orders... We always have a good time regardless of service (if the food is good), but I like to think, part of the reason for the overpriced food items is the good (or at least more attentive) service... or maybe I'm becoming too snobby.

Overall, my family and I had a good time!

I haven't even started eating and this place has already giving me bad service. I made reservations for 2 and they placed me at a table for 6. Whats the fucken point for making reservations if we have to wait for our table. We'll see how that food taste. 
 
Ok after everything got all figured out I must say the food itself was AMAZING. The general manager of the restaurant was so accommodating.

This Brio location is my go-to spot for happy hour, lunch outside on a nice day, or a healthy dinner either with the girls or on date night. So basically, I'll come here anytime! I love to sit outside when it's nice out. Some of my favorites are their bread, the White Peach Sangria, Spicy Shrimp with Eggplant, and the Chocolate Lava Cake (it's called something else on the menu). I especially love the "Lighter Side of Tuscany" aka healthy menu- every item I've tried has been delicious. Come here, you won't be disappointed.

Get yourself to Brio for their $2.95 Happy Hour specials!  Their HH is Mon-Thurs from 3:30 - 6:30.  The best day of the week to go is Thurs when they have $5 martini night.  All of the HH food is fantastic, especially the Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant and the Roasted Garlic, Spinach, Artichoke Dip.  Make sure to arrive early because HH is only served at the bar & lounge and seating fills up fast.

I wanted take out pasta for tonight, I had the choice to go either at Pizza California Kitchen either at Brio. Unlike California Pizza Kitchen, as soon I walked in I was greated with a smile from 2 polite and friendly hosts who didn't hesitate to go over the menu with me.

This place reminds me of Vegas-meets-Cheesecake factory decor wise.  It's loud and kind of cheesy on the inside, although peeking out at the patio, it seems nicer out there (and quieter)  It's your run of the mill corporate restaurants.  The food is decent, the portions are enormous!  You can't really go wrong with the pastas here, although my angel hair was about 30 seconds over cooked.  My co worker had the lasagna and she wasn't a fan of it at all plus it looked pretty pathetic and way too cheesy.  They have decent lunch specials, and if you are just grabbing a bite when you are around the SQ it serves it's purpose for an average meal, at average prices.

My wife had to send back the house salad because it was soggy and tasted aweful. It was definitely sitting for a long time before service. The entrees were bland and uneventful. They looked delicious but there was a complete lack of flavor. The check was 50 bucks for two entrees, two salads, and two waters. At this price I would expect to get a meal with some flavor, and a fresh salad. Save some money go to Olive Garden.

Sunday Brunch at Brio was even better than I thought it might be.  A little online research showed some promising entrees, but it was more than that.  The ambiance was perfect Sunday, even though we only had a lunch hour instead of the normal brunch experience.  Service was quick, and we had delicious bread and artisan crackers on our table before we could even order.
The brunch food is awesome.  I had my heart set on the vegetable omelet with egg whites, mushrooms, etc. (I was sold with the mushrooms) and my darling wife had the Sicilian Omelet, with ham, bacon, sausage, etc. - and the star of the whole meal by far was the tomato compote on top of her omelet.  That sauce made us think of Italy, and made us want to come back to try some pasta here, because it was the most flavorful, full-bodied tomato sauce we've ever had. It totally took over the omelet, but in a darn good way.
My white omelet was awesome, and I would get it again in a heartbeat.  But I'll try getting the tomato compote on it...  And maybe the brunch potatoes, which are also sublimely well done, not too crisp or soggy, not too salty or bland, just yum all around.

Brio was wonderful, great food at wonderful prices, the selection was great, everything tasted good, we ordered beef tartar that was humongous and tasty, and they white egg veggie omelet. The bread was hottttt and fresh and the butter was tasty the combo was dangerous lol 
Go there and check it out

We just had a party in their group dining area. The staff went out of their way to make the food presentation beautiful. We ordered several appetizers, pasta, and a salad. From start to finish the customer service was excellent. Kayla and Matt returned emails and messages immediately during the planning of our event. I arrived almost an hour early to mildly decorate, and the staff was busy setting up tables and food warmers. I can't believe I was worried about the size of the fruit and vegetable platters, they were beyond expectation! The food was ready perfectly on time for our guests and our server Mark (a true professional) managed to keep 30 water glasses always full, and was there for our every need. I would recommend Brio for any event, thank you for making our baby shower so special! (I usually don't write reviews, but this was such a great experience I felt like I needed to!)

went to visit vegas and stopped in here. wow is what I got to say. service was great, clean and elegant place, food was crazy good. crab cakes are to die for and the desserts yum! good prices as well. I do recommend this place!

Had the Espresso Rubbed ribeye and it was delicious. Cooked to a perfect medium-rare. Was actually very surprised how good it was. Go to fine dining strip Steakhouse's with my wife fairly often and this was just about as good and for only $32. Also had the lobster bisque, swordfish and a kids pizza. Food was good, service was good.

What can I say... I am not much of a "chain" kind of girl but this place never disappoints!!! I have never had a bad experience! Whether it is a casual luncheon, happy hour or full fledged dinner... Their food, drinks and ambiance is always spot on! Great happy hour specials by the bar. Amazing appetizers, flatbreads and drink specials. My absolute favorite is the spicy shrimp and eggplant. It is so much creamy spicy goodness! Oh lord have mercy!!! It is ridiculously yummy! Funny thing is... I am not crazy about shrimp and I'm not crazy about eggplant. Somehow this just works! Have also had carpaccio, pasta and the Gorgonzola crusted lamb. Everything has rocked!!! Also, awesome outdoor patio with plenty of misters and shade so one can sit and people watch outside. Fantastic drink specials as well!

A wonderful first time experience here. As we often do on a first experience we over ordered and ALL WAS GREAT. I'm sure we will borrow some of their selection's to create at home.A separate menu with the specials included photos of each selection was appreciated. Nice touch with questions to our server Britney we let her guide us and she did not dissapoint. A nice conversation with manager Hanna about our anniversary made us feel like a regulars on our first visit. As it was Graduation night they were  accommodating all size party's with ease. Next visit we will sit outside. In all its delicious and charming.

Wow! NIGHT and DAY compared to the Brio in town square. They have great customer service and the food is also prepared better. I'm not sure why there is such a difference but I love it. I was pretty much done with Brio after many not so great visits to the other location. Thank God I decided to give this a try. Crystal you were wonderful! Thank you!

Loved this place until today... Worst, rude service ever. This fake Australian ruined our date. He was so obnoxious and you could tell he didn't want to be there. 

Side note: Don't ever just assume you're going to get a bad tip because you mess up once... You could always make it better. Instead you made it worse!

This is the short version of the longest review ever written...

I got married in Vegas June 20, 2008 and chose Brio for the after ceremony (reception?) dinner. I planned my entire wedding over the course of 3 weeks remotely from Colorado, so I didn't realize Brio was in a mall. I'm sure I could have figured that out if I'd read more reviews...

I ended up loving Brio! When we first arrived, we were told that our private room was not available due to the air conditioning unit going out inside and the room temp hovering around 90 degrees. I think when something goes wrong with a major reservation, the way the staff treats the issue is a true sign of their customer service skillz. Well folks, the staff at this Brio location has mad skillz, the skillz that pay the billz even!! They apparently left me a voicemail letting me know of the issue earlier in the night, but for some crazy reason, could be that I was exchanging vows and bling with the love of my life, I didn't get the msg. So anyway, they were very apologetic and seemed almost let down themselves that I didn't have the perfect room for my dinner on my wedding day....it was really okay though because I was at a very zen place right then and they were so nice about it. 

So, onto the meal. The staff had curtained off half of the regular dining area so we still had a private dinner, it was just a little louder around us than it would have been behind closed doors. Brio comped us two bottles of Champagne for our toast due to the room being unavailable and Chris, who was absolutely sweet and could not have been more attentive, waited on us hand and foot during our meal. He also provided sparkling orange juice for the kids and my sister in law who is expecting for the toast. The champagne was good, the bartender even came in and helped us pick out a few bottles of wine to drink with our meal which was nice. We all ordered right off the menu since there were only 14 of us. My son and I both had the Salmon which was served on parmesan crusted tomatoes and with shoestring potatoes, so delicious! My husband and step-son had the lamb chops and mashed potatoes - I don't like lamb but I tasted the mashers and they were seriously the best I've ever had. All in all, the food was scrumptious and prompt and the service was outstanding. 

The day after the wedding, I had a message from the manager at Brio, Kenna, that someone in my wedding party left something at the restaurant and she needed my address to send it to me. I waited a few days to receive whatever it was that was left there after I got back to CO. To my surprise, a package arrived with a letter from Chris and the staff at Brio thanking me for choosing them for my reception dinner. Included was the cork from our champagne bottle, that day's newspaper and the table covers that we had written on in crayon while enjoying our meal. So thoughtful and cute, the staff at Brio going above and beyond made the experience of my Vegas wedding that much more enjoyable! Grazie!

Brio has the best happy hour in the city!  I love the atmospere and sitting outside, it makes me feel like I am not in Vegas. Love the option to sit at the bar inside or out!  3.95 for a wonderfully cooked burger?!! My husband loves the carpaccio, be sure to ask for extra sauce. They used to have a steak brushetta with Gorgonzola on the happy hour menu, I am sad its gone but they still have great selections, like my favorite spicy shrimp and eggplant, again ask for extra sauce.

 You can get a cocktail for 5 dollars as well! We usually stick to the martini, but have tried a few of there specialty cocktails and they were all good. We usually sit at the bar close to Del Mar, he is so awesome! He's busy and still manages to make us perfect drinks, he is always attentive and smiling and always gives outstanding service!! He's in my top 3 bartenders in Vegas! When in doubt of where to go, he keeps us coming back!! Such a great asset to the bar! This is one of my main reasons it's our fave happy hour!

Happy hour specials are great :) that's what keeps us coming back. Service here is normally on point. Last weekend we definitely had a hiccup. 4:30 after work on Friday. We were brought appetizer plates that had already been used and a clean plate was put on top. I addressed it with the manager and he comped a couple of the appetizers. Service wasn't very good. We were on the patio and I had to go inside to request service twice. Bummer :( 

Food is delicious and I absolutely love Peroni. We will keep coming back for that. Hopefully service will be on point next visit.

We went here last night to try the restaurant and see what the new Tivoli Village was all about.  The complex is beautiful.  There was a live band playing in one one coutyards with people mingling and dancing.  Very cool.  If and when additional phases of this complex are completed, it will be a wonderful destination.

The restaurant carried the theme of the complex, with beautiful flooring, stonework and large spaces.  The vibe, ambience, seating and service were all excellent.  We had a 6:30 p.m. reservation and had to wait 15 minutes for our table, the only drawback to an otherwise perfect evening.

The wine was priced reasonably asnd the beer was ice cold.  We ordered the quartet of brushetta.  It was beautifully plated, visually appealing and delicious.  My wife had the penne alla vodka, which she really enjoyed.  I had the veal Marsala, with a very dark, rich sauce that was a bit too thick for my taste but otherwise excellent.

We look forward to going again.

Went for lunch.  Very attractive and spacious restaurant.  Took a little while to get service but went great thereafter.  I felt like a salad and didn't look at the rest of the menu.  I had the Med. chicken salad....fresh, crisp, great textures and moist chicken.  My friend had the steak salad....beautiful thick pieces of medium rare steak.  Artisan bread to start.  Very enjoyable.

My daughter and I went to Brio Tuscan Grille on vacation last week and were pleasantly surprised how enjoyable it was from the greeting when we came in until we finished the meal.  Our waiter Alex was very attentive and the food was extremely good.  We always look for the best restaurants when we travel and this one totally fit the bill.  We both had the Salmon with asparagus and sweet potatoes and it was delicious.  We also had the Caramel Mascarpone Cheesecake.  I would recommend this to anyone in the Gilbert, AZ area.

Adjust the temp! I love going there but not to freeze while I eat.  My food comes out hot and turns cold automatically because the air conditioner is on full blast. It's every time I go and I don't want to go back. The ladies next to me had to leave due to the chill as well. Come on... jeez!

Spent my birthday here for lunch. I have a mixed bag rating for this place...there were things I did like: bread basket (flax seed crackers were good), calamari and white sauce and then things I didn't: turkey sandwich (see pic), chop salad (pic)......for your bday you get a very tiny dessert (very tiny like espresso shot cup size) - it was ok. Overall it was ok but I wouldn't rush back to eat there. Service was fine, nothing to brag about.  Honestly the best thing there was the flax seed crackers lol which was free.....I think is recommend eating there for HH instead of paying full price for their food.

I've never been much of a fan of happy hour....Reason being, I like to eat and generally Happy Hour mostly focuses around tiny portions, usually hit or miss, unpredictable or all of the above.

Well, I came out of my shell after being invited my friends to Brio Tuscan Grille for the best time of the day...First, my social life needs a little work so it felt good to be out and to mingle, but I won't lie to you - I went there for the food and I was far from disappointed.

The Brio Tuscan Grille Happy Hour menu is tiny...just  a couple of items. However, the service is very attentive and swift. I am basing my experience on a wonderful setting, match made in heaven weather, mind blowing prices, and absolutely scrumptious dishes...$ 2.95 really - I've got to call that the smoking deal of the century.

Brio you really wowed me, and not only did my social life get a little polished, but my taste buds also had an orgasm...what a way to kill two birds in one stone...Will be back!

My girlfriends and I came to Brio for Sunday lunch and we were promptly seated. I ordered one of the restaurant favorites, the Mezza Chicken with pasta. Although the flavors of the marinara sauce were tasty and satisfying enough, it didn't blow me away. The lunch portion size left me quite disappointed since there wasn't as much pasta as I expected, especially for a pricey dish at $13. The service was pretty decent but the lackluster food and price doesn't give me an incentive to be back.
Hosted a group of 75, great food, great service! Had numerous positive compliments from our guest. Great job team Brio!!!

Brio is a great place for happy hour. Tasting plates are $2.95.
The carpaccio and shrimp tini are awesome. Thursday is Martini night.
The bartenders and servers are very friendly and we always have a good time
Excellent Happy Hour.  Food has always been consistanly good. The service is good. Nice atmosphere and prices are reasonable

Served wrong food after 30 minutes of waiting and people around us who came after us got their food. This is just a big corporate chain, the employees really dont care. 

Eggs for my mother came out for a benedict almost completely raw. 

Ended up eating mediocre bread for lunch. I guess in the end this place is no better than an Olive Garden just more expensive.

Eaten here several times. Each time we have been pleased with the food. The Tuscan harvest salad is delicious. The waiters & waitresses are average and at times irritating due to lack of experience, poor serving and not checking on you. I would recommend this place to my friends and family. Just wish the service was better

The setting and decor is beautiful.  So I can give it 3 stars for ambiance. The restaurant really has a nice feel and would be perfect if the staff were more attentive and the food faire was better thought out by the Chefs.  First, we were seated for 7 minutes before our server approached us.   Second, the temperature inside the restaurant was uncomfortably warm and stale.  Third, the meals.....My wife had the shrimp and lobster pasta.  We counted 6 small shrimp and mere flakes of what appeared to be lobster.  The sauce was good, but the pasta was the main attraction not the seafood.  I had the crab cakes.  They were just ok.  Two small crab cakes atop a mound of fingerling potatoes and green beans.  The main course was the potatoes.  

The olive oil and vinegar cruets were disgustingly sticky and I asked them to be replaced.  They were without hesitation by our server, but it's obvious they are infrequently cleaned which is concerning. 

We had high expectations but were sadly disappointed.  We won't be back.  

I got an private message and gave the Mgr my phone number many days ago. Never got a call.  So my recommendation has gone down to 2 stars.

I gave them a second chance. I regret it. First try here was yesterday 6/11/18 with 3 girlfriends I dragged out of the house. We were seated outside right next to the mist by the sidewalk where foot traffic was plenty. Beautiful atmosphere. Our server came and for the first few minutes she was sweet and nice. She grew impatient and short after we asked her several questions regarding drinks. The difference between the tropical martini and this other martini. So I decided to just cut it short and order something to resolve the initial interaction. She brought our drinks all was well. Food came out.. I asked for silverware. My girls are halfway through their food and I had to catch a busy boy on his way back to the kitchen and ask for napkins and silverware as she never came back with any. It was pretty quiet yesterday. Not busy at all. Still tried to make the best of it and enjoy the company of my girls. We are and our drinks were low... after our food she never came to check on us. None of us noticed the bill she placed in the middle of the table. She never asked how we want it split. So we figure when she comes back, we can ask. Again she got by us and by the time she came back our 4 credit cards were already charged. I asked, how did she decide to split the bill? She replied, "Equally." I asked her why didn't she bother to ask? No response, so I did mention, in the future please check with your table and ask how they want it split. (This isn't something I should tell her) Day 2.. today. I decided to go back and redo this experience with my fiancé. As he has never been. We head in and ask if I can have the same spot yesterday. One server said yes and the assistant manager said no. I had my receipt to show her that we were just here yesterday and sat at that exact table. Her response, "The general manager was here when you guys were here so that's why you were able to sit there." My thoughts... of the GM approves us sitting there, and she was only the assistant... why couldn't we sit there? We showed up same time. Today was far more dead than yesterday. Literally a total of 3 groups of a small party seated outside. I could understand if it's packed busy and they had to designate a spot. Anyway 2 days consecutive of shit service was enough for me.

What the heck happened to this place? The service is now terrible. The girl who sat us was rude. I stated ahead of time we wanted a booth. I recently herniated three discs so sitting in a wood chair sucks for me. So of course they tried to sit us in wooden chairs. She had a mini fit when I reminded her I asked for a booth. Trust me it sucks to be young and have had an accident I don't need a 19 year old treating me like I'm being difficult.
To top it off it took twenty minutes for a waitress to come by. She seemed shocked no one had been by to take our drink order. By this time we had our menus sat to the side and were ready to order our meal. 
There's to many good restaurants in this town to deal with bad service.

I had my daughters baby shower here. Let me tell you I was a pain with all my changes. The banquet manager, Nova was very helpful and patient. At the event the room was beautiful, service great and the food was really good. I did not have one complaint!

I went here last week and just had to add my review. The place is gorgeous, the staff was friendly and attentive. I got the Pasta with the Vodka sauce, per reviews on here, and it was PERFECT. I also had the wedge salad which was so delicious. We had the cutest little deserts that came in an espresso cup. My only complaint was I did not like the breads that came before the meal.... and considering my entree wasn't a very big size, it would have been nice to have some really good breads before the meal. 

All in all, i think you should try it out!

I've been to Brio a few times now.  The first time, I loved it, it was so wonderful and fulfilling.  I enjoyed every morsel I tasted.  The service was impeccable and the portions were well worth all that was spent on them. 

I then took a couple of friends their for Mother's Day and a thank you, they were quite impressed as well.  The food was melting in our mouths, no complaints came from us. They were very accommodating!  I love it would recommend it for a casual afternoon on the patio, or even a romantic evening with that special someone!  A definite MUST if you're in the area!  

The aroma's coming from the kitchen definitely get your mouth watering for the delectable menu!  Bon Appetite!

Honestly, I don't understand why this place has such a low rating. Maybe those people weren't here during happy hour? 

A group of five of us stopped in on Friday after work. It is an AWESOME happy hour! The Rosa Sangria is to die for, and all of the other drinks looked great, as well. The food is really what made this place special. Very reasonable prices (especially for Scottsdale) and a good amount of food. I recommend the Blackened Shrimp, the Artichoke Dip, and the Eggplant Fries (my favorite). The deserts are fabulous (there was a caramel/pumpkin cheesecake desert that was to die for, the lava cake was amazing, too!).

Our waitress was very attentive, considering it was a busy time. She even held her grace when we were being difficult and asked for separate checks. The crowd is obviously very Scottsdale (Botox and plastic surgery all around), but it won't deter me.

I will be returning!

My hubby and I went to Brio Tuscan Grille  on an invite from local friends (we are from Chicago). I received absolutely the best service from the time I walked in until I left. I had an amazing red sangria at the outside bar, where misters keep you cool,  while we were waiting for our friends. My food was perfectly cooked and tasty (gorgonzola beef medallions, veg medley and mashed potatoes). My husband enjoyed his vegetable pesto pasta. The atmosphere and decor is beautiful and seating is comfortable. I can't wait to come back!

Wow! My husband and I decided to try Brio on a whim and I'm so glad we did. We had a great experience from start to finish. Our server was super on top of it and kept brining my husband a fresh soda (which is one of our favorite things a server can do!). We ordered the Quattro Bruschetta, the Gorgonzola Medallions and the Lobster Shrimp tortollini. All of it was soooo yummy! We will definitely be back!

We have had a corporate dinner two months in a row with 20 attendees.  The service has been excellent.  Nova; our contact at Brio Tuscan Grille was very easy to work with and communicated with us while preparing for our events.  We look forward to our next event already scheduled for June.

Avoid their take out! VERY DISAPPOINTING,  Dry pasta, dry salmon. Small portions. Will not do take out from them again. I don't mind the prices when they deliver an excellent product, but this was a rip off.

As a former employee for brio, i can honestly say their food is top-notch. I was there tonight for happy hour and the bar was really full but the bartender jim (james g) was outstanding and handled the high volume of customers with a sense of urgency and still made time to be personable to not only me, but almost everyone at the busy bar. 

The food is always amazing, and that goes for the happy hour food as well. Im glad i live close by now so i can visit more regularly here.
Service  was awful,  food cold,  drinks took a while , although  it was a weekend  ,  next time if we do go back it will be lunch week day .

We came here a couple of weeks ago for reverse hh on a friday and sat at the bar to take advantage of the HH.   Mr h ordered the Brio burger and I ordered the margherita flatbread, both apps were below average apps. The burger was bland and the Hubster ordered med well and added sautéed onions. the burger was served well with charred onions.
my pizza seemed more like a thin flavorless cracker mess. I like thin pizza but this was way too thin and falling apart. We both ordered the mojitos & they were so disgusting we had to send those back.  the bartender took it personally but they were super bitter and nasty and we could not enjoy them.  I understand it's happy hour and its super busy on Fridays, affordable drinks & apps but if you want me to return...please serve some tasty food so I will be tempted to have dinner here in the future.  I doubt I will be returning.

Ate here for the first time. The 3 of us had the salad with steak on top and it was fantastic. The lettuce was fresh and the steak was a nice cut and cooked med-rare. The portion was large enough for 2 but I pigged out. All in all a great stop for lunch and not very crowded on a Tuesday afternoon.

The inside of this restaurant is beautiful, with its high ceilings and Tuscan villa-inspired hangings. They've also opened some of their windows so the nice breeze circulated throughout the place.

My friends and I went in for lunch. I ordered the Mezza Chicken Under the Brick, while my friends ordered an omelet and a risotto lunch special with salad. The breads for the table were delicious! My favorite was the crispy one with sesame seeds. I wish the butter was softer and more spreadable.

The Mezza Chicken, listed under 500 calories, was a good lunch-sized portion. The chicken was delicious and absorbed the mushroom flavored gravy it was topped with; but the vegetables were my favorite. They were seasoned very well and I loved the slight char on all of them. The mashed potatoes were light and provided a great contrast to the vegetables and chicken.

Our server was great and friendly. There was a mistake on our order, where we were charged an extra $5 for a salad that was included in the lunch special. When we pointed it out, she apologized and remedied it. I would definitely come here again, and I hope the location near home will be as beautiful as this one.
Service was amazing, server was an act in himself with my shot-drinking girlfriends at brunch. Lobster bisque was incredible. Loved everything!!

Went for Happy Hour and had the following dishes:

Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant (5/5)
Margherita Flatbread (3.5/5)
Pepper Formaggio Dip (Eek! 2.5/5)

My least favorite: The dip flavor was very odd (almost like the components together yielded a canned cheese flavor) and the ciabatta was over-toasted, it was more like a crostini that was way too crunchy.

The portions were huge for a Happy Hour serving and the service was really good.  I'll go again to try the ravioli or maybe just order off of the regular dinner menu.

We had a horrible experience yesterday. We sat ourselves out in the patio because we had a double stroller, a toddler and a baby. My husband was going to run in and let the hostess know we were out there but we saw an employee pop his head out, look at us but didn't acknowledge us. After a couple of minutes the hostess cane out to inform us that part of the patio was not being used and that we can use the other side. Okay so we moved over there no problem. As we were sitting down the waiter popped his head out handed my sister a stack of menus and told her he would be right out. We sat out there for almost 20 minutes. No one came. It was hot out and we didn't even have water offered. The restaurant was not busy at all so there was no reason for that to happen. Finally the waiter came out and didn't even apologize for the wait just wanted to know what we wanted to drink. I made a point that we had been sitting out here for a while and again didn't apologize. Instead came up with a weak excuse that he was bombarded with a bunch of stuff at the same time. So again he rudely asked what we wanted. I felt that our business was not wanted and said we were leaving. The waiter cheerfully said "okay have a good day!".....no apologies! We felt so horrible. I can't believe we were treated so badly. We will never be returning and will be telling everyone we know about the horrible service we received.

The boyfriend and I decided to eat here after attending the hello kitty event. Haha. 

For appetizer, I had the Roasted Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke Dip with Parmesan flatbread. Honestly, I was so full after that. I didn't even want my entrée anymore. Haha. But as my entrée, I ordered the Ravioli Di Bello. Which had portobello, mushrooms, grape tomatoes in it. It was very creamy but hard to eat.

The service was so slow. Our drinks took forever, I asked for napkins and it took almost 15 minutes for me to get, same goes to the to go box as well.

The ambiance was nice, the decor and set up is  like Cheesecake Factory.

We tried Brio tonight for the first time and loved it. The wait was pretty long, so we ended up in the Bar and grabbed a table in the bar when one opened up. The dark wood and decor are nice - we liked the feel. The bread was fresh, warm and delicious. I liked my pasta and butter (for those of you who know me, you know I'm super picky). My husband, who really only ever "loves" hot, spicy new mexican food, "loved" his dish - Chicken Milanese Pomodoro - I never hear him talk that way about Italian food. The rest of our party was enthusiastic about the food and atmosphere as well. We'll be back!
Service and food is phenomenal! I love the bartenders, genuinely good folks! I've been here several times and never had a bad meal, it's all good.

This place is awesome! The food, the atmosphere and everything else! My best bro n i went here for happy hour and the food is awesome! We got two brio burgers, Carpaccio, and we got the italian lemonade and the white peach sangria! Everything was amazing and the bill was very cheap!

Jim was the best bartender ever! He had the best hospitality and was very friendly! Hes awesome! Keep it up Boss and thank you for everything!
Abby was amazing! She is such a sweetheart and accommodates to anything we needed! Brio is amazing due to her hospitality #teamabby we will ask for her every time!

I thought I would try Brio again during Arizona Restaurant Week to see if anything improved from my first visit.  Again,  the service was not what one would expect for this establishment.  Our drink glasses went empty and nobody noticed. I had to ask for more.  Usually, restaurants with these price points are more concerned about keeping drink glasses full. Some of the time it felt like we were on auto pilot.  I was trying to get some balsamic and olive oil for my bread.  It took awhile for the server to come back to check on out table.  The kitchen runners just drop and run.  Also, I noticed some flies in the dining room and a lady at the nearby table stood up to swat at flies.  She asked me if I noticed the flies and if I was having any trouble with flies.  There is nothing like swating flies and trying to keep them out of your dinner.  There were some very frustrating circumstances about dining here tonight.

4.5 stars. We walked in on a Friday night without reservations and had to wait 60-80 min for a table. BUT there was lots of shopping while we waited. Food and service were amazing. Christian was awesome. And the prices were good. Get the spicy shrimp eggplant.

I chose this place as my wedding lunch reception back in October. They were great and the food was delicious. My guests loved everything they ordered and the staff tended to everyone in a timely fashion. To this day, my friends and family still talk about it. I'd highly recommend them for reception lunch or dinner.
Recenly went to brio, and loved it, all expectations were met from service to meals and drinks.

Service was just ok and had to ask server if there were bread, he apparantly had forgotton. Had chicken limonode which was tasty and portion  size was perfect. All the others had pasta and were small eaters and were dissappointed in the taste and the very small portion size. They all ended up ordering additional things when they saw how small their portions were. I have to say for the price, a cup or less of noodles without much on it was a rip off. I understand we are not in Little Italy but knock the pricng down if its not home made pasta and a measley portion. Have only been here once before and this experience made me remember why.

Went for happy hour with a  group of professionals.  Found a spot out on the porch and waited for our waiter!  Finally came.  
Rather than waste all of our time on the details.................We will not go back.  The service was terrible!  The food was good and you can't beat the happy hour prices. 
Some of group never received their order and we had to ask (waiter had forgotten to turn it in!!).  No apologies or compensation.  We spent over $100 and had to chase the waiter again to get our bill and pay. 
Not worth the great happy hour prices and treatment we got.  No thanks!

I went to this location by accident. I thought I was on my way to the "Yelp Goes Under The Tuscan Sun" event, but I went to the wrong location. The reason why I didn't turn around and hed straight to the yelp event was because we arrived at 6:40 p.m. at the Santan Mall location and we were supposed to go to the Scottsdale Quarter location. Because it was rush hour and we had already driven from Tempe, at this point we just wanted to have a nice meal. 

At first I was bummed when I didn't see red yelp balloons and a line of eager yelpers ready to mingle, but I was starving so I decided to stay for dinner. The manager and server were very accommodating to me and my friend and I really appreciate the effort they made to make us feel welcome- despite no yelp event to attend. I really wasn't that upset! 

The food was delicious. I'm pretty sure the words "tantalizing taste buds" came to mind that night. I loved the ravioli appetizer and white peach sangria! My server was so sincere and attentive. I want to say his name was Fausto. My apologies if I'm wrong. The manager was very sweet, as well. Thanks so much for letting my friend and I create our own idea of what a yelp event could be with a guest list limited to 2. HAHA

We went for bunch last Sunday and were horribly disappointed.  Portions were small, I had the eggs and avocado with chicken dish.  Absolutely tasteless except for the chicken which tasted like lunch meat not pieces of fresh chicken.  I expected a lot more, maybe I shouldn't have!
Words can't explain the awesome experience dining at Brio's Restaurant. The service was Outstanding and the food was great. Hands down if you are looking for a nice place to dine, Brio's is it.

We came in on the holiday weekend. Excellent service by Summer! She promptly greeted us. We started with wine, and shared an appetizer of Spinach Artichoke Dip. It came hot and was delicious. My husband had a Grilled Chicken Breast Dinner and I got full on the appetizer. I went with the Brio chopped salad after that.  The chopped salad is always my favorite here, with a tasty dressing. The lettuce is finely chopped and is perfect before a meal when I don't have an appetizer. My husband said the chicken was flavored very well...it came with a side. He wanted pasta, the suggested side was fettuccini alfredo. He had asked if he could have the pasta with red sauce instead. Summer said "of course", and my husband was happy with having that option! What completed this as being a great experience, was that the manager, Corey, came by, was very friendly, and wanted to make sure we were enjoying our dinner. We were impressed he did this at the door, and noticed he also checked on other tables. Brio earned our five stars!

I went there for a mid-afternoon lunch. I ordered Grilled Mahi Mahi and an iced tea. The mahi mahi came with spinach and farrow. It was okay . . .  A-OK . . . not really. $25 for lunch for a small portion of fish that somebody had not bothered to season correctly - some bites were too peppery, some were not peppery at all - I don't like pepper. The spinach was good, but there wasn't much. The bread was okay - I'm not a fan of sourdough. The crackers with everything - a step up, but not a big step up. The farrow was good and there was a good amount of it. The tea was fine - not any better than what I make at home. 

 Oh, it is healthy - they halved the portion  and doubled the price. And, after tax and tip, I spent $25 for lunch - for that much money I expect a whole lot better than I got - way better than "I could have done far better in 15 minutes or less at home". I won't be back.

We went on a Friday about 1pm and had a 10 minute wait. I had Roasted Sweet Potato & Chicken Risotto. The waiter asked if I wanted a half portion with a salad. I didn't know I could do that and was glad he suggested it. A full bowl of Risotto would have been too much for me. My friend had Crispy Eggplant Pomodoro, which she enjoyed. The eggplant was cut in thick slices and wasn't overly battered. We also had a bottle of Chianti Classico, San Fabiano (Tuscany, Italy). The total bill was just over $60. I would definitely go again.

After a day of shopping in Kierland Commons we were looking for a late lunch and a cool drink.  We sat in a booth in the bar area and the service was great.  They've got a great wine list and the menu has a great varied selection - something for everyone.  For us, we just enjoyed lots of appetizers.  The spinach artichoke dip and the bruschetta sample platter were terrific and moderately priced.  It was a great place to spend an hour or two after a long day.

Tonight was an utter failure. A Monday night - not a busy time for them.

I've held off on updating my review for several sub-par visits. But, tonight was the tipping point.

So, here's the deal:
Newer server: 3 stars - clearly a bit overwhelmed; took several minutes to greet us; was very polite; took the orders accurately; very slow to fulfill drink orders; one glass came with a huge lipstick stain on it; didn't put the entree orders in to the kitchen until after the appetizer was consumed; was slow to check back but was very visibly trying to handle his workload with other tables.

Kitchen staff: 0 stars - the steak appetizer was the shining star of the night; lasagna was brutally overcooked; chicken milenase was just average; creme brulee was curdled! Was the Monday Night Football game a distraction? The restaurant was not busy and I counted at least 8 staff on the kitchen side of the pass.

Prior, recent, visits: the crab cakes were a majority breading not crab meat. The flat bread pizza was disappointing. I had come to expect higher quality for the price that Brio commands.

Overall, I'm going with the 2 stars as the floor manager was, at least, apologetic. And, I think the server deserves a chance to get things figured out.

My final frustration was that it appeared that the management and staff wanted to place all the blame for this very sub-par experience on the (newer) server. It was his fault that he was slow to greet and slow to get beverages served. It wasn't his fault that the crew charged with getting serving ware clean let a glass with a huge lipstick stain get through unchecked. It wasn't his fault that the pasta in the lasagna was as hard as tanned leather. It wasn't his fault that the creme brulee had curdled (a comp'd item and still a blow-it!).

Folks, it's going to be a while before I think to come back. A shame, really. Brio was on my frequent dine-out list. Now, we'll take a pass until our out-of-town friends come back and just "have to" come here.

We went on the Saturday of a holiday weekend and was surprised to get a patio table with shade. We sat across from the fountain so it had a great vibe. We initially had a concern due to a holiday special two for one for brunch and was told by the waitress that it only covered the specific brunch items not the brunch menu. The manager came over to clarify that it did indeed cover any items on the brunch menu up to $15. I ordered the Pesto Chicken and Quinoa Salad and loved it. The menu states all ingredients and the calories which is helpful in making decisions. It was so filling that I had to take some home. The staff was super friendly and the bread before the meal must be one of the best in town.
Jesse the General Manager was very accommodating and was helpful answering questions. He made our experience a great one.. We will be back .. thank you

One of my favorite restaurants, the prices are reasonable and the food is outstanding. It's a little bit too good when you are trying to diet. However, the lobster bisque is to die for, and one of the chocolate desserts actually melts in your mouth. Definitely a great place for a nice and quality lunch or a peaceful dinner!

I stopped by Brio Tuscan Grille a few weeks ago while in Vegas during a luncheon with some friends that recently moved in the area.  They were raving about this great pasta spot near the south side of the strip so we decided to stop by here.  

I believe Brio is an Italian chain around the US, although I don't believe they have any in the Southern California area; hence, my unfamiliarity.  The decor is actually really nice.  It's more of a nice date place.  They've got a really nice faux Colisseum exhibited in the dining area.  A very nice touch to the restaurant.  

I ended up orderering the Pasta Fra Diavolo with chicken.  I thought it was ok.  It didn't really pack the kind of flavor that I was really looking for.  Usually the sauces are exuberant for this type of dish, but this one was a little on the bland side.  The chicken was also forgettable, not really adding much to the dish.

Would I come back to this place?  I'd probably give it another shot and try something else.  There was a nice salmon dish that I saw on someone else's platter that I would have liked to try.

This place is growing on me. I have been to the Scottsdale Quarter (Arizona) and Las Vegas locations and had the same thing and it was consistently satisfying. I got the sweet potato and chicken risotto and salad. Yum! My company also enjoyed what they ordered. Service was terrific. It definitely adds to the meal.

To start off, my wife came here with a girlfriend weeks ago and liked the food so much that she wanted to bring me back to try it. We were excited. We had lunch around 2pm and was greeted and seated instantly. Within minutes a busser dropped fresh bread and butter and took our drink orders. Being that it was the end of April, it's starting to get hot outside but the inside where we were seated was freezing so if you hate being cold you wouldn't have enjoyed it. After about fifteen minutes our waiter came and asked us for our order in a very hasty way to make us feel like hurry up, I have things to do. The food came out quick and it wasn't bad, not good, but not $50 worth of quality (Olive Garden is 10 times better if you get the idea) since it was so cold I tried to see if we were seated next to the vents and when I looked up, I could see the vents caked with dirt and dust. These vents are on the expediting line right above the kitchen so you'll be eating that. I looked to the ledge that separated our table booth from the kitchen and I took a picture of a thick layer of dirt at my eye level. I could only imagine the amount of dust and dirt that made its way into my food. Won't be going back anytime soon. (The napkin is what I used to clean some of the table while we were eating)

UPDATE: They reached out to me after this review stating they were concerned about my experience and wanted to speak with me. I gave my contact information and never heard a word. Hopefully they take a real hard look at their standards. This review wasn't to bash a company or restaurant but to make the guest experience better for future customers.

Had bad customer service when i came in. Our food came alittle late but i wasnt really worried because it was busy and i can understand that. When our food did come, it had a piece of hair. Our server took too long to come by so by that time, i lost my appetite. I paid the bill and me & my friend just left. For what it was worth, u shouldve just gone to fast food. Wouldve saved me money and time.

Wonderful place for lunch or dinner.  The service is fast and friendly.  The menu has all different types of choices including a wonderful gluten free menu! If you like beef carpaccio there's is the best I've  had by far.  Phoebe our server was very attentive and cheerful and the manger even stopped by to see how everything was going:).  I will definitely be back!!

Recently we celebrated our Anniversary with Friends at Brio Tuscan Grille. The service was very good along with the terrific Italian cuisine; grilled salmon, mouth watering grilled pork chop (bone in); savory lobster and shrimp linguini, delicious veal scallopini and more. Our waiter refilled our water every 10-15 minutes, or as needed.

We are definitely coming back.

Good location, nice staff and well decorated restaurant. I got the salmon dinner. The salmon was very salty and over-seasoned... And this comes from a girl who loves salt! The sides it came with were pretty good, but I would suggest trying a different plate.

This was a fun last-minute lunch place that I and a few friends visited this weekend. I had heard about the place but had never been there. WIth this being the first day to really feel like summer (well, summer in Ohio, where I'm from) I really enjoyed sitting outside and enjoying the sunshine, the breeze and the passers by (including Carrot Top, who said hi as he ambled by). The atmosphere was fun and casual- I really liked the view of the outdoor section where diners sit separated from the sidewalks of Tivoli Village by an attractively scalloped, metal "fence."  Aluminum-colored heating elements spaced throughout the outdoor area looked sculptural and artsy.  Large umbrellas protected patrons from the bright, hot sun.  Our waiter, Brian, had a great personality and made the experience even more enjoyable..

I had the risotto with chicken and the tossed salad for about $14.00. It was tasty, but I liked my friend's shrimp version better.  The crusty bread served before the meal was quite enjoyable.  A couple of us had the wedge salad, which was accompanied by a gorgonzola and garlic dressing that, in my opinion, was light and not overpowering. My friends loved that it had bacon.

I would definitely come here again and bring family or friends. Now I want to see what it looks like inside!

Brio is located in the Town Square shopping center. I absolutely love it's ambiance, especially at night! 

Husband and I came in after doing a charity event. We were seated at the corner of their patio--perfect! It was like a mini impromptu date. It's like gold to be able to escape from 4 kids! Love them gremlins beyond the furthest sun but good gosh do they suck the bone marrow out of you.

My husband ordered the Pesto pasta as I opted for the sliced steak bruschetta. Both were absolutely deelish! I love how my steak melted with the bruschetta! Portioning ratio was definitely adequate for us. They are a tad pricey, in my opinion, but alot of fancier Italians places just are. The best part of Brio is that it is a place that is both classy and casual.

We ordered a couple drinks which I don't even remember their names. Lol. I will say this...bartender was NOT greedy about the alcohol content whatsoever! Husband and I were looking at each other like, how the hell are we buzzing already? Lightweights. Lol.

I'm giving this place 5 stars because while the two items we tried were pretty good but that caramel marscapone cheesecake! Wholly deelish! Please do not fail to order this when you stop in or fail to make room for it. Don't even share it! Hahaha. It's THAT deelish!!!

My husband and I have been coming here since it opened and loved it. Since menu changed we were extremely disappointed but we wanted to give it another chance. Went there today and my husband ordered the risotto and they came back and said it wasn't ready! Really they have been open since 11:00 and we know chefs get there early so what's the deal? Then server asked if there was something else he would like and he said the salmon and she said sorry we are out of salmon!!!! So we got up
and left and went to Cheesecake Factory. Won't be going back to Brio's until they make necessary changes to get their loyal customers to come back.


Since our last review management reached out to us and we have to say this last meal was a pleasant experience food was very good! We will be back for sure. And John our server is always very pleasant!

There are so many good places to eat in Town Square.  My friend was surprised that I had never eaten there when she invited me a few weeks ago.  (I had attended a private event there last year.  There was a buffet of simple items, such as fruit, cheese, etc.)

Anyway, I was completely unaware her intent was to avail ourselves to the happy hour specials.  I had sat in the main dining room and had already ordered a glass of Pinot Grigio.  The waiter checked with the manager and she was kind enough to offer us the specials.  

To be honest, the HH specials didn't do it for me.  I ordered the pasta brio.  First, I knew when I got it that I would get to take home about half and enjoy for lunch the next day.  It was delicious!  Grilled chicken, mushrooms, rigatoni...I'm not sure what be sauce was, but it was tasty!

Also, let me give props to my super waiter.  He got me my wine and a glass of water before my friend arrived.  He also brought bread with oil, balsamic, and Parmesan cheese.  

My friend enjoyed her hh of shrimp and an inexpensive wine.  

Great balance to our evening!

What a wonderful night we had at the Yelp event!  Fantastic food, bruschettas, homemade cocktails and delicious pastas and desserts.  We enjoyed ourselves to no end chatting with our friends and taking in the ambiance of such a unique place.

First time there, and I'm giving it 3 stars because of the server(s) only....company party and reservations made in advance, but when I got there, the hostess had no idea what I was talking about for the reservation....uh oh....so, I went to the bar to wait for others to arrive, and a different hostess started seating my party & they called me to find out where I was!!  I was pretty clear to the hostess originally of the name I was looking for, and I'd be at the bar if they arrived.  I wasn't rude, I understood there had to have been some miscommunication somewhere, and would she please alert me if someone else from our party showed up so I could greet them.  From the bar, you can't easily see the hostess station...

Sigh...anyways, while at the bar, I was greeted warmly and the service was superb...the table for 18 was placed in the middle of the main dining area, which was fine, but we'd been assured there would be a private space for our group.  Guess we got outbid by a larger group?  Anyways, not trying to be picky, but when I know this will be at least a $500 tab, I expect to be treated accordingly!!  

The food server(s) tho made up for the initial impression...and that's the best part of this review!  The food wasn't what I felt to be any better than Olive Garden, and I'd actually have preferred the food there?  Go figure!  We ordered appetizers, not impressed with the lobster bisque, the roasted garlic spinach artichoke dip, or the breads....so, bring on the salad....I had a house salad, which sounded pretty amazing as described by the food server, but was a disappointment when I got it, and I know the feeling was mutual with the other salad that was ordered too.
