Main course, we had some lasagna orders, some veal marsala orders, some carbonara orders, and some other pasta dishes that I couldn't discern....no one from our group was impressed, and we're not foodies or culinary school graduates or anything, so that's saying a LOT about the quality of the food....it was filling!!  

Personally, I don't think I'll be going back, but I wouldn't say no to a date taking me there....I'll just know not to expect to be WOW'ed by the food, and just enjoy the atmosphere!!

Service and food was really good! The martini selection has lots of unique options. I had Mediterranean Shrimp and a peach sangria. Both were great. It's a big place and stays busy. Give it a try! Also an H&M is next door.

This is my favorite happy hour in all of Vegas! $5 drink specials and several food items for $2.95!! And it tastes good! I've been here more times than I can count and keep coming back. The outdoor seating area is limited so you may have to wait for a seat.. the seating is better at the location in town square.

Love this place! It's my favorite Happy Hour in Vegas! $5 drink specials and several food options for $2.95! And it tastes good! The outdoor seating here is amazing! I've never not been able to find a seat, even with a large group.

It was okay. The hostess was telling customers that there would be a 20 minute wait to sit on the patio. When somebody questioned the wait -- since half of the tables were empty -- she replied that they only had one server for the patio. Huh? Five minutes later the manager came over, and it was obvious that he was asking why people were waiting? Next thing you know, everyone had seats on the patio. Let me guess...they assigned another waiter to the patio? Anyway, the bruschetta was good, the steak in the steak salad was a little wanting, and the waiter needs a little more training: I asked for Chenin Blanc. He said that he didn't know if they had that brand. I do have to say that it was very nice on the patio. I'd go back.

Not normally a 25% tipper but Brio got mine on 4/20/12! Great food, great service, and great experience as well. It was Friday night and the place was SLAMMED, 45 minute wait for a table. Wife and I decided to sit at the bar and try the house cocktails while we waited. Ended up staying at the bar where we enjoyed the company of the staff, full food service, and GREAT food! We shared the risotto and it was magnificent! Reminded me of the risotto I'd enjoyed in Northern Italy. Definitely recommend dining at Brio Tuscan Grille if you're on the Strip in Las Vegas!

I think the service and the food was equally great. I think our waitress was in training but she did really good. My friend just said we were gonna share and when our food came out, we had our own plates.i think that was really nice and she was paying attention. The food came out at a reasonable time.we didn't wait long.
The food is always amazing. Great service, great food and amazing outdoor atmosphere. This is a can't miss place to eat!!

Really good, attentive service. We like to go to the bar for the happy hour. Split their burger, shrimp & eggplant in black pepper cream sauce, calamari, and beef carpaccio. Very good food. And each of those is $3.95. The bar splits inside & out which will be nice on a warmer night. They do have a drape that cuts some of the cold and heaters too. It's really good food paired with great service.

Looked like they were giving food and drinks away here. 
from 5pm til about 9ish ----almost seat was taken.
tastefully decorated,
happy hour is happening
Crab cakes were delicious, 
2 and they were small, I think their portions can be a bit larger,
especially for what they charged.
outside seating as well.

Came here for a dinner with some friends service was nice. Menu was ok they didn't have much food without alcohol or pork. I got the spicy shrimp which was good. Everyone else at my table got salads and no one complained the lava cake was really good though !
YUMMY! everything I have tried here has been delicious. This place is always extremely busy at dinner time. Try it for lunch if you don't want to wait.

Service was really slow. It was terrible that we got our waitress got switched and we never got what we ordered until a new waitress came. The food was delish but it seemed like everyone was in a bad mood. I get sometimes you have a bad day but cmon. The food was amazing but wish service would have been better

Lovely decorated, roomy and classy. Food prices were pretty legit for an upscale restaurant. Food selection was ample, ranging from steak, to breakfast, to lotsssss of different pastas. 

Our waiter was kind of rushed and cold, but he warned up somewhat towards the very end...he looked like he hadn't slept in weeks and his attitude reflected it. 

Try the fried calamari with aioli sauce!
Great food! Our server was Jasmine, she gave us good suggestions. We had awesome pasta dishes. Wonderful evening

Happy Hour is the only time to go! Obviously my previous statement means this following review applies only to the happy hour menu and service. The food on the menu is $2.95 per item; this is as good as cheap gets! The food is great and the Brio Burger is definitely one of the best. The bruschetta is a another one of my favorites... oh, and the eggplant... and the beef carpaccio... and the--just kidding, they're all pretty freaking good! Unfortunately, they don't really have drinks on the happy hour menu. I usually still get a mojito and it's filled to the brim with ice, leaving very little room for actual alcohol in addition to the fact that they add too much club soda and not enough rum.

The desserts are not on the happy hour menu, but they are definitely delicious. The available desserts seem to vary according to a random and unknown schedule because there's always an old item from the past visit missing and always something new to try.

The service is great and the food comes out quite quickly.

La comida riquísima el servicio, excelente . Mother's day . With my daughter. .me  sentí muy consentida por el personal  y el manager . William. Gracias . Excelente todo 09 012016thank you very much for the service we got. the food was delicious . we got vip attention. Wiliam manager treated us like princesses. Servian good at all. @ maria Esther TOVAR

Wow.  Really blown away by my experience here tonight (Saturday evening, dinner).

The interior is very nice, but not stuffy or pompous. Casual wear is not out of place.

Ordered a couple drinks off the bar menu, a Raspberry Mojito and an Italian Mule. So good, I would return just for drinks.

REALLY enjoyed the food. The lobster bisque was hearty and flavorful,  and I considered cancelling my entree and just getting another 2-3 bowls, it was that yummy.

But I am glad I didn't do that, because the entrees were delicious.  Campanelle Carbonara was a very flavorful pasta dish, with just the right balance of ingredients.  The Mahi Mahi special was perfect. Grilled without being over seasoned,  allowing the flesh to be the center of attention.

We enjoyed a dessert trio that was a fantastic finish to the meal. A mascarpone cheesecake that had hints of cinnamon, a creme brulee that was the perfect texture, with plenty of vanilla, and an AMAZING seasonal strawberry shortcake that blended flavors and textures exquisitely. 

It was one of those meals where every scrap was consumed,  and every belly is satisfied.

If I HAD to come up with a negative... like, for a job interview or something ('what is the greatest weakness?') ...the portions were too perfect.  Any more would have been too much, any less would've been overpriced tapas.

Where Brio really stood out tonight, was the service and personnel. Quite simply the best service I recall having in a long time. 

The hostesses were smiling and welcoming, and made sure to give us a nice goodbye on the way out. We were visited three times by the manager - he brought out our soups/salads, checked on us during the meal, and checked again at the end of the meal.  Really invested to ensure we had a good experience. I should have gotten his name. He was great.

Our server... Nick... was simply awesome. Friendly, but not goofy or cheesy. Paid really good attention to glasses and plates,  and ensured we we never sitting there wanting. Suggested options and offered upgraded, without an ounce of pushiness.

I simply cannot wait to get back to Brio

I gotta admit, I've spent several happy hours out on the patio at Brio. Our usual server is a cute young thing and he always remembers our tastes. While I'd like some drink specials for happy hour, you can't complain about a $2.95 appetizer list... and everything tastes pretty good. By everything, I mean we ordered one of everything and went through 4 bottles of wine our first time there. It's also a terrific people watching spot; leave it to Scottsdale to have constant traffic at the valet out front when there's a half-empty parking garage 10 feet away.

Recommendations: the flavor of the shrimp with eggplant was great (I wouldn't call it spicy, though), and the roasted red pepper bruschetta was really tasty as well (despite the fact that I hate peppers).

This review is based solely on their Happy Hour, which is one of my favorites in town! I usually go here whenever I just want to grab some refreshing sangrias and a quick bite with a friend. 

Their HH is Monday-Friday 3:30-6:30pm and their reverse HH is 9pm-close. Keep in mind that it can get busy and seating at the bar, tables and booths are first come, first served. However, there have been a few times where it gets too packed in the bar area that the server will accommodate my party and I and we get to sit in the main restaurant area even though we are doing happy hour, which I really appreciate! 

Their cocktails range from $4-6 and each food item on the HH menu range from $5-6 which are GREAT deals! The drinks are delicious and can be pretty strong (especially their sangrias lol) so they don't cheap you out on getting your alcohol on! 

White peach sangria, the Moscow Mule, and the Black Raspberry Cosmo are my favorites and a must try! 

For food: Very shareable! We usually like to just order a few items and will be stuffed by the end of the meal. Our favorites include the Black Pepper Shrimp, Brio Burger (omg so good!) and the Margherita Flatbread. All super yummy, filling, and satisfying.

Their service is always really great and they even have a rewards card that you might want to get to stack up some points. 

With that said, if you're looking for a good place to get your Happy Hour on, definitely go to Brio!

I do like the wedge salad; however, the 'famous' lobster bisque never has ANY lobster in it....they do put a few shrimp pieces on top....but no lobster and I even asked for it specifically. I tried this bisquie number of times; I think they should just call it creamy thick soup that uses the seafood soup base.
Brio is a consistently good restaurant. They finally shortened their menu which I was very glad to see. I love their food, service and how well kept everything is!

Great Place for Happy Hour

Brio at San Tan Village has a happy hour that can't be beat.  My wife and I will stop by as we are out running errands.  The bar staff is cordial and efficient in a busy atmosphere.  

There is a good selection of alcoholic beverages discounted along with quite a few menu items.

I LOVE THIS RESTAURANT!!!  I happily recommend it here, because I have recommended it to many friends, all of whom have loved it as much as I do.  The servers are professional without being stuffy - -always pleasant and helpful, and you never feel they are pressuring you to run up the bill.  The food is divine.  The portions are large, so I often just get two appetizers.  They have both indoor and sheltered outdoor seating, and can accommodate large groups.  If you get a loyalty card (no cost), you can receive email offers for discounts and special meals.  Both the Las Vegas and Miami locations are equally good, and both are located near excellent shopping, making them great choices for lunch when I am running errands on a weekend.  Both locations also have valet parking.

Beautiful grille-great atmosphere for lunch or dinner. We were out playing 'tourist' on the strip, and found Brio on Yelp. Stopped in for lunch and was pleasantly surprised with our 'find' tucked in Town Square just off the Las Vegas Blvd. 
All of the staff including Asst. Manager Ashley welcomed us, making our lunch memorable. Spinach dip with homemade flat bread is excellent!
Generous portions, full bar, comfortable dining area. They offer outside patio seating, too.

One of my FAVORITE places to eat in all of Las Vegas! Town Square is already an upbeat, amazing place to hang out with friends, shop, play but mostly to EAT at. 

What makes Brio a must eatery:
1) Beautiful atmosphere - very old European, classic, romantic.
2) Service was awesome. Our waitress was very attentive and friendly
3) All the food was amazing!

Brio is a must for anyone who has not tried it. You will not be dissapointed!

There's mixed reviews for this place and in trying not to be biased by that, I'm writing this review after having dined there twice.  Had the Shrimp Mediterranean for dinner and eggs benedict for lunch and both were really good.  
 
Perhaps my expectations were really low during both occasions (alas, I guess was biased by the reviews), but the grilled shrimp was pretty good and the orzo/farro pilaf was done just right with great flavor.  I normally don't eat rice/pasta, but I have to say this was worth the carb points!

The eggs benedict was over toasted brioche which was a nice change from the classic english muffin.  Although I think I still prefer the crunch of the english muffin over the brioche which was slightly on the soft side (not soggy, just a softer texture than what one is used to with eggs benedict).  But, this passed the main test of quality with flying colors as the poached egg was done perfectly.  After have an extremely poor experience at nearby Cheesecake factory, the bleeding yolks here were very satisfying.

Both experiences were topped off by excellent service.  You're greeted kindly and they try to make some polite conversation as they walk you to your seat.  The waiter/waitress were really kind and polite.  Really not much more to ask for from an upper end chain restaurant.

As for the conflicting reviews out there, I have to admit I went during off-peak hours and didn't go expecting to have "authentic italian cuisine."

WORSE FOOD I ATE IN MY LIFE! They serve garbage salad with old microwaved oversalted fish and half of it skinny sticks of deep fried potatoes. 
Calamari was old. Deep fry staff fell off They microwave them fir sure half of it was deep fried pickles ??!!! Wtf? Soup from lobster was just over salted sauce
Tea and bread was ok

Over the weekend my lady friends and I tried Brio to celebrate my best friend's birthday. The atmosphere was fantastic, well lit, great decor.  

We started our night off with a couple glass of wine at the bar. I thought the wine list was minimal but the merlot I got was decent. There were lots of great food choices on the menu. I started my meal with the lobster bisque which was excellent.  For my entree I have mushroom stuffed raviolis, very delicious. For desert my girl friend and I tried the crème brulee trio (Vanilla, Carmel & Hot Chocolate). I must say that even though it was nice to try the different flavors I am still a big fan of the plain vanilla crème brulee. 

The overall experience was terrific and plan on returning.

My dinner here was quite a pleasant surprise. I was at Tivoli Park for an event and suggested Brio for dinner since we were there. I dined at a Brio at a different location, but it had been a few years. We had to wait for a few minutes, but that's expected on a Saturday night. Once we were seated, our server took our drink order and then our food order. The wait wasn't very long and the food was delicious. I had the Sweet Potato & Chicken Risotto. My partner had the lasagne. My meal was absolutely scrumptious. I was hesitant about ordering it, but my server guaranteed me that I would enjoy it. He was right. I tasted the lasagna and it was cheesy and tasty. There was nothing special about the service. It was average. The restaurant was a little louder than I. Ike, but once my meal arrived, I easily forgot about that. I'll definitely go back more often.

DO NOT GO TO THIS ESTABLISHMENT. The managers and staff are beyond rude. The establishment is disgusting and not up to health codes. The food used to be delicious now I wouldn't feed their meals to my dogs. Brio should be closed down immediately Scottsdale deserves better!!

I was surprised that I liked Brio!  I am not usually a fan of chains, even small ones.  I fully expected to be disappointed but from start to finish I found this place delicious.  We started with the crab and shrimp dip. The parmesan crisps were excellent company for the tasty dip with actual chunks of crab and shrimp.

I followed with artichoke crusted beef medallions which were great! We also had the risotto which was a bit disappointing.

For desert, they were out of several items but we tried the bread pudding.  This is the one fail for Brio in that it tasted like ice cream on store bought pound or marble cake.  Still overall it was a great time. The drink selections were excellent too.

A little on the pricey side but not out of the spectrum of value.

Far better of late! We go once every couple of weeks now for the consistency. It's predictable in a good way and close to home and office. *Best* service is with John at the bar. Lobster bisque, mushroom soup, carpacccio, and the lasagna are faves.

But... Some minuses still include odd servings if you get food to go or ask for your wedge salad chopped for you; your still only getting half the dish?! Table service is consistent; consistently slow. 

I keep hoping for more.
-----

Previous review:

Ordering to-go: Half the food you order in-house but the same price and they expect to be tipped. Tasty, sure. Predictable in a good way. But having ordered both the soup and salad in-person, spending the same money on tiny to-go containers is unfair. Management contacted, let's see what happens.
Good food. Service was slow but the place was packed. Excellent dessert.  Loved the place settings and decor. Had to park in the garage, but it's not a long walk.

I frequent this restaurant in Gilbert, Arizona. For my 21st birthday, my family, my boyfriend and I went here to meet my family that lives in Henderson for my birthday dinner. All I remember is good wine and fabulous service, just like the Gilbert location. The decor is BEAUTIFUL. Probably a nice place to take someone on a date (hint, hint). 

Side note: this restaurant is located with a plethora of shopping around. SO, if you want to just pop in after doing some cardio while shopping and grab a glass of wine, I feel like it would be enjoyable.

My mom and I love coming here to have a few glasses of wine after shopping. We order their bruschetta, but BE CAREFUL if you have allergies. One of the bruschetta has some shellfish or shrimp on it but the menu did not explicitly say it would be part of the bruschetta platter when we ordered it the first time. My mom is allergic. Scary. Now we know better, I guess. 
Anyways, overall, we love the ambiance here and we love the vino. Ok... We love the vino.

Love this place! The food is absolutely delicious and the service is always spectacular. I recommend ordering their casear salad- their homemade dressing is impeccable. Also their flatbread and pasta alla vodka are both favorite dishes of mine
Love this place, always stop by when i'm in the area.

Beautiful restaurant, very courteous and friendly waitress and the food is mouth watering goodness from appetizers down to its desserts! Luckily we got there for early dinner coz this place gets packed. To the staff, kudos ya'll!!!
Had a great dinner tonight. Good atmosphere. Decent service and the food was pretty good.

Edited review.  Long story short, I had an overall disappointing experience with Brio and thought that it may have just been an off night. The parent company contacted me in regard to my previous review and asked for a second chance. My wife and I took them up on their offer and enjoyed a wonderful meal, professional and friendly service, and an overall excellent experience.  If you have problem with your meal or service, bring it up with the manager (as I should have at the time) and I'm sure they will correct it. I'll definitely visit Brio again and now recommend it.

Kids portions are HUGE! Food is always served hot and fresh. 

I have had great servers but seems service support is sometimes a step behind, which causes the server to get unnecessarily weeded and the table to not get essentials: waiting almost 5 minutes after being seated to get a highchair (which we requested when checking in with the host stand), the bread basket not being dropped off until requested and after our entree hit the table) or water refills...

I still give it 5 stars for my servers always being pleasant, helpful and friendly and because the food has always been on point.

You are in Towne Square so it is going to be more expensive. The food was very good quality and well prepared.  The one disappointment was the jumbo shrimp appetizer.  There was absolutely nothing jumbo about the skinny little shrimp they brought out.  To add insult to injury, it was a really sad.  We mentioned it to the server and he gave us a sheepish look and ended up bringing out a couple more skinny shrimp. 

The remainder of the dishes were on point and properly sized.  I would stop I here again if looking for a good quality meal in Towne Square

I'm not from Vegas, so I'm not sure if this is a restaurant chain, but it surely has a chain atmosphere to it. Think of it as a nicer Macaroni Grill with better food. I ordered the seafood risotto and very much enjoyed it, but the shrimp were not fully cooked and still a little blue. We had to take it home to recook it on the stove. The risotto itself was enjoyable though. Service wasn't excellent, but not terrible. The server notified us that one of the entree we ordered was not available about 15 minutes after all of us ordered, which she should have known ahead of time or notified us earlier, but no harm done.

I love being that Brio has an patio and a huge fire pit for their customer. They have great ambiance and great. The staff are welcoming and very knowledgeable with their menu. Try the salmon salad and bruschetta platter

I've been wanting to try this place out for awhile. Finally went to the town square location. Location wise it was perfect. I love town square. Patio was great. But too hot to sit out. Inside looked like a basic olive garden. Food was alright. Nothing out of this world. Service was good.

I've never dealt with more snobs in my life that I have at this restaurant. My wife and I went here for a couple drinks and appetizers before attending a movie in the same complex.  Our first server, didn't catch his name but he was old enough to be my grandfather, essentially scoffed at us once we told him we didn't want to have dinner but only a couple appetizers and drinks.  After putting in our drink order of some peach iced tea special they had (nothing on the drink menu sounded tasty), he disappeared and sent a younger waiter to help us.  Neither offered an explanation of why the change, but I assume its because Grandpa expected to receive a crappy tip since we weren't there for dinner.  We ordered the Margherita flatbread and ravioli appetizer.  The flatbread was a good concept, but when I think "flatbread." I think flat bread.  This tasted more like a New York style thin crust pizza.  The raviolis were good but tasted like they were frozen and thrown into an oven for a few minutes.

One of my biggest pet peeves while dining out is having an empty glass.  Between the iced tea and a water that I ordered afterwards, both went empty before a refill was offered.  Additionally, after we finished everything, we sat there, with all plates and glasses stacked at the end of the table signifying that we were done, for about 10 minutes before our server finally appeared for the first time since taking our order (no one came to check to see if everything was okay after food was brought out.)

In conclusion, I rated this restaurant a "1" due to a commercialized food taste as well as receiving a level of service that was amazingly horrible.  This place is the very reason people call the area "Snobbsdale" and never in a million years would I recommend this place to my worst enemy.
While our server was nice, it's overpriced and the food tastes like it came out of a box or the freezer. Wont being going back.

Brio's Birthday Deal:
My son chose to spend his 15th birthday dinner here on Monday night.  We (son, his father, and I) arrived at 6:00pm and the patio area was packed when we walked by, but we were promptly seated inside at a spacious booth.  I told the hostess that we were celebrating the teenager's birthday and her immediate reaction was, "Oh, you didn't tell us at the front--let me get his birthday card!"  What?  So, she came right back with a birthday card that was obviously pre-handwritten for such occasions, but it did include a coupon for a free appetizer on our next visit--nice touch.  The kind lady also informed us that the birthday boy was also going to get a free dessert of his choosing with a lit candle, but that there would be no singing--yay!  My son picked the perfect place for his birthday!  We've been to Brio several times and this is one of the reasons--they give great customer service.  Our waitress was attentive, we always had plenty of bread and drink refills, and were satisfied with our dishes:  Chicken Under the Brick, Sweet Potato and Chicken Risotto, and Grilled Shrimp & Orzo.  The kid chose the Chocolate Lava cake and free dessert is always delicious!  If you want to get the most for your money on your birthday, check out Brio:  great food, fantastic service, and freebies!

From happy hour to regular dining I'm never disappointed with the service or food. The beef carpaccio and brio burger are my faves along with the Kaiken Malbec. Wish I could eat here every night of the week.

This review is based off of the last two visits. The food is always delicious here. I really feel as those the management is lacking in the sanitary areas and managing employees. When we were seated our table and seats were FULL of crumbs. The bathroom was dirty and out of toilet paper and there was a roll on the floor. The dividing walls between the tables were very dusty. It's just very disappointing because they are supposed to be an upscale restaurant and their food is amazing but at this point is over priced. When we went on Mother's Day yesterday our bread was frozen in the center! So now I know their bread isn't even freshly baked.

The restaurant itself was beautiful.  The ceilings are very high and the decor is real nice.  The food is way too expensive for what you get. The waiter that we had was ok.  I ordered the lobster bisque only to get our food and no lobster bisque ever came.  The bread to start was ok.  My husband found a piece of wax paper in his piece.  The plate with my food was good looking to my palate but it tasted so bland.  I had the prosciutto and fontina cheese stuffed chicken breast with mashed potatoes.  The  prosciutto was not good and it actually felt like I was eating onions. I don't like onions.  I never did see the cheese or taste it.  The chicken has a bit of fat on it.  The mashed potatoes got cold very quickly as the air conditioning in the restaurant blew in our faces. My husband ordered a pasta dish with lots of shell fish.  He didn't like his either.  

We should of went to Nora's as I was originally thinking of first but decided on Brio because I wanted to go to Town Square.

Great happy hour! The service was attentive. The parking was convenient. The food was very good. The rest room was clean! 

It was my first time there and we were happy! Thanks.
Lunch at Brios - Our 3 plates were a TRIFECTA of PERFECTION. My Steak Salad was great! Service was A+ too. Highly Recommend Brios. Enjoy =)

Brio is one of my favorite spots to go for happy hour because their drinks and appetizers are always so amazing. I love that this Brio is located in beautiful Tivoli Village (which so happens to be the center that I work at). Their outdoor seating is beautiful and overlooks the fountain. Our server Justin was very helpful and fun to talk to, and he made our experience that much more enjoyable. I always get the flatbreads and bruschettas whenever I eat at Brio which are all very delicious. Their drinks are great as well, my personal favorite from their happy hour menu is the Santa Rosa. It's basically a rosé sangria.

Convient to the Red Rock, Summerlin, Lakes area of Las Vegas. Restaurant atmosphere was inviting and pleasant. The service was top notch, and the food excellent. The meals are a great value. They should implement a children's menu, the food was great but way too much and wasteful for little ones.

Came here last night for the very first time having received two gift cards. Was very happy to receive 1000-points for reserving a table from open table. 
Our server greeted us immediately and was served with a basket of bread. I started off w a glass of prosecco and put in two appetizers for the table: the calamari and the spicy shrimp & eggplant. The calamari was good, nothing special. It came with two dipping sauces: garlic aioli and a marinara sauce. But the spicy shrimp & eggplant was really good!! The eggplant was lightly breaded to a perfect crisp topped off with shrimp. So far, my favorite!! And another perk!! If you check in on Yelp, you get a free appetizer! So was very happy about this. 

As my entree, I got the shrimp Mediterranean which is 5 jumbo grilled shrimp on top of orzo, farro, broccoli, asparagus, tomatoes, spinach, and feta. It's the light menu so it only has 485 calories! Might as well eat light since the appetizers and the Cesar salad I got. My husband got the shrimp and lobster fettuccine. It looked great but when I saw my husband's face I knew something wasn't right. He thought it tasted too fishy and he actually sent it back. (He NEVER sends anything back so I was really taken back). He ended up trading it for the pasta Brio instead which has grilled chicken, seared mushrooms, w roasted red pepper sauce. He said it was better but nothing spectacular... he felt like it needed more sauce. 

My shrimp Mediterranean was good but it didn't blow me away but if you're picking from the light menu, what do you expect? Besides I was full from the bread, appetizers and salad.. my girlfriend got their ravioli special which I wished I had gotten instead. It's buy one, take one home! Very cool! You can have another full meal the very next day. I ended up eating one shrimp and lobster ravioli and it was excellent!! 

Overall, the food is good. Definitely recommend the spicy shrimp & eggplant appetizer. And the service was excellent! Took off one star simply due to the fact that the food is good but not spectacular. Will come back and try their happy hour.

Great customer service. Atmosphere was nice with ambient lighting and great presentation. Overall fine dining experience however I did not really care for the menu. Don't get me wrong, the food was great, but nothing really popped up to me.

As far as chains go this is a not so bad one. It's in a great location and is always busy. On weekend nights a reservation is needed (you have to call to make one). The staff is always friendly and the service pretty quick. If you sign up for their emails you get the occasional good coupon. The menu is pretty large and has much more than just your typical Italian place pasta on it. There is outdoor seating and even a small outdoor bar.

My good friend was in town for her birthday and she wanted to meet at Town Square for lunch and shopping. She chose Brio. I am not a huge fan but agreed to meet since it was her birthday. My other friend and I arrived first and scored a nice table outside as the weather was perfect. Our two friends arrived shortly after us and we all got comfortable. I just wanted to have a light lunch so I chose the Strawberry Chicken salad. My friend chose the Chicken Limone. My salad was better than expected with good flavor from the spicy pecans and the goat cheese. We also enjoyed really good service. Our server was always there filling up our water and tea. She was kind enough to take a couple of pictures for us too which I know can be a pain when one has several other tables to take care of. I have been to both Brio's here in town and I would have to say that I like the one at Town Square over the one at Tivoli Village. The atmosphere and the outdoor patio dining at Town Square is much nicer then having to inhale exhaust from the cars that are driving through Tivoli Village. I do like Brio's happy hour too during the summer as they offer some great drink specials at decent prices. This was an afternoon of good times with good friends to celebrate Buon Compleanno!
They have a burger here during happy hour that's worth 12 bucks but discounted for 4 dollars between 3 to 6pm. I can't get over how good this burger is for 4 bucks. The best value in vegas.

Let's get one thing straight - I love Brio at Town Square, so after going to the Kidville CYME today (8/22/11,) I headed over here at 11:30 AM. The place was pretty dead, save for a handful of tables. Literally, you could count the tables that were full on one hand. My three siblings and I were sat at a booth right next to the kitchen (annoying) and given menus. 

Our waiter would periodically pop in to say that he would be with us in a minute and after a little over 10 minutes, we finally got to order our waters. 5-7 minutes later, he ask if we still needed time with the menu or if we were ready to order. We were ready. After the wait, my sister and I were talking about just getting up and leaving - it's aggravating to be discriminated against because we're young. Don't put us in the back by the kitchen because we have two kids with us and don't ignore us because you think you won't get a good tip. Bad service, like what was exhibited, equals a bad tip.

Anyway, I ordered the lunch portion of the sweet potato & chicken risotto with the bistecca salad ($12.95.) My sister got the fettuccine rustica ($9.95) and then our younger siblings got the kid's ravioli ($4.95) and the kid's fettuccine alfredo ($4.50.) 

My food was okay but extremely salty/ msg-ish. It had that overwhelming umami flavor that comes with excessive msg so that made me leery. I actually got really full quite quickly and couldn't finish it all. Also, the risotto was kind of unappetizing with the cubes of not soft sweet potato and green beans. It was edible, but I wouldn't order it again. My sister complained that her pasta was also extra salty and she left most of the "goodies" in her bowl. The kids liked their pasta - it actually came in the same size bowls as our meals with the same sized portions. I was actually worried that the waiter didn't write that they were kids' meals.  

We got one water refill about 5 minutes before we got the check. We would have ordered dessert but my sister said she was really sick of constantly waiting for our waiter so I paid $40 and we bounced. Go to Brio at Town Square at Happy Hour if you want a great deal and great service. Come to Brio at Tivoli Village if you want to be ignored and leave unsatisfied with your meal.

First time at Brio today! Decided to sit outside because the weather was amazeballs. The wait wasn't too bad (20-ish minutes) and we got to sit outside in the nice weather. However, there were numerous hostesses that all seemed not very friendly. They were just okay. Our waiter was chill and friendly enough. Key word -- "enough". Meh.

My lunch date ordered something on the brunch menu and waited quite a while before the waiter came and told us that brunch ended at 2 (it was 3pm). However, the menu stated that brunch ends at 3:30pm, which was bewildering to say the least. Last time something like this happened to me where my original dish couldn't be made and I waited a while, the restaurant gave me my meal for free. Brio offered nothing as compensation and the apology sounded far from sincere.

So why 4 stars if the service was not very good? The fooooood! The sourdough bread was warm and yummy and the cracker positively bursted with flavor. My risotto was tasty and cheesy without being too heavy (the chicken in it was a little dry though). The salad I chose with my risotto was the wedge salad, which was huge and crispy and well-plated and just awesome. 

My date ended up ordering the salmon with angel hair pasta and he was a little disappointed when the plate arrived at the table. "Only this much food for 15 bucks?!" Well he took a bite of the salmon and was surprised to find it juicy and tender. The taste definitely made it worth the price.

The food far exceeded my expectations but the service left me hungry for more. I will probably eat here again if I'm at Town Square and the weather is nice. Hopefully the employees will be friendlier and enjoy their jobs more next time I visit.

Brio, where have you been all my life?! I was down at Town Square on Saturday, 4/16/11 because my sister had to meet with one of the directors for a project she was working on and I didn't feel like sitting through the meeting. I wasn't going to get home till way past midnight so I needed to grab some food. I wanted to check out Brio, but assumed it would be super expensive and I felt silly spending $40 to eat by myself. I headed on over to CPK but it was overpriced and I wasn't in love with anything I saw on the menu. Despite my reservations, I checked out Brio and Wow! They're actually cheaper than CPK!

I went inside and was told it would be 10-20 minutes for a table for one. I was mid-heel turn when the hostess told me I could eat at the bar. The weather was gorgeous and the bartender was very friendly. I ordered the chopped salad and lobster bisque ($1 up charge) deal. The bread basket is amazing with the best crispy flat breads and sourdough I've ever had. My total, with tax and tip came out to $11, which isn't bad whatsoever. When my sister showed up, the waitress told me the Dr. Pepper was on her that I ordered for my sister, which was nice of her. Forget the Strip, my sister and I agreed that this would be our go to restaurant from now on. 

Because I enjoyed my first visit so much, two days later, 4/18/11, after hitting up the 51's game, Beau S. and I headed over here for some after the game drinks. We walked right in to a fairly empty restaurant. We went to the bar and were told it was happy hour. I got beef carpaccio and he got the steak bruschetta and they were each $2.95. It was a great deal and I loved all the capers that came with my carpaccio. I got a soda water and Beau got some sort of beer. We also split a caffe panna cotta that was out of this world. The total, with tip was $15. Really great deal. 

Obviously, I'll be back for a third time!

I came here for lunch with a few friends and we honestly were not impressed. The food was not that great. We ordered off of the lunch menu. I ordered a prosciutto sandwich and a lobster bisque soup. The sandwich did not have any prosciutto on it and was mostly slimy cheese and the soup was extremely salty and I think there was a hair in it. A friend of mine is vegan and ordered a plain salad with just vegetables in it and they charged her $20 for it. She brought it up to the waitress and she said it was because it was a modified salmon salad... But she didn't have salmon in it which is the most expensive part. We also waited 40 minutes for our food and it wasn't even right. It came with items she didn't ask for and it took an additional ten minutes for the waitress to bring her side of salad dressing. It's a shame that the food isn't great because the place is really nice and has patio seating.

After work decided to go to Brio happy hour. It's from 9pm to 11pm. Probably some of the best deals I've seen in a while. Had a red sangria which was pretty strong for $4 dollars and they had a variety of foods ranging from $4 to $6 dollars. The Brio Burger is good and the potato chips are great. Also had the flatbread pizza which is good also. If your looking for a good happy hour with good food and drinks... This place won't disappoint.

Food:8/10
Service:10/10
Price:8/10
Atmosphere: 8/10

We've seen Brio around towns square for the past few years now and decided to give it a try for Valentines Day. We were not disappointed! 

The food was really good! I ordered the New York Strip ( it was cooked to perfection) and my girlfriend ordered the Signature dish Chicken Limone. Everything was cooked great and tasted amazing except the roasted veggies, they were just blah.
Our waiter, Rami, was awesome!! He has a great personality and genuine customer service. He made our entire experience amazing and is the main reason we will start to come to Brio more often!
The price isn't too bad considering the amount of food you get. Our meals along with an appetizer and 2 drinks a piece came out to about $120 which was worth it because of the service and the quality of the food.
The atmosphere of Brio strikes me as classy but not too classy. You don't need to wear cocktail attire, but you should wear a nice button or polo. It definitely added to the experience.

So usually when my hubby craves for Italian dining this is one of our go to restaurants. We celebrated birthdays and one anniversary here. The food is always delishhhhhhh. I love the ambiance of the restaurant. They have a great outdoor firepit sitting areas as well as indoor seating with a view of high ceilings and Italian art on the wall. Waiters are extremely nice n helpful . I would def recommend this restaurant and location

They ran out of chicken. This place loses a star because they sold something they did not have, and did not let my friend change her order, but instead wait for them to obtain/prepare more chicken, ending with her getting a plate of mashed potatoes and vegetables, and finally offered a to-go box for her chicken (which was ready after we had all eaten and hung out for a little while afterwards). However, I will try to review this place apart from this experience.

Like a typical nice chain from out of town, Brio has all the atmosphere and cool factor you can have in our cookie-cutter buildings. The service is accomodating, willing to join in a surprise party with a slow arriving group. The drink selection is decent, a fair amount of wine but a limited selection of beers on tap. The food is quite pricey for what you get, as I would compare this to a Romano's or Olive Garden in actual taste and quality, though they do get style points for appearance. I enjoyed the food, though, and my friends enjoyed the atmosphere, and that's what counts.

Except for the Chicken fiasco. That docks them a star, because when a situation like that happens, you should do more than expect the customer to wait and pay full price instead of changing orders.

Love this place, something nice for summerlin.  This is a great  restaurant for birthdays, date nights, dinner with my friends etc.  Great service above average for price point in fact.  It is often crowded but always seem to get a seat with no wait unless I'm with a group. Love the mints when you leave.  I have been getting the Shrimp Verdutta which I can't eat all at once but always take home and eat the next day too.  SO good.  I easily would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a nice dinner not over priced.  Just took my parents here in fact.

Food: steak salad, salmon with asparagus, and kids spaghetti with meat sauce. Food was just ok. My daughter didn't like her spaghetti. I tasted it and the noodles were overcooked. My steak was cooked perfectly on my salad, but the rest was meh. 

Ambiance: nicely decorated. 

Service: attentive. 

Location: conveniently in Town Center. 

Too many other options out there, so probably won't revisit.

I love Brio Tuscan Grille. I get the fillet mignon medallions with the Gorgonzola mushroom sauce on them. I love the crackers that they serve with the tables that have flaxseeds on them. And they're one of the few restaurants that have good wines so when I go there I'll actually have a glass. The head chef, Gustavo comes out when he sees me, since he loves the fact that I'm a foodie and I really appreciate his cooking.

First and last time here. Really slow customer service. Took 20 minutes from the time we got seated to even get our drinks in. We finally got our food and it was alright. Nothing that really impressed us. Our bruschetta was really bad though. The bread was stale and really difficult to eat. The lobster bisque was OKAY. I would have left three stars but our waiter was really rude and forgot about us all evening...save your time and money.
Went here for a business Christmas party and the food was good and the service was good. Will go back
Can't laugh at Brio!! Anna might think your intoxicated and refuse you service... go to Parkway Tavern instead!!

So the service was still just ok.  Bread before drinks my friends drink was not replenished the same time as ours so he felt like he was experiencing two different dining experiences.   My brio brunch burger had the option of adding a salad for $4.50 extra so I did.   The salad came out literally with just one crouton and it is so tiny for $4.50 this salad is worth .50. Pasta not as al dente as it should be.  I used to absolutely adore this brio and now I won't even go there.

This is a great place to find breaded eggplant and delicious veggies, meat and salad. They use a sauce with their dishes that is just to die for. The service is always great and very attentive. I love coming here for happy hour and it's always a pleasant experience.

Very beautiful Italian restaurant w/gr8 food and good service.  Nice wine list and bar menu w/gr8 happy hour.  Pasta dishes, grilled dishes and appetizers are my favorites.  Eggplant and shrimp, beef carpaccio, calamari, ravioli, lasagna, vodka penne and mahi mahi are recommended.   Desserts are average. Service is slow sometimes.

The place
Beautiful interior, can't complain about that.  I'm sure the other reviewers probably do more justice to the description.

The food
The food was tasty, but not outstanding.  The first thing I tried to order was some kind of sandwich with turkey - which I was told was no longer on the menu, hmm.  If it's not on the menu, then why is it on the menu?

The bottom line
A bit pricy but the quality was above average so not too bad.  Dinged one star for out of date menu.

We're visiting Vegas from CA and went here for dinner with friends.  We knew we got a brand new waiter, because another waiter was shadowing him, so we were like....here we go....this should be interesting!  Wrong!  This kid "Justin" was GREAT!!!!!  Good hire Brio!  Awesome food! Awesome service!  We'll be back!

Cody was our waiter and we had amazing table side service. The meals were perfectly cooked and the bread was warm. We only wished we had room for dessert. Highly recommended as always. The "go to" for a great family dinner.

We were a party of two and both loved the meal.
I had the Caesar salad, and it was great.
For my main meal I had Grilled Chicken "Under The Brick". Not a morsel of chicken, or the mashed potatoes was left on the plate. So good!
For dessert, they brought over their "dessert presentation". I opted to have something that wasn't on the presentation, the Chocolate Layer Cake. It was incredible. This is a no-brainer for next time!
Highly recommended!

Lobster rigatoni with shrimp.

cooked lobster too much and it was bit chewy, shrimp was good. Would ask for more seasoning I had to add salt on my plate. Great service and worth to try lomonade

So okay.  You know Happy Hour at Brooklyn I'd just very awesome! Now I will tell you that lunch is very excellent also.  We had the steak salad.  I recommend it.  Max and Larry handled 2 demanding women and made them leave with smiling get faces. :) can't wait to return to Brooklyn with husbands to taste the delicious good Thank you!p

The food here is fantastic. My wife and I eat here on a regular basis because the quality of the experience has always been so high.

The atmosphere is comfortable, and family friendly even though there is a bar off of the entrance. I would never come here with out a reservation though in the evenings because the wait times are always at least 30 minutes.

The restaurant seems to train their help well since the service levels are high being attentive to its patrons without being annoying.

I highly recommend.

Very very very disappointed with this trip to Brio.  We had eaten here several times in the past and the food was pretty good though pricy.  A couple of weeks ago we saw that they had gotten 6 violations on the dirty dinning report but since we had good luck in the past we figured that they would prob be trying very hard to work past that issue.  We went into the bar for there happy hour and the first thing we came across was when the person across from us asked us if we where supposed to get bread while we wait??? She asked the bartender and was told that they had changed the policy that now you have to ask for bread if you want it.  The bread is usually a curtesy at most restaurants how do you have to ask for a curtesy either you give us the bread or not but to have to ask for curtesy bread is insulting.  We ordered some bread and where told it would be a while because they needed to bake some more??? So we ordered some appetizers we sat and waited and waited and waited from my seat I could see the kitchen and I saw what I thought must be our food sitting under the heat lamps where it sat and sat and sat finally the manager called over the server and sure enough it was our food which was of course getting cold and our burgers that where supposed to be medium where very WELL done.  All around it was a very lackluster performance at a time when they weren't even busy.  Our budget for eating out is not as flush as it used to be and the disappointment Of this visit is just irritating and kind of ruined our afternoon.  Don't think we will come back  if we are in the area there are a lot of other restaurants and I don't want to waste my time or money.

Ate lunch here with my husband and in-laws for his birthday. I had the shrimp fettuccini lunch special which I enjoyed. The food was really good and service was average. Just would like to advise management to remind  their staff to inform guests about their loyalty program. I would have loved to join, and the only reason I know about it is from my friend's review!

I received a message from a "Bill B" of Brio who wanted my contact info for what he said was a "follow up" by their "guest services team". Well that worked about as well as the restaurant because I have never heard from them. Very sad situation and we all know what happens when restaurants like this drop the ball repeatedly !!!!
Sat at the bar couch for 15 minutes.  Bartenders and hostess walked by us 3 times not even a glance! Wow.  Horrible.  Got up and left to Mexican food place across the street.  Unbelievable.

The service here is horrible! We sat we for 15 minutes before our drink our cane. We had to sit another 45 minutes before our meal came. There restaurant is empty. Nobody ever came to check on our drinks prior to our meal arriving. The meals came and he checked our meal one minute after the meal arrived and never came back to check on our meal or drinks. Our bread (2 servings)was never replaced

Excellent food....been here 3 times and never disappointed.
Waiters/waitresses explained clearly menu options.

Will be back for sure
Enjoyed dinner with friends.  We had halibut special,  chicken risotto, cod,  short ribs.  All were good.  Service was good,  nice surroundings.  We have been here several times and will return.

The quality of food at Brio is a pleasant surprise.  The lunch menu has a lot of variety and I probably would have been happy ordering one of 4 or 5 different things, but lasagna wins almost every time, and Brio's version is quite nice.  It comes with your choice of 3 different salads (chopped, Caesar, or house) and I was very happy with the chopped.  Far more than a boring plate of greens, and it isn't drowning in dressing.   The lasagna arrived not long after, and it's made with white sauce, meat, and the usual noodles/cheese/sauce.  I dove in and was a little sad when I took the last bite because for a second, I contemplated ordering another.  It's nicely balanced, has just a teeny tiny amount of burned edges of cheese/noodle.and the meat is moist, like a meatloaf.

Mimosa wasn't anything to get too excited about, but the raspberry gelato (not on the dessert tray) was the perfect amount of dessert.  Allegedly Brio may make its way to California, and I can't wait!  So much better than Olive Garden!

It's really a shame that California doesn't have any Brio locations.  This was my 3rd time at Brio and just about everything on the menu is excellent.  It's also a great value, with dinner items around $20 per head.  Service has consistently been good, and they do a good job keeping an eye on your bread & drinks, & asking if you want more.  I had the lasagna, which was very good and Mrs. C was extremely happy with her petite filet mignon.  The restaurant is slightly noisy with an open kitchen, so it's also good for families or if you have small children.

Brio is a nice change of pace if you're trying to get away from the buffets, and just 5 minutes from the airport or Mandalay Bay!

went there for dinner last night, Feb 27. Definitely wasn't bad, but for the price, wasn't great either. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and in a great location of Scottsdale, nice for walking around after dinner. Waitress came to the table and offered us drinks. I asked about the beer and whether it came in 12 and or 16 oz glasses, she said only one size, a pint, OK fine and how much are the beers, she didn't know, really? I ordered the chicken pesto, presentation was very nice, chicken was dry. There are tons of restaurants in the Phoenix area and this is not one I would go back to

Stopped in at San Tan Mall on a Saturday afternoon with friends.  The ambiance is nice. They have a nice patio but it was too chilly for me to eat outside. Middle of the day so not very busy. We were seated right away and took advantage of the $5 Bloody Mary and Mimosa special.  I had minestrone soup which had a lot of vegetables. I should have had it as an entrée.  It was really good. Yummy! The bread offering was good.  A few different types. My entrée was a chicken and spinach carbonara.  Good.  Not the best I have ever had but good. My friends had a different chicken dish and the other had a beautiful salad, which they both loved! Service was good. Our server was pleasant and attentive. I enjoyed it and would go again.

Love Brio's happy hour and the special Rachel Sangria (ask for it - it is BOMB) ... Ok the bar food happy hour for me is .. Bread Basket, Brio Burger, Ravioli Caprese are the best things on the menu. I am a huge fan of Artichoke dip but this one falls short  as it is too cheesy and not enough artichokes. I give it 5 stars because it is my favorite place for happy hour if you get there early enough for a seat, usually there is a wait. The ambiance is good, good wait staff and my favorite happy hour food & drink is located here.

Good place, not my favorite though. Super busy and noisy. Very crowded!! If you come there with friends and want to enjoy some conversation with them, forget it. Not going to happen. Can't hear each other. That's kind of aggravating.
Also if you are not wine lover, you might not enjoy any other drink that you order. I always order Mi Tai. They don't know how to make it right. Always comes out bitter. Mi Tai is a sweet drink, guys!! A place with a bar should know how to make cocktail!!
The food is good
I love Brio, it's always reliably good food for an affordable price,  the service is great and always fast.  It can be 1-2 hours wait on weekends for dinner.

Standing in Brio right now. Had 6:30 pm reservations. We arrived 15 minutes early.  It's 6:45 pm right now.  Hostess told us they overbooked and have 15 reservations for 6:30pm and their is two more tables in front of us.  Not the biggest deal if we didn't already have tickets for a 7:50pm movie.  It's a Saturday night,  at this point we are screwed if we go somewhere else.   Did I mention I have 2 starving kids with me who spent all day at a karate Boot camp.   They are not happy and neither are we.  After rushing through our meal, we just made the movie. But we did get front row seats to the movie.

Hey its been 10 months.  Still haven't heard from you.  Guess it wasn't that important.

I love coming here, mostly because of the beef carpaccio appetizer. Sitting outside is nice when the weather allows, and the food has good value. 3 stars cause of the service - the hostess was very rude and we almost left the place on her account , she almost seemed pleased that it's a 40 min wait

July 2, 2011 Saturday - dinner 8:30 PM
2 adults and a teenager

Atmosphere - 4 stars
Food - 2 stars
Service - 1 star

Background - After a long day of driving from Reno we wanted Italian close to our hotel.

Atmosphere - The best thing going with this place.  Lofting ceilings with great colors covering the walls make for a warm inviting place.

Food
Appetizer - Free bread came in a small basket, it contained three triangular cracker thin bread slices covered in seasoning and a chuck of soft bread.  The cracker bread was seasoned, looked, and tasted like pizza.   They could have offered to bring more bread when it was gone.  If I was eating some pasta as my meal I would have liked it to arrive without me begging. 

Main Course - They did not have any stuffed pasta that I was interested in.  So I went with the sliced steak salad.  The steak was over peppered and the medallion pieces needed to be cut.  The lettuce was nothing special, mostly iceberg chopped into small squares.  The highlight of the meal was the candied pecans.  This comment you could put under service or here, the menu indicates that steak will be cooked to order.  The waiter  never asked and I forgot as it took a long time to place our meal order with him.

Dessert - skipped it  

Service - This was really lacking.  The floor was simply nasty.  Noodles all over the floor next to wear I sat.  As we sat there I noticed a Gatorade bottle on the floor next to me after the lady at the next table over placed in on the floor before they left.  The busy boy must have not noticed it as he kicked it under the table.  I typically only drink water with my meal now, and when you fill a 12 ounce glass completely with ice, you better be coming back with more water frequently.  But not the case here, only once was my water refilled, placing the glass at the edge of the table should all I have to do.   As we were finishing up our meal, a different bus boy took care of the other table next to us.  The table was covered in a table cloth.  When he placed the new one on the table it was like he was making a bed up and down with cloth.  I know it was a hot night but I really do not need a table cloth fan next to me.

We absolutely love the happy hour for date nights it has an excellent environment the eggplant shrimp dish is really good my husband always gets the pizza and the burger we really enjoy coming here for date nights
Been for happy hour only I love love that salt and pepper shrimp so good and the moscal mule. Bree was the bartender super nice helpful and made great drinks we will be back !

Party of 14, staff was friendly, professional and even took time to take a photo for us! Great menu with options for everyone, even accommodated my husbands eating challenges. Well done and thanks for making memories with our family.

I'm a fan!

Came here for an early dinner out on the patio yesterday after work.

I was looking to eat a yummy salad since I'm "watching" what I'm eating... 

Wow... the salmon salad is amazing! Super pretty too! Only thing I didn't like was the over drenching of dressing.

I would come back just for the salad... maybe a pasta dish whenever I feel like busting my butt doing 2 hours of cardio post Brio :)


If you're in the area... stop by Brio and have lunch or dinner out on the patio!

I'll be back!

Personally I'm not a huge fan of Italian food but we went here for a work dinner. I was pleasantly surprised. I ordered the Mediterranean shrimp for dinner with the lobster bisque as an appetizer. 
We were in a large group so I understand the service being a little slow, however it was a Wednesday night. The restaurant was not that busy. I don't like when I'm at a restaurant and I have to wait long periods of time for a water or drink refill while I'm eating if the restaurant isn't full. 
The food was great! I absolutely loved the lobster bisque, great texture with chunks of lobster in it. It went really well with the cracker-like bread that came in the bread basket, which was also fantastic. And I never like bread. The Mediterranean shrimp was good, and I was pleasantly surprised because I usually don't pair seafood with cheese. It was a nice light dinner and I was able to finish it without feeling too stuffed. Everyone else at the table ordered pasta and took home leftovers. My neighbor ordered pasta with sausage and it smelled great! 
I would go back for sure.

The worst service. Had a baptism gathering there n had about 40 people and they gave us two servers only n just asking for drinks it would take so long. Also the food they said it was a family size but it wasn't because it wasn't enough for half of the people we had!!! And when asked to bring more it took them more then 20 minutes to bring more food to the table when they should of been prepared!! I'm sorry but I know for next time to not bother coming here anymore!!

I've been here a couple of times.  We were seated pretty quickly each time but each time we had to wait a long time before our server showed up. 

This is fine as the menu is quite large but I'd like to at least have my drink order placed especially on a Sunday when I want a latte and they say that it takes extra long to get it.   

I'm gluten free and they have a gluten free menu which is great but it was very disappointing as it had about 3 items on it.   I know if I come back here I'll just end up "cheating" and taking benadryl because it's very slim pickings.  I will say that the gluten free pasta was very delicious and cooked very well. 

I'd rank it a bit higher if the service was better.   I really really hate waiting and waiting.

Got the Grilled Salmon Fresca. The salmon was tasty with a hint of charred. The asparagus had a good flavor and texture but the overall dish arrived luke warm. My sister ordered the Ham & Eggs Benedict. The eggs were over-poached. My cousin ordered the Berries French Toast which was tasty with the maple syrup and warmer than my dish. 

The booth wasn't clean and the plates for the bread weren't clean either which lessened the quality of this place. Go to the one in Scottsdale!

Absolutely LOVE this place!!! Great happy hour, great service, great food, and the ambience is beautiful. Perfect for a date, or just meeting up with the girls for happy hour on the patio. I have been here a handful of times and have yet to be disappointed in anything.

Yum! The bread, the appetizers, the salads, yes! Our server was very funny and when we told him we were eating just apps and salads because we had too much popcorn, he kept joking around and teasing us. He was friendly but not too friendly. He helped us but not too much. I got the salmon salad and it was delicious! I got the dressing on the side and it was even good the next day!

I have wanted and wanted to try this place since I moved to the area.  Finally decided to go ahead and give it a go.  So, we walked in and got seated right away.  It was not busy at all, as it was 3:00 pm.  It took the waiter a longer-than-it-should-have-taken while to come and take our drink order. Quite a bit longer, he brings our drinks and a bread basket. We asked for extra butter. We order an appetizer and our entrees. Twenty minutes pass and we get the appetizer, which was delicious. We remind the waiter about the butter.  Several minutes later a different waiter brought another pat of butter.  Another 45 minutes pass and our entrees arrive. Everyone thought their dish was alright at best.  After we all stop eating it takes another 20 minutes for the waiter to return and ask about boxes and drops off the check (without asking about dessert).  Another 15 minutes later the waiter comes by and grabs the check.  He brings the credit slips back 5 minutes after.

From the time we entered the restaurant to the time we walked out the door, almost two hours had passed.  That is a long time to wait around for overpriced "alright" food. Especially when the waiter seemed to have absolutely no clue what he was doing.

Brio's website says they have "call ahead seating and take reservations", I attempted to call at 5 to leave our name, the hostess said there was currently no wait but that could change. When I asked to leave my name she says they are booked until 8. 20 minutes later we arrive and wait 65min. to be seated.

The atmosphere is terrible, tables are too close together. My pasta alla vodka was delicious, although overpriced. My husbands had pork chops which were EXTREMELY undercooked, pretty much raw. We will not be returning.

Brio is the perfect place to have that romantic date you've been meaning to have with your significant other.

I went to the Summerlin location for Valentine's Day and was impressed. They take both reservations and walk-ins so lucky for us since we didn't make a reservation. The estimated wait time was 80 minutes? But we actually got in earlier, probably 30 to 40 minutes?

Anyways... We ate outside near a heat lamp which wasn't too bad in today's weather. We ordered calamari as our appetizer which was fine. I mean, it's calamari... Not much else to it. For our entrees, I got the pasta brio which is grilled chicken with rigatoni. My boyfriend got campenelle carbonara which kind of resembled chicken Alfredo. I also got a flirtini - probably won't get that again. It resembled cough syrup to me, but that could just be my taste buds.

All in all, for $67 this was definitely not a bad place for a date. We will probably check out the one in Town Square once the weather gets warmer since they have a fire pit outside.

Happy eatings!

Review is for happy hour at the bar only. I've been to Brio a couple years ago and although its a beautiful place, the food was forgettable. Better than olive garden, but what isnt? Today was my first time there for happy hour and I may become a regular. 

No drink specials except $5 martinis on Thursdays, but their cocktails are pretty reasonable. However they have one of the best food specials - a nice variety of things for $2.95. We went with the beef carpaccio, pepperoni sausage flat bread, brio burger and shrimp cocktail. I didn't expect much for the price, so it was a pleasant surprise that all of the food was a good sized portion and plated nicely. 

Carpaccio was fresh and served with some greens on top - so perfect for a summer evening on the patio. Burger looked like those preformed Costco patties but it was cooked perfectly medium and yummy with a soft tasty bun. Flat bread was the perfect size for two and the dollops of I'm guessing goat cheese? on each piece was a great finish. Shrimp cocktail wasn't a typical cocktail - cocktail sauce on the bottom with tossed romaine and 4 or 5 ok sized shrimp on top. Everything in it was fresh and good. I'm betting it's a lot better than that sketchy 99cent shrimp cocktail downtown. 

My friends white peach sangria was a little sweet, I loved my strawberry basil lemonade (non alcoholic). There were some issues with the bill re the drinks, but the manager was quick to take care of it. Service at the bar was pretty great - bartender was attentive, everything came out quickly. The manager seemed very hands on. He kept making sure we were ok, that our food was coming and immediately corrected the bill. 

I may have to try Brio for lunch or dinner again soon. Hopefully that experience will be as good as today's.

This place is definitely a chain Italian restaurant and you can taste that. The meals are neither noteworthy or horrible. The last time I went I ordered the risotto with lobster because the waitress said it was one of the guests favorites. I don't know how you mess up something as delicious as lobster and risotto! First, the texture was runny. Second, the taste was just way off. I barely ate any of my $30 dish. We shared a salad beforehand and that wasn't bad. Our friends liked their dishes. I can't recall what they had. So it may just be a preference thing.
love the bellinis & eggplant shrimp!

I love me some Brio! Yeah I am sure this will be a real balanced review...  At any rate I really enjoy the Brio at the Town Square location and thought I would give this new spot in Summerlin a try for a casual business dinner. I will save you sometime and just let you know it was a real solid choice. The food came out very quickly and the happy hour specials were priced rather inexpensively. Mid way through our meal the executive chef made his rounds and made sure to say hello to every table and introduce himself.  I have to say thats a rarity and the touch was well received.  I honestly have no problems recommending this place to anyone as the bruschetta choices are all amazing, the Veal Milanese was great, the ravioli were cooked to perfection, and the wine list had some great choices for excellent prices.
It's a long wait here , food it's ok nothing that will have me coming back for more, better location at summerlin

I've gone here a couple times now and been really happy each time. The staff is really nice and polite, our most recent waiter, Matt, was absolutely amazing. He went out of his way to make our son feel included and even brought out some dough for him to play with! We had a great dinner.
Good food, good staff. Great Happy Hour food and prices. Everything is $2.95.

Brio is one of my favorite Italian restaurants.  You're not going to get mama's memorable home cooking from Italy, but it's good food.  Even though most dishes are very flavoable and delish, the lasagna is my favorite.  Great staff that's efficient, and professional.  Plenty of parking in garage.  You may have a wait some nights.

Love the happy hour good affordable prices was able to try everything off the HR menu few times I've went here usually busy at the bar and sometimes hard to find a seat but worth the wait.. Bartenders are very polite and attentive.

This place is a-ok and I'm sort of a fan so I'll round it up to 3.5.  

I don't go out of my way to come here, but occasionally I'll crave some beef carpaccio so I'll end up here.  I've had a few of their entrees and they were all very good.  The risotto here is really tasty and one of my favorites.  My only gripe is the portion.  I've asked servers if they do half portions and they've always responded with an "I don't know."  Don't know how hard it is to ask the chefs if its possible, but apparently it is.  For this reason I rarely ever order an entree to myself because it's such a waste.  I sometimes share one with my dining companion and the portion is enough to fill us both up.  The portions are definitely by the whole "chain" restaurant standard.  I think it would be nice to offer half portions for those who cannot devour a whole meal to themselves.

That said, I find myself coming more often just for their happy hour.  It's such an awesome deal.  $2.95 a plate!!!  They have a pretty big selection from their appetizers and the portions are still big enough to share that you won't need one plate for each person.  They also have $5 martinis.  The basil one is tasty but sorta too sweet.  I've also tried the sparkling raspberry and it's not so good.  It tasted like watered down raspberry vodka.  Happy hour is from Monday-Thursday (possibly Friday?) 3-7pm and again at 9-11pm.  

Service is so, so.  Not the greatest but not the worst either.  Sometimes it seems like there's an excess of waitstaff.  I don't care too much of the ones I've gotten, they almost always seem rushed and uninterested.  The bar area is not that great either, but I dont expect much; it's whatevzzz.. can't complain at $2.95 lol.

Opted for a small/quick Sunday lunch at Brio with my two kiddos in Town Square, as it was on my radar of nicer restaurants in Town Square for my fiancé's birthday party reservations later this week. I left feeling pretty disappointed. 

I don't like waitstaff who start out very nice and then snub you when you just order an appetizer and drinks. It was lunchtime, not prom night. Geezus. Our waiter's attitude changed instantly when we ordered a bruschetta, kids meal and drinks. He actually said, "That's it?"  He never came back to check on our drinks or to clear dishes. He was in an ass-kissing conversation with the table across from us when he dropped off the check, it was an absolute after thought. 

The bruschetta sampler was delicious, and my daughter liked her kids lasagna, but I won't be coming back thanks to the service. I am not willing to risk putting our group of friends & family through crappy service for an expensive, special occasion dinner. 

I understand that society believes it acceptable to tip off the dollar amount of a meal. This is why waiters get annoyed when you don't spend the big bucks, I get it. I, however, tip off the quality of the service. I believe a customer who orders an ice tea deserves the same great service as a customer who orders a $500 meal. 

Sorry, Brio. Epic FAIL.

I love this place, they and Babbo have restored my faith in Italian food restaurants. The Steak Gorgonzola Bruschetta is one of my favorite things. I've had a few of the pastas as well and they were all delicious. I haven't had a single compaint about any of my visits.

I took my mom and her best friend here when they were visiting from out of town for their birthdays.  I read the reviews on Yelp and decided I'd give it a try.  We had had a bad experience the night before with a server and then Allen L at Brio blew them out of the water!  His service made all the difference in the world to our experience there.  I could tell it was busy, but he never seemed too rushed to answer our questions and recommend items in great detail.  

The food was outstanding, as were all his recommendations.  From the wine, to the food, to the service... Brio was outstanding.  We had the Bruschetta Sampler, Gorgonzola Lamb Chops, & Pasta Pomodoro with Chicken...all were fantastic!! 

Thank you so much!  I'll be visiting again soon!

Horrible service! I have been at the place twice! I asked 4 diffrent people for a side! Eventually had to walk up to the bar! I was very dissapointed both times! I even ask my waiter what was wrong his answer was it is what is! Food is decent tho, but do not expect even decent service

Normally I would not go back to a restaurant I was dissatisfied with. The restaurant in my opinion should always consistently serve good food at all times. After much deliberation, my friends wanted to dine here and I hesitantly agreed and I am actually quite glad that I did agree. 

The restaurant definitely did something different this time. Their pasta was flavorful and tasted great. I ordered the lobster bisque again and it was quite tasty. The service was on point and their bread was delicious.

So the experience definitely changed and the food just tasted better and was cooked very well. I am still a little skeptical to go back because of the previous bad experience but If it came down to it I might just go again. 

Kudos to Management as well, as they sent me a well thought out and professional e-mail about my bad experience.

Seriously love Brio. For most date nights my hubby and I sneak out to Brio. I switch up what I order most times but every time I have really enjoyed it. Every time I get wine, appetizers, a meal and dessert. It never disappoints. I usually ask for the waiters suggestions and it's always so good!!!

I ate here on Feb 19, 2018, part of a larger group.  We had 4 tables of about 9 or fewer at each table with a pre-planned menu, which was small caesar salad, chicken masala with mash potatoes and broccoli and carrots, creme brulee for dessert, and non-alcoholic drink (coffee, soda, cold and hot tea).  

Service appeared to all of us at my table, anyhow, as very slow and "inefficient".  

For instance, they bring us coffee, without any creamer.  After waiting for the creamer a long time, I got up and asked for creamer.   Maybe an hour later, they came to refill the coffee cups but the little creamer cups were empty and used from the first coffee pour.   So I went to the server outside the door, and said "I like it when we are brought coffee refills, but no one noticed the creamers (tiny one-serving ceramic pitchers) are also empty."  The waitress got a little defensive and said that I did not give her opportunity to get the creamers together to bring to the table ..... yet.  

Well, OK.  It took a LONG TIME AFTER WE FINISHED OUR DINNER PLATES, before the dessert was brought.  They were not waiting for our dessert choices, the choice was made by the host before we even arrived, what we are being served for the evening.  However they brought us the creme brulee without giving us spoons to eat it.  This time I waited and did not say anything.   But it took a long time waiting for the spoons (not sure if someone at other tables told them we did not have any spoons) to arrive.  

Now I would think that when they serve the desserts and bring them on a tray, that they would have spoons on the same tray, so we can dig right in, and not have look at the creme brulee for 7 min before we have utensils to eat it.  

The lady had a different and larger salad from the caesar.  I asked her how she got that salad.  She said she told them she does not eat caesar salad, and asked for a "house salad substitution", so guess what?   They brought her another caesar salad with same romaine lettuce, but they put the CAESAR dressing ON THE SIDE.   I asked her if it was the same server she asked for substitute salad, as the one who brought her the second salad with the CAESAR dressing on the side.   She said no it wasn't the same person.   I said, "Oh the right hand doesn't know what the left hand is doing", which I found happens at many chain restaurants because it is not the same server who takes the orders, who later brings the food, etc, and the food server does not bring you the tableware (so you get none).   The person who seats you when you first come in, gives you the tableware, so the food server does not "notice" that you have no tableware to eat the dish they just brought, cos it wasn't their job to give you tableware.
