We could have all gone home much earlier, but the service was so slow.  And the lady who did not want caesar salad, sitting across from me did not get her chicken masala until the rest of us were almost finished eating, some had already packed their leftovers.  

As for the chicken masala, I give 3.5 stars.  It is one of the rare chicken breast experiences, where the chicken was not cooked all dry and hard. That is why I never order "chicken" when I go out to eat, cos even places like upscale steak houses "vulcanize" chicken breast.   Here at Brio's, it was tender, and had a bit of charbroiled lines and flavor but the masala gravy was very very miniscule.   I asked for more gravy, and our male server brought a large urn, which I happily shared with everyone at our table.  I put the gravy on my mashed potatoes, too, so did other people.  It had plenty of mushrooms in it.   Gravy is 4 stars.  

Creme brulee, when it finally came, and the spoon later arrived so we could eat it, I give 4 stars.   It was really good, but not one of the best I've eaten.  

If I was the host of this group event, I would not book at Brio's again.  Service is the reason for the 2 stars, and "the service is so bad!" did not come from my mouth, but was a general consensus, that some of the people at my table, were talking about.   I concur.  I told them that I would be writing this Yelp review.

It's been awhile since I've been to Brio, usually never at Town square for longer than a movie at the AMC theater. But my girlfriend and I decided to have a lunch date. I usually have the hardest time choosing a place to eat but though it's been awhile since I've had Italian food.

We get to Brio right around lunch time and get seated quickly, we literally had a round table which seats 5-6 ppl just for the two us! They were very fast at seating people which was good cause you could see they were good with getting people in and out. It's been awhile so when I saw the menu it was limited. One side was the food and the other side your alcoholic beverages. 

We decided to order a lemonade and a mango iced tea, both very refreshing. They give you an appetizer once you are seated of their flatbread and hot bread, very good! We ordered the spinach artichoke dip for an appetizer, also warm and delicious! For our entrees, my girlfriend ordered a chicken pesto club sandwich and I ordered a cheese tortellini in vodka sauce! I have to say both were pretty good! I just wish I had more of that tortellini!!!

1.  Two of us went last night at 7:30pm, thought there wouldn't be too much of a wait on Wed night.  Ended up waiting 30 mins, but when they sat us there were plenty of empty tables.  Turns out we were basically the last ones waiting for a table.
2.  We never did get a basket of bread, not sure what the other reviews are talking about.
3.  Only two soup selections ... Lobster Bisque and Cream of Mushroom.  As I'm lactose intolerant ... no soup for me!
4.  Ordered the chicken limone (picata) ... it was pretty good.
5.  Price for two entrees, one soup, one tea, one mineral water .. almost $80 with tip.  A little on the pricey side.
6.  Other reviews mentioned going here for date, disagree!  Way to noisy and not all all intimate.  MUCH better places to take a date.

Amazing happy hour! Great drinks at fair prices and their happy hour appetizers are delicious! Regular meals are a little overpriced in my opinion, but still tasty. Definitely would recommend for happy hour deals and for dinner if you don't mind paying $20-40 for simple, basic pasta dishes. Their portions are huge though so at least you get enough to bring home for next day's lunch.

Located in the heart of the Town Square shopping center, Brio boasts some delicious Italian food without the Strip pricing. I didn't even know Town Square existed until a local from Las Vegas took me here. If you are looking for a restaurant experience devoid of tourists, Brio definitely focuses their attention on the locals. 

It was nice to enjoy a nice glass of wine while paired with my Frutti di Mare, an assortment of seafood with thin spaghetti. It was well seasoned and tasty. Not only was the food good, the impeccable service made the experience quite memorable. Brio would be a good choice especially if you happen to be shopping at Town Square.

Beautiful setting! Superb ambiance!
Lobster bisque is delicious.  The Ravioli is awesome.  Service is always good to excellent.  Entree Salads are huge and wonderful.  I love Brio Tuscan Grill, as do many of my friends from Vegas and St George, Utah.
Wonderful atmosphere and food.  Yes the lemonade is as good as they say!!   Great service. Reasonable prices for such great food.

I will never ever waste my time or my money on this Brio or the other one on Rampart and Alta. Both visits were disastrous. The servers were non-attentive, rude and slow. The manager was no where to be found, the food was tasteless. What an over-rated, non-satisfying place to have dinner. Never again...
Excellent service. Our server was amazing. This is my favorite place when I'm craving Italian. So many choices, and I love that they have dessert shots. I highly recommend this place!

I can't get over their HH deal. It is too good to be true. The best part is that even though it's only Monday-Friday, they honor it on national holidays.

I love their sausage ricotta flatbread and their beef carpaccio. The other stuff I can pass on, but their Tuscan tots are good as well.

it's in a great location so that you can go shopping afterwards with the money you saved from HH. LMAO

first time here and i was very pleased with it! the service is fantastic and the price point is right where it should be. ended up taking a date here and couldn't ask for anything more. oooo and check out the veal marsala. its fantastic!

This place will never let you down! Wow! They really do have the wow factor here. From being greeted when you walk in, to great service, exceptional food and drinks and a "thank you" on the way out. The customer service sets this business apart from all the rest. Yesterday, 11/11/14, one of many visits, we had warm, fresh baked sourdough bread, creamy lobster bisque, the perfectly salty artichoke dip and the chicken and bacon panini. Everything was phenomenal and came out perfectly timed! We shared the white peach sangria and it was crisp, sweet and refreshing. Our server was a tall male with short brownish blonde hair and he split all of our portions in two for us! What an above and beyond task. Thank you Brio for always making us happy and full!
Great food, great service, good price. Stopped by hear and had brunch. Would 100 percent come again

This is another example of the special category known as MPLF, or "Mall Parking Lot Food." I would probably pick this over Chilli's, Olive Garden, etc., but only if I wanted to pay more for the same food. The potato chips were good, and the salad was alright cuz I was hungry. It all tasted like it came out of a can though. Service was alright... and the manager was attentive, however I am not in any hurry to ever go back. Unless I'm on a freeway and its the only thing around.

Great atmosphere for outside patio seating. Too noisy inside. Good bar service and seating. Food...unfortunately is Super SALTY!!! Always leave there feeling swollen and bloated no matter the choice of food. So good for the drinks and outdoor patio atmosphere, just can no longer eat there since they haven't fixed the problem of using salt as an herb.

This review is long overdue. My husband and I went in for our date about 3 weeks ago, Armando was our server. He did an outstanding job. He was very fast, never had our table empty, whether it was refills or more appetizers. He really knew his shit. Unfortunately, the plate my husband likes was sold out and Armando suggested a different one, which was really good!! He could slow down a little when he talks, and he would be perfect but, everything was satisfying!  THANKS ARMANDO!

Sorry, but even though the food and service is fine, their lack of knowledge and information for this year's Lasagna Day was not. 

In the past, lasagna day was half off their lasagna dish. I called a week ahead to see if this was still true and made reservations when the person on the phone said it was. One week later, we get there and sit down and order. The waiter didn't know about this at all, or what the special was. Before he took our orders, the salads that came with the lasagna were included. And yet after we got the check and I asked about the discount, he said the manager said that the salads were what were given for free. 

Unless they come out with better and more clear announcements so that everyone is on board, not four different people thinking different things, I'll have to cancel the lasagna anniversary. =(

The food here is really good. I know it's a chain restaurant, but needless to say-it's food.
Location is ideal but parking is crap, of course.
Ambiance is nice, we were there for a wedding rehearsal dinner, had the back area reserved for us. 
Service was good, prompt, and attentive.
I don't have anything negative to say.
My bestie-the bride-even left her purse, which they held for her until we were able to make it back.
Good experience!

We went today for a friends birthday brunch. We made reservations to sit outside. It was a little chilly at 11am, so they were kind enough to bring a heat lamp over to our table. We ordered so much. We started with the Bruschetta sampler. There wasn't a bad one in the dish!! I think for each of us, this stood out as the winner. We ordered peach sangria, mimosa and coffee. The coffee was average, drinks were above average in quality and alcohol ratio. 
I ordered a Greek chopped salad. It was inexpensive and hit the mark. My friend ordered a burger and fries. She said everything was great, my other friend ordered breakfast- eggs, toast, potatoes. She said the potatoes were pretty super. Then we finished it off with mars Capone cheesecake. This was everything I had expected it would be when they showed & explained it to us. 
Everything about this place works for me. Really a perfect place for brunch! Again..... do the Bruschetta!!!!

On Yelp, 3 stars says "A-OK," and that's what I think of when I think back to our meal at Brio Tuscan Grille. 

The inside of the restaurant is expansive and the architecture is nice, in the way that many Phoenix restaurants are new and designed to look old. I didn't mind it, but it lacked the intimacy that I love from a dim Italian restaurant.

Our server was nice, maybe a bit slower to get us things, but she didn't make it a bad experience. And she definitely sold us on dessert at the end - one of the most impressive parts of the meal!

I got a shrimp dish that was noted on the menu to be "healthier." When you're at a place like this, you know that the butter runs deep, so nothing is really healthy, but I was hoping for something a tad heartier than what I got, which was a small-ish helping of veggies and a few shrimp. Luckily, my dining companions filled my plate with tons of their food - most notably an alfredo dish that was pretty fantastic. And her portion was enormous. So...take that for what you will. Fiancé got a filet, which he loved, so good on them for not messing up a good cut of meat!

Wine list was extensive, but not a lot of by the glass options, if I remember correctly. 

Again, I really enjoyed dessert. We got the "tasting," which I think was a "small" portion of 3 or 4 desserts, and I just remember it being massive - like we couldn't finish it all between 5 of us. There were three full size desserts. And it was only $10! Don't make me tell you twice - save room (or don't) and get this.

Wouldn't make this my first stop on our next trip to Phoenix, but wouldn't say no to it, either!

After reading the reviews I will definitely be coming back for happy hour!  We had a very nice dinner here.  The kids liked the lasagna, didn't like the burger (I know, why would you order a burger at an Italian restaurant) and my youngest enjoyed her gluten free pasta.  The apps and the meals were delicious and the service was great.  I love when a restaurant has gluten free options as Brio does!

Really good Italian. Ambiance is great as well. A very short and simple menu, something you find in select places such as this. I've eaten at the two Vegas and Houston locations, and they are all consistently good. Versitile. A great place for a drop in, date, or for a finer flair.

Really good Italian. Ambiance is great as well. A very short and simple menu, something you find in select places such as this. I've eaten at the two Vegas and Houston locations, and they are all consistently good. Versitile. A great place for a drop in, date, or for a finer flair.

A good time to go is during their Happy Hour. It's Mon-Thurs. 330-630. $5 Martini Thurs. Their HH menu is $2.95 per plate. They do give you pretty descent size portions of food so it's not disappointing. I've tried pretty much everything on the menu. I've also ordered the Dirty Vodka Martini (extra dirty). It's a must after work! :-) All in all, the food, drinks and service was very good!

I dont even know where to start... the service was amazing. Our waiter Alex was super knowledgeable on the menu and very attentive. He went out of his way to make sure we had a great first time visit. I had the Lasagna and it was perfect. My girlfriend had the Salmon Fesca and shes still talking about it today...The atmosphere there was perfect for our date night.

Was walking by this place one night with the hubby when I saw the outside guest eating some calimari.  It looked so tasty that we had to go and have some.  SO glad that we did.  Not only was the calimari very good but the lobster bisque was good as well.  Wish that it had bigger pices of lobster in it but still very tasty.  
My raspberry mojito was ok.  Raspberry flavor was very weak.

Okay, I get it - Brio is a chain and chains are supposed to be dull, and the menus uninspired. Obviously, Brio Tuscan Grille hasn't gotten that message.

We chose Brio from a host of other restaurants for a Welcoming Dinner for our son's wedding. The coordinator (Tiffany) could not have been nicer and more helpful. She walked us through the menu, choosing insalata, zuppa and entrees as well as passed appetizers. When asked, she easily recommended wines to compliment the other beverage offerings.

Last, but not least, she recommended a couple of bakeries to handle my request for a groom's cake. All of this over the phone or through emails.

Everything was excellent and the waitstaff was extremely attentive. We were able to reserve the Colosseum Room which was perfect for our group. We were able to choose 3 entrees for the group (they printed a menu for our guests) and chose Pasta Brio, Wood-Grilled Salmon and Tuscan Grilled Pork Chops - all excellent from the comments I heard. I can actually comment on the Pork Chop - excellent! We chose the Bruschetta, Beef Carpaccio Crostinis and Bacon Wrapped Shrimp for appetizers and they went over very well - especially the shrimp.

This is a great place to go if you want to escape the Strip. It is located just south of the airport off of Las Vegas Boulevard in Town Square a new shopping area which is quite nice as well. An excellent experience all around.

Good happy hour atmosphere. Dinner w/adults and/or children good too. My favs are caprese salad, risotto, veal Marsala.  Happy with wine choices by the glass. Not a fan of the chicken pomodoro Classico. Children like the pizzas.  I gave 4 stars vs 5...it's just a good place, you know what your getting, but its not overly amazing.

Happy, Happy, Happy Hour.  Tip:  If you want to people watch and sit outside on a patio, go to Brio from 4-6 weekdays. 
Split a Tomato Mozzarella Salad,Vine-ripened tomatoes, fresh Mozzarella, field greens, basil, balsamic drizzle, lemon vinaigrette and Sausage & Pepperoni Flatbread, Ricotta, Mozzarella, Provolone, housemade tomato sauce. Both priced at $4.95 during happy hour.  The flatbread has a great crispy think crust and was tasty.  The sausage was okay, but it  looked like a cut up precooked link?  Salad was fresh and had a good flavor.   If these are the same portions as the regular menu, this was quite the bargain!  
The patio was very busy but the server really hustled and took care of us.

We love the bar! The bartenders are amazing Jasmine and Ken are fantastic! Super quick service at the bar. They were on it! I had my drink with in a minute! Food was great and the service was great! We will be back!!!

The atmosphere felt nice and I felt like a hot shot.

Then the food came. The chicken was digestible. The fried tomato slices were disgusting and I could not finish them. It is not true about the more butter you put in something the better it tastes.

The tomatoes reminded me of chicken nugget breading from Sheetz.

The desserts that came afterward were well presented, and because they were well presented, I chose one. The crema catalana was delicious, and it came in a small enough portion that I did not feel guilty.

Waited about 30 min until our food arrived.
The food wasn't all that great but good enough.

Happy hour is a killer time here at Brio.  Not only do they have happy hour, but they have reverse happy hour!  I came in for 50% Ravioli, and I found out about some awesome Happy Hour prices of grand total of $3 per appetizer.  1 or 2 appetizers, you are good to go.  I highly recommend the Lobster Ravioli.  It had a spicy flavor with the right amount of sauce and cream.  The lobster inside felt like I was in heaven!

My only complaint of the night that does not give this great place a 5 star is that service was quite slow.  It could have been because of the many patrons during happy hour, but there was not as much detail and attention.

If you are looking for authentic tasting food as though you were in Tuscany, Brio is the place to go.

During my last visit to Las Vegas, we went to Brio twice (Monday & Friday).  They have an excellent Happy Hour with a number of very popular Apps for $2.95ea.  

Very good food and great service...check it out!!

It was pretty good. We were seated pretty quick with a party of 8. The food portions were bigger than I expected.  The waiters were nice and attentive to our needs.  We ordered a lot of food.  Ambiance is nice and intimate with dim lighting and it can get a bit loud but it's normal.  They also have free ice cream for the birthday girl in our group. Would definitely come back to try other dishes.

My family and I came here during brunch time so the menu was a little different than dinner and not as many options. We got the fish and chips, lobster bisque, pesto chicken club, bruschetta sampler, and calamari appetizer (this was free for checking in). The inside of the restaurant is really beautiful and the staff are all clean and professional looking. They give you bread and butter to start which is always nice! the calamari we got was pretty bland and disappointing because the calamari itself wasn't seasoned and came with marinara sauce on one side and a mayo based sauce on the other side which had a plastic taste to it for some reason. The bruschetta didn't seem to be too popular with the family and the size seemed a bit small for what it was. The pesto chicken club was pretty tasty, the chicken is pounded out thin and well seasoned. The fish and chips were pretty good too, decent size fish filets and crispy French fries. Our server was attentive and really good with filling our waters and clearing the crumbs off our table. Overall this place is just A-ok, but not a place I'd come back to for brunch/lunch.

My husband and I went here for our 5th anniversary after longingly passing it by it every time we were in the Santan area. 

We're very happy we did because it was a great date. The service was wonderful, our waiter was fast with the drinks and bread, great for suggestions (I ask even when I know what I'm getting to test staff), and above all he was friendly the whole time.

The food was perfect. I had the lobster and shrimp fettuccine, it was everything I hoped for and more. I honestly can't remember much after that because it was all I could think about.

We sat outside during the middle of summer but the misters made it very nice still.

I definitely recommend Brio as a lovely date spot

Mark our waiter was great! Joe the manager helped me taste white wines because I wanted to get a bottle. 

Our whole table enjoyed our meals, cocktails & appetizers. 

Great menu with choices to suit any palette. 

Two draw backs but we wont mention because they made up for them in spades! 

The only negative was hostess who rolled her eyes and was rude when we had to change our reservations. What happened to smile with service.

Today just wasnt my day, my usual dish i always order (which is my fav) Campanella Cab, was just awful, it had no flavor what do ever, not even the Parmesan could save this dish. I ordered extra sauce to see if that would help but the sauce was so flavorless. The waitor brought it out twice and both time it tasted like water down alfredo sauce. So i just ended up ordering something else, and i should of read the meat description in the lasagna, it had italian sausage, which i hate fennel seeds. So yup my dinner sucked!

Town Square is always a fun choice. 

Brio has a lot of options to choose from whether you are dining at the bar or in the dining room, you can't go wrong.


They have one of the better happy hours in Town Square. The happy hour menu is a great way to try a variety of items and choose what you like.
 
When the weather is nice... be sure to sit outside and people watch!

I'm sorry in advance for the review that I'm about to post. ... may no one ever feel like the way we felt yesterday.

I have been to this Brio many times for the restaurant and not happy hour. Yesterday we came for happy hour at the bar because we've heard SOOO many good things about it. We heard that service was good, food was even better, and the drinks were worth it... I mean look at other reviews. I always HATE to be THAT person. SO it cringes me to write this review.

We come in and the bar booths are all full. The tables next to the bar are full. So we opt to go outside. There's one table open but kind of in an awkward spot so we decide to sit at the bar that's located outside. We were sitting there for about 10 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us. We felt like... why isn't anyone coming to us? And there was a couple that had just finished to the right of us. So we knew we were allowed to sit there. Finally, a bar back (not a bartender) actually acknowledges us and gives us menus. Still from there, no bar tender. We decide to go back inside and find a spot inside of the bar. Finally two chairs but still no attention from anyone. We see at least three bar tenders catering to other people. At this point we're thinking "are we invisible?" Finally some guy (after about 20 minutes of being there) asks "Can I see your IDs?" checks them, and asks if he want something to drink. No hello. No how's it goin. Uh, okay. We order the our drinks and they come out. WE ask if we can order food. I don't know, does he not care that we're paying customers here? We ordered Beef Carpaccio and the new Nachos to start. While waiting for the food I had to get his attention to ask for lemons which took forever to get. I could see them right there, I felt like I could just grab them myself. The food came out. I liked the Beef Carpaccio but it was pretty salty. The nachos weren't nacho chips but potato chips (never seen that before). Interesting. We wanted to get the flatbread but then again it takes forever to get their attention to order something. Finally getting his attention, we ordered the pepperoni and sausage flat bread. Very dry. 

We had our receipt already because he kept printing out the tab every time we ordered something. Okay, that's good at least we didn't have to ask for the check. But paying took forever. My boyfriend had the payment out for quite a long time. No one acknowledge it and finally another person who wasn't catering to us came and grabbed it.

Overall, I was very disappointed with the service and quality of the food. The drinks were okay. And I definitely am shocked to have had a very different experience than all of my friends. I seem to always have bad experience at bars. I don't understand if it's because I look young or what. But that's how it feels most of the time. I promise I'd tip well if you'd treat me well. But this wasn't the case, again.

Went here to meet up with friends on Friday afternoon for happy hour only to find that they do not have any drink specials.  Wtf?  What good are $3 appetizers if I am paying $9 for a glass of wine?  That did not make me very "happy".  Also, the bar area was insanely crowded so good luck finding a place to sit.  I really don't get why everyone is so freakishly excited about this happy hour when in reality it is not even a happy hour, they are just running a sale on appetizers.  What a scam!

Once we got a table on the patio we had a pleasant enough time in spite of the fact that our server, Amanda, was god-aweful.  I had a chopped salad that was just ok and also split the Calabrese flatbread with my sister which was quite delicious earned them an extra star, but isn't enough for me to want to go back any time soon.

This is one of my favorite places for happy hour in Las Vegas! Everything is a great deal! The creamy shrimp with fried egg plant  is a must! If you want cheap drinks and good food this is a place to stop by... our bar tender the other night wasn't too friendly but whatever we enjoyed each others company and drinks.

One of my favorite valley restaurants and tonight did not disappoint.  It was my birthday and the service was outstanding, friendly,  and attentive. My gluten free shrimp and lobster was delicious and the creme brulee was one of the best I have ever had. Usually we sit outside since they have great seating options but chose inside due to the weather. 
Overall a tremendous night out and just another reason to return as soon as possible.

Tried some of their appetizers during the Yelp fundraising bake sale, and dropped by again for Suki L.'s Happy Hour UYE.  I have to say for the $2.95 price tag on their selections of hour hour menu, the food was delicious and the portions were fair.

My favorites on their new Spring 2011 Happy Hour menu are the Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant (the Black Pepper Sauce is great with pretty much anything savory, try it withthe BRIO Burger or the shrimp from the Shrimptini), followed closely by the Marghita Flatbread.  I would also recommend The Beef Carpaccio, BRIO Burger,and as far as their Strawberry Lemonade (non-alcoholic).

If you are not working during the weekday afternoon,and happens to be at Town Square shopping or watching a movie or whatever, drop by for inexpensive and very good food.  But plan on arriving around 3:30pm,as the HH is only valid at the bar area, which fillsup rather quickly.

Thanks again to Suki L for organizing the UYE here, so I try their HH. And like Anthony M, I think this is also one of my favorite HH in Vegas.

Decor: 5/5 It reminded me of the decor at The Cheese Cake Factory, but with their own twist.  Ilike it.

Ambiance: 4/5  It has good atmosphere.

Service: 5/5  The bartenders, waiters,bussers were all great.  Even when it is busy, they paid attention to the customers making sure our orders are placed and our drinks are refilled.

Food:  4/5  Based on the HH menu only.  I liked most of the food I ordered, while some I am glad I tried but would likely not order again now that I know which ones I really like.

Price:  5/5 for HH
            3/5 for non-HH.

Location:  Perfect for those visiting Town Square for the entertainment, shopping, or food.

4 stars. I will definitely be back.

Love the risotto here! So good with asparagus  mushrooms and chicken. The hubby had the huge portion of lasagna. Said it was amazing!! 
We split the Caesar salad. The best dressing I've ever had! The croutons were very good. Not hard but semi soft with tasty seasonings. Yum yum 
The bread basket is good too. 
Beautiful indoor and outdoor seating. They have heaters outside. Not touristy but busy most nights we've been there. I make an online reservation. 
Bar and wine menu is great!
The staff works hard to get your food and beverages to you in a quick manner. Not hurry hurry so you fell rushed. Just that food arrives hot. 
Vegas servers are awesome. They could write the book on how to do a wonderful service to guests in the restaurant world. 
Sorta makes it hard when you go elsewhere as the Servers are not as great.

Their HH is one of the best on town! $5 drink specials! and $3.95 tasters! 

Delicious food that melts in your mouth. HH is available in their bar area and the fire pits. This place is perfect for a Girls Night out, my girlfriends and I ordered everything that was on their menu for HH. I also took my boyfriend here, he loved it. We loved their Crispy Shrimp Piccante, Roasted Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke Dip and Brio Burger. Their service isn't too bad either, our server forgot about our drinks. He apologized and said it was on the house. Good job Brio!.

Definitely looking forward to more Girls Night Out here and a date night's with my leading man.

This place is always solidly delicious. The menu is long enough to have a lot of great options, but not ridiculously epic-noval-ish enough to make you want to give up (Cheesecake Factory, that's you, buddy, but I'll still come visit every once and a while when I can't decide beforehand on a particular type of food I want at the time). The servers are nice and the patio is awesome, when the weather's right. The inside is a large, mostly open space that can get a little loud-ish during peak times, but not so unbearable that you have to yell to your eating companion(s). The price is what you'd expect to pay: not the cheapest, but not that pricey, either; I consider it a slightly less-expensive alternative to my other favorite Vegas/Henderson Italian joints, Casa di Amore, Nora's, and Gaetano's.

Love Brios. My friends and I always do birthdays and Happy Hour at Brios.
Amazing Happy Hour. Love the service and the food.

After wanting to try Brio for so long and hearing about their good food, we finally came here for dinner the other night. It looked a little busy for a Tuesday night, but thankfully, we only had to wait a few minutes before being seated. The first thing I noticed was that the place was very loud. Also, the tables were pretty close to each other. We sat next to a party of 4, who was obnoxiously loud, swearing, and complaining about their jobs all night. It was like we were being forced to listen to their conversations. Not the restaurant's fault, but just an FYI, you may want to request a booth or a table outside instead.

Service was a bit slow at first. One guy showed up to give us our basket of bread and butter (loved the sourdough bread), but our server kept us waiting for about 20 minutes. She actually turned out to be very nice and attentive, so I guess I can forgive the wait. :p At first glance at the menu, I was a little worried that I wouldn't be able to find anything to order. I love Italian food and pasta, but all the dishes seemed complicated for someone who is very picky as myself. My order was about to sound like this, "Can I have the Chicken Pomodoro Classico with no tomatoes, pine nuts and basil?" Then, I spotted the only pasta dish with ingredients that I actually liked! Surprising, I know. I had to look twice just to make sure. 

The Campanelle Carbonara had grilled chicken, bacon, Parmesan cheese, spinach and Alfredo. Sold! Our dinners came out about 10 minutes after ordering. My pasta was very flavorful and not salty. The chicken and bacon were cut into perfectly bite sized pieces. The Alfredo sauce was just right and not overpowering. My husband ordered the Roasted Lamb Chops and said they were very good. I never liked lamb. I tried it at Texas de Brazil and didn't like the taste it left in my mouth. However, these lamb chops did look good with the red wine sauce it was served with. For dessert, we shared the Tiramisu, which was delicious as well. A perfect balance of coffee and creme flavors. They also have a gluten free and light menu.

It looks like they have a MyBRIO loyalty program that you can join for free. According to their website, you get a complimentary appetizer valued up to $10 as a welcome reward. Our server didn't mention that to us at all, so I guess I'll have to remember to ask about it the next time I am there. Brio is a bit on the expensive side, but I would definitely want to come back every so often. The food was awesome! You won't be disappointed.

Have been here many times as I live close by and it is convenient. I always get a decent meal for a chain.   

Three of us went this past Saturday for dinner and two of the three of us had downright lousy meals. The side of pasta on each of our dishes had no sauce as we requested, but worse than that, it was over cooked and one hard clump. The server got us some sauce to try to remedy, but the  meat (one of us had chicken and the other lobster) was overdone and dry.  Clearly, the kitchen was not doing a good job this night. 

Our server was friendly. The manager tried to make it up by comping dessert which none of us wanted, but I really think they lost a customer after tonight's weak presentation and performance.

So I have been to this place a couple of times with friends and sat outside at the patio both times. The inside restaurant I would say is beautiful and has nice ceiling decorations.. very high and fancy with the long drapes above. Hosts are nice and friendly. ambiance of place is casual but also a upscale feel to it. Pricing isn't too bad as well. 

So the last time i was there I ordered a risotto dish with lobster on top!  the presentation of the dish was amazing!! beautifully done ...I adjusted some ingredients on there and they accommodated it all. I also had the crab cakes and it was delishh! the creme brûlée was yummy as well! Service by the waiter ..hmm he just doesn't seem interested in serving us. 

Another time I came here I ordered a Alfredo pasta with blackened shrimp on the side.. the shrimps were good. BUT the pasta they gave me was DRYER than the desert! I had to wave down the waiter help to ask him for extra alfredo sauce... which he called a manager over and he had it sent out shortly after. Manager was quite accommodating and nice. The waitress we had was OK i suppose but hardly around for service.. we literally would flag down anyone we saw walking by... 

Overall what i would say about this restaurant is that the ambiance is nice.. if I'm in the area i would def come back. Food is tasty for the most part.. but service is something I have never been fond of!! hopefully management or corporate can see the review and make sure that the waitstaff IMPROVE on the level of SERVICE they provide for every customer that comes into the place. It seems like they pick and choose who they provide good service to. Smh....

Three of us had a brunch today. Two of us ordered the Brio Hamburgers and one of our group ordered the Sicilian Omelet. The omelet was very tasty, but two of us got sick eating hamburgers.
Presentation- 8 out 10
Hamburgers were so dried and burned. A lady (she looks likes the manager of the Brio) asked us, if we ordered medium well. The server never asked us how our burgers like to cook. Arugula were wilted, French fries were too salty and hamburgers had no seasoning.
Sadly we wouldn't order the hamburgers any more.
Beautiful place and rotten hamburgers

I was hesitant to go back Brio to eat. Because I had a bad experience @Brio in Tivoli.
Seven of us to celebrating out dear friend, Julia.
This time, I was very wrong.
All of our meals were delicious and superb, our server, Jessie, was so wonderful!!!
I guess everyone deserves to have a second chance.
I am glad I went and had a marvelous time with my dear friends.

This can be a great restaurant IF you order right.  I previewed the menu and reviews first and had the shrimp and eggplant appetizer as my meal.  It's heavy, but oh so good!  I'm kind of a vegetarian except I won't give up seafood. And, I LOVE eggplant so this was perfect for me.

Don't waste your time. Maybe they were having an off day, but it was as if they were barely keeping the wheels on the cart when we were there. I always enjoy drinks, apps, entree, dessert when on vacation and out with friends --- not here!  Not that we were in a rush, but they definitely were not. Forgot salad, overcooked eggs, double charged for entrees. There are many other options to choose from when in Town Square.

In Westlake on business and wanted a good Italian dinner with friends so we chose Brio despite some of the lackluster reviews.  All 5 of us really enjoyed our meals from the salads to the various pasta dishes to the small deserts that were just perfect to top off the meal.  The portions were plentiful and very flavorful, the wine selection was very good and the drinks were fixed just unimpeachable.  The atmosphere, service, and presentations were also first rate.  We all said we would return.
A good place for all occasion and season. Nice and friendly staff. Good food and quick service. A great place for a friendly gathering.
AWFUL calamari was rubber and my salad had a hair in it!!! Over all I was disturbed . I do not want to sacrifice my health for a meal!!!!

I was shocked was told how great place this was and just need to go. So I did and it sucked. The food was cold there was five of us one meal came out fifteen min later  the manager was very rude. I will say the server we had was amazing she Jessica you rock I hope they know she has a good one here.
Great place for a happy hour date! Had shrimp and eggplant appetizer. It's a must! A good selection of wine. Gets very crowded at night.
This place is a local jewel. A glass of wine, a nice appetizer and you're set. This place can get busy during dinner hours, be patient and enjoy the atmosphere.

Good ambient but reservation means nothing. You still have to wait for the next available table. 
Lobster bisque is good but only half a bowl.

Probably the worst service we have ever had in Vegas. Server forgot silverware, didn't bring it even though we asked her to, and basically forgot about us the entire meal when it was not busy. We will not be returning and my husband felt he completely wasted money on lunch here.

Great staff and delicious food. 
Been here about 5 times and they never fail to meet my expectations they really do know the meaning of Great customer service.

THIS PLACE HAS THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE. It has fantastic food but my friends/family will never give them our business again. If you want to find a great Italian restaurant in the area I would try Babbos Italian eatery!

I have come to Brio several times and each time my meal and the meals of those I am with is solid. Came here with my parents and my boyfriend during the holidays. Here's the breakdown:

Atmosphere: Gorgeous! I love the decor of this restaurant and it's high ceilings. It's always decorated so lovely during this holidays.

Food: Overall, good.

Calamari- bland. It needed the accompanying sauces to make it have any flavor.

Spinach & Artichoke dip- very tasty, although the crackers that come with it are not a good match for the dip. The crackers are asiago cheese crackers and the asiago conflicts with the cheese in the dip. I ended up just getting more bread and using that with the dip. It was much better. 

Chopped Salad- Tasty, but very onion heavy. Don't go kissing anyone after eating this salad!

Lasagna- delicious. Cooked perfectly. 

Service: Just AWFUL. Our server NEVER came by. Our meal took over 2 hours. It was ridiculous. Now, I could have understood if the place was crazy busy, but it really wasn't. You know it's bad when you have to ask the busybody multiple times to get our server. We got there around 8pm and didn't leave until well after 10pm.

Prices: Very fair. The portion size and quality is in line with the prices.

Overall, I will come back to Brio for their food and atmosphere, but if I get seated in the section of the server we had again I am going to request to move to a different table, as I have a life and would like to get to it someday, rather than spending it at a 3 hour dinner.

My mom and my sis and I came here on New Years Day for brunch.  Although, the place was pretty busy, our server was very friendly.  Our food came out a little slow and we didn't order anything complicated.  I had their grilled salmon, which was cooked to perfection - delicate and moist.  My sister and I also ordered their Bloody Maryl, which was also very good. We really enjoyed our visit here.  Hopefully, Tivoli Village will fill up soon to bring more people to Brio and the other restaurants.  Right now, there's really no shops to go to around there.

Celebrating an early Mothers Day, shared the Lasagna Bolognese, Salmon Griglia, Tuscan Grillled Pork Chops, Pasta Pesto and Calamari Fritto Misto. Large serving of  Lasagna and very traditional, while the Pork Chops were very tasty and prepared well. The salmon and pesto were from the "light menu" which were small portions. Everything was prepared and presented very well.  
The service was very good and the restaurant has great atmosphere for a nice evening. 
Would recommend this for a nice relaxing evening

My husband, daughter, and I were checking out the beautiful newly opened Tivoli Village last Thursday, and Brio Tuscan Grille was one of the few restaurants that were 1.) already up and running and 2.) had a wait less than 20 minutes during the lunch peak hours.  

The service was FANTASTIC, and that is probably because they just opened and are still in that "honeymoon"  phase.  Along with crayons and the kids menu to color, they also brought Pizza dough for my daughter to play with. They even offered to cook it for her when she was done- but she was having too much fun just playing with it. 

I have never been to a Brio Tuscan Grille before so I had no expectations.  In fact, I didn't even know it was a chain restaurant at the time. Nonetheless, I am a fan of the food.  I ordered the Fettuccine Rustica and I highly recommend this dish if you like sun dried tomatoes.  I added the Bistecca Ensalata for an additional $3.95 and this salad was a meal in itself.  It was so delicious and so filling- I may just get a whole order of that next time since I am a sucker for gorgonzola cheese and bacon!  My husband ordered the chopped salad to start with and the Shrimp and Crab cakes.  It had only come with 2 average sized cakes, but they were so flavorful and surprisingly quite filling.  We ordered the kids lasagna for my daughter, and for $4.95- this was practically an adult serving.  In fact, the three of us shared it because it was that big, and that delicious! 

The dessert display looked too fabulous to pass us, so I ate about 1/4th of my delicious pasta and had the rest packed up to take home.  We ordered the creme brulee and the raspberry cheesecake and both were the perfect way to end such a satisfying lunch.  The total bill for the 3 of us was less than $50. And it was well worth it- the ambiance, the service, the food were all great.

I love this place and am a pretty loyal customer.  I try to hit it every time I'm at San Tan especially during happy hour when I feel the urge for Italian.  Not a single complaint from me so guessing they'll be no private messages from management with a possible freebee....LOL

Time to time we escape from the hectic strip to Town Square, relaxing atmosphere and this time was no different. Outdoor sitting with nice view and the food was very good. Party of six we all had different items and all lined their choice. Soups and bread were excellent. 

Service was a bit rushed and not caring... asked if we want the beer after the soup but didn't care about the answer. Glass with clearly visible lipstick type mark made to the table and replacement still came before the soup.

Ate there Sat. night, party of 10, for a birthday.  LOUD, terrible service.  Waiter took 3 tries to get us right check, waited 15 minutes for coffee service and never brought the pot back for refills.  Lobster items ordered by 3 of group had no lobster in them!  Waiter ended up bringing bits of lobster to table separately.  Agree with other reviewer that food was cold by the time it finally reached the table.Veal was so over salted that it was unedible!  This was for both of the people that ordered veal.  The cod was over cooked and also unedible.  I believe there was confusion on part of wait staff as to who was handling the table.  The peach bellinis were wonderful, however.  NO WAY would I ever go back.  Sad, because it is a beautiful place with a decent menu.

So sad! We wanted to love this place! Went for brunch and had the most annoying server... Finally ordered (we couldn't make up
Our minds) and I opted to start with a salad and artichoke dip. Dip was okay. Nothing special. I'd love to mention the salad but it never came. Got the spicy chicken bacon sandwich. BEWARE it tastes like chipotle sauce and mayonnaise only! It was the most awkward tasting item is ever had before! French toast was underwhelming as well. Very tart with some gross lemon filling. But the fruit and syrup were delicious. Which we had to ask for syrup from three different people. Bc we were still hungry we ordered a side of scrambled eggs... Which took twenty minutes to arrive. Then I had to go to the bar for ketchup. It was just an overall poor experience. We wanted to love this place. The patio is very nice to enjoy! We had a great time people watching!

If you're looking for a chain type Italian restaurant forget Olive Garden and come here. The food is creative without being fancy. Everything is fresh and tastes great. Good happy hour prices for appetizer (drinks not so much). Happy hour service was a little rough, I really hate when bartenders ignore younger patrons, but the $2.95 appetizers still made it a good deal. I love their Italian Wedding Cake Martini!

I just had my last supper here.  Okay, not a last supper but I wanted to indulge on copious amounts of carbs prior to trying to lose some of the inches around the diameter.  They didn't disappoint.  I wish I could tell you the exact name of the dish that I ordered but it was chicken and penne pasta, anyway it was delish.  And the wine they brought over was a perfect pairing.  My friend who was with me did not like her breaded chicken dish at all and tried to swallow it down.  I let the waiter know since she was unwilling to speak up but she didn't know what else she wanted.  He said, "Do you trust me" and she affirmed.  "He said, I've got just the thing for you and you won't be disappointed." And she wasn't.  The mini desserts in little Turkish coffee size cups (e.g. Tiramisu, Creme Brulee) etc were perfect for those who don't have any more room for the Big Boy Size confections but could slide in a bite or three amidst the now expanding pasta in one's stomach.  We finished the meal outside taking in the great Vegas weather and the delightful ambience that is Town Square.  I've been there before, I'll go there again.  I'm a fan.
